user_review: It was my first time here for dinner.Food; spectacular! There's a self service bar towards the back where they have a lot of nicely displayed entrees for your picking. YES YOU CAN GET UNLIMITED AMOUNTS OF THESE. They also have several servers walking around the dining area with sticks of meat ready to serve if you desire. You get a little wooden block with green for more and red for stop. They alternate between wings, steak cuts, briskets, cinnamon pineapples, and other delicious fancies. They also serve a full bar to the table with a lot of fancy cocktails.  The host and servers we're all extremely friendly and explained the meats they we're serving with the option of medium well, to medium-rare. The price is 40$ per person and it's an AYCE type of deal. If you have been meat deprived like me, this place will do wonders for you!

Came here for Valentine's Day dinner 2020. It was $44.95 per person. I read some decent reviews so I decided to give it a try. The buffet where you can physically get up and grab food are all sides made with inexpensive ingredients and are very limited. For example, they offered plantains used for tostones and steamed potatoes. I liked the tostones but they really should offer gourmet dishes at a churrascaria. When the rodizio comes around, you only get a small portion of food (about a bite-sized portion per person or table per turn -- refer to attached photo for accurate portion sizes (one single sausage the size of an average man's big toe for the table (there's 2 of us) and about two pieces of lechón each) and honestly not a lot of options of meat to choose from. The only type of steak they have is from a rough cut of meat that's worse than flank or skirt steak. The only meat I actually enjoyed was the lechón - roast pork. They give you a small double-sided place card you can leave at your table to indicate if you would like more meat but they don't come around your table as frequent as you'd like them to - they have a timed system of making their way around the dining area. You can only dine for 90 minutes which was fine with me since that's the norm with most decent restaurants but you honestly pay $45 for just about $8 worth of meat and sides. I enjoyed the pork and friendliness of the staff but the lack of options and diversity in the restaurant and the continual waiting between turns just to get tiny portions of meat made my experience less than magical. The $45 we paid was holiday price so normally it probably would be less. It was an okay experience and I'm glad I got to try it but I wouldn't recommend. Sticking to Fogo de Chão in Midtown next time. Breakdown of review:[ FOOD: 2.5/5 ]Steak: 2/5Lechón: 4/5Sausage: 3/5"Buffet": 1/5[ ATMOSPHERE: 3/5 ]Would I recommend? No. There are way better options in terms of food and flavor all along the stretch of Roosevelt Ave in Jackson Heights and Corona.Would I come back? While I don't entirely regret this trip, I wouldn't just because of the food. The place is great but once is enough.FINAL RATING: 2.75/5

I am sad to have to update this review for the worse. I returned this evening on a Saturday night with my husband and my in-laws. My first visit had been on an evening during the week, and we were one of only three tables dining at the restaurant that evening. My experience that evening was much different from it was tonight. The place was full as expected for a weekend, but it was immediately clear that this place does not operate well with a full restaurant. Service was extremely slow - empty glasses were left unfilled unless we flagged down a passing member of the waitstaff. The salad bar food that was delicious during my last visit was bland and flavorless this time around, so I ended up throwing away most of what I picked up. What a shame. It took so long for anyone to come to our table with meat, but the majority of the time when anyone came to our table it was the same offerings - chicken, sausage, and occasionally ribs. Where was the steak? We voiced our concerns twice, once to the gentleman in the suit (the maitre d assume?) and then once to our waitress, who finally got a few steak options sent over to our table. But unfortunately, they all suffered the same issues - they were bland, overcooked, and chewy. No juicy and flavorful meat from my last visit. This was the first visit to this restaurant for my husband and his parents and unfortunately, they were so appalled by the subpar food and service they will not be returning. Neither will I.

To preface this review, I was here ages ago (20+ yrs) back when it was called Greenfield's.  It is nice to see that it still exists and that it's so beautifully decorated.  While there are plenty of proteins served, I do miss the rabbit and the many variations of beef options they used to have.  It seems times have changed the menu quite a bit.  Gone are the wooden cues - red for stop, green for more food.  They have been replaced by square shaped business cards (red on one side, green on the other) to signal the staff that you want more grub.I was here on Monday, Memorial day for an early dinner, group of 15 (adults and kids alike).  Confusing start as some items were included in the one price point vs the other (they differentiate between the salad bar vs the all you can eat) and there is no dessert or drinks included in the price per person.  Those are all a la carte.  A full beverage and cocktail menu is available - ranging from soda, juice, Brazilian soda, Mexican Coke, ie.Adding to the confusion were the kids' pricing - ages 4-10 were one price, regardless the rotation of meat or not.  Then any child 11+ had the option of the salad bar only or the all you can eat meat as well.  Price difference obviously stated, was approx $10 more for the AYCE meat.Our waitress was very friendly and helpful in getting us all that we asked for.  We noticed the servers were not coming over to us as much as we'd like...partly due to where we sat. If you can, request for a table near the salad bar or in the main dining area.  We sat just outside of that, by the windows and the cocktail Bar.  This is also where the TVs are at.  While dining, I saw most of the servers with their meat skewers on display walking around the main dining area first so by the time it made it over to us, there was a lot of meat gone.We also noticed the variety of meat that was being paraded around was the basically chicken, sirloin, or pork ribs.  So, we took note with the waitress and started ordering on demand - which worked out way better.  Duck was not available (we asked), though it is advertised. We ended up requesting quail, Lamb, and cheese bread. Not quite the fresh pan Con queso but it'll do. Bite sized cheese bread is always a win.The bacon wrapped anything was delicious. The quail was really good too but a bit on the small side. Best thing actually was the grilled pineapple and the medium rare steak. My group and I had a fun evening nonetheless once we go to dessert. They had chocolate cake, tiramisu, passion fruit mousse, cheesecake and red velvet cake. There may have been one or two more but I can't seem to recall now.BTW, the salad bar does have meat entrees in it so if you're not a big eater, it could be a good option. Pasta with meatballs was available, fries, chicken nuggets, fish, lots of different salads, and a yummy beef stew type option with potatoes. But alas, I came for the all you can eat meat so I only made one pass at the salad bar. It was just to get my veggies in. LOL So this review was just three stars as some of the meat was only ok. I expected more variety and I didn't like that it was all you can eat only on the meat. For the premium price, it should've included a soft drink or one dessert option. They should just create that option.

Came here for dinner. When I entered, there are several parties there.There were TVs playing sports and music playing in the background. I was seated right away as it only opens for dinner and it was close to closing. In the salad bar, there were some dishes, salad area, fruits, and jello. There were several cuts of meat coming out.The item that sets this place apart from the other rodizios I have been to is the cinnamon pineapple, which is sweet with its cinnamon fragrance. I will come back.

Celebrated my friend's birthday last February here at Rainhas. The place is packed on a Saturday eve with about 10 to 15 mins of wait, not bad. Rainhas is a must among buffets. Great selections of salad, fish, beef, desserts, etc. and the non stop rounds of roasted meats served! Lamb, beef, chicken, pork, sausages. Not to mention the corn and their out of this world roasted pineapple. The servers were friendly, attentive and always smiling. Plus a great dance showcase of ladies dressed in Brazilian costumes! Got home with a happy tummy! I am definitely coming back!

This place was pretty far from me since I'm not from queens. But if you're in queens, definitely try it out. Luckily we made reservation because this place fills up pretty quick. If you're a meat lover, this is your spot or you can always try out the buffet section. Overall experience 8/10

Loved it here when it was Greenfields. Still love it but they needed more staff for an unexpected Tuesday night rush. The hostess was great in not having her feathers ruffled by the amount of ppl she was busy hosting and serving water too as well as picking up dirty dishes from tables who were done. The food selection was good. Wished they had more fruits available but again it was a Tuesday and I've been here on a weekend and your overwhelmed with choices. 4 stars because they were understaff and there appeared to be a manager on hand who wasn't willing to pitch in where needed. Good thing he had the hostess there, as she did an amazing job. This is buffet style which is why we only have desert pics... and all meats are served at your table. For the sake of privacy for the servers I wouldn't post pics of them as they served.. but the meats are the best part of this place, besides the sangria

Johnny was amazing.  He is the best at serving and he also remembers us every time we go.  His service I'd what makes me go back to the resturaunt multiple times.  He makes you feel like you're the most important table because he comes back accordingly.  He also knows what your favorite meat is and will especially make it just for you! Now that is why I go back!!

Went here a couple of times, the meat selection was pretty good, the rotation of the servers was very well distributed within the restaurant which makes sure that everyone got served and offered their preferred meat. Though the server forgot to bring us our drinks multiple times, she came back to ask us if we wanted drinks 3x and still never got it, I have decided to look past that because the place was pretty packed when we went there.This is my go to AYCE Brazilian place in queens.

Came here for Son's birthday last night. My 1st time coming here. The Meats were amazing! Ate soooo much. Pineapple is OMG, It was had a touch of cinnamon and a delicious glaze. Top sirloin was a big Wow. Beef and chicken bacon Wrapped was Slamming! Servers were friendly, professional and attentive. Definitely A Must Try. I highly recommend this place if you love meat!

This place is insanely busy. On Saturday night the place was jumping.Free valet parking.Make sure to have a reservation, waits are very long.Its a neighborhood restaurant, and i'm sure people come from other places. The price is alright, with the money you pay, i guess you cannot get better than what it is.Adults $39, kids are half price.With your all you can eat, there is an open buffet for salad bar, and some hot dishes.Our waiter came just once at start, took our drinks order and disappeared. And we got our drinks way after we started our meal. And that was it, never been asked of we want more. Just when finishing, tried to be present.Meat carvers, runners work a lot and very attentive. Especially have to thank Johnny with his amazing service.From the cuts, bbef tenderloin, top sirloin, and skirt steak were my favorite. Don't care too much with chicken, beef shish kebab( too sweet tasting and seasoning not right ). At the end got some pieces of lamb as well, they were to chewy and not edible, so I don't recommend that one as well.

Honestly I cannot fault thIs place whatsoever. What is not to love?!Unlimited variety of beautifully cooked meats brought to your table for you: check.Nice lively atmosphere: check. Decent selection of drinks: check. Additional hot n cold buffet: check. Entertainment (there was a belly dancer or something while we there unsure if it was for a private party or if the restaurant provided the dancer): check. Prompt, friendly service: check. Lovely place to bring a date or a group of friends  and family.Word of warning though, make sure you come with a big appetite! You'll definitely need it if  you want to try all the different meats they have on offer!

Good place to eat. Great service come on a very empty stomach cause u gonna eat a lot!!! Highly recommend. The meats are delicious. Our waiter very nice. Drinks and desserts not included in the price but affordable delicious!!!i would go again and again.

We came here on a Saturday at around lunch time. We weren't impressed. We thought we're not coming back but yesterday I was craving for a good steak, so we came back. This time it was a Friday, and we went dinner. And our first experience that was negative was completely replaced. we thought we weren't coming back but Johnny's VIP treatment to us made us feel so welcomed and special. So we'll def coming back. Food wise, really, really good. My faves are the sirloin, ribeye, and chicharoooon. Ohh the wings too, so so good! Thinking of it makes me salivate lol add the foods that are included in the Hot and cold buffet. Cleanliness, absolutely. There's unisex restroom upstairs and separate restrooms downstairs. Staff courtesy and thoughtfulness, 100% great. They respectfully ask you and not just give you a piece and leave. They are nice, and very patient when I am indecisive if I want more or no. Thank you to our wait staff Tina, and most especially the captain waitstaff, Johnny. We're coming back because of your staff and good food of course!

Service: GoodQuantity: GoodCleanliness: GoodFood: All you can eat$38.95+ dessert $8.95Our holiday party was held in this restaurant on a Friday night. Reservation is required for more than 8 ppl. Lots seating, and walk in is welcome.If you are a carnivore, you will love this restaurant. Mediocre salad bar and hot food buffet, which I shouldn't complain when It's only $38.95 a person vs much higher price in other Brazilian steakhouses. We were all so excited when the servers bringing all different kinds of meats to our table. Roasted beef, beef tenderloin, chicken wings, BBQ ribs, sausage, pork loin, roasted corns, and roasted pineapple. All meats were perfectly done and tailored to your taste. You will get to pick rare, medium and well done. Servers check on us throughout the night to ensure we have enough food. My favorite items are the roasted pineapple. Brown sugar cinnamon coated pineapple after roasting brings out the fruit's rich flavor of sweet and sour. It was so good I can't stop eating it. Dessert selections are available at &8.95 a piece. I highly recommend this place for the price and quantity of the meats.
My go to place when I'm craving some good ribs or churrascos steak. The staff is very friendly and the price you pay is worth everything you get.
Really great experience! The lady and I had a good time, with delicious food.The steaks were great and the pineapple is absolutely amazing.

Took bf to Rainhas for a birthday dinner to experience a Brazilian Steakhouse for the first time.  It has a nice atmosphere, and is quite crowded... but full tables is not a bad sign for a place like this.  We were seated immediately and given cards to leave faced up or down depending on whether we wanted cuts from the meat that was brought out by the waiters or not.  There is a hot and cold buffet area with things such as pastas, potato salad, onion rings, french fries, shrimp, fruit salad, white rice, fried rice, chicken, etc.  The steak was the highlight of the evening as it should be.  As the standard, diners can choose how they'd like their cuts done (Get it medium rare or you're slacking).  I especially enjoyed the beef brisket and lamb kebab.  One of the waiters, Johnny, was especially welcoming and treated us like family.  Johnny brought things out especially for us to try based on the foods we told him we liked in general (like duck), and gave us the best cuts.  Eventually, the waiters began to bring out roasted warm pineapples covered in brown sugar and cinnamon.  It tasted INCREDIBLE.  I have made it several times at home already because I absolutely can not get over how delicious some warm cinnamon-y pineapple is.  Our waiter told us it was helpful in the digestion of the steak so it seems like the pineapple is a win-win.  The only downside was how long it took our original waitress to get some soda.  We ordered it and waited nearly 20 minutes before getting a glass.  Overall, this place has incredible food and great waiters.  It's safe to say that bf enjoyed the bday dinner.

Amazing place! It's pricy but 100% worth it. I'm vegan and there where a lot of vegan opptions. I ate rice beans salads, there guacamole is so good! I went with family and we are 5 people which was in total of 267 + 18% of gratitude which was $330 so yeah, really great. The waitresses are really nice and attentive.

For once a yelp rating is right. This place is good. Friendly service.  They don't rush you.  The price isn't bad.  Nice selection of wine.  I wish there were some token real sirloin or filet mixed in.  Everything was good though. For sure.

Excellent restaurant for meat lovers. We went here on a Saturday night no need for reservation, we were seated immediately. Buffet cost 45 per person and it was worth it. Variety of dishes available including salads, rice. We didn't even have to go back to the Buffet area because different types of meat dishes were being served. The servers go around the table serving the meat dishes. Drinks have separate prices which was not bad. Had a lot of fun! Servers were very friendly and attentive to our needs. Definitely we will come back there.

The experience was divine, the food, the service the atmosphere was most definitely appreciated. Every cue of meat brought to our table was delicious. Our server Johnny is very knowledgeable very polite engaging and I am already planning to revisit. The service was very speedy,  everything was a perfect date night. The entire place was clean, the bathroom was clean. The ambience was indeed very nice.
Best brizillian stakehouse!!!Johnny was so kind and has so much pride!!Service is excellent^^ and pineapple is the best of best~ must eat:)

Everything was great from the service to the food left so stuffed. Drinks were good and strong. I literally just ate the meats and grilled corn wish their buffet section has more options but it was still good.

If you are looking for a Brazilian style steak meal this is a cool spot. This place isn't anything fancy but you'll definitely get a nice meal for $40 bucks.Naturally we started with the hot buffet and salad bar. They have quite a bit of selections for everyone to choose from. Notably for me the best things were the mashed potatoes w/ gravy, shrimp, the cheesy bread and the salad. Again there are various things for everyone to try even sushi.For the meats everything that we tried in the rotation was good; Lamb, chicken, various different cuts of steak, roast beef, sausage and ribs. Everything was tasty and well flavored. One of the best things that came around in the rotation was their specialty Pineapple Caipirinha which was absolutely delicious. It tasted like grilled pineapple with brown sugar and honey, it was excellent!For dessert I ordered the red velvet cake which looked better than it tasted but it was okay. For a cocktail the waitress recommended the henny ginger mojito. It was definitely something different if you're a henny drinker.Overall the service was very good and honestly you can go dressed as is. I would recommend this spot for groups for sure!
Our server Johnny was a class act. Friendly, attentive, and respectful. Food was on point as usual.

I love Rainhas. They have a wide selection of meats and they also serve a delicious cinnamon grilled pineapple! They waiters come around and cut your meat for you, you can have as much as you want! We really like Johnny, he was so friendly and checked up on us so often! I have been going here for years. A beautiful place for family and food! You can dress up or dress casually, it's up to you!
The steak is just okay. They got other options that are not just meat. The side dishes are much better than the steak!

Just visited with a large party  of family members. We all left happy and with a big full belly.5 stars to our waiters Johnny and Jonathan, made our night even better. The meat selection has great variety, and they will get you whatever you want, while the rotation continues. Salad bar is amazing, alot of veggies and nonmeat options. Good variety for the kids too.We got to see samba dancers, atmosphere and music was good. Bathrooms were clean and non crowded.The place is huge, can seat about 300 and have private areas for events you can reserve. The parking is a bit challenging you must come like 30 mins ahead of your reservation time to park inside or with valet; if its a weekend street parking is almost impossible in the area.Totally recommend and will visit again.

I've been coming here for years and have never been disappointed! The servers are the best, so friendly, so attentive... My personal favorite server's been here for 16 years, Johnny (in the photo), is the absolute best. The customer service is outstanding and the food is even better! The lomo (pork) with cheese is juicy, never dry, and always tastes; my absolute favorite thing here! I recommend this place to everybody I know, and obviously I will be back.

Meat quality is mediocre, most cut are overcook. I'm surprised that they don't offer leg of lamb or lamb chop. Buffet bar has many selection but nothing special...Service is attentive. I may give it a 5 stars if dessert and coffee are included in the price. They don't even have an ice cream machine.
Delicious!!!! We enjoyed everything! Johnny made our night! Excellent service, a lot of meat options! We loved the pineapple and the picanha just amazing! We'll come back for sure!

We've been here 3 times and it's been great each visit. Johnny in particular was an incredibly polite and attentive server that helped make our last experience memorable. Johnny was prepared at the drop of a hat to serve us tons of meat.

It's okay. The meat is very salty. The salad bar is very basic. The service is okay. We waited 10 minutes for the first batch of meats and then it was slow after that. There is basically just different cuts of beef. No shrimp or scallops. The only pork was ribs and they smelled funny. The place was jam packed so maybe it's me. I just was not impressed
Amazing service! Fab food! Great staff! Great ambience. Clean. I've  been here 5 times, and the quality of food and service has been consistent. This is my favorite Brazilian restaurant!
Meat is amaaaazing. Extremely family friendly and the wait staff is on point. Especially Johnny. Thanks for the service!
Food was delicious. Johnny was excellent making sure we had everything we wanted. I'll be back.

A dining experience where they walk around offering you some cuts of meat is great and different. Go if you want to do something different. The food is good. It is annoying to be constantly looking out for the foods that you do like and waiting for them to come back with it for some more. Dessert- we ordered the pineapple speciality. Not worth it. It is an extra cost to the buffet.

Wednesday was my boyfriends birthday and we decided to go to Rainhas Churrascaria because he's a huge fan of Brazilian steak houses, and we were not disappointed! The food was amazing and the staff was attentive and friendly. The salad bar was huge and we lost count of different meats that came to the table after 13! I want to give a special thanks to Johnny (he was one of the meat slicers) for always making sure our plates were full of the most perfectly cooked meats. You can tell he takes pride in his job and wants to make sure everyone is having the best time possible! I even took a picture of him and my boyfriend to remember the amazing experience. 10/10 would recommend and we'll be going there a lot!

The food and the service that our server Johnny provided was exceptional. We felt so well taken care of, like having our own personal chef! He gave us the best Rainhas has to offer. Truly an evening to remember. We will be back next week for my birthday!

AMAZING RESTAURANT!! The food here is definitely top notch, and to top it off the servers are so attentive. They honestly offer a great service especially our server Johnny. They have A LOT of different meats and selections at the salad and hot plate section. The meat is the main attraction and it's definitely the star of the show. Will definitely be back!! Thanks Johnny!

Amazing location. I was looking for food on date night with the hubby. I was scared about price but honestly it's worth every penny $38.99 for unlimited meats and appetizers. If you don't eat meat there are several options for you! It's great for groups.

Absolutely incredible experience! Food was amazing and the service...... other restaurants need to learn from them.  Our hostess was super sweet and our server Johnny was absolutely phenomenal, I have never had a more welcoming and helpful server in my entire life, friendly, talkative and attentive to everything.  This place is our new go to...

All you can eat Brazilian steakhouse for about $50 after tip and tax? Yes, please! The meats are brought to you as you seated and you let them know how much you want.  Their roasted pineapple was my favorite.I really enjoyed their service, the staff were very attentive and our waitress made sure we were doing satisfied during the whole dinner.  If you have a group of 8 people or more, then reservations are recommended, the restaurant doesn't take reservations for groups less than 8 people.  I came here at 630pm on a Friday evening and there wasn't a wait at all, but by 730/800pm the restaurant was pretty packed. So I recommend coming on the earlier side if you can.  The food was good, but I wouldn't say it was amazing.  The only thing that was amazing was the service and roasted pineapple.  Some cuts of meat were on the dry side.  I would definitely recommend this place if you really enjoy eating meat. For the experience alone, it was worthwhile.

On Saturday Aug.10th around 5pm. Went to celebrate a birthday, my first time there. It was so nice & the meats cut tableside were AMAZING & DELICIOUS! The pineapple was sooo delicious. And what an assortment of food to choose from. Everything was delicious. We recommend not loading up at the buffet so much & so you can enjoy the delicious grilled meats. I ate so much that I didn't try any sweets from the dessert bar! The cakes looked so good!!The staff was really nice I enjoyed Johnny so friendly & nice and especially our waitress Karla who was so sweet & had an infectious smile & laughter. She was so nice really professional. You must try the margaritas SO GOOD!A really nice place! Donna
Johnny is the best!!! Service and food was great :) get the pineapple and short rib!!!

Been here a couple of times now. Always a good experience. The place is very large and open space.  Great for larger party's. Has good food selection and food come quick even when place is crowded. The pre-cooked food is always very good and love the cheesy bread. The meets were all cooked great and had very good flavor. Lots of different choices. Loved the pineapple. Service for the most part is very good and fast. The waiter would ask if everything was good and if there waS any meets or other foods that we would like to eat.

Disappointed. Came here with my family and it was a disappointment. We were served meat about 4 times and they never came back again. We continuously had to ask the waiter to come. We sat right by the cooking area and our waiter couldn't care less about us. He was friendly in the beginning, but afterwards he didn't even care. However, I also did notice he was awfully friendly with other tables. Needless to say, after paying $150 for dinner, I will not go back there anytime soon.

My husband has been wanting to bring me here so we came for our 6yr wedding anniversary.  And man oh man. Our waiter Johnny was AMAZING and didnt skip a beat with service. Definitely 5   if i could give more i would....  food is absolutely delicious  and the pineapple is the key to it all!!  Definitely returning

This is probably my favorite Brazilian steak house in queens. The unlimited meats dinner is a no brainer. The severs come around very often and are very generous with their portions. After 5/6 rounds of meat I was stuffed. I would highly recommend the chimichurri sauce to pair with your meats. We had Johnny, who is amazing and put us one to the secret sauce. If you are feeling a little full ask for the pineapple, it's absolutely delicious and helps create more space in your tummy to push more meat down. We paired our meal with a 35$ bottle of wine, definitely over priced but still good. There is an unlimited salad and hot bar but we only visited it once. Lastly the come around with a platter of desserts!!! Mostly cakes, but very tasty. We will definitely be back and we'll ask for Johnny!

Went here for the first time to celebrate my Dad's 67th birthday and I must say it was a wonderful experience filled with great service and good food. Johnny was one of the serves and we were so delighted by his service. We explain it was our first time here and my whole family was welcome as his own. Definitely, we recommend this place as a must-try experience because once you go you will be definitely come back. Thank to the Rainhas staff for making my dad's birthday special.

My cousin took me to this wonderful buffet. I had an incredible time. The drinks are delicious and affordable. The service was phenomenal the waiters comes around frequently and ask if u want anything. Kitchen staffs walks around with various varieties of meats to sample and corn and pineapple. To die for I fell in love with the pineapple. The atmosphere is welcoming and relax. Very huge and clean. Definitely would be back again

This was a great experience! Went for a friends birthday and it was so nice. The service was great and the staff was pleasant. Everyone had a smile on their face! They have valet parking. The dinner room is great with a waterfall. Very pretty! Also they have a bar. You pay $40 for a meat rotation as people come to your table with different kinds of meats every few minutes. You get to try all different types of Brazilian meats. As well as a full buffet. They also have this awesome pineapple with like cinnamon on it. Totally worth a try. The sangria was $35 a pitcher as to glass is $10. Beer was about $10 a bottle. Good place to come to for a party with family and friends

This is NOT a Brazilian churrasqueria. The quality of the meat was very disappointed. Salty and cheap cuts. We asked for costilla and they're gave us a boiled nasty cut of something that we couldn't eat, just 3 pieces of garbage. The buffet was a joke. Remind me of something along like cheap buffet like cafeteria. Cheap and unfresh salad.  Hot dishes were not appetizing at all. Cheese bread was a joke ( only if you request) I'm so regret that we went there for my mom birthday.  We won't ever be going back again and I dont recomend this place. The service was ok. We paid $ 300 for 6 peoples just for the grilled pineapple.  To the owner!!!don't be cheap with the meat. If not you should open a sandwich store.
Good food, great service, beautiful venue. Johnny (the server) is outstanding!!! Definitely coming back!!

This place used to be great! I've been there a few times with my wife and family in the past. There seems to be new owners now that are catering to the masses and they don't really care about quality anymore. They've changed their hot and cold salad bar offerings cheap junk and the BBQ Meats we're not up to par like they used to be.We won't ever be going back again.

Great server named Johnny attended to me and my husband it was my last meal pregnant and I was in the mood for meats. Best mojitos capairinas even virgin drinks. Clean and huge place. Not overpriced like it the city. Parking too. Great buffet.

First time here at Rainhas! Why did it take me so long to come!! Seriously I don't think I have any complaints at all about this place. Service was great Johnny was wonderful! The good was amazing, even the hot buffet and cold salad bar. Love their shrimp dish and ceviche! I can't wait to bring my family there. This place is a must have if you want good food and good service for good price! Oh how can I forget about that pineapple and cheese bread! Make sure you try that too!!!!!

It's ok compared to Texas de Brazil. There is no lamb served. The steak is good though. The overall price is affordable but the dessert is relatively expensive. It's interesting that they have grilled pineapple!

My family and I came here on Christmas Eve, the staff on board was amazing (even though you can tell they were understaffed)!! But, ROMERO (one of the people who bring the meat to tables) wow was exceptionally incredible!! Despite how busy it was, he always ensured to provide excellent customer service! He always went above and beyond to bring us cuts of meats that we wanted. He is the definition of a hardworking exceptional server (even though he is not a waiter). Wow, I hope he is there every single day so I can return to enjoy the experience. Overall, today was the best service we've received in all of the times that we've been here! To the manager, Romero deserves a reward/promotion for his dedicated service :)

Amazing Food! That is the first thing I will say about this place, effortlessly. Will come back for more! The meats are good extremely juicy as they should be. With numerous choices involved, this should be your next stop. 10/10

Always love coming here with my family, because there's something for everyone. From all the grilled meats, grilled pineapple, to their buffet tables and salad... you can never not find something to eat.Everything is super fresh and tasty. If you are looking for a particular meat to be served, just ask the waiter, and they usually grilled something up fresh for the table.Must try those sticky wings... delicious and you won't be disappointed
The Place was great with great service like johnny the server did a al some job .food was great don't mind coming back again.

$45/person, not many buffet options, steaks came often, tea was slow (fault of the woman who for some reason could not find our table but our waiter Johnathan was splendid and apologized for this and did not charge us for the tea). The steaks is worth coming for but I would suggest expanding the buffet and sauce options.

The food was good. If you visit, safe your appetite for the brisket and the grilled pineapple which comes out at the very end of the meal. They are far superior to the other meats that come out. I also though the chicken wings and sausage were good but that grilled pineapple is really something else. The salad buffet was okay, I didn't go back for seconds. I though the white rice was a little undercooked and that the beans didn't have an authentic Brazilian flavor. I would probably try a different Churrascaria before returning to this restaurant.

This place is awesome! I came here for a bday dinner for a friend of mine. The food in here is superb. They were all well cooked, fresh and tasty. The ones that I liked the most were the Picanhas and the pineapples. Apparently, this place are well known for these two dishes. In terms of service, the waiters/waitresses were all attentive to our needs. Even though my party was made of 27 ppl. Most of our needs were well satisfied. In terms of pricing, I believe pricing is good for the quality and quantity of all you can eat buffet. The food were delish and the amount given was superb. This place is definitely worth coming again and again! XD

The food was excellent and the restaurant is very spacious and beautiful. The service by the food servers, Elias and Rameo was amazing. They made sure we got the meat on time and we can see that they both worked very hard going from one table to the next. They were also very kind and friendly. Thank you for such wonderful hospitality.
Food is great, but service leaves something to be desired. It seemed as though our table consistently got overlooked during the meat service. Buffet has a nice selection, and drinks are strong.

Great experience, Johnny was a pleasure and knows how to please the crowd. Hes even a fabulous photographer. Ms Diaz  our waitress was sweet as well. Loved everyone's tentativeness, and the unique atmosphere and experience.The food was awesome, all of the meats  were juicy, tender and seasoned. The pineapples were quite the treat.Please keep up the great work and customer service.

A little pricier than other churrascarias (ie, NJ's Brazilian neighborhood in Newark) but definitely more upscale and elegant so worth it. Service was excellent and the food was very good. There was a large variety of buffet items, some of them even substantial dishes on their own (ie chicken marsala, spaghetti w meat). There were also a decent amount of options for those who dont eat meat or dont love meat. Would recommend.
Took my mom here for her birthday. Great food and great service. Special thank you to Johnny for bringing my mom another round of her fav meat of the night!

My second visit at Rainhas Churrascarria.  I suggested this place because I feel that compared to other similarly themed restaurants, Rainhas has one of the better salad bars. One member of my party doesn't eat meat and was satisfied with the salad bar selection. Jonathan gave us an enthusiastic greeting. He accommodated a 13 person party and got all of drinks right on the first try. Johnny was definitely our MVP. He made sure we had a chance to try eat cut of meat. If there was anything that we weren't presented he was sure to ask for it and then follow up and bring it to us. The restaurant was very strict about not seating us until the party had arrived in full despite the restaurant's known delay in valet parking. Even then, they were patient and accommodating. They did not rush us out and were great about coordinating a double Birthday celebration. I hope that anyone that visits Rainhas has the pleasure of being helped by Johnny, Chucky and Jonathan. It was a pleasure.

The meat selection here is pretty limited and falls subpar to my experience elsewhere. My favorite thing here is the pineapple, but that's really it. I don't feel like the food comes around often enough.

Umm this is a hard place to rate. The service was impeccable but the food left a lot to be desired. Our wait staff was great made a lot of jokes and created a friendly environment but the buffet style food was not that great. I understand that we got there with less than two hours to closing but there should be an ample amount of food left. Many things were down to the scraps. The quality of the buffet reminded me of something along the likes of Golden Corral. The meat that came around was great.We at the table  enjoyed that part of the evening. So all in all the staff would get five stars but the food from the buffet would get 1.5

Gave you guys a last chance, we were there for early dinner Saturday, told the waitress our past issues. But still service was terrible, meat selection was terrible and the amount of meat going around to our table was poor it was 10-15 minutes between the selections., even when we requested a certain meat it didn't come out.....we noticed a table came and they brought them everything over and over and kept bringing them every variety of meat plus requests, yes got much attention from the waitress and the meat servers.... for years we have been coming every weekend for dinner, but I can't see myself coming back. Too bad it was my favorite dinner spot...
Omgggg. What a great experience!! The food and service was beyond amazing! We are full AND happy!! We will definitely be back!
Great sorts of meats but this food gave me a stomach from over eating, definitely worth it.
Love this place food is always fresh!!! Cheese bread is the best! All the meats are great!!
Great food. Even better service. The servers are very friendly and accommodating. The pineapple is amazing. Waiter Johnny was excellent!

The staff, very friendly, attentive for the most part...a lot of places aren't. They came to check on us often, from beginning to end of our whole dinning experience.We were seated next to their drink cellar area, pretty dark corner; all night and only once was I unable to get someone right away. And they insists on doing their job and performing the services required or asked of them. (Prime example of that would be our runner, Jonathan.)Our server: Celeste (Very friendly, patient, and attentive)Runner: Jonathan (I heard often unrecognized, please give this man some well deserved acknowledgements or a raise...He was fantastic)Our Meat guy: Franklin (He was awesome too, you make requests and he'd bring it..Every time.)People that you know that they don't hate their jobs lolFood/Meat section: Briskets, beef ribs, flank steak, skirt steak, beef tenderloin (picanha),  filet mignon wrapped in bacon,  chicken wrapped in bacon, sausages, lamb, caramelized pinapples, plus a hot and cold buffet selection...etc) Other selections by request: quail, duck, chicken heartsNo BYOB and desserts and drinks not included. However, this is an AYCE Brazilian steakhouse with no time limits. $35.95 per person, and after tax and tip, roughly $50 each, not bad.The meat quality isn't the highest of grades, but for the price....It'd make most carnivores happy without a doubt.

The meat skewers were excellent! As good as I remember and it's been maybe 15 years since I have been back here. The salad bar/buffet was pretty lame for the price of $38.95 per person along with the fact that desserts and drinks are not included. However, if you're like me and are there for the meat and happy with a good Caesar salad then this is the place for you. The meats are seasoned well and brought out at a steady pace and in a variety of doneness. I think I ate my $40 worth of meat and had my meat fix for the month. I left a happy customer and you will too f you can half your body weight in meat!
Amazing food! Johnny is the best! Will definitely come back again very soon! My favorite restaurant in Queens.

Not the best churrascaria I've been to. I love meat and sadly don't recall any of the beef cuts being memorable. I did however ask for lamb twice because it was cooked to my liking.It might sound crazy but I'd pay the buffet price to eat just the grilled pineapples. No joke!

Weekend is better to go to this place . Weekdays , they don't serve lots of meat. Give u small portion of meat like u just there for meat tasting ! Only weekend is the best to eat in there . We have been there on Monday which is no good .we have paid the same amount but the service is not good and meat portion was small .

This place is super busy. There is a buffet which has all kinds of food. Lots of vegetables for any vegetarians joining a family dinner. The only issue I had with this place is the plethora of red meat and no poultry in sight. I had told several different meat bearers that I wanted poultry or pork but yet all that kept arriving to our table was red meat. And even when I saw the little wings on their meat serving rods they would skip our table and jump to all the other tables instead of ours. I finally got so upset that I went up to the manager and complained. Only then did we have all sorts of variety of poultry and pork come our way in waves. I understand that it is very busy but they need to have a better way to serve the tables and keep the patrons happy. All in all I ended up leaving stuffed because I kept taking so much poultry because I then felt bad that I complained and they sent every single waiter in the place to our table to appease us. I thank the management team for doing their best to make our visit a pleasant one.

Had a amazing time here much better food and honestly staff is amazing friendly and inviting. Johnny was awesome great personality and was very kind good guy. I will definitely be back here again because of the experience I had with the staff especially Johnny thanks man for listening to the customer appreciate you.

We are a group of 4 young families trying this restaurant for the first time and we were SUPER HAPPY! The food is awesome! The buffet and the meat is unlimited! The steak served at table were fantastic!!! We love our server Johnny, Jeremie and 1 more guy we forgot the name. Johnny probably one of the brightest and happiest face! He is the one of sweetest and funniest guys. He served and talked and sharing experiences with us! Good vibes! we will definitely come back!! Love this restaurant and the wonderful customer service!

Great father's day dinner celebration!  I've been coming to this Churrascaria since it was Greenfield's.  It's a basic cold and hot buffet but the real experience is the array of seasoned meats that are slowly grilling in the cocina from sausage and skirt steak to tenderloin and slow cooked ribs.  I also noticed grilled pineapple and grilled corn on the server's plates which is new thing.An an FYI, all drinks and desserts are not  included in the $38 buffet price so be aware of this.  The desserts and drinks can get very pricey.  The signature cocktail was a pineapple caipirinha which was good but not a $13 drink.  All desserts (flan, tres leches, cheesecake) were $9 each which is a little pricey for desserts that were not made in house.A few tips, if you want lamb then advise your server earlier in the dinner because it's considered a special request (does not cost extra).  The hostess and the server (Yennifer) were very pleasant and attentive.  Lastly, I appreciate the fact that this churrascaria actually looks at the "green and red" table signs so they know when to bring the grilled meats.  Have a great time!

So good! I came here with some friends for my bf's birthday. The food was amazing. If you havent had brazilian food this place is a great introduction. The service was great. Overall no complaints and i would definitely recommend trying them.

I have been here since it used to be greenfields and man oh man this place really has changed,so sorry to say I will never ever ever ever come back to this place ever again,the spices on the meat and the cheap buffet it's not worth the time never the less the money,,,service is always good

My family came here for my mom's birthday dinner. It was our very first time eating at a Brazilian steakhouse. We arrived around 6:45pm on Wednesday night. I ordered tap water for the family, but they gave us a spring bottle water and charged $9. It made no sense because they had a man serving water for free. It would've been nice if the waitress warned us about that. We did say it was our first time. Other than that the meat service was great! My favorite meat selection were Beef Tenderloin Steak, steak sirloin, and BBQ spare ribs. The warm cinnamon pineapple was delicious. The salad/entree bar wasn't bad. You get salads, rice, pasta, and American foods like chicken nuggets and french fries. It's $38.75 per person. Then you add drinks, tax, and gratuity. You can spend about $50 per person. Do not eat a lot at the salad/entree bar. Try the meats! They offer sausages, pork, beef, chicken, and steak.

Absolutely loved their food and impeccable service! George I believe was the one who served us and he went above and beyond to cater our needs. He even went out of his way just to get us lamb even though it wasn't rotating at that moment. All in all I loved the place and will definitely be going back again!

I went here on Friday April 6, 2018 for a party. We were a large group approximately 40-50 people. This is a large rodizio place. It is the typical size of an all you can eat buffet. It is nicely decorated and it was a comfortable temperature- important to me because I hate a freezing cold restaurant. They have a large selection of food to eat from their salad bar and hot food trays. Included in the drinks you can have is soda. Strike one in my book- you can't include coffee or tea?! I'm not saying a cappuccino or Earl Grey or something like that. I mean a lipton tea bag or plain sanka coffee is not too much to ask. Strike two was that I had to wait approximately 57 minutes before I finally saw someone with meat come around. Now I know we were a large group so they were letting us settle in but some of us only came to eat the meat- not to fill up on the salad bar. A real pro rodizio eater knows- forgo the sides and load up on the meat! Now note I said I saw someone come around with the meat he skipped me because I did not have a plate. (I had no idea about this plate thing when they had mini plates on the table.  That should have been clear especially with as many times as I asked about the meat!) So I had to wait for him to make his rounds and then I was able to sample what was left of his selection. The meat comes out very slow at this place. There does not seem to be a rhythm or method to it. Just someone will pop up every now and again. There was a lot of lag time waiting for the meats to come around. (I was sitting on an end so I was easily accessible to the guachos (meat servers) to get to) Food: The guachos come around with Bacon wrapped chicken, bacon wrapped filet mignon, bbq ribs, spare ribs, buffalo chicken, bbq chicken, prime rib, roast beef, lemon crusted pork  loin, cinnamon dusted pineapple and kebab meat. There is also the option to try duck, quail and lamb but they don't really advertise this. I had to ask for this twice. Salad bar: olives, bean salad, pickles, pepers/gherkins, beet salad, spicy mango (mango chow) , corn, cucumber salad, chickpeas, artichokes, Caesar salad, jello, fruit salad, chips, salsa, shredded meat, imitation crab meat, roasted potatoes, pasta salads, other green salads, spicy chicken, chicken nuggets, onion rings, platanos, french fries, cauliflower, broccoli, creamed spinach, mashed potatoes, gravy, chicken marsala, tilapia oreganto, shrimp bobo, shaghetti bolognese, mac and cheese, yellow rice, and black beans with bacon.  Overall Experience: I think perhaps my experience was lackluster because the main waiter for our party seemed a bit overwhelmed. He had a helper at first (Emely) but then she disappeared and it was just him. I really wished that I could say I liked this place especially in light of its price point. You get a lot for the price plus dessert. However, this experience has sullied it for me. Perhaps I will give them another try, but for right now, I'd rather go to a place that doesn't have me begging for what I paid for.

I haven't been here in years. I used to come a lot, probably 10 or more years ago but for whatever reason I haven't been back until recently. It's a Brazilian style restaurant and if you have never been to one, and you love meat, then you are missing out. They have Valet Parking which is convenient and its free as well. Pull up and you get a ticket and no worries there. You walk thru two sets of doors and the hostess is right there. We were seated right away, and its a very large restaurant.So there is a decent salad bar and small hot food buffet, mostly sides. But you didn't come here for that. Do yourself a favor and don't load up on the buffet stuff. The salad bar is good and the sides are rice, pasta, beans, soup and a few more. Once your grab the sides you wait for the meat. There's a card now on the table for each person and depending if you want more or not you have it turned to a certain side. The meat is bought out on skewers and every minute or so something new is out. There was skirt steak, lamb, bacon wrapped filet, more steak, chicken, and more meat that I don't remember. If you have room there's a dessert cart rolling around with red velvet cake, cheese cake and a few more. It was pricier than I remember but that was a long time ago and I thought this place has gotten better so well worth it. I will be back soon.

An amazing place as usual, the price is what you pay for simply said, no wait and seated quickly. Once we arrive we already know the drill to get the plates stacked and get back to the table to murder the meats to come out. Although this is my first review on yelp I've visited this place 8 other times. Pictures to be posted as well A+++

my girlfriend and her family has came here a lot but it was my first time going with them and wow !!! it was an awesome experiencelots of food but the best part is getting lots of steak and sausage and pineapple getting to you back and forwardi got so full but great full i would come back again !

Meat overload! What makes this restaurant stand out for me is the service , Johny and Melfis make sure your satisfy with your food and always check on us beside the guys walking around with their meat.

A large expanse of a restaurant with a steady stream of meats.  The tenderloin was one of my favorites for its texture.  The beef rib was very rich and tender but the outside was a little too salty.  The lechon was another highlight as the server readily parted with specific body part requests from the piglet (i.e. knuckle, cheek).  The passion fruit mousse was light and not too sweet.
Love Rainhas!Me and the husband go at least once a month. The food is tasty and the staff is incredibly sweet. Totally recommend the bacon wrapped chicken and filet

This place has gotta be one of the best place to get stuffed. If you cant eat dont come here,lolz. Especial thanks to Jaime and Jhonny for the great service and company. You guys made our 9th year wedding anniversary dinner wonderful. See you soon.....

buffet salad bar / hot dishes were sub par. comparing this to Fogo De Chau in the city, this restaurant is simply not as nice, service wasn't as on point, and food was just okay.we came here on a thursday evening(4 of us), without reservations. we were sat promptly. the first meat arrived at our table around half an hour later, so in the meantime, we were picking at the food from the mediocre buffet. only thing worth eating was the rice. the salad bar was honestly just sad af, with the tomatoes and cucumbers looking like they were immersed in water for days.the meat itself was fine. they had a good variety, but when i asked for pork belly which is my ultimate favorite, they said they only had it on certain nights. i tried the duck which was interesting bc even though im a huge fan of duck i felt it wasnt seasoned well enough.my favorite meat was the tenderloin, although was confused when they could only offer "rare" or "well done". why would you not have it cooked medium? isnt that how most people commonly have it? curious.will not be returning, but it seems people in the neighborhood think this is a very fancy restaurant. it was pricey, food wasn't memorable.

Services here are better than their food. Food choices at the buffet section are not the best..and the unlimited meat just taste soso, many of them are very bland. Only meat really like is the sirloin and that is it. Pineapple is no doubt the best, but not paying another $40 just for the pineapple to be honest.

My family has been coming to this restaurant since I was a little girl and there is nothing better than going back after so many years and being served with the same quality...if not better. There aren't too many places that we were introduced to as kids that are still around, let alone thriving! Brought my future husband here and he was amazed with the quality & quantity of food that is served. The server even let him cut his own piece of meat for his birthday! The waitresses always know the best drinks to serve us and we always experience great service.Lifelong HAPPY customers here!
Such a pretty place to eat . I went on a Thursday and it had a nice amount of ppl in it. The place had slot of pretty declarations . I didn't like the lamb everything else tasted great

Where do I begin? I used to enjoy this place.My last two birthday celebration dinners have been here. My brother enjoyed it so much he had his birthday here. I called this location as I have done in the past to make a reservation for a table. I confirmed  my reservation for 14 people. I confirmed with the hostess if the policy was the same which I was told in years past and this year that in order for you party to be seated you would need 50 percent of your guest to be present. Proceed to the night of October 6th 2018. I arrived to the restaurant 10 minutes prior to my scheduled reservation with 2 of my guest. I greeted the hostess and explained that I was the here early and that U was waiting for some more guest to arrive. Currently there are 3 of us waiting on the 4 more so that we would be seated. Within 5 mins 2 more people showed up and then 3 minutes after that 2 more people showed up and roughly after  2 mins after that 1 more guest showed up. So now the total of guest are 8. I reapproach the hostess and explain that I have 8 guest here ready to be seated so that we can startvto situate out selfs. The host then flat out said that you would need to have 80 percent of your guest to be seated. To my suprise I explained to her that When I made my reservation they told me that ai would need 50 peecent of my guest to ve seated. She then called a manager who was unwilling to seat us with 8 of the 14 people of my party.As I am going back and forth with this manager in regards to being seated 2 more of my guest walk in bring my total of guest to 10. And you guessed it even with 10 guest they still would not seat us. Now we are queued waiting damn near all the way in the bathroom. A truly embaraasing moment. I ask to speak with the owner and then the manager proceeds to call hom over. As I am going back and forth with the owner of the establishment 2 more of guest arrive and you guessed it they still did not want to seat me. After a couple more minutes the manager reluctantly sat us. The manager did not even have the respect to look me in thr eyes as he was talking to me. I will never patton this establishment again. Our waitress was non attentive and we found ourselves dying of thirst. The picana is the best meat there but ai am pretty sure I can get that some where else at the same level if not better.I hate to use the race card but I feel as if the manager tried to profile me at this location. We spent over 700 dollars that night. Really loved this place in the past but now I dont see my self ever going there again

Vegetarian nightmare... but meat eater dream!I loved their sweet sausage, spicy sausage, steak, bbq wings, pineapple and grill corn.Once you sit down, waitress will explain the red and green card. Explains drinks and desert is not included. Also they will take your drink. I ordered the Rainhas signature pineapple caipirinha. Signature caipirinha has mixture of vodka, pineapple, pineapple juice and lime on ice.We then headed to the buffet and helped ourselves with some salad, fruit, sushi, soup, beef stew, fish, mix vegetable.After finishing our appetisers. Ramos and his staff comes with continues meat until you are full and fill your card to red.Service was great, dishes were replaced and water was refilled. A lady will push deserts around and if you have appetite, she will take your order. I had tres leche, which was delicious; not too sweet.Before we leave, 2 dancers started dancing around the restaurant. If you didn't make reservation, expect 1/2 to 1 hour wait.This restaurant is very well run.Excellent!!

We had a Xmas dinner event that left us all full.Everything from our waiter to the food was great. Drinks were strong and well made. I would highly recommend here for special events. They even sing you happy birthday.

I don't ever leave reviews but this restaurant deserves it best place ever the service is amazing , the food to die for we had Johnny & Chris  serving us and they were  the sweetest most attentive people ever always checking up on us  , also the rest of the staff treated us amazing forgot their names , being our first time there i had the best experience , i had to stop eating just to write this so i don't forget to do it because they truly deserve it . I haven't left and already planning to bring my parents and friends over . And last but not least beautiful restaurant

This restaurant was amazing. One of the best Brazilian steakhouse in nyc. The meat selection was astonishing and very delicious. Our waiter Johnny & Jonathan were very attentive and friendly, also the other staff were extremely nice as well. I came to celebrate my birthday and had the most amazing experience ever with my family.
The quality of the meats was very disappointing, most of them were very salty and fatty. Sad to say this was first and last time going there. Also the side dishes were not appetizing at all
This is one of my favorite Brazilian restaurants! The staff is amazing, the decor is beautiful,  the music is great, and the food is just the best!! Great location for small or super large parties.
This place is allways a good idea if you're craving great steak!!! The food is incredible...waitress are great and the restaurant is allways so clean...

Came here last week on a Friday night expecting this place to fix my meat crave but it didn't. I haven't been here in about two or three years. The first time I came here the servers were constantly bringing out different cuts of meats but this time around it was pretty sad. They brought out two different sausages, bacon wrapped chicken, roast beef, top sirloin, and pineapple. Where were the other cuts of meats?!?!?! The servers were very friendly but I came here to gorge myself in MEATS. I was not full and ended up eating pasta from the salad bar. After tip and tax, I think each one of us paid like $50/person. This place is not like what it was and I won't be coming back here again.

The Story: Came here with a friend I haven't seen in over a year!Food: Well...food was okay. Unfortunately, when we went it was around the holidays and the meat came over rather slowly (there were 5-10min pauses that I had no meat on my plate) and I became full. I enjoyed their pineapple, corn and picanha dishes. You have to pay extra for dessert :(Price: about $40 a person. The norm for Brazilian AYCE BBQ.Service: Service was good. Our waitress came up to check on us frequently. The slow part were the meats :(Parking & Finding the Place: They have valet parking.Additional Thoughts/Tips: Maybe i'll pick a slower period to come as there are less tables for the meats to visit

Very disappointed. Never going back. Place was recommended as was told it's great. Decided to check it out. Had a horrible experience in 2017. Decided to give it another try. Not surprising- had another bad experience. First of all- they accuse u of sharing food. Maybe some customers do that. But do not go around accusing ppl just because that's what u want to do. Secondaly, they charge for everyone on the table. Even if it's a 3 month old baby- like seriously!!! Because the baby ate the food , inhaled the air or occupied space -1 seat-  in ur massive area??Food maybe great. But customer service is horrible. Takes away from ur appetite.2 tries is more than enough. Left the place with a bad taste in my mouth. Adios peeps. Never again.

I love a Brazilian steakhouse...But I really love a clean Brazilian steakhouse with great service! This place is located in Queens, right near LaGuardia airport. On a Thursday night, we were able to get seated pretty quickly and head over to the side bar, which had plenty of great options and it was pretty well maintained. The sides were not bad and then came the severs with the meats...fantastic. Everything served was absolutely delicious and what I liked most about this place was the juicy smoked pineapple that was the perfect flavor to complement the meat. My server made me a cocktail that was so awesome that I was convinced that I was bi....lingual. I cant pronounce the cocktail with Spanish ingredients right now but at the time, I thought I was fluent lol, so that alone was an experience I equally enjoyed and bonus to the food. I also really enjoyed the price. For the quality, I thought it was a pretty decent price point and I certainly didn't leave disappointed.
Excellent service by Johnny and Karla. The manager was also very attentive and immediately took care of a dining issue we had. Will definitely come again!!

Where do I start? Oh yeah, with the salad bar! Rainhas flip-a-card steak buffet is an extravaganza of meats, from the hot dishes to spins of steak and sweet caramelized pineapple. Johnny, our waiter, was attentive and kind, even when there were four loud birthdays happening around us. I recommend the top (and bottom) sirloin and the RED jello. 5 stars. Dan
The ambiance and the food is great especially if your a meat lover like myself. Make sure you sit in the section Johnny is serving because he keeps the food flowing and is very attentive.

On 11/17 /19  we celebrated our daughter's christening with our friends/family  at this establishment , unfortunately  this will be our last time .We've been to this  restaurant several times before and every time the service became worst and worst  but thought nothing of it until now . We selected this  restaurant only because it could accommodate a large  group .Problem : service was bad they didn't come around with as much of a selection or water for our group  .When  I asked for our cake they placed it on a dirty table no clean plate or utensils and walked away .When our waiter came  back to our area, he argued with me making  excuses as to why he  didn't clean the table off . We then asked to speak to a manager  a female came out to our table had a nasty attitude , didn't not seem apologetic or as if she wanted to resolve any issues  she quickly said with an attitude that she doesn't want to many people speaking to her ( I immediately shut down cause I know myself ) and her attitude was to much my husband tried to explain what happened ,she told my husband she would have to roll back the cameras to see what actually happened ,But her workers did nothing wrong .  What's crazy is that a few days later ,I kid u not someone called from the restaurant saying that they were sorry for the managers behavior and that they normally treat African Americans as such cause they feel that  we won't  tip , what's a tip when your spending $1000 at an establishment . It's a shame ... that they tried to ruin a wonderful moment .
The food and customer service was outstanding, in particular one of our servers, Johnny was very courteous and friendly an all around good personality.
Food was very underwhelming. I was expecting a lot higher quality and flavor but I was mistaken. Our waitress didn't do so hot either.

This was my first time coming here with the new owner and name, let me tell you I was very impressed. Our server Johnny was excellent. He was very attentive in describing the types of meat being served. Also my fiancé is learning Spanish and Johnny was very sweet in showing my fiancé how to pronounce Spanish words. Also the hot food bar and salad bar was very yummy!! I will recommend anyone who lives or visiting New York to come here!

My friends and I went to this place for New Year's Day dinner. We walked in and we're seated immediately. It took quite sometime for us to get a waitress though so we just helped our selves. Finally after our first plates were almost finished, the waitress finally came for our drink orders. She was pleasant but at one point we friend to order a specific drink and she said they didn't have it but then we saw other people with it so maybe we were describing it properly. They food was delicious and cooked properly. Honestly I've been to quite a few Brazilian steakhouses around the country and this was the least impressive but it was good. I have no real complaints and you get free valet parking which is nice. I'd go again!

Brace yourself for a meal that will make you want a pillow at the end of it because that's how our entire party felt after our meat-a-thon!I came here this past Saturday evening for a birthday party dinner with a group of 20 people and we had a genuinely great time here. As for the food, as a whole it had its ups and downs, but experience wise this was a FANTASTIC choice for a big group gathering.Let's start from the beginning -- the arrival. The restaurant offers valet parking, but if you're not a fan of valet parking like me, then there's plenty of street parking nearby, including right in front of the restaurant. The restaurant had a very elegant feel to it and, to sum it up best, looked very classy. Although the decor was nice and modern, there was NO dress code at all so there was an assortment of people dressing to impress to people who were very casual .... and I MEAN very casual with baseball caps, running sneakers, t-shirts, etc. The bar was located right after the entrance and there were a few TVs for those who wanted to just relax there. The restaurant had a very open feel to it and you really could see the entire dining area throughout wherever you stood or sat, including the bar.After arrival, our party was seated promptly and, since we were starving, we got straight down to business! We were asked for our drink orders, then proceeded straight to the salad bar and hot buffet. The salad bar and hot buffet weren't huge, but there was plenty enough there to wet our appetites. Pastas, rice, oxtail, various cold pastas, salads and cut up fruits were just a sample of what they had to offer. A word of advice --- If you paid $35.95 for access to the full rotation of meats, DON'T GET FILLED UP ON THE SALAD BAR OR HOT BUFFET! It's quite tempting to load up a plate of goodness from there, but the meats begin arriving fast and furiously after you sit as it did for us so hold on tight and be patient. So many different waiters with variations of meats began approaching our table so quickly that our heads were spinning - Sauages, pork, different cuts of steak, prime rib, spare ribs, lechon (roast pig) - you name it they had it! They even had grilled pineapple slices going around! Despite the decent variety (as there should be), the meats were ok. 60% of the meats were unfortunately cooked too well and dried out, while some were a bit too much on the raw side. Even though we were disappointed in some of the meats, there were still 2 verrrrry bright spots in the spare ribs and lechon. The spare ribs were literally fall off the bone! Moist, juicy and super duper tender. The lechon was cooked perfectly -- moist meat and extra crispy skin -- just the way we love our roast pig.If you manage to stay awake after the gastronomic test you just had and have some room for dessert, the restaurant offers it for extra charge. Once in awhile, someone will roll a wagon of cakes around ranging from red velvet, tiramisu, tres leches, chocolate and try to tempt you to fit a slice into your quickly expanding tire of a belly. In closing, as for the capacity of the restaurant, we were seated at around 7pm and the restaurant was only about half full, however when 8pm rolled around the place was full to the brim so reservations seem like the best way to go. Birthday parties were rampant throughout and huge parties of 15+ were scattered all over the restaurant. Our experience here was very good and the service was truly excellent, but the meats have some room for improvement and correction, which can be done. With that said, for $35.99/person it's so hard to beat this Churrascaria deal and worth at least 1 go around!

My boss brought us here for our christmas dinner, this was my first time visiting this place and the experience was amazing. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave such friendly service, respectful and kind. Had a blast the only name i could remember is johnny...haha he was awesome the young lady she was so cool nice and sweet talked us out of our comfort zone to trying new things she too was amazing...and the dominican guy with dreads omg...hahaha he was cool too although he passed by us twice then gone...over all i would definitely reccomend this place to my friends and family..awesome awesome place to visit... the food amazing I had duck...DOMINICAN DUCK!! (inside joke between us and Johnny) oh oh...haha the roasted pineapple my God im in love..awesome..sorry im just going and going but it was AMAZING YOU WILL NOT REGRET YOUR VISIT..

Great Drinks fun restaurant. Arrived for a business dinner. The meat they served was delicious. Everything they gave us was really good although it felt like force feeding. However the food under the chafing dishes left something to be desired. I stuck with the Cesar salad and stayed away from the other options. All in all a fun place to eat but a far cry from fine dining.
First timer, food was amazing, the staff was very friendly, environment was very cozy. I will be going again!

Cane here for the 3rd time this year.  As always the food is excellent.  With so many choices from the salad bar to the meats, there was no shortage of variety.  I also like the option of not having the mewt and having the salad bar only.  With a large group and a large variety of tastes, this allows for options for all.  Of course there is the excellent service. The staff is all very hard working making sure the food is fresh, the water cups are full and you are always satisfied.  Of note is one gentleman, Johnny - see the photo attached.  He truly works hard, loves what he does and makes the experience even better than the 5 star rating.  I will definitely be back.  Thanks Johnny!!

Place is awesome. Grills were great and pricing were great...aside from the drinks and desserts, they are easily $10 or more each, I guess that's how they make up for the cheaper grills. Other than that though, servers were nice, they come around often, salad and apps buffet were not bad. Will definitely come back.

Food is fine. Nothing special about this place. Texas de Brazil has better cuts of meats. Service here was also slow. We paid $32 for a pitcher of sangria that was filled to the top with ice, and it took 10 mins. to arrive. No one checked on our table. No one cleared our plates. Bo one refilled our water. If we didn't flag someone down, I think we may have had to cook the food ourselves.

First time here and was kinda disappointed with selections of meats, steak, pork, buffalo wings, sausages.  The salad bar and entrees were ok.  The food was salty.  The drinks were the only good thing going at here.  The waiter was funny and very helpful.  We skipped the deserts and are more fruits at the salad bar.  The price was not expensive compared to the mid town restaurant where it has more selections.  I can see coming back just for a good dinner.

Went with a friend for lunch on a Saturday. You get what you pay for.I wanted to try this place out because it was near where my friend lived and was cheaper than the Brazilian places in the city... Well, there is a reason: way less meat. There was like 6 different types of meat. 2-3 were very similar. I saw a waiter with ribs but when I asked about it, was told its an hour wait for more. I spent more time waiting for another waiter to come than eating. This doesn't happen at fogo de chao or churrascaria.
Food was okay, but do you really only have 1 bathroom for a restaurant for 300+ guests? Seriously?

The food was great phenomenal! However, the service is needing an update they took 15-20 mins after I went to get my food to get me water and that was after I had to alert a waitress. All together though the meat was great and the buffet area was phenomenal. After going to a similar restaurant in the city it is a better bang for your buck :)

Extremely disappointed by the way my bf and I was treated last night.... we got there 3 mins past 9pm and nobody even came to us.. some waiter just made a gesture from far saying no more seating!!!!! I get it they close at 10 and last seating is at 9 but we were THREE Minutes late!!!! And that fact that they didn't feel the need to come and speak to us made it even more disgusting!!!! So much for hospitality right???

We've been here a few times before but yesterday was special . Johnny and the rest of the staff out did themselves with the service  they provided. They were very accommodating and went above and beyond to making sure our dining experience was amazing (even tho we have been here quite a few other times lol) Johnny is very enthusiastic, even got me to try certain cuts of meat that I wouldn't typically eat . Kudos to Rainhas . It's great to dine places where the employees are genuinely happy working there . Be back soon .
Everything I have had here is nothing short of amazing! One of my favorite restaurants. They have the largest buffet and selection of food in Queens!
Really awesome place. Friendly staff, spacious, and very family friendly ! We had a really awesome by the name of Jhonny! He was great and very lively ! Will recommend to others !

Love, love, love this place! Been here a few times and every time it always exceeds my expectations. Thank you Johnny for taking care of my family tonight with an exceptional service and not to mention great food!
Absolutely love it ! The waiters were on time ! The service was amazing and so was the food ! Definitely coming back !

Johnny brought us our food and was very helpful and made sure we got everything we wanted. The food was delicious and I would highly recommend it to anyone who would like to try a variety of foods. The buffet was enough to make a meal without all of the delicious meats that they bring to your table. Definitely try the pineapple!

Great food and amazing service!! Johnny was very attentive. Brought out fresh meats when we asked for a special type. I love this place and would return soon! Great place to celebrate a birthday which is why I took my boyfriend here for his birthday.

If You like meet this is the place that You like to go Very delicious food An the atención of Jonny Make You diner especial A very good place to share with family o friends  Definitely I came back soon :)
Food is good but the picanha and rib-eye are so delish! Love the roasted pineapple to finish off the meal. Our waiter Johnny was the best and super attentive. Thank you!!!

My girlfriend absolutely loves coming to this restaurant. The service here is beyond amazing, Johnny always makes sure we are well taken care of. Ensuring that the service is amazing and asking us how our day was. Johnny is amazing, thank you for the amazing service. Definitely recommend Rainhas :)
