I saw this on my yelp recommended and decided to try them out! The food was amazing overall and the people were very nice. The food was prepared so quick and even got two choco pies! Definitely a place worth trying! It's a little hard to know where to pick up the food because of covid, but nonetheless, amazing and will most likely come again!

I order from Lim's Kitchen every time I have a korean food craving. Their food and delivery is consistently good and on time. I will say their ddukboki is definitely on the spicier side, so just beware if you are sensitive to spice. The delivery people are always so courteous and gracious. Great service!

Wow this is probably the best Korean restaurant in Queens. I ordered delivery for lunch today. The food was way beyond my expectation! Army Stew was so authentic and flavorful! I miss the Korean taste a lot. The wings were so crispy and the sauce was the best! Korean sweet and sour source level 2 is one of the best sauces I've tried in Korean restaurant. Also the delivery was fast (30mins ahead of expected time). The food arrived in perfect condition (even the Army Stew, which was extremely hard to deliver). I appreciate the effort they put in making everything perfect! A big thumb up to this fantastic Korean restaurant in LIC. Will definitely come back to the store with my friends!!

Glad to find this great spot during this pandemic. Food was made quickly and tasted awesome! The people here are friendly and they were kind enough to throw in a few side dishes for us to try. The fried rice was a bit underwhelming, but everything else was a great and will definitely order again soon.
Ordered food for the first time and it's really good. It tastes like home cooking. I am planning to try a lot of dishes in the menu. Totally loved it.

Such good portions!!! Kimbap was delicious and they also gave us miso soup in cups. Thank you!!! We also got ddukbokki with cheese which was very good. Very legit korean place, so glad to have found you

I ordered food for my family earlier today. It was my first time getting Korean food outside of Koreatown. I was so impressed with the quality of the food. Their pickled raffish was delicious and so was spicy Rice cake. The fried chicken was sooooo good and spicy. I'll definitely go back there.

Amazing Korean food! We ordered the japchae (noodles), the small boneless chicken, and the fried rice. Wood ear mushrooms are how you know the japchae is legit. Love that the option for a chicken fried rice, since my partner has a self-imposed seafood allergy. As with all good Korean places, the food came with some sides (macaroni salad, radish, fish cake, a broth (miso?), and kimchi) at no additional cost. Sometimes you just wanna order a bunch of Korean food and sit home, ya know?
Amazing korean food as good as flushing and k town.  We got Kim bop And kimchee jeega was amazing.
I ordered delivery and to be honest, I did expect too much but the bulgogi kimbap is REALLY delicious! This is my fav. Tofu kimchi stew and chicken wings were also good. Worth a try!
Fast delivery service and great taste. Service with soup and chocolate pie! Really recommend!!!

My roommate and I were craving fried chicken, so on a friend's recommendation we decided to order from Lim's Kitchen and OOF are we glad we did! As we scrolled through the menu, we added sodduk (rice cake + sausage skewer) and kimbap because they just looked so so good and we were hungry sooo why not right lol. The two flavors of the boneless chicken were neatly partitioned in the box, with just the right balance of flaky and tender and crispy and all things that Korean chicken is :') Sauce was good, and not too overwhelming so you can actually still experience the texture of the chicken. We shared a small and (along with the other food we got) there was still a bit left over so I think if you're eating by yourself a small should be more than enough. Sodduk was very good, but unfortunately due to the delivery time the rice cake parts had hardened a little bit. While I initially thought it was a bit salty, that actually made it a perfect pairing with the kimbap. Much appreciated and I was personally pleasantly surprised at how thicc the roll was! yeet Delivery was estimated at about an hour, and our place is a bit isolated lol so we were just like chill about it but the food arrived about 30 minutes after I had ordered and they called to confirm my address and also to check on if I had any delivery requests re: the covid situation so I very much appreciated that! Definitely will be ordering again for quality of food and service :) a local business I'd love to see ~flourish~ even more!

Ordered delivery here from twice and both times the experience has been great! Their quality and quantity of the food is amazing. There's not that many good Asian restaurants around Astoria and I'm so happy to have found this one. Some of my favorites: dumplings (the way they fry it so good), kimbap, pork cutlet, army stew, rice cake/sausage on stick, and fried chicken. Honestly everything I tried so far was delicious. Would def recommend.

I only ordered takeout from here once, but it was pretty solid Korean food. The chicken sandwich was dark meat, so it was nice and juicy. Also ordered army stew, which is exactly what I had been craving. The banchan/side dishes were yummy. I'm most likely ordering here again

One of the best Korean restaurants that i've ordered from. The spicy soy garlic is out of this world and the order came very fast. Definitely recommend this place for anybody that loves korean food or is wanting to try it for the first time. I would post a pic of the food but I ate it so fast to get a chance

A hidden gem, the best korean food in the area of LIC! Their service is excellent, food always packed nicely for delivery, food is amazing. My favorites are their Kimbap, fried chicken combo, japchae, spicy rice cake. I aim to try out everything on their menu. Strongly recommend! Please order from them to help them survive this pandemic!
Ordered some kimbap from doordash. The kimbap was huge with tons of filling. Definitely worth it. Next time I'll order one of the noodle dishes. I'm so happy this opened up near me.

Food was delicious! Everything arrived perfectly. Will definitely be ordering from them again. Love that we were able to order bottles of soju as well. Thank you for being open during these unprecedented times!!

I'm so glad the place opened up, they're incredible. We ordered the spicy squid over rice, the dumpling and rice cake soup, and a seafood pancake, and it was all fantastic. We were particularly impressed by the quality of the broth in the soup, but the squid and seafood pancake were also very good. We will definitely be regulars!

Amazing A** food!! I had good expectations after looking through reviews but the food was amazing and I ordered through seamless which was easy and fast. All items came correct and with a good amount of sauces, forgot to order some soju but will next time! Great restaurant close to good hotels in LIC.

This is my second time ordering from them. I've been getting the spicy tuna kimbab with rabbokki. I absolutely love it. Being raised in a restaurant family, Lim's kitchen exceeds my expectation around here. I'm so happy to have found them. Hope they stay open and healthy during this pandemic cause I'll be crying without my once a week lunch from here!

There's no Korean in my area and I was super excited to see this place pop up for delivery. Was worried it would be your standard mediocre affair but super amazed at how well-made and delicious the food was! I ordered the rice cake, tonkatsu, and spicy pork. All were legit and had that something extra that actually put it above a lot of other restaurants. The delivery was fast and it all came well packed. Would order again and again.

This was my first time ordering from Lim's Kitchen, and I was happy to see that there was a Korean place in LIC. I was definitely suspicious enough to consider ordering somewhere else, afraid of Korean food that might taste half its parts, but ordered after seeing reviews. I'm so happy!! The radishes were crisp, Kimbap not soggy, the jigae wasn't too salty and the cucumber kimchi was delicious. We got two kimbaps, spicy udon stir fry, jiggae, and boneless Chicken. It was allll so delicious. The udon noodles were spicy spicy but worth it. The delivery was also 30 min faster than expected !! Overall, I hope this convinces you to order Lim's Kitchen

So glad that Lim's kitchen is delivering out to Hunters Point South. We've been craving some great korean food and we definitely found it here! The fried chicken sandwich was delicious and still super crispy which is almost impossible when ordering delivery. The kimbap was exactly what we were looking for and packed with delicious meats and flavor. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu. If you are looking for something to brighten your dull quarantine routine, please order from Lim's!

I ordered the spicy shredded beef soup and the bulgogi kimbap. As a Korean, the food quality was great and just how I like it! I live on the other side of the queensboro bridge but the delivery was super fast.  This was my first time ordering and definitely not my last.  I found my goto spot for when I crave Korean food, which is everyday

Delivery is fast, price is fair, owners are nice (free soda and heartwarming personal note attached to order), and most importantly, the food is delicious! I ordered twice during this pandemic and was not disappointed. I will be back for more! Looking forward to visiting the place in person once the lockdown is over.
Efficient Delivery and korean food is very authentic and delicious!!! They even sent me a free soda with a sweet note of appreciation Will definitely place an order again

My friend and I have been craving for Korean fried chicken since quarantine so we found this place on yelp and gave it a try. The food was delivered so fast and packed so well. And the portion is worth it for the price we paid. We ordered spicy boneless chicken and honey garlic combo. Both tastes very good! The pickle radish is really really amazing pairing with fried chicken. I'm grad to see they serve all kinds of typical Korean food with decent portion in this neighborhood. Will try army soup next time!!

Pleasantly surprised at this hidden gem in LIC.  Great food, accurate ordering and prompt service/preparation.  We will order here again and is now our go to place for korean food in the LIC area.Keep up the good work!!
Ordered off seamless. Great Korean food. Really quick service the food was awesome ordered the kimbap and soon tofu soup it was delicious.

Really excellent fried chicken! No comparison in the LIC area. Super flaky, crispy skin on tender meat with a decent portion size! Their kimbap is also made fresh and priced well for NYC. Definitely going back for  (Korean fried chicken + beer) once this quarantine is over!
Great fried chicken and veggie dumplings! Quick delivery! They even added complimentary miso soup and soda! Will definitely order again

I've ordered three times in the last three weeks. Lim's Kitchen is the type of local business you should support during these trying times. Great food, fast service, consistently delicious! You'll be glad you ordered from here

Thankfully this place is still open and delivers. The food came very quick and was delicious. So glad I ordered the Kimchi Pancake. They also gave a small snack with the delivery and a note to stay safe. It was a nice touch. Highly recommend.
Food was great! Thought it didn't ever come but the deliverer just left the food at front desk instead. I found out when I was picking up a package.

SO YUMMY!!! We ordered for lunch for 3 adults: 2 bulgogi kimbap, 1 spicy tuna kimbap, and 1 ttukboki (spicy rice cakes). It was a very filling meal for the 3 of us! The kimbaps are really large and packed full w ingredients (especially the meat!!). The ttukboki is packed with rice cakes, fish cake, kimchi and onion and the sauce was really good. Everything arrived warm and fresh and on time. Will definitely be ordering from here again. Highly recommend if you're looking for good Korean delivery.
Amazing fried chicken wings with crispy skin as well as tender and juicy meat! Perfectly match with the sweet and spicy sauce.

Excellent Korean food Deffinetly Pay attention to detail I ordered the 6 piece soy garlic chicken it was moist and flavorful and a bulgogi bimbop roll also very flavorful and excellent presentation the delivery man gave me a bow and thanked me for ordering overall good experience will be my new go to Korean delivery spot

Don't know why it took me so long to find this place, but Lim's is awesome. Got the Army Soup, Drumsticks and Kim Chi Fried Rice. Everything was piping hot, delivered by a friendly driver, and a bunch of great ban-chans. Plan on working my way thru the rest of the menu!

Ordered take out here for the first time today, and I am so glad to have found this place! Every single dish I ordered was delicious. I had to ham kimbap, fried chicken (which they were nice enough to do half soy garlic and half soy honey), the beef tofu stew, and the kimchi fried rice. They gave so many little side dishes too, just like when you visit a Korean restaurant. The portions were generous, everything were fresh and  excellent. The beef tofu stew was spicy at just the right level. The restaurant was nice enough to leave a hand written thank you note, plus a face mask for me. Please support this restaurant during these difficult  times, I hope they stay in LIC area for a long time to come. This neighborhood needs good authentic Korean food! Will definitely be going back!

There is a lack of korean food near me, aside from a few lackluster places that make their food either too salty or non authentic. I was skeptical of this place because of how new it is, but I am so happy I took the risk of ordering from here. Every single item from the kimbab, stew, and fried chicken tastes home-made which is exactly what I was looking for. The food was also prepared very quickly and was still piping hot by the time it got to my house. Do yourself a favor and order from here, you wont regret it. I am a very picky eater and I can confidently give this place 5 stars. You can taste the love they put into their food

This place is AMAZING! I have been looking for good korean takeout for awhile, and this felt like my mom's cooking! Everything tasted so fresh and delicious! We got the boneless chicken wings, pork cutlets, and veggie dumplings and ALL were amazing! I cannot wait to order again soon! Not to mention a little hand written note from them, love to support local businesses in these tough times!

Placed an order for a pick up. At first, I thought I was being scammed lol but the owner happened to be around the corner. (Must be inside their kitchen) She comes outside with the takeout. Order was fast and foods are delicious! If you're craving Korean food, I would recommend here! Thanks for working during this time and saving us from always eating home cooked meals .

I've never been in person but have been ordering a lot from here to get my Korean fix during these covid times (it's been so hard to get Korean ingredients!). We've ordered a variety of soups (kimchee jjigae, budaejjigae, yukgejang, and soondubu) that all really hit the spot. Always comes well packaged and hot and piping. Their kimbaps are also solid!
Love the sausage and rice cake. Would be 5 star if the delivery man didn't demand for extra tips.

This food is excellent and delivery was prompt. The restaurant threw in a can of soda and Korean appetizers for free. We enjoyed every dish -- udon noodles, fried rice and fried chicken. Would highly recommend this place! We will definitely be ordering from here again soon.
Awesome new neighborhood spot. Gave it a shot with a small order to start but will definitely be ordering a lot more in the future. Fried rice and Kimbap were great. Fried chicken looks amazing.
This place should get more reviews! Ordered some takeout soy garlic wings and they were delicious and arrived right on schedule. Looking forward to trying more menu items.

I had no idea about this place until today! My order came in less than 30 minutes and the delivery man was super friendly, it was nice to see the note they left on the can of coca cola . I do wish the korean soft tofu stew was a bit more spicy though, other than that I will definitely order again. Please remember to support local businesses during these harsh times and always tip in cash.

We ordered delivery from Lim's tonight and it did not disappoint. The shrimp roll was delicious and and a great value ($8 for a huge roll!). The kimchi pancake was super flavorful. All around a great meal. The delivery was extremely fast (within 30-40 min).
Amazing wings. Get the 2nd level hot sauce! Make sure you stop by. The service is great. They gave us complimentary vegetables and a coke

10/10 would recommend.  I've been ordering from Lim's Kitchen roughly twice a week during the pandemic, and the food has been great every single time.  I usually get some mix of the kimbap and a stew/soup.  I'm looking forward to dining in when the circumstances change!

Amazing food!!! Ordered the boneless chicken, seafood stew & kimbap, flavor was great and best korean food I had in awhile. For the boneless chicken had spicy soy garlic, sooo good, better than turntable chicken! Seafood stew had so many ingredients, perfect flavor, spicy but not too spicy. Highly recommended this place, can't go wrong!

Really great delivery service and delicious food!  So glad I tried it one day.  I tend to have a lot of skepticism when it comes to Korean food delivery (having grown up eating it), but this was definitely worth it.  The delivery was prompt and the food came piping hot.  Quality of the food was great too.  All around has become my new staple delivery!

Ordered delivery and it was amazing! Got some fried chicken, kimbap, and bossam. The fried chicken was really tasty: still crispy and the sauce was delicious. The bossam was sooo good. It came with some ssamjang and salted seasme oil. Would recommend trying it out. The whole meal came with some banchan which was a nice suprise! Overall a really great place and I can't wait to be able to go in person.

It's been hard to find decent Asian food around LIC so we were stoked to come across Lim's Kitchen! Extensive menu, authentic food, timely delivery, great service -- it's the best restaurant for your Korean fix, hands down. We hope the business receives all the support it needs during this difficult time! We can't wait to dine in once shelter-in-place ends.

This is my go to Korean restaurant at LIC! Food is excellent and it is always packaged perfectly when delivered. Many korean restaurants do not give the side dishes (banchan) but Lim's kitchen does which is nice. I've ordered the soft tofu soup, shredded beef soup and the kimchi pancake and they are all very delicious. Highly recommend!
Ordered wings and ramen from Lim's...both were amazing plus delivery was quick. Will be ordering again!

I usually don't write reviews but felt compelled to share based on my overall amazing experience. Having ordered pickup from numerous restaurants during the COVID period I was very impressed with how well organized Mojo was at handling my order. From ordering online, to the text notifications and pickup; the experience was seamless and well thought out. I ordered the chicken mojo, guac and chips and a couple of sangritas, all on point! The chicken mojo was flavorful, guac and chips provided the perfect side and the sangritas were punchy. My only regret was not ordering dessert. I look forward to ordering from Mojo again and trying other items on the menu. Great find as a foodie and I can see them doing amazing things for the community. Overall cinco estrellas!

I have no clue why I didn't dine here before given that I actually reside in FH! I placed an order for a delivery and it's amazinggggg! Amidst these difficult times, Mojo definitely delivered! Although the delivery took just a bit longer than expected, I must say that the food was very flavorful and drinks definitely did not disappoint at all.Can't wait until this chaos is all over and dine in at Mojo! Thank you guys and take care :)

Wow this place is amazing! Even with this crazy pandemic going on, the workers at Mojo make sure you're taken care of. They have these amazing frozen drinks that you can take to go! I highly recommended!

This cute spot is a hitttt right now. The drinks are SO GOOD. It was a bit of a wait but so worth it. I'd go on a really nice day so you wouldn't mind the standing outside to enjoy some fresh air. The majority of the drinks were unfortunately sold out when i came but still i enjoyed what i had. I had the froze rosé on the rocks. And my bf had the sangria one. Soooo good. They definitely know how to make a good drink lol. The process can be a TAD bit confusing but you'll be fine. One like for ordering and then another for when your order is ready. They're pretty orderly. I'd absolutely go back to try more drinks. Oh and i had the calamari appetizer and it was SO GOOD. So food is a must with you order of course and it's really goood anywayGO FOR IT

This place was put on my radar due to a Yelp elite event that I sadly didn't make it into. First time around we stopped by for brunch they do offer a brunch menu & some frozen drinks I had the Watermelon Frose this was good nice taste, also tried the Frozen Sangria another great drink & the Watermelon Margarita was not bad. Appetizers tried the Beef Empanadas, very good w a nice dipping sauce. Main dish I had the Chimi Burger yumm great flavor to the meat, nice tasting bread & combo had it with a small salad not bad good dressing. Hubby had the Salmon with rice, salad & maduros good dish as well. Second time around stopped by for happy hour so glad the frozen drinks are part of it, great Frozen Sangrias. Appetizers we tried the Corn I must say very good.. Also tried the Chimi sliders instead of bread it comes on tostones not a bad idea,  good "slider".Another time regular dinner menu I gave the Jumpin Lomo a try u have Angus beef stir fried with tomatoes & onions comes with garlic rice & truffle fries, decent rice really good truffle fries specially mixed with the sauce from the meat. Hubby had the Pulled porky , nice tasting pork good combo with the rice, maduros & beans. For dessert we gave the Flan a try , great tasting flan with the coconut flavor. Glad this place was open during Quarantine, they had a good set up that ran smoothly we placed a take out order got the Chimichuri chicken & the Pulled Porky both came with rice , Maduros &  beans. Meat for both the Chicken & Pork were good decent rice & Maduros , the beans not good had no flavor. We were disappointed with the serving portion for take out , one scoop of rice on a $16 dollar dish not the best. We also got Frozen drinks to go those were great. Nice looking place 2 floors, simple yet nice decor with some Latin flavor, good music playing. Regular dinning so far has been a good experience , take out ahh depends how badly u want them drinks. Great during happy hour specially for drinks , price wise not terrible but it can add up quickly , we have enjoyed the drinks & food so far & will continue to visit from time to time.

Called in an order in and 2 hours after waiting outside and giving them my order and name FOUR times when i say i wanna cancel they come out and say they never had my order and they're sorry. Why do you need my order 4 times from my to still not put it in? The lack of competence was overwhelming. Yeah he compensation for this was an offer of one free drink. I don't have another 2 hours to wait. Never had this happen at any restaurant.UPDATE: they call me after 2 hours and 50 minutes to offer me a free shot after 4pm on Thursday. Smack in the face with beyond minimal effort.

Since Covid -19 has shut our city down. I must say this restaurant has fully executed all the rules mandated by the CDC which makes this restaurant safe to order take out from.  I saw a sign in the window honoring First Responder and Senior Citizens and that stole my heart. The take out service I have been receiving here has been phenomenally. Word around the street is that they have the best bag drinks to go.

I've heard great things about Mojo and I decided to give it a try! They are super busy during quarantine so please have patience ! Lex was able to help me out personally luckily THE PICADO is so good and so is the chimichurro sandwich.I ordered a big boy rose azul and it tasted sooo goood.I would defiantly say mojo is offering real authentic Latin American food and I'm here for it!!! Would defiantly recommendI suggest placing a pick up order online before coming because their super busy !!!

Saturday was the worse experience ever.Take out sucksI ordered 2 drinks I got an alert it was going to b ready 50 mins after my order been placedI got to the place past 10mins. I got there and the guy by the door asked for my full name ( not sure why) then I showed him my email about the order been ready he said make the line and wait. Line? ... of 20 people waiting. Are you for real? It was raining it was windy. I left the line.My question to the place: why am I ordering something and I have to wait twice. I waited the 50mins and now I needed to wait in the line? For what? My order should've been ready. Ughh.. the system for take out is so disorganized. Not good for business

I came here on 2 separate occasions and I have to say that the service is kind of spotty. The first time I came for dinner with my cousins. We were a smaller group and our waitress was friendly but kind of slow. We were fine with it because the restaurant was still pretty new so we figured she just needed to get the hang of it. She messed up on our drink order but still let us keep the incorrect one. However, the second time I came with a bigger group for a friend's birthday and the waitress was slower than last time seemed annoyed anytime my party asked for anything.I find the guacamole to be a little bland - the price at $10 is not bad considering it comes with regular tortilla chips and plantain chips but I've had wayyy better so it's a pass for me. The fried calamari was very crunchy and came with 2 dipping sauces which were both really goood! The first time I went I had the lomo salteado which was very salty and the fries at the bottom were super soggy - I couldn't even finish the dish. The second time around I tried the Latino fried rice and it was delicious! I cleaned my dish which is rare for me. Everyone else seemed to like their dishes (including the salmon, arroz con pollo and churrasco) and there were no complaints. The drinks are also really good. Hopefully the staff is better trained but I can definitely see myself coming back for dinner and drinks.

Great date night spot with authentic Latin cuisine. We had the corn al diablito which is their version of Mexican corn which was delicious. The guac and plaintain chips is a great starter for your meal and the arroz con pollo was full of flavor and tender. I recommend getting the frozen margaritas which come in several flavors and also the moscow mule. Will definitely dine here again.

Ordered delivery through Yelp. Mojo Chicken and Wagyu Chimi Sliders. The order page said the menu was only available from 10a-3:15p (it was 7pm), but it went through anyway. Food arrived 15 minutes before the Yelp estimate. The chicken was moist and the sauce was rich and tangy. The sliders were nice too, though I'd prefer a regular bun to the single piece of tostone per slider.

Came here on a Thursday night for a friend's birthday dinner. The group of 9 had reservations for 6:30pm. We were seated upstairs at a large table at exactly 6:30pm.The hostess, waitress and other staff were extremely friendly. The first time I came here, I got the arroz con polo which was decent but I felt as though it lacked flavor. This time around, I tried the pernil - don't expect this pernil to taste like your grandma made it. I find the food to be exactly what is promoted "a Latin experience". Happy hour was until 7pm ($5 drafts+wine, $6 Frozen drinks, $7 flavored drinks, i think).Mojo puts a nice twist to Latin food. I wouldn't say the food is enriched with flavor or mouth-watering but it's decent for the price and ambiance. The happy hour drinks were delicious! I got the frozen margarita - classic for $6, i believe. It was strong and really good!This location was once a different eatery - if you're from Queens, you know what i'm talking about. It's amazing how the owners of this establishment designed it beautifully!! Great for special occasions, dates or regular degular lunch/dinner/dranks. Dinner and Happy Hr dranks worked out to about $460.00 with gratuity and taxes included. I think that's pretty good for the service, food and overall "Latin Experience".

Placed an order of Latin fried rice.  It was semi hard- at first I thought it was rice from the bottom of the pot/ but that wasn't the case. The rice wasn't fully cooked through- I can only assume the establishment was quite busy and going through the rice quickly without allowing it to be fully cooked through. A bit disappointing, bc this was dinner for my 22 month old son in which I couldn't give it to him. I called and inform the restaurant so they are aware of the situation.We deserve better - please kindly allow your rice to cook through before serving. Thank you.

I have heard so many different views on this small business. Friday night me and my colleagues wanted a drink so I suggested we visit this location to support small open business during the pandemic  of the COVID:19. The drink menu was informative and eye catching. I really wanted to try one of the signature drinks which was the Pink Flamingo or the Rosa Azul. They had a small range of drinks flavors to choose from, unfortunately the signature drinks weren't available. Suck to be me at the moment after I suggesting this spot to my colleagues. So I didn't fuss and just purchase the Big Boy Green Lantern since not other size was available for purchase. I felt force to purchase a big boy drink since they claim to not have small cups available. When we received our Big Boy drinks we realized the logo of our drinks weren't on our Big Boy container. False advertising since the menu shows the logo on all Big Boy drinks. I was disappointed and over it. Then when I got to my car I realized the cashier over charger me she added tortilla chips to my bill and I never asked for tortilla  chips for $2.00.

Great vibe in the restaurant and yummy drinks and starters! We had the chicken tacos, the Spanish kebabs  and the "Down the Hatch" ceviche .  The drinks we ordered were the mango margaritas and they were flavored perfectly! Our Only cons were even though our waitress was really sweet she seemed really distracted towards the end of our meal and we had to wait an extremely long time for the check. Also, the Latino rice felt like it was missing so much of the Latino flavor, it tasted really bland to us.

Finally made it to Mojo after attending an Elite event here. Let me just say that the service here is OUTSTANDING! Kamila at the bar is the sweetest and friendliest bartender I've encountered. Not to mention her drinks are BOMB! We arrived here on a Sunday night for a few drinks before  the long work week. We decided to get mojitos which were an excellent choice. Both the passion fruit and the coconut were so good. I highly recommend the coconut! Appetizers: we got the guacamole, a little spicy but I love spice. We got a side of sweet plantains which were perfect to settle the spice. We also got the skirt steak skewers with yuca frita, the yuca was delicious. This is a great place to grab some drinks at anytime if you're looking for a delicious cocktail. The staff is super friendly and the service is outstanding!

Mojo has been on my to-go list from the moment I found out that it was taking over the former Exo Cafe spot. I tried to keep this place a secret until it was my hunny's birthday. Earlier in the day I dropped off a cake from Martha's Country Bakery at Mojo so that I could surprise my hunny with it after we finished dining. I have to say that the Mojo staff were not only accommodating, but also understanding of me wanting his night to be perfect. I initially had a reservation at 7pm for two, but his mom and brother wanted to take him out also so I changed the reservation to 7:30pm for a party of four. We were seated upstairs where our waitress gave us ample amount of time to make our decision.We started off with apps and drinks which consisted of Moscato, Watermelon Frozé, and a La Amazonica. My hunny's La Amazonica was too strong for me. The Watermelon Frozé was bomb.com. I love frozen drinks. It tasted like a watermelon jolly rancher slushy. I definitely recommend trying it as it is one of their strongest frozen drinks. For our apps we ordered Tostones and Frituras Del Mar. I'm not sure how the tostones turned out but they were finished before I was able to take a picture. Our Frituras Del Mar app was on the smaller side and looked like a dish for one person, maybe a dish for two if you don't have much of an appetite. Certainly not a dish that can be easily served amongst four people. The Frituras Del Mar was okay but can be vastly improved if the dish was cooked a little longer. The batter was lightly fried which didn't provide the crunchiness I was longing for. I'm a huge fan of pickled onions but it didn't add much flavor to the dish, however it was aesthetically pleasing to the eye. The green sauce was amazing. I didn't care for the tartar sauce. Our entrees consisted of the Jumpin' Lomo, Churrasco, and Latino Fried Rice. My hunny and I both enjoyed our Churassco. We ordered our skirt steak medium which came out perfectly cooked. The garlic rice was really good. My only gripe is that the beans did not come out with our dish. I mentioned the missing beans to our waitress. She brought our beans out momentarily. His brother enjoyed his Jumpin' Lomo, but stated that the dish became salty towards the end of his meal. He also said that the portions could've been bigger -- I totally agree. His mom stated that the dish tasted rank and that the meat didn't taste as if it was cleaned properly. I'm not sure what their meals tasted like but the guys finished their meals. His mom and I ended up taking the rest of our meals home. Our waitress was kind enough to provide a sparkler for my hunny's birthday cake and even went as far as singing Happy Birthday to him with a few of her coworkers.I give Mojo a solid 3.5 stars.

Love this restaurant, great food, great drinks and amazing service! I definitely appreciate that the owner replied to my original concerns with a sincere explanation. Will continue ordering and supporting. :) (please bring brunch back)

What an amazing experience here at Mojo. Not only did I throw a 30th birthday celebration here but I was also surprised my partner with an engagement proposal. AHHHMAZING! The staff was very attentive and went above and beyond professionalism! They helped me arrange when to pop the question and even gave me ideas, they really made this experience better than I imagined. So major 5 star for the service!  Now let's talk about the food; must say everything we ordered from our pre fix menu was very satisfying. Not only did I enjoy my veggie fried rice but my guest enjoyed their orders too. The food was seasoned very well and the price was great. $50 for family style appetizers, entree, dessert and one alcohol beverage. Overall I recommend this place for big parties and if you're planning a special event. For big parties just keep in mind, you will be dealing with the venue planner via email, but do not worry they are very efficient with their responses. Please visit this establishment!

Mojo Restaurant is a trendy Latin restaurant on Austin, in Forest Hills.The food is good to great. The ambience is very trendy. There are table seating upstairs. It was a fun vibe for a Friday night.K and I met a friend here for dinner. We shared the following.Guac and Chips- classic good appetizer. Guac was smooth. The chips were plantains and crunchy.Wagyu Chimi Sliders- The beef was tender and little too well done. The green plantains were soft. I liked the sauce for this dish.Pernil with fried plantains and rice- the pernil was juicy when we started but drier as it sat. The fried plantains were good.Jumpin Lomo- stir fried sirloin cubes with truffle fries. This was one of the best entrees- so much beef juices in the rice and over the crunchy fries. It was so good! Macho Marino- shrimp, squid, fish, bay scallops in sofrito sauce. The sauce was so creamy, oceanic and flavorful! The scallops were wonderful! This was a great entree!Dessert:Choco Churros- Crunchy finger-long churros dusted with cinnamon sugar with chocolate hazelnut dipping sauce. This was great! The churros were fresh and crunchy. I loved the rich chocolatey sauce.Mango Tango- Mango mousse between layers of filo dough- essentially a mango Napoleon. This was my favorite dessert! So crunchy and the mousse was fluffy and light. The mango flavor was mild. Cookies and Cafe- Shortbread caramel cookies with ice cream. The shortbread cookies were so light and fluffy. The cookies were the best part! I loved it.Thank you Eli for the excellent service! Our waiter was fun and energetic! We had a great time!I would reorder Jumpin Lomo, Macho Marino and Mango Tango.

Pleasantly surprised by the brunch at Mojo. I loved the ceviche here - the Down the Hatch was Peruvian style, filled with little corn nuts, raw fish, shrimp, squid, cooked calamari, and plantains. The lime mixture was a little on the sour side but it was pretty authentic. The steak and eggs were really good - made with thin skirt steak and chimichurri sauce. The avocado tostadas weren't bad but missing a bit of a flavor. The happy hour here is bomb. I got frozen sangria for only $6 and it was awesome!!! The coffee here is also very good as mentioned earlier by another reviewer. Glad to have another solid brunch spot and fohi.

Guac & chips are very good here! The guac has a significant lime flavor to it that makes it stand out above other guacamoles I have tried. Not much of a fan of the popcorn kernels in the chips but I know some people enjoy it. I usually get their passion fruit margarita on the rocks since I really like that they make it with fruit purée instead of flavored syrup. I loved getting the chicken mojo here but the last few times I have tried it I feel as though the consistency of the sauce has been too thick & creamy, and lacked the original flavor that initially caught my attention.

Definitely a Modern Hispanic Styled Restaurant with great music, ambiance and menus that light up, They take reservations, Although for a table of 3, we waited no more than 5 minutes (if even). The server "Elle" was super friendly, She was patient, we did not feel rushed as we could not decide what we wanted to order, she came back about 3 or 4 different times to politely check in on us, we appreciated that! We honestly couldn't decide what we were in the mood for so we decided to munch on appetizers. Wagyu Chimi Sliders $14 (Delicious!!- a lot smaller than expected but so good with the sauce) Camarón Toast $14 (very good!) Spanish Kebabs $13 (if you are stuck between this appetizer and another one, get the other one! This portion was way smaller than expected, the yuca fries were drowned in unnecessary oil, it was not bad but not up to standards with the other two apps I tried, it was okay, try it if you must lol)Truffles Fries $7 (good for fries, does not come w the cheese flakes on top) Pitcher of White Sangria $30 (Delicious! Great portion. I say it would serve a total of 6 glasses) Total after taxes was $84.91, spent $100 after tip.Also, the restaurant was very clean, there was a bus  boy doing his thing, bathroom was cute and clean! They have a happy hour Mon-Thurs 12-7pm I liked it, if your on the forest hills strip, looking for somewhere to eat, i recommend you try it out!

It's always a good feeling when you get to go to a restaurant you've been eyeing. I love fusion restaurants and this is Latin Fusion. My bestie and I came here on a Thursday night a little after happy hour (ends at 7PM) unfortunately. Mojo is for sure a trendy spot and is two floors. We were seated upstairs and our waitress came to her quickly. We ordered the frituras de mar for starters, which consisted of fried shrimp, calamari, and catfish. It was hitting. We also ordered the Camaron toast with some wine of our choice. Note: they have a fairly decent selection. We decided to share the blood orange salmon and that too was really really good. I'm still thinking about it days later lol. I def recommend coming here the food is good, not too loud, trendy, the only downfall is where it's located parking is so hard. If you're in the neighborhood check it out. After all the food, two rounds of drinks, and tax the bill was roughly $90 between two ppl. I'm for sure going to come back since I now know they're offering brunch!

Great addition to the neighborhood! I love Latin cuisine so was excited to try this place. Decided to order takeout for my mom's birthday because I wasn't sure how kid-friendly or noisy it would be inside. Turns out, after waiting for my food, it appears to be fairly kid-friendly and had a decent noise level. Gorgeous restaurant inside. Kitchen opens at 5PM for dinner. A bit of a wait but the food was mega fresh. Wagyu Chimi Sliders - it's beef on a tostone (fried plantain). Delicious! Great flavor combo. I liked it with and without the sauce. Still pretty good and fresh considering it was take out.Spanish kebabs - oh my, the beef was perfect! The yuca fries were the best yuca fries I have ever had. Perfect crunch on the outside and well-cooked yuca on the inside. Yuca can be a challenge to cook but it was executed well here. Chicken mojo - The sauce on the chicken breast was divine. Loved the garlic rice, really kicked it up a notch and added so much flavor to the meal. Asparagus and black beans were standard.Latino fried rice - decided to try this based on other reviews. Unique twist on fried rice. I like that they added pieces of sweet plantains. Good flavor in this. My kids really enjoyed it.Jumpin' lomo - another delicious meal! The beef was just right, rice was on point, fries were soaked up with flavor - overall a great dish.I was really pleased and happy with all the food here. Best part was that everyone said it wasn't heavily salted so you don't need to guzzle a gallon of water afterwards. Great flavor, fresh food and good service. Can't ask for more. Although one gripe is that it's a bit pricey (all this was just under $100) but for a special occasion, it's worth it.

They kept the main structural elements of Expo and enhanced them. I really like how the decor came together to give it a more Latin Vibe/Tropical Vibe.The first element of this new place I noticed , was the amazing Salsa classics playing ! I really love that they don't play  any bachata or reggaeton;  but I'm sure  that will eventually change because there is no new salsa music out there and you want to provide a new vibe or experience for returning customers .Menu: They light up and I love that extra touch! For the appetizer I had the Wagyu Chimi Sliders that were absolutely juicy and great tasting . So much so that , I didn't really think twice about the shrimp toast that was also ordered.The main dish was the skirt steak which was also very good, well cooked, well seasoned and juicy! The portion of meat is small but overall I loved this dish , especially the side of black beans and maduros with a sprinkle of cheese!! I've been here  a couple of times already and I'm happy to finally have a more modern Latin Spot in the area.

Came here for a Yelp Elite Event a few months back, and now my co workers and I have become regulars! The Happy Hour and dinner here is amazing. The frozen margaritas, frozé and mojitos are soooo bomb. My favorite is the blackberry margarita so tart and refreshing at the same time. There's also a bunch of awesome bar snacks- looove the Cotija Truffle Fries and The Yuca Fries, if you don't want a full meal. But hey! Why wouldn't you? Everything I've ever tried here has been amazing!

I see you Mojo... and your vision. I can reasonably predict that Mojo will be one of the main staples of Forest Hills very soon. I came here for some quick drinks with wifey as we normally do for our life and career strategizing. I ordered the Vegan ceviche with a side of fries and she ordered the Cuban sandwich with fries, which both were good, however the fries needed a little bit more salt. The waitress was very attentive and polite and the bartender provided some good drinks. (Passion fruit mojito and frozen sangria. )We also had the privilege of chatting it up with the manager Alex (cool dude). I really like what they have in store and we have some high expectations for Mojo. We are looking forward to having brunch here with the family and see if they can live up to those high expectations....so far they are.
Mojo is it. Good food, liquor, SECURITY @ the door !!! Spicy to perfection. Thank you MOJO !

Finally placed a delivery order this evening. We had been to this restaurant before and the food was very good and huge portion. We had their Avocado toast, I had the Quinoa salad which was large and very good. My hubs got their burger which was very juicy.Looked at seamless, doordash and their website and they have three different prices and menu is different on all the sites.We had ordered the Churrasco, very small portion, requested for med rare and it was well done and tough. The Jumpi'n Lomo was extremely salty. It came with truffle fries but the sauce from the steak made it soggy. The only good dish we had was the Salmon. We did order from doordash, wanted to get some alcoholic beverages.Thank you Mojo.Hope you guys stay safe

So I've had this placed bookmarked since the first day it opened up, and I finaly had the chance to pay it a visit.  First and foremost the ambiance and decor deserve a 10! Very relaxing & chilled place to enjoy a nice meal. Drinks were on point! Super tasty and strong, plenty to choose from. Appetizers were delicious! We got the chips and guacamole and the corn al diablito both super good. Desert was also very nice. The reason for my 4 stars is because of the entree. For some reason it wasn't as great as I was hoping for it to be, I had the Latin fried rice and it was lacking flavor, my husband had the Lomo and it was overpowering with the flavors and salt. But overall it was a nice experience.

Saw a long line and thought this must be good stuff then waited 45 minutes for a Hennessy colada that had no Hennessy it was colada and cinnamon. The drink was watery but milky and never forget pricey...I donot recommend this restaurant..

My friends and I have been trying to eat at Mojo Restaurant for a while now - and now that we have, well, we wish we didn't. Yelpers, you led me astray on this one!We came in a rainy day, so it wasn't too crowded, which was great. We got the menus - which light up, by the way! - and saw that the price range was typical for Forest Hills (though I will never understand why entrees are that much, but that's for another conversation). I ordered the Macho Marino ($26) and it was different. The description says: Seared fish in a savory shrimp, calamari and bay scallop sofrito bisque. Served with yuca and garlic rice. The bisque was great - but I was surprised to find the yuca ... in the bisque? From the description, it sounded like it came as a side. But anyways, it was fine, just different.What was not fine, though, was the rice. It was microwaved. I know this because the rice was crunchy.Rice should not be crunchy.But there were a lot of things that happened that shouldn't have happened.- My friend and I ordered the same entrée. His dish came out, mine did not. Only until I asked our waitress about where my dish was (we waited about 5 mins after his dish came out).- My entrée came with rice. His did not. And when we asked about his rice, his rice suddenly came with scallions, which mine didn't have.- Then we realized that I had a spoon for my bisque, and he did not. And when we asked for the spoon, it was a different spoon from what I had gotten (he got a tea spoon, I got a soup spoon).It was all these little things that just stuck out to us and had us asking - what is happening? - several times during our dinner.- Another friend ordered the Chicken Mojo ($22) and that chicken was so dry on the inside - and again, microwaved rice!- We also ordered tostones ($5) as a side and that was good within the first 30 seconds. It was immediately cold after that.And we ordered a pitcher of sangria - just do yourself a favor if you're planning on drinking sangria in Forest Hills - don't. No one in the area apparently knows how to make it correctly. This one was the same as Cabana - too sweet. We ended up adding so much water to it and just not finishing it because it wasn't worth the potential cavities.We paid so much only for us to not enjoy our meal. I'm still reading the other 4+ stars reviews and am still in shock that my friends and I didn't have the same great experience. No recommendations.

The food was mediocre at best. The guac was good, but the chips it came with were cold, stale, and greasy- definitely not made fresh. The entrees were just Ok. Definitely not worth the price. There are definitely better Latin restaurants in the area. The music and drinks were the only decent parts of dinner.

Manue seemed rather basic...... but.......... I ordered the calamari and the truffle feta fries... calamari:good batter still crunchy and not to hard. They substituted the marinara for a salsa verde.ok I like... but only 4 bites, then I want my marinate. The ***YUCCA**fries on the bottom or this plate though....... were awesome. So little seasoning or effort needed but these yucca fries were delicious. FRIES: didn't like them I would have needed more feta on as a topping and more melted. I think it too much Greek flair for a Latin spot..I suggest a beef option empanadaOh and classic margarita; sugar on the rim **effin awesome**

The vibes were great, atmosphere was on point. The waiter could have been a bit more attentive given the fact it was not super busy but it's all good. I would have given 5 stars if they brought out chips to wait for the food with. The food was good, tasted fresh. Priced a bit high for the portion given. All in all a good experience but there wasn't anything on the menu that stood out. This was more of "our plans fell through and this place was close" rather than "Wow I'm really looking forward to trying this spot". A tasty place for some comfort food!

Mojo has become quite popular during Quarantine due to their delicious frozen drinks which are rather large. I bought one last week on Wednesday for $15.  Along with Latino Fried Rice. Food was great. So I came back on a Saturday and the line was down the block. A testament to the popularity of their huge drinks. I stand in line & place my order at 3:57 pm. The drink has gone from $15 to  $20 now. They ask me to wait in my car. And they will text me. I continue to wait for a text. A hour goes by, I say hey I haven't got my text. "Sorry were busy" 2 hours go by , I only ordered rice!  I go up to them & demand a credit.  Finally get my food. And guess what. It sucked. Rice had way too much garlic. They must've hired a new cook. I was so upset I didn't even sip on my frozen drink & saved it for later. Bottom line. I get raising your prices by a dollar or two. But $5!!! That's price gouging during uncertain economic times. That's horrible and taking advantage because everyone else is charging $15.  If your gonna raise prices , then you should provide quality customer service.  I'm not going back..ever. I'll take my business elsewhere. Just wanted to provide a warning to everyone. They finally did text me. 4 hours later ‍
Awesome food! The best fish dinner around  I don't eat red meat often but cannot resist the chimi sliders! Try em out

I placed an order during the rough times of the corona virus. I drove 40 mins from LI to Queens & was served with raw meat ! (Ofcourse I didn't find out until I drove all the way back home.) I called in the order while on my way to the restaurant and didn't get the text that it was ready until I was just parking out front. 40 mins for RAW steak ? Thank god I called in advance but what does it matter if your food still is half way cooked I ordered the Churrasco with Shrimp order it came with white rice and sweet plantains. 1. The meat was raw. (Manager explained that they cook their steak at medium temperature which would make the middle red.) & that I didn't state the temperature I wanted my steak to be cooked at. I asked him why the employee who took my order didn't ask me "how would you like your steak cooked?" And just assume that everyone likes raw meat. 2. The rice is not "latin" rice. It had no seasoning at all it tasted bland.3. The beans looked like they were put in a bowl of water and soaked, what type of gravy would that give my rice ?4. The baby sized shrimps that comes with the meal are not worth extra money. 5. The only thing DECENT about this meal was probably the maduros except my boyfriends plate had 3 pieces and I had 2. Are they just throwing shit in a dish? How many maduros are supposed to come with the order ? 2 or 3Upon calling the manager I was told I couldn't receive a full refund bc he would need the food back. & as you can probably tell I wasn't gonna drive another 40 mins there and 40 mins to get back home to return this garbage. When I expressed to the manager that I invested my time and money to come SUPPORT them and that I needed a full refund he rudely told me that the time it took me to get to his restaurant is not his problem and the only thing he can do is a half refund. This is a mistake I will NEVER make again. This was clearly a rushed order due to the high call volume during corona virus, you'd think people would put more love and care into the food their serving ESPECIALLY IN SUCH HARD TIMES. (When i stated this to the manager he started bragging about how they've been giving free food to hospitals and trying to praise their brand) but when you view their Instagram stories they only have posts of reposting ppl who tagged them in their drink orders. If you're actually "helping" ppl how am I being denied a full refund on horrible service ? He also said "I hook people up all the time who are a little more patient with me" when I became upset that I was getting only half my money back. How do you want a customer to be patient for receiving raw food ? Supposed I got food poisoning would that warrant me a full refund ? Every logical point I stated was answered with a snarky response and this is not the way customer service is supposed to be!    I am unsatisfied with this restaurant this is my first & will be my last time going here.Also they have a IG post saying the big boys are $15 but when you get to the restaurant they still charge you $18 that would've made my 2 drinks with 2 extra shots at $3 each $42.. I was charged $45. When I went back in to ask about the IG post they said it was an old post but yet that post never specified that it was for that day only or for a limited time only. I drove 40 mins out, came home with raw food was overcharged, and STILL had to cook my raw steak at home so I didn't waste my money. Thanks for a horrible experience & your take on "representing" latin culture

Great addition to the neighborhood! I've been to Mojo a few times since they opened and tried something new each time. The Mojo Chicken is my favorite, the sauce it comes with is delicious. You can't go wrong with either of the seafood ceviches, both were great I can't decide which I like more. Friendly staff, trendy atmosphere, perfect for date or happy hour.

I ordered a well done burger with the sauce on the side with fries along with a frozen drink. The burger was pink, cold, undercooked in the middle, and the buns were soggy filled with sauce. I had to recook my burger on my stove and throw out the bread. The fries tasted old and dry. The only thing decent about this order was the drink. This was such a waste of $28.00. I have no idea how this place has such good reviews.

Love this spot, Pete and his team remained open while this time was still uncertain because they saw the importance of feeding our neighborhood and providing options. A clear Austin street staple that we should all support!

Food and drinks are great here. The only reason I docked a star is because whenever I've gone I've gotten the skirt steak. Both times I've asked for medium and both times I've received it very well done. It was still yummy, but a little chewier than I wanted. Other than that, no complaints. The ambiance is nice, and in the summer the doors are open so you feel like you're dining outside. They used to have a spicy margarita or some frozen spicy drink which was awesome but they got rid of it because many people did not like it. If you like spicy margaritas like I do, the bartender will mix in jalapeño oil to spice it up.

This restaurant is super lively and has very loud music. Overall, it's a great spot to just grab drinks and eat good food with your friends! There could be a little bit of a wait but you can leave your number and they can text you once your table is ready! You don't wait too long since they have 2 floors of seating.For starters, we had the chicharron buns, which is probably the highlight of the meal. Highly recommend!! The chicharron was crispy on the outside and juicy/tender on the inside. Also got the chicken taquitos, which were really enjoyable as well! For the entree we shared the jumpin' lomo which is the sirloin cubes. The dish was a bit on the salty side, but still pretty decent. The drinks were tasty too. I recommend getting one of their frozen drinks! I had the frozen mango margarita. Service was really slow unfortunately, which is why I'm bumping it down from 4 to 3 stars. It took us a very long time to order since our waitress was taking care of so many tables by herself. We tried getting the attention of other workers, but we were instructed to wait for our specific server. However, our waitress apologized and I totally understand that it can get hectic. Definitely recommend hiring more help, so that they can satisfy the customers' needs more efficiently, especially at night on weekends.

Such a great addition to my neighborhood!  Austin street is lacking some quality food (I'm tired of chipotle and bar food).  This place sets a really classy and fun vibe.  I loved every single dish from the unique presentation to the developed flavors.  I wanted to sample everything and had very low expectations when I walked in (thought it was going to be basic - boy were my taste buds surprised).The salmon and scallops ceviche was absolutely delicious!! So creamy and rich and perfectly sprinkled with edible flowers.  The steamed broccolini side was surprisingly good (I just ordered it to be healthy and expected it to taste whatever - but it was one of my faves!).  The wagyu sliders were decent (my least favorite but just as delicious).ORDER THE MANGO TANGO DESSERT! I was ready to lick my plate clean and my husband reminded me I'm in a public setting (OOPS).Although a little pricier than my usual takeout.  I would definitely come back here again - this time with friends.  Give this place a chance!

I finally tried this restaurant by having brunch with a friend on a beautiful Sunday morning. The decor and ambiance is definitely what I would classify as modern, with dark hardwood floors and tables, tablecloths, some modern artwork adorning the walls, artwork adorning the walls, and so forth. I was a bit taken aback by the stones in the restroom sink; it just strikes me as trying too hard.Our waitress was extremely attentive, refilling my coffee and my friend's without us having to flag her down. Considering we chug coffee like water at brunch, that is some great attentiveness.Per the waitress' recommendation, I had the Chilaquiles Verdes, which she described as "kind of like nachos." I really enjoyed it; it was heavily sprinkled with cilantro and they certainly did not skimp on the Oaxaca cheese. I was mildly disappointed with the portion size, but at least for this dish, it's denser than it looks and the concave dish contributed to that. If you are looking for portion size / bang for your buck above all else, there are diners located in along Austin St. that are better suited.My friend got the avocado tostada and liked it as well; a nice Hispanic take on the stereotypical hipster "avocado toast" that aging boomers use to make fun of younger people. He mentioned that the roasted sunflower seeds it contained gave it a nice crunch on top of the fried corn tortilla.I can also confirm that the coffee is definitely high quality and they have free refills as of the time of this review. No free refills of coffee means I do not dine at your restaurant for breakfast or brunch. It's coffee, not mimosas, Bloody Marys, or wine; it's NYC so it may be hard, but please don't nickel-and-dime people.So yes, I definitely like this place, for it's a definite change of pace from my usual haunts, where I pride myself on finding places that seem like they were yanked from their respective countries and dropped right here in New York City. The brunch here is quite good, I have not tried them for dinner, but I probably will be doing that soon. However, I cannot help but be flabbergasted at $10 "gluten free chips and guacamole" appetizer, because due to my previously mentioned habits, I know plenty of places where I can get a full meal at a sit-down restaurant for less than that. Sure, they aren't trendy and the bathrooms are usually about as cramped as one on a passenger jet... but I'm there for the food, not the trendy decor.

Had a prefixed brunch here on Saturday. The ambience of the place is definitely really nice & they even write a little message on the menus. It's a nice touch and the price was good. The appetizers - guac & chips and a fruit salad - were tasty. Personally, I had the steak and eggs for the entree & it was good. The others ordered the Tres Golpes which they didn't love. Overall good experience. Would love to come back and try their dinner options!
I'm the midst of this pandemic, their service is horrible. The food was cold, it's just not worth going outside for this shit. Drinks are trash too

I have mixed reviews about this place on my first visit but I decided to give it another try and visited a second time. It didn't go well. To keep the story short my friend and I sat at the bar and order a round of cocktails - they we Good -  on my first visit the mojito was way too sweet - thinking its batched and made in large quantities.We both order the vegan ceviche and a guacamole and chips - our ceviche order came out incorrectly - they gave us a mango salad - which we were thrown off by but it was descent tasting and we were hungry so we ate it - halfway through eating it the bartender tells us it's the wrong plate and that the ceviche was coming out - we appreciate that he was honest and corrected it but then the ceviche came out and it looked nothing like a ceviche. One of the owner was by the bar and we spoke to him for a bit and I told him my feedback but he brushed it away. Feedback in any business is very important- if a customer is going out of the way to give you information so that you can improve - be receptive and appreciate it - don't knock it down and give excuses. Just turned off by the owners attitude more than the food itself - prices are high and the expectation of the customers experience should be high as well. I do appreciate that they have vegan options but - don't call something a ceviche that doesn't look anything like one. Ps : vegan ceviche is super easy to make - just YouTube it

I am taking time to write this review because people need to know about this. First, with this entire chaos that is going on we need to be united and instead most businesses are being greedy and false advertising and price gauging their items. I am a regular at Mojo I go there all the time for brunch, lunch and dinner so I am pretty familiar with prices. There have 2 instances already where I have been charged for items I did not order and thankfully I ALWAYS check my bill. I let that go because I understand people make mistakes but sometimes I believe its done on purpose. Nevertheless, they have an advertisement all over social media stating 50% off take outs now it does not specify exclusions. When I go to pick up the order now the whom I think is the owner says " you know its not on beverages" now Of course I had to look again and it is crystal clear it does not state exclusions. He was pretty nasty and boldly says I need to make money and stay afloat! of course so does every other business in NYC. I understand small businesses are struggling but do you think by false advertising and being disrespectful to your customers is going to get you to make money. For every customer you treat disrespectfully you lost 10 more because that person will tell their friends and so forth to take business elsewhere. BE HONEST with people and don't false advertise and then be rude when people question YOUR advertisement! Trust me customers check your receipts always! they have a pretty bad habit to add " extra items" thinking you wont check it and they change prices when you order alot of beverages all of a sudden happy hour does not apply to certain drinks. SMH sad that they take advantage of customers.  Good luck Mojo
Just got home from a lovely dinner at Mojo. It is an amazing restaurant with great service and delicious food. We had 3 apps and an entree with a Passion mule, it was the bomb.

My fiancé and I came here this past Tuesday evening and it was definitely pretty busy for a random weekday, however there was still seating available and we got in with no wait. We ordered one round of drinks to start and later another. We started with the Rosemary Pisco and Sabor A Mi. Both were absolutely delicious! I don't remember the names of our second round of drinks but we liked the first choices we went with more.For appetizers we shared the guacamole and the ceviche. We loved the unique flavor and presentation of both (the guacamole was more smooth rather than chunky how it usually is and the ceviche was served in a nice glass). For entrees we ordered the Jumpin Lomo and Macho Marino. All the food was delicious and service was great. We will definitely be back again for dinner and drinks. We are so happy this place opened up in this area.(My only minor comment is that it did take a bit longer than you'd think for our appetizers to come out. Being that it was just a Tuesday it made us wonder how long we'd be waiting if we came here on a busy weekend night.)

The new spot on Austin Street!Had the chance to stop by the opening week on a Friday. This place was packed (as expected). Our servers were very helpful getting us seating and offering suggestions. Overall, we loved the flavor in the dishes, the plating of the dishes, and the ambiance. Starting with the new renovated look of the place (we remember how it looked as Exo Cafe), the colors of all the restaurant are a mix of wood, white, and earth tones, with the accommodation of floral mid-century accents. The chairs were comfortable and matched the tables nicely. We admired the aesthetics of the restaurant throughout our meal.Now on to the food. We stopped by just for drinks and appetizers, which started with frozen margaritas. We had the passion fruit ones, which were great. And our appetizers were the Wagyu Sliders, Spanish Kebabs and Chicken Taquitos.The Taquitos were my girlfriend's favorite part. The taquitos were mouth watering and juicy. They had the perfect balance of spice and her favorite avocado. The Sliders were my favorite, the housemade pink sauce that layered the bottom of them complemented the tender meat with sweet and savory flavor. We enjoyed the Spanish Kebabs as well (comes with 3 kebabs and 3 yuca fries), I always love Yuka fries and the meat was delicious.Lastly, we ate the Churros with Chocolate and Strawberry Sauce. We LOVED the chocolate and strawberry, it was absolutely decadent with the 4 churros.Overall, excellent place. Priced accordingly with the other Austin restaurants. Will definitely come back for Entrees next time. Check it out!

We are new to the area and this place came highly recommended from friends. My only complaint was that the chimichurri was very salty, the salt overlook the herbs. I would have also liked an element of heat, whether some jalepeno in the guacamole or some heat to the pickled onions or something. The dishes needed that to cut the richness. We had the churrasco and the pernil. Both were delicious. Sides included black beans, garlic rice (which was delicious) and maduros. The ambiance was great and there was definitely a calm that felt like a getaway from busy Austin Street. The food was great and the menu had some unique dishes on it. My steak was cooked to a perfect medium (usually if you order medium it comes out medium-well). Everything was very flavorful and great. Portions were excellent. The drink was appropriately strong. We will definitely be back.

Really great food and the manager (and staff) was receptive to feedback. I visited while in NYC and met my family here for a late night dinner. While the service was questionable at first the moment I spoke up it was explained and corrected. This place is a prime example of customers come first. I got their churrasco which was tasty and dessert (can't remember which two but they were both yummy). My mom and sister also enjoyed their meals and drinks.

Great date place...trendy, hip. It was noisy but not to the point where you have to strain your voice to chat. Price is up thereWe had the...Frituras de mar- it consist of fried shrimp, calamari, catfish, yuca and pickled onions. The catfish was damn good. It was fresh! Calamari was soft ... not too chewy. Shrimp was pretty fresh too. Churrasco- I like the chimichurri sauce... other then that the steak was pretty tender. We order medium rare... probably came out to mediumService- excellent. Very attentive...Multiple staff would refill our water. Must have done it 8-9 times. Manager even came by to inquire if there was any problems Price- was pretty expensive. High 50s after tips and tax for just an entree and appetizer with no drinksDecor- hip and trendy... even have tv broadcasting sports around the bar areaParking- this is Austin street... heart of forest hill... what do you expect?This place is great... if price is not a issue.

I went to this restaurant about a week and a half ago for the first time. My friend had a frozen red sangria, which I had a few sips of and I personally thought that it was ok, while my friend loved it.  We order guac and chips as our appetizer, the guacamole was great, the chips were good, however, The fried green plantings that the plate comes with were not good. They tasted strange, like not natural or something.  I think that it's a pre-packaged thing and they simply fry it at the restaurant and was a big disappointment. I got so excited when I first saw the plate and I saw them they incorporate a fry plantings to their chips and guac, I liked the combination but it was an epic fail  My friend and I ordered the same main course meal, Jumpin' lomo. The plate was good but I have had this meal in so many different restaurants, I know that it is a Peruvian plate and I think that they did OK. I am aware that they gave their own little twist to the recipe and that they also use another type of steak, I would say a better quality of meat than any other restaurant I have gone too. I have to say that I loved the atmosphere, they were playing great music, and the decoration of the restaurant is amazing, from the walls to the ceiling to the restroom... Amazing. I do believe that I will go there again, and definitely try other meals.

Mojo is a cute little addition to Forest Hills! Overall, the food was ok and the service was great. FOOD (Rated: 3.5/5)Guac & Chips - While the chips were great, I've had MUCH better guacamole. This was watery instead of chunky and had way too much lime. Don't recommend getting. Sautéed Vegetables - This dish was just okay. Lacked in chimichurri sauce and also came with 1 spoon of quinoa on top of the veggies. If I had know that this dish did not come with quinoa, I would've ordered something else. Don't order unless you want to pay $17 and still be starving. Arroz con Pollo- My boyfriend ordered this and said it was just okay. The rice was flavorful but the chicken was a tad bit dry. Definitely have had better arroz con pollo elsewhere. SERVICE (Rated: 5/5)The service was excellent. Our waiter was very nice and very attentive to all of our needs.

Ufffff. I wanted to love this. Bartender was excellent. Her name was Jessica. Very nice. The pork slider/bun lacked something. Maybe the bread killed the flavor some, for me. Didn't love it. I had another app that I can't even remember, but I do recall not liking it and discarding it. Frozen sangria was okay. I'll give it a more solid try soon, tho. Hopefully I find a good entree to love, so I can keep coming back. The place has a great vibe! 3.5 stars, but to be continued...

This is my first review on yelp, mostly because my experience at this restaurant was so terrible it left a sour taste in my mouth and the only way to get my frustration out is to write this out. After waiting for over 40 minutes after putting out names down, my group of friends sat down to order drinks. We were told by our server that if we only ordered apps and a drink we would only get 45 minutes to sit and have our drinks. Fair enough, it's busy and it's policy. So to comply with this rule, my friends order appetizers I order an entree so we can actually sit and have time to eat our food instead of being rushed out right after getting it. We get our food, start eating and our server comes by to say we have 15 minutes left. We just look at her confused because we ordered an entree, and she this time clarifies no "EACH PERSON" need to order an entree, a complete lie because not everyone at the table next to us ordered an entree. When I ask her why she didn't clarify this when I ordered the overpriced tiny entree, she becomes belligerent and refuses to answer instead, instead repeating like a broken record "it's policy". To add insult to injury, on the bill they charge a nice, fat 20% party fee and gratuity, which clear states for parties of 6 or more, we were 5 people. Maybe because we looked like teenagers they thought it would be easier to get away with being so shady, or maybe our waitress couldn't count. All in all what a shady business practice, you don't even let us sit for more than 45 minutes when we have ordered over 100 dollars worth of food and drinks but you can happily charge the party and gratuity fee without batting an eye?? We had to chug the rest of our drinks and take the food to go to comply with their policy as well as give them the mandatory 20%. If you want a restaurant that will treat you like shit and send you packing before you can even finish your food and drink that you're paying for, but have no problem with overcharging you, you've found your place.
From the food to the platting to the drinks, everything is perfect. The atmosphere is so chill and inviting. Definitely one of my go to places.
If I can give more stars I would ... my favorite restaurant and go to spot ... staff is friendly service is good and the food and drinks is bomb ‼

Love this place! Drinks are on point and the food is so delicious. I had the Kobe sliders on the tostones , the garlic chicken in that creamy sauce ,the chicken taquitos and the empanadas with the Picadillo inside. Yes we went overboard and it was so worth it. The portion size is very good and I'm digging the prices. And FYI, The green tomatillo sauce is simple but banging. Yum! This place is my new favorite Cuban inspired place in forest hills.

Random date night with the hubby called for a new and random choice and we so happened to be standing a block away from the restaurant when we yelp restaurants near us and thought we would give it a try. Place has great decor the all day long happy hour Tuesday. Passion fruit mojito is a must try and the chicken  mojo is just simple and so damn flavorful. My husband had the Latino fried rice with the pork belly  and he loved it. Definitely will be coming back again.

The drinks and atmosphere is great for a location in Forest Hills. We ordered a ceviche and it was good! However we also ordered a arroz con pollo, rice and chicken and the chicken was super cold, when you actually bite the chicken you can feel the cold in the middle, was quite disappointed, make me believe that they didn't cook the chicken right then. They should have the staff make sure they ask the customers how the food is.

If you're hanging out in Forest Hills and strolling down Austin street, deciding where to go for a bite and drinks, stop into Mojo.  You'll get a fantastic meal and the drinks are delicious as well. I came here with my bff to finalize our big trip overseas and what better way to celebrate than over a meal and drinks. Let me start with the beautiful decor, which sets the stage for a summer evening. Sitting at a table with the doors open to the street as you sip on your fancy Strawberry Margarita and watch people pass by. As we enjoyed a few different Margaritas on the menu we ditched an appetizer and dug into their Aron con pollo and their Veggies dish. (See attached photos) The food came out quickly and everything was delicious. The chicken in the Aron con pollo was so tender and seasoned perfectly and sat on top of a bed of cilantro beer garlic rice, red bell pepper, green peas, green plantains and pico de gallo. I'm licking my lips just thinking about this dish and how good it was. Their sauteed veggies consisted of quinoa, roasted bell peppers, broccolini, cremini mushrooms, sweet potato, cherry tomatoes and asparagus seasoned in chimichurri. Which is all gluten free and vegan. It's great when a restaurant has these options on the menu. Our server was friendly and attentive. I'll definitely be adding Mojo to my rotation of 5 stars restaurants in Forest Hills.

First time checking this spot out. Came here on a Saturday night without reservation & was seated right away! The staff were friendly & attentive which is a plus. The food and drinks were  amazing! Deff recommend this place to everyone! Check it out ASAP.

My boyfriend and I always try nice places to go out, eat and drink. I discovered this place not too far from our house and the experience was amazing !!! I was starving and we were sat immediately and asked for appetizers, drinks etc. It sucked because I didn't bring my ID for drinks, but my boyfriend loved his!!! They weren't cheap with the tequila in the drinks, so it was worth the 12 bucks per drink, so the drinks made this a five star.
