The appetizers were some of the best I had, the corn al diablo reminded us of Esquite and the empanadas were freshly fried and juicyyyyyy.  The main dishes we had were steak and the arroz con pollo and they were great!!! I wasn't too much of a fan for the arroz con pollo because the veggies were hard in the rice, but I will try something else next time. Churros for dessert were sooooooo good and fresh!!!! I was already stuffed because the plates are HUGE. We spent about $145 with tip so it was a pretty affordable place for two.  The server always came around, refilled drinks and always asked if we needed anything, so the service was very attentive!! Would totally recommend to latin food lovers. :)

Let me start off my saying the service is ok.. can't definitely be better...  as for the food I had a Dominican dish called "tres golpe" you can't really screw this dish up and here it was delicious.  Girlfriend had the salmon she loved it. Dish was very nicely prepared also!! Decor was decent and and comfortable... I would recommend this place for Spanish dishes.

While I always enjoy a new restaurant, I didn't even realize until after entering this was the Exo Cafe's old location. They made some interior changes and they do look really nice. the host greeted us upon arrival and we were sat on the second level. The waiter used an electronic tablet to take orders, oh yea and the menus are lit up as soon as you open them, for easy reading. We ordered two frozen margarita, flavored. They were cold, but they were very sweet. As for food we ordered guacamole and chips for an appetizer. When served it was mixed of plantain chips and tortilla chips with the guacamole. The guacamole was delicious but the chips, both of them, were really stale. I mentioned it to the waiter but honestly didn't get any reaction she just took away the plate. As for the main course we ordered pernil and jumping lomo. The dishes were flavorful and a good sized portion. To give the drinks another chance we ordered plain frozen margaritas. Yep they were still really sweet, we did not finish them. I guess it's a nice new place on Austin street, if you look real sweet drinks then this is your spot but the food was very good besides the stale chips

Came in around 2:30 for lunch. Really cute decor we were seated immediately. Menu was alittle weird it was a brunch/lunch. Dinner seemed to have way more delish options but the food and drinks were good! We had a great lunch. Will be returning.

I had seen some posts on social media from some people I follow and decided to stop by today. The bar was full and lively and we were welcomed by both the bartender and a random hostess that was there to pick up drinks for her table . The drinks were really good. Each different and delicious and strong enough to give anyone a quick buzz. When we got seated we were taken care of by our server Eli who made us feel comfortable and was also very helpful on and informative. We ordered the blood orange salmon, the jumpin Lomo, the corn, and the S and S ceviche... The food was delicious and flavorful. I pretty much licked the plate clean. Matthew, the manager came by afterwards and greeted us and I couldn't help but commend him on how good the food was and that I was definetly coming back...The experience at Mojo today was very good and comfortable. The food was delicious. The drinks were amazing. The fact that there is a new Spanish restaurant that is trying to stand out and make a name for itself is awesome. Overall, I think this place great and can't wait to go back! Good luck to Matthew, Eli and the rest of the crew there on continued success!

Me and my boyfriend went here for our 4 year anniversary today and had such a great time  it was our first time here and it left such a great first impression! The food was so good and the service was very nice. We even had our waitress take a Polaroid picture of us and she was so sweet about it ! We will definitely be coming back here !!

If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. I think it's absolutely  disgusting and pathetic to price-gouge your customers during this pandemic. None of the other restaurants that I have ordered from have pulled this crap. Let me repeat that, NONE OF THE OTHER RESTAURANTS ARE PRICE  GOUGING THEIR CUSTOMERS!  Yet this place increased their prices and then the owner wants some sort of prize for staying open. Like really?!?!! Everyone else that's  open figured out how to keep prices the same. That's a scumbag move.  Scumbag companies will always find an excuse for why they are ripping off their customers. We don't need your excuses.   Time to support HONEST small businesses!

This spot JUST opened & I've already visited twice. The first visit I hosted my birthday dinner. I reserved with Mohammed at info@mojolatin.com. Mohammed answered every question promptly & was able to accommodate my every wish. I was provided 4 prefix menu options, an extended happy hour time just for my party & they even printed my customized menu for the table! The service was great & I returned two weeks later. My favorite dishes are the Arroz Con Pollo, Chicken Mojo & I've also tried the Jumpin Lomo. The coconut mojitos are amazing and the Guac YUM. A lovely place for casual dining or celebrations.The decor is chic & romantic. I've referred many people & I'll be visiting like tomorrow. Definitely a must try!

Omg!!! This place brings me nostalgia of when I lived in Miami with authentic Cuban food. The chicken mojo is amazing!! Not an understatement... highly recommended. My mother ordered the pernil and she was amazed of how delicious and spot on they cooked the pernil. Clearly the latin fusion to the tee.. she said it was the best! My salute to the chef. Our waitress was one of the managers  catherine... she was super attentive, courteous and made us feel right at home. The passion fruit mojito also highly recommend... 1 turned to 2 and almost nonstop addicting! Thats how great it was. Ambience was great too..: authentic cuban  tunes that brought me back to missing my havana and miami nights!!! Thank you so much for everything, wish i could give beyond 5 stars of how amazing this place is and how great they treated us.

First time going to this establishment last night..it was crowded and had a waiting time for a table but we opted to eat at the bar..All in all it was a great experience from beginning to the end..Friendly staff, nice vibe, music playing not loud in order for you to see the game on tv and the food was delicious and drinks were on point..Appetizers we ordered the guacamole&chips..for dinner we had the arroz con pollo (chicken/rice) and the baked salmon!!! We will definitely be repeat customers and will spread the word about this gem we found!

Great place to take family,friends,wife,girlfriend,or side piece. The food is phenomenal the staff is friendly and it's conveniently located near mass transit. My favorite dishes are the churrasco and mojo chicken. Dinner starts at 5pm but if you get there earlier I highly suggest the apps and frozen beverages.

Had Sunday brunch here, I use to come here when it was Exo, so the lay out is still the same , nice updates on the decor,  good vibes inside. We sat near bar area since it was a packed day. We had the steak & eggs which was seasoned very well. My friend had a glass of wine, I had a frozen watermelon margarita,  not bad but didn't give me a buzz. I wish they had unlimited mimosas. Service was good as well.
Nice place for a date night. Didn't realize there was more to the place as we went in. Food and drinks were delicious.

The foodie in me is NOT HAPPY. Overpriced food that was just OK, I know I ordered Vegan but French fries white rice an sauté veggies WHERE THEY DO THAT AT!!!!  My guest had sweet plantain with feta cheese and a spicy shrimp taco (shell was made of plantain also). The atmosphere of the place was beautiful, restrooms clean an staff very attentive.

We came to this location to celebrate my brother-in-law and sister in law 7th wedding anniversary. We had a nice set up and fixed beautiful customized menu. The food was delicious and the place is gorgeous. The bar area is a title too small and it can get very crowded but it's worth it because the drinks are amazing. I do recommend this place for a large group event or simple dinner night out. Two thumbs up

I love it here. The music, the vibes, the food, the service...all of it. We started off with appetizers. We got guacamole and chips which was served with plantain chips, tortilla chips and pine nuts and the wagyu chimi sliders served on fried plantains with a homemade pink sauce. For our mains, we got the jumping lomo which was lomo saltado with garlic rice and truffle fries. We also got the pernil which was shredded pork with white rice, plantain chips and green plantains. We also got the macho marina which was a seafood dish with calamari, scallops and shrimp with yuca in a delicious sauce. For dessert we got the mango tango, a flaky pastry dessert with fruit, churros and chocolate and cookies with ice cream. Everything was amazing and our server Eli was the absolute best. He was super friendly and attentive. I really enjoyed my experience here and will come back and try their drinks and brunch.

This is the new hype restaurant in Austin St. Cozy yet stylish decor. Very latin yet updated. The frozen sangria was served right away, and it was awesome. The fried calamari/shrimp/fish trio was a hit, and the vegan ceviche was average, yet unconventional. Not a cheesy place to be on a first date. Waitresses' outfits  are eye-catching, yet professional. Worth coming back

Have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment since opening week. Always a good time from the great music and atmosphere to the great food and drinks and most of all the wonderful service. If you haven't visited yet you must make your way here you wont regret it. As far as food I love the S&S scallops and salmon ceviche that sauce is everything I literally want to lick the plate. I usually have the mule but the mojitos are great and to my surprise the sangria is delicious and $15 pitchers on Mondays is a steal! my new Monday spot for sure. And lastly the bathrooms are the best for selfies lol Wish them the best of luck and have gained me as a loyal customer that's for sure

5 Stars hands down. I was extremely upset when Exo Cafe closed. It was one of my favorite places. I was not planning on liking Mojo as much as I did. I went for dinner with my mother, husband, and mother-in-law and every single dish that we ordered was absolutely delicious. My mother-in-law and I had the arroz con pollo. It was mouth wateringly good and a large portion. I had enough left over to take home. My mom got a vegetable dish and added shrimp to it. She enjoyed it very much. My husband had a pork dish that he was raving about too. The next night I went with a friend for drinks and everything was delicious. I will be back again

I made last minute reservations for Father's Day. I was a bit disappointed that it was a pre-fixed menu since I had my mind set on the ceviche and the options offered didn't seem to be anything out of the ordinary.  So we placed our order and were a bit turned off but once the food came out we were all pleasantly surprised with the flavor and the food portions.  The managers sent us over extra servings of the quinoa salad and the salmon appetizer that we didn't even think to try and we all enjoyed every bit of it.  I had my 8 month old in his stroller and the hostess went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable which I really appreciated since I'm new at this mom life. The waitress was very prompt and informative and the managers were friendly and accommodating.  They even had the first series of match ups for the world cup games on the big screens by the bar which was another surprise.  We were able to enjoy our dinner, frozes and got to see Uruguay win against Ecuador. We will definitely be back to try the ceviches and other entrees in the near future so we can give this establishment the full 5 stars.  Mojo's will definitely stay on my list of local spots to head over too!

It's extremely hard to come across a good restaurant that serves Spanish cuisine. Forest hills  is my neighborhood and I never seen this spot until yesterday. The food was amazing , I don't eat onions , but the sauce in my dish was sooo tasty I even ate the onions .... our waiter whose name I can't remember I am so sorry was very helpful and friendly. If you go there just look for the waiter with the cool beard . Hahahah live music too...

Omg! Talk about cute and great atmosphere... first and foremost the decor is really great.. from the bathroom candles to even the rocks in the sink as your washing your hands, you feel at home.. very ZEN. The staff are very welcoming, music is at a perfect volume where you can actually have a great conversation at brunch without yelling... My preferred plate is the salmon quinoa, as i am a pescatarian and they have great dishes for us here! The ceviche comes really pretty and tasty! The food is not salty whatsoever and the guacamole is very homemade and fresh! My friends ordered the Latino fried rice,  chicken mojo dish and the churassco ! They loved it... rice and beans where on point too! I even has some :)The FROZE IS OFFF THE CHAIN! They have a great selection of cocktails.. they even have one with eggwhites in it! That's awesome! the bartenders are all pretty and unique.. the staff too, very good looking people ;) Apparently all their juice is freshly squeezed.... and the watermelon that comes with the froze was bomb! I'll be back :) thanks for having us!
Mojo chicken and churrassco were cooked to perfection and tasted outstanding.Would definitely go again. Had a great vibe

Decided to check this spot out before the movies and it was great! I definitely like this new restaurant compared to the previous one. The food was good, the drinks were good and cute and the decor was very nice, will return!

My friend and I went to check out this new addition to Austin Street. The decor is really nice, a good change from the previous restaurant. It was very cozy and had a good atmosphere. The service was decent, the hostess had no sense of enthusiasm or didn't seem to be very welcoming but the waiter was fine. I had two appetizers and my meal. The Spanish kebabs and the chicharron buns. I really enjoyed the chicharron buns, if you don't like the fatty parts then you with like it, and the yucca fries. My friend had the churasco. We both actually did not enjoy the steak from either of our meals. It did taste pretty bland. Although the meal wasn't 100%, we will visit again because the drinks were good and we just won't order the steak again.

My husband and I have been here a few times and have enjoyed our experience. The food is really tasty and we both enjoy the sangria that they make. While I prefer sangria to be stronger, I don't mind this one. Now, the food is the heart and soul of this place. I've ordered a few different entrees from the menu and it is really really good! Our most recent visit had a slight hiccup with our order taking forever to come but the manager comp'd our dessert in addition to speaking with us and apologizing. I want to have my birthday party here over the summer :)

What can I say? I liked Mojo, dont get me wrong.  My bartender was awesome,  and my happy hour margarita was powerful. However, my $14 appetizer--chimi sliders, i believe-- was tiny. I mean delish but sooooo small.....UPDATE: changing my review to 5 stars to include their wonderful  customer service and graciousness receiving my feedback. I am impress!!
Absolutely amazing food and amazing service! My son the biggest food critic loves it here!The manager of the place is so kind and wants to make sure you are having a wonderful time! Love this place

I'm so happy I came here tonight! Service was great and so was the food and drinks. I had the passion mula drink and if u like passion fruit it's delicious. I had the chicken in the white sauce and ooooh my it was SO GOOD! & for dessert-those were probably the best churros I've ever had. Tasted hot and fresh. Will be coming back!
This place was great!  Cuban Sandwich was very good and the cocktail with Tequila and IPA Beer really good.

Pros: - Great location- No wait time - Great selection of specialty cocktails - Food presentation and overall quality Cons: - Parking in the area can be tough - Prefixed menu was mandatory (fathers day) Great food, music and frozè. The restaurant was not overly crowded which is always an issue on holidays. Service was top notch, although I wish I remembered my servers name! He was attentive and thorough. I will be returning since I live fairly close, and I would love to try other items on the menu. And, more Frozè!!

I came in for appetizers and drinks and was delighted to see the venue had such a homey contemporary feel but yet sexy and modern look to it. The crowd was lovely and so was my bartender Jordan and general manager Mo, who recommended meals and drinks that were exquisite , the food was tasty and so were the drinks. I had the chamuco, which was a spicy tequila drinks and the beef sliders. Everything was unique with its simplicity, even the restroom lol.Really enjoyed my time. Will come again
A hidden gem in forest hills, great attention to detail, the drinks are very reasonable and the food is to die for!!!
Awesome vibe! Great music lots of tvs and food and music was superb, will be going back again

My hubby brought me on a date here a few weeks ago. The place is beautiful, service was pretty good, they were playing old school Salsa which is my fav! I had a Sangrita which was pretty good. We had the Wagyu Chimi sliders for appetizer, and the Jumpin Lomo for dinner! The food was amazing although for the price I think they should serve a little more food, portions were very small, due to this we had space for dessert and decided to try the Churros they were delicious , always the perfect end to any dinner!

I used to love this restaurant when it was Exo Cafe and stopped going after something I ate there gave me really bad food poisoning. I've been to a Mojo a few times and overall the service has been good but the food/drinks decent. On my most recent visit, I ordered frozen passion fruit margaritas, guacamole and chips and Latin fried rice with pork belly. The drinks had too much passion fruit syrup at the bottom of the glass (even after I asked them to put less in the second one) and weren't mixed well. The chips were VERY stale and needed more salt/seasoning, as did the guacamole that was drowned in micro green garnish. The rice and pork belly were salty but good. However, I got food poisoning from eating at this restaurant again and will not be returning.

Visited Mojo on one of their opening days and was very impressed!What really stood out to me, besides the food, was how the menus light up. It's a very unique take that makes them very memorable. Staff - 10/10Very pleasant and attentive. Food - 10/10The steak skewers were so juicy and delicious. Writing this review actually makes me want to go back and order this again. Highly recommended!

So I went with another couple and both of our kids, my friends 6 mo and my toddler 2 1/2 .. food was fair priced  at brunch time, good flavor and very good portions.. CONS although they have high chairs I don't consider this place kids friendly.. no changing table in the bathroom for my friend's baby and they took looong time to prepare our table, between cleaning, setting it up and letting us go to it it took long time .. food itself took looong time. Although we had kindly requested  to bring the toddler food first and most urgently to avoid a meltdown.. def disappointing

Their food is absolutely amazing, one of our new favorite spots in forest hills. Try the chicken mojo or the Wagyu burger, you will not be disappointed! Good variety of drinks, the frozen drinks are my favorite!

The waitresses were very pleasant during my visit on a Sunday night. The food was beautifully plated and delicious. I ordered the arroz con pollo and my date ordered the "down the hatch" and loved it. The red sangria was amazing.
The most amazing margarita I ever had! Great good and ambiance. My new fav spot ! Def check this spot out!!

As soon as you walk it gives you a rustic feel and the music is great!! The decor is unique. We were greeted by the host when we walked in. Then we were seated upstairs. Our glasses were filled with water and we were given menus.  We ordered frozen red sangria and passion fruit mojitos. The drinks were awesome! The menus were cool as they light up. For the appetizers we ordered the Spanish kebabs and the chicharrón buns. FYI: they come in 3's  ...The Spanish kebabs were tender and juicy. The chicharrón buns were fresh, the pork belly was crunchy which great flavor! We went on to order the Latino fried rice and the Jumpin' lomo. The Jumpin'lomo was okay  nothing to brag about. The Latino fried rice was extremely salty it was not edible. I asked for it to be fixed but it still did not tickle my fancy. I still wanted to give this restaurant a chance so I ordered dessert and got the churros. The churros did not disappoint, sweet, crunchy and soft. The chocolate sauce went perfect with it.

The place is alright , it's in a great neighborhood with both indoor and outdoor seating. And the food was pretty good nothing extraordinary spectacular. We waiting a while to be served and when we were served they said ran out out frozen margaritas.... how do you run out of ice at a big establishment Servicing so many drinks. We then ordered an appetizer and it never showed up to the table. Which is why I took off a star . But overall seemed to be a nice restaurant to go to.
I had a margarita on the rocks and a frozen margarita wasn't the best I've had. The ambiance was good.

When my partner&I walked in it the front of the house staff were oh so welcoming! We were seated right away..the atmosphere was magnificent, the service we received was excellent(our server was Samantha she's sweet!) and the food was AMAZING! I recommend the chicken tacos.. the churrasco steak&the Salmon! BOMB!! you won't be disappointed 10/10. We enjoyed

The service was good. The drinks were very good, we tried mojitos and frozen sangria. The bar area looks nice and I would definitely meet someone here for drinks. The food was ok, not as flavorful as I expected.  the guacamole appetizer portion served mostly chips but the actual guacamole portion was small to share, and was on the watery side as another review mentioned.  The corn Diablo was good, but a little too creamy and missed the roasted taste usually found with Mexican street corn.

Went here for my birthday with a party of 8. Our table was very spacious and comfortable. First impression, the ambiance was like stepping into a vacation. Service was excellent from beginning to end. Frozé was delicious. Ordered the Chicken Mojo,  very tender and tasty. ALL of our apps were delectable, ceviche is def a must try. Great place for parties big or small.

Came here on a Wednesday around 8 pm, it was fairly packed. Great after work vibe. Beautiful ambiance. The staff was very attentive. I got the Latin rice, Frozé and shrimp tortilla appetizers. Will definitely come back.
Such a beautiful space, great drinks and to top it off the staff is super attentive! I'll definitely be back

Olivia was our server and she was so sweet! Great service, great food and ambiance. Music wasn't so loud that you couldn't have a conversation. My friends and I had frozen sangrias - basic but delicioussss. Definitely recommend this spot!

Came in on a busy Saturday night and there was a bit of a wait for a table, but it was well worth it! Firstly, the ambiance and decor of the place is great. My friend and I ordered a Passion Mula and a Mojito and both were excellent. I definitely would recommend the Mula to anyone, it's my new favorite drink. We started with guac and chips - loved that it came with both tortilla chips and plantain chips, but the guac did have a LOT of onion which I wasn't completely a fan of. For my entree, I ordered the Churrasco which was cooked to perfection and I really liked the hint of garlic in the rice. Our server, Olivia, was fantastic and gave us a lot of recommendations and was always checking on us to make sure everything was to our liking. Will definitely be back!

Amazing food and great drinks, music.! I loved it. Server Eli is on it.! He did most of our recommendation and he didn't fail bc he came Thur as all the plates were delicious! Def coming back again and getting the Main course.!! And them some
Food was just okay and the customer service really lacked. My waitress was horrible and took forever to take my order and hardly checked on my table.

I have to say Eli the waiter was the biggest sweetheart super nice and super attentive. He gave his recommendations on the food and it was all amazing  My fiancé and I wanted to go somewhere where food was great and good drinks. The drinks omg were out of this world ! You must try passion mula I mean I can still taste it !
love this place! The mojo chicken is  life! Be sure to ask for extra sauce because it's addicting! Can't wait to go back & try the rest of the menu. Great addition to Austin street.

Came here for my birthday last week.  It was okay. They have to work on some things. Hopefully they read the reviews and work on it. First of all the restaurant looks beautiful. Great decor.   We were seated upstairs.  The waitress we had was lovely. Very sweet. The floor manager or host was gracious.  Welcomed us with a big smile.  They have an unusual mixed cocktail menu. Very eclectic. I tried the one with the roasted pineapple. It was sweet but Delish. I tried a sample of the frozen rose.  It was disgusting. Had a bubblegum aftertaste. Even though rose is dry.  This drink was sickly sweet.  Thank god I asked to try it.  My second drink was a strawberry margarita.  Although strong ...it tasted off.  An aftertaste I can't put my finger on.  Me and my sister ordered the chicharron burger and two Medium Skirt steaks.  Rookie restaurant mistake ...they brought out our appetizer and our meal at the same time. There was hardly any room on our table. We ate the app fast so our food wouldn't get cold.  The chicharron was beyond excellent.  It was huge and very flavor-able.  I could have eaten two of those and I would have been happy.   The steak ... my sisters was medium and mine was well done.  We both asked for medium. I hate to waste food and I hate well done steak so me in my sister split half and half so we suffered equally. The flavor was good on the steak.  The rice was under cooked and the beans tasted canned.  For that amount of money they are charging this is not acceptable. We got there kinda late 9:30 pm so they started to put the chairs up around us and close the back lights. The restaurant closes at midnight I believe.  That's unacceptable. If the entire restaurant didn't close yet ...don't do that. It's rude.  It only takes minutes to put up the chairs..wait until your customer leave.  I'll be back for the burger and maybe a glass of wine.  Hopefully they work out small kinks.  I wish them luck.
Great restaurant and excellent service. The sangria is delicious as well as the roasted veggies and salads.  Highly recommend this restaurant!

Restaurant seems pretty and nice on inside but too bad that doesn't help much in the flavor dept for food and drinks. This is subpar Spanish food it's greasy and flavorless. Deff not even good for just drinks as the bartenders don't know much at all. Save yourself some money don't bother coming here. If you ate here and enjoyed it your pallet is that of someone who's lived off fast food your entire life and like the Olive Garden find this amazing .... basura
The food is Latin Fusion and high quality.  Very delicious with lot's of flavor. Drinks are amazing and the dessert of cookies and cafe icecream is a nice way to finsh your meal.

Great food, great atmosphere, responsive staff that are accommodating. But drinks are lackluster, I been to most of the restaurants around Mojos and they are the worst in terms of quality of drinks, food they are one of the best, but if you can't get me a decent margarita I won't be back, I can deal with bad food with good drinks but I can't deal with good food with bad drinks.
Went here on a Tuesday which was good cause they have happy hour all night here..I had 2 Mojitos which were good & the guacamole n chips & sliders the food was good service was good as well

This place is seriously amazing if your in the mood for some Spanish food, I've gone here 3 times so far and it's only been a week since I've discovered it. The décor has a modern aesthetic and the food is very fresh. I've tried just about everything on the menu and I don't think I can complain but you should definitely try the chiccarron buns ( we ordered more than one round of these) and the Latin rice is a must. As for drinks, I tried their frozè ,it's super refreshing and gets the job done ;)

Second time came in one week that I'm here!! DAniela was our waitress she was amazing and the manager Matthew remember me from the night before and made me really feel welcome. Make sure u try the fired rice and the lomo Ps the Frozen drinks

Loveeeeed this place. Took my family for brunch and the food was so delicious. I had Pernil and it was sooo juicy and flavorful. The rice and beans were perfect and the guacamole holy sh_t. One thing I must say is give those pancakes a Latin kick with some dulce de leche or something, the Nutella was pretty boring.

Mojo is one of the best if not  the best restaurant on Austin st. Come here all the time, the drinks and food are always on point. The staff is great, very accommodating and super friendly. Highly recommend.

2nd time here and definitely making a 3rd visit this weekend. Food is addictive and staff is so friendly. Matthew was so accommodating and super sweeChurrasco was amazing! Jumping Lomo was to die for.Looking forward to trying the salmon this weekend.

Great food, but they squeeze customers in like sardines. On weekends, it gets crowded and loud, and you can't even hear your partner...Also, the bus-boys and waiters need more training- they either do not understand or plainly ignore customer orders. Very inattentive and nowhere to find them when you need something.
Good atmosphere good music phenomenal food and very very good service.  It's the kind of restaurant no matter what you order you can never go wrong

Came here for drinks and appetizers at the bar area.  The food was delicious!!  Had a few Margaritas and they were good but I was really feeling them after the 2nd one so I switched to water.  Music was great and I loved the mixed older crowd, no youngins' that night.  I will def come back to try dinner!!
Great customer service,  Peter is AWESOME hes got the Salsa and the Mojo...................
Best Margs in Queens! I recommend it any day of the week.
This place is so lively and fun with great music & food!I definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a fun and lively atmosphere to go to for a fun date night!

The food is good but lil expensive. The service was great until the food runner had a major attitude. I said excuse me and he goes "what?" And then goes to tell me to go ask my  waitress for soda with major attitude. I spend few hundreds dollars expected  friendly attitude.
...good cocktails and good food...service ok but not exceptional...could be because it was a busy Saturday night...a bit pricey for the food that was offered...solid Latin American cuisine...
Absolutely love the vibe! The guac with the plantain chips are awesome. I really enjoyed the salmon. The churros and drinks are probably the best part. Great addition to the neighborhood

The restaurant staff was very nice however the staff was not the most attentive especially when it came to water refills...Initially when my table of 8 were seated I noticed myself and other guest in my party had old water because our water was warm however the other 6 glasses were cold and sweating...I ordered the Latino Rice which was good and portion size was lovely however very upset that I paid $4 for extra pork belly but it was only (1) one small pork belly piece laid on top of the rice...Overall the food the experience was good but I had to keep a vigilant eye to make sure service stayed on par....Decent experience however I would not personally return here on my own accord....
Yummy brunch/lunch! The steak sandwich was great. Would like to try the dinner menu. Loved the vibe inside, and it was nice to sit next to the open window
Great ceviches and the plátano desert is a must have!  the chicken taquitos are amazing as well.  I have eaten there 3 times this week and nothing has disappointed.
The environment is amazing, the food is wonderful. Best Latin American food. I highly recommend this place.

Basically a hispanic hooters. The waitresses/ bartenders wear bras instead of shirts to distract from the fact that the food is overpriced and bland, drinks are mediocre, and the wait times are insane. 40 min wait for a table and then ANOTHER 40 min wait for just appetizers to be brought out is a joke. It's guac... are you waiting for the avocados to ripen or..... ?
Our first time here for dinner to celebrate a birthday and it was a good experience... good food, good drinks, and a nice waiter... we'll be back.

Decided to embark here for a late night dinner! Arrived at around 1030 and it was pretty packed. Although packed didn't have to wait. The ambience and entire vibe was great. Took a while for our server but like I said it was pretty busy so no big deal! Everything was great following the wait from the food down to the presentation. Our server was very helpful with explaining things we were unsure of. We did have one hiccup and didn't receive and cocktail we order. Eventually we got it and the server gave it to us on the house to make up for it, so no harm no foul! Overall great experience and nice place to enjoy a great food and amazing vibe!

Food was authentic and delicious! I had the cilantro & beer green rice with chicken. My friend had ceviche and the other had the taquitos appetizer. The only dish that fell short was the taquitos appetizer. My friend thought they were dry and had to ask for a sauce to hydrate them ( which should have come with). The service was ok but could be improved by the servers better knowledge of menu and drinks. Food served at a good paste. The ambiance is great for a night out with friends. More Miami than NY but that's the point. Will be back to try the churros!

I ordered the avocado,tomato and bibb salad off the brunch menu.  I added grilled chicken.  It was delicious.  My sister ordered the 2 eggs with bacon and home fries, her food was delicious the bacon was so fresh and tasty.  She had coffee and I just had water.  The only reason I am not giving it  5 stars the service was slow , I think they may need more staff not sure.  Also I asked the person who dropped off my food for extra dressing and he didn't come back. There also is no salt and pepper on the table and we couldn't find anyone to get it from without the food getting cold.  I am going to have a drink next time I go and hopefully an appetizer. I really enjoyed my food.  They just need to amp up the service and I would edit this  to five star.
Great ambience, Arrived early for my reservation and was still immediately seated. Drinks/Apps Outshined the Entree, Am I dying to go back, no... Will I go back,Yes.

This is my first time ever writing a review. I'm very appreciative of the staff who went above and beyond to make my reservations go out smoothly. Though there were a bit of a hiccups they did try and accommodate my every need. Mohammad one of the managers there was very helpful. Planed a birthday dinner for 19pp. Everyone had a good time and enjoyed the food. Definitely recommend for larger or small groups. Kid friendly as well. We all enjoyed. Thank you Mohammad and the staff for allowing us to have a good birthday dinner. Alex was very accommodating  as well. And our waiter was excellent.  thank you all.

Best drinks delicious food. Manager came to check on us graciously. Camilla the bartender was awesome always kept the drinks coming at the bar and made sure me and my boys were well taken care of. The wait staff was helpful and food was fresh and tasty definitely coming back with all my friends!

First time here and I was super excited since I love Latin American food. The restaurant was very pretty and had nice music and awesome vibes all night long. But the service was slightly slow. When we got seated it took over 20 minutes for the waiter to come to us and introduce himself. We already knew what drinks, appetizers and entrees we wanted to order by this time. The drinks came on time but everything else was very slow. It was busy so we were very understanding but there were multiple times we had to wait over 15 minutes for someone just to refill our glasses with water. After we finished with dessert we sat for another 30 minutes just for someone to get us our check. There was a party of 8 next to us and the waiter seemed very attentive to them and was constantly coming to them with drinks and food in a timely fashion which I found to be very surprising with the current situation I was in. I had plans around the neighborhood early but it has to be canceled because I was literally sitting in the restaurant for over 3 hours because of everything.Besides the slow  service I must say that the food was still very good and I was not disappointed at all with the flavor and amount of food given. Just wish the service was more attentive to their other customers during busy times!

The food and drinks were really good. We got a variety of items from steak to fish, all delicious. They might've gone a little heavy on the salt but still good. Love that menu lights up. No need to use your phone's flashlight to see. The decor and vibe is beautiful. Trendy but still somehow down to earth. Took a point off as the hostess completely ignored me when I walked in and stood by the stand. She went up to the people standing behind me, who came in after me, and seated them first. It was not only rude but strange. But our waitress was lovely. So do not be deterred from going.

I came here with my best friend and we absolutely enjoyed everything about MoJo. The best thing I had was the frozen rose'. It was so good I had three. They have a great happy hour special and the food is also good. I will definitely be back again.
Food comes out fast. Everything was delicious and well priced. Also got the avocado flower salad that was so good but a little small. Coming back to try the cocktails

This place is awesome! The food was super delicious and the drinks were amazing. I had the lomo saltado and the salmon. It's only been open a week and I've been there twice already. I'll probably go again this weekend. This is just was forest hills needs! Check it out!

We went for lunch on July 4th, 2019. I had a chicken salad, and my wife had a catfish po boy.  I had better salads at chains like salad works or chop't.  My wife's po boy was better but it was still pretty average at best.  The food took at about 20-25 minutes and there were no complementary chips or something to eat during the wait.  I think they are still working on their lunch menu but I don't recommend going there for lunch.  The prices were more expensive than other forest hills restaurants.  Unfortunately, Mojo is consistent with FH restaurants where you don't get a lot of value for your buck.
They cook good taste good healthy and satisfying and the price is affordable too and reasonable I love the food there u can try it

The service is slow here. The staff is nice but it takes forever to get your food. The food is mediocre but decently presented. We ordered a cuban sandwich and the pulled pork. The cuban sandwich was delicious while the pulled pork could have used some sort of sauce to liven it up. I will probably not be returning. 3 stars for efforr

Came here several times.. Service is wonderful & everyone is very attentive. Come sit down for dinner... Latin fusion? Delicious! Or have a seat at the bar for Margaritas (frozen or on the rocks) or one of their specialty drinks which btw, are perfection!
Love this place! My Thursday hang out with my favorite people!! Myy favorite bartender is that Dominican dude Jordan! Serves the best cocktails.. best service ever!

I went Mojo for Sunday brunch. Portions are not big but good enough. Brunch won't come with any drinks. No HH for weekends. Mojitos($11 or+1 for flavors)were very light. Probably I won't order again. Tasty food with good service. I love the atmosphere with Latino music. Music are not too loud it's perfect. Not sure how it's like at night but definitely good options for brunch spot.

Four stars only because we only had appetizers. With that being said, the ambiance was absolutely gorgeous, very chic and modern. We ordered the beef skewers and the chicken taquitos, both were delicious, especially the skewers! We did look at the entrees and everything looked amazing. Definitely excited to go back and try the full menu. Overall, a great addition to forest hills!
First time at Mojo!  Food and cocktails are excellent.  Our waitress, Kelly was very friendly and knows the menu very well.  Looking forward to visit again.

I'm torn because this place has a lot of potential. I gave it three stars because most of the food was worth 3.5-4 stars but they gave 2 star service. Not sure if it was because they were understaffed but they seemed to have a decent amount of Bus people to clear the tables and bring water but it took us a little over 45 minutes to get our food. Met up with some family so we tried to patiently wait but after looking around a lot of people next to us we're saying the same thing trying To eye down their waiter to ask them what's going on, as they too we're waiting a long time for their food. The waiters, and servers did not appear to be on the same page because after the 45 minutes the waiter came up to us and asked if we were ready for dessert. When we told him our food hadn't come to his credit he ran to the kitchen to find out what went wrong. He brought up me and my girlfriends order but it seemed he forgot about My cousin and her husbands order (or got distracted with someone/something else in the time it took him to go back to the kitchen a second time) because we waited another ten minutes and we had to flag him down again to ask him where their food was. He ran back again and came back in ten min. When all of the food arrived my girlfriend's Salmon was undercooked but we no longer had the patience to ask them to recook it. The "Down the Hatch" ceviche was amazing and I ordered the Pernil which was a little dry but otherwise well presented and tasty. The ambiance of this place is great, the drinks are tasty and it has a lot of potential. I'd be open to trying it again but I really hope the service improves. The previous venue this was "Exo Cafe" had similar issues. Good food but service was not that good. Not sure if it's the dynamics of being a two floor venue but I really hope they improve this as I would really like to like this place.
Nice atmosphere with Latin music in the background. Chicken mojo was tender and had a nice mild cheese sauce served with rice and beans. The guacamole was fantastic. Will definitely be back here!!

I think this is more a 4.5 star place but rounded up. I really liked the decor and the prices are much better than other places in the area. Staff was attentive and the food came out so fast.We got the Wagyu burger and the Cuban and they were both so good! We inhaled the food and think the burger is the best in the area. We would definitely return. There is a .5 because the water tasted weird and had no ice. I also wish they had a non-alcoholic menu as I wasn't feeling mimosas today but wanted something fruity.

We came here today for lunch. The menu was really sad, 3 types of salads, 3 types of sandwiches, main entrees are mixed with brunch menus. So we ordered chips and guacamole. Chips are mixed with banana chips which taste stale and the guac is doused with lemon. We could barely taste the guac. I had steak sandwich and house salad. Again, whoever prepare the food had a heavy hand on lemon. Salad had too much lemon and may have been used as dressing. The steak in the sandwich was so thin and they put so much caramelized onion which made it harder to taste the steak. We had pineapple juice that we had to return because it was watery and full of ice. The virgin mojito was so tarty, too much lemon...again. Service was excellent, music was jamming which made the stay better, hence the 3 stars. Should have went to Cabana.
Delicious drinks, friendly staff and the arroz con pollo was absolutely delicious. Will definitely be returning!!

Came here on a Saturday night after hearing so much about the place and it was great, food was good and the drinks were good too I had the froze. My wife had the frozen sangria and she liked hers as well. The decor was nice and warm. LittleBut of a wait time but our server kept coming by making sure we were ok while we waited. Definitely a good new date spot for forest hills I was be back!

great place to go out with friends, family, or a date night.  very nice atmosphere. good music. great service. great drinks. great food.  great price point.  i would recommend this place to anyone i know. you  wont be disappointed.
The food was amazing i was very impressed with the presentation and the service was excellent definitely recommend the chicken mojo was off the hook give this place 5 stars. Definitely coming back !

Came here for brunch and the ambiance and music was great and food was delicious and the service was on point! The drinks were a little too strong ( to the point where it kinda ruined the flavor) but our waiter was super cool and accommodating. Will def be returning for a date night or come with the girls for dinner. :)

I went to dinner on a Sunday evening and I have nothing but good things to say about this place The staff was very nice and attentive. The food was very good from appetizer to all the way to dessert I was pleasantly satisfied. It was so good I'm going back next Saturday lol

I was excited about my first Mojo experience. I was very disappointed. Although the staff was very friendly and helpful the drinks and the food left a lot to be desired.  The Caipirinha that I ordered tasted all sorts of wrong. I ordered the lomo and more mand it was ridiculously salty and kind of cold.

Small portions for a lot of money. The Jumpin' Lomo I ordered had only 3 tiny pieces of beef. That's no bueno. Learned my lesson here and I won't be coming back. Plenty of Peruvian Restaurants that are not cheap with their portions.

3.5 stars. Service was very kind. Food was good. We had Spanish kabobs (diced skirt steak on a stick with three yuca fries)  and chicken mojo. I also ordered a cocktail which was well made. The food was good but nothing amazing. I felt like it was on the level of my home cooking which I love ..but Let's be real.. you don't want to go out for dinner and pay a nice price for food that is on par with what you can make at home. That being said all of the meat was tender/juicy and the dishes had good flavor.

I usually frequent Austin street on the weekends. To my knowledge this is the only Latin-fusion restaurant/bar on Austin street. Everyone in Mojo from the owner to the hostess is very polite and friendly. The bartenders know their stuff. Even when my friends and I went on a Friday night the service was impeccable. Camila and Stephanie were behind the bar and they made fantastic drinks despite the large crowd ordering drinks at the bar. They mentioned that their garnishes are fresh and all syrups used for cocktails are made in house. Going based off the taste I'd say it's true. Frozen margaritas and mojitos are great! I ordered the guac and chips, ceviche, and arroz con pollo. At first I did think the food was a little expensive, but the quality was amazing and well worth it. During my meal the manager, Mohammed, approached me to ask how everything was and we ended up conversing for a few minutes. I can't remember the last time a manager/owner approached me on a busy night to make sure my friends and I were enjoying ourselves. Overall I had a great time here. Drinks were perfect, food was delicious, service was impeccable, and the staff were extremely polite. Forest Hills definitely needed a Latin-fusion restaurant and I believe Mojo will be very successful. Highly recommend!!!
MOJO, was the Best experience ever! The margaritas are one of the best I've had, not only the food was amazing but the staff were very welcoming!  Great ambiance over all

I came here last week and had a very nice and delicious brunch with my husband and baby. Just now at 11:14am I figure I would return for some mangu and a cold beer since my daughter finally fell asleep. The moment I walked in a gentleman that worked there mumbled something unpleasant, rolled his eyes and pointed to a table in annoyance. Guess I was too early. I felt extremely uncomfortable and unwelcome. I told him never mind and he kept it moving without a care. Me and my Husband live in the Austin area and look forward to brunch every weekend. All it takes is one negative experience to never return somewhere, and at that I was with my child. Back to Jack & Nellies where I can show up a minute early and still receive a warm welcome!

I went there for lunch with my family we tried a little bit from every category . The place is new and clean inside and will be a solid place for many years the food was good but my coffee was cold and service could have been better . For better eating I would go to my usual mom and pop places but I took my wife and daughter today .

I've been very excited to try the new restaurant ever since it opened. I heard nothing but good things from my friends and tonight we decided to pop in and try it out. The appetizers were great unfortunately I didn't like my fried rice. Which was the least of my problem. Our server Samantha b. was very rude. My friend waited 15 mins to order her second drink because the waitress would walk right past us until we raised our hand. She checked on us once when we got our entrees and I hadn't tried my food yet then when I tried mine and tried to let her know I didn't like it she didn't come back. When I finally got her attention to tell her, everyone was already done with their food and I told her I don't want anything else and with attitude she told me that I should've told her earlier and when I don't like something I should say it as soon as it comes out. I proceeded to tell her I tried to but never got her attention and she just walked away. I work in this industry and I just feel like there could've been a better approach to this situation.
This restaurant is spectacular. The service is on point, the staff are very nice and the food is awesome. The restaurant has a really nice vibe and it's just overall a really excellent place to eat

Hands down, THIS is the new FLAVOR of Queens.  Ceviche with drinks, something special. Hospitality is on point.  Drinks came fast with the food. App: Ceviche  Dinner: Arroz Con Pollo- taste like my grand mother is back there cooking. Get a chance, this is defiantly a place to enjoy a date night, or just hang with the fellas!!!! Great addition to Forest Hills. Make sure you make it because if not, YOU WILL BE HEARING ABOUT IT!! So let you be the trend setter, and be the one to tell your friends.  Blessings on your success Mojo. You got y support 100.

Tonight was my first time at this venue. What stood out to me most was the OUTSTANDING service! My waiter Eli informed me of his name, asked if I had any allergies, did I have a favorite food, so attentive to my needs. Shortly thereafter, Matthew, came over to ask if our food met our satisfaction. The ambiance was welcoming. Eli came over to refill our cocktails and suggested something new, adding the perfect compliment to our entrees. The icing on the cake was having our bartender Vanessa check if those drinks were mixed to perfection. What wonderful service at this place. Would suggest for ladies night or a first date. The music keeps you entertained and subtle enough to engage in conversation.

If you're looking for delicious food, fantastic drinks,  great service and a lively atmosphere... go to Mojo. Guacamole, chips, plantains and toasted corn  is a must.  Quinoa salad was so delicious and the fried seafood app is outstanding! As far as the entrees are concerned, the Lomo is a favorite as well as the Mojo Chicken.  But before all that, make sure you get a frozen drink. You won't regret it. I also had a margarita on the rocks and it was delicious. Just the right amount of tequila to mix ratio. A lot of places make it to heavy on the mix. Eli was an outstanding server. Friendly, funny and very attentive. Overall, this is a great place to go and the food will not disappoint.
Amazing food, amazing margaritas, friendly waitress . The corn is fire. Will go again for sure.

The customer service is amazing and everything that I have ordered was very tasty. I usually get churrasco and it's amazing . Only thing would be I like my steak medium and when you say medium they will make it well done. So I usually say rare and comes out perfect. And the decor is beautiful definitely sets a great mood.
Nice new spot on Austin, much opportunity to improve on customer service.  Food is very good and drinks are as well.
Awesome chimi sliders. I like frozen margarita too. Good vibes too! A much needed ambiance in the neighborhood. I'll def come back!
The food is amazing will definitely go back but the drinks are slightly too expensive

Quality, friendly service, and DELICIOUS food! The marinades and sauces were so satiable, I was tempted to lick the plate. Beautiful presentation. Positive vibe with music and ambiance. I'm a connoisseur of the Queens restaurant scene and I am truly impressed. Highly recommend and will DEFINITELY be back. Bonus, cocktails are beautiful, tasty and priced right!

I've been to MoJo twice since they recently opened. SO good! Food, drinks and vibe! I'm so happy they opened on Austin Street. I Took a vegan friend the second time and she had the vegan paella and it was fantastic as well. Whether you're in the neighborhood or not, MoJo is definitely worth taking the ride for. Exceptional!

Great ambience, amazing staff, and brunch everyday till 3:30pm . Great Happy hour till 7pm!  The Chilaquiles verdes and Pernil is to die for. Latin fusion at its best !! Finally a place I can bring my whole family for Brunch!!

Great food, great drinks. The frozen drinks highly recommended. The Cerviche down the Hatch 1 of the best I've tasted and the corn side is something thats so tasty I've had it 3 times already. Definitely a place to go visit on a date or with family. So happy this spot has opened in FOHI

Came here on a Saturday night food and drinks where amazing. The decor was beautiful , our server Eli was so energetic and full of life. Hospitality was great !!!! Thank you Mojo for the amazing service will definitely be coming back

I am basing this on the delivery and not the food. Because i never actually got the food. I love cuban food. I was SO happy to try this restaurant. I ordered a salad that sounded amazing. I get a text that my salad is going to be 45 min later than anticipated. The 45 min goes by. Still nothing. i call the restaurant. My salad had been sitting there for 30 minutes and the delivery guy never showed up. She asked if i wanted to wait for him and i said no, cancel my order. Why would i want to wait for someone who they don't know is even going to show up or not? And why would they think its okay to send him with a salad that has been sitting out for 30 min? Plus i have to get Seamless to refund me which they haven't yet (this was 2 weeks ago) instead of the restaurant. The thing I'm most upset about is the restaurant did not call me to let me know what was going on waiting 90 min for my delivery and still not getting it. Just the text to say it was going to be late. And i used the first time delivery coupon they offered on food i never received. Nothing but pure aggravation. Thanks Mojo!
The food was amazing prompt service ,drinks are A1 my girlfriend and I were very pleased, deff will come back

This place is nice all around. Friendly and professional staff. Great experience. Nice place for happy hour and plenty of TV's for sports. Music was good and not to loud not low. The bartender was amazing all her suggestions were on the money. Nice to have a bartender that knows what they have and what to suggest. Just finished my dinner here and it was great  I had the pernil and it was to die for. My buddy had the arroz con pollo and it was delicious as well. My frozen sangria was tasty btw first time I see that on a drink menu. Thank you Desiree for your exceptional service and suggestions. I will be back and highly recommend MOJO.!!!! Vibes and ambiance thumbs up.

The waygu sliders are not sliders. They are plantains with a mini dry piece of meat. Also the skirt steak skewers were not cooked well. Guac and chips were stale. And sangria was not tasty. Never coming back

We're do I start off, let see poor menu choices . I mean I  have never rated  any restaurant before . But I am sorry this place needs to be rated . Terrible meal portion . When we left after spending 1k we ended up going home and ordering domino pizza . Cause we were all starling . So if you like to go to a restaurant to get ripped off, and not get any food , this is the place to go . Menu is super cheap just like their portion in food . Food was terrible . If anyone wants to go eat Spanish food I would not recommend-this place at all .

Staff was super friendly, sat quickly on a Friday night, we had the steak skewers as an appetizer with yuca fries, it was delicious but definitely a very small portion even for one person... ordered Mojitos which were not great they had an after taste of vanilla not your typical mojito, ordered two entrees the skirt steak and the Blood orange Salmon again delicious but very small portions. In total dinner for two ran us around 120 dollars and left us hungry for more... I understand the place is new but Cabana is right around the corner where the drinks are amazing and the portions are huge for what you are paying... this place has a nicer atmosphere as far and music and the venue itself, I'd say improve on portion size for what you are paying and revamp the drink menu because nothing on it mad it even appealing to try. Maybe I'll give it a try later on when they have more time open.

4 stars because the food was really good and creative. Lomo was amazing and so were Chimi sliders. Decor is cute. The churros were kind of stale though and the sangria is not really worth it. It is mostly ice, super sweet, and 3/4 of a pitcher didn't even have me buzzed. In addition, our waitress was not really attentive or friendly at all. Would go back because it is a cool place, just in need of some improvements.

What a wonderful atmosphere. We just departed the restaurant and I am very happy with the service we received. At times I can be difficult to please however, everything was perfect. I tried Garlic Rice for the first time and that alone has guaranteed my return. The food portions are more than enough and the margaritas were delicious. We also tried the Mango Tango dessert which also was delicious. CABANA, move over I have found a new spot
The drinks are great. Not a place for authentic Latin food. Food is more on burnt side.

C'mon, who is writing these reviews. This place is a joke. It took 10 minutes for a waitress to even ask if we wanted drinks. We were finishing our appetizers by the time our drink came out. Simultaneously with our entrees. I don't know which was worse the service or the food. Bland, overly saucy, stale plantain chips. Chipotle is better. 1 bartender on a Saturday night?!? (On Labor Day weekend). Too bad, it was the only decent thing. Would have ordered another had the service been decent.

The restaurant itself is very nice but this place need a LOT of work. We got to the table (3 people), table set for 2 + 1 appetizer plate, waitress brought 1 extra glass no utensils. We finally asked for utensils and napkins. Waitress looked lost and didn't have a clue about the menu. Now food, appetizers we had camaron toast(tasty but cold), wagyu chimi sliders (very good) and Spanish kebabs ( kebab itself good but cold, yuka was soaked in oil, nasty). Main course we had jumpin lomo (SALLLLLLLTTTTTYYYY AND COLD but tasty) salmon ( SALTY but good) macho Marino (SALTY but still tasty). SALLLLLTTTYYY and not warm enough was the consensus (and my sister likes salt and it was salty for her) Can't judge dessert because we never got it since the service sucked. It took 45 min to get main course after we finished eating appetizers, and another 20 for the waitress to show up after we finished the main course and she didn't even offer the dessert menu ! So we said forget the dessert since we were already sitting there for 2.5 hours ( got there 8:45 left 11:30!) and weren't even offered one so we just asked for a check. Now it got me really mad because when I made the reservation I clearly stated that it is a birthday celebration. And to top it all off, I barely check my bill but good thing I did here, we got a 2 pitchers of sangria which on the menu was $30 but we got charged $32, now it's not about the $4 because if I can afford to go to dinner I can pay $4 but about trying to cheat your customers !  I personally would not go back !

This place is over priced. Small portions and I don't like that they didn't change anything about the place. Same set up as the restaurant before. The apps are good but their main courses weren't great. They are trying to be too fancy. Wouldn't go back
Food is bland and certainly not cooked by a Michelin chef. The service was also not great for my wife and our toddler.

Only OK!! The new design and good music draws people in but Im definitely not coming back to this place. Food is only OK. Mojitos are only OK. Our waiter was not too attentive but nice. I saw a waiter drop the birthday candle (you know, the one that shoots out the sparks). Dangerous. Seriously, walk down the street to Cabana! Anyone saying that food and drinks are the best here, has not been to Cabana.

Came here for my birthday on a Monday night. I'd seen a lot of posts on ig and figured let's check it out.  I had the chicken mojo and coconut mojito and was not disappointed! Amazing food and service ! Will definitely be returning !
Four of us had a mediocre meal at this fairly new restaurant. The cost seemed to high for entrees that were mainly consisting of rice. No recommendation for this place

I had lunch with a couple of friends at Mojo.  The atmosphere in the restaurant is welcoming, and all the food was tasty.  I especially liked the churros that I ordered for dessert.  A great new addition to the neighborhood!

I worked at the gym across the street and this is my favorite eatery in the neighborhood. I seriously love this place. I waited for months for it to open and it did not disappoint. I used to go to the other Cuban spot years ago but it doesnt have the same pop that it used to so I'm happy there's another option. Also, I'm a mojito-phile and their's is well made. It's about $10 for the classics and $11/12 for flavored. They have other drinks but I haven't tried them. My assumption is that they are just as good. There are happy hour deals that bring the cost down to about $7. The food is also good, especially the Chicken Mojo. Price is about $22. A bit much for grilled chicken and rice (double compared to a local Dominican/Cuban spot) but you are paying to dine out in Forest Hills. The vibe is sexy Miami-esqe: Dark wood, dim lighting, modern decor, some palm trees. And the staff is great Stephanie, Matthew, Jordan, Jonathan always are welcoming and accomodating. The implemented a Mo Lunch/Mo Brunch menu a few months ago, which I believe id everyday maybe 12-5p. It's a limited version of their regular menu and cheaper. The brunch items are pretty good and its an overall truly Latin fusion menu (Vegan ceviche, Chicharron Buns) They also have update website and active social media so always check those out for special events
I love the ambiance and my meal was delicious. I had "Jumpin' Lomo". I would definitely recommend.

I never write reviews but felt compelled to do so for Mojo. The food is phenomenal and the service was prompt. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. I've lived in Forest Hills for 24 years and have tried almost every restaurant in the area and in my opinion, not one comes close to the experience I had at Mojo. I wish them continued success and hope they stay in the neighborhood. Amazing!

After seeing a few bad reviews I was a little skeptical to try the food but when I went myself it was the best Latin food I've had in forest hills. The ceviche is amazing!!!!! And the frozé is my favorite drink. Will most definitely be my spot to go this summer!
Appetizers and drinks were amazing! Dan the man thanks for changing the music!!!! Try the IPA signature drink, the chicharrón sliders, and the camarón toast. It was amazing!

This new place on Austin is much needed for the area. Booked a reservation online to avoid the Friday wait. We ordered 3 appetizers, the chicken taquitos, pork belly buns, and wagyu sliders. I personally liked the pork belly buns the most, with it's crispy texture but all 3 were pretty outstanding. Prices are good for the value and we left content and full. I'd definitely return soon to try their entrees.
Dann the man !  thanks for changing the music  chicharron sliders and drinks were awesome ! The IPA mojo is sooooo good ! Try el chamuco too !

This newly opened restaurant, formerly Exo Cafe, offers a great selection of Latin cuisine and is definitely worth trying. We started with the kebab and yuca appetizers (heaven on a stick ), followed by the ceviche, chips, and guacamole, all were quite tasty, but my favorite was the kebabs.  I really enjoyed their signature dish, the Mojo chicken that comes with white rice, asparagus, and black beans. I like that the portions are reasonably sized as well. The decor is so beautiful and elegant. Even the restrooms are impressive looking. The service was great, I was very pleased to see a few familiar former Exo Cafe members working there. That is what lured me into the place in the first place. Damian and Tony both made the visit very warm and pleasant. I'm also excited to hear that Mojo will soon offer a weekend brunch special- I'm looking forward to it!!
This is probably my new favorite place in forest hills ! Pete always gets it right ! Attention to detail amazing food and even better drinks ! Great vibes and good times !!
Awesome food , I thought the food was amazing. Very nice new addition to Forest Hills. Will be back for sure.

Incredible atmosphere, service, and food. Bartenders are amazing!!!  If you get Eli as your server, count yourself as lucky. Mojo is a great addition to the neighborhood. Will go back time and time again.

This was my first visit to the new restaurant, Mojo. Mojo is located in the old Exo Restaurant on Austin Street in Forest Hills. My wife ordered Arroz Con Pollo. The Arroz Con Pollo came with Cilantro Beer Garlic Rice with a butterflied thigh along with a Maduro & a tostones. My wife enjoyed the taste of her entree. I had the entree Macho Marino. The entree included shrimp, squid, bay scallops and yuca fries in a sofrito sauce. White rice accompanied the Macho Marino dish. My dish was very tasty!!! My only complaints were at the beginning and end of my meal. Once we were seated, it took over 5 minutes for a server to come back to our table. After receiving our check from our server, it took another 5+ minutes for the server to return to pick up the bill. Food was good; service was less than stellar.

Great addition to the neighborhood..amazing food and great staff.. especially the bartender Jessica very friendly and attentive .the drinks are also really good! Try the froze. I am not disappointed at all!!

Almost everything about Mojo is awesome!! The first few times I visited Mojo, I was seated in the dining area so I didn't have a view of how my drink was being made. The last time I visited I sat near the bar. The service and food have always been great! BUT there was a hygiene issue with the bartender. Although she was wearing gloves, she used those very same gloves to clean the counter, make drinks (touching the fruits that go into the drinks), fluff her hair repeatedly and handle everyone's money. She did not change or remove those gloves for the entire time that I was there and I was there for at least two hours and who knows how long she'd been wearing those gloves to begin with. None of the staff seemed to notice or correct this issue. Maybe an orientation on cleanliness is in order for the entire Mojo staff. Why bother wearing the gloves in the first place if you're going to use them to touch everything? This is an issue that can be easily resolved, hopefully they do.

Mojo offers a sultry, luscious Latin experience!  With great cocktails and dishes influenced by Latin cuisine from Peru, Mexico, Dominican Republic, Puerto Rico, and beyond, we loved the fresh and flavorful ingredients and fun atmosphere.
Still thinking of my dinner a week later! Delicious food. Highly recommend for a great date or dinner with friends. Beautiful atmosphere, great drinks and the food is really to die for.
Food was amazing the staff was great drinks on point ! Great place def recommend this pace for any occasion !!

Went to Mojo for dinner before a show at the Forest Hills Tennis Stadium.  The pitcher of red sangria we ordered tasted like watered-down strawberry juice with no discernible alcohol content.  We ordered the guacamole and chips.  The portion of guacamole, literally, was about 2 tablespoons  - barely enough for one person - a rip off at $9.  The plantain and tortilla chips were stale and soggy and were accompanied by some sort of roasted corn that was like trying to eat unpopped popcorn kernels.  The $26 Macho Marino contained what looked and tasted like two Mrs. Paul's Fish Sticks, a couple of small shrimp and a couple of calamari rings in a bland, watery, creamy red sauce.  The $19 Arroz Con Pollo was decent but, again, the portion was small.  As to service, no one came over after our food was served to ask if everything came out okay.  In fact, we were pretty much ignored until we had finished our meals and asked for the check.  Very disappointing and we will not return.

As you can see I never have left a review before. When we were leaving we were asked to review the restaurant. So here it goes. My wife and I  wanted to go see what all the hype was about. I can see the potential in this restaurant. But they need a lot of work. The wait was about 20 minutes to get a table. And then another 10 minutes to get the menu, Then another 20 minutes to see the waitress. We had been in the restaurant for at least an hour before we got any type of drinks or food. At least give us some chips while we wait. We ordered a frozen margarita that wasn't frozen at all and very weak in alcohol. We ordered the sliders and pork belly as appetizers. Maybe the waitress forgot about our food because it was cold. So cold the oil started to stick together on the bottom of the plate. The pork belly buns were hard that I got stabbed in the gums. They have a very limited selection on the menu. So you would figure that the food would be excellent.  First off what is it with cold food? both of our dishes were cold  I ordered Jumpin lomo and my wife had the arroz con pollo. I have never tasted food so salty. The jumpin lomo came with rice that wasn't even cooked and the beef was chewy and salty. Arroz con pollo was a joke. Let's be real and say its rice with chicken. That is no arroz con pollo I ever had.  For the price of the food, you would expect a nice portion. My wife was given one piece of chicken thigh on top of a large serving of uncooked rice. The jumpin lomo had lots of rice and fries but very little meat. The service was very mediocre. Why are the girls half naked? It really is a Spanish hooters and the girls behind the bar are not attentive if you are not drooling over them. We wasted about $200 for food and service that was not $200 worth. Like I said before it has potential. The food had flavor but the execution sucked and the service sucked. Once they fix the cold food, food portion, and the service they can excel in forest hills.

Since my initial visit this place has become a decent go to place for some Thai food in Queens. Drinks I tend to always go with the White or Red Lychee sangria, both very good. Appetizers a new favorite are the Curry puffs not sure why I didn't try before they are so good, great with the dipping sauce. Good Dumplings, Crab wonton's , Calamari & Wings can't go wrong with either choice.  Main dishes the Spare ribs were delicious great tasting thai style chili sauce the dish comes with veggies, not bad good with the sauce. Basil fried rice has always been a good choice so has the Pad Thai. The Guay Tiew Pad Sei Eiw is a good dish , flat noodles with your choice of meat, great with beef good with chicken as well. Yellow curry chicken is pretty decent , a lot of sauce with this dish best with the white rice. I was very glad these guys were open during Quarantine, we placed an order through yelp & were able to set up a pick up time, once we arrived food was ready , nice & easy process. Service during dinning is good, quick but you don't feel rushed , prices are great here & very reasonable. This place has become a good go to spot for Thai food, I decided to up the stars because so far never been here & had a bad meal, this place is certainly worth the try I will for sure keep stopping by from time to time.
I just loveeee the Thai chai lattes here! The food is good too. Always prompt service as i usually pick up from here.
Good food, never disappoints, friendly staff, delivery always on time, overall excellent food.

They're still open for pick up and delivery at this time. Weve been to some fast food/quick casual type restaurants a few times since there weren't many options in our area so I was happy to see this place was open. L is an essential worker so he gets fed every day at work by Sweetgreen and other catering spots but what we're really missing is some good hot food!! I've always had Kitchen 79 on my list but with all these restaurants available before I never got around to this place. I tried Khao Soi which seemed to be be one of their more popular dishes that not every Thai place has on their menu. For $12 it's actually a good portion. This curry noodle soup comes with soft and crispy noodles,  normally with a chicken leg but here you get it with a generous amount of sliced chicken breast which L loved. There's some pickled veggies which added more texture and tasted pretty good. Everything is packaged nicely so the noodles weren't soggy. I love green curry and normally order it from every Thai place but Kitchen 79 has a slightly different option. I got mine with Thai pasta with a good portion of chicken, bamboo shoots, green beans, peppers. It's $14 but it fed 2 individuals and it was reheated In a pot the next day. It was so good. Not crazy spicy, so we were able to enjoy the curry and all the veggies were still crispy and fresh even though it was sitting in the curry sauce overnight. Great food.

What a tasteful place! I am amazed!Everything was full of outstanding flavors.There were a few appetizers and a main course and I liked all of them. Rolls stuffed with bean sprouts, cucumbers and egg, topped with a delicious sauce were amazing! Dumplings with chicken and pastries with curry chicken were also expertly prepared. For main course I had brown rice with onion, basil and cucumbers.It won't surprise you if I tell they have  a vast number of vegan options.But this Thai restaurant is good not only for dining, but offers a great variety of the beverage. Beer, cocktails, wine cart, everything is super miscellaneous. There is something for your liking among the diversity of non-alcoholic spirits as well. Me personally was surprised with their huge portion of good iced coffee. The interior is stylish and the service hasn't disappointed.Will definitely explore the rest of the menu

Omg! How have I not tried this place. Now I onlyOrdered one dish but the flavors, the presentation and the prompt service. I ordered the Gang Phed Phed Yaang the duck was crispy but so juicy and the curry sauce is delicious - aromatic and the perfect type of spicy. The veggies were crisp and steamed and their brown rice (notPictured here) was perfectly cooked. I will definitely be ordering again !

One of the best beer menus in New York. Really great bar food as well. Service is wonderful and attentive even when the place is packed. The chicken pot pie wasn't great, more of a soup based on that dish, but the chicken sliders were amazing as were the nachos. Great vegetarian and vegan options. I had the plant based "meatloaf" with sprouts and potatoes. The sauce on the meatloaf was delicious. Savory with a slight kick. They always have a great rotating selection of good beers.Had a great time coming here with a couple of friends - vibe is laid-back with a lot of great drink options available. We did not have food, but have heard good things and would definitely into dining her in the future. Good for bigger groups as well.All in all a nice place to sit down with friends for good food and good drinks. One of the best things about the place, in my opinion is the fact that the music there is not too loud as to prevent conversationExcellent beer selection, fantastic space, and great happy hour specials, if a bit too noisy during peak times.

Last week I ordered food from this restaurant I was so disappointed, pad Thai was horrible!! I have eaten here before but food to go, it's BAD. Please don't order from here at least until the go back to regular seating.

I'm late to the party with this one. Standing at 4.5 stars with over 580 reviews, Kitchen 79 deserved my attention. Kitchen 79 does have the small, cozy restaurant feel to it. I prefer the full ethnic decorative style, so I must say I was a little underwhelmed by the interior design choices. The food and presentation, however knocked it out the park. Starters included the fried calamari, in addition the Ya Ma Mong, which is basically the mango salad with shrimp. For the main course, I ended up with the monster sized Pla nung manow (steamed fish with spicy lime sauce) with a side of sticky rice and she the curry chicken with white rice. We couldn't be happier with the dinner choices, as everything was fantastic. I must critique the service, the waiter was a little lento considering it is such a small place. For those in the Jackson Heights area, you have a neighborhood gem that impresses with great tasting food and presentation schematics.
