The service, at least for my experience, was not on par with the likes of Kin'd in Fresh Meadows, nevertheless the reviews are justified.

Great Food, Weird AmbianceGreat food. Great service...but the ambiance was weird. I'm not super religious or anything but still kind of weird when they have pagan statues...kind of puts the entire dining experience into another perspective. So I'll just say this..if this doesn't bother you at all, this is def worth the trip. Solid food and solid service.

Awful awful awful!! I hate it when I am looking forward to a great time and totally excited for a place but they literally ruin my experience!!! After reading fellow yelper reviews, I had high expectations for this place. Probably my bad luck also I'm a highly picky eater. I love the decor very elegant and romantic. The whole plan was to have dinner and a surprise my friend at the end with a birthday wishes from the restaurant crew. We were seated immediately by the manager as the place wasn't busy at all. We ordered fried chicken dumplings and veggie dumplings for appetizer. For entree we chose: Pad Thai with tofu and sautéed chicken with string beans. My friend liked his fried chicken dumplings and for the price paid the quantity was good as well. I was highly disappointed for the veggie dumplings as they looked nothing like what I expected so I had to return it back to the kitchen. Therefore no appetizer for me sadly!! Pad Thai was ok nothing exceptional as I had better and portion size can be improved. Sautéed Chicken w/ string beans and side of rice was absolutely ridiculous in regards to taste and quantity!! We have asked for medium spicy and even inquired with the host how spicy is it. But my friend was barely able to eat it as it was really spicy and requested it to be re-made. Now this is where the complete bs starts....the host comes back with little bit of chicken, asked us to taste it. We did and it was fine in regards to the spice level. The host takes the plate back again and comes back with little bit of chicken and more than half the plate full of string beans!!! I even asked the host is this it?? He's like yes this is your food. This is all you get!! Utter bs, so you are charging me for less than half the food that was on the plate the first time? One of the major issues was lack of communication as our host wasn't very fluent in English. I am not even sure if he understood what I have said when I placed the order. The manager was aware of the situation but she didn't come attend my table until I requested for her!! That's what you call poor customer service. If you are aware of what is happening then attend your customer and resolve it. She knew there's communication conflict between the host and me. Not a place for me!!

This place is a gem! It's spacious and the decor is very modern chic.My partner and I came with high expectations, and they were met.The flavors were so bold, but not overbearing. Everything was cooked just right.Everything was simply delicious- nothing was left behind!The service was great. No complaints.The only possible downside is that this location is very close to a train. Every time one passes by, you slightly hear/feel it. Nothing too crazy.Can't wait to come back!

I was excited to go out for dinner in Jackson Heights, as I know it has a reputation of being very diverse and full of great restaurants. Upon looking at Kitchen 79, I was excited to eat there because of its quiet and quaint appearance, just off the main road. There weren't many other people eating there, so my friend and I had  our choice of seating. Their menu is very extensive, so you will definitely find something that suits your appetite. The service was very quick and everything we ordered was delicious. Plus, they serve huge portions, so come hungry! They have good Thai iced tea, and plenty of vegetarian options, or dishes they can easily make with your choice of meat or tofu. It was such a cozy environment, my  friend and I stayed for over 2 hours just eating and catching up! The server was very patient and didn't rush us. 10/10 would recommend!

TLDR; Good food, different proteins have different tenderness (aka texture), service good but hasty to take away silverware. I arrived around 7:30 at night on Christmas Eve and there was no wait for a table. We were sat down right away and we noticed how clean and well decorated the restaurant is. There aren't a lot of tables but the other people that came after us did not have to wait. We order beef satay and thought the beef was on the chewier end. The satay sauce was not what we expected (we've been to a number of Thai places in different regions before). The app was all right but I wouldn't order it again.  While we were waiting for our entrees, the waitress took away our silverware despite not being done eating the appetizer. I'm guessing this was in preparation for the entree but we were dipping the satay beef into the sauce while they were doing this, so I found this rather weird. We ordered a plate of pad see ew with pork and a bowl of Khao soi, replacing the chicken for fried tofu. The pad see ew tasted good, saltier than we are used to and less sweet tasting. The khao soi was delicious and a reasonable level of spice. While the bowl didn't look like much, there were a lot of noodles and add-ins inside. I was pleasantly surprised by the pickled veggies inside. I ended up not being able to finish and had to get it packed to go (still tasted great the next day!). It wasn't a super long wait after but no one checked in with us after we got our dishes or after we were done eating. I had a bit of trouble flagging someone down to get the check, but after I did the process was smooth and they said bye and thanks to us on our way out.

Let's keep it real hereNice higher end Thai food place for Jackson Heights. Outside isn't impressive but the inside is pretty decked out. The food is pretty authentic, service is average, price isn't competitive, overall experience is still good. 2nd time eating there, will probably try other Thai places next time.

This is a neighborhood gem! Such a great find! Whenever I crave thai food, this is the only place jay comes to mind. I have been coming here for years since I came across this place.The service is amazing and the ambiance is lavish/cozy. My favorite starter is the Crab Rangoon. I literally order 3 for myself because they are just so damn good! My go to entree is either Massaman curry which consists of Indian inspired spices blended in chili paste with onion, potato, peanuts simmered in coconut milk or Guay Tiew Pad Kee Mau which is wok fried spicy flat noddles with egg, basil leaves & bell peppers. Both are absolutely delicious! Authentic flavors of this dish makes my tastebuds so happy

This restaurant certainly will be added to my Thai food list! Perfect flavoring, display of food, atmosphere, and the service was #1 as expected. Kitchen 79 certainly holds up to its reputation and I would recommend. I ate the sautéed duck which was obviously delicious as you can see from the pics ;P I also had their Thai beer and lychee mimosa ( PLEASE DRINK if you enjoy alcohol lol )The prices are also pretty affordable which I do enjoy.And the service is humble and they do not rush you. THANKS FOR FILLIN MY BELLY KITCHEN 79

They have a very decent lunch menu..and it's all week not just Monday thru Friday. The decor is very cool and sheik.  The food was very tasty and was on par with the many Thai restaurants in this area. This was not our first time here and their food is consistently yummy and service was always very friendly and attentive.

I've been here twice now - and the second time was because I forgotten I had gone here because the food was unremarkable during lunch my first visit. This time around I tried the som tum, pad Thai, red curry and basil eggplant stir fry. I think that the basil eggplant stir fry was the best dish we had on the table and it was the only one we finished. The rest was just average to subpar tasting Thai food that you can get anywhere else in the city. If it wasn't for the proximity of this restaurant to Elmhurst's mini Thai town I suppose that might be ok but I was disappointed and regretted not going to one of my favorite haunts there instead. My recommendation is skip this place and head to Elmhurst Av and eat over there instead.

Extremely underwhelming taste wise. I ordered through seamless and the food came in a short time, 1 star for that. Another star for edible food. There are tons of Thai choices nearby. I'd be hesitant to give this place another shot.

This place is a GREAT Thai place in the neighborhood! The decor is cute and the staff is friendly. The food really brings it home though. Everything is prepared very well. We started off with the papaya salad which is one of my favorites and what I judge Thai food on. Well, this may be the best papaya salad I've ever had! The flavor was great and not too fishy. I also had the wild boar curry which also had great flavor. Why they didn't get 5-stars: This needs a 4.5-star rating because they're near perfect. I ordered the wild boar dish because I wanted something a little different. The sauce was great but it overshadowed the boar a bit and the eggplant was a bit undercooked for my taste.

I've already been to a lot of the Thai restaurants in the area so thought I'd give this one a try. I tried:Tod mun goong (deep fried shrimp cakes): I prefer the non deep fried versions. There wasn't any Thai spices in this at all (usually for these cakes you get kaffir lime, red curry flavor...) so it was really just deep fried shrimp paste. Gauy tiew pad kee mau with crispy pork: this came out a bit cool (sitting in the kitchen a while?) and it was a mistake to order crispy pork because it tasted hard/stale and quite unpleasantMoo yang (grilled marinated pork with sticky rice): really nothing special and a tad too sweet. Kanom jeen numya phoo (crab curry with Thai pasta): this was the only good dish. We asked for spicy but it was not very spicy at all (lots of coconut milk). There were a lot of nice crab chunks and went well with the bean sprouts, Thai "pasta", basil, and pickled greens. Overall, there are much better Thai choices in the area. This one is just ok at most.

Omg the BEST lunch specials at any Thai restaurant EVER. Fantastic delivery service too!!! :)They give a much more diverse range of appetisers when you order their lunch specials, I'm talking about those crab cheese dumplings and curry puffs. The lunch specials in question, starting from only $7.95! I had put in an order of Pad See Eiw (chicken) with curry puff as the appetiser and basil fried rice with salad as the appetiser.The pad see eiw had a great texture to the noodles and there was ample amounts of chicken breast in there, however when it came to the sauce, it was lacking something and needed that extra umph. The curry puff that came with it was probably one of the best (if not THE best) I've had in my life, the pastry was so deliciously flaky and buttery while the filling was packed with curry wonder....the soft potato pieces combined with the buttery taste of the pastry? Omg they just put my inside the curry puff, it would be a happy death :D they also included a sweet, slightly tangy cucumber dipping sauce which I basically drank in one shot haha xDThe basil fried rice (with shrimp, only an extra $1) was better, the shrimp tasted super juicy and fresh, generous amounts of basil, good ratio of vegetables in there too. The spiciness wouldn't have you frantically grabbing for water but enough to let you know it's there. Overall the flavours were well balanced. The salad that came with it, was just your standard salad that you'd get at your average Thai restaurant but they packaged really prettily....kinda almost makes you not want to eat it so you don't ruin it haha :)The portions are on the smaller side but still worth every penny!!! I definitely look forward to dining there, from pictures I've seen from other diners, quite fanciful for a Thai restaurant and definitely for one in Jackson Heights. I don't know why it took me this long to discover it.....Go for a visit, you'll love it too ^^

According to my check ins I've been here 9 times- might be more! Noticing the food is changing. The Pad Thai is now overly sweet and more chewy. I had a whole fish here as well with a mango salad and I don't recall anything remarkable besides the fish's head. I am sad because this was my favorite Thai place in the area. P.S. They must be cleaning their dishes/utensils with bleach, but the smell for me on the cups is too much.
This was amazing !!!! There were two waiters and they gave good overall service. The food was seriously so good you must go here and the entree start off at 11$

Solid 4*! Nice flavors!  We got vegetable dumplings- great flavor and texture! Super flavorful noodles - Pad Woon Sen, but we found the pork to be too chewy (next time try vegetable). The veg curry was good but not really memorable flavor-wise. Although we wanted mango (didn't have) sticky rice, we enjoyed coconut ice cream with sticky rice (with exception for whipped cream which tasted commercial). Service was great, but sadly we were served a plate with a giant chip on it - not acceptable! Also, parking is pretty tough around it.

There are a lot of Thai food places around the area but I came to Kitchen 79 after reading the reviews from my fellow yelp friends. I went during lunch and took advantage of their lunch special. It was very affordable at $7.95 starting to less than $10 for other dishes in the lunch menu. I ordered a Thai iced tea and it was huge!!!! Literally the most I've ever got in a Thai restaurant ever!! I had the curry puff as my appetizer and a tofu pad Thai. The pad Thai was good, but it wasnt out of the world. It is worth it for your money though because they do give a lot. The curry puff was good, but I thought it wasn't as crunchy and crispy as I normally had. The servers were attentive. Parking wise- it's a bit easier if you go during the week around lunch. I heard at night it's tough to find a spot.

The crispy duck in red curry is out of this world. Really high end. We also had the rice noodles in green curry (with chicken). So satisfying. The presentation of the dishes is careful and attractive. I ordered warm sake to go with the meal and was pleasantly surprised that the combination worked well. Chic ambiance, nice for a date. Very friendly to children too though.There are several thai restaurants in the neighborhood but this one is definitely #1!

Worth the wait if it is crowded. Get a drink while you wait. The lychee sangria is refreshing. The service is outstanding here. The woman who took our order was awesome. She was very nice and helped us through our menu options. The coconut soups are delicious as well as the entrees. This time around, we ordered the crispy duck and steamed fish. The fish takes longer to make but it's worth waiting for. The food can get a bit spicy but the cooks can make it milder or even less spicy. Definitely check this place out in Jackson Heights.

Came in on a quiet Wednesday afternoon for the lunch special! Ordered beef pad see eiw as my entree and deep fried tofu as my app. The service was very friendly and accommodative. The tofu was crispy and fresh. The only reason why I took off a star was because my pad see eiw was DOUSED in sauce, which made it super salty - snug my lip a bit from the saltiness because I had a small cut. (You can kind of see the amount of sauce in the picture)I've had the same dish at multiple other Thai places, so I was a bit taken back by the sauce to noodle ratio- had to even check yelp, but maybe it was just this one time the chef prepared my dish. Beef was also over cooked so it felt like I was gnawing on rubber.Ambiance is a bit tooooo dark, considering it was also a very gloomy day out alreadyLychee juice was yummy and refreshing.Will be returning

Small hole in wall kind of place A hidden gem on 79 Rosevelt ave .. just look around u will find it .!!! Cool decor .. been a monthly regular for a while , I can Surely can  say this is my best go to or take to guest for Thai food. love the food & service & the whole setup is great of the place .

I decided to come here since I was in the mood for Thai food. The appeal of the restaurant looks like something you would find in Manhattan rather than Jackson Heights. When I first walked in, there were not many people in the restaurant. There was a large party of around 12 and a few other small groups. I decided to get a table. The decor is absolutely stunning. The floor tile pattern was also very appealing. It's a perfect place if you want to get together with your friends after not seeing them for some time or if you are going on a date since the volume of the atmosphere is somewhat quiet. I ordered the lunch special. This comes with an appetizer and an entree for the price of 7.95/8.95 (depending on the meat). I got the Shrimp Guay Tiew Pad Sei Eiw which is by far my favorite thing to get at Thai restaurants. It was a little saltier than most Thai places. There was probably more soy sauce than anything. It was your typical pad see ew. The appetizer was geoy nam which was chicken broth soup with minced chicken wonton. You get two wontons in this small bowl of chicken broth. I must say, the chicken wonton was very fresh, almost homemade which reminded me so much of my grandmother's home cooking. It is not your typical Chinese takeout kind of wonton soup. It was clear and fresh. LOVED the appetizer. The waiters here are very attentive and very quick. They are also very accommodating. The service was excellent. I would definitely come back for the fried calamari and curry.

Although I've been living in the Jackson heights area for a while, I'm surprised I never came to this Thai restaurant. It has some 'Michelin star' items so that's very promising although I didn't go for those dishes. I tried generic shrimp drunken noodles and my friend went for the glass noodle salad. These are basic dishes so I can't really say much about them. They taste as they should. The place was very quiet and not crowded for a weekday evening, which was good. The place is also conveniently located by the 7 train, so very easily accessible.

Saw all these great reviews of the place so thought I would take advantage of their lunch specials while I'm still in the area.Ordered for pick up and was told it would be ready in 15 minutes.Btw you can't redeem the check in offer for lychee mimosa's for pickup. It's a dine in perk only.So the curry puff was decent. It wasn't crunchy anymore but that's okay.The pad see ew with chicken was okay too. The star of the dish was honestly the flavor of the noodles. The chicken was on the dry side and the vegetables didn't taste that great. It was a good price for the portion size though.

Small restaurant that wasn't busy at all but they ought to be! The food here is delicious! They have so many authentic dishes that it was hard to figure out what to try but everything my party did get was super tasty. I would definitely recommend the steamed whole fish (very fresh and loved the herbs and sauce on it) and the pad thai (the best I have ever had). The gaeng tai pla curry was, no joke, every spicy. Our waiter had warned us so it definitely is not for everyone. It also has a fishier taste to it due to the mackerel. The icing on the cake is their cheap drinks! $5 for a lychee mimosa or sangira (white and red). They also currently have $3 beers all day long. I believe it usually is just one beer on draft. The area is inconvenient to get to by car because of the parking and congestion but I will be back for sure!

Dear BOH & Owner of Kitchen 79, ( I won't expose your name)I've been ordering kitchen 79 more times than I can count.  It was recommended to me by my neighbor and I thought the food was delicious. So delicious, I kept ordering even when I found legit reasons not to. For example, that looong hair piece i found on my singapore noodles back in April. Or, how about that plastic piece I found in my lunch todaY? Or how about the countless inconvenient times we "returned" the delivered food upon their "request" as proof there was really an issue? Sounds like ya'll have some trust issues...  Upon calling the restaurant back just to inform them, I received nothing short of an attitude. I didnt understand why I was getting this type of tension until the owner called me personally. Apparently, the person that dealt with my order, Pearl, was their last day.  Im pretty sure I can understand with one foot out the door, that person didn't want to bother understanding "damage control" for the next job that person receives. The back of house, probably feels some type of way because not only do I pride myself of being super honest, they can't admit their own possible mistakes. Even when I sent them pictures! What egos! The first step anyone can tell you is be accountable for your mistakes because mistakes happens! No big deal in my eyes, as long as you acknowledge a mistake was made. .  I wore many hats in restaurants and been in the business for 15+ years. Something I didn't believe I would grow to love the food industry, but I do. However, upon learning of the possible "cost overhead" the owner explain she would lose ($30 lunch), I decided to bide my final farewell. I'm too old to be petty and come up on a free meal. You were going to end up giving me the refund to end up throwing away the returned food, so what exactly are you losing? It doesn't make sense for you to "explain" food cost to me if logically youre not going to do anything with the contaminated food. Or are you? She even recommended I dont order anymore as she was "embarrassed" by the restaurant's behavior.  Apparently, she owns 5 - 2 in manhattan, 1 in queens, and quite frankly, the one in queens is the only one with "such problems". While we were understanding enough to accomodate the restaurant, after numerous mishaps, it appears that they need the money more than they needed a honest loyal customer. To the owner: sorry for your troubles, better fix the house before it burns down. To the public: Hope this doesn't happen to you, eat at your own risk.

Michelin Guide Thai food.Pad Thai is the way to go.Im always torn between the pad Thai or the pad kee mao but today I decided to order the pad kee mao. First off it was a little dry and not very flavorful. Second the portion was appetizer sized. My friend ordered the pad Thai and it was delicious! Each noodle was covered in flavor without being salty or too "wet". Also the pad Thai portion is about 3 times larger then any other noodle dish. The fried calamari is also fried very well and with the mayo sauce it was gone within 10 seconds. I can see myself coming back again and again but for the pad Thai.

I have been going to Kitchen 79 for several years now and it never disappoints! The Thai Green Iced Tea is divine and you can't get this drink anywhere else!!The other good dishes at Kitchen 79 are:- Pad thai- Pad See Ew- Khao Soi- Thai Basil Fried Rice- Thai Pineapple Fried Rice- Panang GangIt's always a pleasure to eat at this great place!! :)
Usually one of my favorite Thai spots but recently had a bad experience with their Take our.

So i came here because the yelp reviews are so high and they did not disappoint. From the ambiance, the service, the food, the drinks, everything was beyond amazing.Appetizers spring rolls and calamari. I had the spring rolls whoch were definitely fresh and delicious.The spice levels beware though. I appreciated that our waitress told us the spice levels in everything, as my dining friend doesnt like spicy. I like spicy though and she said 'medium spicy' but i like things hot. She said just get medium and you can put hot sauce. Well im glad she said that because the medium spice was perfect spicyness and hot!Overall, love this place, will definitely be back, i highly recommend!
Always delicious! I've yet to have a bad meal here and service is friendly too! Try the crispy pork, I've never been disappointed.

DATE NIGHT! DATE NIGHT! DATE NIGHT! Such a cute and whimsical place to have dinner. The food is exceptional. Easily one of my top 5 Thai restaurants in NYC. They also serve a dessert that I haven't been able to find anywhere else - the Lychee Crème Brûlée with fruity pebbles. It's so amazing that when I go with my family we tell them to put 4 creme brûlée's aside for us before we even order the appetizers.
The noodle soup I ordered was alright. Nothing bad but nothing special. So, mediocre 3 stars.

It's not hard to see why Kitchen 79 has become one of the most popular Thai establishments in the borough.They have a robust staff, a sexy / contemporary ambiance, and serve beautifully presented food. They've done just enough to separate themselves from the Woodside competition, all while becoming part of the awesome dining scene in Jackson Heights.In some ways, they're sort of like the Blend restaurants of Astoria / LIC but the Thai version. Food wise, everything is beautifully plated and the trendy undertones are perfect for the average Instagrammer / food pornographer. Thankfully, most everything tastes as good as it looks.Some of the standouts include their yum wonsen (glass noodle salad), their dark colored pad sei ew, ten ta fu (spicy red curry soup), ka nom jeen gang tai pla (shrimp curry with rice noodles), and their jumbo white crab fried rice. I would feel comfortable recommending the entire menu honestly, especially their massive Thai iced teas. Good Thai fare doesn't come cheap unfortunately, at least not at K79. Most entrees are a good $3+ compared to most Thai establishments in the area. The portions are debatable as well, while not being too small but certainly not entirely abundant either. This alone might be a turn off for some folks, but the primary focus is flavor and not portion.Service is spot on. I've never had an issue with the staff or even the speed of my food (notable issues with even the best Thai restaurants) but I think the best approach is to order a number of dishes for sharing to get a true taste of what they do best. It can get tricky though with their tight interior, group dining is not as easy as the date setup that they've got.

Excellent and very authentic Thai place that occupies the space formerly used by another Thai place (Arunee) which moved a block away. I came here for the great lunch special and was surprised how nice the decor looked. It is very classy and modern with a bar area. Their lunch special is only $6.95 (vegetarian or chicken) or $7.95 (beef) for an entree that comes with an appetizer. The selection of appetizers is varied as well and includes items such as curry puffs, spring rolls, roti, soup or salad. The entree selection as well has something for everyone with noodles, curries, and rice dishes all offered.We opted for the pad thai and pad priew wan. The pad thai noodles were not too sweet or spicy - just the right amount of flavor. The waitstaff here was very friendly and will offer to have the dishes made to cater to your tastes. The pad priew wan is not a dish you often find in Thai places. It is a rice dish with meat sauteed with pineapple, tomato, and sweet and sour sauce. I found the flavor of it to be very rich and interesting.This place in general had many dishes you will not find in other (more Americanized) Thai places. These include dishes like yum woon sen (glass noodle salad), khao soi (northern Thai soup) and jungle curry. Definitely give this place a try.

Ordered delivery and it came in 40 minutes... pretty normal. The curry puffs were stuffed with mushy curried potatoes. They were nice and came four in an order. The Tom yum was filled with vegetables like mushrooms, onions and carrots. The broth tasted very lemony, a bit too much lemongrass but was not salty. That was a big plus. The chicken broad noodle dish was good. The noodles were thick and tasty. The dish came in a simple brown sauce that didn't smother the noodles and the vegetables were bright and crunchy. Still some flavor to make the dish complete was missing.Mera's Tip: try the curry puffs.
Good food nice and friendly serviceBut if their accept the "American Express" in the restaurant i will decide to enjoy the food and drinks in the restaurant than order from the online
The food was bland . Wasn't the best pineapple rice  . The prices was decent tho. Service was a bit off . Only four ppl in the restaurant and not once did the guy come and check on me .

Kitchen 79 has a nice sleek and fancy feeling interior. I ordered my food to go so I can't comment on the service. If you order drinks as take out, they tape up the opening on the lid so there is no spillage. It took me longer than it should have to figure out why the straw wouldn't go through. The thai iced tea is delicious; flavorful and not too sweet, but half of the drink consisted of ice. We had the pad thai, pad see ew, drunken noodles (pad kee mao), gaeng kiew warn (green curry), curry puffs, and pla muk tord (calamari). The noodles  were good, but not the best I've had. Curry puffs were also very good and comes with some sort of sweet sauce, although I've had better. I highly recommend the green curry, which was delicious and mildly spicy, and the calamari. The calamari was nice and crispy and comes with a sauce that tastes like thousand islands dressing.

After reading the reviews of 79 I had to try it for myself. I must say the food here is delicious and thr service was completely on point.  The only draw back is that parking is very tough around here.

I liked the setup of the restaurant with the booths in the back and sides of the restaurant. The servers need to be more in tuned with the customers, but that's about it. We ordered two appetizers, the Tao Hoo Tord - which is the deep fried tofu served with sweet chili sauce and peanuts and the Saty Gai - thai marinated chicken satay served with peanut sauce. Both were really scrumptious. For entrees we ordered - the Khaophad which has thai fried rice with Chinese Broccoli, tomatoes, onions, and scallion (your choice of meat, chose chicken). Another entree chosen was Ka Nom Jeen Gang Kiew Warn Gai which is Thai pasta with chicken, basil leaves, eggplant, and coconut milk in green curry. Very delicious both of the entrees, however we needed to add some condiments to the dishes for more flavoring. Last but not least, we ordered fried coconut ice cream as the other tables got it and it looked great. They put it on fire and it just burns the fried part of the ice cream. The coconut part wasn't overly powering which was great. I did order a red sangria as a drink since it's only $5.

One of the best Thai restaurants I've had in a while. The vegetables were crisp and not soggy. The spice wasn't overwhelming. And my favorite: it wasn't greasy. They didn't use crazy amounts of oil to sauté everything. Delicious food. Large portions.
Again I found with the price of the home delivery  order for fried rice (chicken) quantity was very low unfortunately... may be my bad luck for the 2nd time.... but it was delicious food..

Eaten in and ordered delivery via Yelp from Kitchen 79 for years so I've decided to leave a review. Interior is very modern though all of the glassware and close proximity to other tables have prevented us from bringing our young kids here. Service is always top notch here as they wait staff is has always been attentive to our needs. Here are some of our thoughtsPros:- reasonably priced and the food is consistently cooked well. #1 reason why we keep coming back with take out orders- very quick turnaround time from the time of our order to food at our table/at our door- nice mix of modern and traditional dishes- lots of healthier options/alternatives- clean bathroomCons:- don't bother leaving comments on online orders. For example, we've repeatedly requested that our order not include plastic utensils, plastic straws and white rice which is ignored (trying to reduce waste)- there were few times that our food was either over cooked, overly oily, or ended up being smaller than normal. However this is not the norm.- restaurant can be tight

Great soup on the cold day. This  duck noodle soup save me from the cold. Love the spice and sweetness from duck leg. You can taste the freshness and feel like mommy home cooking. Look for nowhere for real quality Thai food. Delivery is very polite and they deliver super quick too

The ambience in this place was aesthetically pleasing. I went here during lunch hour with my cousin and we both ordered their version of pad se ew for entree,  and we both also shared the dish since we know we weren't going to finish our food if we got separate dishes. For appetizers, we ordered crab wontons however it's called a different name on the menu, I am not able to recall the exact name. The crab wontons are worth every penny, they are absolutely delicious and crunchy. During lunch special they only give you two wontons, so me and my cousin decided to order another set of crab wontons and I believe they give you 6 crab wontons in total. We also ordered two Thai ice teas and boy was the glass huge, this is the first Thai place that gives you a huge glass bombarded with lots of Thai ice to drink. I believe this place is worth it however I didn't like the attitude of one of the waiter and that's why I couldn't give it a 5 star. I just believe they need more attentive staff.

Have been coming here since I was a child, this place is still so good. I went with my mom tonight and got the pad Thai, Crab and cheese fried, Tom yum soup and green tea ice cream with lava. The waitress we had was super sweet and so beautiful and took photos of us. I come here a lot and have never been disappointed.

Great food, delicious food but bad service. I went out with family and friends so it was 5 of us. Gratuity is applied on parties of 5 or more. So it seemed like, since her gratuity was already included in the bill, she didn't have to be courteous, happy or attentive. Service is everything. A restaurant can have mediocre food and awesome service and I would go over and over again. You feel welcome and you are happy to spend your money because you are treated well. But a place that has delicious food and poor service will not get my hard earned dollars ever.

This place is my all time favorite for Thai food! If I'm ever craving Thai food, this is my go to spot! I'm really fond of their lunch special because it's not expensive and it comes with appetizers as well (geoy hor cheese is soo good). Their service is always good and they are very kind too! If you come during the day, it won't be that crowded, however during the night they get very crowded. The place is very cute and perfect to have a romantic date!

Kitchen 79 is okay. The interior is modern and cozy. In terms of the food nothing really stood out to me. One of the chicken dish we ordered came out barely cooked and it seemed like they just microwaved it... But their hospitality and service was very kind.

Excellent authentic Thai food. I heard about this place and made the trek out to queens from Manhattan to try it. Started with a lychee mimosa - I think it was only $5 and very tasty. Had the Tom kha gai soup which was excellent. Then had the ka nom jeen gang tai plan - a noodle dish with pumpkin, eggplant, vegetables, shrimp and mackerel in a spicy sauce. The waitress at first tried to dissuade me from ordering this as she insisted the sauce was very spicy and the mackerel had an overpowering flavor. I tried it anyway and it was quite good, but she was right - only order this if you love spicy food and don't mind the mackerel flavor. We also had the ka prow ka moo which I highly recommend. The pork was soft and juicy and the flavor was excellent. I would definitely return here to try more from their extensive menu.

Visited this restaurant for dinner with 5 family members and the place did not disappoint. The service, food and ambiance we're all excellent.  Mixed menu with several signature drink options for purchase.  Our group had the sangria, fish, Thai rice, dumplings, calamari, beef dish, soup, Papaya salad and dessert.  Everything was delicious! This Thai restaurant is such a nice addition to the Jackson Heights community and a must try.  The place is conveniently located near the 7train.  Street parking available in the area.

I will never ever eat at this place again. Come in to try their dishes with a high expectation since I am very getting bored about Ayada Thai food restaurant around the area. Want to try something new. What a mistake that I made for the day. Because I got the food poisoning with their food. I order their pad cha fish. I am wondering how long they have stock their fish in their refrigerator. Because when it come to the table, basically I can feel like this fish is coming from the frozen pack and tasteless.  After leaving the restaurant within an hour, I got a very bad stomachache and have very bad diarrhea and fever .Technically, I just eating with a bunch of deep fired frozen fish from the out of expiration date package. A big warn for dine in. Avoid this dish. Please see my pic. Good luck

My friend and I came here a few weeks and it was good experience but the food was just ok for me. We arrived on a  Saturday afternoon at around 3pm and was told we can sit anywhere we pleased. There was not much people there so its the perfect place to sit and talk and catch up with a friend.  I was on a no carbs thing so I was not able to order what I really wanted to eat so I settled for a salad even though the menu is an extensive one filled with many options. As an appetizer I ordered the chicken satay and for an entree I had a salad. The salad was made with seasoned ground chicken, red onions, scallions, mint leaves and roasted rice on a bed of lettuce. At first the salad was good but then it became too much. Way too much ground chicken and it was way over seasoned. The mint leaves was also too much. I don't think I got through half of it. The chicken satay on the other hand was very very delicious definitely wish I had more of that dish. For my drink I ordered a red lychee sangria and I was not really a fan, too sweet and too strong for me. As for my friend I think she enjoyed everything she had which was coconut soup and also a mango salad. So I would definitely wanna return and try other options on their menu because I think I may actually enjoy the food.

A delightful and cozy Thai option in the Jackson Heights section of Queens. We came here the other night for the first time and it was absolutely delicious. The space is intimate and warm, with low lighting and tile covering the back wall.  Many menu options to chose from. Wonderful staff too.

The food is ok, the staff is friendly but the lady with the baby was horrendous.  The baby was fine!  I don't mind crying from a baby because that is what they do.  It was the stupid woman who was making the crying sound each time the baby cried.  What an idiot and she did it most of the time they were there.  I think their whole party was a bit embarrassed by that idiot.  Seriously who does that? Just which someone would have told her to keep it down.

Atmosphere: Dimly lit, cozy place with bar seats. Could hardly see what I was eating. The table I sat at was oddly large for 2 ppl. My sister couldn't hear me from the other side. Food:If a Thai place should get 1 think right, it should be the pad thai. It was sweet and had a fishy smell like the fish they use in Vietnamese food. So that was a turn off, I've had good pad thai before, this was not even close. The pad see ew was also overly sweet with the fish well. My sister got green curry noodles which was watered down, so the flavor was almost non existent. The noodles were extra skinny so there's not much chewing happening. We finished with lychee cream brûlée, which wasn't too bad, the best thing we had there. The lychee fruit is at the bottom of the dish and the cream is sitting on top of it. Overall, I was disappointed with the food. I felt I wasted my night and money on this place. Wouldn't go again.

I ordered the green curry lunch special here and they served me old rice. Its very obvious the rice is old because of the dry hard texture and brown color on some spots of the rice. I get most restaurants serve old rice but try to make it less obvious jeez. The curry was mediocre and nothing special. This place is overrated, I really don't understand they got a Michelin. I am probably not going going back here again. Horrible quality and dishes.
Loved it here!  Excellent food. Cute intimate vibes inside. I wouldnt recommend for large groups because it's small. But I would totally come back.

Awesome lunch deal that runs every day until 4pm. Entree n app for $7.95-8.95 including noodle dishes, curry, kra pow etc... and about 6 apps to choose from. My pad Thai was delicious and well portioned while his basil curry was small and sorta bland. The teeny crab wonton and fried tofu packed a nice punch. Service is kind and plentiful.
Very good Thai restaurant. I like the hot spicy chili soup. Nice atmosphere and good menu. Large portions. Thai coffee was delicious.

This review is long overdue. I've been coming to Kitchen 79 since moving here about two years ago. It's a regular staple for me and my wife. The quality of food, happy hour choices, and variety of the menu is unique and a great value for the price. If you're into keto-friendly dishes, order one of their sautéed dishes with meat and vegetables and don't eat the side of rice it comes with. They also have the best raw shrimp salad, but ask them to make it mild because otherwise it can become exceedingly spicy. We usually have Tom as a server, who's very helpful in recommending dishes or steering you clear of dishes that may be too spicy.
Hosted our bridal team lunch here and they were very accommodating. The food was good everyone loved it. Ambiance fit the menu well. I would come here again.

Incredibly nice staff is an added benefit of this super tasty place!! Reasonably priced and great selections plus $5 sangria that you actually want to drink! My vote was definitely for the pancake appetizer!

The food here is delicious and the ambiance is very pretty and romantic. They have a bar stocked with beer and wine. The lychee mimosa was very good and it tasted like lychee soda. I would highly recommend trying it. My friends and I started off with the curry puffs and calamari. Usually I don't expect much with calamari when I visit other restaurants, but the calamari and sauce were so appetizing and delicious! The curry puffs were soft, flaky, and had so much filling. We ordered the guay tiew pad sei eiw, gauy tiew pad kee mau, and the guay tiew rad nha. Each one was flavorful, savory, and scrumptious. My friends and I have all traveled to Thailand before so there has always been an impending feeling of disappointment when we tried other Thai restaurants in new york. However, the pad sei eiw at Kitchen 79 is spot on, delicious, delectable, and close to authentic. The noodles were cooked perfectly, the chicken was moist, and the broccoli was sauteed well. In conclusion, the service was great, waiters were very friendly, and the food was amazing. I would definitely love to revisit this establishment and try other items on the menu.

I was immediately enamored with the decor of this location. It had a cozy feel to it that was topped off with great service. My choice of meal was the crispy duck salad and my sister had the pad thai - both options were amazing. It was my first time having duck and I was a bit nervous to try it, but I can confidently say that I will definitely be going back for a larger portion of it! The pad thai wasn't super oily like other thai spots, it had a perfect balance of flavors. Definitely try the lychee sangria, the sweetness of it was one of a kind!

Good customer service the wait time was long, but it's a popular spot. I ordered the fried rice with chicken. The rice was very soggy. The red sangria was good though. I def had better Thai food elsewhere. Nice atmosphere and service.

First : finding parking in this area is absolute *H E L L. You've been warned! Also, I believe the 7 train runs here so that's an option. The store front doesn't have a sign above, only a circle inside the window that says "79" so it may be hard to find for some and it's also located within the block and not on the main Ave. This restaurant is absolutely gorgeous, the pictures do make it seem bigger than it is. The minor details are simply exquisite and there's no doubt that a lot of time and money was spend on the decor. The seats are leather, the chandeliers are stunning and the overall layout of the restaurant is great! They made such good use of the limited space they do have.  The bathroom is so cute. The waiters have denim aprons and the dishes are served in either square or oval shaped plates. The water is served in beer glasses and there is a full bar (with a check in offer). Upon arrival, (7:30pm-Saturday), my bff and I were greeted right away and seated. We opted for the love seat which I absolutely adored. A very unusual seating area which would be perfect for a couple/date night. The staff was very helpful with the questions I asked, kudOs. What we got for under $50: the menu has so many options, it was hard to choose a dish! Curry Puffs: delishDumplings: moist, savory, mMmmMmMy friend got some worth of pineapple and chicken dish with white rice from the "wok" section. It was perfectly sweet and yummy!I got the 1st option of fried rice (I forgot the name but it's the first one in that section). I opted for medium spicy and got it with shrimp. This was really flavorful. I felt as though the rice was a bit grainy and the portion was unusually small. Teatree Fried Ice cream: they do serve this with flames. Eh, it tasted smoky and burnt. I didn't like the taste of the outter shell but the ice cream itself was good. Thai Ice Tea - large portion and very good. Overall: beautiful ambiance and good food.

This review is long overdue since I've been coming to Kitchen 79 regularly for over a year now. My fiance and I love Thai cuisine, and this is one of our favorite spots. We feel very lucky to have it in our Jackson Heights neighborhood. We dine at Kitchen 79 at least twice a month and also order takeout from here occasionally. The food is delicious, service is fast, and the decor is beautiful. Their panang curry is exceptional and different from other Thai places, the noodle dishes are all wonderful, and they have khao soi (a Northern Thailand dish), a favorite of mine that is not available at all Thai restaurants. Keep up the excellent work!

Another Thai restaurant that is conveniently close to me. Hence why I eat a lot of Thai food lol. It's on the corner of 79st and Roosevelt ave. It's a small space but cozy and intimate feeling. The decor is modern,sexy with black and white accents and dim lighting to set the mood. I've sat everywhere in the restaurant and this last time I sat at the bar. And had a glass of white wine while I waited for my gf to arrive. My only problem is that the bar only has wine and beer. They need to step that up cause I was really craving a lychee martini and instead had to settle for wine. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and it's small but clean and smells good. Once I was out of the bathroom my gf had arrived. We browsed thru the menu and we decided to share chicken Satay. It's one of my favorite Thai apps. The grilled chicken flavor,delicious peanut sauce and the refreshing cucumber sauce is just a perfect combo. I can eat this daily lol. For dinner she had what looked like a beef stir fry with veggies,ginger and brown rice. I tried it and it was delicious, but it wasn't spicy and I love my Thai food spicy. I went for the red coconut curry with shrimp,bell peppers,bamboo shoots,basil and jasmine rice. I really enjoy this dish. Silky sauce,complex flavors,perfectly cooked shrimp,veggies and a pretty decent amount of heat but not overwhelming. The jasmine rice is the perfect compliment to it. Just a great balance overall. Just thinking about it is making my mouth water lol. I alternate between this spot and arunee Thai which is down the block from my apt. I do however like the more intimate vibe of this place. The prices are right,good food and service will keep me coming back.

This is hands down the best Thai place! I mean the food is soo damn good. It's flavorful as well as spicy. We loved it! Their service is top notch. We ordered veg spring roll and fried chicken dumplings in appetizers with lychee mimosa and roasted duck red curry and khao soi they both were delicious!! No doubt they have Michelin star

Nice atmosphere, but the waitress wasnt too friendly. The desserts were great but the food was so-so. Definitely recommend the thai tea, lychee creme brulee & mango sticky rice. But not anything with beef. The satay beef entree and tender beef entree were both overcooked and dry. Great place to sit and chat with friends.

Been here twice and it has exceeded my expectations on both occasions.Everything from the noodles to the rice is phenomenal, honestly. I've had the glass noodles, spicy flat noodles, fried rice and curry and all were exceptional! Even the appetizers, ahhhmazing. I think this will be my new go to Thai place. Parking: sucks, this area is always so crowded. Decor: small but beautifully decorated.THAI ICE TEA IS THEEEE BEST I'VE EVER TRIED, and trust me I've tried ALOT lol.def recommend.

First time visiting and overall a good experience. With a yelp check in you can get a free lychee mimosa. Everyone in my group got one.  Food :- the Som Tum Poo Dong Salad (papaya salad with the salty crab ); the salad part was pretty flavorful and tasty. The salty crab didn't really add much to the experience and I could have gone without it, perhaps I did not eat the crab the right way. - the Larb Gai Larb Moo Salad; pretty good and flavorful, similar to the other nearby Thai restaurants. -Peek Gai Mak Khamin Tord (chicken wings); they had flavor combination of salty, savory and some slight sweetness. I wish there was a side of dipping sauce to really soak them in. Drinks:-Thai iced tea and coffee come in huge glasses. For the price definitely worth it. The atmosphere and decor:Clean and modern. The chairs are low and soft, quite comfortable to sit back in.

I went here for the first time in this past week and didn't regret it! With the lunch special, I got the spring rolls and chicken pad thai with a thai iced tea. The spring rolls were honestly one of the best I've had. They came in these cute little ceramic dishes. The chicken pad thai was excellent and came in a good amount; I couldn't even finish it! The thai iced tea was, to put it simply, beautiful. It wasn't too sweet and had a great taste.The staff were really friendly. Our waiter kept checking on us and refilled our waters. Everything was served fairly quickly. Four lunch specials with four thai iced teas and an extra appetizer came out to be around $50.

Was in the neighborhood and stopped by Kitchen 79 for a late lunch (~3pm) and what a nice treat.Aside from comparing a traditional Pad Thai, my go to dish to compare Thai Restaurants is their Beef Pad See Ew. It is my favorite dish and having had some of the best ones in Thailand, I know when a good dish is GOOD! And this is probably one of the best! It was less oily than the ones I had before, and thats a pro. Very flavorful and had tons of beef (although my friend ordered the same and didnt have much beef). I guess I lucked out and stole his. :) Be warned that the dish is on the sweeter side. I actually prefer it this way, but this could rub people the wrong way. Cost: $7.95 lunch special and came with the spring rolls (small and not worth any mentions).I also ordered the Thai Ice Coffee which was also on the sweeter side with a bit too much ice. It was served in a large mug, and priced at $3.50. Reasonable but on the pricier side for the neighborhood.What I really like about this restaurant is the decor. I really like it. It is chic and modern, clean in a warm/dark setting. It does not feel like you are at a Thai Restaurant and a great place for a date if you are in the area. We sat in one of the two booths by the window. Prices are very reasonable and dishes are great. One last mention is that the lunch portions are not huge but would be filling if you add an appetizer to the meal.
Love the food!  The food is fresh and tasty.  Service is on point.  The restaurant is clean and well decorated.  The beverages come in huge glasses.

Modern Thai restaurant. Gets pretty busy on weekend evening hours. Should've called ahead for reservations because ended up waiting about 30 mins for table for 6. Had space at bar though. Nice touch with free beer with entree with yelp check in. Ordered beef Kee mao (drunken noodles). I've had better. It was a bit dry and couldn't been more spicy and larger portioned. Others in party who ordered same dish were still hungry after even with sharing 3 appetizers. Others in party who ordered pad Thai were very happy and dish portion seemed larger. Would return to try other dishes.

The restaurant is right at the corner of Roosevelt and 79th St. We went on Sunday around 3pm. The place was about half full. We got the Peek Gao Make Khamin (fried chicken wings), Larb salad a d Gaeng Massaman Curry. Everything was delicious, the Larb salad was on par with other Larb salad I have gotten at Thai restaurants on    Woodside ave a few blocks away. The Thai ice tea and Thai coffee comes in big beer mugs. Keep in mind, when they ask how spicy you want your dish, spicy is very very spicy!
Loved the environment,  I've been here a couple of times and the waiting for the food is very short.  Great to have a date.It's different from the restaurants in the area.

This was our favorite spot to eat at until today. We usually order in so we never had an issue with the actual dining experience. Today we were highly disappointed as we ordered our favorite dish on the menu "Pad see Ew" and it tasted flavorless and burnt. I sent it back and decided to try the other plate we ordered which was the pineapple fried rice, looking for some satisfaction after the terrible pad see ew. I am enjoying the rice until one mouthful tasted awfully weird. I was chewing on napkin. There was a piece of napkin in my food !!! And it was cooked into the rice so I couldn't tell the difference until i chewed it. So unpleasant. The worse part is that they didn't seem sorry at all. They didnt even offer us anything off the bill or gave us anything complementary. We had to request them to take the plate off the bill. We will not be eating here again, i suggest you dont either.

Love the Thai food here. The appetizers we're a bit different style of what I usually see but the taste was pretty good. The sauces they used on the appetizer and entrees matched the dish really well. Their crispy duck llred curry dish was really good. The duck was cook to it's perfection and not dry at all. Their chicken pad thai noodles were great as well. Their Thai green milk tea was super size and tasted just right! Didn't expect it to be in a huge cup - definitely shareable size. I also had their mango sticky rice which also tasted pretty good and the mango was not just a few pieces but a while mango! Atmosphere was nice too - they have candlelights so it's a good date spot too. Service was definitely attentive and the food came out at a nice pace.

I love this place is my go to Thai restaurant, I love the decorations that they have. The staffs is always friendly and they make you feel like family I have taken family and friend to for lunch or dinner and a couple of days ago a toke my sister to celebrate her birthday  since is her favorite restaurant as well. Thank for the great food and service you provide your customers with.

When I think of Jackson heights, I've always just gone for Filipino food or Spanish food. But my friends and I were craving Thai food and came across this Kitchen 79. Cute little restaurant tucked away in the corner of 79th street and Broadway!  Though we were disappointed to find that there was no lunch special or drinks offer because it was a holiday (President's day), we were still delighted by the quality of our meals. I always resort to pad see ew because it's one of my favorites but this time my husband got it and I ordered pad woon sen, which is made with glass noodles, eggs, ear mushrooms, chives, and I got it with chicken. I really enjoyed my dish. It wasn't spicy but it had a pepper kick to it. The vermicelli wasn't dried and I devoured the dish in minutes!  Hubby liked the pad see ew- surprisingly some Thai places can't make a good one as it can easily be too salty but this one was sweet and a good balance of meat to noodles. We also got the Thai iced coffee which came in a huge hug/cup and was delicious. My personal favorite that ended our meal was the lychee creme brulee. Wow! If I can make a dessert like that I'd want to open up my own shop too. It has the perfect texture and taste of a great creme brulee but with surprising chunks of lychee that add a surprisingly element to this popular dessert. I would get it again next time!

DO NOT order for delivery. The Pad Ka Praw was loaded with Peppers and more Peppers with just a few pieces of the crispy pork, which is supposed to be the main component of the dish. Same was the deal with Penang Curry. Very disappointed and wont be ordering from here again. There are manu cheaper alternatives in the close localility.

Came here with family (8 of us) on NYE and we were seated right away. The food was good and so were the Thai drinks. Most of us got drunken noodle with shrimp and shrimp fired rice which was very tasty. The fired calamari was cooked to perfection! Will def visit again!

UPDATE! Three years on, this place has gone downhill.... FAST. The only thing going for it is the team of delivery guys who are fast and always friendly.The food has gone from 5 stars to no stars. Before, noodle dishes were tasty and packed with fresh ingredients. Now the ENTIRE bowl is CLUMPED together (see my pic from today). They included plastic forks/knives/spoons with my order but how do I use a plastic fork on a CLUMP of noodles that's as hard as cement?Last week I thought the restaurant was just having a bad night. I ordered Pineapple rice for myself and a curry for my husband.The "pineapple" rice? Don't EVEN call it pineapple rice when you can't be assed to put in more than 3 minute chunks of pineapple. And don't call this dish rice when the ENTIRE bowl was a CLUMP of overcooked, tasteless gooey garbage. It was revolting. I ate half because I hadn't eaten all day. My husband took one bite of his curry and put it in the fridge to save for the dog.What the hell? When did good, authentic Thai food become tasteless, don't-give-a-hoot-about-our-customers crap? WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. Put some effort into your meals, Kitchen 79 or you will close in no time.I pity the fool who chooses to eat here.

Great Thai food place. Environment 4/5Small place tucked in a corner, causal and had a very cozy feel. The black and white tiles kind reminds me of a retro 90s design. Nice place for a meal and to chat. Food 4.5/5I really enjoyed their pad Thai they had a great balance of the smokiness and sweetness down. The crispy duck was a bit dry but the flavor of sauce and duck was superb. Had some cocktails and they were a bit on the light side. Everything was also well priced aService 5/5The service here was top notch. Staff was super friendly and attentive. They even entertained all the random questions I had about the food.Overall 4.5 (25% environment, 50% food, 25% service)
The food is good, the prices are good, we hung out there for a long time and they were fine with it. If you're in the area it's worth checking out
Love the food and the atmosphere. Very sophisticated and the staff is great. I love getting the lychee mimosa, one of my favorites.

I have ordered from this location from the last 5 years.  Their food is not the greatest but above average for the neighborhood.  My last two orders have been wrong. And the brown rice, for which they charge extra, was extremely undercooked.  The first time I thought it was my mistake, so I let it go.  The second time I make sure I pressed the correct protein choice and the system still processed the wrong item. I called them to let them know that their system may be jumping or malfunctioning.  The person who answered the telephone was extremely rude, and simply directed me to take it up with seamless. I explained that I ordered through their site but he just kept interrupting me.  It sounded like this is a common occurrence that they do not want to address.

Overall: 3.5 starsI liked the ambiance and we were lucky to walk in and get seated at the best table!  However the food and service was just average.  We're not sure what all the rave is about.  Please find below ratings for individual dishes.Green Curry: 3.75 StarsThe sauce was appetizing.Mango Salad: 2.5 StarsReally didn't like this. Michelin-rated Fish: 3.25 StarsIt was average; pretty underwhelming for a Michelin-rated dish in a self-proclaimed #1 Thai restaurant in Jackson Heights.Pad Thai: 2.75 StarsNot good.  A lot of other places have better pad thai.

Friendly service, good food, what more can you ask. Oh right, did I mention if you check in on Yelp, you get a free glass of beer? There's stiff competition with Thai restaurant nearby however even though others may be higher rated, the food here is still solid. My go to Thai dish, drunken noodles, can be made with a little more kick.

Stumbled upon this place by random search and was surprised to find that the ambience was suited for dates as well as casual get togethers (thought it was going to be a hole in the wall, but it wasn't). The restaurant was packed on a Saturday night, but we were still able to get seated within 10 mins of waiting.  Servers were friendly and service was decent.  No complaints.The main staples I tend to order at every Thai restaurant is the tom yum soup and the salads, which I started off with as appetizers.  Both the shrimp tom yum soup and mango shrimp salad were tangy with a spicy kick to it.  The spice level is not volcano status but rather a mild level (or at least ask for mild if you can't handle spicy) so do attempt to get this!  It's good!  The sour spice will awaken your palette and leave you craving for more. For entrees, we got the pork tenderloin dish and a duck leg noodle soup. The pork was not only flavorful but tender and juicy as well, and served with a side of sticky rice. The duck noodle soup was rich in broth while the duck leg was very fatty but also tender. This is a nice restaurant addition to the busy neighborhood.

Really enjoyed dinner here last night! My group and I stayed here for over 2 hours until closing time because the atmosphere was laid back and none of the staffs were rushing us out. The prices here are unbeatable for the quality of the food. Everything we ordered from appetizers (curry puffs, roti with beef, cheese wontons) to entrees and desserts were superb. I was pleasantly surprised at the beautiful decor and the quality of every dish provided. I would stay away from the $5 cocktails though because there were barely any alcohol! Go for the beer or wine instead! Check in on yelp for a free beer with entree.

If anyone ever wants REAL traditional Thai food, this is the place!! The food is very traditional and also very spicy. A lot of places I go to for Thai food, it's not as spicy as this place. The dishes here are very flavorful and you can taste every spice that's in it. Customer service is awesome and the environment is romantic and spacious. The price is reasonable. One thing that I loved most was there fried ice cream! The experience was amazing! I definitely would go back again!

Curry puffs all up in this face. Ridic homemade deliciousness.Fried dumplings were the first ones I've truly liked. They're usually barely pan fried potstickers but these were so nice and so crispy and so flavorful.Salad was good, somewhat standard but with a delicious homemade peanut dressing and nice fresh ingredients.Pad sew ew also good esp with the hot sauce tray to let you mix it up.Stir fry (not sure which one) with the pork was very good.Curry isn't my thing but we had the curry soup with chicken which was good and the green curry with beef which was also loved by the curry fans.This place is cheap for lunch (no idea about dinner) and soooo freaking good... really a must try. Owner is also super legit.

Green curry is amazing. I get why it was Michelin recommend dish. Crab fried rice is also good. Loved the calamari, lightly friend, but still crunchy and flavorful. Lychee créeme brûlée is worth the calories...trust me. Drinks are also pretty good. Had the white sangria, red sangria, and Thai tea--all good.
What a horrible Thai food we had for lunch. Everything was very salty and with no taste.

This place was a cute spot! Food was excellent and a little different then other Thai places. They got unique dishes. I got a pad sew to try how different it was from other places. It was good and not as sweet as other places. It has more of a ginger taste to it. The Thai ice tea was awesome!! They gave it in a huge mason mug! The service was excellent and you wouldn't think there was a Thai restaurant there. Parking was not as easy to find but we found one. They didn't take Amex which was a bummer. They sat at us at a booth with a huge marble table that I felt far away from my friends but it was cool. Big enough to have all your dishes on the table. I would definitely go back to try other dishes.

Came here for dinner with the bestie and this place definitely exceeded my expectations. Checked in and got a free beer and the good food made the experience even better. We started off with the spring rolls as an appetizer and it complimented my Brooklyn Lager very well.For our entrees we ordered the Pan Woon Sen and Guay Tiew Kua Gai. Both were full of flavor and just the right amount of spice. For dessert we shared the Lychee Creme Brûlée, which was to die for especially the surprise chunks of Lychee we were not expecting. The dark lighting with candle tea lights on the table during the dinner time makes this spot a cute place to take a date too. The decor is really pretty as well. We will definitely be having another girls date here again.

Came exclusively for the ming ka-na. Also ordered calamari and iced teas. After ordering and upon being served iced teas, waiter told us they were out of ming ka-na. Asked to cancel the calamari and was told the kitchen had already prepared it. Disappointing service.Calamari was bland, and the dipping sauce was too. Wouldn't recommend or return.
Really good pad thai and friendly service. Will be coming back for more. The ambience is modern and clean, it's worth a visit.

We've been going to this place for nearly five years now. It's a nice little cozy place and not noisy like some other places in the neighborhood. I have had several dishes these past few years and I can say assuredly you won't be disappointed either...

This place don't play! I had the kanom jeen tai pla and the flavor was there! That spice creeped up on me. If you think you kinda ok with spice don't order it. If spicy food makes your day then you go for it! FYI check in on here and get a free beer and the beer was good too! Nice and friendly staff and the environment is nice. Anyways I recommend it.

Kitchen 79 is a small Thai restaurant with a great modern appeal, smacked in the middle of residential buildings.  Having said that, it is quite difficult finding street parking, especially if you come here on a Saturday night like we did.  Both the exterior and interior of the restaurant are pretty contemporary and upscale-looking.  The lighting of the establishment is a bit on the dim side, but it works well with the semi-gothic looking furniture and decor.  We situated ourselves by the bar because we found the tables to be a tad close to each other, given the size of the space and the number of tables the establishment tried to fit in there.  Unfortunately, what came with our own privacy was getting knocked continuously by passersby.We next checked in like avid Yelpers and claimed our free lychee mimosas, which were delicious (I mean, they're free).  We then ordered the steamed dumplings appetizer, the stir-fried glass noodles and mango salad to share.  Every single spec of food was devoured by us, because they were that tasty.  Service was pretty good as well and a plus that there is a TV by the bar area to keep us entertained while chowing down.  I'd definitely recommend this place.  We walked in on a busy night, so I'd advise trying to make reservations in advance.

My boyfriend and I were in the area last night so we decided to check this place out. Once we entered the staff greeted us and seated us right away. The ambience was beautiful. I had to order a Thai ice coffee after reading the reviews and hearing so many good things about it. We also got a Thai ice tea as well. The size of the cup was HUGE. We also ordered a chicken pad thai, chicken pad see ew and a fried tofu as our appetizer. After sitting there for half an hour the waiter comes over to tell us they lost our order....so then we waited another 15 until we got our food. The food was delicious and it was sauced perfectly. I really enjoyed my pad see ew and my boyfriend liked his pad Thai. At the end when we called for the check, the waiter took the drinks off our check which was really nice of him. We would definitely come back to try something new if we're in the area again.
Ordered Uber eats for my second time food came hot and in 40 minutes. Fresh and delicious...the crab rangoons are so light and fresh and the noodles are sweet and flavorful....will be ordering again

Came here for a girls night out with my girls on a Saturday night. Although making reservations, the spot wasn't too packed for a Saturday night. Ordered chicken Satay, calamari and fried tofu for appetizers. Everything was good. Service was good. Pad Thai and pad see ew was standard. Friend ordered the drunken noodles and that was delish!!! Definitely recommend ordering that when visiting.

First time here, very pleasant experience. Ambience A+Food and presentation A+Attentiveness A+Cleanliness A+One of the best Thai restaurants I've visited around this area. Worth a visit, you won't be disappointed.
Really good Thai. Super good prices for the food quality and ambience. I got Thai tea as well and it was larger than any I've ever had.
Probably my favorite Thai restaurant hands down. The service is lovely & the food is wonderful. Also this is the only place I can fulfill my lychee creme brûlée craving.

I ordered a large catering order from Kitchen79 for a get together I has hosting that same day.  Everything we ordered came out great.   We ordered 1 appetizer, 2 trays and a few items a-la-carte.Their portions were more than enough for the 18 guests (with leftovers too)  and they didn't skimp on the meat for the trays.  I would say they weren't the cheapest in terms of catering, but the price was more than fair.The staff were helpful with loading the food to my car on day of pickup. I would order them again for large group needs.

My first time here, but I used to order for delivery before. I went for lunch with a friend. Good food, good service, and all the staffs are very nice. And also Thai Iced Tea and Green Tea that we got are very good.

We tried a *lot* of dishes at Kitchen 79, but two things really stood out to me: the curry puffs and the spicy pork knuckle. It was worth the visit just for those!We had a reservation for four, but my friend and I arrived an hour early, so naturally we got a head start on appetizers. We tried the aforementioned puffs, the spring rolls, the calamari, and the fried tofu. The others ranged from okay to good, but the puffs were the only thing we doubled up on after trying. There's not much to dislike about the dish!Later, once our other friends got there, we got entrees for ourselves. I went with the spicy pork knuckes, which advertises two different heat sources. They weren't lying: it's hot. The pork itself was tender with the right amount of chewiness, and our free check-in lychee mimosas helped offset the spice.The menu at Kitchen 79 is giant, and filled with items you won't find at your typical Thai restaurant. For that reason in itself I'd be happy to return, but it doesn't hurt to know I've got some curry puffs waiting for me as well.

Our secret favorites Thai place around Jackson heights. Food is always on point - I'm taking about the spicy level, the waiter would like to explain the details and the lychee cocktail is my go to. The only drawback might be (it's just for myself) that the small table.
This place is spectacular.  I have never ordered anything I didn't love.  They are reasonably priced too.  You can't go wrong here.  LOVE

As soon as you walk into this place, you will like the decor. I love the seats-they're so comfy! At first the waiter seemed agitated and annoyed but as time passed, he began to be more attentive.  The woman waitress was much friendlier as she made sure we were taken care of and answered any questions we had. Let me begin by saying that the Thai Iced tea was huge and was mediocre-I've had better! Food was great! Coconut soup was a bit watery but still enjoyed it. Tom Yum was delicious but wished more vegetables were added. Steamed snapper was cooked well until we realized it wasn't scaled thoroughly. Otherwise, it had good flavor. Khao Pad rice  with tofu was delicious-wished it had more eggs. Duck was great as well-worth trying!For desserts, we had fried ice cream and coconut ice cream. Fried ice cream was okay as I've had better and coconut ice cream tasted just like a coconut with pieces of flakes added.Overall, I will definitely return to try other items:)

This was a very nice hidden little gem. Came here with a group of 8 and they were very accommodating.The food here was very good. I highly recommend getting the chicken curry puffs. You also get a free beer when you check in and order an entree!Would come again and try a bunch of other dishes in the future.

Wow! I guess my expectations is too low but when I get there I was surprised about the interion & vibe of this restaurant. Its modern & classy. I love the black and white interior. So when we get there we got seated fast & the servers are really attentive & helpful. For my drinks I got the white sangria and my bf got thai iced tea. Thr glass for the iced tea is huge! My bf loves it. Food: Calamari-- it was crispy. Excellent!! The sauce on the side makes it so flavorful.Papaya salad-- omg!! This is my favorite & it was full of flavors. The sweet & spicy taste makes it perfect. Pad thai-- taste a little sweet & my bf enjoyed it. Fried pork with chinese broccoli-- superb!! This is my order & I enjoyed every taste of this. It has a lot of flavors that when you take a bite you can really say wow!!Overall it was a great dinner!! This is my new spot if I crave for some thai food.

Great food, nice and quiet ambiance - one of the best Thai food in queens!! My wife and I decided to check the place out based on other yelp reviews and I would highly recommend it to other folks - if you in the jackson heights area, please please please go check out the place. You will not regret it!!

Today i'm order the pink noodle (Gauy Tiew Yen Ta Fo) The tastes is sweet and sour I really like it. It's very tasty good for this cold weather. The service is still on top of it. This place is never disappointed me. I will be back again

Cozy Jackson heights restaurant . The decor is very tastefully done and the service was excellent . For an appetizer I had the fresh spring rolls and the steamed dumplings . For the main course I had beef drunken noodles medium spice level. All of the food was great and I would definitely come back. I can't prove it but I feel the sake was a good deal. I want to say it was 6$ for a 270ml cold sake. I easy poured 6-7 shot glasses full from the serving .

I miss Kitchen 79 so much. I used to lived in JH and Kitchen 79 is my favorite Thai restaurant. Now I live in downtown Manhattan and couldn't find the good Thai food in my area. I like Pink seafood noodle soup, Pad Kee Moa and Sautéed Basil. The staffs are very friendl & helpful.

Cute thai restaurant tucked in a corner in Jackson Heights, absolutely cozy with a great menu and service. Food was delicious and service was wonderful. This restaurant stays on my list of favorite Queens spots!  If you're looking for delicious Thai food & cozy setting then definitely consider this location. I intend to drop in again soon!

This is my go to spot for Thai food. Their calamari is by far the best I've had compared to other Thai spots. I am never disappointed with the food or service. If your looking for a god Thai spot I would highly recommend you try this place out.

4.5 stars.Excellent food for an excellent price in Jackson Heights.  There's plenty of more popular spots around, but there was no wait at Kitchen 79 on a Saturday evening and I would surely choose this place over SriPraPhai and Ayada Thai.  I went with a group of 6 and we were served with barely a wait for a larger group.I ordered a Thai tea and it was only $3 for a MASSIVE mug of probably some of the best Thai tea I have had in NYC thus far (and I've had a lot).  Most people can't tell the difference between their Thai teas, but after visiting Bangkok and drinking Thai tea growing up, I've become somewhat of a Thai tea snob.  Kind of weird, yes.  Kitchen 79 gets an A+ for their original Thai tea.  They ran out throughout the night though, so my friends got the Thai green tea, which I'd never had before, but tasted somewhat like a green tea frappucino from Starbucks oddly enough.  For our appetizers, we got the normal som tum (papaya salad) and the nam tok (grilled beef salad).  The papaya salad was also one of the best I've had in NYC and was quite authentic and very flavorful.  A lot of the papaya salads in NYC lack flavor.  This was really spicy and sour and tasted as it should.  I liked the beef salad as well, with just as much flavor.  However, it was a tad bit too sweet for my liking.   Still really good, though.  Warning: spicy here is really spicy!For my main, I had the duck noodle soup which was something like boat noodles in Bangkok with the dark herbal soup with angel hair noodles.  I got a massive duck leg in my soup versus pieces of soup which was interesting.  Not spicy at all, so I added a generous heap of spicy powder. I think this had tons of MSG in it or something because when I got home I couldn't stop drinking water.  Either way, tasty noodle soup dish!For dessert, we got a crazy fire presentation of fried ice cream.  The batter was a bit too thick for my liking and it was soaked in some very strong alcohol from the fire.  Yikes.  Probably the only hiccup of the evening.  That, and I could barely taste the flavor in the ice creams.Excellent authentic Thai food for the price and very large servings.  Would come here again.

On my second visit after awhile, the staff was very accommodating to our large group on a Friday night. The food was still good. I like how their Thai/Green Iced tea is served in such large cups.
