However I do prefer the iced tea elsewhere (Dek Sen, Chao Thai). I was most excited to order the lychee creme brûlée as that was my ultimate memory from the previous visit. I was unfortunately disappointed when they just dropped the check on our table and didn't tell us the kitchen was closing. Normally the staff warns you in advance and asks if you'd like to order anything else, but they just said the kitchen was closed after we said we wanted to order dessert. I know the creme brulees are premade in advance. You just dust it in sugar and torch it. I'm a bit miffed by this since this was the only reason I came here but aside from this, everything else was still good.

4.5 StarsExcellent food, this was some of the best Thai I've had in awhile. I loved the somtum thai, it was fresh, well-seasoned and delicious. I enjoyed it so much, I ordered a second one to take home. The pad woon sen was pretty delicious too, The glass noodles had plenty of flavor and were paried with beef, woodear, bell pepper, scallions, and other vegetables. The Thai iced tea came in a pretty big mug and was excellent as well. It was on the sweet side, but very good. The only dish I tried that was harder to eat was the gaeng tai pla (a curry dish with shrimp, mackerel and vegetables). The server warned that this southern thai style dish would be really spicy and a bit fishy. He was right, even though the heat was toned down by request, it was still hot and the mackerel flavor did permeate the dish. This dish would definitely be an aquired taste. Overall, wonderful food. Lots of options to choose from ranging from noodles, curry, curry, to sauteed and specialty dishes. I would definitely like to go back and try more menu items.

Found this place on Yelp randomly and was drawn in by the high reviews and close location so I decided to give this place a try. The Jackson heights and nearby Elmhurst area is flooded with Thai food, so there's a lot of competition in this cuisine in the area. However, I've tried Ayada Thai and SriPraPhai several times, unimpressed, I decided to give this place a shot.As others have said, this place feels much more upscale.. similar to a restaurant you'd find in the city.. but for much cheaper prices. The lighting inside is a little dark for my preference, but definitely enjoyable for a romantic date. I started off with a Thai tea.. because.. who goes to eat Thai food without enjoying a Thai tea on the side? (Did you really go to a Thai restaurant?) $3 is $.50-$1.00 more expensive than how much other places charge for Thai tea, but I assure you that the quality of this tea is one of the best in the area. The portions.. is.. fair, most of my cup was ice and nothing compares to the LARGE jug of Thai tea from Ayada Thai. We also had the calamari for appetizers which was underwhelming since the batter was not crispy.. it was actually quite soggy even though it was warm and evidently just came out of the kitchen.My go-to Thai cuisine, that I get at every restaurant without fail is Pad See Ew.. so I would say I am some type of Pad See Ew expert.. this, was done correctly. The noodles are soft but chewy, flavorful, not too oily, chicken was soft and not rubbery tasting.. and the portion was right. My friend had a curry option (I don't remember the name exactly) but he enjoyed it though it was not something he typically liked having (so that is a plus).Overall, I would love to come back. Great food for a great price, at a convenient location!

I will NEVER eat at this place ever again. Last week during lunch I purchased pineapple fried rice and spring rolls for appetizers. Inside the rolls were too much black powder spice, not edible at all and my very last piece of chicken was uncooked. The meat was pink. The waiter was very rude and had the audacity to give me a bill.
Fish Cakes, Thai Ice Tea and anything from the specialty menu will not steer you far wrong. The standard curries are a little too watery for me. One of the better Thai options in Queens.

Sunday Birthday Party with about #15 of my Trinity Grace Church Queens friend's.Ambience = 7.5The table's were very close, however it would be a great place for a 1st date..Mixed Drinks = 9If it was Whiskey, Vodka, Gin..,the place wasn't shy on the drinks. Waiter/ Waitress Staff = 8It wasn't busy for a Sunday, and the staff was superb. There was another large group at the place, so the staff had their hands full.Food = 8Calamari was good, however the presentation could have been better. However the [ large amount ] for the price was brilliant!Wine = 5There's always a wine buff in my onterage  of friends in Manhattan, Queens, and Brooklyn, however this place didn't have a extensive wine list.

Last night we ordered two chicken pad Thai and got one order of shrimp Pad Thai. We were very disappointed. Also their Thai teas, that are usually are very delicious, taste off. We are so really disappointed.
This is hands down my favorite drunken noodle spot! Also their thai iced teas and coffees are so goood, Im addicted!! I also love the ambiance of the restaurant, definitely can be a cute date spot.

I would rate Kitchen 79 four and a half stars.I stopped in for the lunch special which included an appetizer and main course for under $8.50. I started with the kanom jeeb. This dish was very similar to shumai without shrimp.For the main course, I ordered the Thai red curry with chicken. The flavorful profile was magnificent. Spiciness from the curry, sweetness from the coconut, a hint more of bitterness and sweetness from the basil, and earthiness from bamboo. All in all, it was a very well balanced dish.The service was quick and attentive. The staff was friendly and polite. The decor is and sleek and modern; it could easily be mistaken for a trendy cocktail bar.

Not a typical New York Thai Restaurant. The flavors and textures of every plate were different than the usual Thai food served in the metropolitan area. The Phed Ma Kham (roasted duck in tamarind sauce) was a favorite plate. The atmosphere of the room is usual and pleasant.
Found this place on UberEats and absolutely loved it. I was really impressed with the flavor and the portion size for the price.

A very trendy and cute spot, right off Roosevelt which makes it alittle more quiet and special. I had the ozeki sake warm, peanuts cabbage salad, the duck speciality and pumpkin custard cake. Overall the meal was really good, portions are larger than expected. I went on Thursday early afternoon. I was 1 out of three tables there. The staff are dressed very nicely and polished. Overall I would def come back on a date or just to try out the menu more

I booked a reservation for 12 people. It was our wedding rehearsal lunch. I pre-ordered items a head of time because I wanted the food to come out once we were there. They were very accommodating and everything was prepared by the time we all arrived. So no time was wasted! I thought they would require me to put down a credit card but they didn't. There was more than enough food. See below for what we ordered. Some highlights were the lychee creme brule and the Tom Kha Soup. I also enjoyed the crab meat fried rice. Wish we ordered more of that. and not the pork knuckle. Pork knuckle was not what I expected. They were small and dry. Appetizers2 Tom Kha Soup 8.95. 2 Pla Muk Tord - Calamari  7.95.2 Yum Ma Mong Salad - Mango Shrimp Salad -  9.95 Curry Puffs  with Lunch SpecialsEntrees 2 Khao Soi -Chicken  11.95 2 Ka Prow Ka Moo - Pork Knuckle 15.951 chicken Panang Curry 10 1 Khao Phad Nura Poo -Crab Meat Fried Rice 13.95 2 See Khong Moo Aob- Ribs 15.95Lunch Specials 9.95 each Green Curry  Pad ThaiPad Kee Mao Pad See EwDessert 2 Lychee Creme Brule1 Coconut Ice cream2 Fried Green Tea Ice Cream

Good Thai place to eat in Jackson heights. It has a funky decor and their food is amazing. I love their soft shell crab when they are in season, they are nice and crunchy with good texture. Their Thai ice coffee is nice and strong. They also have a full bar but haven't tried their cocktails yet. Their staff is nice and friendly, would definitely come back
Thai iced tea - pretty good, not too sweet. It comes in a really large glass. Drunken noodle - not the best, but not bad. A little heavy on the flavoring, I would have liked it a little lighter.

This place has great ambience (lighting, music and decor), great service and really good Thai food.  The sauce on their pad thai isn't my favorite (only because I prefer a sweeter sauce, which I also feel the dish could use more of), but their curry puffs are really good, as is their fried rice with pineapple in it. The prices are also great. Been here a couple of times already and know that it will definitely be my go-to when in Jackson Heights.
A few pieces of chicken were undercooked, which made me worried I'd get sick.I have yet to find a Thai place in the area that can beat Ayada Thai.
We got the green curry and pad keep mao. The food was average. I feel like there are better Thai places around that area. However, this place has a nice atmosphere and the service was good.

Wow super fast delivery on a Saturday night! The crab wonton appetizers were warm and spicy with a great sweet sauce. I also ordered a Thai iced tea which was amazingly not spilled. I also ordered the phad kretiem vegetables with rice. It was a little basic but that's what I wanted. I prefers medium spicy and it was not spicy at all so would amp it up next time. Plenty of veggies and the garlic sauce was great!This place is cheap and delish!

Ordered through Yelp Eat24 from Kitchen79 for lunch. Didn't wait too long as the delivery was real quick within 10-15mins, superb service! Thoughts on the food:-- Chicken Pad Thai was good, nothing special but the serving was enough for two. Ordered in "mildly spicy" but didn't feel any kick to it at all, I've tried better ones but for the price it's alright. Lunch special includes an entrée & a choice of appetizer.-- First time to try the curry puff. Very flavourful & it wasn't overbearing. I loved the soft buttery & crispy pastry, it's very similar to an empanada but with a curried mashed potato filling.-- Kanom Jeeb was pretty good. It's like a steamed chicken dumpling but twice the portion size. It went really well with the tangy sauce.-- THAI ICED COFFEE IS REALLY GOOD. Hands down the best thai iced coffee I've ever had so far!  In sum: 4 & 1/2  Stars. Good food, large portions, & quick service. Would definitely order from them again. Thank you!

Needed some late night food and found this place. I ordered the phad Ka prow which was really good no the curry puffs which were also good but just softer than our normal Thai place. It's was $17+ for both.Glad they were open late. Just walked in to pick it up and they were very friendly on the phone and in person.
Food and service were good but the restaurant is a bit cold near the window.  The entree portions are decent and the food was very flavorful.  It's a small restaurant so I don't recommend big groups.

This is hands down my favorite Thai place!!! Their food is so delicious and flavorful. They also adjust spice levels according to your liking, which is amazing because I love spicy food. The chicken fried rice and the drunken noodles are always on the table when I go here. My cousin always takes advantage of their lunch special that I have yet to try. They are often very busy so some waiting might be involved. My only complaint is that there is a slight fish smell in the restaurant, but it's a small sacrifice to make for such delicious food. Please do yourself a favor and go here!

I'm a big fan of Kitchen 79 since they've been opened. I've never been disappointed about the food & service. I'd like to recommend Crab Meat Fried Rice, Salmon Chu Chee, Roti Panang and Shrimp Cake. And don't forget to try Thai Iced Green Tea !!!! Delivery is on time. Thank you Kitchen 79. Love love love.

My friends and I were in Corona and then we decided to see where to get food close by. This place was highly rated on Google so we came here for dinner today. The food was SO delicious. I had the crispy pork belly cooked in peanut sauce with white rice and it was SO good. The setting was dimly lit with lots of decorative (but not bright) lights and candles everywhere, marble tables and nice indie music. I will come here again next time I visit Jackson Heights and I will recommend this place to everyone.

When I first walked in, I noticed that there were chandeliers everywhere and the restaurant was very dim. (Just like every other Thai place) There was also a bar (I believe full service) Our server was nice, very attentive in filling the water glass.I ordered phaug tord (deep fried taro with a sweet chili sauce) and a tofu guay tiew pad see eiw. Both dishes were good, but not out of this world, haha. Prices were normal too.

The pan fried flat noodles were amazing and the basil fried rice was really good. The beer selection are pretty good and up to date.my wife had the basil fried rice with chicken and that was really good , she made the mistake and got it way too spicy lucky me I love spicy food

I stopped by for dinner with friends on a Sunday night. It was fairly busy and there was only one waitress for all the tables. It took her a while to get to us and she was very impersonal so I bumped the rating down a star. My friends and I were seated at very uncomfortable seats. We felt like we were sinking in the seats. I had to sit at the edge of my seat to feel a bit more comfortable. I ordered:- Thai iced coffee (If you like your coffee bitter but sweet, you should try this)- Yum Ma Mong salad (Such a refreshing salad. It's a bit on the sour side but that's what makes it good)- Lychee Crème Brûlée (I'm always down for some crème brûlée. The lychee flavor added a nice twist to it and I definitely recommend)I must say that I am not big on Thai food. I feel like maybe it's because I always associate it with pad thai (so sick of it after eating it one too many times). However, I know I'll be back for more at Kitchen 79.

Love this place. High quality, delicious food in a clean, comfortable restaurant. I came with 3 other people for a quick lunch, and their lunch special menu (served before 4pm) allows you to pick an appetizer as well as a main dish as part of your meal. My group ordered fried wontons filled with cream cheese and crab, salad with peanut sauce, red curry, green curry, basil fried rice, and pad thai. Everything tasted delicious, and the portions were perfect for lunch. There is plenty of seating inside, so I will definitely be bringing more friends along next time.

This is our favorite go-to dinner/lunch/anything spot in Queens! We love the Thai iced tea and crab Rangoon's!! Every time we go we order the same meals because we are so hooked! Service is great, friendly and quick!

The food would bring me back! Started off with some apps, the Pla Muk Tord (calamari) crispy with a great sauce. Kanom Jeeb (friend dumpling) the sauce made them better but it drenched up more of the oil than I would have liked. The thai tea was great but would have been even better with some boba! We had a guay tiew rad nha noodle with chicken, the gravy made it better. And I liked a gauy tiew pad kee mau noodle better though. For dessert we had the lychee creme brulee, a MUST have SOO good creamy not too sweet, great consistency with pieces of lychee. Fried banana rolls with green tea ice cream was overall too sweet, maybe due to the honey on the plate also, but not bad. Cons: There's only about 12 tables inside and they don't take reservations for parties of less than 6. The parking is a little bit of a pain but that's jackson heights in general.

This place is well decorated, a warm hearted service and attentive staff. The food are also delicious. Especially The Tom Yum Fried Rice, it is the best dish ever!! Really recommended to try. Khao soi is the dish that comes with both  fresh and crispy noodles, which makes it so unique and  the soup was rich and flavorful. We finish our meal with the Lynchee Cream Brulee, and we Win ;)Definitely come back!!The Thai Ice Green tea is also yummy.
This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants. . The staff is friendly and very polite. Everything that we have ordered has  been delicious.

I've been here a couple of times and I never leave disappointed! The menu is great, so many dishes to choose from. A lot of Thai places don't have such a big variety, but Kitchen 79 does. I love their service, everyone who works there is very nice and welcoming. It's a great spot to take your friends, or a date. My favorite drink to get is the Thai Iced Tea; their choices in drinks are pretty limited.My favorite dish is the Phad Ka Prow, with shrimp. I love spicy food, and whenever I ask them to make it "extra spicy", they deliver! Definitely recommend this spot to Thai lovers.
WORST SERVICE EVER!! I would give this negative 5 stars if I could. Food not so great either. If you can't treat your guests with respect and courtesy GET OUT OF THE BUSINESS!!

Had a  great dinner with family and friends at this small Jackson heights gem. The food was great the apps were tasty and the decor was cool. The staff was friendly and accommodating to our large party of 13. They made us feel welcome and at home. Tried the glass noodles and was satisfied.

I came to Kitchen 79 for dinner with a few of my friends. The restaurant is intimate and cozy. We ordered calamari, curry puffs, pad see ew, and the pad kei mao. The calamari was crispy and came with a delicious dipping sauce. The curry puffs were okay in my opinion. They are served with a cucumber dipping sauce that I was indifferent about. I don't think I would order the curry puffs again. My pad see ew was good. It was a fair portion and I even had enough for lunch the next day. My friends ordered the pad kei mao and thought it could have been spicier. As someone who doesnt really eat spicy food, I would agree. The dish was very mild. If you like spicy food, I recommend asking them to make the dish spicier. Overall it was a good experience at Kitchen 79. The staff were accommodating and nice. Definitely would recommend.Note: It was freezing out the night we ate here. We felt a great chill every time the door was opened. next time we would probably ask to be seated further from the door. The restaurant is also conveniently located by the train station. I suggest taking public transportation instead of driving. Finding parking around here is a nightmare.

Usually I never write reviews but I am so furious.  Worse customer service ever! I always give at least15% tip. They added 18% gratitude because there's seat for5 people. The fifth person is a 2 year old who doesn't eat.  No place I've been to add tip like this.  The waiter looks at us and being Asian she probably think we won't tip.  I am so angry for this insult.  The tall skinny female waiter is very rude and extremely late at waiting you after you sat down.  The waiters were talking bad about our table when I asked them to fix the check for the added tip.  That is the most unprofessional service I've had up to this date.  Food was ok mainly sweet, good presentation. I've had better basil fried rice elsewhere.  The appetizers are decent but main course don't order too much because all you taste will be sugar. I was going to order desert but I'm feeling too sugary.

The ambiance was very pretty. Service was excellent food was good except for the seafood noodle soup for which I did not mind the spice but the flavor doesn't have that 'wow' factor to it. The calamari and fried rice with the seafood dish was very good. Will visit again.
Great atmosphere,  but wasnt impress with the green curry or the pad thai dish. Service was good. Probably wont go back.

Lately I've been doing so much eating I haven't even got the time to write reviews but I had to come back to write about this one. First of all, I've been hearing about this place for a long time. When I had to chance to go to New York, I had to make sure I made time to go here. Almost 45 min of metro from where we were staying but it was worth it. I went on a Sunday afternoon in between lunch and dinner time so we would miss the crowd but also because we woke up really late haha. Ambiance: I have to say it wasn't what I was expecting (in a good way) from a Thai restaurant. The set up and decor was modern and upscale but still had a comfortable feel to it. I took a minute or two when I first arrived just to look at the surroundings. Drinks: - Thai Tea (3 cups there, 1 cup to go)I don't think I need to explain this, I love Thai tea! They also have a full bar for those who might want alcohol or wine. Appetizers: - Fried Tofu- Steamed Dumplings (Kanom Jeeb)- Calamari- Tom Yum SoupThe first 3 appetizers are my go to whenever I go to any Thai restaurants. The fried tofu is pretty standard with good sweet chili sauce, tofu was fried well. The dumplings was also really nicely done and not all Thai places get it right. The calamari was also great, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside! My friend had the Tom yum soup and he really liked it. The appetizers were all great, we cleaned the plates and bowl.Entrees: - Shrimp Pad Thai- Roast Duck in Red Curry. Pad Thai is usually my go to whenever it's the first time I visit a Thai restaurant so I have a baseline to compare. It was well balanced, I would say slightly towards the sweet side which is my preference, so I loved it. Had to box some of it to take with me because of all the appetizers but it was still good later! The roast duck was fantastic. First of all, the plating was basically eye candy, you just can't help but snap pictures of it. And the taste did not fall short either, I definitely recommend everything we've had there. While we were there, I noticed the next table had order a whole fish, that's definitely something I will try next time I visit this place. Service: Awesome friendly service, food arrived at reasonable times, made good suggestions, made sure our glasses are never emptied, checked in on us on a timely manner. All in all, well worth the trip and hype! Definitely will be back to try other dishes!!

The place is legit! Looks kinda like a dinning room/bathroom because of all tiles but the food steals the show. Try the curries. Try the curry puffs and fried taro cake. A cute date night place. Planning come come again soon!

This is probably my favorite Thai place ever. The place is so nice and spacious with a beautiful touch of class. The decor is modern. The staff are friendly. The food is AMAZING bursting with flavors. My sister had ordered the crab fried rice, all I can say is wow! It's freshly made with crab meat and the flavors are superb. Never had it before till now. By far it's a new add on to my palate. Will definitely be coming again and recommending this to everyone.

As soon as I discovered this place for local Thai cuisine I had to come by for a visit and it was well worth it. I had my birthday party here and they were able to accommodate such a large group under their reservations. Everything from their appetizers to desserts was delicious. The deep fried soft shell scrab, the egg rolls, the fried whole fish, pad thai, duck curry, Thai iced tea, etc. Literally you could order just about anything and be completely satisfied with your meal. The place is beautiful with the arrangement of seats and tables and modern decor is sure to impress. I'm so glad to now have a go to Thai spot in queens! I only wish they had a parking lot so I could come by more often, but it is located near the train station so be sure to drop by, this place is a true gem!

As I was eating, I kept thinking to myself, "Self, this is the most unkindest cut of all." (Please indulge me with some dramatic license here.) But seriously, how I could be enjoying myself so shamelessly when all the while I was betraying my beloved Thai go-to, Sripraphai?  Clearly, I got over it:Anyway, our meal here was very solid.  The biggest standout was the ultra-fresh tasting Seafood Salad, which popped with lemongrass flavor.  Tofu-filled Summer Rolls were a nice, light, non-fried way to begin.  Cut into bite-size pieces, this was a very shareable starter.  Though the kid, a self-avowed tofu hater, managed to scarf down most of this.  Another dish worth mentioning is the Whole Fried Fish with Mango Salad. Though the fish was perfectly cooked, the Mango Salad lacked the bright herbal punch of Srip's version.  (Yeah, I went there).  Not worth $27 (!).This spot apparently prides itself on a focus on Southern Thai cooking, with a few menu options that fall into this particular category.  We tried a Southern Eggplant curry with Tofu that was very brothy with lots of heat (no coconut milk).  Honestly, there were a couple (Southern) meat-based choices that looked more intriguing, but we were with my pescetarian brother, so we accommodated him.I rarely mention service, unless it is exceptional in some way.  In this case, we enjoyed exceptionally gracious and helpful service, in sharp contrast to Srip's often impersonal, rushed variation.  Ambience here felt more zen too.Ultimately, this was just a dalliance. No matter how much I stray, I always return to Srip.  But this was no one-off.  I'll be back to explore some of the more meaty menu options sans my tofu, fish and seafood-centric brother.
Best Thai food! It tastes sooo goodand the server was so kind and friendlyAmazing place! I didn't know this pretty place is in JH

A horrible dining experience. The food made me physically ill. There actually was tissue paper that I found in my meal. Unknowingly, I ate some of this paper and had to vomit. To this moment, I still feel ill and have lost my appetite. Avoid this restaurant at all costs. It is not worth getting sick.

I'd concur with what seems to be trending as a 4-star review. First off, it really is a nice space that's conducive to a pleasant evening out--even though I was here alone just getting off a flight. Ordered Khao Phad Ka Prow hot and on the latter I found it just right to my liking. Hate when you can tell they dumbed it down to mild because you don't look Thai (that'd be me, Mr. Midwestern white boy). Ordered with pork which while quite good, there was not a lot of it. Savory, nice peppy basil and onions and the rice was quite tasty, seasoned about right. I note that I arrived on a late flight and was eating at 4:00 p.m. which is a recipe for poor food and service and locations. Not here.I found this amusing and must pass it on: of course they serve Chang beer which almost any Thai restaurant with a liquor license will. They had bottles on display along with the wines, etc. The other prominent beer option? Here goes: Pabst Blue Ribbon... for those hipsters that just must I guess. Gross.Ah well, nicely done Kitchen 79. You've given the locals a pretty nice venue that has an intimate feel without having to leave the 'hood. If I lived here I'd be returning for sure.Overall:Restaurant interior/design: 5 starsFood: 4 starsService: 4 starsPrice: 3 stars ($11 for a plate of rice with a little meat... not overly impressed on this.

Sexy.  Intimate.  Great for dates!  Hell, it is great for wedding proposals.  I love the interior!  Lots of thought and insight put into details.  You can tell they want it to have a lounge like appearance while still balancing a nice dinner menu.  The music is light and unlike most bar/dinner arrangements you can have an actual conversation and hear what the other person is saying at all times.  I went with the duck noodle soup.  It was in pho broth which was heavenly.  Inside my bowl was a huge duck leg complete with fat and skin.  May I say more please?  I loved it.  Right before I arrived, there was a couple who thanked the waiters countlessly over the great experience they just had.  That led me to believe only amazing things about Kitchen 79.  I would totally go back in a heartbeat.  :)  Thank you Kitchen 79 for making my day!  (well, if I wanted to be persnickety, evening!)
Good for big party.  Lunch special is a good deal. You get appetizer and entree for under $10. Good portion and taste is well balanced. Friendly service.
Very tasty Thai food with fair prices. Service was kind and prompt. If you're in the area for lunch during the week, check them out. You won't be disappointed.
There  are a few Thai places around but this one is our favorite!  Food is always good regardless of eating at the restaurant or getting take out.

What we were looking for was the opportunity to try something different.  Various Thai restaurants in the area have their own specialties, but rarely do so many dishes on a menu appeal to me.  79 is our new favorite.  I won't bash anyone else in this review, just tell you why you have to go there.We tried over-ordering the first time, getting lots of dishes from a very large menu.  Each dish was not particularly large but neither was the price tag.  I couldn't believe the check was as low as it was for as full as I was for what I ate...Wait a minute, I haven't even started talking about the food...  It is incredible!  Super ingredients, done beautifully, plenty of spice.  I'm at a loss for words.Well not really... delicious!  I asked the waiter to not white spice me, as this routinely happens in other restaurants.  They will make the hot dishes as hot as you want them, but never does the chili overpower the fresh taste.Having been to Bangkok and having dined with Thai people, this is as authentic as you can get.  When asked "do you want it served Thai style?"--answer yes.What does this mean?  It means your beef or pork salad will not look fancy or be served in large pieces but ground so that is absorbs the fresh flavors.I'm a super-stickler for som tom (papaya salad) and I was slightly disappointed that they don't serve it with salted black crab as I've had it before.  My disappointment lasted only until I tasted it.  Best in NYC to the extent of my knowledge!  Better than some I got in Bangkok.  This is just my opinion.  Don't be afraid to let them crank up the heat as the crushed chili oil will marry the shaved papaya.Noodle dishes!  Order at least one to share if not two or three.  The wok's breath infuses the fresh rice noodles with a smoky pop.  I had a favorite place for a "drunken noodle" before coming here.  I have a new favorite, 79.  I'm sorry if I repeat myself too much.  Order the proteins you like and they will make it amazing.I tried something a little more subtle on another trip, a rice noodle with squid and chicken.  This is not fiery like the papaya salad, just so good that you will be struggling not to order than along with every other item on their menu on subsequent visits.That's just the thing: you can't go just once.  You might not select the most amazing dish, but if you balance your meal with multiple courses and share a bunch, you are in for a treat.The salads are fresh and a nice balance to some of the other appetizers.  The stuffed pepper with ingredients that don't seem to make sense: I don't know how it works only that it works.  Curry puffs are delicious!  Chicken wings are excellent.  I wasn't the hugest fan of the shrimp cakes, but it's a little more subtle than what typically strikes my palate.I haven't even told you about every dish we've ordered.  I don't have to.  Just go there, try a bunch of things and you're going to be back again struggling with decisions to try new things or rely on old favorites.

Kitchen 79 is another reason why Queens is the standout neighborhood when it comes to diverse cuisine in New York City. Kitchen 79 is a great addition to the multitude of Thai restaurants in Queens which includes one of my favorites SriPhaPhai. I came here with a friend for dinner on his recommendation and I've been meaning to try it out after his rave about it and he was right. The food was spectacular. I had ordered the wild boar with spicy curry paste and the server actually warned me it was quite spicy. Now, when it comes to spice, I always say I can handle it and then regret it afterwards. I actually debated whether or not to get a different dish but I'm so glad I stuck with my first choice. Thanks to the addition of the baby corn, Thai eggplant, and bamboo shoots for fresh vegetables, it toned down the spicy curry paste but it was still quite spicy. However, it was that really good kind of spice in spite of my low spice tolerance, I really enjoy. It burned but it burned good and still flavorful because of the basil leaves in the dish too. White rice helps as well.  As a specialty dish, it stands out.Our service was excellent throughout the entire meal thanks to the attentive staff. The decor is dark and modern with the the black brick interlaced with white throughout the space. Some of the seating arrangements are a bit cramped but compared to other places in Manhattan, you could do a lot worse. Go for the Thai food at Kitchen 79. Happy eating and remember: Don't deny, satisfy!

Had the chicken pad Thai and spring rolls which were delicious. Wait staff was attentive and courteous, super chill nice decorated city/barn atmosphere. My party tried various items on menu and they all really enjoyed their choices as well. Best part - Free beer when you check in!!!!
We stopped here late on a Thursday night, a half hour before close, hungry and exhausted. The staff was welcoming, encouraged us to take our time and enjoy our wine, and the food was fantastic.

Finally stopped by Kitchen 79 last night with a friend. I'm often looking to find great places in the neighborhood to change things up from time to time. I'm glad I remembered this place and gave it a try!The restaurant itself has a nice ambience. We sat at the booth in the back next to widow. The table was huge (especially for the 2 of us)! The other tables in the middle of the restaurant looked comfortable as well. Really enjoyed the music they were playing and appreciated that the volume allowed for conversation. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. One of the dishes we ordered was mixed up, but they were quick to fix it with no problem.Now onto the food. We ordered an appetizer from their chef specialities menu (pictured). I don't recall the name exactly... mummy shrimp?... but it was delicious. The shrimp was skewered with a long thin pepper and they were wrapped in bacon. It had a good balance of spicy and sweet, especially when dipped into the accompanying sauce. It also had some greens and cherry tomatoes as a base. We also ordered pineapple chicken fried rice & beef pad sei eiw. We asked for extra paltes so that we could share and were very satisfied with our choices. Definitely recommend!

One of my favorite places in all of Jackson Heights! This is an up and coming Thai restaurant in the neighborhood and its review status does not lie. With just three people at lunch special prices it came out to just over $10 a person - BUT the food and service and atmosphere and ambience is reminiscent of the restaurants that are visited by the upper echelon. We had the Papaya salad, green curry, pad see ew and curry puffs. Not one thing to complain about. Finished off the meal with green Thai iced tea and it was perfect. All of these are a must have. One of my first reviews in a long time but I felt as though it was necessary for an amazing restaurant like this. Support the small businesses!!!

Kitchen 79 is a hidden gem! The food was flavorful, the workers were kind and the place had a great atmosphere. A group of us were meeting here for lunch, but a few of our friends were running late. The owners of the establishment were so nice, they didn't force us to order or give us an attitude. The lunch special was a great bargain. The food was fantastic and it was relatively cheap.

Truly 5 stars at this place.  Great service, large menu selection, and reasonable prices for the portion sizes.  I had the panang curry, and mopped up every bit of sauce with the leftover rice... it was that good!  Friendly waitstaff, no one seemed to mind the constant questions that every table seemed to ask.  Definitely worth the trip to Jackson Heights!

Im so lucky to be living on the same street! It's some place you can always bring your guests too. I have learned to love thai food because this restaurant, a few steps from home, serves great cuisine. Their interior design is really nice. You'll love the ambiance. And the owner has always been very accomodating. I've brought almost every guest i had to this place. My personal favorite is the Thai Noodle Khua Gai and Thai Ice Tea (theirs really tastes wonderful!)

Quick delivery via Seamless. The drunken noodle-like dish (can't remember the name),  and chicken and pork satay appetizers were very good, the pad thai less so, which is surprising given that it's their most popular dish according to the app.  The appetizers came with this outstanding peanut-based sweet sauce.Pretty sure I have dined there before actually and really enjoyed the food.  But this review is for a recent delivery.

My favorite Thai restaurant of all times!! Guess what!?! I only experienced this restaurant yesterday for the first time ever! That's right first time !! Let's just keep this simple and straight to the point ....The food: AMAZING!!!!The service: AMAZING!!!!!The decor: AMAZING!!!!! The experience: Well, you'll have to go and see for yourself!! You won't be disappointed! I promise !!!

My husband and I came here for dinner before heading to the airport. We got the Yum Ma Ming salad, Pad See Ew and the lychee creme brûlée for dessert. The salad was very good however I did find a short hair in it... other than that it was good. I thought the Pad See Ew was a bit sweet for my taste but I think most people would like it. I really like the Lychee Creme Brûlée and the presentation is pretty. I think it would be better if they put lychee jelly at the bottom instead of the canned lychee. Overall I did enjoy this restaurant and will probably go back again.

* 4.5 stars * (only because I feel I haven't tried enough to judge completely) So happy I found this place upon yelping Thai restaurants in Queens. I visited Kitchen 79 on February 6th (almost three weeks ago...yes and I'm writing the review now) with the bf and it was REALLY pleasant. Here's why:We got there roughly around 3:52 pm as the trains took forever and yeah, a pretty LATE lunch. The $7.50 Chicken, Tofu or Vegetable and the $8.50 Choice of Shrimp or Beef lasted only until 4:00 pm. The friendly lady greeted us and gave us the lunch menu. It was 3:56 pm and she told us we only had a few minutes to put our order in if we wanted the lunch menu. Now she could've gave us a dirty look and pass us the dinner menu but she didn't. Thumbs up, thumbs up!! APPETIZERS--we chose the 'ka nom jeep' (steamed fried dumplings with minced chicken) and the deep fried spring rolls with mixed veggies and glass noodles. Those were appetizing for sure. I really liked it. I can't really 100% remember how it tasted like (I will make sure I write reviews on the spot or shortly after from now on)...but salivating nonetheless because I remember really enjoying it. I got the Pad Thai (always have to get the pad thai at every Thai restaurant as I said in my other Khao Thai review) and it was delicious. The portion was a pretty good size and I was stuffed. Can't forget about the huge mug of Thai Iced Tea for only $3. Oh boy. SO WORTH IT. The bf got shrimp Khao Phad Ka Prow. It was delectable as well.Service was superb (user experience is so important). The decor is another thumbs up. I was super pleased and I cannot wait to revisit!

I got here on a Saturday at 7p and the place was half full. We were kindly welcomed and gracefully served by a welcoming and attentive staff. The place has a sexy look... good for a romantic date. Labb with pork: although the minced pork was tasty, the greens that came with it were cut too big, and never really mixed well with it. It felt like eating plain lettuce with meat on the side. Moo yaang (grilled tender pork): although the meat was tender, it wasn't as hot as it should have been; also, the sauce was uninspiring. Phed ma kham (roasted duck in tamarind sauce...$18): this sauce instead was very good, and the portion size huge; however, the meat itself was kinda tough, and the steamed veggies beyond boring.Overall, I only tasted three dishes, but because of the fact that they tend to be popular, they probably represented a general idea of the chef's skills. I found them ok, but with considerable issues that prevented them from being good. Despite the kind service, I'm not sure I'd come back.

Ta ThaiLocated in a predominately Latin America area is Kitchen 79. A rather stylish, modern with mild remnants of the culture behind the cuisine. That and the Santa Clause in the glass that looks like a fancy dessert from afar.  Kitchen 79 has all the staples you are looking for from the curry puff & tom yum soup as starters to the pad thai, pad se ew & my go to....crab fried rice as the main dish.The two best dishes I've tried so far is the curry puffs and the crab fried rice. Both have a good mix of spices that don't overpower the pallet. The crab fried rice had multiple healthy chunks of crab cooked just right. Potions for prices are reasonable. A starter and main dish for dinner will be under $20, maybe slightly over with tax & tip.The most disappointing dish was the Tod Mun Goong (Shrimp Cake Fritter). While the sauce was excellent, the flavor was ok. Breaking into the outer layer was difficult since it had been fried to a crisp, but not burnt in any way. Maybe for other people it tastes better, but for me I wasn't a fan. Overall: 3.75 StarsSolid Thai food. Certainly not the best in the area, but it does the cuisine justice.Portions for the price are hard to beat (possible, but hard).Reservations are not necessary, but I recommend them between 700m and 800pm just in case.Ambiance is sleek modern and perfect for a romantic get together with your loved one.Kitchen 79 is worth a try.I seem to always have problems writing reviews for Thai restaurants these days. Sorry if it sounds bad.I also apologize for some of the blurryish pictures. I botched that up too.

We were promptly seated when we arrived. The restaurant was fairly quiet with 3 other small parties. The hostess was very friendly and seated us in a large booth by the window. The food here is better than the more hyped place in Woodside; I actually prefer their food over the other one. We ordered the curry puff, beef salad, calamari and Wonton soup for appetizers. The shredded beef salad had a much more pleasing taste than other restaurants as it did not burn my throat eating it. Curry puff and calamari was tasty as well. We did not care too much for the Wonton soup, although my non-Asian husband loved it.For entrees, we had the chicken yellow curry, Singapore rice noodles and oven baked pork ribs. The curry was sweet in taste and excellent with their jasmine rice. Oven baked pork ribs had a tangy spicy sauce over the crispness. The Singapore rice noodles was too salty for my taste buds and we had a few uncooked Chinese vegetable stems in it that ruined the taste of the dish for me. Dessert was coconut ice cream and fried green tea ice cream. My daughter and husband devoured the coconut ice cream and fought over the last bite. The fried dough was crispy and delicious but the green tea ice cream was too hard - as if it was sitting in the freezer for too long.All in all, we would go back again!

I usually go to another Thai place in flushing cuz the all Thai restaurants that I have tried that one is the one I like the most. Since I live in Jackson heights I decided to give a chance to kitchen 79 and I don't regret it the taste of the tom yum soup is very real Thai and my second favorite dish green papaya salad I love the flavor the only thing I didn't like it's that instead of being full of green papaya it had cabbage which it's not my favorite. They have good lunch specials and happy hour wow

Just want to say right off the bat, I'm coming here again. I'm definitely coming here again. It's about an hour and a half away from where I live and I'm coming here again. I arrived a couple minutes before my friend did. I was seated and given a menu while I waited. We had agreed to meet at 6:30 so the restaurant was pretty empty. (But boy did it fill up later on) I asked a waitress which Thai salad she thought was better and she went in great detail about the flavors and spice of each, which salad was most popular and which one was most authentic to Thai food. It was unexpected and much appreciated since my questions about dishes are usually responded with "they are all good...'why do you think they're on the menu...duh'". My friend arrived and we ordered the green curry, pork satay, green mango salad and the tom yum soup. Pork satay (B)The flavor was very good. It was super juicy and the peanut sauce and vinegar sauce that accompanied the pork were delicious as well. I would give this dish an A if the pork wasn't so chewy. I could barely eat the meat due to the really chewy fat. But great flavor. Mango salad (A)Omg this was delicious. I asked for spicy and they definitely gave me spicy. It was sweet and sour and salty. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the mango was slightly sweet but had a great crunch to it. The cashews have a nice creaminess and small crunch and the spice was so spicy I started sweating, but it was fantastic and I loved every minute of it. Tom yum soup (A)Definitely one of the better soups that I've had. Tangy and perfectly sour. There was cauliflower in it which was surprising (but I love cauliflower so no complaint from me). I was able to get just vegetable Tom yum as well. Not as spicy as I would have liked but very very good. Green curry (B)Not the best green curry I've had, but not the worst. It was a little too watery for my liking. It wasn't spicy at all which I was a little disappointed about, but my friend is very sensitive to spice so it was perfect for her. She really enjoyed it and would give it an A. Each to their own. Great and very friendly service. Nicely decorated and there's a small little bar (seats about 5 or so people). Lots of mirrors and a nice ambiance at night.

After an impromptu decision, I found myself eating at Kitchen 79. It's fairly new and I had been wanting to try them out. First thing that pops out is decor. It's beautiful. Love the black white. Modern, edgy with this masterpiece on the wall and sleek all around.Staff are amazing. Greeted, got me water, and unlike service we sometimes get, a genuine desire to help me figure out what to get. Not too hungry, I started with Tom Kha soup and a green Thai iced tea. The Green tea comes out in this huge mug. It was delicious. My soup was perfect. So flavorful. Then I decided to try out the papaya salad. I was deciding on getting it with crab or not. The waitress was honest and real. So I ordered without crab and spicy. Another home run. Place was not overly crowded but busy for sure. Everything was delicious. Staff were amazing and they had Planet of the Apes on as a bonus. Definitely try them out!!

I ordered the drunken noodle with vegetable and spring rolls, both were absolutely delicious. Vegetable were fresh and I was pleasantly surprised by the variety. Food was served promptly and piping hot. Between the quality, service and taste, you can't go wrong with this lunch special!!

Delicious food, great ambience, reasonable prices, and white sangria! The fried calamari appetizer and curry puffs were delicious. The pad Thai is also very delicious, and the green coconut curry. $3 huge Thai iced teas, and $5 white/red sangria during happy hours.
A nice find! A slightly different Thai restaurant with a great lunch combo. Must try their Pad Prik Sod, spicy but great. Also good dessert and Thai Ice Coffee

Me and my cousin stopped by for an early dinner on a weekday. There was maybe one group by the window so it wasn't busy at all. The service was A+ but the food was below average. I ordered the fried calamari and chicken thai fried rice. These are usually my go to thai foods. The calamari was good but the fried rice was so bad i had a gag reflex while eating it. It wasnt spicy (i wanted medium spicy) but very sweet. I couldnt eat more than 3 bites. It was that bad.2 star rating for the service and decor.
This place is nice. Good for dates. Food taste good and the server are friendly.

My family and I really love this place. It's a hidden gem with delicious food and good prices. The staff is very friendly.The only issue I ever had with them was that one time our brown rice smell funky and tasted weird and when we told the waiter he just gave us a blank look and just said okay... It was awkward and there was no resolve, which annoyed me because we eat there once a week so I felt unappreciated as a loyal customer.
Food and drinks were delicious! I would definitely be back! The lychee sangria was sooo tasty.

Wow just wow. So close to my house, quick service, beautiful place and delicious food. Their pad Thai was so flavorful and huge!! The pineapple fried rice was gone in minutes. We cannot wait to come back and try the other dishes.
Nice FoodThe frozen Chai Teas are delicious, as is the tamarind duck. Definitely the best Thai food that I have tasted in all my trips I will eat there.

Finally came here after having this on my bookmarks. Decor was nice and modern. Really comfortable seats. Came here expecting cocktails but all they have is beer, wine and sake. Now, the food. Started with classic curry puffs but found them to be on the bland side. Tamarind duck was pretty good but nothing spectacular. Hate how they just throw some steamed vegetables on the side just to fill the plate. No flavor. Just straight up steamed vegetables. Also had the crispy pork eggplant basil but it was soooo good. Texture and flavor was all there. Fried green tea ice cream was mediocre. I'll give this place another chance solely based on the eggplant basil.

Stopped by for a quick bowl of khao soi the other night and it came out real quick and was good, though not great. There wasn't enough curry soup in the bowl to really get the crispy egg noodles wet and into that perfect slightly-soggy-on-the-outside-still-crisp-on-the-inside state that makes khao soi so delightful.

An excellent Thai restaurant. A very rare full 5 stars and they deserve it. Very authentic and a welcome taste. We had the very good Mango salad with shrimp, excellent Basil chicken and excellent (very spicy) Catfish special. Fried rice was very good as well. All in all a good experience and we will definitely be back. Highly recommended.

Went with my family here on a sunday night and it wasn't really busy. We ordered the fried fish,Some kind of spicy fried rice with beef and beef pad Thai. The fish was really good along with the mango salad it comes with. The pad Thai was good and flavorful. Their lychee sangria was good also. The decor was really nice as well. Would come back again to try their lunch specials.

Great Thai food. I have tried it twice and the food was delicious. I heard they specialize in southern Thai food whereas Ayada and Sripiphai specialize in northern Thai food. I tried Gaeng Tai Pla, a mackerel and shrimp soup, most recently and it was amazing. I didn't try any of the dishes that are more popular in America, but I'm sure they are good too.The most surprising thing to me about Kitchen 79 was how nice it was inside the restaurant. There are few restaurants in Jackson Heights that are trendy like this. And the prices are about the same as the other Thai places in Elmhurst and Woodside. I went on a Tuesday night at 9 pm and it was 3/4 full - cool  and not typical in Jackson Heights. I think it would be a good place to bring someone from out of town, if you want to bring them to a nice looking restaurant without leaving the neighborhood.One last thing. The spicy food is actually quite spicy. I was pleasantly surprised by the heat level both times. But if you aren't used to eating very spicy food regularly, be aware that this on another level.

First off, I'm glad I read the reviews. We went here last night. We had amazing service! I mean the wait staff and hostess were extremely nice. The minute we walked in we were greeted immediately. It's very dimly lit place so as mentioned before its great for a date night. The food was nicely plated, flavorful, hot, and fresh. The price is perfect. We shared the lychee creme brûlée which was delicious and it was only $5! To be honest I would come here again.
from just the pad thai ..too sweet. way too sweet. the shrimp was gross. couple of them had poo veins... they didn't taste fresh at all. they should provide some spice condiments. this was delivery.

Awesome! Food came out fast, large portions. We ordered beef pad Thai and some chili chicken. Seasoning was spot on. Definitely going to bring my mom here for her birthday. Place is very clean and lovely decor.
Very cute and stylish little restaurant. Service was courteous and food was good. Lots of vegetarian options.
Just went there through recommendations from my friend. It's indeed nice and cozy place. The staff there was so polite with lots of suggestions. We enjoyed the food so much.

Kitchen 79 looks and feels a little more upscale than other Thai places in the area bit without much of a price difference. Definitely very dark if that helps you get an idea. There are candles but you still can't really see your food if you're there at night. I just like to see my food. It's like a guessing game when it's that dark: "Oh, some chicken... that's squid... hmm onion... nope a pepper!" but everything tasted good so we made it through!Besides eating in the dark, the food was good but not mind-blowing to me. Not all food is or has to be though. Definitely solid food with fair prices and a more sophisticated ambiance.That being said, I do think there are a lot of other great places in the area. I personally prefer SriPraiThai, Ayada, and Arunee overall vibe and food wise. If you're looking for a Thai spot to bring a date, maybe this is your joint. It's dark enough she may not see that booger in your nose or that weird stain on your shirt you couldn't get out before leaving the house.
Worst highly pricy food and service if you want to get it then you can go in there . Don't waste your money

This place has by far the best Thai iced tea I've ever had. It's funny that I didn't like the drink before, but I guess I just never had well-made Thai iced tea. The mug was huge, and I could only finish half of it (a shame since it was so good). After looking through the reviews on here, I decided to order the duck noodle soup. The portion was fairly large (for me at least). It came with a nice and rich broth, thin rice noodles, and a large roasted duck leg. The waitress was very nice and attentive, offering me spicy condiments for the soup as well. There were four different condiments, and she recommended the spicy red paste for my dish. The servers were very nice to me, and gave a smile whenever they passed by, which I really appreciate.I will definitely come back here again. I'm excited to try the lychee creme brulee and curry puffs.

First of all, a big Yay! for Kitchen 79 for extending lunch specials to weekends. You get a fairly wide selection of starters--options cover one side of the menu--and the main courses are listed on the other side. In addition to the typical offerings, these guys offer quite a few alternatives for the jaded Thai food enthusiast. Spelled out with Thai script and names, some menu items sound unfamiliar but are actually dishes we know well.It's not just the Thai iced coffee and tea that are big--the food portions are pretty generous too. Decor is tasteful, and the cushioned seats are comfy and inviting. The only distractions were the "old digs smell" when you first walk in, and the black tape used to patch up the bench cushions. Our waiter was friendly and accommodating.Yum Woon Sen - 4.5 starsExcellent balance of flavor. Maybe they toned down the tanginess, but I took a half star off because it lacked a little punch.Ka Nom Jeep, fried chicken dumplings - 4 starsDespite being a lunch special appetizer, its texture and sweet tangy sauce were surprisingly satisfying.Pad Thai - 3 starsDrenched with sauce. Not a good version of the classic.Guay Tiew Pad Sei Eiw (a.k.a. Pad See Ew) - 3.5 starsAlso heavy on the sauce and very salty. This version lacks breadth of flavor.Khao Phad, fried rice - 3.5 starsNot bad. Avoid ordering it with beef. It was incredibly leathery.Gaeng Kiew Warn, green curry with crispy pork - 4.5 starsThe crispy pork is similar to Chinese roasted pork belly, and is a refreshing choice of meat for all curries. The curry itself is pretty standard in taste--nothing wrong with reconstituted paste--but the bamboo shoots, peppers and meat were quality ingredients. Lots of novel items on the menu to try, so we'll be back!

My boyfriend and I came here for lunch. Pretty place. We checked in on Yelp and got lychee mimosa. We got them non-alchololic. This place still can't beat Arunee which is right up the block. I was a bit disappointed to see dust on the bottom of my glass. My boyfriend's plate was chipped. This made me upset.The food was alright. The crab rangoons are great! The chicken fried dumplings are okay.The guay tiew pad kee mao was alright, and my spicy basil fried rice was decent.I'd rather go to Arunee, bigger portions, and better tasting food.

This is probably the best Thai restaurant I've been to in NYC. Their staff are really nice and polite and the place itself is very beautiful. The prices are reasonable, the dishes are always delicious no matter how many times I go. It's never bland or underwhelming. Their Khao Phad is my go-to and one of the best ones I've ever had. Please order their Geoy Hoy Cheese- it has crab meat and cream cheese, yes it's freaking delicious- it's one of the best things they have to offer! And please make sure to order their Thai Iced Tea! It's so rare to find a great one and it's perfect! It's not watered down, it's not too sweet and it's a pretty great size for $3.50. Definitely recommend for a date or a hangout. Such a gem in Jackson Heights.

After reading the rave reviews I decided to give this place a try but I respectfully disagree. I ordered the basil chicken and it was extremely sweet and the vegetables were soft not crunchy also the rice was mushy I didn't enjoy it at all maybe the noodle dishes are ok but I will stick to my favorite Thai spot BTW the cashier didn't even say thankyou which is a big no no to me

Worst Thai delivery I've ordered in the area, it was nothing like Thai food. I ordered basil fried rice, there was no hint of basil, rice were undercooked. I asked them to make it spicy (it wasn't). It was sweet actually, there were no veggies as mentioned in description. Basically money down the drain
Excellent Thai food, well prepared, and delivered quickly.  I also enjoy their well appointed dining room.This is a great neighborhood place.  I prefer it to the inconsistent Arunee Thai.

Let me start by saying that the decor is gorgeous! Beautiful ambience. GREAT staff. Since Thai all appetizers are delicious I decided to tell the waiter, "Copter" to choose his favorite 5 apps. Well we were not at all disappointed- TRUST ME!!! We also ordered the traditional Thai Iced Tea(just delicious), Thai Iced Coffee & Pumpkin Custard (TO DIE FOR). That's all she wrote...

Lovely lunch ! Lovely atmosphere The lunch was an app and entree (8$/9$ depending on meat you choose) Free glass of lychee mimosa (I got non alcoholic )The pad Thai I got was perfect and so was the app I got which was a salad with peanut dressing. I would highly recommend this place because the service was also great
Love this unassuming little place in Jackson Heights. The food and service is really excellent.  I especially like the variety of chili sauces they give you.  Def worth trying.

My sisters and I took our mom here on Mother's day without a reservation and we were promptly seated within 15 minutes. I can tell that they were understaffed especially with the holiday rush but the servers did their best to accommodate our needs. We ordered the following:1. Fried calamari ($7) & fried wontons ($5/5pcs): They were so great. Crispy and not overly oily or fried. We inhaled it all. 2. Chicken pad thai was perfectly done. Texture was on point with enough flavor and sauce to go around. 3. Beef masaman curry: For the first time, I think I've gotten more beef than the curry itself. Beef was a little tough and could have been more tender. 4. Beef pineapple fried rice: The flavor was not what I was used to in other thai restaurants. It was odd and we all couldn't even take a second bite. It was much better the next day when I refried it with egg and some kitchen. 5. Shrimp drunken noodles: The flavor was nice and spicy and the shrimp was big and succulent. 6. Asian broccoli with pork: I loved how the pork actually tasted like pork belly with it's tender flesh and melting fat unlike a lot of other thai places. It could have been a little less salty but overall, it was good. Shout out to our waitress! You really made our Mother's day dinner a pleasant one!

This is such a modern restaurant for this neighborhood. The inside is clean and nicely furnished. The service was wonderful! Now onto the food...Pla Muk Tord - Crispy Calamari, amazing amazing amazing. Get this! There is a substantial amount of calamari and it is not drenching in oil, unlike other experiences I had. Som Tum Thai Salad - Refreshing. The peanuts with the papaya, make the perfect marriage. Khao Phad Nuea Poo - Best fried rice I had ever, and the crab meat did not have that rubbery texture. I recommend it!Gaeny Dang Curry - I have never had green curry. This dish made me a lover of it. The dish way flavorful and milky, but not heavy. Pad Thai Noodle with beef - I recommend getting this classic dish! You know if a Thai restaurant is good if their Pad Thai dish tastes good. Gauy Tiew Yen Ta Fo Noodle- The waitress gave us some background information about this dish, which I very appreciated. She told us how the dish is more on the sweet side, which can throw people off. The dish is definitely something different, oh and the broth is pink! The fishballs were the highlight of this dish.Suki Talay Noodle- Huge portion, can be shared with 2-3 people. The mussels tasted fresh. This is a good dish overall. 7 dishes for 4 people came out to roughly $80 and full bellies, come here soon!

Must be missing something. Placed a pickup order via one of their many online ordering options (where you can't get their lunch specials) and arrived AFTER the estimate to be told it wasn't ready yet (45 minutes later at a time when when they had zero customers and no deliveries going out). Stood there on sticky floors by the bar and finally got my food, a very underwhelming  Satay Gai / Satay Moo 16.00 Make it with: Chicken and some eh Curry Puffs 15.00.Yum Woon Sen SaladInstructions: Mild please1$9.00Gaeng Panang CurryMake it with: ChickenHow Spicy?: Mild1$10.00Jasmine Rice1$2.00Khao Phad Sup Pa RodMake it with: Chicken1$10.00Pad Thai NoodleMake it with: Chicken1$10.00
This place is better than any other Thai restaurant in Manhattan. I keep coming back to Queens just to eat here. The Lychee mimosas are pretty good.

Maybe the best Thai restaurant in NYC. Between Kitchen 79, and Ayada, the area has a killer Thai food scene. The two stand out as clear winners, even a notch above Sripraphai. You don't have to take my word for it - K79 has Michelin star to back it up. The menu is far from your boring traditional manhattan generic Thai selection. K79 offers various regional Thai dishes, not found elsewhere in NYC that would typically require a 21 hour flight.

Celebrated a birthday lunch here, service was great and food was good. Chinese Broccoli with Crispy Pork is awesome as was the BBQ Pork. Pad Thai Shrimp was tasty and the drink specials were good. That was the first occasion.The second visit was for dinner. We had to flag the waiters down for every item, they never checked on our table even though the place is quite small. Food was just as good but the service totally ruined the experience.

Celebrated my birthday at this hidden gem recently and completely fell in love. As a starter, I had the delicious fried calamari and a green tea Thai tea and for my main I had the shrimp pad Thai. Service was great and we had the sweetest waitress ever! Prices were reasonable and the atmosphere of this place was great.

To be fair, we have only been for the lunch special. Although nicer looking than some of the other Thai spots we go to, it didn't deliver better flavors. Seems a bit more mainstream and a little disappointing... it kind of fits into a midtown Thai lunch spot... and who goes to midtown for Thai? Will give another shot.

A true gem. The decor doesn't exactly take you on a journey to Pattaya but it doesn't matter, this place is all about the food. Excellent presentation,  reasonably priced, family run by folks who spoke to my Thai girlfriend in her native tongue. Much better than other spots nearby at very similar prices. The Tom Yum soup was the best I've had, very rich broth and nice and spicy. Steamed whole fish was beautiful and delicious.  Glass noodle salad was excellent,  and I'm not sure what they did but the wood ear mushrooms (often rubbery) were soft and flavorful. Attention to detail was present though out the meal. Again, a hidden jem that gets a little fanfare. Can't say enough about what an terrific experience I had.

Amazing prices to be honest that's the appeal to me. They could give more food but eh it's life. But oh my lord in love with the Thai iced tea. I frequent a lot of Thai places because I love Thai food. But so far this is the place that had the biggest Thai iced tea. Went for the lunch special. My mother and I both had appetizers, and the big plate we were not disappointed. Well she did said her shrimp plate barely gave her shrimp but other than that she liked it. I like the decor inside as well looks fancy. Convenient place in Roosevelt 74. Would go again!

I am a lover of all things food, but especially when it comes to Thai food. So can you imagine how excited I was when I saw this restaurant pop up under the "New Businesses" section? I bookmarked it immediately and patiently waited for the day to come.It was a bit hard to find parking as this neighborhood is quite bustling but just as we were about to give up after going around like four times, we found one. I walked in with my food buddy (aka husband) and were immediately greeted by a friendly lady who seated us. We were served water and given a regular menu as well as the lunch special menu. I love that they have lunch specials even on the weekends! However the menu is so overwhelming because there are so many options! My husband ordered a lunch special ($7.50) that comes with one curry puff and the pad kee mau with chicken. I ordered a Thai iced tea, the calamari, and the panang curry with chicken.Wow! My fellow Yelpers were not kidding when they say the Thai iced tea is humongous because it really is! One order here is like 2-3 in other Thai restaurants. It is definitely on the sweeter side but that is how I like it and honestly probably the best one I have ever had. I don't usually like curry puffs, but this one is really good and super tasty. The calamari was battered and fried nicely, but I did not care too much for the dipping sauce. The pad kee mau was flavorful and delicious, but can use more heat in my opinion. The panang curry is the real winner here. It was savory, a bit sweet, and yet packed just the right amount of spice. Pair it with some jasmine rice and you got yourself a perfect meal. Deee-licious!I don't care too much for the decor as I found it to be questionable. It has a "Dark Note"-esque feel to it (for all my anime nerds). Everything was colored either black or white, and they definitely went tile-happy with the floors and the walls.. all either black or white of course. Then there is the splash of fun with the abstract mirrors and a bit of industrial charm with the light fixtures at the bar. I cannot forget to mention the very interesting and confusing clock on the wall which poured water into a lit cup. Perhaps it is saying it is time for a drink? My husband said the clock had figures of people falling/dying and a random salamander, but I cannot vouch for that as I was too distracted by the creepy fake white bird on the bottom of the clock looking at me eat it's cousin (aka the chicken) in my dishes. I honestly think the decor might not have worked for me because I went during lunch time when the sun was still out, I'm sure it looks much more trendy in the evening.Overall, I would absolutely come back. This has one of the best Thai foods I have had in New York. Plus the prices are good and the service is excellent. Can't wait to come back and try other things on the menu!

LOVE it here. Staff are really very sweet. I love how they never let my water glass get empty. Usually when I go to Thai places I have to ask for refills of my water, which can get annoying tbh, but not here! Love the look, the chairs are so comfortable ! They're not typical wooden cheap chairs. And the food is YUM! I had the pad kee Mao with shrimp and it was perfect! Would've preferred a bit more bell peppers but it was very delicious. Appetizer I had the cream cheese dumplings which were mouth watering ! I wish I had ordered more. And the tofu for appetizer was really realllly good. So surprised how good those apps were ! And for desert I had the fried ice cream with coconut ice cream and wow was that good. I'm usually not a fried ice cream kinda person but I def could've had seconds. Really really good Thai restaurant. Definetly would recommend it to everything! And try those dumplings !! They're sooooo good!

The place formerly occupied by Arunee definitely got a facelift. Holy mole, Kitchen 79, I love what you've done with the place. It's beautiful, chic, and modern now... but that's not why we're there. We're there for some good Thai food!First off: Don't let he lack of signage and the multiple beer taps fool you. It is still BYOB. Fortunately, there is a liquor store around the block on Roosevelt and 78th.Second: The service is very gracious but is missing that spark. I couldn't quite put my finger on it.Third: The food. Pretty good but definitely not the best Thai I've had - especially for the area. Arunee definitely had this place beat in the food department. Fortunately, it is just down the block. Well, Kitchen 79 is still new so we'll see how it fares after a little more time in the oven.

they did it again...recently moved to the neighborhood and feel so blessed to have kitchen 79 in my delivery zone.just ordered in on a friday night and honestly it might have been the best pad thai i've ever hadshout out the friday night chef

I think it is time I rave about Kitchen 79. I  have been a regular customer for almost a full year and not only has the restaurant never disappoint, but it has met or exceeded expectations almost every time.  The other day I came with my boyfriend to Kitchen79 and I had another spectacular evening. For appetizers, we ordered the tod mun goong, which was crispy and delicious. Thhe texture was great. For the main course, we ordered the steam fish with spicy lime dressing and the spicy glass noodles with lime juice.  both dishes were on point and the portions were great. they even offered a spicy kit set. This chef is special because the food here will make you crave for more.I would also like to add that the quality of the food, the impeccable service, the comforting atmosphere, and the reasonable pricing all make this restaurant a number one priority.

Place looks pretty with their trendy/classy decor. Nice selection of menu. Big thai ice tea serving. The smell is what bothered us. Something smelly like a restroom kind a cleaner or something coming from that place! I still give it a 4 star! I will definitely come back again when im craving for thai.
One of the highest rated Thai restos in the area, we stopped by from going home from the beach. Ordered Thai iced tea (it's huge), yellow curry, and pad thai. It was delicious! Elegant, clean inside.
They included romaine lettuce in their salad when there is a CDC warning to not consume any lettuce given the ecoli outbreak. Very irresponsible.
Great food, ambiance, desert, service. Gotta come here. Everything was served timely with great prices as well. Didn't break the bank for a 5+ Star meal.

I cannot say enough how good this place is!!!!! Extremely recommended. My co worker recommended this Thai place just opened up a few mouths ago. We went there today with high expectation. Everything is beyond our expectation. The owner is very friendly and helpful with the menu. He recommended the dishes that other Thai restaurants don't have. We tried southern style Shrimp curry which is very spicy but we are gratefully enjoyed. Also big leg Duck Noodles Soup OMG absolutely amazing!!!! Everything is perfect. Modern sparkling decor makes this place outstanding unlike other Thai places. In Queens where you can find lots of Thai restaurants BUT this one is finely outstanding with authentic southern Thai style that I confirm everyone will love. P.s. Don't try just pad thai. Do try something different. You will LOVE Kitchen 79 ;)
Great food, great service. Limited alcohol selection, but the drinks that they do offer are decent. Great ambiance.

This was my first time here ( July 5th 2015 ) it added to an already great July 4th weekend. I came here with a group of friends to celebrate my girlfriends birthday. To our amazement it had a very intimate vibe and welcoming atmosphere. We sang Happy Birthday about 5 times and enjoyed every moment with everyone celebrating a birthday that night. They were very accommodating, when I realized I forgot the candle for the cake, they were kind enough to to provide us with one . Now to the good stuff ..... We ordered a ton of appetizers curry puffs, calamari , crab cakes and lobster and cream cheese wontons ( all equally delightful ) . As for the  entrees we ordered pineapple fried rice and pad see yew both with chicken and shrimp (YUMMY!). The portions were a decent size (we were able to bring home lunch for the next day). A little under staffed, but overall great service!

I made a reservation for my mom's birthday for 10 people. The hostess on the phone told me to not be more than 15min late or we would lose our seatings, which was reasonable. Typical rule for most restaurants. However, when we arrived, we were seated by the hostess BUT the tables weren't ready for 10 people. Our waiter looked at me with confusion and asked if we reserved in advance (actually he didn't look at me - there were no eye contact during this discussion). I responded that I did - for 10 people and reserved the seats for 6:30. Fine...no big deal. Now we didn't get enough water for everyone..I asked for another. We didn't get enough utensils..I asked for another. We ordered...never received our Pad Thai when we nearly finished all of our plates. I felt like I was in elementary school...raising my hands patiently...to get service...it was quite ridiculous! I cant blame on the waiter. He was constantly working. The whole place was packed and there were only 2 waiters!!! 2 waiters - to seat the guests, to answer phone calls, to work in the car area, to grab orders, to clear up the tables...you get the point? Nice presentation on the food but service was below par. If they didn't automatically take 18% gratuity, I would not have given them closed to that amount. This place is not good for groups.1. Appetizer - Calamari was delicious2. Appetizer - Curry Puff was not bad. Slightly greasy3. Entree - Soft shell crab - fried perfectly. Definitely not worth $20 for 2 crabs4. Entree - Fried whole fish with mango salad. Nice presentation. Fish was delicious5. Chicken Pad Thai - you can never go wrong with this!6. Crab meat Fried Rice - delicious7. Khao SOI noodle soup - This good too!8. Pad Ped moo phase (wild boar) - Too spicy! 0 out of 10 people gave it more than 0 scoreLike I said nice presentation. Poor service. Would be nice to welcome the guests with eye contact than constantly looking down - waiter seems agitated having us. Definitely not group friendly. 1-3 guests...would be a different story. They looked stressed out!OOoO, need to change credit cards on Yelp to DO NOT TAKE AMEXDefinitely had better Thai food elsewhere! Im very disappointed. Definitely not a 4.5 starts material as indicated on Yelp. Will not come back...Sorry Kitchen 79. First impression is last impression
This is one of the best Thai restaurants that I have ever been to.  The best part is that they also have a nice, but limited, selection of beer.

Came here for lunch one afternoon after shopping in the area. Cute hidden gem in Queens if you ever get the cravings for Thai food. Food was good, perfectly filling and plated very nicely. But I think the best part was the price, was only $11 for the lunch special! You get an appetizer and entree included. WOW. great food for SUPER cheap. The chicken wanton soup I had was fantastic, the broth was tasty and the wantons tasted like they were made fresh and had a slight cilantro kick to them. Mhm my favorite item off the the menu. The decor was also very eclectic and clean lines with the contrast of black and white. If I am ever in the area again I will be back!

My husband and I visited this restaurant for the first time today. The food was the best thing ever. Very tasty. The prices were so reasonable. The staff was so friendly and attentive. There is also a nice "team vibe" within the staff which I never noted anywhere else.Their desserts are to die for...will definitely go again and again...

I've been coming to this restaurant since it first opened. Firstly, the service is phenomenal, Rudy the owner I believe, is a sweetheart. My boyfriend and I go there frequently and Wee usually serves us, he is very nice and always treats us well. Now for the food, the food is amazing. I have been to many different thai restaurant and this is the best I have been to thus far. The food is FRESH. I usually go for the chicken pad Thai which and my boyfriend gets the phad ka pow. We usually visit this place at least once a week neither of us live or work anywhere around this neighborhood, that is how amazing it is! Definitely try it out.

I was very disappointed in the food last night. It was tasteless except for the curry in one of the sauces and the amount of protein in my dishes- shrimp and chicken was barely enough. I had the food last year and it was very good. I cannot understand the high rating based on last night's experience. Maybe the ownership changed or the chef was on vacation. Sad as I love Thai.

Words cannot describe how food perfect the  Kitchen 79 really is . i had curry puff duck curry ka prow ka moo and some dessert , that was awesome great food chili ambiance i went there with my friend we ate like queens the duck curry hits the spot. the food here is among the best i've had at any thai restaurant. The staff are so friendly and welcoming I cannot wait to return !!!

Wow. Why haven't I found this gem before? It was my daughter's birthday so we decided to take her out. They were so busy that we had to wait for 10 minuets even after making a reservation a week ago.
