Instead I was presented with actual shells of the guava in syrup and an amazing queso that I could eat without any additional accompaniment.The split of the bill came to exactly $20 per person which, for the quality and quantity of food was perfectly fair. I spotted a cuban sandwich that might have to be tried next time.Rincon Criollo is only a few feet from the 7 train and will be featured on an upcoming episode of Drivers, Drive-Ins and Dives. Guy Fieri and Celia Cruz, under the same roof, in a corner of classic Cuban Corona, that's Rincon Criollo.
Get the Ropa Vieja with some Yuca Fries... Amazing!!! Staff is pleasant and knows the menu well.

Saw this restaurant on the food network. I freaking love this placceeeeee sooooooo much!!! I highly recommend to give it a shot.  Try everything!!! My recommendation, Must try the ropa vieja (shredded beef) its so delicious. Ox tail is yummy too. This might sound weird, but the egg/planntain omlete is tasty.  Just try it.
Super authentic Cuban cuisine! Get the oxtail, it's amazing. Plaintext's  aims were great! Nice service , cute atmosphere. Highly recommended!

THAT OXTAIL STEW!!!! This place supposedly closes at 10pm but at 9:30 on a Thursday they still have people waiting for tables. I had the oxtail stew, yuca, plantains, and the tres leches. I actually came because I wanted the cake after seeing so many people rave about it and the bartender told me the stew was way more worth the hype - and he was right. Both were great (I'd definitely come back and order both) but the oxtail was incredibly tender and flavorful. I had leftovers the next day and still felt the same way.

Come here now before this place becomes "I used to go there all the time now the wait is just to long" .        Rincon is in an episode of "diners, drive ins and dives"so it is only a matter of time. The food is great, the price is right, the service is attentive and ultra friendly, and it is one of those places you will be able to say you went before everyone found out about it!

The staff here are super friendly! They smile all the time!I ordered the pork chop and tops vieja, which is shredded beef in tomato stew. The tomato stew was okay, the flavors were a bit too strong for my taste.I love the pork chops! The portions are HUGE! I got exhausted after the first pork chop, and the second one was an uphill battle for sure!Their plaintain side dish was a bit soggy so I was indifferent to it. My glass was never empty because they always made rounds to refill waters. This is rare for me because I drink a TON of water. It was the first time I had Spanish food and this place did not disappoint!

This is probably one of the best restaurants I've been to in NYC!! I came here on a Saturday night and the place was packed. It only took about 20 min to get a table for two. I ordered the roasted half chicken with rice and beans(cooked together) and sweet plantains....with a glass of sangria. My love ordered the snapper that was cooked in garlic and white wine with rice and beans. EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS! If I could eat here everyday I would.The service was also amazing. Everyone was extremely friendly and attentive (which is rare in NYC.)This is a restaurant that you have to try out if you're in the area! PS- the only credit card they accept is AMEX!

Cuban guy told me this was the best Cuban restaurant in the city.  With little basis for comparison, I can't endorse that view, but will say that I rather enjoyed the food, sangria... and my credit card balance afterwards.  The place is a step up from "hole in the wall" white retaining the vibes of a family business.  I had the roast pork with yuca and beans, but was more impressed by the explosion of flavors offered by the rincon criollo appetizer, a delicious mix of sausage, ham and cheese.  The pork in the entree was juicy and tender but could have used slightly more flavor.  And there is not excuse for having Tabasco as "hot sauce" - anywhere, ever.  Recommended.

Maybe it was what I ordered or the fact that I've grown up around this food but I really don't see what the big deal is about this place. The service was great but the food was just mediocre. Same chicken, rice and beans I can get anywhere else. Don't get the Cuban. It's a thin panini lacking all the goodness it should contain. Probably won't be giving them another try unless I'm missing the usual Spanish food entry.

My mom and I went there today for lunch and I was really excited because of all the reviews. Sadly I was super disappointed and left all of my food behind. I ordered the steak with onions and the rice with beans , my mom ordered the shrimp omelet and cassava . Everything lacked flavor and they didn't have any sauces. I'm pretty disappointed cause that was my cheat meal and a complete waste of calories. The rice lacked flavor , the beans lacked flavor, the steak lacked flavor, the shrimp omelet lacked flavor. The cod fritters were very fishy, but with enough lime were OK. The chorizo was OKAY. The staff were really friendly. The food was a total let down.

These are the kind of places you need to go visit! Granted it is in a very congested area. But, it's well worth the trip. Practically, everything we have ordered was amazing! The Cuban Sandwich was great. Toasted bread, meats galore, the flavors in your mouth and the textures is unimaginable. If they tossed in an egg and avocado.. I would have been in heaven. The smoke Chops. Was something different. It looks like chops, but It taste just like ham! Oh how tricky they can be! My favorite dish was the Chicharron Pollo. Was probably the best. I can eat that with rice. All day! and of course the best for last. The Seafood and Meats Paella was amazing. Make sure if your want to order that. Order it first. It takes about 45 mins to an 1 hr. It says it feeds 2? but easily 4-5 ppl. I only took a star down. Due to parking as always!

Took my whole family here for dinner last week for my birthday celebration.  Food is always delicious. My eldest son was here for work & I wanted him to try an authentic Cuban cuisine & he loved it.  We mostly had their famous Pernil which is so good & tasty & tender. They must have really seasoned it so well & marinated long to it to taste this great.  One thing I don't like us my diet goes out the window the moment I sit on their table!! Ha !!Glad I'm only like a few blocks away & it's like in my neighborhood.  If anyone wants to have an authentic, Cuban, Peruvian, Ecuadorian , Mexican or Columbian food, come to Elmhurst , corner of Junction  & Roosevelt & enjoy all these fine Latino cuisines... You'll  be glad you did...

Deliciously DaintyI had a Cuban Sandwich here for 5 bucks to go. They use a sandwich press to get it flat warm and toasty. The tender ham wasn't overly salty and wasn't rubbery at all. The enjoyed the meltiness of the Swiss that masked the slightly dry pernil.  The neutral flavor of the mustard was subtle and lacked the extra kick of spiciness the sandwich desperately needed. I suspected the sandwich wouldn't be big enough to satisfy my appetite so I also ordered myself a $3 tamale. The pleasantly airy consistency tamale was above average, but I was hoping for more of the filling. I managed to find one tiny piece of pernil hiding in the corner. However, I appreciated the toasty floury corny flavor which warmed up the inside of my belly.Tip: if you are dining in and you tell them it is your friend's birthday, a waiter will do an over the top performance while bringing out a complimentary birthday flan. The flan was the best I've ever had.

I've been eating here since I was a kid and I've always loved my. My favorite dish was the breaded pork cutlet white rice and black beans. As I've grown up I have tried new things and I've loved everything I had.Some of my other faves:Croquetas Cod frittersOx tailRopa vieja The guys make you feel like family. Highly recommended if you ole Cuban food!

Amazing! Worth circling the same few blocks of bumper to bumper traffic looking for parking. And probably even worth getting a parking ticket if you can't take it anymore and park however and wherever you want. I consistently get the bistek con criollo with rice and beans. It never disappoints. And the steak is as big as your head.

Real Cuban food ! I'm surprised it took me so long to go to this place. Food is usually delicious and tasty. Depending on what night you go there can be a wait. Go on an off night and there won't be much of a wait. Last time I went the only con I would say is they only take cash and Amex. Might have changed since I been last which was about 6 months ago. Definitely a place to visit if you want Cuban food !

Maybe it's because I compare every Cuban place to my favorite Cuban place in Manhattan, but I was not really impressed with Rincon Criollo. I won't name the place but the food is better, the price is comparable, the staff are Cuban, they play live latin music, and they have a Cuban guy rolling cigars all night (hint: it's located on Thompson street and shares the same name as the country).  We shared the chicken broiled in garlic sauce and the ropa veija (which is a standard in testing Cuban restaurants)!  For sides we had beans mixed with rice, plain rice, fried plantains and fried sweet plantains.  The food was ok but not amazing.  My sister went to Miami a week earlier and went to a tiny authentic Cuban restaurant and thought the food was much better there.  The ropa veija was really soggy and oily but did still have good flavor.  The broiled chicken was pretty good but was so salty that it was hard to eat after going half way through.  The fried plantains were perfect!  And the sweet plantains were good but they were a little too mushy and not as sweet as I would have liked.  Good part was there were leftovers to eat the next day! Also, I did not know Guy Fieri went here! I took a pic of his marking :-)!

Let me first say...I'm Cuban and this is a very good place to enjoy our food and culture. They have a really nice service and the place was packed ... that means something . I really recommend this restaurant .... you won't be disappointed at ALL!

Great food, great service with a smile. And a dancing celebration on your birthday. This is one of our staple restaurants. The food is no frills, and delicious. The vaca frita has a cult following, as it should because it's crispy garlicky deliciousness. We always go on slow nights because once we're in, we want nothing standing in the way of our food. I've tried many dishes and have lobed every one of them. I haven't tried the paella yet, but I plan to the next time we visit. The plantains are magical, the fried chicken is juicy, and crispy, and the desserts are just the perfect ending. The staff is attentive and sweet as can be. This place feels like family. We will be coming back again and again.

Service 5/5Ambiance 4/5Food 3/5I found Rincon Criollo to be a very old school Latin Restaurant. You know the style very bright lights, Latin Music, pictures of music stars from past generations plastered on the walls, waiters wearing short sleeve white shirts with a bow tie. All good and very kitschy.Service was very good with lots of Teamwork. Quick arrival of waiter on initial visit to the table. Attentive throughout the meal experience. Funny. Very solid old school service. Chicharron de polloThe chicken was crispy and flavorful, but just OK. It was not golden brown and moist, but very dark and dry. Masitas de puercoSame as chicken. Nice texture, but just OK. Again, dark in color, but not as dry.The sides had potential, but again very average. Yuca was tasty, but overdone. Moro rice was not hot. Maduros and tostones again just average.AMEX and Cash only.Overall, I found the food to have potential, but it was just a notch or two below what I expected it to be. I grew up eating chicharron de pollo, masitas de puerco, yuca, tostones, etc. The quality was just not there. I had the feeling that the food was the end of day leftovers. Will I be back, YES. The overall feeling of Rincon Criollo was very welcoming. I just need to be there earlier than 9 PM.

Great Authentic Cuban. Parking is easy on the street but it's Junction Blvd so you may need to drive around to find a spot during certain types. One block down from the 7 train running on Roosevelt Ave. I had the Caldo Gallego, Yuca, Pernil and Arroz Morro. All were excellent. Also the Sangria was a great choice on a hot day. The waiter was excellent and attentive.

I am not sure why this place has such good reviews. My sister and I went and were super excited to eat here. She got the bistec encabollado ( steak with onions)  it was so bland and lacked flavor. I got the Pollo milanesa breaded chicken breast, you really cant mess that up. My plate was good but I have no interest in going back. Can any one recommend a good Cuban spot ?

My buddy convinced us to come here by telling us he had read that it was rated one of the best restaurants in Queens. It was Saturday morning and surprisingly empty, so it was easy to get a table for a group of 6. The restaurant was very traditional-looking, with lots of Latin American pictures, maps and flags on the walls. The waiters were super friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. Only complaint about the decor was a Guy Fieri stenciled graffiti on the wall. What a d-bag.Anyway, the menu was full of things that sounded amazing. I finally decided on the pollo a la carrera (chicken on a run), and it was great. For $12, you get half a chicken overed in olives, onions and a tasty brown sauce. I was also surprised that it came with two sides. What a great deal! I had it with beans and rice (mixed together) and fried potatoes (which were really just french fries).My friends ordered the chicken and rice for two, and it came in a really big metal pot covered with a towel. It was yellow rice and baked pieces of chicken (I assume a whole one, since there was so much). I tried some of it, and it was pretty good as well. Definitely worth the hype.Go to Rincon Criollo!Note that the only credit card they accept is American Express, which is a bummer.

Food is good and staff was nice but I walked out because it was cash or AMEX and I don't have AMEX. I didn't use cash because of the reason I was given for the current environment. The reason given was that it has been that way from the beginning and it's hard to get the owners to change. They just don't want to add visa and MasterCard. Well, their lack of innovation and flexibility will prevent me from coming back.

3rd generation owner, Rudy, told me; "We're not a Diner, Drive In or a Dive", we're a RESTAURANT, and he is correct.  From the vested waiters with ties, right down to the flan for dessert and everything in between, the place is excellent.  If you can't wait to go to Cuba (soon hopefully) go here.  No cuban cigars please, though they are good.                                                                                      !!AMERICAN EXPRESS ONLY!!

I love this little hidden treasure. So authentic and humble. Have there chicken soup it will have you coming for more on those cold days. My only complain is how small it is but you know what they say " when a restaurant is good leave it as is!"

Queens, NY Aug 15 2015 2PMWalking into this resturant I felt as I was walking into someone's grandmothers house. This resturant gives you a very "homey" feeling where you can just sit and relax.The waiters were very nice and welcoming. They start you off with complimentary bread and butter while they make your meal. I got the famous ropa vieja which has been seen on the food network Diners, Drive in's and Dives along with rice, beans, maduros and yuca. Tip: The steak/chicken that you order comes along with two sides. 5 stars for this authentic Cuban restaurant!

Called an hour ahead for their tasty, enormous $42 paella on a Monday afternoon and arrived to a not-too-busy, boisterous, yet slow dining room.Sadly 'Queens' tops the mention lists of nearly every highly reviewed spot in the borough, and while we enjoyed our food, this particular dish didn't make me tell friends from elsewhere to justify a visit. We finished with both flans and the natilla, and enjoyed each (and the gentle price tag), but although our water was constantly replenished, it took forever to get our check.FYI Amex or cash only, according to the menu, but others have claimed they take other payment.

I saw his place featured on a tv program.   Sometime finding a simple, foo Cuban restaurant can be difficult.  This place isn't fancy, but reminds me of places I've eaten Miami.   Not fancy, but the servers are professional and the food is prepared with care.  I enjoyed the rosa vieja.   It's not a fancy place, but worth visiting.
I came here on a Saturday afternoon with my 11 year old son. We ordered two ropa viejas and it was delicious. The service was on point and the atmosphere was calm. My son finished my plate.

Great authentic Cuban food. I was recommended by my Cuban friend to try it and really loved the good. They also give a big surprise to the birthday customer with disco ball lights a electrical shining clown glasses and a small dessert with a candle. The whole room sings together and the birthday customer really gets the attention. It is fun!!
Went to dinner with my family to celebrate  my daughters 10th birthday.the food sales for itself. But one of the waiter was drunk or high.ruined the evening.will never go back. Maybe to takeout..
The ropa vieja is absolutely fantastic.
Food was excellent. !!! Service was fast and great . Everyone who worked there was really nice and the best part is how they celebrate birthdays !! . I'll definitely go back again

This food is amazing , and great service. The vaca frita, rabo encendido, and flounder in garlic sauce is delicious. Must try. The decor and ambiance also is greattt. Im in love with this cuban restaurant. Will be back.

I think it is about time I write a review. Been here way too many times. Stumbled upon this place from Yelp Reviews and have religiously visited this place for any special event in my life ( graduation, post elopement , birthdays, etc). Apart from the amazing food ( my particular favorite would have to be el rabo encendido ), is the service. I always try to go when Rudy is there as he is the most animated and lively person in there. I secretly like to always say it is someone's birthday just to see the lights dine and have him wear the hat and sing/dance ! Not sure why it is only cash/amex, but! it must be a good sign. Each entree come with two sides and its always best to get different sides if going with a group to be a nibble here and there of different sides. Always ask how the avocado is for the day. They are honest and will tell you whether they are buttery or not ( hey! everyone has their preference). And take the time to ask the gentlemen about the history of the place. If i am feeling gluttonous and get an appetizer, I ALWAYS get the yucca rellena ( yuca roll). Amazingly crispy on the outside, moist and seasoned beef in the inside. Pairs well with some hot sauce. And great to wash down with their homemade lemonade. skip the bread to make room for everything. Best times to go would be week days and weekends before 6pm. The good thing about this place is that they actually let you enjoy your food ! In saying that, they will not rush you. So if you are waiting for a table, they don't ever try to guestimate nor do they do the distasteful check drop off mid way into your desert. Its a very lax waiting period for tables, so be patient.

How have I not reviewed El Rincon Criollo yet?! My spouse's family is Cuban - we just traveled to Cuba in 2012/2013 on a *family visa* and stayed w/ relatives (i.e. pre-Obama announcement - we could travel freely throughout the country on buses - without the requisite chaperoned guided tour that is required of US citizens who travel via a special "tourist" visa). We celebrated Christmas, New Years, Honeymoon there and I finally tasted proper yuca with lime...  Batida de Mamey (!!), amazing fresh pressed guava juice (that can only be compared to the same in India). My spouse's abuela is in her mid-90's, still spunky and lives in Queens. She, along w/ spouse's parents (who grew up in Habana and NYC) trust Rincon Criollo - not just for their authenticity and quality of food - but also due to the family that runs the restaurant. They personally know their customers and have been a staple of Cuban food for emigrants since the 1970's, where they brought the recipes over from the island. We have been going there for abuela's birthday pretty much every year. As you may know Cubans basically swim in pork and lard... and I'm a pescatarian. However, in Cuba, there is actually a lot of fish/seafood served - and same with Rincon Criollo. INSIDER TIP: On Monday they serve the Tamal en Cazuela - abuela dreams of this and we have had to plan our schedules for Monday dinners so she could eat this (and of course others were required to eat it as well :-) ). Although there is meat in it, I once took a sip of the broth out of respect for abuela and it was REALLY complex and lovely.My Favorites (In no particular order): 1) Mariquitas - They are a must order. Specifically because the mojo that is served alongside them is SO on point, garlicky and spicy at the same time. You can't easily find mariquitas like this in NYC (I have tried and to this day, nothing compares),2) Frituras de Bacalao: These cod fritters are perfectly fried and have a great ratio of chunky fish in them. Read: They are not overly bread-y. Sometimes, I just order this as my main meal. 3) Maduros: Very well made. 4) Tostones: I put it on here, because they are better than usual for *restaurants*. HOWEVER, my spouse makes the absolute best tostones that I have ever had (even better than his family in Cuba). It is his family recipe passed down... 4) Bunuelos 5) Flan de Leche: Again, not the best (because that would be homemade). But extraordinary for restaurant flan.6) Cafe con Leche: You must finish off your meal w/ a proper Cuban coffee.TAKEAWAY:If you live in another borough - it is *definitely* worth the trek to Queens. Plus, if you go on someone's birthday, the owner sings and puts on this hilarious outfit and they put on strobe lights. A great place to take a shy person ;-)
Great place, amazing food and excellent service. Always friendly with a good attitude!

What is a "Perfect 10" restaurants?  Given its great food, but courtesy service, and comfortable atmosphere is a must....  Well this restaurant GOT IT ALL!!!!I'm not Cuban, and I don't work for this restaurant.  I was in the area, and I was suggested by a friend to visit this restaurant.  The food is "AMAZING"!!!!  I had the shredded garlic beef and its unreal!!!!  My friend had the garlic chicken.  The serving size is filling!    The price is around $15-$17.00.  This place will make you smile!  I love this place, and when I left I had to tell the waiters of their amazing job and I WILL RETURN!!!

Been coming to Rincon Criollo since 1980. My favorite dish is Pechuga al Ajillo with rice and black beans. Throw in some fried bananas with a little avocado salad and I am good to go!Their fresh lemonade is highly recommended.

One of my favorite places! Casual place. Everything from the food to the service is A+. Very hefty portions and the prices are great. Come hungry. The birthday shoutouts are awesome here. It really does feel homey here. The decor is nice. Don't get me started on the coconut flan, it's delicious. The coffee is strong as well, a cortadito please! I need it especially after this meal.

Do yourself a favor. Order the oxtails. It is all about the oxtails. A cult favorite at Rincon Criollo is the ropa vieja (shredded flank steak in a tomato based sauce), but my go-to dish is their oxtails. Savory, flavorful and delicious. Plop some rice and beans on the side and you are good to go! The interior of the restaurant is decorated with old photographs and tidbits of Cuban culture. The staff is friendly and enthusiastic about the food they serve. Feel free to ask them for recommendations on the menu. They know what's good. If you ever find yourself in Corona, Queens, make your way over to Rincon Criollo. DO IT.

I had the oxtail and it was DELICIOUS. By far the best I've ever had and I've had my share of braised meats. The sauce was rich and sticky and perfectly seasoned. The best way to relish it is to eat it with white rice, which is what I did. The meat was fatty and falling off the bone, just the way I like it. And while it may look like a big dish, the actual amount of meat isn't a lot, which is a good thing because it IS fatty and a small amount really fills you up. I don't live in the neighborhood but decided to check out this place enroute to CT from LGA based on recommendations on Yelp. Thanks fellow Yelpers. You were spot on. I don't get too many opportunities to eat Cuban food in the DC area and with the bar having been set so high, I think I'll have to return. Or at least route some travel through LGA .

great place to go if you are craving some cuban food. the service was great and everyone was so friendly. i had the ropa vieja with tostones and arroz negro and it was very good. i also tried ox tails for the first time and i have to say, i was not disappointed. they were so flavorful and tender. im visiting from california and im so glad we found this spot.
My favorite cuban restaurant. The food is delicious!Fair prices and very friendly staff.

My go to place for Cuban hands down!  I love the old framed photos of the owner and his family from when they were in Cuba on the walls.  The decor reminds of an old 1950's restaurant.  The waitstaff is dressed in white shirts and black ties and it's so nice to see a touch of class in this somewhat run down neighborhood.  The food is incredible. Must tries:Frituras de Bacalao: codfish fritters....crispy and light, just deliciousChorizo Espanol: Who can say no to sausage?!Ropa Vieja: tender, juicy and so much flavor!Lechon Asado: aka Pernil aka slow roasted pork shoulder...aka yummy in my tummy!Moros y Cristianos: My fave way to have rice and black beans...all mixed together!Yuca con Mojo: Cassava in garlic sauce hits the spotEnd the meal with Fland de Leche, Tocino con Leche, Dulce de Leche Cortada, and Bunuelos Rincon Criollo.Seriously delicious food and really great service to boot.
- Great authentic Cuban food. Reasonable prices, about $13 per meal. The pork and rice & beans was my favorite dish. Delicious rice pudding.

Friendly staff, amazing food, and highly recommend.  We had the ox tail, green plantains and chicken paella for family of four.  The ox tail was very tasty and flavorful.  The paella was worth the wait, while we snacked on the bread and green plantains.  The bread was also nice and toasty warm.  The paella was one of the best that I've tried; rice was nice and moist, chicken was tender and juicy.  All were amazing and tasty.  Basically you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  One of the waiter helped to entertain my young son, so that I can finish up my dinner.  It was a great experience.

I was super excited to try this place but left very disappointed.I ordered a few appetizers: Croquetas de Jamon, Frituras de Bacalao and Yuca Rellena. The Codfish Fritters were horrible. They were deeply fried and I could barely taste the fish. It was obviously frozen fish. The Ham Croquettes were also fried to the extreme and a bit too salty. The Stuffed Cassava was the only dish that was a-ok but nothing extraordinary.I told our waiter that our appetizers were less than satisfactory. He was nice and recommended that we try the "Ropa Vieja" and he assured us that we would enjoy it.$16 for the rather small dish of Ropa Vieja was a bit too expensive. The beef was SO salty and the dish was mainly just tomato sauce.I'm sad to say that not even 1 out of the 4 dishes that I've tried was satisfactory. Maybe I ordered the wrong dishes but I don't trust a Cuban place that does not have good Ropa Vieja.

One of the best meals of the last year.  Great everything - my steak was super flavorful - her fish was better if that's possible - appetizers, desert, and coffee was excellent. Our waiter Joseph was a pleasure to chat with. We could not have enjoyed ourselves more.

One word, DELICIOUS!! Everything that I had here from the drinks to the main course was delicious!  From the service to the atmosphere I am so glad to have found this place here on yelp.  Drinks:Red Sangria was so refreshing Eats:- Chorizo Appetizer which I would order all of the time, the chorizo was perfectly cooked.- OxTail was very meaty and the juices was very yummy. Goes well with the black beans and white rice.Dessert:- Bunuelos Rincon which was fried dough topped with sugar and chocolate sauce.  Not something I would get again.  Just really reminds me of fried dough Likes:- Service was on point.  The entire wait staff was fully aware of what we need and always made sure we were ok- Parking was convenient....its municipal pay parking but not too bad to get a spot close to the restaurant- FOOD WAS GOOD!!!!!!- Sangria!!!Dislikes:- Pricey but sure worth itI will definitely be coming back here again!

I would give this place 10 stars if I could. If you're looking for authentic Cuban food look no further, Rincon is where it's at. I lived in Miami for some time and am always craving Cuban food. I'm so glad I found Rincón. It's basically a Cuban grandmothers cooking! Don't go here for drinks because that surely is lacking but, it doesn't matter because the food is absolutely perfect. Take this advice from someone who actually knows real Cuban food!

I throughly enjoyed the experience here. It feels very homey yet also so classical. I loved the decor and the look of all the furniture! The staff is very curdious and considerate of our time. They made us aware of the time it takes to make certain food and if we were okay with the wait. We ordered the seafood pietta. It was so amazing! The rice was rich with flavor and the seafood was cooked to perfection. It was a wonderful dish. I ended the night with a sweet potato donut dessert. It was unique I could really taste the sweet potatoes. All in all I had an amazing experience here. I am excited to come back and try more on the menu.

I've been coming to this restaurant in the past and I remember having a good 'arroz con pollo'. However, last night we ordered a portion for two and waited close to an hour as the menu indicated. After waiting, we got a pot with liquid on top, pieces of chicken and the rice at the bottom. Nobody makes 'arroz con pollo' like this, unless you are a novice or getting a prison meal. It was painful to look at the dish as I am sure it would have been painful to eat it. It hurt to write this review since I have good memories of family dinners at this place.

service was certainly on point, upon arrival we had a table in the back of the restaurant. i was cold, so i asked the waiter right away for a cafe con leche amd within a minute of ordering, he was back to the table with the coffee, water and ready to our food order.simce it was only 2 of us, we decided we would share everything. we had the stuffed yuca and the bacalaitos.  the stuffed yuca is like a tamal made of yuca and stuffed with ground meat. the meat was nicely seasoned but not much in the form of presentation. the bacalaitos were good but not something i would order again.  I felt there was an excessive amount of batter and yhere could have been a sauce or something to spice it up.  the main course we decided to order "rabo encendido" which is oxtail.  The name of this dish literally translates into oxtail on fire. we asked for arroz con moros, maduros and donner for 2 was $35 plus tip. the oxtail was good but it lacked authenticity as all of the components were presented separately.  not a bad meal but i dont think i would make a trip just to come and dine here. Tonight, i just happened to be in the neighborhood and so i decided to try this place based on the reviews.

Yummy!  Authentic Cuban food!  Our entire party if 7 left full and content!  I really didn't want to like this place because it was so far, tiny and crowded when we got there, but so worth the wait people.  I'd have to say this is the best Cuban restaurant in the NY area I've been to (I've tried a few).  If you like Cuban this is a must try.  Go early or go ready to have a few drinks at the small bar and wait.  The staff was really nice including the bartender and our waiter.  Keep up the good job guys!  Hope to be back someday if ever in the area...I just might have to make up a reason to be back in the area, yes it's that good!

I visited the restaurant for the first time and enjoyed the food very much.  Place is small, but the good food makes up for it.  I had the Pork Chops, black beans and white rice.  It was awesome and filled with wonderful flavors.... good price...Joe, Brooklyn

Best example of a 5 start restaurant..parking was easy, service was out of this world, and food was delicious. We started with a soup to warm us up, than I had shrimp with a Spanish sauce & my GF had grilled liver- sides of tostones/beans/rice & 1/2 of pitcher of Chardonnay. Our waitress was excellent too made a lot of recommendations her best hit was on the Papaya w/ cream cheese desert.

Love this place,  everything about it.  The atmosphere and service are friendly and inviting. The food is absolutely delicious and reasonably priced. I'll be recommending it to others and returning myself.Oh and the air conditioning was blasting which didn't hurt.

Great, great food, and a nice environment too but get here early! These people don't take reservations so my son and I got there around quarter to 7:00 and ended up waiting nearly an hour. We also made the mistake of not checking in with anyone so they could add us to the wait list. As a result, we waited an extra 15 minutes or so while a couple who came after us were seated. Once we were seated, however, the service was fast and the food was fantastic. My son convinced me to try the chorizo and I liked it somewhat although I rarely eat sausage (or pork for that matter). I had the oxtail which was wonderfully tender and my son had shredded beef, which he really enjoyed. The tres leches cake was amazing. I don't think I've had anything like it, with a bottom layer soaked in syrupy sweetness.The place has a really nice family atmosphere too. The owner seems to know many customers and there's a whole musical number and dance for people's birthdays. I would have taken off another star for the wait but I realize that part of it was my fault so, despite that, it was a really nice experience.

We had a huge vat of paella style arroz con pollo, and every spoonful was amazing, tasty and fresh. This is classic, stick-to-your-ribs Cuban fare. The restaurant is small, but it doesn't feel crowded, just homey. And I love the wood cut-outs of all the latin countries running across the top part of the walls. The waitstaff is great and of course very knowledgeable.  Although we only had that one dish, with a side of maduros (sweet crunchy wafers), I don't doubt that the rest of the menu items shine just as bright. I only wished I lived closer to indulge myself more often.

We loved everything. I had the fish filet and it was a hit at the table. The chicharon de pollo was so delicious. Everything was delicious. The favorite dessert was the arroz con leche and dulce de leche. The staff is so friendly and you can feel the Cuban culture. Arrive early because the place is small and many regulars go and it's all worth the wait!

Rincon Criollo is the best Cuban restaurant in New York, with authentic food and great service, a perfect place to bring your family and friends. The waiters are very good at taking care of your every need and even sing on your birthday or anniversary. The chicharron de pollo is amazing, tender and full of flavor. The plantanos and beans were also excellent. Cafe con leche is superb. Would definitely recommend of you're hungering for really good food.

food was good, and portions where on the small side but flavorful, the ambiance was cozi and the server were nice, 3 stars because i felt they try to rip of people by saying we only take cash but we have an ATM at the entrance!!??? but we do take AMEX!i am sorry u either do o dont! ur. cc fee should ve included on your food and operation cost!

I've wanted to stop by this place many times...especially after seeing it on television. My girlfriend and I spontaneously walked into this spot, and only had a limited amount of cash and didn't know that they only accept American express. So we wasn't able to try their infamous seafood/chicken paellas. But we did get to try their other dishes. For appetizers, we had the cod fritters and the rincon criollo platter dish. The cod fritters were not bad, it tasted like seasoned bacalao but fried. The rincon criollo appetizer is like a sample platter which consisted of pernil, ham, spanish sausage, cheese, and olives. The pernil was okay but the ham and Spanish sausage were pretty good. Every entree comes with two sides of your choice which is pretty nice. I had the fish filet dish which was cooked and seasoned nicely. My sides were rice and a side of black beans which were okay. My girlfriend had the oxtail with the rice and beans along with cassava in garlic seasoning. The portions for the oxtail was pretty big and chunky. The seasonings were okay, maybe because I prefer the dominican/Puerto Rican style. The rice and beans had chunks of pork in it which they said it was bacon, I didn't really like the chunks of pork because they didn't taste fresh to me. But their garlic sauce (garlic minced/puree with oil) actually went really well with our dishes and made it taste better. The atmosphere is very causal and cheerful. But their service was excellent. We happened to be there when a big family was celebrating someone's bday and the way they brought in the cake with the music was very cute and little different compared to other restaurants. The only downside is that they don't accept any major credit cards but American express... Overall, the food was good and would definitely come back again to try their paellas, especially since we live nearby!FYI. We were told that the paella will take at least an hour to have ready.

Very delicious cuban food. I don't eat cuban food often so I don't have that much to compare, but the dishes we ordered were tasty, and the servers were friendly and helpful. The restaurant had a real family feel to it.We ordered (I forgot most of the names of the dishes):-chorizo for appetizer--typical, just what you'd expect-vaca frita - which was the fried beef. unique taste, had some strong garlic sauce to it so if you don't like that don't order this. otherwise this dish was delicious-oxtail - flavorful meat and the tomato sauce it was cooked in was addicting-fried chicken - not the typical fried chicken you'd expect. I don't think the chicken was breaded, and so it just had a thin layer of crust/crunch on the outsideeach entree came with a side dish, therefore one entree was plenty of food.Also, be sure to come here on your birthday, I don't want to ruin it for anyone but it's a pretty nice show.If I am craving decently priced and tasty cuban food I will definitely return.

Went to the Rincon, on a recommendation, to celebrate our Dad's birthday. From the moment we walked in the door, we were impressed. Since it was Papi's Birthday, Rudy totally hooked our Dad UP! Arranged for him not wait standing up (it was quite busy), grabbed a tamal & a Cuban beer for him... both were delish! While we waited, we met all the servers... all were just awesome and man... how warm & welcoming (despite the place being PACKED)! After being seated, we asked what "boliche" was... they brought us a sample. We ordered mariquitas & bacalao frito as appetizers... simply delicious. For our main course, we had vaca frita, rabo encendido, bistec encebollado, moros y cristianos, fritos maduros, & yuca frita ... everything was amazing! As if that was not enough.... THEN came the birthday song!!! Rudy just did his thing.... hi energy song & dance.... he made Papi's day (stole mine & my sister's thunder!). Papi TRULY enjoyed the experience. We wrapped the night with fantastic cortaditos & cafe con leche! Good food, clean establishment & great staff! We'll definitely be back!!!!

The best Cuban restaurant in all NYC. Amazing food! Been going here since I was a kid and I'm now 43 yrs old. Quality of food has never changed. Restaurant staff is wonderful and attentive and pleased to serve there customers. Must try the Ricon Omelette. What am I sayn try everything it's amazing. Can't say enough about this Restaurant food fantastic. I travel all the way from the Bronx to eat here. Viva Cuba!

Love this place. Just do yourself a favor and come (or order since its quarantine)here. I hate mushrooms with a passion but I always order the chicken or veal cutlet with the mushroom sauce because it's soooooo good omg. Just come here and live your best German food life
Best German food in the area. Second only to Jaeger house in Whitestone.Schnitzel off the hook.Seiners are succulentGo to the deli next door for German cold cuts!Apple Strudel is awesome with coffee.

This restaurant has been here since 1972.  Looks very much like a German or Swiss "bierhall."  The restaurant is beautiful, but has seen better days: A bit dark, a bit drab, a bit worn down.  A restaurant that's been "lived in" for a while is cool, but longer than that, it begins to look tired. It could use a cleaning / freshening up.When you look around, you'll see a large percentage of older white folks.  I imagine these people are the holdovers from the neighborhood who refused to move as the neighborhood diversified.  I imagine this is Trump country...am I being unfairly prejudiced?This must be a horrid place to work, because the waitresses rarely smile; they look miserable, even pained.  I found the service to be professional, efficient, but simply unfriendly.  Granted, we came here for Saturday lunch, and who wants to work on the weekend, right?  But still... I tried hard to engage some of the waitresses by asking them about the restaurant, and my daughter was dressed up like Little Red Riding Hood -- cute as a button!  Nobody even cracked a flicker of a smile.Foodwise, Zum Stammtisch had some nice high points which could've been improved even higher.  In general, the food is very good.Table Bread: A+Was warmed and delicious.  Crust was crusty.  Inside was soft and fluffy.  Perfect bread.Goulash Soup: A-Delicious.  Slightly too liquidy for me, but the flavor was out of sight.  You can see the flavor by just looking at my picture.  The portion was bigger than expected.  I was almost full just by the soup!Split Pea Soup: AThis is a homogeneous split pea.  There are no split peas or split pea chunks.  It leans more towards "soup" than "stew".  I'm not saying it's thin, because it's not.  It was put through a food blender, so there are no split peas to chew.  I would've given this soup an A+, but it had hotdog cut up into it.  The hotdog was ok, but seems like an odd choice for a German restaurant.  Why hotdog?!?  how about nicely grilled sausage chunks?  Or more traditional grilled ham chunks?Bratwurst: A-Knockwurst: A-Krainerwurst: A-The sausages were wonderful.  Unfortunately, considering this is a German restaurant, they SHOULD HAVE been perfect, but they weren't.  They were all very tasty and fresh, but I had two problems with them.  First, they weren't grilled consistently.  One side had grill marks; the other side didn't, and perhaps wasn't cooked enough (yikes).  Second, all three sausages either had gristle or weren't cooked enough.  I'm hoping it was gristle because I don't relish the idea of eating under-cooked pork, but either way, that's why I'm giving the sausages an A- instead of an AThe potato and sauerkraut that comes with the sausages were very good.  I felt the potato could've been better; it was a tad dry, and could've used onions and garlic, but with mustard, and accompanying sauerkraut, was good.  Table mustard was excellent.Sauerbraten: CSweet flavor, which I'm not overly fond of, but the bigger sin is that it was as dry as the Sahara on a hot day.  Criminally overcooked and not a gram of fat to be seen.  I did not enjoy this dish.Jägerschnitzel: A-A fun dish: a breaded veal cutlet with mushroom gravy and home fries.  Delicious.  The breading is wonderful.  Maybe slightly too many mushrooms, but the mushroom gravy was fantastic!  I don't normally complain about price, but $30 for a breaded veal cutlet with mushroom gravy seems a bit ridiculous.  Doesn't change the fact that this dish is delish!Coffee: ANew York is the only city I've ever been to where you can pay $100 for a lunch and get crappy coffee.  What is wrong with this city?!?  Happy to report that the coffee at Zum Stammtisch is excellent.  We got 2 refills.  Nice!  And kudos on the good coffee!Eier Eis: A-Nice quality ice cream, but a more high-quality "vanilla bean" type ice cream would've made this excellent dessert perfect. You get 3 scoops of vanilla, and just the right amount of liquor... not too overpowering, but not leaving you wanting for more.  Good way to end a meal.

Phenomenal throwback restaurant that's admittedly a little out of the way. I used to go here when I worked in Ridgewood many years ago, and have occasionally trekked out there ever since.The atmosphere is second to none! Seriously; animal heads, thick carved wooden beams, knitted cloth placemats, and friendly servers wearing dirndls. Then the food comes along and KAPLOW! It is stupendous, generous, and always fresh. I had Sauerbraten yesterday after a herring appetizer. My friend got the Goulash. Both were incredibly delicious.They start you off by dropping a mini loaf of bread on a little cutting board on your table, with a knife stuck right into the loaf. Beers are frothy, fresh, and remain cold in stonewear steins.If you like German restaurants, this is an absolute must-visit. Most places in the city are predominantly sausage & beer gardens. This is proper, sit-down action.PS - the attached German delicatessen is stocked to the gills with authentic meats and products

From the outside, Zum Stammtisch reminded me of Germany. The feel continues inside. It looks just like a German beer hall and took me straight back to Munich and Hamburg. From that moment on, I knew this was the real deal and was super excited.My husband and I came here on a Friday night for dinner. It was busy, but not super crowded. The menu appears to line up with what I have seen in my travels through Germany.Overall, the food tasted pretty authentic and was complete with large German portions! My husband ordered the bratwurst and knockwurst with home fries. The waitress brought mustard over for him; I was excited to have some of the sweet and spicy mustard like in the Hofbrauhaus. Too bad it was standard brown mustard. His dish was good, but I enjoyed mine more. I ordered the veal cordon bleu (comes with home fries) with a side of purple cabbage. I loved how cheesy my dish was -- it was dripping out and some cheese was even toasted in the fryer as it leaked out! The breading was thin and crispy. On the whole the dish was salty, creamy, and crunchy. I quite enjoyed it.My husband and I had a great dining experience. I would definitely come back to experience a bit of Germany in the U.S. Next time, we'll have to try some beer!

Excellent German restaurant that's been around forever!  Whenever I'm in NYC, I have to eat here at least once.  The food is authentic German fare--huge portions and all very tasty.  If you have room for dessert, their selections are also delicious.Waitresses dress in traditional Bavarian dresses, adding to the experience.  The bar offers great German beers that you won't find elsewhere, as well as German schnapps.  Everyone here is very friendly too.  Overall, I always have a great experience when I eat here & I highly recommend it.  If you're planning on coming for dinner or on the weekend, I'd recommend making reservations, but if you don't, you can sit at the bar and have a beer while you wait for a table.

My family has been coming here for years (and by years I really mean generations). My parents grew up coming to Zum Stammtisch when my grandparents lived in Ridgewood, and they carried that tradition forward when my sister, cousins and I were growing up. Prior to this most recent visit, it had been years since I visited Zum Stammtisch, but I'm happy to say that this place still delivers quality, both in terms of food and service.To start with the basics, Zum Stammtisch is a traditional German restaurant. In fact, the German derivation of the name means "family table". The inside of the restaurant almost feels like a combination of a tavern and a German hunting lodge, featuring dark wood furniture, rustic lighting, and Bavarian decor.Service here is also top notch. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and very service-oriented. We were here to visit my uncle's birthday, so she also offered to take several pictures of us and made sure they were "social media worthy".Finally, let's talk about the food. My family is very predictable in the sense that we all crave Sauerbraten (call it a family tradition). Sauerbraten is not easy to make (it takes days) and it's quite simple to screw up (much like slow-roasted southern style brisket). Nevertheless, Zum Stammtisch doesn't fail to deliver. The sauerbraten is tender (can cut with a fork) and covered with sweet-and-sour gravy. The side of red cabbage and dumplings (traditional for this dish) are also made perfectly here. In addition, every meal begins with free bread service (so good), and the beverage selections are on point (plenty of German beers and lots more to choose from).There's not many of these places left, so I'm glad Zum Stammtisch is still around. It's a classic German restaurant that focuses on service, food quality, and family. If you love German food, this place is a must. If you don't like German food, this place might convince you otherwise.

I am shocked that I have yet to review this place after going there hundreds of times over my life lol!  I usually come here 10 ish times per year...  So where do I begin.  This place has been featured on Food Network several times, and is the standard for German food across the country.They actually filmed a turbo tax commercial here years ago!When you walk in, you feel like you are stepping into a local bier hall in Germany.  It is dark and dimly lit, but it is more than bright enough to see everything!  It is filled with wood and imported items from Germany.  The ladies are also dressed in dirndls.  It feels very authentic inside.On to the food.  I haven't tried everything yet, nor do I know that I ever will lol!  I have a few favorites.  I like to start out with Goulash soup, usually a bowl.  The bread is dunk in there lol!  I am also a fan of the steak tar tar, but I am 1 person, and its a little big for just me...  For Entrees, any schnitzel is always amazing.  I usually stick with the wiener and I get a side of sauerbraten gravy.  My wife loves their jagerschnitzel.  All meals come on top of their famous home fries.  I don't think that we have ever left there without a take home bag haha!  I also enjoy their sauerbraten.  Its a little smaller than I hope, but its delicious and full of flavor.  The sausages are also great! They are also very well known for their prime rib!  From what people tell me, it is the best around by far!I have always had good service here.  The staff has always been very friendly.  Ive never had any issues.  One of the organizations I am part of has their Christmas party her every year, and I am looking forward to it this Thursday!!!They also have a great German deli right next door!All in all, its in the middle of nowhere with horrible parking.  Its hard to get tom but it is totally worth it!!!

I've never been to this place before, now I finally get it. I can't say it's authentic because I've never been to Germany unless you count EPCOT. Lets get this review started!If I'm going to Queens, there's no better foodie wingman than Yelper Jim D. My grandmother would have loved to feed him, the man can eat! I made plans with him a few weeks ago. I got to the restaurant first, there is one thing about Queens, it's hipster free. Guys at the bar all drinking some quality German beer, no kale chips here. I nudge my way to the bartender, I don't know what the hell to order but I see a guy drinking a Pilsner. I tell the bartender I'll have one of those. A few minutes later, Jimmy D shows. Guy back slaps happen and we're shown to our table.Now I've been reading the website, I know I'm going to order the Wienerschnitzel. Now Jim is in his element, he starts telling the waitress bring gold flass (?), beers and potato pancakes. That is a lotta food and all the while I'm thinking I have to drive back to Stony Brook.Some amazing bread is brought to our table. I'm trying not to go into a carb overload but the bread is really good. Jim & I are talking, I can see my buddy is in a good mood. I always say, happy wife gets you a happy life. He's in the zone, teaching me about Gold water and how the Jagerschnitzel gravy needs to be on the side so it doesn't get soggy. I would have put mozzarella on this thing, who knew?!I see my Yelp buddy Tonya J has a Yelp ROTD here, I'm excited for what's coming. I'm now staring at the massive plate with a Jagerschnitzel hanging over the side?? I'm about to cut into it, Jim D plops a potato pancake on my plate. This is German food at its finest. The Jagerschnitzel? Krazy good. What I was most impressed with was the potato pancake. It was so good and crunchy! We had one left over, I wanted my wife to experience how awesome the food was at Zum. I can see why people love this spot, this is great German cooking, Queens baby!I can't believe I ate everything. Now Jim? He's itching for more. He orders coffee, no problem. Then he asks for a dessert menu? Jim.. Baked goods are my weakness! I also order the famous apple strudel. Growing up in Brooklyn, I had my share of Strudel. This strudel takes it to another level. The shell was very light, unlike what I had my entire life. This was a well executed and perfectly crafted strudel. The apples were very fresh, nothing out of a can from these folks.Will I return? Of course but it's a hike for me. If you want to experience the Best German food in the area? Zum Stammtisch is the spot.

Ok solid four stars over here for now; I'm new to this German joint but I'm a regular at Octoberfest & let me tell this place has delicious authentic German  favorites that will not disappoint !!!Love the old charm inside well decorated with a lots of nostalgia even the waitresses wear theses cute uniforms .....Very friendly staff in place, we arrived a Lil early about 11:45am thinking we would have to wait until 12 noon when the restaurant opens but to our surprise their were 8 people already at the bar .... We ordered some appetizers; their jumbo Pretzel & their kasespatzle .... the pretzel was very good along with their honey mustard & german deli mustard & the horseradish sauce which was my favorite!!! The Kasespatzle was like the best I've ever had ... loved the Swiss & onions & bacon bits !!! ( we shared that between the three of us next time I would get that for my meal )Dinner was awesome as well; we all went with the chicken hunter; the portion was huge and it was delicious the brown sauce & mushrooms as well as their home fries .... " Go here Hungry " we all ate our left overs for dinner !!! Desert; really had no room but we had to try their homemade apple strudel & whip cream which was another home run ....We have another German restaurant to go head to head with Octoberfest !!!Can't wait to explore the rest of their menu .....Funny thing..... one of my co workers use to work in the kitchen .... MASBOO and he always bragged to us how good the food was and we use to laugh because he's from Iran and we use to say what do you know about German food ??  Lmao, but he was right !!! Thanks,Greg D & family

Finally got to visit!  The hospitality here is top notch.  Everyone is helpful and friendly.  Food is delicious.  The fresh bread with butter so warm and comforting.  The salad is wonderful and the house salad dressing is great.  I ordered the breaded chicken which was perfectly fried and the homefries were cooked to perfection with the crispy edges.  Apple strudel was AMAZING!!!

Have been coming to Zum Stammtisch for years and it will always have a special place in my heart, it was my grandfathers favorite restaurant.  His favorite was the sourbraten and mine is the weinerschnitzel. You can not find more authentic German food outside of Germany!!

It's a mini-vacation to Germany. Was there this past week on a Tuesday night for the Oktoberfest menu. It was a full-out party. Food was incredible, jaegerschnitzel, jaegerschnitzel, jaegerschnitzel. I wish I didn't get so full on the steak tartare, served over sliced bread with briny stuff and onions. And the goulash has layers over layers of flavor. The live music / entertainment was a fantastic touch. So much fun. I can't speak enough about the servers, who encourage pulling you out of your chair to dance. It's all good. Although I think the Oktoberfest vibe is temporary. Regular nights it's just a fantastic restaurant with friends gathering at the table.

Hi Yelp Friends, Welcome to Zum  Stammtisch. In Big Jim's opinion it's the Best German restaurant in the area. I've been going to this wonderfully authentic spot for over 30 years. The place is always exactly the same every time I visit. The bar is the same, the tables and the decorations haven't changed and the menu I have memorized. I was really delighted when Mayor Bill suggested that we meet here for Zums for lunch. My friend didn't know that I've been coming here with friends since my college days. The place has so many memories of my youth and Good Times. I can see memories of dear friends passed on.., still at the bar here drinking and enjoying the times. I guess In Heaven There Is No Beer, that's why they're still all here ..It was a wonderful homecoming to return and great to see my Cool Yelp friend Bill.I love the Jagerschnitzel here. I mean it's Big Jim's favorite meal for a reason. It's just so Big, crispy and the best I've had anywhere. I get their mushroom hunter sauce on the side and then dip, keeps every bite crisp and delish. For appetizer of course we got Zumies famous homemade potato pancakes. Served with sour cream and applesauce, I can taste them now so hot freshly-made . A must order, these potato pancakes are off the chart. We got a good German beer to pair on meal with, and then Billy and I toasted good times with the  incredibly lavish 22 karat Goldwasser liquor shots. This is a serious shot Folk's, as it's actually flakes of gold floating around in the liquor. Prost and bottoms up. And let's have another round.  Next up coffee and dessert, I had the incredibly delicious Black Forest sundae and my friend Bill enjoyed his light crispy apple strudel.The Goldwasser made our meal even better, getting lit up with the local folks in the cool German Bavarian atmosphere. Our server was just wonderful prompt with water refills, and was wonderfully attentive to all our needs. We had such a good time at the Zum Stammtisch for lunch this afternoon Thanks to my friend The Yelp Baron Mayor Bill( ..That's his Yelp title).. for making the suggestion we meet here. I've always loved it at Zumies.I can't wait to return here, there's a reason this is my favorite German eating and drinking joint. See you all again soon. Moin-moin Friends!

The best German restaurant I've ever tried. Their menu is extensive and varied. It's not all meat and carbs. We ordered a bunch of stuff but i highly recommend the pretzel! It is so big and fresh. I got the shrimp special because again i don't like meat that much, and i was surprised how well they cooked it. Shrimp was fresh and cooked crispy. Beef tartar is great to share as it is huge!! Everything is largely portioned so come hungry.

I first heard of Zum Stammtisch through my parents - they dined here a few times with some family friends and always had good things to say. This intrigued me because you don't see a straight-up German restaurant on just any street corner. My only real experience with German food was when I was in Disney World at Biergarten, so when I had the opportunity to try Zum myself, I pounced.Zum has been in Glendale since the 70s; in addition to the restaurant, they have a shop next door where they sell meats and such. You can tell the restaurant has been around for a while, but aesthetically speaking they really did an amazing job. Zum definitely screams German restaurant with its dark color scheme and little details everywhere. The aesthetics spill into the menu - they really have a nice variety of dishes, all with roots in Germany or Germanic/Nordic countries. We were started with two substantial loaves of bread and butter - I'm not sure exactly what kind of bread it was but I was tasting some sweet and rye notes. Whatever it was, I was enjoying the carbs. I also decided to get a cup of goulash; this was really good - lots of chunks of beef and filled with flavor, it was delicious. We all shared käsespätzle, which was a good idea because it was super rich. Despite the richness, I really enjoyed it - the noodles, the cream, the bacon...I mean, come on.For my main I decided to get sausages. One of the options was to get a choice of three sausages with sides of sauerkraut and potato salad. I chose one of each sausage they offered: bratwurst, knockwurst, and krainerwurst. Each one had really good flavor and complimented each other well while also holding their own - I'm glad I chose one of each. The sauerkraut was good, but the real side dish star for me was the potato salad. It wasn't mayo-based which I liked and had a slight acidity which worked well with the dish overall. Really the only sour spot for me was when dessert came and they were out of black forest cake. Normally I'm okay with out of stock issues, but to be out of a signature German dessert on a Friday evening? mmmm :-/. We did however get the apple strudel which kind of made up for it - it had nice cinnamon and apple flavor. Service was great, everyone was really friendly and service was prompt. Overall, Zum was a fun treat. The food was honest and delicious, plus the aesthetics were on point. I would definitely come back and recommend this place to friends. A trip to their pork store is on my radar, so perhaps a revisit will be sooner rather than later =)

If you're looking for laid-back German food with a more casual atmosphere, this is your place.It stands out on the exterior. We drove by months before actually stepping foot in here and I remember saying, "that has to be a German place.". Inside is larger than you might think. You only see one room of two when you go inside. Tucked behind the bar is another larger room with plenty of tables and chairs. The menu here is meat and beer. Okay they also offer salmon but are you really ordering that? I went with the light beer (even though I also tasted and enjoyed the dark beer). Yes, they do boots here. No, we did not use them. Yes, I got a big ass mug of beer that required two hands to hold to take one sip. For my meal I had the breaded chicken. The food was okay, nothing too great but I also find German food in general to be on the bland side. The service here is what really bumps this place to 4 stars. Everyone is friendly and helpful and your fellow diners are also there to have a good time.

Can here with a party of 7. German food remains to be my least liked food. I'm going on my opinion and that of my friends.  Was looking forward to one of those big warm pretzels. It was only 7PM and they ran outI stay safe with the wursts. They were good with the hot sauerkraut but the potato salad was cold and it's usually served warm which makes it so so much better. The other dishes were smothered in gravy or sauces. My friend said the sauerbraten wasn't great. I tasted it and the meat was so potted that it was mush in your mouth. If you have no teeth this is the dish for you!!The pork chop was dry as anything as you can see in the pic. Best part---- desert. Hot apple strudel with vanilla ice cream. Asked for whipped cream but never came. At least they make decaf coffee which a lot of restaurants don't. Good bread on the table to start. Service was good. Wouldn't go back. Parking is pretty difficult. No lot.

There really aren't a lot of authentic German restaurants so it seems silly to call this my favorite one. But it really truly is. Zum Stammtisch is an authentic, real deal German restaurant in the heart of central Queens. Sure parking is tight, but the atmosphere and experience bring you back to Bavaria. The waitresses are dressed in traditional clothing,  the decor is dark, rustic and filled with blue checkerboard. The food is delicious and consistent. The goulash soup is my absolute favorite and as good as my grandmother makes it. Even the free brown bread they serve is fresh, authentic and tasty. The sausage platters are huge and also tasty as are the sauerbraten and chicken dishes. The portions are very large and can be shared. Also: beer  is a great way to compliment your meal. Served in huge mugs the German beer selections are always a good way to go!

I've been dying for good German comfort food ever since Kleine Konditerei closed in Yorkville, and this place really filled the void!  Sauerbraten superb, and real potato dumplings - just excellent.  Red cabbage a bit too sour for me, but was very good.  Husband's Jaegerschnitzel also excellent, as was our herring with beets appetizer.  Highly recommended.  Too bad it's so off our beaten path.  We need one in Westchester, Putnam or the Capital District.
Great atmosphere! The German food was amazing! I personally recommend the beef goulash and the Chicken Riesling! Service is prompt and the accents were super cool!

It pains me to write this.  I have had several great experiences, but this past Sunday 11/10 was horrific.  Had a reservation for 6pm, did not get seated till 6:30.  Bread and water cam fast.  25 minuets later waitress comes over and takes our appetizer order.  Comes out 30 mins later.  another 45 mins later, they take the food order.  It is then, they tell us no specials tonight.  That's is what we were going for.  we ordered.  an hour later the food comes, an hour later.  Most o the dishes are cold.  I ordered the weiner Shitnizle, which was cold, and gummy.  the potatoes were cold as well.  I asked to speak to a manager, a 20 year old comes over and says talk to your waitress, i said I would if I could.  They offered to reheat my order, no thanks, Prices too high to heat up in a microwave.  The Manager did take off 2 entries and they offered to buy my table dessert on the house.  We were all disgusted and opted not to take their offer as we were there well over 2 and a half hours.  Very disappointing.  1st time on a sunday and now my last.  The waitress was very apologetic but I was upset and extremely mad.  So after 2 meals deducted my bill was still $186.00, before the tip.

People talk about this place all the time. Went to try it with my friends and honestly don't understand the hype. The food is okay, nothing great. Kind of expensive for ok food and the staff isn't that friendly. It's cool to say I've gone but don't think Id go back

worst place EVER! Have been here 4 times in the past. first two was ok, but the last two STUNK. Parking is horrible and the last time I was there I got  COLD FOOD (it wasnt even warm!) gave me a bad stomach ache. disguisting place for the bathrooms weren't even clean. dont bother going here. but of you do, DONT FORGET THE IMMODIUM A.D.!!

The decor and vibe of the place is definitely Bavarian styled and makes you feel like you're in an authentic German place. Food wise, not so great. Food taste almost franchise like (AKA Applebee's, Friday's, etc.)We got the jaegerschnitzel and the sauerbraten. Both were cold and sad tasting. Food is super pricey and not worth it! The girls were lovely and service was good but obviously everything else was not up to par. Don't have to come back here again.

We've lived in the area for about 3 years before actually and eventually getting to try this place out. It really is like stepping into little Germany in NYC! Service is so warm and homely and the staff are so knowledgeable about the food and beers. They're also dressed up (some of them) in traditional Bavarian attire. I had the veal cutlet which was cooked to perfection and my wife had the shrimp special which she wasn't to keen on. The bread basket they give you as appetizers is off the hook! So fresh and tasty for a bread basket and the flight of beer we ordered was so great. To end we had the black forest slice which was a nice generous helping (as if we needed more after such a wholesome meal?!) definitely one of the greats in this area!!!!
The food and beer on tap is very good but the service from the host and the server is average at best .

I come here every year around Christmas time. The food is always very consistent and high quality! It is a little pricey but the prices are in line with how large the portions are. The decor around Christmas is a great feel and it's a great place to come with family. The bread is always fresh and warm! If you have a bigger group definitely make a reservation as it gets very busy.

This is hands down my favorite restaurant. If you want to try authentic German cuisine, you must visit!! I have tried a variety of food from here including the Jaegerschnitzel, brats, and steak tar tar. Steak tar tar might just be my favorite. It is ground steak meat that is served raw in pieces on a thin bread, and paired with potato salad in the middle. I was a bit weary because of the "raw" part, but it absolutely seasoned to perfection and has become a staple! You also must have the ground pepper garnished on top! There's really nothing like it and in my opinion is a very unique dining choice!There are also a variety of other dishes to try that are true to German tradition, however the 3 i named are my favorite. You can also choose appetizers, desserts, and specials that change daily. The lunch menu is also the same as the dinner menu.Try to get there early for lunch or make reservations for dinner. This place fills up fast on the weekends, as it is a popular place for locals! Parking can be difficult, as there's only side street parking. However, of you do go for lunch or on a week day you'll have better luck getting a spot. If you're in the mood to try something different or you're already a fan of German food, this is an absolute must try!!!!!
Very on Obnoxious waitresses.. food is  mediocre at best. Has potential bUt they charge a lot for  very little.  The place is cute but the staff is nasty.
Delicious authentic German food! The Goulash soup is unbelievable. We've never had a bad meal here, plus the attached market offers a variety of treats!
Typical American German food.  It's always pretty good. And the beer selection is good!

I live a couple of blocks away from this restaurant and after a long time we ( me and my best friend )stopped by for dinner . The atmosphere was amaizing , it was October fest if I'm not wrong and all the waitresses were dressed with the traditional costume . I ordered a steak but I think it was way to much cooked ( maybe that's how they eat it) . The meals were totally something new to me and it was kind of hard for me to get used to it but the service and the atmosphere were amaizing . This place it's always busy !! Loved it and definitely will be back
Amazing! The beer hall is such a cozy place to hang. The amazing and authentic sausages are the real star of the show. Beers too, of course. Oh, and lovely staff

Get a taste of authentic Bavarian German foods right in the heart of Queens NY. Hey, if you're really interested in having a good Schnitzel (veal cutlet) then you're in for a treat. Having said that, I have to say that the entire menu was very authentic. Spätzle prepared with cheese that is melted in a crock is a nice starter! But do couple that with a good Pilsner beer! For the meat lovers I highly recommended the Sauerbraten which is prepared perfectly, and served swimming in a pool of gravy. This you can couple with your choice of Knödels (German Dumplings) where you are served two, or mashed potatoes or a vegetable! Whatever you couple it with, the Sauerbraten remains the star of the dish. If you're into sausages, there is a good assortment here, and they have a plate where you can try most in one serving. My entire party was very happy with their meals and the service is absolutely great! If you're not familiar with German food, or if you are, you will enjoy your experience here. And don't forget the apple strudel for dessert! They also have a German pork shop next door, where you can get some sausages to take home and a good collection of German Edibles like marzipan! Worth a trip!

Wonderful family dinner with Jägerschnitzel, dumplings and red cabbage followed by apple strudel. I can forgive the blunder that they ran out of potato pancakes and black forest cake. I guess we'll have to go back soon to sample some more!

There is no place like this one. I have been going here my whole life and I can't think of a better place to spend time with family and friends. Make dinner reservations ,but come early and spend time at the bar. The beer is awesome. I can't say enough about the food here. You have to get the goulash soup for an appetizer and the jager schnitzel for entree. The meat is cooked soo well and the veal cutlet is huge. The hunters sauce is one of the best sauces I have ever had. If I had to select a last meal this place would be it. This place is a family tradition to me. Can't say enough good things about it. Check out the porkStore. I hear they have an online business now. I would give this place 6 stars if able.

Came here for a friend's birthday lunch on a Saturday at 2pm - the group was about 19 people. We reserved a space in the back and were hoping to get to 20 people for their set menu. We asked if we could just have the set menu (which was a choice of an appetizer, entree, dessert, and coffee for $35 a person). Definitely a great deal as their portions are gigantic here!I split the entrees with a couple of people, so I ordered the jargerschnitzel, another ordered the beef dish, and the last person ordered the sausage option. The jaegerschnitzel was definitely the winner, and apparently is their most popular/signature dish. I requested the sauce to be on the side, as I still wanted some extra crispy portions of the schnitzel, but this was given to another person at the table. Either way, even with the mushroom sauce covering it, it still maintained a nice level of crispness. It was honestly perfection!The beef dish was in a sauce that was a bit too sweet for my taste, so I wouldn't recommend this, and the sausage option was pretty meh.The cheesecake was really, really tasty! The staff handled our huge group pretty easily and were joking around with su the whole time.The other thing I'd like to tough on is their beer flight - this was not your average flight with 4 oz. pours, their pours were about 8 oz. each! By the end of the meal, I was stuffed from the food, and the amount of liquids I drank, as I got a half liter of hefeweizen even before we ate. An absolutely wonderful, friendly German place, and one that I'd go back to frequently if it wasn't so far from me!
As usual very hearty and satisfying! Jaeger schnitzel was enough for two and salmon was fresh. Service was efficient. Dining room could use a little sprucing up however.

Me and my husband we live in Nassau county for years my parents ate at this restaurant we would come 2 times a year we were disappointed today my husband  had a veal dish that was chewy and mashed potatoes were cold he was so upset he didn't even want to tell them waitress realized he didn't even touch his dish they did take it off the bill but sorry to say for the prices they should have been much better we will not Be going back again

Been going here since I actually lived in Glendale in the '70's. This was always our favorite German Restaurant and would travel 1.5 hrs each way from NJ in traffic just to eat here.  This past visit on Saturday 8/10 was so awful I don't think we will ever go back.  Service was fine but Food was so awful we wondered if they sold the place or got a new chef.  Such a shame.  Their food and desserts were always so phenomenal that no other German place could compete.  Don't know what happened. ‍

I have been going here for years. The food is decent. My favorite is the jaegar schnitzel. The ghoulash is also good. I went recently with a group and was turned off however by the service. Additionally the server charged us $2.50 for every refill of soda. She could have mentioned it, I don't recall seeing it on the menu. Usually we get beer, but this night in particular we wanted soda. Imagine our surprise when we see an extra $20 on the bill for soda! It's from a fountain anyway, you can literally see the station from the front entrance. The experience definitely put a bad taste in my mouth.

It's been over 6 years since my last review. I remain a vegetarian, Grandma is 6 years older, and the Zum Stammtisch still doesn't know how to take care of its customers. My family had dinner here this week. The portions were huge (they seem to have increased since we were last here), the food was delicious, and our server Megan was great. There were even potato pancakes available, and if you've read my previous review, you understand why that's really something to celebrate. The trouble came with the bill. We had spent nearly $300 on food and drinks. Imagine our dismay when we discovered that my uncle had been charged $3.95 for the 4 ounces of extra gravy he asked for with his Jagerschnitzel. We thought this was ridiculous, and brought it to the manager's attention. He was very apologetic and asked what he could do to make us happy. Did we want him to remove the charge? Nope. We wanted it to never be on the bill in the first place! Was the $4 worth annoying otherwise happy customers? This restaurant needs to change its nickeling and diming ways. We will never be back, and that's a shame because the potato pancakes were worth the 6 year wait.

Of all my reviews, I have only given 1 star to 5 places...sadly, this will be #6.  I had heard and read so many great things about Zum Stammtisch, but our experience tonight left a really sour taste, and I probably won't be back.  I have a real issue with greedy restauranteurs who do NOT care about their customers.  There are plenty of other great restaurant who would appreciate our business and treat us so much better.Service was terrible.  Our server, Nerina, had an attitude from the very start.  I don't know what her problem was, but she had a chip on her shoulder before we even said hello.  Granted, we were a large party of 10 ppl and it was crowded in the restaurant.  But still, crack a smile, it won't kill you, I promise!
