 We only saw her 3 times during the entire evening:  taking the order, serving the order, and giving us the check (after we asked 3 times).  We were ignored by her for most of the evening.Besides our terrible server Nerina, my main complaint is the horrible customer service on the part of the manager.  There were 10 of us dining tonight, and we pre-planned a family-style dinner (based on their online menu) so that we could have the opportunity to try as many dishes as we can.  We ordered 6 appetizers and 6 entrees to share - Keep in mind, the portions are HUGE!  Well, apparently, they charge $5 per dish if shared.  When I went to speak to the manager about the sharing charge, she was completely unbending and kept saying that it is in the fine print on the menu.  And I kept reminding her that nowhere on their elaborate website, does it state that there is a $5 charge per dish for sharing!  We would only see the fine print once we were actually IN THE RESTAURANT, which she somehow couldn't seem to comprehend.  She just kept giving me a blank stare and said it's on the menu.  This just reeked of greediness and uncaring, horrible customer service.  Was the extra $30 you squeezed out of us worth the loss of future customers?Note:  6 appetizers and 6 entrees was more than enough food for 10 ppl to share.  We had sooooo much leftovers!!!  I can't even imagine how much food we would have had if we ordered 10 entrees!  Normally, I would go into detail (with photos) about the food but quite frankly, i'm just disgusted with Zum Stammtisch.On a more positive note, the food was good!!  Kudos to the kitchen staff!  Also kudos to Tiffany, our server's assistant.  Tiffany was so pleasant and wonderful, and so hard-working!! Give this gal a raise - she deserves it!
Amazing authentic German cuisine!  My one complaint is to bring back the linzer torte!!

For years some of my co-workers have suggested Zum Stammtisch. German food is a favorite and I had looked at their menu many times online. But, since Glendale is not easily accessed from where I live I never went.Last Friday night I had the opportunity of going with friends from Queens. My two complaints are they don't have parking, and why did I wait so long before going!The meal is everything I expected- great food, good drinks, and excellent service!I could not decide between two entrees, so I will have to return soon to try the Wiener schnitzel. At the server's suggestion I went with the jager schnitzel.

Yes yes yes definitely worth going. My husband and I were there a couple of times and this place have not but delicious food and great beer. The service is super nice and everything about the place is great. It is a family business and old fashion interior. It is a gem.

My favorite German restaurant in New York, and the best, period. It's still as great now as it was when I was a kid growing up in nearby Middle Village. You come here for superb classic Deutsches cuisine, for the beer, for the warm atmosphere and deep sense of history and "Gemütlichkeit". You can't go wrong with the goulash soup, herring salad, sauerbraten, jJägerschnitzel or any of the wursts. All are still top notch. Sip a big stein of beer while you munch. I like to finish off the wonderfully heavy meal with a coffee drink like the Rudesheimer or German coffee.

Holy schnitzel!!  The Germans don't play around with their food, and Zum Stammtisch proves that with extremely hearty and robust, flavorful, authentic German cuisine.  My go-to has always been Manor Oktoberfest - neither one place is better than the other, both places are fantastic and unique in their own way!  ZS however, is special in the fact that it seems they truly stick to those tried and true old-world recipes, and the decor is really beautiful with an historic charm.  As soon as I stepped foot in here, it really reminded me of "aux anciens canadiens" restaurant in Quebec, Canada, which is one of the oldest restaurants there.  The vibe and ethos of both places are very similar.  The second place it reminded me of was Zum Schiffchen in Dusseldorf (Altstadt/Old Town), Germany, but the decor was different, and the food is actually better in Queens!!Service was quite warm and friendly, at least from our waitress.  My friend who turned me onto this place did share a gripe about their odd seating arrangements, and how the booths are so coveted and difficult to score without a reservation, and sometimes they'll be empty but they won't seat you?  Neither he, nor I, a noob, knows how it works with regards to that whole situation, but the four of us were able to get a table quickly and we all had a great time the night that we went to ZS.  I ordered the famous, "Jägerschnitzel" or "Hunter's cutlet" (per the menu:  our most popular item, the "hunter's cutlet" is a breaded veal cutlet topped with a sauce made from fresh mushrooms & veal stock, $27.95), and I have to say, it was ridiculously portioned (in a good way) & absolutely satisfying and delicious.  Mind you, the price is bit hefty, but it's basically two meal servings in one!!  I doggy bagged half of the meal and we ate it for breakfast the next day and it tasted incredible.  If you don't pace yourself well, there's zero chance you'll have room for dessert, which is exactly what happened to our table.  I'd likely come again and only get the "Jägerschnitzel" because it' EPIC, but their menu is wide ranging and varied and there are lot of tantalizing options!  My husband got the pre-fixe which came with a warm pretzel (yum), a cup of soup (Goulash is so good!), and your choice if three types of wursts, and a side of sauerkraut.  I had a bite of each wurst, and they were all great, though the currywurst could have kicked it up a notch with the curry flavor.  Overall, still an excellent meal.

Beer and food was excellent. 6 steins later, I was feeling no pain. Food was very good. Would love to go back for a true dinner.  When I went, it was a big party celebrating Oktoberfest. So everyone was drunk, dancing, singing. Lol. Really good time with great friends

I've only tried German food a handful of times but this place was delicious! They still have the old school decor which they probably had since the place opened and i loved it. Gives it character. The service was very friendly and attentive. I tried their weinerschnitzel, red cabbage and dumplings. Everything was very good especially the dumplings. Can't wait to visit again and try something different.

The decor old world Europe looked just like my favorite German Beer Halls and Restaurants abroad.  The Beer was excellent and for starters we had Sausages: Bratwurst, Knockwurst, Krainerwurst: Pork Sausage Smoked With Hickory. Grilled & Served with Potato Salad & Sauerkraut It was excellent.For my main course I had to order the Wienerschnitzel one of my all-time favorite dishes, sad to say not great but very good, will be back to try again. I may have been spoiled by my extensive traveling in Europe. My friend had the Jagerschnitzel and loved it, the same as mine but covered with mushrooms
Always a great meal and portions that require a take home bag!  I've tried most of the menu and I'm never disappointed!

I must say I was skeptical of this place, mostly because I kept hearing people rave about the goulash. Whatever...goulash? Really? Well, I'm from Arizona. I know goulash is that dish your mother makes; a casserole with pasta and Veg-all. Well, German goulash is not what my mother used to make. Zum Stammtisch goulash is a little bit of heaven in a bowl. The worst part: I was sharing a bowl. This was my fault because of pre-complaining that I didn't like goulash, so, only one bowl was ordered.  Everything we ordered was exceptional. The service was great! The ambiance was nice. This will be my go-to when I'm in NYC. I'm sure there are other places just as good, but this was love at first bite! I would recommend it without apprehension.
The quintessential NY German restaurant, and one of the last of the old guard. Step back in time here and have a delicious meal!

Want German food? This is it. The real deal; not the typical knock off imitation we usually get. Order anything on the menu and you will be so happy and full - for days! After I eat here, I'm usually full far into the next day. Honestly, I dream about the food here. But I must warn you - ZS will ruin you. Once you taste real sauerbraten, jagersnitzle, etc. you won't even waste your time in those other restaurants. In fact, I drive 50 minutes just to go here. It's that good.
Great place and Great food. Sauerbraten and goulash soup are delicious. Portions are large and food is authentic.There's also a nice meat market/shop attached. Highly recommend!

Every time I'm in New York City I make it a point to come here. The decor is quaint and authentic to a German beer hall. The food is consistently amazing (the goulash and jagerschnitzel are divine, it's what I get every time). And the wait staff is friendly and happy to help. Don't miss out on this spot!!

I've been to this place twice. The second time was on a Saturday and got to take advantage of the specials. My dining partner and I shared the duck and prime rib along with mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. Absolutely amazing! The complimentary bread they give you is also very good.

When I lived in the hood I begged my parents to bring me here. Decades later I still make a detour to come here. I have brought my family as well. I would add this to the wonders of queen's. In the winter you must have the goose.But it's the hot summer now so I had the duck really good! my sister had the choice of  2 sausages, with amazing German potato salad. Her boy friend sourbratten (the dish not his name!) all served with amazing pickled red cabbage. Our waitress was really nice but rushed. The rest of the staff was also friendly. We had the Apple strudel for desert. THANKS TO THE STAFF

Such a disappointing meal: heavy, wet overcooked.  Sauerbraten had a heavy sauce that drowned the tasteless meat, escargot in a potatoe was equally tasteless.  Jagerschnitzel was soggy like a washcloth as was the huhnerschnitzel.  The hamburger was enormous and unseasoned.To be fair the veal cordon bleu was ok as was the kids chickenschmitzel. Portions are enormous. kitchen was very slow.Wait staff was efficient, friendly and courteous.Apfel streudel pastry was soggy but the filling was tasty.  On the whole I'd say not worth the $25-30 per main course. At thst price one deserves better food.

Full disclosure, I have sentimental memories of this place which was one of my since deceased husband's favorite restaurants. However, I had not eaten there in well over 10 years and learned that it's long time competitor in the area, Niedersteins, is no longer in business. Anyway, I happen to be in the area with a friend so we stopped in, not knowing Oktoberfest what is happening. This is a prefix event that apparently sells out long in advance. Nice Octoberfest style ambience with live music. However, since we were not part of that, we had to wait half an hour for a table, which ended up not being too bad because people watching was great. My friend agreed that the way it was well worth while, we had a great time and the authentic German food was excellent. If you're not sure what to order, try the Bauern Platte and get the beer sampler. Despite the über busy night they were having, the staff were still friendly and attentive.

Food is 4. Service is 2.5 for me.  I am sure there are other people who gets warm service.  It is unfortunately that we have to think in our heads " is it because we are looking a little bit different than the usual costumer base there?"  We stand there being ignored as many servers passed by not acknowledging our presence and not making any eye contact for a good 5 to 10 mins.  No smiles.  Restaurant was moderately busy but I don't think it has anything to do with that.  We understand that individual could have bad days.  But it seems to be a collective thing there. New York has a lot of unique restaurants.  We do not not need to go where we do not feel welcomed.  Will not be going back.

Old. School. German. Loved it. (Disclaimer: I typically really enjoy German Culture, Beer, Food, etc...)This place is charming. I came here on a recommendation of a friend (both of us have been to Germany) and I'm really glad I did. I sat at the bar since I was flying solo but I'm glad I did. Pat was the bartender and everything about him was great. (He's an OG professional and reminds me a bit of my dad who also tends bar)I had some classic German Beers of course and a pretzel!I gotta say most pretzels in NYC let me down but this one is great (menu says it's baked locally and now I want to know where). Can't wait to come back and maybe sit down for dinner. But either way I hope Pat is here...cause he's the man. First timer and already a fan!

Zum Stammtisch serves generous portions, is the best German restaurant in NYC. The food quality is very consistent and wonderful to my taste. I highly recommend you consider the daily specials as they are exceptional. Prime Rib, chicken cutlets, sauerbraten, stuffed cabbage, weinershnitzel, jagerschnitzel are the dishes I have had so far. Reservations are highly recommended on weekends.

Was meaning to try Zum Stammtisch for over 3 years now since I first heard about it and finally got the chance to 2 nights ago. I must say I was blown away from the friendly staff, the beer, and the exceptional food that is offered here. This restaurant brings out the feel of dining in Germany in the 17/18th century with a modern amenities of course.Got there around 9 P.M. My friend and I were promptly seated. We started off the with 2, 1 liter house beers. I don't directly remember the names but one was the wheat beer the other Lauger. I had the Lauger and it was amazing. My friend had ordered the 2 sausages. Knockwurst and Krainerwurst. A rating for both. I had gotten the Jagerschnitzel. That's their coveted dish. Served with cabbage, Mushroom sauce on top of Veal cutlet and home fries with bacon. I was blown away. I didn't get the coffee they offer but based off other reviews they say it's amazing. Next time for sure. I'd come back soon. Excellent choice.

Second time visiting that place and unfortunately disappointed. Wiener Zwiebel Rostbraten was purely fat, not a steak. Literally all you could taste was fat. On top of that, the onion was covered in dark burn. That dish was huge, barely finished it, but just GREASE. Second dish, that we ordered was Sirloin Steak, medium rare. Very juicy, tender, but no FLAVOR. Same thing, steak was literally burned. All I could taste was bitter flavor of burn on this steak. No use of SALT/PEPPER/GARLIC/THYME/BUTTER to make this nice piece of meat stand out. The only thing that we enjoyed were the steak fries and beer flight. Total cost was $97. With tip, $112. I mean for such a price, not a visit worth of going. I hope, the rest of their dishes is not that poorly executed.

Nice place, as usual the menus is a mix of traditional Bavarian food (Leberkäse) and others (shrimp cocktail).  The beer list is ok. Service friendly. The portions of some dishes are just way too big!!!! The Leberkäse for example can feed two or three people, which is a petty as they charge you extra if you split a meal and there a delicious deserts on the menu, which will be untouched, unless you are a professional wrestler and need the extra calories.

Never had a bad meal or bad service.  The steak tartare is delish!!  Even the short bar menu is great, particularly the hunerjager (spelling)? which at the bar is a smaller portion. Oh and the black forest sundae!!!!

I grew up in Glendale and I may have gone to Zum Stammtisch as I child, but I did not remember. My dad took me here tonight before flying back to Tampa after Christmas. There was an hour long wait, but it was worth it! This place is very small and popular so if you have a party of 4 or more, you should make a reservation. We arrived around 5:30pm and did indeed wait an hour for our party of four. The building is very old and I don't think that the decor has changed at all since it opened many many years ago. There is not a ton of seating, but they do have a small bar area to hang out at while you wait. There are maybe 10 barstools and plenty of long benches along the walls to sit with your German beer. There is a full liquor bar as well. If you want a true neighborhood bar experience, you'll enjoy this place. The food is really the best part of coming here. Amazing German classics like wienerschnitzel, jaegerschnitzel, sauerbraten, brats, weisswurst, knockwurst, leberkase, spaetzle, red cabbage, sauerkraut, black forest cake, apple strudel, etc. My dad had the jaegerschnitzel which was plated on top of home fries. It was enormous! Very tasty and cooked perfectly. My sister had a bratwurst and knockwurst alongside potato salad and sauerkraut. Also tasty. I chose the steak tartare as I was feeling adventurous. It came served atop small bread pieces with potato salad. The quality of the meat was amazing! My grandmother had ordered this dish many times when she was alive and I have always wanted to try it. Glad I finally did! I would highly recommend this German restaurant if you are looking for a dark and classic place to dine with your family. Enjoy a pint of a good German beer and a giant plate of food! You won't regret it!

If you're in the mood for German food, this is THE place to go. An old school spot from what I hear and it lives up to the great reviews. Since it's a popular go to for locals and people from afar, a reservation is recommended. The place - old school decor which builds a lot of character for the place. Multiple seating options and you feel comfortable due to the spacing. Service - plenty of workers at this establishment who was attentive and friendly. Our waitress (forgot her name) was there for what we needed and filled our glasses of water without asking (love that). Food - beef goulash - must get! Share it with friends or hog it yourself!! A very hearty soup that can be an app or an entree. Jagerschnitzel - my go to when I go to a German spot. The portions here are huge!! You can easily just order this for 2 people. I had mine for myself and took the rest for lunch the next day. Everything about it was great. Perfectly seasoned cutlet, crispy hash and savory mushrooms. just a delish meal. If I'm craving German food. I come here.

My best friend is from Regensburg, a quaint city on the Donnau two hours north of Munich. She lost her mother to cancer 4 years ago and hasn't returned to Germany since. At her job, where she works as an investment banker for a German bank, she hears constant ravings for Zum Stammtisch from most all of her colleagues. She nearly ejected out of her car seat when I told her where we were dining as she had been wanting to go for years. When we walked in, she smiled a huge ecstatic smile at being somewhere she knew was authentically German. For her, It was like stepping back in time to a homey space when her mother was alive and times were good. The food was outstanding, the ambience warm and the crowd happy and friendly.  I was thrilled to give her a little taste of home here in Queens. She will definitely be going back!

My friend and I arrived at 6PM on a Saturday night and were curtly told that it would be over an hour wait. Since we had made the trek over and it was the last thing on my list of "places to eat in NYC," we patiently waited for a table (our wait ended up being 70 minutes). The front entryway is a bit small so got cramped with all the people waiting for tables. They only take reservations for parties of three or more, and the restaurant is actually not that big so there aren't that many tables/seats. Several would-be diners were turned away by the hostess's rudeness; the prevailing theme seemed to be that the food here is good but the service mediocre. Notably, a table of four sat empty for over thirty minutes despite the throng of people waiting; we thought maybe it was being held for a reservation, but no one ended up being seated there, and the chairs actually were taken for use at another table later.When we were finally seated, we were quickly brought complimentary bread and my friend and I immediately placed our orders (we had had a lot of time to peruse the menu while waiting). Unfortunately, they ran out of duck (one of the Saturday specials), so we ended up ordering the jaegerschnitzel and prime rib, in addition to a cup of goulash. I really enjoyed the complimentary bread; it was warm and flakey, and a pretty decent size for two people (they give multiple loaves for larger parties). The goulash was flavorful, but definitely would have tasted better hotter (it was lukewarm). The entrees were good, and definitely were HUGE portions (the prime rib in particular was a ridiculous amount of meat, over 20 ounces for sure). Vegetables included but you might have to ask (the menu says "available on request").My friend doesn't eat that much meat, and she also doesn't love mushrooms (jaegerschnitzel is covered in mushroom sauce), so I don't think she really found this meal that enjoyable. I will say that I have had better German food for less money elsewhere (e.g. Anaheim, CA and especially Fredericksburg, VA). Nonetheless, our waitress was actually pretty friendly, and I thought the interior was cute/made you feel like you were in Bavaria.Our total bill after tip came to $90 (most entrees are $20+). Granted, the prime rib at $36 was a very generous amount of meat and we had leftovers of both entrees, so I guess overall value is debatable.I would recommend coming during a non-peak time; it will make your experience much more enjoyable!

My parents used to live around the corner from this place well over 30 years ago and they never took me here until today. It was so worth wait! The food was amazing and my mouth watered the second I walked in. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming and I can't wait to come back! The flights were bigger than we thought, and it was awesome. The food was beyond any other German food I've had. Def will be back!

Zum Stammtisch is my favorite and probably the best German restaurant in New York. Opened since 1972 and still packed for dinner any night you go. I find myself here every other month or so to get my steak tartare fix, which I'm absolutely obsessed with. Still have yet to find a place that makes it better than them.Immediately when you walk through the door you will find a nice homey feel to the place. It's the kind of place where you can just plant yourself at the bar and never want to leave. Definitely a good thing because without a reservation you'll probably find yourself waiting there for a bit, especially on the weekends. Once seated you will find a menu of traditional German fare from brats to tounge and potato salad to schnitzel. It nice how they don't give in like some other German restaurants and throw American dishes on the menu. Hate it when that happens. I would like to recommend something but really everything is delicious. Definitely be sure to have a beer in one of their heavy mugs and always end your meal with a apple strudel alla mode.
This place has been putting out great food since I was a kid and they just haven't stopped. Pick your schnitzel and beer then relax and enjoy!

I have been here on multiple occasions when living in Queens and now eat here whenever I am in NYC.  Always consistently delicious, fresh and well made dishes are served. Zum Stammtisch offers a variety of authentic German dishes which are hard to find elsewhere.This place is always crowded, particularly weekend evenings and nights so plan accordingly.My favorites are the goulash soup (divine!), Deutscher Salat (beautifully delightful), Leberkase  ala Holstein (yum!) and of course any schnitzel dish!   The bread served is perfectly matched for all the dishes and is great to have with the goulashsoup!Portions are generous and pricing is most reasonable for the high level of quality. The decor of the restaurant allows the full German experience and the staff is always so friendly and attentive.   This is one dining experience you must partake in....lots of specials offered on different days and of course the beer is most excellent!

If you ask my Mom, Dad or Boyfriend where they want to go for their birthday dinner, the answer is the same: Zum Stammtisch. The warmest, German interior, steins of good beer and AMAZING German food are where we like to celebrate. We drive out from Long Island as no where else compares.They make my FAVORITE goulash, and I have travelled through Germany and Austria. I look forward to the day I can have an additional freezer in my home so I can keep a lifetime supply of the stuff. We can never go without ordering the pretzel. Other favorites include the saurbraten, jagerschnitzel. They bring veggies and red cabbage for the table as well which is delicious. I tried the black forest cake and a German coffee for dessert this time, which I'll be adding to my regular order.Ps. The boys get a real kick out of the men's bathroom

One of the best restaurants I've ever eaten at. Been here a bunch of times and each time the food is phenomenal. The atmosphere is adorable. The goulash soup and Jagersnitzel are both must haves. Beer flight was huge and delicious. Warm apple streudel alla mode for dessert was to die for. This place is the best!

Came here twice with large groups for a birthday dinner. This is a neighborhood institution where generations of families come to celebrate and eat decent Germany food. The best and most popular item among the locals is the jagger snitzel. The portions are HUGE so don't over extend yourself on the appetizers. However the spaetzel was delicious and our table devoured it in an instant. Personally I enjoyed the home made head cheese, which was fresh chewy and delicious.  For my main course I went with the steak, ponder thin and piled high with crispy fresh fried onions. Seriously this was a HUGE pile of onions on top of the meat, delicious, but it's guaranteed to make you breath kick.

This was a great place moved away and came back for a dinner with the wife and we were truly disappointed the The maître d' was not very observant it seem like she wasn't caring it all the same for the wait staff they came to the table twice lucky for that we had asked for the check several times the food I had was served cold and not very tasty sorry to see it was one of my favorites most of all they didn't speak German can't understand any German restaurant that hires people that don't speak German last time I go there you only reason I give them one star because the beer was good!! Das Essen schmeckt mir nicht gut du brauchst dir nicht essen das sind sehr viele Restaurantessen sehr besser Wiedersehen!!!

Great authentic German restaurant, drinks are  great beer taps fresh. Food is to delicious and consistent. I don't have a favorite here cause everything is so good.  Now they have the butcher shop next door so you can bring anything home.

My daughter and son in law took me to there for my birthday. The staff was friendly, service was good but the sauerbraten was not so good. I love sauerbraten but this had so much vinegar and it was over seasoned. I should have sent it back. I did not like it at all. The potato dumplings were good though.

It's been 10 years since my last visit and I don't know why it has taken me so long to come back. Large, tasty portions of all your favorite authentic German food. Cold German beers on tap as well.Make reservations, because it gets crowded and arrive early and have a drink at the bar if possible.Excellent split pea and beef goulash soup.Prime rib special can be eaten by 2 people, it's HUGESauerbraten was a very large plateThe only downside is no potato pancakes on weekends and parking is on the street.I got to get back here again soon
The best Oktoberfest party in NYC! The food is great and they have my favorite beer, Warsteiner pilsner on tab!

This place is absolutely amazing! I am so thankful I have found it. It is an authentic German restaurant. With the German butcher shop right next door! It has a bar if you just want a mug of beer. They have drafts and some classic German beer. It is crowded at times, but I went on a decent day with not many people. They servers dress the part and have their Dirndl. Which is wicked cute. Their Wienerschnitzel and Bratwurst is amazing! Seriously so heavenly.

If you are searching for an authentic German dining experience...Zum Stammtisch is the place to go to. I grew up a few blocks a way from this landmark establishment, and come from a German background. This places always serves delicious food and the service is great!

Made a reservation and an hour later we were seated. Unbelievable! Why bother making a reservation if you have to wait an hour. Beer was good. Food was ok. I brought one of friends from Germany and she said the food was ok. I wouldn't come back here. Happy I tried it. But unhappy about the wait.

"DiD u guYz try DIS place yet?1!1" - all our friends who tried this place. Yes, we have. And we loved it!   I ordered the Knockwurst and Bratwurst with the potato salad and sauerkraut and a glass of the raspberry beer. The potato salad was okay but the sausages? OUT. OF. THIS. DAMN. WORLD. Juicy, crispy skin and hearty. The gold standard for sausages. Also not a beer fan but DAMN, the raspberry beer (don't remember what it was called but I posted the photo with its name and am too lazy to refer back to it). I don't like beer, or strong alcohol for that matter. I prefer my liquor to taste more like dessert (White Russians, haaayy). Will return for more sausage perfection.

The end of an era of great German foods has pasted. Neidersteins had great food until it's last days, but this place is rapidly dropping off. The once stable and legendary Goulash soap taste closer to chilly now. The potato pancakes over fried and almost unable to be eaten. Smoked pork chops dry , this was all purchased at the Zum Stammtisch butcher please note. If I have ordered any of this in the restaurant , I would have sent it back !!!!!!!!!

Steak Tartar and Schnitzel were everything! It was a blessing in disguise because my mom and I ended up sitting at the bar since the wait for a table was 30 minutes. That meant we got to enjoy a half order of the steak tartar which was still pretty large but half the price. Worse service ever at the bar, bartender had a "greater than thou" attitude. Not sure if he had an issue because he had to serve two women or what, but I'm a big believer that individuals who don't like people shouldn't be in the restaurant business lol. Anyways- it won't stop me from not coming back. Food was great!!

I haven't been here in a few years and i was really happy to see they hadn't changed their daily specials since then haha.  I made sure to come back on a Wednesday so i could have their pork loin special with mashed potatoes and potato soup, which is what i had last time and it was ahhhmazing.  I am glad i did because years later it did not disappoint at alllll. The pork is huge and cooked perfectly and the portions are huge. We also shared the potato pancakes which were perfect.  Very crispy but not greasy or soggy at all and they're very big and come with apple sauce. For dessert i had the apple strudel and my friend had the black forest cake which i usually hate but it was actually pretty good.  I just wish the apple strudel was heated all the way through. The apples were kind of tough too eat and spots were cold.  Buttt that didnt stop me from killing the whole thing of course.  Service was okay, not very friendly and we saw the bus girls more than the waitress.

My dad and I have been coming here for 10 years now. His family comes from Germany, and he and I have traveled to Bavaria quite often... every time he comes home to visit me in NY this is always a family staple. We always get a hood round of large hoffenbraü and differ from the orders of schnitzel and pork loins... never ceases to make us happy and feel like we're back in Omas kitchen  I hope this place never loses its German hospitality, nor its home... will love Zum Stammtisch forever!

Great German food! Nice decor inside and pretty cool vibe. There's a small grocery store attached which is worth checking out too. The place does seem a little over priced for what you are getting but it didn't want to knock it down a star just for that.

Back to my routes at @zumstammtisch !! I need my fix of german cuisine every so often and this place brings me back to my childhood! The Bavarian decor, german music, waitresses in the garb and most importantly the food!  They have a lunch prefix menu on Mondays and Tuesday's! I got the amazing goulash soup, pork jaegerschnitzle, and rice pudding all for $21. 99!! Pages of selections in their menu and of course german beers on Tap! Their adjoining store is a huge market of everything german from t-shirts to steins to a full german deli! This place is definitely worth the trip to Queens!
Great food (loved the cheesy spaetzle), friendly service, and huge portions! The holiday goose special is delicious. Comes with cranberry sauce and stuffing with goose liver.

Simply Delicious! And the waitress was so kind (I have celiac disease) and she made sure with no judgement and a smile that the bratwurst was gluten free. HOORAY- It is! Will definitely be coming back soon.

I'm old - perhaps too old for a German birthday celebration. I am unable to have more than two beers with a huge meal.Food: all portions were huge. We had the JagerSnitznel (spelling?) which is a pork sausage. We also ordered Pork Gordon Bleu, lightly breaded steak, sirloin steak, cheesecake, and apple strudel a la mode. Everything was delicious. I strongly recommend the Munich Lager, but the Pilsner was also quite exceptional. The potato pancakes were good with the apple sauce, but not as good as the one Service: this is where it lost a star. At the beginning, everything was just really slow and response times were long. However, by the end of the night, we were told by our server that we were the nicest group that she had encountered for a long time. Score =). We were also the only Asian Pacific Americans there, which will make it easier to remember us.Decor: it's dark in here. The bathroom is in the basement. I have a flashlight.I shall return.

Went to Zums last night with a few friends.  It has been a while since I have been there so I was looking so forward to having dinner there.  We were greeted by Patty the hostess and she was very sweet and welcoming.  We were seated right away at a comfy booth and had a amazing friendly and helpful waitress. (Wish I got her name)..Our other waitress Tiffany was also very sweet and helpful.  Food was amazing.  Everything from the drinks, apps, bread main course and desert was incredible.  We were not rushed and enjoyed our evening very much.  Can not wait to return.  Thank you Zums for being the best German eatery ever.  I pray you never close your doors.  P.S I would give it 10 stars if I could

One of the last old German restaurants around. Always a wonderful meal here. Goulash soup. Sauerbraten. Kartoffelkloss. The best red cabbage. For dessert, hot raspberries on ice cream. I love this place. It takes me back to the times I ate at luchows. An era gone bye. This place is cute. Nice waitresses. Good beer. The best German place left.

Great service. Food is not authentic at all.  Schnizel was very soggy.  I believe traditionally it's supposed to be breaded and fried so it's crispy on the outside and still tender inside. Think about it.Now to the apple strudel.  It had the same problem.  The outside was very soggy.  Inside had too much apple but that may be just my personal preference.  Breading inside was good.Portions were huge huge. This definitely gives the wow factor for those who are not familiar with the cuisine.The free bread was very good.   Although I dont think it was very german.

I love this place and it's always a great time whenever I come back to visit. Was a bit packed on a Friday night and the wait was about 30-40 minutes. Schnitzel is amazing and their beer selection is always on point. The best authentic German food I've ever had and I'll always keep coming back when I'm in that mood. Prost!Staff is friendly, a bit expensive but 100% worth it because all their meals are prepared with so much flavor and heartiness

Folkswagen like the car Volkswagen, meaning "for the people" is what Zum Stammtisch proved tonight.I had a long day at work and wanted to have a quiet dinner alone, just my guilty pleasure (food) and I.I decided to take a seat at the bar and not take up a table for 1 ol' tiny person that can be used for 2 or more people. (Honestly, I really didn't want to wait if there was going to be one. This craving had to be fed ASAP lol) The classic German styled bar instantly attracted me. Rustic wood and dark decor made me feel comfortable and calm, ready to take on a heavy hearty meal. The bartender Tommy said hello and asked how I was doing before I could even finish settling in on the hightop rotating bar wood chair that my small feet dangled from. I knew this was going to be the exact experience I've been looking for.I skimmed through the menu with pretty much an idea of what I already wanted. I asked for a particular taste and style of German beer and Tommy picked the perfect one and skilled the perfect pour. KUDOS to that! I started with their Deutscher Salat which consisted of a fresh homemade cucumber, carrot, beet, and cabbage salad with a loose type of consistency dressing. I saved just enough to take home and enjoy again.Then, I ordered my main dish. Can we say it was UBERLY DELICIOUS! Huhnerjager was my choice. Two thinly pounded cutlets, lightly breaded and topped with their savory, yummy hunter mushroom sauce. It came with home fries, but home fries are a breakfast side for me, so I substituted it for the Spätzle.(egg noodle)I worked on exactly half of this dish and had to pack the rest to go for a rainy day. I was overly satisfied and full. It hit the spot in every way that I was looking forward to.Danke und Jubel!(Cheers & Thank you)

OMG had the best time having dinner here with my sister a few months ago! Don't know why it's taken me so long to review it. It's the quaintest little cottage type atmosphere, but extremely spacious on the inside. The perfect beer garden, with amazing food, incredible beers, and and great service. I've been to Europe many times and visited various beer halls - this definitely reminds me of the old country if you're missing home! :)

Always clean with amazing food and beer selection.  Found a cool beer I like too! The bread they give you when you order is amazing and so were the brats like always! We always go with a group of people and they never have any issues seating us.  The bathrooms are always clean and stocked.

When I think of German food in Queens Zum Stammtisch always held the higher mark for best in food and ambiance. However there were a few great German restaurants dating back over fifteen years, in the area that could hold their ground as well. Gebhardt's, Von Westerhagen, Neidersteins (now replaced by an Arby's--what a crime!)These restaurants were located in close proximity to Zum Stammtisch and were a viable alternative to the top dog of German food. But all have closed up shop which bothers me greatly because now we have no more than one option. When I walked into Zum Stammtisch last Tuesday in the early evening with my partner, who had never had German food prior, out greeting was less than welcoming. The petite blond, who left out the greeting portion of our entering the restaurant, immediately asked us both quite sternly "Do you have a reservation??!" Her demeanor was so intense I felt like walking out right then and there. Not the preferred method to treat your guests. To expound on this point just for a moment, I owned a restaurant-I always had customer service and customer management as a top priority, even when the meal was over and I thanked her upon my exit, there was no reply although she looked right at me, no acknowledgement of my thanks for dining at Zum Stammtisch.The herring in cream sauce was more lettuce covered in cream sauce with a few herring fragments and heave on the raw onion, hmmm.. A game of hide the herring to be sure.Sauerbraten was average at best, no onion, no carrot no gingersnaps, rather a  mass produced meat hidden below a  hot gelatinous swimming pool of sauce. The side dumpling was far from proper temperature for serving and there is not much that is more unappealing than cold potato balls..Pork loin Special was enjoyable, nice cut of meat and well prepared..Our server was amazing, she cared about our meals and served  our meals with genuine enthusiasm. Our young bus boy was so desiring to do the best job possible and succeeded in every aspect.

Straight up fire. It doesn't get better than this if you're searching for German foodEverything is perfect here. Go on Fridays and get the Wurst special Beef goulash soup , a whole pretzel with horseradish dip, and ANY 3 wursts for only 21$The amount of food is insane and it's perfectly delicious I love this place, the decor, atmosphere and food tie in perfectly together Eat here immediately.
Best German food in NY! Prime rib special was biggest I've ever had, better than Peter Lugers!Make sure to call for reservation or you will wait even if it doesn't seem busy.Don't forget a boot.

I definitely felt like I was in Germany when I entered this place. It has a very "Oktoberfest" kind of feel and all of the waitresses were wearing the typical German wear. My boyfriend and I both got the prie fixed meal for just $21.95, which is a very good deal considering an entree in itself is around the same price. We both got the goulash soup which was very rich in flavor. As for the entree, we both got the Jägerschnitzel which is one of their popular entrees. The portions were huge and their house sauce is very good. For the dessert, we both got rice pudding!Along with our meal, we ordered a separate appetizer - smoked salmon latkes and they were SO good. It came in 3 potato pancakes and it was very filling. I would only recommend coming here for their prie fixed meal which is only offered on Mondays and Tuesdays.

Highly recommended place for German Food. This is real deal German style and atmosphere. This place is somewhat transporting with the Bavarian Beer Hall atmosphere. They have an awesome Reuben for Reuben "aficionados". This Reuben is huge, tasty, juicy and satisfying. They have Long Island Duck, Goulash, Schnitzel, Spaetzle, Bratwurst, Red Cabbage, Sauerbraten  and many other specialties. The beer is a real deal option as well. The parking is a bit difficult as this restaurant is in a busy neighborhood, but once you are at the restaurant you will be cozy and comfortable. They also have a food shop next door (attached) with many specialties as well. If you like European candies and desserts you will find them as well. We had one minor issue: we wanted a Dijon style mustard with our meal, but the closest we could get was a spicy mustard. Otherwise a very delicious meal.

This neighborhood restaurant is still going strong and serving up delicious German food. I feel bad not coming here as often especially since I live close by. Jaegerschnitzel was a big portion and tasty as I remember it, as was the Veal Cordon Bleu. Big portions, tasty food, pleasant service, clean restaurant and decent prices. You can't go wrong eating here. Leave room for dessert!Although this is the review for the restaurant, their own butcher shop next door has great meats, sausages, tasty pinwheel steaks etc. to cook on your home BBQ grill. Delicious!

Super authentic & family environment. It feels like you are walking into another place and time when you walk into zum stammtisch!We had the goulash, pretzel, sausages, potato salad and cabbage, all are Great. And they serve beers in huge mugs! A pleasant find close to forest park. Definitely recommended. Prices are also great

This place is great! We love the decor. It's very cozy inside. We were here on a Sunday night for dinner. We were seated immediately. Our waitress were friendly & polite. She gave us the menu, bread, & explained to is about the special. We got the HB Dunkel beer, the Jägerschnitzel, & the 3 sausages. The Jägerschnitzel is breaded veal cutlet with mushroom gravy. As for the sausages, we got the classic bratwurst, knockwurst, & the krainewurst. The sausages came with sauerkraut & potato salad. They were just absolutely wonderful! Delicious! The portion is generous. We were stuffed!The service were great! Our waitress were attentive. We would definitely recommend this place for a good German food. We'll definitely go back!

Ok so Koenigs in Floral Park has gone ist tot!  (Dead)So we need our German food fix.  Lorraine D, an elite Yelper, has sworn that this is the place to go.  So here we are in Glendale Queens at Zum Stammtisch, loosely translated the same old table/place.   It's late Sunday afternoon and the place is packed!We ordered some wine, I know, I know but beer is not my favorite beverage.   We then ordered schrimp cocktail.  How can you go wrong?For the main course sauerbraten and jaegerschnitzel of course !!!Wunderbah!!   This will become our new go to German place!   Does anyone know how we can get in touch with Minnie and Mickey??!!!
It was my first time trying German food. I really liked the food and the way the staff was dressed. It really made us feel like we were in some town in Germany.  It's mostly sausages and beer.

Guten Tag!  A trip to this Glendale outpost will take you on a trip to Bavaria or perhaps Munich.  Fantastic traditional German fare is served up alongside liters of Heifer Weizen or any number of well-appointed beers, FYI it can also be had in a 2 litere boot, which seems excessive but definitely worth it if you are here for the long haul.  Jagerschnitzle was fantastic, veal pounded and breaded topped with brown mushroom gravy served with crispy home fries that were definitely made with bacon, and bacon makes them that much better.  Service was friendly and attentive.  The dining room is small so make sure you make a reservation for the busier hours of operation.

After multiple recommendations I decided to try Zum Stammtisch for lunch with a friend. We each had a cup of goulash, which was amazing. My friend had 2 sausages (Bratwurst) with sauerkraut and creamed spinach, excellent choice. I had the Jagerschnitzel, very good, but in my opinion with too much sauce, which was almost overpowering. Will go back to try the sausages and sauerkraut.

I ordered takeout from Zum today. I was expecting amazing food, because that's what Zum is known for. What did I get instead you ask? I got a raw Chicken Riesling and a wrong order instead of the 3 Sausage Plate. So I went back and got....you guessed it, attitude from the waitress! Because hey, apparently, I don't know what I ordered.So I finally got the right 3 Sausage plate and decided on getting the chicken schnitzel in lieu of the Riesling, come back home, take a bite and THE CHICKEN IS RAW! Again! And the SAUSAGES ARE COLD! So I called them and got more attitude from the manager. Definitely done with this place. I will never ever trust a place that will serve its customers RAW MEAT. Ever.

While on a trip to NY we decided to stop in for lunch.The atmosphere is so cozy and authentic! We felt so warm and welcomed immediately. The service is top notch.The beer selection is awesome and so well priced. We enjoyed two glasses of dunkel with the deliciousness that was about to ensue....As for the food---omg. It was amazing. Hands down the best German food we've ever had and this is coming from someone who visited annually in my childhood and has tried multiple restaurants searching for a place like this. We started with the steak tartar- this was definitely the highlight of the meal and that is saying a lot because all the food was incredible. The tartar is  MUST try.  We also had the goulash soup, three wurst platter, and the jagerschnitzel. Aside from our embarrassment at how much we ate that day we left happy people.Hats off to you guys for bringing a piece of Germany to NY.

This place is amazing! I've not had many experiences with traditional German restaurants but I know a good place when I see one!I made a reservation for a group of 20 to celebrate a friends birthday but unfortunately a few friends ended up not being able to make it. I felt really bad but the staff was extremely understanding and so nice about it. Most of us ordered from the Prix Fixe menu which is actually a really good deal considering you get a starter (either goulash soup or salad - I'd go with the soup, it was extremely good), an entrée, a dessert (rice pudding), and complimentary coffee or tea at the end of the meal for $21.95. I got the Jagerschnitzel (pork cutlet with mushroom sauce) which was absolutely amazing. We were all so full by the end of the meal that we couldn't move. But that's also because I got the Beer Flight (a sampler of four beers) to pair with the meal.Definitely a great experience and will definitely come back to visit again!

Came her for a family lunch/dinner this past Saturday. I've never eaten at a German Restaurant before so I wasn't really knowing what to expect. Someone recommended the Jagerschnitzel and being that I love veal, that's what I went for. It was delicious. I don't think I've had better veal before. The beers I drank were also very good, and the mugs were huge lol. I live on Long Island, but I may have to take a trip out here sometime.

Horrific arrogant attitude towards customers. We were running late for our 5pm reservation on Sunday 12/30/18 and called at 4:35 to say so. The gentleman who picked up the phone said that it was "no problem." We arrived at 5:25 and the young, cold, uptight hostess said that we missed our reservation and had to be put on the wait list, which was considerable since there were many people waiting for tables. When we told her that we had called she said that the guy who took the call had already left and hadn't mentioned anything to her and that "there was nothing" she could do. No sympathy, no smile, no warmth, no trying at ALL to try to be understanding. I said, "what's the point of calling??" She just repeated, "There's nothing I could do." I see now why others here have written about poor service and a bad attitude. Some restaurants are just as busy but still love their customers like Manor Oktoberfest (Fantastic German food and GREAT service). Others like this one let it get to their head and think that they're doing you a favor. Never coming back.

As German food becomes increasingly rare this place will leave your full and satisfied. Perfect atmosphere,service and authentic food. Make sure to stop and the pork store attached to the restaurant. My favorite German restaurant by far.

These Germans don't play. They feed their people good.  Soup Goulash was so good.  Their spatzle is excellent. Their selection of German Beer is excellent too.  The show stopper is the Jagerschnitzel. End it with the German coffee made with a little peppermint schnapps. Good night Irene!

All the good reviews made my group of 6 take a trip to this place. We had a reservation so we were seated quickly. The waitress, she pretty much tried to rush us to order drink or food as soon as we sat to check the menu. Very rude! We asked for some time then she posed angry speaking with demanding tone "No drink?"Remember You are serving ppl not feeding livestocks! We need time to see and decide!Usually we order food and drink to share with the group. When we ordered beer 2 liters I believe and tho it was like a pitcher, maybe it was my mistake of not asking if it was shareable but saying we have to share from one big boot shape cup (we asked for some glasses to share and she brought 5 saying "we don't usually do this and gl serving?") after that when we ordered food to share she said she had to charge extra per person for sharing and not ordering main entry per person (never in my life had to pay money for sharing!) At the end food came... Goulash soup tasted just like tomato sauce from pizza and way salty... And both Schnitzels... is it how these are made? I tho it was more crispy... but it was very soggy... difference btw the two schnitzels was just the mushroom topping... Experience overall ppl way overrate this place... For some reason random lady coming out of the restaurant said "Good Luck" to us...

Best best best German food I've had in ny by far. Great authentic experience. Decor and ambiance is just perfect and makes the visit so much more enjoyable. The staff is super friendly and does a great job making sure you've got everything you need. Fellow patrons are also so friendly and love to chat with each other. I guess it's because the restaurant gives off a home style vibe. Ordered the giant boot of beer. We tried the roast duck special which was an entire half of a duck served with mashed potatoes and cabbage. So yummy. Also the breaded chicken with mushroom sauce was amazing. So moist and flavorful. Potato pancakes are only served during the week which was slightly disappointing but the rest of the meal made me forget about them! I'll definitely be back to try more!
Great german menu. Smoked brook trout was great. We had the round top in the corner. Roof leaked but food was good

This place is amazing. The atmosphere is as authentic as the food and drinks. The goulash is the best I ever had by far and the Jaeger snitzel is delicious. The price seems a little high onthe menu until you see the portion size which is usually good for another meal the next day.

Had a gathering with people from work. You open the door, and boom, Germany. Well, at least that is my image of Germany. The portions are huge so limit ordering too much appetizers but loved the steak tartare. I've never been here so I don't know if it is always that crowded but it sure got packed on a Wednesday night quick. I also don't know if this is because they were busy but the service was just ok. Of course they have great beers but wines by the glass are limited, especially I was told they only have 1 option for red by the glass, the house red wine.

Tried to get into this restaurant one night and the wait was 2 hours.  So I left and said I would definitely go back.  The following week, I made a reservation for two.  We arrived and were taken promptly to our table.  The service was awesome!  I had the prime rib special which was a nice size.  It was cooked as ordered and was delicious.  I ordered, as a side, the german noodle spaetzle which was delicious.  My friend had the sauerbraten with the spaetzle which he also enjoyed.  We did not have dessert whereas we were full from the dinner.  The only down side to going here is that they do not have a parking lot so you have to search on the street for parking.The food  is so worth it though!!!

The food & drinks were delicious. The pork shank, which is served on Fridays, is to die for!!! I also loved the pork store which is attached to the restaurant. They have a grapefruit beer, similar to Schofferhofer, that was really good!
Been going there for many years with family and friends. Always 100% class, service and attention.

This is a super traditional Bavarian/German restaurant in Glendale. Looks like it's quite the neighborhood establishment as well, and I bet that it's been here for many, many years. Lots of different beers to choose from, as well as a menu offering super hearty German fare, all while you're dining in something that looks like the main room of a skiing lodge in the Black Forest of Bavaria. There's not too many offerings for you if you happen to be a vegetarian (like myself), but I like the environment and the beer offerings here, which makes me rate this place 4 stars.

It used to be the 1 of the two best German places around.  Now I just go there to maybe get something to eat at the bar and talk with Pat. Pat is a great bartender and  a great guy.  If I'm starving I go to McDonalds across the street first. The food at Zum Stammtisch is as salty as McDonald's fries  The best German place around is Koenig's in Floral Park

#GermanFeast #Got the Jägerschnitzel that a lot of Yelpers were talking about #Giant cutlet #Really good, but I might try it without the gravy next time #Wiener Schnitzel#The Goulash Soup is really good too #Very Meaty #Basically Beef Stew#Super far from any subway station #But possible to get there without a car #I did it! #But I did walk for 40 mins in the #blistering cold.

The ultimate German experience. If you want an authentic meal, dirndl and all, come here. If you live out on the island, come in to Glendale. If you live in the city, leave. (Forget the UES)Recommendations:Get the jaeger schnitzel Get a kraner wurst also sehr gutGet a stein Get a side of red cabbage and kraut Get a linzer tart Get a tshirt You heard me
Great food. It's a little dark on the inside but you come hungry and leave full. Never had a bad meal there.

Hands down,  best German food in Ny.  I've triedd them all.  There's a reason this place has been packed everyday since the 1970s.  The jagersnitzel is out of the world with a huge pounded veal cutlet smothered in a mushroom gravy..  when you walk in,  you could swear you're in Germany.   Five stars all day!

Went here for my Mother in Laws birthday and probably never will again. I had the Uber pretzel for an app, it was pretty good.  Nothing to go crazy for.  I had the weinerschnizel for my main course and it was very bland. It literally had no taste. The home fries were pretty decent though. If you order soda, be careful, refills are not free! We didn't know this and we racked up a pretty hefty bill that we wouldn't have otherwise and the restaurant wasn't willing to budget on anything.  It just wasn't a good experience and like I said, I won't be returning

I came across this place while searching on yelp and chose to do my birthday dinner here. I mainly chose it because it could fit a large amount, take reservations, and on Tuesday night they had the a prix fixed menu option. Parking was a little tough, but we were able to find parking the next block over. The place makes you feel like you're in Germany which is very nice. The décor and ambiance of the place had the German feel to it and for me, since it was my first time dining at a German restaurant I had a pleasant experience (as well as my friends). Let me start off by saying it's a must to order their goulash soup. From reading other reviews I had to give it a try when I was there and boy was it spot on. Perfect. Delicious. Satisfying. As for the entrée portion of the pre-fixed menu I got the Pfeiffer schnitzel, which for me was pretty good. I'm not too much of a schnitzel guy, but my entrée was good. I guess I just didn't have the right taste buds for it. As for dessert it comes with a rice pudding which was very delicious. The service was great as our waitress checked up on my big party every so often to make sure we were doing okay. Water glasses always full as well. After the meal, in addition to the cake, we were all very full and satisfied. Well worth the money. Overall, my friends and I had a great experience and I would definitely come back again to try the other things on their menu.

Outstanding. I've been to Germany several times and I will tell you, when I'm at Zums, I feel like I'm back in Germany. The food, the crowd, and the beer are all great. The woodwork and flow of the bar is super cool and very Germany feeling. Seriously, if you haven't been treat yourself. The drive from Long Island is worth it!

Zum Stammtisch is amazing! It is a classic German restaurant, where you can enjoy traditional German meals. The decor is very German and makes you feel like you are in a restaurant in Berlin. The good is spectacular, it with every bite it's gets better and better, there is no question on why this restaurant has been on the food network.

So my wife & I come to this Resturant, with positive expectations on Date nite. My wife post-op is unable to eat regular size meals. Over the last year, we have had very positive & understanding Resturant staff. I'm sadly disappointed that we were told she could not split a meal.  Thumbs down to either the wait staff or the management. Not coming back.

Perhaps the only downside to this place is the wait. But if you can manage that, you're entering what seems to be German comfort food heaven!It all boils down to great service, nice portions, savory dishes, and that cozy down-home atmosphere.Loved it, would def wanna come back!

My fave spot to get my German comfort food fix!Most of the staff are older ladies but so very nice and pleasant.  If it's your first time there they will take time out to explain the dishes on the menu too.  I think the most I've waited for a table here is 10-15 minutes so not bad...I love their leberkase and the various 'wursts they offer.  But I nor any one I've ever taken here has ever had a bad meal so that's a good thing in my book.
Awesome place. Very authentic and a staple in the neighborhood. I had the breaded veal and my girl had the flounder. I def recommend.

Appetizers: 1. Goulash Soup (Cup) - A generous portion of super lean cuts of meat. Incredibly flavorful, and hearty. Perfect for a chilly day.2. Schnecken im Erdapfel - Six snails on a baked potato with herbs. Really mellow, but unique flavor.Entree: Sauerbraten - Really lean cut of meat (in my opinion, at least), with yummy gravy smothered on top. I love the simplicity of the dumplings, and the mild sweetness of the red cabbage.Customer service was great on a Sunday afternoon.Incredibly clean.Must. Go. Back.Pro Tip: Parking was tough. Pack extra time, and patience, to look for a spot to park in.

I don't know if it's cus it's a subconscious thing that I'm eating German food but they make all their wursts really good. It is absolutely nothing like any of the wursts you can get at any deli or supermarket or whatever. We ended up getting choice of three sausages and got the kielbasa the bratwurst and knockwurst... All of them were really juicy and delicious, along with the sauerkraut and home fries they served it with . Also got their veal cutlet , which came topped with mushrooms and some kinda gravy sauce . Was really tender and crispy , and the cutlet was almost the size of my head huge :0 Two orders brought us to ~50 , and if it weren't for the fact that we were absolutely stuffed afterwards woulda ate more. Add a star for the decor and ambience... You really feel as if you went into another country

Food was lame .  Got oily pork chops and my 3 friends got the special .Which was  soupy cutlet.  Staff was super friendly and the atmosphere was great. This place really need to re-amp it's food menu I wanted to love it and I'll give it a try again

This is the place to come for authentic German food at reasonable prices. The food is excellent! Ordered the sauerbraten with potato dumplings, the 3 knockwurst platter, and a side of potato pancakes. Finished off with the apple strudel a la mode. Everything was great! Be prepared to wait as there is always a full crowd.

The atmosphere was lively , the food was excellent and plentifulz The apple strudel ala mode made me warm and fuzzy . Our server Gina was a sweetheart ! Thank you ! Oh that humongous pretzel appetizer with the 3 dipping sauces was friggin' awesome :)

I don't get it.  I eat here more than I'd like because I work w a German dude and some other people who like beer.  I'm not in either of those categories.  Not sure if that's fortunate or unfortunate.German food is just so....heavy.  And sometimes weird.  I've tried about everything on the menu, and while I like the Knockwurst, Bratwurst, and Krainerwurst, there's nothing else I can really say tickles my fancy.  The steak tartar is purported to be one of their best items, but I don't find it to be anything special.  The schnitzel and the spaetzle are solid, but gosh it's just not something that appeals to me.Waitstaff is always good, the bread they give you to start is tasty, and the ice cream with honey liquor is good.  There.  I'm ending with a positive.Signing off before I start whining again.

Such a great experience at Zum Stammtisch!Came here last night (Thursday night) with my boyfriend for dinner because he was seriously craving German food.Pretty quiet and relatively empty, mostly seemed like locals that were dining here along with us. Aka, no reservation necessary.Really lovely atmosphere with the fabric placemats and the artwork and servers in traditional German garb; I felt like if we looked out the window we would see the German countryside.We started with a cup of Goulash soup each.Such depth of flavor. Incredibly tender meat and just a good stick-to-your-bones comforting kind of soup. A large bowl of this definitely could have been our entrees.Then I got the Jager Schnitzel with a side of mixed vegetables. Perfectly fried veal cutlets under the greatest sauce in the history of gravies. Seriously, I want it on every food that I'll ever eat ever again. Heavenly, creamy and perfectly complimented by the bed of mushrooms. Some hashbrown-type potatoes tucked under all this gravy goodness, which was a lovely little surprise. Something about this meal was just.. it felt like it was cooked with love. Like my mother was in the kitchen, taking her time and preparing it perfectly for me. To finish, we got the Apple Strudel which was warm and cinnamon-y and the apple still had a bite to them and flaky and oooof I can only imagine how much of a daydream it would have been with a scoop of icecream.All in all, the question is not if I'll go back, but exactly when I'll be returning. When a German restaurant makes you want to actually go to Germany, you know you've struck gold.

Love love love this place.  This is the best German food this side of Berlin.  Beers are great also.  I moved from Queens over 10 years ago and this is one of the few places that we return to often.  Never a bad meal.  My favorite is the Jaegerschnitzel.  It is beyond hearty and satisfying.  Glendale perseveres as a German stronghold.  Zuum's has been in continuous operation since 1972.  Only caveat is that it's always busy so call for a reservation if you can.

Came here with the family for lunch today.  My husband has been wanting to come here for awhile.  We couldn't miss the place since it was right on the corner of the block.   The building is white with brown slanted stripes.  We were able to find parking immediately on a side street nearby.  When you first walk into the place, it looks like your walking into a bar.   There is a long hallway and then upon entering you will see tables and chairs and booths along the wall.   A busy waitress spotted us, asked us how many and asked if a booth was ok.  We love booths so that was great!        A waitress took out drink order as soon as we were seated.  She was very attentive.  The waitresses are dressed in a German folklore dress.  I ordered water with lemon, the hubby had the Oktoberfest beer and my daughter ordered a ginger ale.  We were given blue menus and one still had crumbs on it.  Our drinks came and u went to put one on the coaster and realized the coaster had some stains on it as well.  This is the reason I give 4 stars in lieu of 5.       My husband loved his goulash soup.  It was savory, yummy and full of meat.   The Sauerbraten we both ordered was pretty good.  I never had it before so I was surprised at the sour taste.  I now know that is how it should taste.  It came with two potato dumplings.  We weren't able to finish it all so we took the rest of it home for dinner.   My daughter liked her cheeseburger from the kids menu.   It was pretty big in size and came with a side pickle, lettuce and tomato.  It also came with home fries with bacon bits in them.  They also serve Jaegermeister here!   I saw a customer having two of them.      All in all this is a great place to try at least once, especially if you are looking for authentic German food.  I think we will back here to try other things off the menu.

Last year my boss took me here for a late lunch early dinner after work. We first stopped at their adjacent store & bought an array of different German delicacies , mustard, jellies, chocolates, boxed cakes, red cabbage, Bratwurst, knock wurst etc. they also have a big selection of German Beers. Then there is a hallway that leads you to the restaurant. The place was decorated like an authentic Bavarian Inn with rustic wood & colored stained glass, moose head, very German from Decor to the staff.. warm & cozy OctoberfestI had Herring in Cream Sauce for appetizers, delicious & Prime Rib, Goulash Soup & vanilla Ice cream w hot raspberries. Last Friday the 5th, went back there again , did the same thing, shopped at their store, got some Homemade Goulash & Chicken Noodle Soup, Liverwurst, Chicken Schnitzel, pastries, Jellies, Crepes then had dinner.  This time I had the TBone Steak, rare , GoulashSoup, Creamed Spinach & the Vanilla Ice Creme w Hot Raspberries, delicious !!! Next time I have to try the Boiled Beef which was equally delicious & fork tender!!!

This place is honestly the BEST GERMAN RESTAURANT in all of NYC. The beer is absolutely delicious the staff is great and friendly the food is absolutely amazing virtually everything on the menu is phenomenal. They also have a butcher shop and souvenirs authentic German goods for sale adjacent to the restaurant. This pace is literally heaven on Earth. Thank God I live all the way in Bay Ridge Brooklyn if I lived closer I'd be 400lbs. Do yourself a favor and get your tail there and see for yourself. Vunderbar.... Danny Boy

Authentic German food is not easy to find outside Germany. Zum Stammtisch has mastered German cuisine. This is honestly the best German food I've ever had in the U.S. I advise that you come hungry because the large portions are like something out of Man vs. Food. My boyfriend and I conquered "the boot", which as you probably guessed is an over-sized boot filled with German beer.The servers were a bit strict. The four of us tried to move to a neighboring table. Nein! That table is ONLY for 6 people. The atmosphere is German in a somewhat Disney like way. However, I found it very cozy and ideal for the winter months, but then again Disney equates to cozy for most Floridians.The connected German grocery is incredible, I just wish they had later hours so I could keep my job and go more regularly. Unless you have a car its a journey to get here, but worth it in my opinion.
The best German food in the states. From the soups to the specials all prepared fresh. All authentic. And the the holiday  goose special is a special dish that I look forward to this time of year

Heard about this place many times finally came in for that "Hearty German meal" I was cravingok I don't eat meat but I wasn't going to NOT go with my meat eating people very cute inside with cozy round booths it has that dark feel to itwaitress was just lovely even had a German accent! and dress in a dirndl our a warm crusty loaf of bread was placed on our table in secondsI opted for the fried guyere cheese sandwich hearty and tastyin the olden before vegetarian days I would have had the sauerbratenthis is pot roast in brown gravy and red cabbage oh my goodness this can be so good my son had the sauerbraten I had to eat his cabbage oh man was it savory and goodhis beautiful plate also had a huge dumpling I almost gave up and wanted to eat it but it was sitting in the gravy ...my daughter had their pot roast another savory dishthis is hearty good food with friendly service and a cute atmosphere

We hadn't been here in 15 years,  and it hadn't changed much. Better than average German fare. Large portions of schnitzel, wursts, and some great German beer. The wait staff could use a little better customer friendliness. We weren't sure if this was them trying to be authentic Germans, but we took someone who lives in Germany with us who is going to school here in NY and she said wait staff back home were way friendlier. You can't go wrong coming here if you're looking for authentic German food.

My husband and I are big fans of this very friendly old-school German restaurant. It's one of our go-to-spots for dining locally, with out-of-town friends and family or just on our own. Make reservations, especially on the weekends.

Great food. Its a little dark in there and the portions are large. You will need to be rolled out of there. Just be carefull when going to the restrooms. They are downstairs. The staircase is a little steep and narrow

Ordered the goulash, chicken hunter with mashed potatoes and red cabbage, steak with home fries, and a children's cheeseburger. They bill you for every single drink refill you order, which I think is odd. Our favorite was the goulash and chicken hunter, these are highly recommended.

Definitely my all time favorite restaurant I've been coming here since i was a little girl and love everything about this restaurant between the food, atmosphere and staff its just an amazing experience all around!

Whenever we are in NY and can get to Zum's we get there! They make the absolute best German Cuisine around. The Jagerschnitzel is the best!  The steak tartare is amazing as well. Not one bad meal on the menu. If you are near this place, go!
Love the food.. Cooked to perfection. Excellent service. They also have a beer flight... Totally great.. I deft will come back.. Prices r good.
You cannot go wrong coming here if you enjoy food.  Zum everything, and keep coming back to get everything on the menu.  The staff is amazing and they look cute in their outfits, lol.
My first time here, great atmosphere, amazing food and service. Will definitely be coming back.
This place is very good.Always take family here and was surprised how great everything is..my cousins who were visiting loved it . can't wait till Octoberfest!!

Excellent German food!!! Friendly service, great location and fresh German food? What more can one ask for? I wish I could pronounce the names of the food we had but I unfortunately cannot. But try anything on the menu. I'm sure you can't go wrong!

A friend recently asked me to lunch and asked if I had a suggestion for a German restaurant, we were a few miles from Zum Stammtisch, I couldn't wait to get there! The fact that we happened to be in the area and he wanted German was an opportunity I couldn't pass up.I had the  Wienerschnitzel and my associate had the Sauerbraten, we were both in heaven!We also had herring salad, which was fantastic. The Wienerschnitzel came with sauerkraut that melted in your mouth,,buttery and just the right relation of sweet and sour.The Sauerbraten was perfectly cooked with fabulous gravy, I have to go back soon it is so good. Excellent prices, very reasonable and big portions.As good as German gets in NY, the service is great, highly recommend.

My friend has had this restaurant on his New York list for quiet some time now, so we decided to bus over here on a Saturday night to try some German food. Showing up at 6:00pm on Saturday evening without reservations is not a good idea on our part.  The waitress, immediately said that the wait was 1-1.5 hours long. They take reservations but only for parties of 3 or more. So being a party of two and limited time-killing options in the area, we decided to wait and chat. You can also wait in the bar, which many other customers opted to do with their 1 liter glasses and boot glasses. But we aren't big fans of beer ( I know, I know, why even German food?) After the accurately predicted estimate of 1.5 hours, we were finally seated for our meal in the absolutely PACKED restaurant. For my first German food experience, we selected the Goulash Soup ($5.95 cup), Jägerschnitzel ($26.95), and Prime Rib Steak ($34.95). We hoped to order one of the daily specials- Duck Roast, unfortunately they were out. The Goulash soup was quite delicious, filled with chunky meats and vegetables. My only qualm was the lukewarm temperature of the soup. In my opinion, soup should be steaming hot  when it's placed in front of you!The Jägerschnitzel and Prime Rib Steak were both ordinary dishes, no socks getting blown off here. Although the size of the steak was absolutely massive. I'd never seen such a huge chunk of meat on a plate in front of me before O_OOverall, with the average service and food, I give this place a solid 3 stars. During our 1.5 hour wait, I overheard customers absolutely raving about the delicious food. Per their reactions, I would be willing to try other items at this restaurant, but let's avoid a Saturday night rush again.
Great afternoon of great food, atmosphere and drinks. Waitress was awesome. She made our afternoon incredible The food is always great. So glad we went

I've been trying to get to this restaurant for the last couple of years.  The place is large and wait staff is very friendly and efficient BUT.  OK - not a biggie but a German restaurant doesn't sell Riesling  by the glass??  No Spaetzle?  Thankfully our friends had eaten here before and while potato pancakes are not on the menu for an appetizer they do serve it.  They were the best thing we ate that night.  The breading on my weinershnitzel was not crisp and subsequently when I cut into it the breading separated from the pork.  The potatoes on all of our dishes were home fries which was disappointing.  Some of the other dishes my friends ordered came with red cabbage which I tasted and that had a good flavor.  We were stuffed so unable to order dessert but saw them at other tables and they looked good.  Dinner w/tip for 5 of us was $50 pp.  That was for 5 entrees, a glass of wine , 4 beers.  We shared 2 potato pancake appetizers and one coffee and a shared apple strudel.  The strudel was very heavy on the spices which overwhelmed it.

So we gave Zum Stammtisch another shot and sad to say, nothing has changed. The food is okay but the service is awful. We barely had time to review the menu and we were asked twice if we are ready to order. At most restaurants they wait until you close your menu and lay it on the table before asking for your order but oh no, not here.On the opposite end of the coin, we were never asked if we wanted refills on our drinks, we were never given water or asked if we wanted more bread.When it came time to get the check our waitress was no where to be found. I had to ask another member of the staff to find her and get our check. When I finally got it, it took forever for them to pick up the bill with my credit card. The hubby had to search for the waitress. It also took an extremely long time to get my card back.I should have taken my own advice and not come back!!

Have beenComing from Staten Island at Christmas time for last 6 years with family. Every time we leave AMAZED at how authentic and delicious the food is . The schnitzel is made to perfection the beef goulash also a must..the beer selection offers the best variety of German beers to enjoy the dining experience. It might be hard to be to full after your meal but try to taste some of the tasty desserts

The Jäģerschnitel is the best . The homfries are very good . The sauerbraten is a bit too sweet for my liking , a little pricey , but the service is good .
