I took a star away because they reuse the cloth place mats , which i thought was gross ! When i asked the bus boy if he  was seriously just shaking off the crumbs and flipping it over , he said he was told to do that and yelled at ,if he replaced too many ,lol . Im still kinda shocked by that , but anyway , the food is good . If you like german food or meat and potatoes , i recommend trying it . Oh and of course the beer is great , Hofbräuhaus Hefe-Weiss being my favorite
Our server Jackie was amazing ! The food was phenomenal !!! I'm in a food coma with a smile. I have nothing else to say. We drove 40 miles to kick off Octoberfest !!! Xo

Super cool,  feels like you've stepped into  Germany when you walk into the door.  Food is really good with Huge portions,  can definitely share.  We had the delicious goulash soup, the Schweine haux, the bratwurst, and the jagerschnitzel. All were fantastic! Highly recommend if your sick of eating the same thing when you go out to eat.

Food is fantastic. I have had several of the veal dishes and at least two of the steaks and was never disappointed, my wife usually goes with the sauerbraten or the special. They have a nice selection of German beer in a variety of sizes. The service might be a little slow but that is because the place is usually packed. The only downside is the home fries don't have a nice crust and are a little bland. I wish the would have the spetzle In a daily basis.
Been coming here longer than I care to remember and it never disappoints.  Great food and spirits.  And I always take a little something home for later on

Jaegerschnitzel- red cabbage - spaetzle.House beer & Warsteiner Pilsner.Waitstaff (Meghan) OUTSTANDING!A must stop if in Queens. Old world charm, damn good cooking, authentic no - pretense presentation.

Like the vibe of this place. Met some friends here for dinner on a Saturday evening. There were plenty of beers to choose from. We tried the beer flight my favorite was the hofbrauhaus dark. I was too scared to try anything so I opted for a plain steak but when the food arrived there was a mistake. That day they had a steak special, and they thought I had ordered that. I took whatever she had and I'm glad for the mistake! So good!! And don't even get me started on that Apple crisp!
The Steak Tartar is the best on the planet. The beer is cold the service is great. If you're looking for the authentic German experience this is the place for you.

Great place, very cool German ambiance . You instantly feel happy like in the middle of a Beer Fest!We had the Wurst special: 3 sausages of your choice with sauerkraut and potato salad, a little bowl of Goulash and a big pretzel with horseradish. Everything absolutely delicious! The Goulash deserves a special note, though. We also ordered a breaded chicken with mushroom sauce and it was not very good. The taste of the breaded chicken was somehow weird. The very attentive waitress noted that we were nothing eating it and she immediately offered to give us another dish. So, 5 stars for service! Good beer and such a good time. We will be back!

I went here with my father and sister this past Saturday night for dinner - first off, try to make reservations. They were incredibly crowded, but the hour and 45 Minute wait we were projected turned out to only be just under an hour. The food was great, as were the beer selections. I was a fan of the vintage decorum in the place, which was presented festively for Christmas.If I had one complaint, it'd be that the service was slow. People who walked in well after us were served beforehand. Still very much a place I'd come back to.

Great food and atmosphere! The inside looks like an old, German hunting lodge and all of the waitresses are wearing traditional dirndl dresses. The food is absolutely delicious. Definitely recommend the Jagerschnitzel! The sauerbraten, sausages, and strudel are also fantastic. The menu is filling very meat and potatoes heavy (one of my favorite parts of the menu is the "vegetables available upon request" written at the bottom). The owners also have a great German store next to the restaurant.

Loved it! Stopped by with my German husband before our flight out of JFK to Brazil. He says it's one the best Lebe kasse mit speigel ei he has had in the states. Many years spent in Hannover Germany with his family. We're planning a trip from RI (only 2hr away) sometime soon because he's craving some German food!

We have been eating here for over 30 years and it hasn't changed at all, that's a good thing! The food is consistently delicious and the portions are enormous. The atmosphere is old world German, authentic and comforting. I have made the mistake of eating at other German restaurants and ordering their version of the classic Jager Schnitzel, big mistake. Zum's is the gold standard, hands down. I am baffled by any negative reviews, seriously, we have never had a bad meal here in over 30 years. Be aware, it states very clearly on the menu, that even thought the portions are huge, there is a $5 sharing fee. This is not unusual for restaurants and it is clearly stated right on the menu, $5 is still a bargain for the amount of food are served. The clientele is loyal, many regulars, so that tells you something about how good it is. Parking is a nightmare, yet people willingly put up with it and drive great distances just to eat here. Sorry some were disappointed but I cannot fathom how anyone would be.
The giant pretzel is a must to share at the start of the meal, and the wurst is great!
Been coming here for a few years already. Great prices and very good food. All I have ever eaten here is the duck special, but it is so good that it is likely all I will ever try!

This place was really cool. I came here with friends and family. In general, it's pretty busy and full of people. The location is perfect with bus stops and trains close by. The inside is pretty and well decorated. There's a bar right where you walk in. They have a rule that you can't have more than 2 bottles of wine to prevent people from getting drunk and starting something. I had the breaded chicken cutlet (an outrageous $18 but worth it). It was fantastic! Just great! For desert, I had chocolate ice cream (no sprinkles, WHY?!) and it was HORRIBLE XP. It was engulfed with freezer burn. Just bad The service was awful. You can tell ALMOST every employee hates their job and wishes for their shift to end. The hostess was nasty and rude. Like we were wasting her precious time. Our waitress was kind and warm. Very pleasant. We had a second waitress because the first one left sick or something. This waitress was just annoying. Acting like we weren't important at all and that a waste of space and matter

PROS- Amazing food, great beer/ale choices, Cozy Interior, good serviceCONS- a tad pricey about $60/person if you have soup,meal, desert and drinks, crammed 6 of us into a small booth. Yay Zum Stammtisch, for giving me a chance to hit 5 stars on a restaurant review ! The interior is decorated in a warm old-school German tavern style (lots of dark wood, deer (or Moose) heads on the walls, ceramic steins and mugs, etc. Making you feel like your cozily tucked in the cuddling arms of German grand parents. The service is prompt and polite. The tap has a number of German ales/beer to choose from (all delicious and served in rather German ceramic mugs or tall pilsner glasses ) The food is incredible. I started with a beef goulash soup that had bursting flavors for my taste buds.  I always buy my jaeger schnitzel which is always cooked perfect with a savory dark mushroom gravy on top. My companion selected the rib eye off the daily special list (which I have seen before here and was interested, but had never tried always opting for what I'm sure of) Well, with FULL confidence, I can tell you it was the best rib eye I have ever had at ANY restaurant (including 5 star Steak houses) I was SO soft and juicy, it melted in our mouths like butter.  We finished up with 3 deserts (though didn't have much room, but we were sharing amongst 3 couples) a Chocolate mousse, and apple strudel and something else which we had German coffees with (that had enough booze to kick you in the back of the head :-)  After drinks, meals, deserts and coffees the price came out to be about $130 a couple. Which although pricey for my normal night out, the fact that EVERYTHING was SO perfectly executed, I felt like I definitely got what I paid for. Although not often (because of the price), I will come back again (especially if they have that steak on the special menu).

Eins, Zwei, G'Suffa!!Had a blast here for Oktoberfest dinner - and Zum Stammtisch does it hardcore!I had eaten here before so I knew the food was going to be good, but this night they absolutely blew us away. From beginning to end, was non-stop food, beer, song, and out right Munich madness!This night's dinner was a seating rather than a regular business night so reservations were mandatory. For $55.00pp they give you a 4 course dinner of pretty much the best German food you can find around these parts and was as follows:1. Goulash soup --- insanely delicious2. Smoked shrimp with horseradish sauce --- a little different but good3. Sauerbraten with potato dumplings and red cabbage --- best I've had since my last visit here.4. Hot apple strudel --- f@#% incredible like my oma'sTables were communal which added to the social atmospheric party vibe and we met some new friends which was awesome(Don't forget guys next year on the SECOND Monday!).Die Spitzbuam provided the evening's entertainment and turned this night's Oktoberfest into a wild audience participation free for all - including all of the staff!! So much fun!!Zum Stammtisch thank you again for an unforgettable Oktoberfest celebration..danke, danke, danke!!!!

wonderful authentic German food in a non-pretentious setting.  I had the Bayerische Bauern Platte, and it was a lot of food!  The pork chop was tender, the leberkase was light and airy, and the bratwurst was just right.  Washed it down with the draft hefe-weiss.  Good food and beer.  What more can you ask for?

It was about an hour wait when my friend and I arrived here to eat. Since we were starving, we decided to sit at the bar to eat (there wasn't much room, but we found two empty chairs after waitng around 10 minutes). We both ordered the half-size jagerschnitzel (only available at the bar), a cup of goulash, and a side of pickled cabbage. The half-size was HUGE - I couldn't even finish it (I wonder how big the regular size was). It was delicious!!! - the chicken was covered in a mushroom reduction and served with potatoes. The goulash was good as well, but the best part of the meal was the side of pickled cabbage - it was the best!! (MUST GET!) Overall, friendly service and amazing food.

This place has everything: great atmosphere & the authentic food.. All of the food was absolutely delicious and the people sitting next to us said they had been coming here forever, so it has a loyal clientele. Everything was delicious from the goulash soup to the steak special to the jagerschnitzel and the schnapps. Also, the apple strudel was the best I've ever had. Get it a la mode.I especially wanted to shout out the wait staff. Even though the restaurant was packed (reservations are a must btw) the wait staff was incredibly conscientious, friendly and helpful. This would be a great place for a big party or big group meal but was also a great date spot! From public transit, we took the M to Fresh Pond and the walk was about 15-20 minutes (so not too bad).

Was in the neighborhood and decided to give this place a chance and tried to walk in. Didn't even get a chance to eat as the the hostess was laying a nasty attitude onto the couple in front of me about how they didn't have a reservation. She then shot me a look about how I'd better have a reservation. Didn't give a chance for that pleasure.I walked out. This review is about the bad customer service. Never had the chance to try the food.

I just came in this place and found this "sour face" waitress. She is one of the old ones but is soo rude. This review is just about the customer service not the food. The food as usual is really good.
Best German food around.  The Jaegerschnitzel and Goulash Soup are mandatory when visiting Zum's.

We've been going here for YEARS and always walk out satisfied!  if you're into German food, this little gem in Glendale is definitely worth your time.Their escargot appetizer (served with a garlic sauce inside a baked potato half) and herring in cream sauce are both notable starters.  For the traditional German/Bavarian experience, try their Jagerschnitzel (as long as you don't have any reservations with eating veal) which is served breaded with a creamy mushroom sauce.  If you don't want the sauce, select the Weinerschnitzel instead.  Another classic dish worth trying is their Sauerbraten (beef brisket consistency, marinated in a delicious pickled sauce laden with seasonings).  For lighter (or more casual) fare, try out their sausage platters - you can mix and match two or three to a plate to experiment!  Desserts are OK, nothing too extravagant.Atmosphere is extremely cozy, with a nice "lived in" feel to it, and many of their tables are nestled in little Chalet alcoves.  The place is family owned and operated, and wait staff is extremely friendly, but we've had mixed experiences with the speed of service.  On more than one occasion, it took almost 45 minutes for our entrees to come out....just worth a mention.  It still wouldn't stifle me from returning for another meal if the mood strikes!

I absolutely love this restaurant!  I've been here many times and everything on the menu is top notch.  The herring salad is delicious.  I also love the jagerschnitzel - pork and mushroom gravy.  Definitely must try the place!!
When your dreams come true you wake up here. Great food, awesome beers, wonderful service and pleasant ambiance.

I live right near this place, sadly I've only been here a handful of times because its always sooo packed. It is worth the wait! I love this food. When i tell people where i live the first thing i hear is "By Zum Stammtisch?!"  its a famous classic!

Came here after having a serious craving for some German food. There are not too many places to go for good German food in Queens, so my boyfriend and I decided on this place. The Decor- super German. Feels like you are in someone's house as opposed to the restaurant. The food- Delicious! We ordered the Escargot and the Potato Pancakes (not on the menu, you need to ask for them!). They were delicious and very flavorful. For our meals, we ordered the Sauerbraten and the Weinerschnitzel. The schnitzel was absolutely delicious. Nice and moist and the home fries were perfect! The meat in the Sauerbraten was slightly over cooked. But all in all the dish was good. The Service- Was really fast, but was very curt. We unfortunately were seated in an area where there were a bunch of large groups and so I felt like we were a bit ignored. But I can ignore it because it seems to be fairly busy (for a weeknight) and they were probably running around alot.

I gave my girlfriend the task of deciding where to eat on a Saturday night.  This was one of the two choices and she ended up wanting to come here because people that she knows ate here and enjoyed the food.We walked in and were promptly told by the host that it is "about a 60 minute wait" for a table for walk-in customers such as ourselves.  We were there and not much else doing for the evening, we decided to stay.  Someone has to teach that guy to tell time because a 60 minute wait took 15 minutes... Way to potentially scare away business there buddy!We sat down in a corner booth and I smashed my knee into something under the table... It was a barrel that was acting as a pedestal for the table.  I looked around and saw that all the tables are barrels with table tops and quipped to the hostess that was seating us that the tables should come with a warning because you can't see the barrel pedestal in the very dim light.The menu is not that daunting to get through.  They have the German name for most of the fare followed by the English explanation of what it contains.  I ordered the veal cordon bleu with a cup of split pea soup to start and the my girl ordered the sauerbraten.  While the saurbraten states that it comes with red cabbage and potato dumplings the veal cordon bleu just states the entree without sides, which turns out to be misleading as the veal comes with a side of home fries.The split pea soup was very flavorful and had bits of bratwurst in it to add more flavor.  The veal, I found, was overly oily from cooking but none-the-less delicious.  I tried sauerbraten... It was excellent as well as the red cabbage.  I wasn't thrilled at the potato dumplings.  I've tasted better and the consistency was a bit off.The sourdough bread that compliments the meal is amazing.  They also have Hofbrau Dark on tap that can be served in stein.  I saw that they have boots to drink out of as well but I didn't want to relive college and grad school that night.And for those keeping score... Yes, I did indeed bash my knee again on the barrel pedestal on my way out.

I've never eaten at a German restaurant and I can say that for my first time I really enjoyed it. My friends and I ordered the pretzel which was awesome! It was freshly made and i couldn't stop picking at it. For my entree I ordered the jagerschnitzel and it was delicious. It was smothered with a mushroom gravy sauce!! I love mushrooms so that was a plus for me. For dessert I had the apple strudel, i wasn't crazy about it as it seemed a bit dry, next time I will order it a la mode. Lastly, the wait staff are very attentive and super sweet, which is always a plus as it makes you feel welcomed! I will definitely go back to enjoy and explore other dishes.

Beware...the food was great but i ordered the jagerschnitzel off the prix fixe meal menu along with a cup of goulash which was the appetizer included and when the bill came they charged for a dinner and goulash separetly . When i asked the waitress she said "you didn't specify you wanted the prix fixe meal" and refused to lower the bill. i asked to talk to the manager and she said there was nothing she could do about it (i hadn't paid the bill yet). Even though it was about a $10 difference on a $142 bill its the point that they rip you off assuming your not going to really look at the bill (it's dark at the tables and we had 2 beers each) . When i told her I traveled from Long Island to come to the restaurant and said "what happened to the customer is always right?" she laughed and and said oh well and walked away. i took the difference in the bill and took it out of her tip! The 3 of us at the table where amazed at how stubborn the waitress (she's about 60) and the manager were. Its there job to ask which menu I'm ordering from if they don't know and the goulash side was a obvious hint because that or a salad are the only two options on the prix fixe. We won't be coming back here anytime soon.

Best German food this side of the Atlantic! Saurbrauten gravy was very rich and thick with meat that was moist and fork tender. Can't say enough about the gravy which was more on the sweet side of things (in a good way) and spiced to perfection. Potato dumplings were nice consistency not too dense. Jagerschnitzel was also very tender for such a large piece of veal having absolutely no stringy bits nor was it pounded too thin. Breading was crispy, light and well seasoned. Red cabbage was cooked to perfection and bursting with the sweet yet vinegary flavor you would hope for. Be ware the portion sizes are huge! Goolash was uniquely delightful as well to start.Will be making the trek from Jersey again soon I am sure!

Went with wife and some friends on a Tuesday night for Schnitzelfest !! A complete schnitzel dinner for only $19.95. WOW !! First we started out with soup. I had the goulash and wife had the pancake soup. Pancake soup ? YES !!!! It's a beef broth with julienne'd strips of pancake. Sounds weird ? NOT...it's delicious !!I had the goulash soup which was a flavorful smokey and hearty soup. All it needed was a boiled potato (my grandmother did that) and it would have been a meal !!THEN we went on the the schnitzel. We both had pork Jagerschnitzel (veal isn't available on the special). Delicious !!  One of my friends wasn't impressed with the mushroom gravy and said it tasted "canned".A side order of spaetzle was the highlight of my night !! I could have eaten a ton of it. Light and buttery and simply disappeared in my mouth !!For dessert, one choice....rice pudding. Rice pudding done perfectly right !!!I also ordered a side of strudel but it wasn't as good as my grandmother's. But then again, what could be?Parking in the area stinks !! And make sure to make a reservation because it gets crowded !
Amazing food complimented by amazing service. Cozy restaurant that offered a wonderful environment to catch up with friends. The hours flew by at this restaurant, and none of us wanted to leave.
Excelent food. Just dont plan on doing anything after. Youll eat so much you cant move. The gouhlash is excelent and great beers on tap. The lighting is a little dark.

I love Zum Stammtisch. When you first walk in your blown away with the ambiance. It's like an old Tudor home beautifully decorated like your in an old German village. Now for my meal, I ordered the jaeger schnitzel  Wow, what a meal. Deeply fried pork cutlet smothered in a hunters gravy with mushrooms. This is one of the best German meals I ever had. It was recommended by The Best Thing I Ever Ate tv show. This place is a must. Yelp you soon

This is a man's man's restaurant, although your wife or lady friend will enjoy it as well. Every time I come here I feel like a Bavarian lumberjack who's just come back from a hunt. Mainly because it's a trek to get here if you're not from the neighborhood and finding a place to park is much like Bavarian backwoods hunting (as I imagine it, anyway). The inside is warm and cozy. And very German, from the decor to the bartenders and waitresses. The atmosphere puts you in the mood to eat hearty German food and delicious German beer. Wursts, schnitzels, sauerbraten, schweinhaxe (pork knuckle--only on Thursdays--I think), chicken, fish, whatever you want you can have it here. I like to get 3 sausages (bratwurst, knockwurst, krainerwurst) and (at least) a liter of beer. Then I get my German on, whatever that means. Actually, I know what it means; coming here in the afternoon with a bunch of friends and eating and drinking until they kick us out to make room for dinner patrons (this place gets crowded--make reservations).

Hands down the best veal schniztel I've ever had. Same for the Rasberry Linzer tart a la mode. The atmosphere really makes you feel like you're in a German Chalet and the service was excellent. I can't wait to go again.

Back again this evening for dinner, and it is much the same as before, HUGE portions, and Good Hearty Food. Loved the Pilsner beer.Had the famous Jägerschnitzel which was good, I think more vegetables less meat would be nice.The Beef Rib Eye Steak is HUGE, so be prepared if you order that, was not that great.Also had Shrimp Cocktail and Herring in Cream Sauce. Both seemed liked by all.The dessert's I think can be skipped..The Black Forest Cake lacked Kirsch ,too much cheap whipped cream & Cheesecake was just ok.Coffee was nice and strong, and not bitter.I think it's nice for an experience and for Birthday's ,etc. But would not go back for any other reason.

As always, I feel obligated to respond to complaints that the service is "awful." On the one hand, it's not true. On the other hand, if I worked at a restaurant where people paid with gift certificates and then requested cash back, I'd definitely be surly. I'm serious. In lieu of giving a tip, these people treated themselves to a gratuity. On a gift!Anyway, ZS will definitely appeal to you if you grew up thinking that a signal achievement of dining was to eat so much food that you were practically daring yourself to become carsick on the way home.The Jagerschnitzel was very good. The breading was well done, and the stock in the sauce actually had a pretty rich flavor. I should also note that the meal was large enough for three dinners.And that was after I ate an entire smoked trout. Which apparently constitutes an "appetizer" portion.Both of these things were a tiny bit overcooked. I am not willing to forgive, but I am willing to forget, since I also enjoyed a promptly poured liter of Weihenstephaner hefeweissbier dunkel.By the way, I had some sauerkraut. That was really, really nice.

World Cup Edition: while other places like studio square are taking advantage of ppl during the WC, this place is doing the complete opposite, they give out FREE sandwiches, tee shirts, & beer mugs! Plus they have a special WC MENU THAT IS ACTUALLY CHEAPER THAN THEIR REGULAR MENU. Danke Zum Stammtisch!

Unless you have a car, or live right off of the Q55, it's not that easy to get to. I'll give you that. It's also a little kitschy inside, kind of like it was decorated by a drunken German who once interned for Disney. Once inside, however, you are going to leave in two conditions.The first will be drunk. They serve fantastic beers in mugs that Thor would be proud to drink from.The second will be obscenely full. You will eat meat (that's what she said?), and some type of potatoes. They will be heavy dishes, and you will be full for a few days. That's normal.Admittedly, it would be criminal of me to not turn you on to the carnivore's deal of the century that they offer here. On Tuesday nights, they will serve you an amazing cut of prime rib that's the size of a small sofa for $30. So, to summarize:Meat.Beer.Meat.Slavic women.Meat.It's basically a restaurant version of every Arnold Schwarzenegger film from the 1980's.
This is a great German restaurant! Great food, great traditional German atmosphere, and great German beer. Also, next door is their awesome German butcher shop!

I am updating my review from over 2 years ago. This place is still on the top of my good beer and hearty food list (20 check-ins and going).  They kept up the food quality (did falter once or twice) but recovered quickly.  I really recommend trying their daily specials. The schnitzels are safe bet but a bit boring after a while. I still stand by my recommended dishes from the old review. (Appetizer: Goulash Soup (MUST GET), Steak Tartar, Head Cheese.  Entrée Specials:  Broiled Beef (Friday), Prime Rib, Roasted Pork Shank (Sunday).  Regular Entrée: All sausage dishes, Leberkase Ala Holstein, Jagerschitzel (breaded veal cutlet mushroom sauce. Dessert:  Apple Strudel, Vanilla ice cream with hot raspberries, Eis Bar (Vanilla ice cream topped with honey liquor). I saw few recent bad reviews complaining about service, I am very sad to hear since I never got attitude from the staff.  They are respectful and quick, but they are not dotting (unless you had four steins of beer). They are diligent and hard working.  They don't sit around twiddling their thumbs. They always get you what you asked for and check on you no matter how packed the place gets.  Most of the staff are very seasoned have been there for years.   I understand that how swift and serious can get construed as abrasive or unfriendly but the service quality of an honest and efficient staff is one that I trust a lot more than an uptight, stuck up, fake smiling staff.   One tip, my favorite waitresses are Gina and Helga, they have always been nothing but wonderful and witty, so ask for them and you will great service.  Second tip MAKE RESERVATION especially if you want a table close to the weekend, they can be completely booked and walk in can have up to an hour and half of wait.

Although I can't speak on the food, I can speak to the incredibly rude staff. We walked in without a reservation at 5pm. We were told the wait would be an hour. I'm not sure why we are still here after just over two hours, but the husband really wanted to try this place, bc people who have actually eaten here enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Upon asking, how much longer... I was flatly ignored and told to sit down and I would be called when there was a table. NEVER EVER ATTEMPT THIS RESTAURANT WITHOUT A RESERVATION. What a disaster.

This restaurant is just awesome. I grew up near it & have eaten here several times. Always have been pleased with what I ate & the service. My favorite dishes are the jagerschnitzel & the breaded chicken cutlets. The goulash soup is an experience for the taste buds; just awesome. The environment only adds to the total experience, reflecting the culture that inspired it. Relatives of mine who moved up to Westchester make a point to come here annually for reunions with old friends which is a testament to the the excellent food & service that are standard here.

Moved from Astoria Qns. to Rockport Me. 4 yrs ago--miss Zum"s terribly-BEST German food Iever had (better than good ol' days in Yorkville.)Just took a virtual trip down Zum's memory lane looking at the website--menu, pictures andnew pork store which opened just before I left N.Y.Hopefully I'll get down to N.Y.C. for a visitfor another fabulous dinner at my wonderful ZUMS !!!!!Maria E. RidlonRockport, Maine
Prime rib n roast pork chops no complaints accept for credit card machine out of service,Dinner Was Excellent!

Authentic German food with a great atmosphere.  The Brat is my favorite and I love the apfel strudel.  If you are craving a German experience and are in Queens, this is the place to go.  I highly recommend a reservation, especially on weekends, or else you won't get in.  They also have all types of German beers.
Cup or bowl of goulash soup is outstanding!! Dip the bread in it for a great combo.  The porter house steak or jaegerschnitzel is awesome too.  For a real party have a das boot!

I have been coming to this place since I was a little girl.  Whether it was for special occasions or just a nice family dinner or date, this place has always been special to me. The best dish to get which has ALWAYS been the in NYC is the Jagerschnitzel. Veal cutlet breaded and fried and covered in mushroom gravy...how can you really ever go wrong? Its served with their home fries which are cooked perfectly with slightly charred edges and bacon bits. I've never had a bad experience here. They also have a new special on Mondays and Tuesdays that's schnitzel and an appetizer/dessert for $20. The deal is definitely good but does not include their traditional veal jagerschnitzel.  If you want good German food in Queens then I would definitely check this place out.

Took my mom here for her 66th birthday back in June. She goes here yearly. It was the first time I honestly had went. I never had german food. So the kids and I went with mom.  The kids really liked the place. The interior was unlike restaurants now. I loved how quaint that it was. Wonderful time!

You really can't go wrong with this place; although the service is terrible but what would you expect from a German Restaurant!  Goulash was delicious, Tar-Tar was amazing, Sauerbraten and Weinerschnitzel was delicious, and even though I asked for one dish and received another; it was still excellent.It's been about 10 years since I've been here and nothing has changed.  Tap is excellent as well.  Worth the trip; and the wait.Enjoy!

After hearing so much about this place from my father I had to check it out. Now that I've been here a few times and tried a few dishes I can say the sauerbraten and jäger schnitzel are just amazing.Great selection of German beer, cozy Bavarian atmosphere and the service is good.Be sure to make reservations Thursday through Sunday if you plan on dining at dinner time, or it's a good long wait. The wait however is worth it.

I had been curious about going to an authentic German place for a while and when I heard about  this place with its glowing reviews, I figured I found exactly what I was looking for.Although I insisted on going on a different day, my friends were unyielding in their desire to go during the final match of the world cup, (which for those who might not know), was between Germany and Argentina. Knowing full well the place was gonna be more packed than a tiny car full of obese clowns, my friends somehow convinced me to go. Trying to be slick and beat the inevitable crowd, I called to make a reservation(The first time I ever made one in my life), only to be quickly shut down by being told they weren't taking reservations for that day. So then, my friends and I thought, "The  place will be flooded by the time the game starts, we'll just go as earliest as possible". We got there perhaps a good 3 hours before the game starts, and the place was so full,  I honestly couldn't fully expand my diaphragm comfortably without my stomach scraping against some stranger's sweaty back. But I accepted it and saw it as no fault on the restaurant  itself, in fact, that's usually a good sign. The restaurant, at least on that day, had a sports bar atmosphere, which is fine, but I was expecting a regular dining establishment, and again, no points taken off for that.My friends and I, being the optimistically naive lot we are, kept our heads heald high (Literally), hoping to wait it out for a group of patrons who didn't come to see the World Cup leave a table for us. We eventually resigned ourselves to our fate of standing until the game ended.Having been standing 3 hours before the game started all the way til overtime ended, (Why couldn't Argentina let Germany win sooner?), resting our legs took priority in our minds over obtaining sustenance. The feeling of fulfillment and release described so accurately and concisely in Harold and Kumar go to White Castle after one has endured an arduous trial and obtains what they so determinedly sought after will forever represent the exact opposite experience we shared. The food was underwhelming if a meal ever could claim to be. We all had different meals, and all of them disappointing. While I may not be a professional food critic, I have had a wide range dining experiences, and I know when a meal is worth its price, and this one wasn't.It might seem as though the cumulative bad circumstances altered my objectivity, but it is because I was so reliant on enjoying my meal that I put so much focus into my assessing my experience.

This was an absolutely delightful place to visit.  A Saturday afternoon bike ride from Manhattan turned into a magical trip to Germany.  Friendly wait staff served steins of beer and Wienerschnitzel that was crispy and light, accompanied by delicious creamed spinach and home fried potatoes.  The apple strudel was perfect, nice freshly sliced apples, not overcooked, with just the right amount of brown sugar.   Yum!

I had the special of the day--- prime rib (yelp.com/biz_photos/19o6…)  cooked medium rare. It was freakin huge and could probably feed a family, so of course I couldn't finish. I tried my hardest though. It was tender, juicy, and well-seasoned. I loved it. I took it home and my family loved it.The Jaegerschnitzel (yelp.com/biz_photos/19o6…)  was tender and also tasty, but I liked my prime rib more.For dessert, we tried the Black Forest Cake and warm apple strudel a la mode. Given all the hype, the Black Forest (yelp.com/biz_photos/19o6…) cake was kind of bland and disappointing. Maybe it's just not for me. The warm apple strudel (yelp.com/biz_photos/19o6…)  was delicious, a bit crispy on the outside, but nice and soft on the inside. Service was so-so but it wasn't unbearable. The décor is cozy and old school, and I want to come back and try other things (and get the prime rib again), but it's kind of hard to get to without a car. No subways around.  :(  If you do want to venture out here, do make reservations!

Hostess was rude. She was inconvenienced when  I interrupted her conversation about her hair with customers to ask her to put our name on the waiting list.  Bartender was rude.  Couldn't be bothered to smile, or actually ask us what we would like to drink. I got an imperceptible head nod when I asked to order the pretzel while we waited for our table. Luckily his shift ended at 6 and we had friendlier service after that. Waitress was meh, not friendly and was abrupt. If you are German or a regular I suppose you are treated with more respect.

This is without a doubt my favorite German restaurant. The portions are HUGE and the food is always fresh, very high quality. My husband never had German food before, he's born and raised in Puerto Rico but thankfully open to trying new cuisines. He loved Polish food so I figured German was next. Went with him and my parents they all loved it. Unfortunately he ordered a steak, it was a special he wanted well came out medium rare. Sent it back was still very pink. I tell him to stick with the regular menu items as he never has luck with specials but men don't listen  he ended up with half my jäger schnitzel and loved it, it's my favorite and definitely big enough to share. Dad had head cheese he was expecting a different texture but enjoyed it plus  3 different wurst platter and loved it, and mom who is a total meat and potato freak raved about her pork loin. We all tried it it was amazing, fork tender and had ridiculous flavor. Hubs also loved the goulash. I've been coming here for almost 20 years and have never been disappointed, my only advice would be come on a weekday and make a reservation as it gets packed on the weekends, I've waited over an hour on a Saturday with a reservation. Just a tip

This is comfort food period!  It was prime rib special night but we managed to not order the prime rib as we usually would do.  Maybe this is a testament to its menu which has a variety of other excellent choices but more likely because we recently already had homemade prime rib.  The pork loin, duck and Reuben sandwich alternatives were a good reminder of the restaurant's ability to have something for everybody.  There was no room or time for dessert so no photos today of chocolate ice cream with whipped cream, strudel a la mode or Black Forest cake but know these are also options.  The only comment I should make here is their tea leaves something to be desired. Knowing the beer, especially German beer is the feature beverage of choice at ZS but for the sometimes tee totaler, Lipton tea bags if offered should be free then.  At least have Earl Grey or camomile on hand to show you have moved past the 70s.  Maybe that's done on purpose for this institution to show it's still the neighborhood haunt for your meat and potatoes without any pretenses for making your meal healthier by adding organic teas.  Whatever the case, bring your appetite, leave your diet and enjoy!
For decades now, THE place to eat and drink German in New York !"Iss, trink und sei fröhlich"

Zum Stammtisch WOW this place is unreal, without a doubt one of the 3 best meals my wife and I have had in 2015. I took my lovely wife Gail here for her birthday and am I glad I did . To start with Creamed Herring ...to DIE for simply an explosion of flavor hard to rival. We then had our entree's . Gail had Sauerbraten and I had the Jagershnitzel  with sides of the best Red Cabbage on the planet and sauerkraut. Not to mention the decor is right out of Germany as you would expect . To make the evening even more special there was an elderly gentleman who was celebrating his birthday, and he got up and sang German songs and played his harmonica and it was such fun . Back to the food it was nothing short of amazing we loved it and will go there again ...HIGHLY RECOMEND

The food here was outstanding. I was with a party of four. We all ordered differently and shared everything from appetizers to entrees. All dishes were delicious and there was so much that several of us ended up taking something home. I will definitely eat here again.
Old school German, from decor to food, wait staff to beer! Definitely a must when in Queens!!

Go, go, go!  That's it.  Jagerschnitzel...the best.  A prime rib like no other.  Enjoy a stein of beer in the bar which boasts old world décor and bartenders to match.  You will have a hard time matching the Zum Stammtisch experience.
The jaegersnitzel was awesome. There red cabbage was out of this world.  Couldn't ask  for anything more authentic

Being one of just a few traditional German restaurants, this place is a gem. The atmosphere is just right. The food is German style, great big portions and you will leave with a very full belly. I love coming here with my friends for a few drinks at the bar to hang out or watch the soccer games. I would recommend the goulash or split pea soup. And, if you want to bring something home, you can always go right next door into their very own pork store!! The meats are fresh and reasonably priced. They accommodate large groups, and host an Oktoberfest every year.

Authentic old world style German restaurant with generous portions that are phenomenal! Huge beer selections too! The ambiance makes you feel like you're in Germany! If you're looking for outstanding German food, I think this is the closest you can get to it without taking a plane!

I have so much love for this place. It's hard to pin down what makes Zum Stammtish so awesome: Is it the classic preparation of steak tartare? What about the hand pounded cutlets for the schnitzel? Or the fantastic wursts that make you feel like you're in a biergarten in Bavaria?  Maybe it's all of the above. Whatever the reason I look for an excuse to head here.

The new bus girl, I believe her name starts with a J, maybe Jane or Jill, was TOTALLY BOMBASS. Poured water like a pro and gave an excellent opinion on dessert options!!!! People work hard here! #remember #to #tip #the #bussing #table #folk
Love this place.  We order the same thing every time...goulash soup and jaegerschnitzel.  The best!

Walking in you feel as though you are stepping back in time.  It is wonderfully warm and cozy with decor that represents German culture.Service:  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive.They have a lovely selection of beers that compliment the food well.  We started off with Egg Ala Russian.  Which is a hard boiled egg over salad covered with Russian dressing and caviar.  Since it was light and somewhat refreshing, this is a great summertime app, it was very tasty and a good option to start before the massive entrees arrive.  I had to go for the Wienerschnitzel which was tender and perfectly crisp. Served with a lemon wedge to add some great acidity to each bite.  The home fries that accompany the cutlet are how all home fries should be.  Tender with little pieces of crisp and bacon through out they are delicious. A fantastic dish.  The Sauerbraten was fork tender served with potato dumplings and red cabbage was also very good although I felt that it needed a pinch of salt.  I must add that the red cabbage went lovely with the Wienerschnitzel as well.  Yum!The food is well made and scrumptious.  While the portions are large you don't feel weighed down upon completing your meal.  A great choice for some authentic German fare.
My absolute favorite place in queens. Brings me back to my childhood and all the German goodness.

Got to stop by Zum Sammtisch yesterday. This was one of my favorite spots in Queens in the oldern days, and I'm glad to see they're still grinding it out in Glendale.We caught a 3pm lunch, and the place was already lively. The crowd is pretty much middle aged people having kicking back and sipping German beers, and old timers who have probably been eating the Bratwurst for decades.We decided to go with the Jagerschnitzel, one of their specialties, which is a breaded veal cutlet with a sauce made from veal drippings and wine. We also got the Wiener Zwiebel Rostbraten, which is an steak served with crispy fried onions. Everything comes with a boatload of sides like potatoes, sauerkraut, etc.We liked the Jagerschnitzel quite a bit. It was cooked perfectly, the breading was crispy, and the seasoning was right on. But, for what it's worth, the sauce wasn't as good as I remembered. Very thin, and a bit flat in terms of flavor. I'm sure it wasn't, but it tasted mass manufactured.As for the Rostbraten, man this was disappointing. The steak was cooked fine, but it wasn't a particularly good cut. It was probably a 12-14 oz steak, very basic supermarket quality, with half being edible and the rest being fatty and sinewy. I also had to go to town on the salt and pepps because the chef didn't seem to do anything to the meat; no hint of a rub, marinade, seasoning, nothing. The fried onions were tasty at first bite, but were drenched in oil, and not crispy. I felt like I was eating breaded onion spaghetti or something.I couldn't help feeling that perhaps the quality had slid a bit in the years since my last visit. I used to love this place, but it seems to have transitioned from a really good and authentic German joint, to a nostalgia type place that you go to because it was cool back in the day.

how does that line go again... "i don't usually drink beer but when i do...." a tall glass of beer on tap just seems appropriate for this cute german tavern.  you won't find a laundry list of beer but what they have available we've always been happy with.the food is what i would expect of a tavern.  it's meat done simply but tasty.  am i going to salivate over their prime rib...no, but when i'm craving prime rib and want to dine  without fussing about what to wear, this is the place.  so on this tuesday night, we trekked out to glendale/ridgewood for their tuesday night prime rib special.  for $31, you get a 1 inch cut of meat, lightly seasoned, and flavored with buttery gravy and a side of potatoes.  quite satisfying and shaped our bellies nicely round.for appetizers, we tried the headcheese, surprisingly good and german herring salad.  we are not herring fans, but this appetizer provided a good palate cleanser of the steak we were tackling.we have always been overstuffed to the point where we glutons passed on dessert, despite the amazing reviews i'm reading on here.  but hopefully one day when i decide to order sensibly, i will try something.overall, good local eatery when you're looking to fill your belly well.

My wife and I went into the restaurant and they made us feel very uncomfortable as though we weren't wanted they tried to sit us where they wanted  and there were only about 12 people in restaurant I felt a stench of racism, I'm Black and my wife is Hispanic I will never return there I called them up the lady that greeted us with a very solemn look on her face tried to apologize and said the restaurant was crowded so we left. In my opinion they don't deserve the one star.
Just like wu-tang clan this spot ain't nothing to f with everything is on point from the decor to the staff to the food.

I thought it was delicious!  So much food!  I got two sausages platter: Bratwurst and Knockwurst.  I liked both of them.  The succulent, juicy, non-diet friendly meaty goodness.  I would recommend it if you find yourself in Glendale.  Not only was it the sausage platter, it came along with potato salad(a huge helping) and sauerkraut and what I believed to be homemade bread.

Ate here on a Saturday night. I like the spaaten beer they have on tap. Good service by the staff. I ate the pork shank and it was delicious. The appetizer menu could be better and more selective. I recommend this place.

brought a Korean friend here so he could try German food for the first time. The staff was nice but a few of the patrons at the bar made fun of him, I won't go into details but it was enough to make me not want to come back. This was a sad day - I wish people could behave the way they would like to be treated. I guess if you're not a white European you're not welcome here.
Good beer, crowded bar, generous portions, nice staff. This place can get loud, especially if the German soccer team is playing.

Food is wonderful. But attitude is brusque. The question  is whether wonderful food is worth the nonsense u must experience by staff.  If u r up for it, then just do it.  Don't say I didn't warn u!Here is a link that best describes their attitude.  It's funny but says so much about what you are in for:youtube.com/watch?v=yOHG…PS I hope they can take a joke?

First time here today. A little bit crowded . Had to wait about a half an hour, but well worth the wait! Great service, Great waitress, and the food was outstanding. The goulash soup is to die for! Only regret was I didn't have room for dessert. But we will definitely be coming back here very soon.

I always found it suspicious of how every time I eat here at this long time Glendale German restaurant, I place my order and minutes (and I mean 5 at most) my food arrives.  Is everything pre-made?  Pre-made or not, it's still decent German fare and it's always packed so this place has a long time following.  It may take a while to get a table if you don't have a reservation but you certainly won't wait long for your food.

WOW! Is  what I have to say. I grew up in Queens and haven't been here in at least 15 years and it is as good as it ever was!First off we arrived for lunch on a week day and at 12:30 in the afternoon this place was mobbed, we couldn't even get a seat at the bar. It's a fantastic neighborhood restaurant that transports you to Germany from the moment you walk through the door. There was.a group of 9 of us we had an assortment of food including jaeger schnitzel, wiener schnitzel, sauerbraten, smoked pork loin, goulash soup, stuffed cabbage, and a melted cheese sandwich ( the only non meat option on the menu short of the sides). Everything was delicious and the portions humongous ( doggie bags for all). The red cabbage was devine as was the German potato salad, spatzle, even the mixed veggies were fresh and tasty.MUST GO if you want authentic German food and beer. Wait I forgot o mention the beer! The weizenbier was the best beer really smooth and light ( note you can't get a Bud light to Coors light here only German biers)
Hands down the best Prime Rib i have ever had. Soft, juicy, so tasty. Wish I didn't live so far away in Hawai'i. Although different cuts of meat, on the level of Peter Luger Greatness.

This place is amazing, maybe one of the best meals I have had in the past year or two. Whenever you find an ethnic adventure, you always have to try it out. German food isn't my favorite cuisine, but this meal enhanced my love for this cuisine. The whole experience (except for the music playing) seemed really authentic. The decor was outstanding, as if you were in Germany. The staff were wearing authentic German attire. The menu, despite the price, is fantastic. The prices aren't cheap, but the food is amazing. The menu consists of soups, lots of appetizers, meats, chicken, authentic German dishes, sandwiches, and a huge beer list. Service was great, not the fastest, but definitely efficient. We didn't have appetizers, but I would recommend getting one if with a group. We did start with complimentary bread, which was delicious. We had a jägerschnitzel, which was delicious. The portion was large, the gravy was thick and tasty, and the veal itself was properly prepared. We had a chicken riesling, which was so juicy and tender. The chicken was perfectly cooked, and the wine, mushroom sauce was perfect. I had the duck special, which is only available on certain days. The duck was tremendous, filling up the whole plate. The duck was incredible, seasoned perfectly, treated well, a bit too much fat was kept on. The dressing was fantastic, very savory, contrasting the duck's almost sweet taste. Their sides are fantastic. Try the mashed potatoes, the red cabbage, the mixed vegetables, and their fresh sauerkraut. Make sure to come here for lunch, since it gets packed during dinner service.

overall foods were very sour.  I ordered sausages, sausage itself were good, but the cabbage & potato under the sausages were sour.  My husband ordered Sauerbraten, the sauce was sour, a bit strange, also on the same plate, two big ball of potato, the surfacce were a bit dry, side dish for the meal - red cabbage was way too sour.  The appetizer we ordered escargot, 6 escargots stuffed inside in a whole potato, very different.  The only thing we found good was Goulash Soup.  The service was okay.  Overall disappointed about this high rated restaurant.

Upon arrival, we were distracted by the Stammtisch Pork Store right next door (walks into the restaurant). We looked around and made a point to come back after lunch. We were lucky to be seated in the front (traditional) area, without reservations. It was 1:30pm but PACKED! - and it stayed that way when we left around 3pm. Staff:The owner was kind but always seemed aloof, always thinking about something else Our waitress was borderline rude, but she was very kind to everyone else. When we asked about the beer, she said "I wouldn't know". But looking around, all the other waitresses were smiling and nice. Bartender was very helpful. Atmosphere:VERY authentic German ambiance. Our table leg was a beer barrel! It made you feel as if you were in a nice restaurant and a beer hall at the same time.Food:Bread - Didn't look like much but boy was it good! Crispy on the outside, warm and doughy on the inside. No german butter though.Friday Special: Boiled Beef and Horseradish     The horseradish was very strong, good. The beef was tough. Flavor was good.Sauerbraten: Marinated Beef, Potato Dumplings, Red Cabbage     WOW! This was AWESOME! I wanted to eat the whole thing! The beef was cooked perfectly, tender and juicy - you could almost pull it apart with a fork. The red cabbage was great! Potato dumpling was ok... tasted like a potato matzoh ball. Jaegerschnizel: Breaded Veal Cutlet, Mushroom Sauce, Homefries     We had great expectations for the Food Networks "Best Thing I Ever Ate" dish but were highly disappointed. Of the 4 dishes we ordered, it was the one we liked the least, not to say it was not good - it was just nothing special. Like a glorified Country Fried Steak. And at $25? It was not worth it. It was the only dish we brought home (the rest were devoured). The portion was larger than all the other dishes. 1 Bratwurst, 1 Krainerwurst, German Potato Salad     Mmm! Both were delicious! I would definitely get this again! But for $15, kinda pricey. I can't wait to come back to Zum Stammtisch... it's just a but pricey - but worth it!

Having lived in Germany, I can say that this place is the real deal.  I went there to satisfy a craving for Jägerschnitzel, and satisfied I was.  Super authentic, super delicious German food.  The opposite of trendy/hipster Brooklyn, in the best way possible.

If you are looking for the best German food in the Nassau, Queens, Brooklyn area, then stop looking!! You will have by far the best German meal outside of Munich here. I always start with the goulash soup because it is so tasty, hearty, & filled with tender, moist meat. It's seriously the best. Then, I always order the Jäger Schnitzel which is by far one of the best meals I've ever eaten in my life. The crispy, lightly breaded veal cutlet is extremely tasty & delicate & hearty. It's also a hugely generous portion! It is served with the most amazing home fries & sweet red cabbage. In the winter, I always get a mug of gluwhein, which is superb at Zums. Gluwhein is a warm, mulled red wine with brandy, orange, spices, & sugar that I absolutely love & it packs a nice punch on this Ukrainian/Austrian chic :) The service is always good. The food is always outstanding. Do yourself a favor & go!!!!!! You will not be disappointed!!! It is so incredibly delicious!!!

Selfishly, I am in conflict. Do I write a just review, thereby bettering my chances of having to wait for a table in the future? I'm taking one for the team to wish these people continued good business. I've added my five stars worth; now go try the Jagerschnitzel, goulash soup, spaetzle, potato salad and sausages - all are excellent. Beer list is full of German favorites. Make a reservation.

I went for Schnitzel-fest and everything was amazing!!! The Weinerschnitzel, the sirloin with garlic butter (genius), potato pancakes, potato salad, and sauerkraut. You really feel like you're in Germany with the boot-shaped glasses and heavy beer mugs. The waitress was informative and sweet. Service was also very quick! I can't wait to go back and try more dishes! Also can't wait to check out the store next door. I need to take these goodies home!

Awesome traditional ambiance; St. Pauli girl outfits, dark wood, quaint touches, hunting trophys, etc..Excellent host accomodated us  immediately.  Waitress's were efficient, knowledgeable, and all business as they moved swiftly around the crowded room.  Everyone appeared to be satisfied and content as large beers were consumed at almost every table and mountains of food was being deliveredFood was somewhat overpriced, parking not  so hot and dessert was totally disappointing.  The menu is large with many choices of sausages, pork, veal, and fish.  Personally I would have liked more appetizers to choose from.They serve groups very well as there were several parties going on at once.  Staff worked great together.

Food is decent. I love going here for Oktoberfest too. My husband had a bad experience here with his Korean friend though where bar guests made raspiest comments to him. These guys are a bit too German, if you know what I mean. Not cool. After all, it's New York City not Hamburg 1941
A Haiku for Zum Stammtisch:Here before you wereSolid German done so wellLike mom used to make
Very disappointed after traveling from long island.  Food was good but the waitress so rude. Sent an email to the restaurant about the poor service, lets see if they respond.

One of my favorite places!! I was lucky to grow up in Glendale and my family and I went here all the time. The food is always delicious and the service is always great. It isn't cheap but you get great quality and quantity. Their steaks are huge!

It is a charming place.  Decor quite like the old style restaurants I visited in Berlin.  We had the Schnecken im Erdapfel (escargot), Sirloin Steak and Jägerschnitzel.  I know the first two items are not what most people associated with German food, but I wanted to try German style escargot and I really wanted steak.  Both the entrees were decent, but I will not get the escargot again ... it is basically baked potato dipped in herb butter accented with 3 little escargots on top.

If you enjoy German food, this is the place to be. I have been coming here for the past ten years and have never been disappointed. The atmosphere is very warm and inviting, like stepping into a Bavarian home with cozy nooks and booths. The waitressess are lovely and the food is amazing. The schnitzels are all great. I highly recommend the Jagerschnitzel. If sausage is your thing, try the Krainerwurst.  It is a hickory smoked pork sausage that is so flavorful served with sauerkraut and potato salad.  If you cant make up your mind which sausage to try, you may get all three;  bratwurst, knockwurst, and Krainerwurst. The creamed spinach is so good you can make a meal of it. But why stop there. Let me back up. To start with they serve warm pumpernickel bread (which happens to go well with any one of the thirst quenching beers. They have barrel beers, wheat beers, imported, domestic and non-alcoholic beer. If you are feeling extra thirsty, get the boot, but have a  friend drive!) The chicken Riesling is another favorite. If you are vegetarian,  the potato pancakes, smoked brook trout, the list goes on and on. Now to end a perfectly savory,  hearty meal you cannot leave without trying the streudel or rice pudding, at least share one if you are too full! You no doubt will be adding this to your favorite list of restaurants.
Mmmmm goulash and jaegerschnitzel heaven. This is some of the best food I have ever eaten. The only problem is parking is usually scarce since there's no parking lot.

Was my first time trying German food, and I was not a fan.  However, the restaurant itself was lovely..good service.  Would not return since i did not enjoy the cuisine...But would recommend to anyone who likes German food.

Love this place!! Have had the sauerbraten, pork special, and two sausage platter. Of those my favorite was the two sausage plate, as the meats were amazing, and also the potato salad was spot on! Also, the beers here are very fresh and absolutely delicious. I love the ambiance as well.

This was honestly the best experience I've had dinning out in some time. The service was great and with the atmosphere they create it feels like your just over at your aunts place for dinner, just perfect. The food is by far some of the best German I've had in some time, the menu big enough to hit all the classics it doesn't go much pass the classics but they don't have to. (On a side note you have to get the red cabbage, best I've ever had the joy of experiencing) If you find yourself in Glenwood stop in and have an experience, I know I'll be going back and I don't say that about to many places.
Terrific food.  We catered for a party.  The German sauerkraut and kielbasa was to die for, at least for me. :D
Great Place Every Dish I have had was Great!!! Highly Recommend!!! Come Hungry , Big Servings

Zicke Zacke, zicke Zacke, oi, oi, oi!!Hoist em high and toast them loud and proud.  The BEST German food outside of Germany can be had here.  An institution in the Glendale area for decades the place churns out amazingly tasty food and enough of it to stagger your cholesterol levels. I have tried many other German places but none of them comes even remotely close to Zum Stammtisch.  The deserts, if you have the room for it, will put the final nail in your coffin - you'll sleep for two days after eating here but damn, it is good.

There's something slightly disappointing and even disheartening when after a very long trip (F train from Manhattan to 74th street Jackson Heights, walk to Elmhurst hospital, Q29 bus to the last stop, Q55 for a few stops -- multiplied by two for round-trip) to an "authentic" German restaurant, your waitress (who looks sort of like Jerri Blank from Strangers with Candy, only Croatian) not only doesn't speak or understand German but refuses to acknowledge your own humble (and humiliating) attempts at doing so... Another thing which can't go unmentioned (because it sure as heck didn't go unnoticed): the bathroom smelled absolutely horrible, and there was--I kid you not--a large amount of excrement on the floor, and when i told a restaurant employee about it there was literally a five minute delay before anything was attempted to be done about it... Anyway, the food --after the aforementioned incident I had to go into complete denial, pretending I saw nothing, distracting myself constantly to keep my mind off it--it's decent... When you sit down they bring you a very generous portion of very tasty--especially when piping hot--bread, though I wish the butter weren't served in packets. All the garnishes (parsley, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles) that came with the entrees were a bit limp and lifeless, but the food itself (homemade headcheese with onions, leberkaese with potato salad, cucumber/beer/carrot/cabbage salad, kassler rippchen and bratwurst with homefries and sauerkraut) was pretty good -- I don't know of anywhere in NYC to get better German food... I've been here before, awhile back (after my friend gave a piano recital at Queens College), and had the Sirloin Steak which I remember being pretty good... The beer collection is, fortunately, very affordable, but unfortunately not very extensive -- though they do have a favorite beer of mine, Schlenkerla Maerzen for $6 (for 500ml!)... There were four different people who had birthday cakes brought to them, and at least a dozen people were taking pictures throughout the evening... The crowd didn't seem very adventurous -- I heard two different people say how disgusting they thought Steak Tartare is, and pretty much everybody ordered the Riesling Chicken or the Sauerbraten... I'd recommend this place if you have a lot of time to waste on travel, and hopefully the bathroom will be clean... I'll most likely come back in the future, but not any time soon -- I'm going to explore more convenient alternatives.

This is a great place to eat during fall and winter.  I love their sauerbraten and my husband likes their steak tartare.  They have a great beer selection.  The service can be slow so don't go when you're pressed for time.

Delicious food, and wonderful atmosphere that feels like you're dining in Deutschland.Portions are a generous size and delicious.  I definitely recommend getting the 2 Sausage meal, where the Knockwurst and Bratwurst will come with a healthy portion of sauerkraut and flawless German Potato Salad.  If this portion doesn't fill you up you should evaluate your decisions in life that got you to this unfulfilled point.  Four stars, would definitely go there again and again.Good Beer menu, would be love to to go again during Octoberfest!

So I gotta say, the first time I came to Zum Stammtisch 7 years ago or so, I was not really big on schnitzel. After eating at a couple other German places, I am kicking myself for not trying it here- because I have learned that I really like it! My friends say that the sausages/schnitzel is amazing here. When I came to Zum Stammtisch, I had the Chicken Riesling, which was in a thick, delicious mushroom-y sauce that stood out so much from so many other things that I've eaten that I still remember it! They also have the 2L DAS BOOOOOT here, which I really wanted to try, but I don't think I could fit that much beer in one little body lol. Overall, it's a little pricey, but it's authentic homestyle cooking, so I think it's worth it. I'd love to go back!

At holiday season they have a roast goose which is outrageous!They are known for their steak tartare which scares me but my friend made me try it and it was excellent and my jaw did not lock due to food poisoning from eating raw meat. I like this place. Its real close for me but hard to get in with no reservations.
Tried the bratburger on one visit (potato salad was great) and jagerschnitzel on another.  Didn't really know too much about German food......but damn......both dishes were terrific.

Was here on a Saturday night.   Made a reservation and was seated with no problems. Saurebratan was delicious and the red cabbage the best I've ever had!   Michelle our waitress was friendly and efficient.  Sara, the 'reservations distant waitress' was terrific! !!
I hated beer until I came here.I had a "Weiss Bier" and I instantly became a fan; the same goes for the fare.
Another cozy restaurant in the Glendale section of queens if you have never experienced German food or dishes then you should try this restaurant out food and service are excellent
Best German food very authentic The beer is dam delicious I can't stop drinking 1 stein after another!!
As always, Zums is the place to be for the authentic German food you crave. The service is exceptional. The beer is cold and foamy. The best place to eat and drink in Queens.

I was at this restaurant last week with my sister and the hostess was not friendly.  She asked us if we were coming or going when we just arrived there.  The food was good but could have been hotter.  The service was lousy.  We do not recommend this restaurant.Pat K.

We went New Year Eve had an 830 res and was seated within 10 minutes. It was a delicious as usual. We are always satisfied with the service and food.  The bartender was a bit hyper and overwhelmed. The place was decorated lovely. They had their regular menu truly a win win

I come here with my family whenever we want authentic German food.  It's a hike to get to Glendale from the city because there are no convenient subway or LIRR stops but this place is well worth the effort.  You'll notice that most patrons are loyal return customers.  Zum's is a neighborhood staple...FOR A REASON!As soon as you walk in the door, you feel as if you stepped into a different world, sans Dwayne Wayne.   Cozy nooks and dirndl clad waitresses give you the vibe you seek when eating Bavarian comfort food.  Service isn't always with a smile but that's not really what Germans are known for anyway, right?  You come here for the beer and food!Anything off the menu is sure to staisfy but highlights include the Goulash Soup (BE SURE TO GET THIS!!), Steak Tartare, Herring in Cream Sauce (I don't eat this but my family loves it), any of the Sausage platters, and Jagerschnitzel.  The Sauerbraten is good too but I'm spoiled by my grandmas version so I will always opt for something else.  Finish your meal with the black forest cake or warm apple strudel.  Try leaving hungry...I dare you!
Great authentic German food!  Can't wait to go back.  Simply the best German in all of NYC.  Parking is a little tough but that's the only not so good i can say.

It's everything they say it is. Modern, motivated, delicious and fun. We've found a new favorite Filipino restaurant among favorites to incite another 2 hour chat about our best meals. If you haven't been here yet, don't sit on it- just go! We shared the giante calamari, shrimp with salted egg and fried beef short rib over a caramelized sauce. The salted shrimp egg was short of religious enlightenment it was so so good. Perfect balanced flavors of young ginger, coconut milk, shallots, head juice of shrimps and of course- ode de la salted egg. We couldn't get enough of that yellow edible gold, seriously. That giant squid is a fanfare and great for crowds. Crunchy, messy, bang for your buck fried goodness- we want to try their bbq meat and kare kare fried pork belly next time but was not disappointed in any way with the squid. Alas, there was fried hunks of fatty short rib doused it unctuous, candy brown gravy. What's not to love? This one is more for the sweet n sour, General Tso's lovers in my opinion (you're welcome). We ate every last morsel it was so.so.good. As I've prefaced- I waited to try Kusina n that's my only regret, Bc I cannot wait to try ALL of their plentiful selection.

We came here for Sunday brunch and the restaurant was semi-packed. We ordered the sizzling squid and pork lumpia Shanghai as appetizers. The squid presentation was very interesting and it was really good. The batter was not overly salty. The lumpia was delicious and the meat tasted really fresh. We ordered the oxtail kare kare, which came with 2 big pieces and 4 smaller pieces. It was a big portion for two people. Make sure to order garlic fried rice to eat with the peanut butter gravy! We also ordered pork belly with garlic and black vinegar, which is another typical flipino dish. I would have probably rather order the sisig instead. The price was really good for the amount of food we had. We didn't finish our food of course and we made another meal out of it for $70. I would recommend to give this spot a try when you're in the mood for some flipino food!

The food here is INCREDIBLE!!!!I came here for a friends birthday, we ordered almost everything on them menu it was to hard to choose. We ate like it was our last meal and even ordered doubles of some dishes.Every pork dish here is deliciousThe lumpia is amazingThe fried squid is a mustAnd soooo much more !! Definitely one of my favorite Filipino spots in Woodside and the staff is WONDERFUL!! They gave us all a memorable experience and can't wait to come back !!

I'm always in search of authentic Filipino food and I'm so happy to have discovered Kusina Pinoy Bistro! What brought me here was an instagram post featuring the Calamari Gigantes. This is a massive giant fried squid that will draw the attention of all the tables around you. My boyfriend and I were pretty practical so we only ordered the squid and Adobo rice. The squid is certainly not appetizer sized, and we only managed to finish half of it. It was deliciously battered and fried, but the sight of the oil dripping onto the table made me slightly queasy. Even so, I happily enjoyed it with the Adobo fried rice. The rice was too bland for my liking, but the squid's strong flavor compensated for it. For dessert, we tried the Taho-- a tofu custard with tapioca pearls and caramel syrup. It was sweet and light: the perfect dessert to follow the heavy meal. Dessert lovers will rejoice upon seeing that they have all the popular Filipino desserts like Halo Halo, leche flan, and cassava cake.The affordable prices and extensive menu invite you to visit often.

Came on a Sunday night which they had karaoke night very entertaining. Food was so good this was our first time there and it won't bee our last. We always go to Renee's but we wanted to try a different place. It was 5 adults plus a baby. Must try you won't be disappointed. We ordered a FEAST:- calamare gigantes- lumpiang Shanghai - okoy- chichapollo- Fresh lumpiang labong- lechon kawali - crispy pata- oxtail Kare kare - bulalo- daing Bangus- ginataang sitaw  at kalabasa

Cool Filipino restaurant with a hip vibe and very solid food. Since I personally am not that experienced with Filipino cuisine, I had my Pinoy foodie friend do all of the ordering and be my guide. Since my friend isn't the biggest fan of squid, we skipped the Calamari Gigantes appetizer, but from the other tables that ordered it, it looked incredible and I need to go back and get it. As for the dishes we ordered, the chicken lumpia were fresh out of the fryer, juicy on the inside and you could tell that they were made in-house with a lot of care. My friend was DELIGHTED by the fish sisig. I have no experience with the traditional pork preparations to compare it to, but I was perfectly happy as well and thought it was a very unique and different way to prepare and serve fried fish. The bagnet express was delicious. Rich, creamy coconut curry with stewed chunks of fried pork belly that was somehow both still crispy and yet tender all at the same time. That over rice was just heaven. I wasn't too crazy about the lettuce garnish they served it with, however (which I was told is not a common accompaniment for such a dish). Since the curry is generally eaten with rice, the lettuce and the rice sort of clashed in a weird, uncomplimentary way. The palabok noodles were also terrific - but what's not to love about rice noodles, gravy, crispy pork skin and seafood all mixed together? If you're coming for dinner, MAKE A RESERVATION. This place gets packed.

This is my favorite Filipino restaurant in queens!This is authentic place and the food is fire sizzling !(We did family style, and paid around $16)The sisig dish was our favorite so we ordered 2! The sisig was incredible, the flavor melting in my mouth and it complements the adobo fried rice.The stew flavor was great too! It was rich and flavorful with out being too much. Pancit was also much better than other chain places I have been too. Service was awesome; they have karaoke! I would come back for that. Ivan assisted and helped me gain confidence in singing for fun. "Perfect" by Ed Sheran. Bathroom was clean!
Value 4/5Taste 4/5Service 1/5Presentation of food 4/5Appearance of the establishment 4/5

Honestly, never in my life have I been to a place serving Filipino cuisine, didn't know it existed until I saw this on the 'hot and new' listings. Initially drawn in my the pictures of the interior decor, decided to try it out for lunch today. We ordered the milkfish ($14.95), tilapia ($14.95), trio dessert ($8.95) and pork ($11.95). Regarding the seafood dishes, I thought the value was pretty great considering you get a WHOLE fish!  The milkfish was grilled and I felt it went a bit too long on the grill as the meat was a bit dry. The tilapia was great and meat was juicy, the only burdensome thing was having to eat cautiously because of all the bones. Still for less than $15 with salad and rice, I think the pricing is good.The pork, compared to the portion sizing of the fish (which arrived to the table first), was small and honestly at least 1/3 was bone. The vinegar made its way through the meat well, but I thought it was a little bit too salty. In saying that, the meat was well cooked and still tender. This also came on a small bed of salad with a bowl of rice. I couldn't justify the price tag for this dish though.The trio dessert was nice, especially the ube on top! The flan was delicious too! The casava cake was plain and texturally incompatible with the other dessert components. I think instead of doing a layered dessert assembly, serve it deconstructed and it will allow patrons to appreciate each one better. The fake whipped cream used for decoration could well be replaced with freshly whipped cream too, this will enhance the overall flavours of the desserts. The $8.95 price tag is a bit too ambitious as well, so I thought.The staff were very attentive, loved how they made use of the space and decor concept. Naturally, being a Pinoy establishment, they had karaoke!!!! It would have been so great to hear some when we dined but perhaps that's for the evenings. The restaurant is child friendly, they have high chairs available too.Worth checking out if you're looking at broadening your culinary experiences :)

Amazing food. How I would love to give Kusina Pinoy five stars. The food was just amazing. The Lumpiang Shanghai were crispy, just right, and the Oxtail Kare-Kare so soft all around you'd think it was file mignon. And its peanut sauce, hmmm, hmm hmm.The Siningan na Baka was plentiful, with enough beef and vegetables to tame the coldest of the night. Overall, from a gastronomic perspective, it was close to perfect. We thought the Calamansi juice was way too syrupy but that could be a cultural assessment. An outstanding meal at a great value.However, the service was complicated. We sat down at around 7:35 and ordered about 10-15 minutes later. We were a party of three, and save for four other tables, the ample locale was empty. Our main course came in at 8:35, and it preceded the Lumpiang appetizer. The waiter was somewhat apologetic but he didn't stay on top of our order. It's a shame since I was very close to walking out before our meal was served. And I would have missed out on quite the treat.Others have mentioned the karaoke and how annoying it can sound. Even good food has its limits, and it can't make people sing better.

Great service! Great food!! But they charge customers too much. Attached is the copy of our receipt. Pay attention to the hidden charges. And to the different  taxes they charge.  Plus a 3.99 percent charge if you pay tHru credit card. Management should pay attention to this before they loose customers..

We had the calamari gigantes, pork sisig, ox tail kare kare, palabok and the baked Mussels.Our server was very friendly and engaging as he took the time to explain the various items since it was my first time trying Filipino cuisine.Let me start off by saying that the calamari was HUGE!! It was probably my favorite dish as I enjoyed the crispy exterior and chewy interior topped off with the sauce.The pork sisig and oxtail kare kare was an interesting new flavor and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal.I would definitely want to come back again even if it means travelling 50 mins to get here!

Very lively and colorful dining experience. People come here to share food and culture.
