Ethnic performances, instruments and dances are featured on weekends.The fishball appetizer is a blast from the past. Ampalaya (bitter gourd) had a distinctly watery sauce but good flavor. The Kare-Kare is one of the best we tried. Wonderfully thick peanuty sauce is perfect with the equally thick cuts of tender oxtails. The calamansi juice drink is made with honey, a perfect tonic for the cold or sore throat. For dessert, we tried Mango Turon. Deep fried bananas with a scoop of mango ice cream. Perfect ending. Service is cheerful and friendly. All the servers checked up on us frequently. We noticed the tables were uneven height, but other than that, this place is very highly recommended!

So last minute me and my siblings decided to eat here. Being a Queens native (69th street and down) is known for authentic Filipino food. After finding this on yelp as NEW we were willing to try it out. Being Filipino-American I will say it's difficult finding a nice Filipino restaurant that is spacious and photo friendly. This is definitely a hidden gem. The food is delicious and the inside is maganda with an open kitchen. It can't get better then that!  So with the food me and my sibilings shared the Crispy Pata, Beef Short Rib Kaldereta, Calamare Gigantes, Lechon Kawali. We were definitely stuffed and satisfied, the only thing I wish they had was alcohol! We did order the Calamansi Juice and we loved it! Overall, this place is unique, authentic and creative. MUST TRY and the service was beyond outstanding friendly and really brought us back to the Philippines. Thank you so much for the hospitality we will definitely be back booking my next reservation actually today!

I recently moved back to NY. The day I landed, my family brought me here to celebrate and fast forward to living here for 6 weeks and i've been here 5 times already. HAHA. It is that good!First of all, the service is excellent. Jeff, Lisa, and (I forgot her name but the manager with the long hair), has always been warm, friendly, efficient and just always provides excellent customer service. This is why I keep coming back! FOOD. Everything taste good! I've tried a lot from their menu and I haven't tried anything that I didn't like. Everything is so good that makes it hard for me to decide which to order. Thanks to the chef!The ambience is lively, with loud music from the karaoke that anyone can sing to (without having to pay extra). They play songs that just brings you back to home. I am always amazed when guests/customers go up and sing. Everyone has a great voice, except me. haha. I cant recommend this place enough! It is great! I was just there last night with friends, and I'll probably be back again next week. Thanks, Kusina! My favorite authentic Filipino restaurant.

First time having Filipino food and it was amazing!! We came on a weekday evening and there was a live band playing- music was a little too loud for my liking as I couldn't hear my friends who were directly in front of me.First bite of everything was phenomenal - we ordered lumpia, sigsig, palabok and garlic rice. However towards the end it did get a little too heavy/salty for my liking.

This "new" restaurant was formerly called Promdi but then it was bought out by new owners and renamed Kusina Pinoy Bistro. The layout has stayed the same.  There's a full-sized bar and waiting area at the front, tables on either side of the restaurant and the open kitchen in the back.  They did update some of the décor which makes it feel more modern and classier. I really liked the wood paneling with the leather seats in the main area and the touches of red throughout the restaurant.  They have two screens that plays filipino songs and on weekends they have karaoke. We came on a Sunday for lunch and we noticed that there were already two big groups eating inside.  It's nice to see that they can accommodate big groups here. The restaurant is child friendly and has highchairs available but alas, no changing tables in the bathroom.I must say that the service was top notch.  The waiters and hostess were all very attentive and friendly.  We got our water refilled 3- or 4-times during lunch.  The manager came by towards the end of the meal to chat with us.  And a couple of the wait staff came by several times to check up on us during the meal. We ordered Lumpia Shanghai, Kusina Bistek, crispy pata, garlic fried rice, spicy Laing, halo-halo and Sago't Gulaman. I really like the plating and presentation of the dishes we ordered but did think that some of it was overprice. I found the sago drink to be a little bit too sweet.  I felt it could have used more ice to help dilute the flavor. The lumpia shanghai was very good and not too greasy.  It came with the usual sweet and sour dipping sauce from a bottle.  The bistek was my least favorite dish of the whole meal.  The meat, while tasty, was incredibly tough.  And the portion was so small, barely enough for one person. Strangely, it came with a huge side of white rice.  Still, I would not recommend this dish.  The crispy pata was also on the small side but quite good.  It had a nice crunchy skin and the meat was not too fatty.  It did not come with the usual pickled veggies but only with a small dipping of soy sauce.  Too bad because it really needed that acidity from the pickled veggies to cut through all the heavy meat flavor.  The spicy Laing was a real pretty dish to look at.  It sort of had the "deconstructed" look with the taro leaves on one side and the sauce on the other.  This is not the normal way it is served but I thought it was quite interesting.  The dish had a nice punch but was not too spicy.  I could tell from the taste that they used canned taro leaves which gives a strange after taste in your mouth.  My companions like this dish, me not so much.  The garlic fried rice was quite yummy, but I really wanted it to be more garlicky--just a personal preference.  The best part of the meal for me was the dessert, the halo-halo. This came in a tall glass and had very good flavor.  You could really taste the taro in it, and I loved the crunchy rice topping.  It was a bargain at $7.  I would come back just to order just this. I'm guessing they are still experimenting with the menu since they are a new restaurant.  I'll probably come back and give them another try but will wait for a bit.

Lemme start off by saying that the employees here are super hospitable and friendly. I appreciated them making us feel welcomed and comfortable which is honestly kinda rare in NYC. The fish sisig is not listed on the menu, but we were able to have them serve it for us. Speaking of the fish sisig, it was TASTY and a bit on the saltier side, but it was literally cooked to perfection. Pair that with some rice, and it's the best thing ever. During dinner, we had the halo halo which is a classic filipino dessert. They add ube in theirs which definitely contributed to it being overall more on the sweeter side. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area. However, it can be a bit loud and hype for someone who prefers a quieter place to dine-in at since they have karaoke in the restaurant, but I mean, that just adds to the authenticity of a filipino restaurant. :~)

Took away 4 stars for their reservation screw up.Came here once in early November and really enjoyed the food. Was planning an early holiday gathering with friends in early December so I've made a reservation for kamayan when I was leaving the restaurant.Today I called them to confirm my reservation and found out (a few days before the event) that they " messed up" the reservation. They booked another party with 50 people.Look, I understand if you have a customer that want to book out your restaurant. But at least have the decency to call and notify me earlier. Now I'm scrambling to make alternative plans for 12 people. Food is good here but I wouldn't come back after this experience.
All the foods are really good but over priced. Some of my favorites here are their Kare-Kare, Pork bbq, sinigang and daing na bangus.

The food here is absolutely delicious, my friend Roel Martinez Tumaneng is one of the owners he's been  telling us to come through. Whenever I'm in Woodside I'll stop in, the staff is very friendly and attentive. We just had the best time!!! Thanks Roel!!!

We came here for dinner in a group of 4 on a Monday night. No wait. Well lit with a modern flair, the decor here is much nicer compared to neighboring Filipino restaurants. They even have karaoke! Anyone can go up and sing although I am unsure if there are English song options. Honestly I did found the karaoke to be annoyingly loud. I was there to catch up with friends so naturally I want to be able to hear them talk but the singing and the speakers were SO LOUD. Luckily it was not continuous. We ordered to share: lumpiang Shanghai, pork sisig, crispy pata, large garlic fried rice, chicken adobo, and the halo halo dessert. I actually had Filipino food the day before at Tito Rad's so naturally I am going to compare...- Lumpiang Shanghai: I feel like you can never go wrong ordering this dish. Tasted like little fried egg rolls. I like that it doesn't contain shrimp which I am allergic to. Good, nothing special. - Pork sisig: My favorite dish of the night. I haven't eaten at many Filipino restaurants, probably just like three or so but this is the best sisig I've had. - Crispy Pata: A staple at Filipino restaurants. While pretty tasty, it falls short compared to the crispy pata at Tito Rad's. A little more expensive here, smaller, and just not as flavorful. - Garlic Fried Rice: Always a hit but I did find I prefer the garlic fried rice from Tito Rad's more as I think it's much more garlicky and fragrant. - Chicken adobo: This was very disappointing. Don't get me wrong, the chicken itself was good but it is not your typical chicken adobo. I was hoping for some gravy or delicious sauce to pour over the garlic fried rice but it didn't came with little to no sauce at all! - Halo halo: Another disappointment. Not sure what was all the way at the bottom of the cup but it was sickly sweet. Wasn't a fan. We didn't even finish it and it was shared between four people. That says a lot. Overall I thought this restaurant was just okay. I'm not sure if I would come back honestly. However the calamare gigantes and the baked mussels look pretty darn amazing. So we will see!

As of March 2019 this is the latest Filipino restaurant to hit the block in Woodside NY, 69th Street & Roosevelt Ave. It joins the scene along with long time local favorites like Krystals, Ihawan and Renee's. The interior of Kusina was lovely. Plenty of space inside a long row inside that leads up to a open air kitchen setting which is really cool to see. The inside of this restaurant is a bit more modern to what you're use to seeing amongst the other pinoy restaurants in the area. They even have a full sized bar in the front area (liquor license to be approved by next week - will definitely be coming back for drinks) which is something you also don't see in Woodside. We tried 3 dishes. The Pork Sisig, the Lumpia Shanghai and the Pork Belly Kare Kare. Some classic staples in Filipino cuisine. The Lumpia was what you can expect at most restaurants, definitely a good appetizer portion but a little pricey at $9 for lumpia. The Pork Sisig presented on a sizzling hot plate (classic) was good, but need a hit of extra salt to bring out the flavor more but over all it was porky and has good chewy texture to each bite. Lastly, we tried the Pork Belly Kare Kare (most places will have just Oxtail, but they had a few other options here!). Kare Kare is a type of curry sauce that has a peanut taste to it. This was awesome and it was great to try Kare Kare on something rich but crispy like Pork Belly (you know it's legit when you and feel that crunch on the skin, oh yesss). Everything was great for 2 people. A nice touch at the end of the meal was a complementary dessert of avocado flavor icey (a popsicle you suck on from a plastic container) it was delicious and a nice subtle dessert to have after a dense and rich meal.Overall great place for a date to show them Filipino cuisine or bring a large group like your family! Can't wait to come back next time and try some drinks at the bar.

One of the newer restaurants in the Filipino area of Roosevelt Ave, definitely did not disappoint. The portions are great for the price you pay. I had the spam breakfast, which was great and fulfilling! Also got an order of the lechon kwali, which was ok but can definitely go back and try it again. Washed it all down with a calamansi juice. Service was great and fast.

This is a great Filipino bistro! The food was authentic and delicious. the service was excellent and very friendly staff. Ambience was also nice. You must try the crispy pork kare kare, halo halo and the avocado milk shake.I highly recommend this place.

It's my second time here and because the food tasted really good, I invited more friends to join me. My friends loved everything we ordered (calamares, pork kare-kare, beef sinigang, ginisang monggo, and tripple sampler for dessert) and customer service was exceptional. They also have San Miguel Pale Pilsen beer originally from Philippines and more mixed drinks from the bar. Definitely will go back on our next NYC visit.

My family and I tried this place on the recommendation of the NYT Hungry City column. We came on a Thursday night, it was not packed. The decor and space were nice; the other Filip places nearby are more dumpy/outdated so this is a place nice enough to bring a date.We got the giant calamari starter, the fried pork intestines starter, the mung bean stew, the stewed beef tamarind soup and the pork belly kare kare. The calamari was disappointing; the presentation was impressive but the dish was clearly for the 'Gram. It didn't taste of anything. It arrived dripping with hot oil but was not fragrant. The breading fell off in chunks as soon as we started cutting into it, so eventually we were just left with cooked squid on a stick. Neither the breading nor the squid itself had any flavor other than salty. The fried pork intestines starter was like fried pork skin, except thicker (and therefore harder). The vinaigrette that comes with it helped to cut the grease. The mung bean stew tasted like bacon, similar to how a split pea and ham soup tastes of smoked pork. It had slivers of bitter melon, which was an unwelcome jolt (we're not fans of bitter melon, and it didn't jibe with the flavor profile of the dish as a whole). The stewed beef tamarind soup uses fatty beef shanks, which made the soup base taste very buttery, but the sourness from the tamarind kept it from being too rich. My family thought it was too sour but I liked the tartness. The pork belly kare kare was covered in a sickly rich and slightly sweet peanut sauce that was way too rich. It came with blanched green beans, mustard greens and eggplant slices that went really well with the peanut sauce (better than with the fried pork belly), and came with a pungent and fishy dip similar in texture to XO sauce but with a strong fish sauce taste. It was a weird mix of flavors.The service was attentive and fast, but the food didn't live up to expectations set by the NYT review. The menu was different from other Filip restaurants in Queens, but some of the dishes just didn't work in terms of flavor combos. Things that were very fatty should have had acid to balance. Will not return.

Ate dinner here with a group of friends & we were very happy with the food, service, and overall vibe at Kusina! Our group ordered a little bit of everything and just shared with the table. We came here on a Saturday night around 5pm. It wasn't crowded and they easily accommodated our group of 7. They let us sit at the table even before our entire group arrived. The food arrived in a timely fashion and we were not disappointed with any of the dishes. The restaurant got more crowded as the night went on but they didn't rush us out when we were done with our dinner, which we appreciated. It's always nice to just sit and chat without having the staff try to rush you out. Would definitely recommend Kusina & would come back !

I'm a bit ashamed to say that this was my first time going to an actual Filipino restaurant but it definitely won't be my last! There were so many delicious options on their menu but certainly a lot of meat options so vegetarians/vegans, this may not be the place for you. We ordered two hot plate dishes because who can resist the delicious aroma of meat sizzling on a hot plate?? We ordered the pork sisig, sizzling chicken adobo and the bagnet express. My favorite was definitely the sisig, very flavorful and a great balance of meat and fat in every bite. The flavors of each dish were very unique and very rich. My friends and I finished every last bite of our food! For dessert, I couldn't skip the classic - halo halo. I had asked for ube ice cream but they only had a sort of ube puré. It was sooo good the ube flavor was strong throughout. I had to take off a star for the service, however. The restaurant wasn't very crowded but the wait staff was not very attentive. I had to ask for water twice throughout my meal. All in all, solid place.

I have seen this Restaurant a few times walking by. I looked it up to check it out by Google. I chose this spot for my Birthday. The food was delicious and and I left very full. Mannnnn, was I full. I have it saved in my favorite places to go eat now. I recommend everyone to come and try some Filipino food at Kusina Pino Bistro

FEELS LIKE HOME..I must say that aside from the Best Filipino food that they serve. They have the friendliest staff, Best Chef (Chef Jayson of Adobo Nation) and the most hospitable and friendliest owners (Bong, Dennis, Gelt and Roel). I love them all!!! They are the best! I think that makes this restaurant a hit.. It gives the restaurant a Happy and positive vibe. They would make you feel at home. 5 stars is underrated. I would give them 100% as a rating. From appetizer to main course up to their dessert, I would give a SUPERB rating!! Keep it up Kusina.. This is literally my KUSINA.

Great restaurant! Great atmosphere! A Filipino restaurant I can be proud to take my non-filipino friends. Decor, service and food is top notch! Must try: - Chicken Inatto: very close to inasal, better that HOI. Im from bacolod, so I know.- Sinigang na baka: I love my sinigang sour, the way it's supposed to be and their sinigang delivers! Wag kayo dun sa nagtitipid ng sinigang mix! I'm looking at you lahi, tf yo.- Pork Sisig: perfect balance of meat and fat!  - Kare-kare: never a fan of this dish. Don't even eat my mom's Kare-Kare, yuck! But KUSINA CONVERTED ME. I only eat their kare-kare, vegetables are roasted perfectly. Yum! They make the above food items the best out of the other filipino restaurants I had tried.Other food items I tried:Sizzling adobo 4/5Kaldereta 3/5 sauce is good thoGinataang sitaw at kalabasa 3/5 needs more flavor. Sayang favorite ko pa naman to.Bihon 3/5 it's ayytCant wait for their liquor license and for them to stock up on local beers and hopefully new and interesting cocktails!

First time coming here. Food was delicious and very authentic. The lumpia was probably one of the best I've had in a while. The drink menu was pretty solid. We had the sunshine Manila which was very good. Not to strong but the acidity from the pineapple juice balanced out the taste. The one thing I didn't like was the poor choice of music sometimes. Other than that food and place was astounding would definitely return!!

Kusina Bistro was pretty great. They close later compared to most filipino restaurants on roosevelt avenue, which is convenient for those that are late-dinner eaters. For appetizer, we had the calamares. It was served differently. Never seen gigantic squid on a stick before. Good for "pulutan." Then we got the crispy pork belly kare-kare, recommended by most customers and waiters. I can't comment and that because i'm biased to home-cooked kare-kare  nothing compares. Then we had the bulalo steak, which is another new thing to me. It was like a sizzling bulalo, not your common bulalo soup for the cold weather. It was good, i thought the gravy was tasty, and the meat was mostly fatty so that was the best part. We added binagoongang fried rice - shrimp paste fried rice, which was as expected, salty and savory. I wasn't a big fan of the "sweet" chicken bbq. I didn't like that the sauce was kind of sour. I'm used to the sweet bbq taste. Finally, we had their taho and ube turon. Taho was good but at a steep price ($8.95 for one serving). It was really good, soft tofu was still warm when it was served. I mean nothing compares to taho sold on the streets in the philippines but this was pretty good  The ube turon was interesting, another new thing. We usually just have plantain turon. The ube was super tasty. Lastly, the best part of the restaurant was their service. Their waiters/waitresses were quick, approachable and super funny! I hope they start a comedy bar, would definitely go back for that!
Delicious filipino food, friendly staff specially the girl server. food is reasonably priced. very nice ambiance. they even let me charge my CP while waiting for my aunt.

It was okay Not too great Started off with appetizers, calamari which was good; the baked mussels , it was good as well; had shrimp & vegetables, but it had more vegetables than shrimp; Main course came, started with tilapia in cooked coconut milk... let me tell you, nothing else will give you more stomach upset than this dishThen had garlic rice , which was good ; out came chicken pancit ( which had chicken flavor, like Maggie cube taste ; no chicken in the dish)then came chicken curry ( where spices overpowered the dish); lastly, I was super excited for this; halo halo ... all I can say is bye bye... not what I saw... no vermicelli;no real  fruits  ... highly disappointed grr I had High expectations

Love this place! We were on our way to a different Filipino restaurant but decided to pop in here it was worth it! Definitely a must try. Food was fresh, service was great, and the vibe in this place is just so inviting!

Love this new gem that popped up on Roosie Ave. The sizzling sisig is amazing for a sisig enthusiast and the BULALO STEAK is a must try - soo tender with lots of love and care from the mushroom gravy that it's drenched in.Their avocado milkshake was also perfect - not overwhelming sweet, however, staff were all super sweet! My son really loved the cherry tomatoes that was garnished in the lumpia plate, and so we asked for a little more and they happily brought him out so much more that he couldn't finish them (thanks a bunch guys).Can't wait to come back and try everything else on the menu!
The food is good. The service is excellent. I've been here twice and you can really feel the Filipino hospitality and spirit. I highly recommend.
I've already been here a few times with friends and family. The people are friendly and service is prompt. The homey food is pretty good and consistent. Make sure you leave some space for desserts!
Great service and fun atmosphere. Food is authentic Filipino. I love their Sisig and Kare-Kare! Make sure to drop by if you're in the area.

Ive been here couple of times and i Liked it. But there's this one day where i brought my family with me and 2 dogs. I called them ahead  of time and was told it should be okay. By the time we got there, our table was ready which is near the entrance. Another employee stopped us and say- no its not allowed, Are those service dogs? my brother couldn't answer as he is in the process of  doing those papers. We had to leave. I just think its not appropriate to be saying yes over the phone and then making us leave when we got there!. There were only 2 tables occupied with other customers and then us.  Well! It was there lost for that day--- We are a group of 8.

Fantastic place. Came here on a busy Saturday night and we had a reservation for 10 people. We were seated right away even though most of our party is not there. The staff is very friendly and attentive to your needs. The owner Roel came a few times to check on us to make sure everything is okay. The atmosphere of the place is vibrant and energetic. It's a great place to have a birthday party. There were several that night and the staff all came out to sing happy birthday to the celebrant. There's also entertainment throughout the night. The staff danced with the house music and there was a live band at 930pm. Overall, excellent place. Highly recommended.
Will recommend this place to eat filipino dishes.. Classy and the people are very pleasant

New additional Filipino Restaurant in Queens! Food is really good. I highly recommend the crispy pork belly kare-kare, seafood kare-kare and pancit canton. Great service too. The humidity in the restaurant is my only concern, but no big deal!

I love it all, specially the squid, and Gambas. And I love one of your servers, Leo has amazing people skills and hospitality! Ask for Leo when you come in, he'll definitely make sure you are taken care of!

Tried the sizzling squid today very tasty! I would also recommend the lumpia Shanghai, very crispy and a lot of meat and the service is great as well! Nice, cozy place, this is one of the best Filipino restaurant in NY!

They charge a gratuity/service charge automatically on the bill for 8 or more guests. Which is fine. It's 22% of the bill. They harassed us to give more money on top of the tip they already added to the bill and wouldn't take no for an answer. That said the 22% service charge:automatic gratuity on the bill wasn't a tip but couldn't tell me what it was for. Avoid this place at all costs.  I hope  authorities or IRS see what they are doing and investigate this place . I will def  he reporting them to the better business bureau!!!!
Great clean restaurant, fast service and of course an abundance with food. I have honestly had better food in LA but this will do since it is hard to find authentic Filipino food in New York city.

I decided to try out this new resto in Woodside since my favorite place is closed today. I ordered spicy Laing which is not spicy. It's good but it's not the classic laing that I'm craving for. It's too sweet for me. I also ordered inihaw na liempo (grilled pork belly) which is very disappointing because it's too salty and they put a lot of black peppers. My kids love inihaw but not this one . The Sinigang with crispy pork belly is good but nothing special about it. Overall the price is a bit expensive. Next time I'll stick to my favorite place which is next door. Too bad, they're closed today

Kusina Pinoy Bistro can be considered a ray of hope in the arena of Filipino restaurants in the Woodside (Little Manila) area of Queens, New York.  I went there one Sunday afternoon (3/31/19) for a late lunch. The new restaurant on this Roosevelt  Ave. block is had a nice ambience and interior that appeals. It is "industry design meets classic" aura and one thing that sets its apart from other Pinoy restaurants. It does have the bistro/fine dining vibe.One would also take note of the overall service in this restaurant. It was a busy lunch hour then hence I would understand if staffs were busy but I commend that inspite of that, their "wait service" is focused and all goodvibe and polite. Keep up the goodvibe service!For the dishes served - I ordered Daing na Bangus, Kusina Bistek, had Kape Barako.  Plating was really appetizing when food came, it made me really want to dig in to the food. It was good. I particularly liked the  Bistek!  Anyone who would go here should try their Bistek! It reminded me of how my mom used to make one. I liked endless unlimited coffee - Kape Barako which is truly a taste if the real Philippine coffee brew! Anyone who likes coffee will like this brew, very original. I hope the Kusina management will capitalize in this signature coffee flavor of the Philippines!I was able to try one of their desserts - Crispy Halo-Halo. This is a twist to the traditional mix-mix dessert of the Philippines. One must try this! Again, the plating added excitement on how one perceived flavor and tastes. This was good.The wait time for the food was understandable standard 15minutes. Why? This is a gourmet style Filipino restaurant. They cook food as you order them, not a fast food style establishment! Once you see the food you ordered, you will say wow what a good food presentation. The house chef - is a master of style and creativity that commands good taste and appeals to most delicate epicureans.One item, last but not the least, I see overall the place is well-maintained, clean restaurant..from the main floor and their restroom. Keep it up. One customer will come back knowing the place is clean and organized.This is Kusina Pinoy Bistro, your level up Filipino food restaurant! Any non-Filipino nationals who are in for a good Pinoy food must try and eat at this place!
Great service and delicious, fresh food! Very clean environment, and good music. A must visit if you love Filipino food!

Filipino comfort food made better. I really liked the okoy,  calamare gigantes and tortang talong. All of which tasted familiar yet surprisingly new, also very nicely plated. Do try the dessert sampler to cap off your meal. Fine texture and not too sugary. I highly recommend this place

The calamari gigantes is sooo good. And we really enjoyed the vibe- pumped up karaoke singers celebrating their mom's retirement, someone else getting a birthday performance (jeff is a great dancer), my friend getting a new job!!
Food, portion, price, presentation, ambiance... very good! Awesome job Chef Jason Leonardo Javier and Team Kusina! Definitely a must try Filipino restaurant! Need I say more?

A new hidden gem in the heart of Woodside! What enticed me to go to this place is the price! I thought that it would be expensive, but the prices are very much AFFORDABLE - I feel like I'm at a fine dining restaurant  with cheap rates.  I had tocilog for breakfast and the food is great.  I will certainly go back to try out all the other dishes they have.

Giving this place 5 star because I've been here so many times and they never fail to give an amazing service and good tasting Filipino food! The restaurant is also very spacious and that  open karaoke makes everyone feel at home. Also, I just want to say that the server/waiter Jeff is always on point. He makes sure the table he serves are happy and taken care of!

Awesome service. Servings are more compared to a lot of places around. Best part is that you'll feel home because everyone is vey nice and helpful.  Met the owner Dennis as well and I must say that I haven't been to a place for a while now that the owner actually cared for the customers. Definitely will be back here.  Calamari was good and more than enough for 5 people.  I either like the place or hate the place to have time to write a review here here.   Come check this place out.  We even got a discount first time visit 15% discount without asking for it.  I'm sure they did not have to but awesome gesture from them.

What a wonderful experience at Kusina!  Their staff was dedicated to meeting my needs as a call-in customer for picking up ordered food.  Their awesome calamari gigantes was on my order tonight and you will absolutely look at calamari in a new way!

Ordered sizzling sissig and it came out cold! How is this possible, over priced for the area too, why go here when i can go to Rosario's or the several other options that are far more superior. Order the salted egg dish with noodles and it was flat, no flavor. Crispy chicken skin was also not done well.Good luck guys

Amazing Filipino food with hearty portion sizes! We ordered the pork kare kare, sizzling chicken adobo, pancit bilon, shrimp with salted egg yolk, and a savory mung bean soup. Everything was well seasoned without being too salty. The classics were done well and the more novel dishes were great as well.

Finally tried this new Filipino Restaurant in Woodside and our tummies left very happy! We ordered the sizzling sisig, I'm very happy that it's not salty like how most Filipino restaurants make it. The pork belly kare-kare is good too, the pork is PERFECTLY cooked, I just wish they can put more peanut or peanut butter to the sauce. My daughter had the pork bbq, the moment it was put on the table I already smelled this sweet Filipino style bbq, I knew already that it's good! My daughter gave a thumbs up, boy it was that good! Lastly we tried the trio sampler, halayang ube on top, leche flan in the middle and cassave cake in the bottom! It was sooo good, they're not too sweet so I enjoyed all of them!

To be honest, I've had better filipino food that was not as pricey. Food was okay but not blown away. We had the Kare-Kare, Sinigang, and Tinola. It was definitely more than enough to share amongst 3 people. The dessert was also okay. Quirky twists to filipino desserts but not worth the prices. Avocado shake was literally mashed up avocados on the side of the glass,  shaved ice, and condensed milk. Service was great. Felt well taken care of. Servers are very friendly and attentive. Atmosphere was great and lively. TV is constantly playing filipino acoustic singers or someone is singing on the Karaoke.

Check out this new Filipino restaurant on the Roosevelt avenue Flip block. It has a small entrance and the restaurant is narrow so you might miss it but it's there. this place has been another Filipino spot before but now it's totally different for the better. The staff is great the food is great almost everything is great. I ordered the Kare Kare and lechon kawali.  The good I got it tastes good with meat to vegetable proportion correctly.  Lechon kawali is cooked and flavored well. The service was amazing.  Always keeping your water glass full.  Very attentive. it can get court noisy in here because they do have Free karaoke. Also be careful on your way to the restroom as the small hallway towards the restroom could be slippery.  Otherwise overall great experience and would return there for my next Filipino meal.

Friendly staff, great food and excellent service! I forgotten the taste of Filipino aunthentic coffee and this establishment serves UNLIMITED Barako coffee, having unique pinoy coffee flavor served best with cream.  The atmosphere is relaxing and food is amazing. We will definitely be coming back as this will be my new favorite Pinoy restaurant!
Food is really good and staff are friendly. I love their Halo Halo. Will definitely come back!

Stumbled upon this new establishment as I walked by Roosevelt Avenue looking for a decent place to eat. Not only was I impressed with the friendly staff, I was also impressed with the ambience. The place is very nice and clean. The food presentation itself was appetizing besides being delicious and amazing! Had the Lechon Kawali, Sinampulukan Manok and The Trio Sampler for dessert. All were excellent!! Will definitely come back and recommend to family and friends.
My friend and I had a delivery and ordered Pork BBQ, Inihaw na Liempo, Binagoongan rice, and Turon with Mango. They all tasted good!!! I would love to actually go and have a sit-in meal here.
Nice ambiance! Excellent service! Excellent Filipino dishes with a twist! Original food presentation! Oh la la! Definitely a rising star in Filipino restaurant!

So we came on a Saturday night around 8:30.  The 3 of us walked into a dancing party! At first I thought we walked into a private party the restaurant is throwing and also thought I hope they seat us anyway cuz they have seating way in the front.  When the music stopped, one of the waiters came and said sorry we were dancing and perform from time to time and we were like oh no don't apologize, it was great!  They were great! Such happy staff and I am so glad that we came here.  Now the FOOD, damn the food is delicious.  I used to go to Maharlika and it's gotten way too greasy.  We ordered the fried whole tilapia - yummy.  The palabok is so good, the bone marrow soup is definitely a must on visit from now on and of course pork sisig is not even a question.  Every single dish we ordered was delicious and very reasonable price,  The staff was very nice and attentive, very festive and happy here.  Oh yea there's karaoke too.

The food is pretty good, but it is hot as hell in there.  I literally just stopped eating and left the restaurant.  They had an electric fan that was facing the middle of all the patrons, then decided to face it toward just one table.  Disgusting.

I returned to this restaurant three times and I am liking it more! All the dishes that I have tried were delicious. This restaurant is decent and I do not bring the scent of the restaurant to my next venue!
Great quality food, good service. Nice ambiance. Good restaurant for big groups, family gatherings. We ordered a lot, food looked good and we just started eating.

I thought I was in the Philippines when I tasted my first bite of adobo, lumpiang Shanghai, sisig, Kare-kare and calamares gigantes . They have full-bodied desserts too! One of a kind cozy place to hangout and feels like home with very hospitable staff.

Beef Pochero. To die for. Only place I found in all of NYC that has this!  It's an ilongo dish very similar to spaniard style.  Omg. So good. Crispy pork Kare Kare. Their dishes are totally different from the turo-turo style.  Yes you may save a buck here and there at the other spots, this is priced but big portions you can share one dish 2-3 ppl. The food and ambiance are on point.  Lasang Pinoy for sure!!! So yes you have traditional meets modern.  Sisig is delish there are only 2 places I love it's this place and Sariling Atin.  Also, for a hot day they have different candy ice. I had melon and avocado. Still salivating over it. Coming back for sure. They are fast, humble, service is impeccable. Catering per head is good too.
Enjoyed Karaoke! good ambience - great food and customer service - pleasantly surprised with the fellow customer satisfaction!

I give them 1 star for being nice and polite. But slow. We waited a long time to get our food. And for the place since it's  new and really clean.. But the food was not really as we expect it to be. Big disappointment. Small portions and overpriced. We've never tasted that kind of kare-kare( $17.99) It was very watery and kind of sour. I'm sorry, but it was bland, tasteless and why sour? And it kinda tasted like burnt. The chicken Inato was ok. $ 11.95 for 2 pieces of meat. We ordered dessert that never came. We sat and waited and waited some more till we just gave up and decided to cancel it. If you want a nice ambience for visitors, I would recommend this place but not for the food. Just being honest.

Had a lovely dinner here. We had the fried tilapia in coconut milk, pork belly and pancit bihon. We also had the Lumpiang Shanghai and the chicharron polo. For dessert the trio dessert plate. We got seated right away, they had a high chair for my one year old, open mic karaoke and they kept our glasses of water filled all night. The waiters were super nice and attentive. The fish was yummy, just expect there to be bones. The pork belly was flavorful and they served a moderate amount of it, just enough to be full. The fish and pancit were both big enough to have plenty of leftovers. The Lumpiang was super crispy, nice amount of filling to wrapping ratio and it's definitely enough for at least three adults to share as an appetizer. The chicharron pollo was delicious, super crispy and served with a vinegar dip and lettuce that cuts the heaviness a little. Definitely a perfect portion for two. The pancit was great, the noodles were cooked perfectly and it was not overly oily. But hands down my favorite of the night was the dessert trio. Yummy, ube on top was sweet and creamy, flowed perfectly with the super soft flan in the middle and the dense cake at the bottom, served with light, fluffy and sweet whipped cream and two large strawberries. I would come back just to have that dessert again, perfection!

Im picky with Filipino food because most of the time the way they cook it in restaurants its very oily and salty. Here its just perfect! I was plesantly surprised. The interior is tastefully decorated and service is excellent. Yelpers, you won't be embarrased to bring your friends here who wanna try their first foray into Filipino food... Its like Manhattan ambiance with the price of range of Queens. You can't beat that!
Food is great! Very festive Filipino restaurant. The kare kare and calamari are a must!
The food was great (I recommend the pork sisig) and the prices are alright. No complaints, would definitely return!

A little pricey and they serve small portions only .. the ampalaya Con carne needs a little improvement in cooking.. maybe shouldn't be baked one suggestion: cook same as the original recipe but add small portion of coconut milk and serve inside coconut head...saw this in one hotel in Manila... the bangus sisig is too little portion for 14$... if I would have known I'll be paying 14$ for maybe 1/2 of whole fish then I should have ordered fried bangus... the sisig they included chopped skin which shouldn't be... that's why I only give 3 stars coz of good service
Great atmosphere, great service, amazing food! You can never go wrong with the Kare Kare or Sisig Bangus!
The food was outstanding. The atmosphere was very comfortable and welcoming. Kare kare was delicious!

Feels like I am home!!!! Filipino cuisine with a twist  i love it specially the best seller Calamares gigantes, adobong fried balut match it white rice, tinalong manok, palabok with an amazing tasty twist that will really make you keep coming back and so many choices of food!! Followed by desserts I recommend cassava with ube, taho and halo-halo! Well apparently its my very big cheat day that i had to eat so much!! Very nice ambience and you can sing karaoke too that makes it feels like home

I see that this is a fairly new place which explains the fact that this place was the most quiet Filipino I've been in by far (which I personally enjoy most of the time). I took my boyfriend here to try a more variety of Filipino food and we had ordered nilagang baka, tortang talong and sisig. The orders came relatively fast to our table knowing that we were the only people there seated so we thought that it would take a while. The nilaga was honestly pretty decent. It wasn't too bland not too salty, I just wish they had put some type of black pepper grinder/shaker on our take because I would've enjoyed it more with some pepper to balance it out more. There was a generous amount of beef and vegetables (some Filipino restaurants  I've gone to literally would give 4 cubes of beef). The tortang talong was my boyfriends favorite. It was very tender and the filling was so nice on the palate. There was no problem finishing that dish. Last but not least, the sisig... wow. I love sisig and this place delivered. Again, a generous size and the meat was very tender and the raw egg one top sealed the deal. I payed a pretty hefty bill for these 3 items but was pretty worth it. The employees were very friendly and made sure we were comfortable (despite the fact we were the only ones there). I actually forgot my card at this restaurant and called them to see if they had seen it. They found it and kept it safe for me for when my boyfriend picked it up (thank you again!) This place serves overall great Filipino food when you want to out and not at your Filipino mom and dad's kitchen.

Im soooo happy nice service very nice people i couldnt even take pics of the food cuz it was so delicious ... Everything is clean and has a really nice vive ... Got the avocado with milk as a dessert complements of the house i am so happy ... Definitely coming back
Loved their Tofu Sisig & one of the best Filipino restaurants because of their customer service !

About once a month, I like to take a short subway ride to Woodside for a Filipino breakfast. I was planning on going somewhere else but saw that this place just opened. I stopped in and did not regret it. For a buffet, food was fantastic. Corned beef that didn't look like it came from a can, tapa almost as good as my mom (no one will ever make better tapa), tasty longanisa, arroz Faldo. Filipino coffee. And all for $15. Staff is great. Friendly, eager to please. Hopefully this restaurant has better luck than the last 2

My family and I went here since I was craving some good Filipino food. We usually go to another restaurant just around the corner, but since it was already closed for the night, we decided to try this new restaurant out and we were not disappointed! The prices were reasonable for the amount of food we got. My Filipino blood loves a good pork BBQ on a stick, and their sauce for both the pork and chicken were phenomenal. However, as I was giving my mom a piece to try, she noticed that the pork looked under cooked. The staff was very accommodating and took care of it immediately, but honestly I think we were just very cautious and over reacted since it wasn't our go-to Filipino restaurant. I had already eaten most of the stick and I didn't even get sick the next day. The staff and manager were very nice and accommodating even though I made them go through a lot for no reason!! Definitely would go there again when we have impromptu dinner plans.

I highly recommend Kusina Pinoy Bistro for dining in and for hosting a larger event. Kusina recently hosted our annual fundraiser for 50 guests and they did an amazing job! They provide a preset buffet menu with a wide variety to choose from and include coffee, tea, sodas and dessert. The food was excellent. All of our guests raved about the food especially the sisig, lumpia and veggie dishes. Everything was good. The chef also made a special dish for a guest based on their dietary restrictions. We were pleasantly surprised by this and our guest also commented that really enjoyed their dish. They also provided our guests with containers/bags to take the leftover food to go!  The restaurant also included table cloth (we chose the colors) and a center piece. Everything looked so nice! The staff was incredibly attentive and our guests also had positive reviews about the staff. Everyone was so nice. The water glasses were constantly refilled and the food was consistently replenished. They had everything set up for us upon arrival! As the organizers, we were a bit late due to traffic however when we arrived, everything was set up and there was nothing to worry about.  They also assisted us in placing our finishing touches. Karaoke is included which was a big bonus for entertainment. Booking is seamless and easy. We cannot wait for our 2020 event and look forward to booking with them again! Thank you for everything!

Eating Filipino my entire life, both at home and at restaurants, I can easily say that the food here is excellent. The pork susig had a pleasant kick to it and the pork belly kare kare had a delicate balance of salty and savory.  The service was also on point - staff were attentive and friendly.  Would definitely recommend this place to everyone wanting to eat Filipino food!

Staffs here is so welcoming and nice they let us in at 10:30pm even though they close at 11pm we're from VA and we dont know the city well, we got lost on the way to House Of Inasal but they told us that they we're close but this place accepted us even though they close in short time they let us eat in til we we're satisfied, food was great, fast service and felt like a real filipino restaurant.. they even stayed til 12:30am just to let us rest and finished our food.

Not the the typical Filipino Restaurant that you can find in Woodside, Queens. The place is cozy, the food were great specially the  crispy pork belly karekare, pork sisig and the Calamari Gigante. All of the food we ordered were soooooo delicious.

This is one of the best restaurants in Astoria. Without a doubt you'll be happy you came or in this case happy you ordered! Please visit their site and order for pick up or delivery!! Chris has able to assist and you get these delicious dishes in a timely manner. The fried chicken sandwich, creamy amazing Mac and cheese and award winning burnt ends are worth your time and money!!! Seriously a hidden gem in Astoria especially if you like good

Had a lazy Sunday and ordered from Butcher Bar for delivery. We could not have made a better decision. The meat candy sandwich was mind blowing, the smoked and fried wings are some of the best in Astoria, and the street tacos were really great (recommend getting them spicy style). To top it off, a jar of the jalapeño margarita to wash it all down on a hot summer night was delicious, more than enough for two and traveled great. Highly recommend and will for sure be ordering again.

Hubby and I haven't ordered out since the start of the stay at home order in March and finally decided to get some take-out from here. We ordered the brisket, philly cheese sandwich, mac & cheese, corn bread & fries. It did not disappoint! All the food was delicious, delivered hot and quick. It was worth the wait and we will definitely be ordering from here again soon.

Was walking by the place on an errand completely by chance.  Figured "what the heck" and walked in.Pictured here is the set up they have:  you walk in, after either ordering in advance or on the spot, and they serve you up the same insanely tasty food for the same reasonable prices.On a pure whim, I went in and asked for a serving of their insanely good candied meat.  They said "sure", and also supplied a side of cake which was really tasty and not too heavy at all, which I devoured at home.Absolutely planning on coming back on a weekend for a larger order.  Very happy they're still going strong despite everything happening now.

Their staff are taking frequent breaks to go outside and talk closely with people not wearing masks or social distancing. Then staff go back in and continue work. Very troubling and puts everyone's health in danger. Literally just ordered food and witnessed at least two employees doing this. PANDEMIC ISN'T OVER.

I look at our receipt and we are charged double for our cocktails.I understand during the pandemic that things take longer...but a promised text that your order is ready,should come through.I call a few times,his hearing aid battery dies.Also..after 90m and a me calling back 2x they did not have 2 of the meats that I had ordered long ago(so,why not call me since I never got the text to say our meal was done.)Ok,fine.Now..our food is cold and prices do not add up.I speak to Christina the manager and she tells me that she has pulled our receipt after asking for the number at the top which I gave her..She tells me the monies will be refunded to my cc within 24-48 hours.Great,what is your name just incase something happens.She states that she is the manager,I thank her.Sweetheart reads my lips and points out that we paid cash..WTF,SO I CALL BACK AND ASK WHAT CARD DID YOU PULL UP AND REMOVE THIS FROM?WHAT CC ARE YOU REMOVING THE MONIES FROM?She said she "literally" I guess not figuratively..just got in and this was her 1st call of the day.What does that have to do with anything,I get my food was cold(2 hour wait,was told about 45..I despise cold food but was starving)..I get it takes longer because of the pandemic but to overcharge too..and say you took it off a card that was never there!?Would we have gotten better service if it was the last call?We drove all the way from LI because we had a nice experience the first time.This was a terrible experience.You would think w no table service, the to go would be absolutely perfect.I wonder if this is the same Christina as our 1st time,because she was great.I can say this was the longest I have been in our truck in awhile..sitting waiting then that.My Sweetheart is an essential worker and earns his every dime to not even get an apology or something.UPDATE HAD SWEETHEART LOOK AT THE RECEIPT AGAIN....I WAS NOT SURE OF THE PRICE OF OUR PLATTER,WE WERE DOUBLE CHARGED FOR THAT.I WILL POST A PIC WHEN I HAVE IT IN HAND AGAIN.I just called and left a message,hopefully I will get a call back to rectify this situation. All I can say is "WoW"..with a frown.Update at 3:49:no call from the restaurant to rectify this and not wanting to be the 1st call of anyones day again(ya,she said that.),I will politely call back later..I hope that this is nicely rectified and promptly.I know they read their YELPS I WAS TOLD BY STAFF MEMBERS WHEN WE HAD SAT IN AND ENJOYED OURSELVES.DAMN SHAME..I WAS REALLY LOOKING FORWARD TO THAT MEAL.now again...would you not call and atleast apologize for poor service?I hate ice cold pork that is just ew

During these days of covid-19 and after staying home for weeks and watch a whole bunch of videos about food and bbq i was craving some bbq. With that being said i gotta add i lived in Charlotte NC and i go there on the regular basis at least twice a year to visit family and friends meaning that i know what good bbq is. If you don't know which are the main hubs and style for proper bbq in america, do your own due diligence please. So, my wife decided to find a spot for bbq and we came across with this one in Astoria and give it a try. We went for the basics, brisket , pulled pork, ribs, burnt ends.... Sides, slaw, cornbread. Brisket was decent, but not juicy as is supposed to be. Pulled pork could use more flavor and surprisingly the burnt ends (the super smoked and cooked ends of the brisket) we lacking that "zing" that they must have. It was like the if it was reheated. Portions were good for 3 at a tab of $60 worth of food. (1/2 pound of each). And plenty of cornbread too.Again, to be completely fair i'd give them another try once we are able to be release to the wild again if that would happen. But if you haven't had bbq any where else and you want to start this is a good entry point. Is city bbq and is understandable. I definitely will give them another try once we get released to the wild again, and try them at their location for the full experience if the powers that be allow it.

After much debate of eateries walking the again-filled streets of Astoria, I landed on Butcher Bar. I had really high hopes of this place but sadly I was disappointed by my sandwich. I went with my go-to at any BBQ place, a classic brisket sandwich and they couldn't get that right.I follow the rules "phone eats first," and I should've known from the get that this was going to be meh. First bite in, it tasted like something you would eat at a Beefsteak Trick-Tray fundraiser. I couldn't finish the sandwich and I had to wash down my bite with their Berry Frosé - which is their savior of a one-star review.Sadly, I won't be back but since I left hungry I was able to find a solid restaurant nearby.

I would give this place a 0 if I could. I advise you to look at the way this business responds to Yelp reviews. They do not respect any criticism and consider anything negative a rumor or fake news. Such an unprofessional business. Please listen to customers who are warning you that there are staff who don't wear masks and people do not always social distance here. It doesn't matter if the food is great. There are many restaurants in NYC who make delicious food and still respect their customers' health and safety or at least have the decency to reply professionally.

Sorry Tommy ....Three Stars at best !!! Arrived early Saturday night at 4:45 pm and lucked out got a parking spot right in front !!!( don't forget to feed the meters 1 hour max )The restaurant had just a few tables when we arrived so we were greeted & seated immediately....Nicely decorated dining room very comfortable along with a nice bar .... Our waitress Christine was very friendly and gave us good service throughout our meal ...Starters; Two orders of their Candy burnt ends, would have been 5 stars but they were  served at room temperature..... ( we were starving like Marvin )Fried pickles; were also very good but they too were served warm at best .... Full Rack Of Dry Rubbed Ribs; we opted for the dry rubbed not sauced we added our own Bbq sauce. The ribs were nice & meaty & tender but for me there was a very strong cumin spice which was over powering ..... a Lil too much for me.....They too were also served at room temperature...Beef Brisket; we ordered one pound to share between the four of us; again it was good, sliced thin not fatty at all & very tender .. just for me not peppered enough .... The Brisket was also served at room temperature...Sides; Brussels sprouts with bacon 2 orders, for me they were the star of the show along with the Candy burnt ends ....I did see a lot of tables eating huge burgers  stacked high .... and pulled pork sandwiches that looked delicious..... Tip; tell your waitress to make sure your food comes out hot .... Still my favorite BBQ Joint  is Hometown Bar-B-Que in Red Hook Brooklyn ..... they never disappoint !!!

Atmosphere - 5Value - 5Service- 5Food - 5As soon as I walked in, I smelled the savory aroma of meat. This place was jam-packed upon entry; super popular even on a weekday (better to arrive sooner than later). I had to try their "infamous" meat candy which were, hands-down, the most delicious and tender burnt ends I've had so far. It's a shame their appetizer is only 1/4 pounds or else I'd easily take 3 pounds or more. Even better, our waitress Irene made the dining experience very pleasant and seamless. Our food arrived quickly and she made great small talk. I can't recommend Butcher Bar or Irene enough.

My job got an order from here and everything tasted a bit off in my opinion. Or slightly spoiled like the sauces were old. The Coleslaw was bland but my only real issue is the fact that their fried pickles are horrendous. They were really old. Over fried or possibly even refried. I've never seen someone butcher fried pickles so bad. They weren't even edible. It was just hard and old. I likely won't return.
Is not as great as Joe Brown.Maybe one day I go inside and seat and maybe that will change my mind

I get we are in weird times, which is why as a very good customer I came back for curbside 4 times before finally deciding to not come to you again. I won't even go into everything but you guys gave me "burnt ends" that had not one piece of "burnt" on it and looked like it was boiled gray meat. Garbage. The person who put this together 100% knew she didn't put one burnt end in the container. A whole container of bare grey fat pieces. Whoever did this hates their job, I feel that is a sign of them trying to get you a bad review.

Great draft selection. During brunch happy hour, ALL their draft beers are $6. We ordered 1/2 lb of burnt ends with a side of fries and salad. The burnt ends were delicious with a perfect balance of lean and fat. The texture was very soft. It was probably marinated prior. I'd day skip the fries and salad. The fries were extremely salty. The side salad was just a waste of money. I really enjoyed the bbq with beer.  Service was very friendly. They have nice outdoor seating.

Mmm, perfect for those summer nights when you just wanna grab a beer with your friends & chow down on some southern comfort food. Meat goes by weight but prices are worth it.Came here with my friends, just for a casual dinner. Food definitely hit the spot. All the meats we had were moist & satisfying.If I could, I would've just rolled home...

A popular and crowded spot on weekends and most weekday nights, but rightfully so. Not much room to wait though. Indoor decor is appropriate for the bbq/bar scene.  Came here a couple of times and ordered the platter, which is very filling (I always need to bring home the leftovers no matter how hungry I arrive). Warning: if you come here with a Groupon, you cant order the ribs or steak entrees (or the pork platter since it has ribs in it). Well, technically you CAN order them but it just wouldnt count toward the Groupon amount. Just a fyi

Such a great way to spend Sunday brunch! Christine and the full service team were incredible, friendly and overall amazing! Can't wait for our next visit! Hot Tip: Get the Steak & Eggs. You won't regret it!

This place was wack! Came here on a Tuesday night with the hubs as I was in the mood for some BBQ. We got the fried pickles which were cut super thin and fried to a crisp, when u took a bite you could not taste the pickle. I ordered the burnt ends which were cold dry and tasted like nothing. The hubs ordered the smoked rib which waitress said was smothered in sauce. The ribs also came out cold / room temp and they were not smothered in sauce AT ALL. I am never coming here again!! Save your money and tip!

Butcher Bar is a tasty meat centric restaurant in Astoria. They delivered during this global pandemic so really I can't do anything other than praise them for that and wish them well!The food was all tasty. The "cheesesteak sandwich" or whatever it is called was a far cry from a cheesesteak of any variety but it hit the spot. Just don't get it if you're hoping for a legit cheesesteak (something sadly NYC is lacking in generally speaking). All in all, recommended!

I walked into this place because I was meeting a group of friends for a birthday dinner. As soon as I walked in, most people were frustrated because of how long they've waited for food or how many times their order had to sent back. So that wasn't a great start..But I'd rather go off of my experience. When I got there, the staff was pretty attentive to me but apparently they weren't to everyone else in the party. I ordered a jalapeño margarita, it was very tasty - I liked it a lot and I'd totally recommend it.The food: I ordered the mopped & chopped brisket sandwich. My 3 stars are based on the food. This was not anywhere near the best bbq. My sandwich was moist and saucy but there was a lack of flavor- real bbq flavor. The tiny sides look cheap and terrible on the plate. The cole slaw - not good. The corn bread: reminded me of cafeteria cornbread. Price: the price was pretty expensive for what we had. It was $50 for two medium sized sandwiches and my margarita plus they give themselves 20% tip already built in (so maybe that's why staff lacks attention)All in all, I felt the staff was very kind to me personally but the food here needs to change for me to come back. If I'm ever in Astoria for some reason, craving a marg, I'd come back.
Every meal I've had here has been amazing! Best BBQ in Astoria! The service is always so quick & friendly!

My husband and I came here on a Friday night and surprisingly, it wasn't too packed. There's a parking lot a block away which is convenient given how quickly the parking can fill up around the area. We were able to be seated right away and the service was quick and excellent. We ordered a beer each and they were out in what felt like 2 minutes. We ordered the Meat Candy, or burnt ends, which is their specialty-- very tender, lots of flavor, and definitely worth it. I ordered the Animal Burger which was also packed with flavor because of their sauce. I definitely recommend it. My husband ordered the St Louis-style ribs which he said were pretty okay & could have been meatier. We also ordered their Apple Pie Moonshine (something like that) cocktail which tasted like a legit apple pie in liquid form and I would definitely have more than one of those if I didn't have to drive home.

We were craving BBQ and thought this would be the place to go--I got the half a rack of sauced ribs with mac and cheese as a side and he got the blue plate with brisket, fries, and mashed potatoes. He asked for some of the fatty brisket, but the waitress said they only served lean brisket (which is unfortunately if you wanted to have a choice). We then thought about getting something else--the waitress suggested the burnt ends because that's what they are known for. She said she could provide them as in an appetizer size. The burnt ends were worth it. I would say though out of both of our meals, I would come back for the fries and mac and cheese--not the meat. I wonder if I asked for dry ribs, I would have had a different experience--the sauce was salty and did not go well with the ribs.

I went to Butcher Bar and I didn't know what to expect. I went because of all the rave reviews on Yelp so I had to check it out. When I entered the atmosphere of the restaurant was great especially the servers who were so friendly and very knowledgeable about everything on the menu.The appetizer that I ordered was their infamous meat candy which is 1/4 lbs of their award winning double smoked beef burnt ends (limited supply daily). Also I ordered from the carvery section - a bunch of meats such as the smoked pork belly, smoked and pulled pork, smoked beef brisket, and mashed potatoes with gravy. Don't forget to check-in to get a free side. I really want to go back to try the other items on the menu from the different sections such as the smoked ribs, butcher platters, and other appetizers.

This place is absolutely amazing for those with huge meat cravings. The staff are attentive and food is no-frills delicious. The meat candy is amazing (limited amount each day, call in to check if they're still available), the brussel sprouts crisp, and the corncakes a perfect way to break the heavy meaty tastes. We ordered the butchers platter and could not finish the fries!

Best place for brunch! Cozy environment, great food, and amazing staff. The food is so perfectly flavored that even when you're full, you cannot stop eating! The drinks menu had a variety of options, offering a happy hour price for certain drinks.

We came back again for brunch (great Groupon deal I couldn't pass up). The brunch burger was delicious and the side salad had a great dressing. The eggs Benedict while poached perfectly was disappointing as the country sausage looked and tasted just like Banquet brown and serve and the hollandaise sauce didn't have much flavor. However, the side salad was really good! The service is always really friendly and I can't complain for paying $16 for $40 worth of food.

We had such a great time.  It was my first time here but it's been on my list for a minute.  The food and service we're amazing.  Chris, Emily and Daisy were such a great team of servers. This food, the service, the great atmosphere, you must come here.  There is municipal parking a block away from here and street parking as well.P.S. check out Groupon for their deal

I'm a regular here for dinner and I've had most of the menu at this point. Their brunch menu looks awesome and I'll post another review once I've tried that. The burgers are solid and appetizers are fantastic. The only thing I've had that I didn't love was the steak, but I'm not much of a steak person I guess. The PBLT is my favorite sandwich, and either the Mac and cheese or 5 bacon is my favorite burger, I can't pick one. The Mac and cheese by itself though from the starter options though is amazing, definitely order that. The side of Mac is ok but is not as good once you've had the full version. The salads are consistently good, but come out looking slightly different each time (like sometimes avocado is diced, sometimes is sliced ‍). I've uploaded lots of pictures
Looks really cool inside and the service is pretty nice.  Food was okay and my friend and i weren't fully satisfied but it wasn't horrible.  I'll try again another time and hopefully it's better!

**GOUPON MEAL**Stepped in for an early dinner around 5pm on a Friday mid-March. It's a small room with the usual southern decorations filled w/ fairly new looking furniture. We were immediately greeted with a smile and seated with menus by the host, the room was 2/3 full with diners. Menus, water, condiments and utensils were placed right away. I found it awkward to be seated at the first two tables that were part of a row in the middle of the room. Later on, the room apparently got too hot so the front door was opened and had us feeling cold from the draft coming directly at the middle row tables by the door. The waitress said we can order anything on the menu except the alcoholic drinks to be included in our Groupon. We ordered :Garlic broccoli - tasted great! Not too heavy on the garlic, and broccoli done just right. Mac&cheese - on the creamier side, not cheesy at all, enjoyable except Mac could be softer.Chicken tacos - pulled chicken on the dry side, veggie / sauce topping made the whole bite good.Burnt beef ends - pretty good, less fibrous, really soft - maybe too soft texture almost mushy. Expected to be more burnt? 'Mama' chicken sandwich - only took a bite of the chicken tender piece since friend said it wasn't worth the whole bite. Good level of spice, tender, but nothing special.Beef brisket - little to none smoked flavor, so dry!Cole slaw - surprisingly delicious. Crunchy, fresh, not soaked like usual slaw.Cornbread - soft, not grainy, and sweet. Mediocre taste.Mexicane orange soda - mix between tang and regular orange soda w/less fizz.Lemonade - not to tangy, not too sweet. Just right and thirst quencher. Apple cake - not your usual apple pie. Warm, soft-almost doughy, not too sweet, tasty apple pieces. In the beginning all went well with a pleasant welcome and super friendly waitress. The room was getting packed and we started to notice patrons waiting with a face of impatience. Didn't take long for our food to come after ordering but I later realized there was only one waitress on the floor! 14-16 tables being served by 1 person?? Funnily enough, food inspectors had arrived for their inspection during this time. This pretty much jammed up everyone's service because that one waitress was chosen to guide the inspectors. A second girl had taken her place but service went downhill.The food wasn't all that. Price to portion ratio is within standards. Taste not so much. We  enjoyed the sides more than the entrées. Even if the inspector situation didn't happen, service was unsatisfactory. After inspectors left, both waitresses were on the floor but getting a lemonade took over half hour. Trying to waive them down for additional orders and finally asking for the check was a real challenge. Poor waitresses were stretched thin trying to tend to everyone in the room. I really want to give this place 4 stars, I really do. The Groupon deal is great for this place, I wouldn't come back here otherwise. Hit or miss.

We ordered two popular sandwiches. One was really tender, but I didn't like the brisket thing that much. but both were good tho. Food was fairly authentic to real southern BBQ. We were just looking for a snack so we ordered brisket. I would go again if given the chance. Friendly and fun staff! The food is good too!

We came her on a Saturday afternoon many but around 5pm there was no wait . We had the mac and cheese appetizer which was delicious!!! And we had the queso which was blah (so-so) . The drinks were superb I had the berry good time and my fiancé had the Texas cooler. I had a bacon burger which arrived to me without bacon after informing the Waitress she apologized and gave me the option of getting a whole new burger which would take 20 min or a side of bacon which will take 5 mins of course I chose the side of bacon but by the time it came out I was over it I could barely fit the bacon in the burger my bread started getting soggy. My fiancé had the 50/50 burger he said he liked it he also said that the beans and coleslaw were good. When we arrived the presented the waitress that we checked in through yelp and got a free side we each checked it so we each got a free side however on the bill only one came off, but to rectify the situation the waitress gave us two free moonshine shots valued at 7$ each so we didn't make a big deal for the 4.99 that the fries cost. I would go here again I would also recommend it to others
Ok so it's official Butcher Bar #1 on my list!!! They have amazing food and service Christina B. makes my experience there awesome every time even with this pandemic it was a cool!

We came here around 4:45pm on a Saturday night and there was plenty of seating available. We were greeted immediately and seated right away. The menu had lots of choices including meat platters, salads, and burgers/sandwiches. My friends and I decided to split the platter which came with choice of three meats (we did pulled pork, pulled chicken and beef brisket) and three sides (chose Mac & cheese, cheese fries and bacon Brussels sprouts). There was plenty of food on this platter for three people. I felt the meat was somewhat dry but my favorite by far was the Brussels sprouts with bacon - SO delicious! Our other friends ordered a platter which included the burnt ends which they said were really good and if I were to come back I'd want to try those. Our waitress was really nice and overall we had a great time

Really expected this place to be great based on the 4 star rating with over 1,900 reviews plus the hype it was getting from friends that picked it....but it fell short. For starters, the beer I ordered was no longer being served (but was one of the 10 being advertised), the food took almost an hour to come out (the place was probably 1/4 filled. Not busy at all), AND when the food finally did come the order was wrong. So needless to say I was not too happy with the first impression. -Smoke House BBQ Burger: 3/5, it was alright. The burger itself was like any other burger with bbq sauce on it. I've gotten burgers before with pulled brisket or pork on top so I was excited thinking this was the same, it was not. Instead it was two slices of very mediocre brisket slapped on top of the burger. This was my mistake as I thought it would be pulled not sliced. -Beef Brisket: 2/5, honestly shocked at how underwhelming the brisket was here. Very dry, with not much flavor. -Mac & Cheese: 4/5, thankfully this was great and saved the meal. For $6 I had high hopes which were met by this side. Great flavor. Overall, had I gone into this place not knowing about all the hype and hearing everyone rave about it I would've thought it was just another BBQ joint. After eating here though I personally feel that I would not return. The food and the experience were both subpar and I've definitely had much better BBQ food at other spots. Still glad I gave this place a shot though.
Wow, what a place. Great food, great BBQ, good portion at a affordable price. Everything was great. You need to try the burnt ends, delicious. Awesome environment, friendly staff, great food. A+

I've been wanting to try this place out for a while now. So the day finally came- boyfriend and I stopped in for brunch... and it was so good! We both got the brunch burger. Definitely a good choice. The burger was juicy and amazing. The home fries it came with were some of the most flavorful home fries I've ever had. And the salad was also nice as well. We loved their sauces and would mix it with the habanero and try it with everything on our plate.The brunch also comes with a drink! I ordered a Bellini and my boyfriend ordered a mimosa. Both were delicious. They have a brunch happy hour (I unfortunately forgot the times) but it's $6 each for the brunch drinks, after the one that comes with brunch. We enjoyed our meal and I definitely want to come back to try dinner!
Wonderful experience with the family. Delicious food and server . Christine great waitress.

Got a table outside for 2. We got gimme the beef platter with burnt ends and brisket with 1 side of Mac and cheese. Mac and cheese was amazing! Burnt ends could have been less fat and more lean. Brisket was a little dry. Over all a filling meal and I would get it again. 5/5 service.

Really impressed with butcher bar presentation  and quality of food during this pandemic. I wanted to order something different and introduce my friend to burnt ends. Luckily for me  butcher bar did not disappoint. They were delicious and fall apart in your mouth good. Although the only option was delivery the food still came out fresh and hot. They even included the complimentary apple slice which was nice. Thank you for giving me the same experience I receive in restaurant at home. We will be ordering again soon.

I recently went her for lunch with a group of friend first we order the jalapeño margarita it was so delicious we all had 2each great prices! Then we order the brisket the seasoning was good but dry that was a turn down for us but since we complained they gave us a half of order it was a bit better. I order for my daughter fries & chicken fingers the chicken was so salted that she didn't wanted to eat it! Also order the Mac & cheese with cheese quesadilla very disappointed even the presentation was bad! The adults order were good can't complain! The service was really good the space is nice and open it is busy on weekends! But we didn't wait long for a table!

I want to like the place, but the brisket and ribs just not pleasing hungry palate, brisket was bland and the ribs was dry! came here on a Friday night w group of 5, wait was long and my friend insisted on waiting, so by the time we got the table 40 minutes later, everybody was starving, and we ordered whole bunch of varieties, my whiskey based drinks were so water down that i can barely taste the whiskey in it, the place is loud, service is brief, we had to hail our servers over couple of times, the only think i remember was decent was the bacon we ordered, that was crispy and delicious!

First off, thinking openly, they need more servers or more attentive ones. Was missed quite a bit. I came with my partner here for lunch on a Saturday and it was pretty busy. They first sat us down in the corner and seeing as we were forgotten for the first 15-20 minutes trying to order we asked to move tables hoping to be seen more. (Someone took that corner seat after and also had trouble getting someone to take their order) We ordered forth lb. of brisket, a pulled pork sandwich & fries all like warm. Both of our meat dishes were a little dry, maybe an overcooked batch? Not that bad though, wont complain since it my first time here. I guess the best thing were the fries. Seasoned and lightly fried.  Decently priced.P.s. Also took 10 minutes to get my check and another 10 to find someone to take it..... and another 15 to get my change. Had to ask someone to re-check on that.Again, it was a bit busy so keep that in mind!

I've been living in Astoria for years now, and finally decided to eat at this supposed neighborhood staple. We visited after the dinner rush in a weeknight, and I noticed that our waitress had a friend come into the restaurant, which normally would not be anything to write about. However, after our waitress "took" our order (i.e. tried to memorise it), she then proceeded to have a lengthy conversation with her friend as she was putting our order into the register. So of course, our order came out wrong! She messed up our drink order, forgot to add the extra honey butter for our cornbread, completely forgot an entire entree, and put in the wrong order for ribs. She was completely unapologetic about it, and even had a bad attitude when we pointed out what was missing.Oh, and these ribs... apparently the "Fall of the Bone" St. Louis-style ribs are nothing more than the dry-rub ribs with BBQ sauce poured on top. Anyone with an inkling of barbecue knowledge knows that St. Louis-style ribs are supposed to be finished on the grill with sauce, and not just have the sauce simply poured on the top afterwards.
