And they certainly were not falling off the bone at all!Horrible waitress and bad bbq ribs. At least the mac & cheese and garlic broccoli were decent - hence 2 stars...

Came here due to groupon coupon. Please read the fine print.. the coupon excludes steak and ribs!!!! Kind of odd since bbq restaurants specialties should include ribs. I tried the burnt ends and briskets and both tasted like it was oven baked. I was especially disappointed with the brisket which was so dry and bland. The burnt ends were flavorless and limp. The burgers were ok. The chili and fries were too salty, however the mashed potatoes and corn bread were really good. Our server was great.Wow!! Read the response from the restaurant, folks. Am I ranting and raving? Do this sound like a restaurant I'm willing to return to? Kathy, learn from other's reviewer's constructive criticism. We're not haters or ranting/raving 3 yr olds or have personal vendetta.

I ordered the "smoked and fried" wings, burnt ends, and mac and cheese. First, all of the food got here cold. When you pay for $40 worth of food you would hope they would be considerate to actually send warm food. The wings were tough to eat. You had to pull on it and basically what they sent was old/stale wings that were sitting there then threw some sauce on it and then put it to be delivered. The burnt ends had good smoke on it but were over cooked and fell apart. The bark parts were hard to where you could have broken a tooth. Lastly, the mac and cheese had no taste and tasted as if  no effort was put in to make it. Tasted like they took the macaroni out the box and boiled it and threw it in to be delivered. Plus it was macaroni with no cheese, NO FLAVOR OR TASTE, and a dash of paprika. Do yourself a favor, save yourself some money and just go elsewhere. One of the worst meals I have had.
Loved everything, but the mashed ! They a had soapy taste and lack of butter and salt/pepper.

Such a great small restaurant in Astoria! The employees here look so happy and are the nicest workers I've ever encountered! The music was great, loud enough to jam low enough to listen to my boyfriend. The beef platter was amazing loved how they didn't put sauce on it and I was able to do that myself. I'm absolutely obsessed with their brussel sprouts it was sooo delicious I must learn the recipe!!! I however am giving it a 4 star because while the steak was soft and easy to cut into it had no seasoning and lacked flavor. For 30 dollars I would expect it to be super flavorful and juicy. The key lime pie was just pudding with graham crackers on it too. I will still be coming back however because those burnt beef ends were fire !

My friend and I stumbled upon this spot because the original spot we wanted to go to was closed. I'm so glad it was closed because this bbq spot was delicious.  We went during the week around noon and they have a Blue Plate Special: pilled xhixken, pulled pork or brisket along w two sides for DRUMROLL PLEASE! $10!!!!!! When we got our plates we were amazed with how much food there was! I got the brisket and it was so soft, I didn't even need the knife to cut it! This is definitely felt an authentic bbq spot! I will definitely be coming back for brunch and to try that 50/50 sandwich ! Service: from the moment we walked in the service was excellent. The server was on her A game! I didn't catch her name but she had blond curly hair.

The true definition of a hole-in-the-wall. This place is amazing! I ordered the baked mac and cheese, the skirt steak and mash. My boyfriend ordered  the ribs.The mac and cheese is to die for!! The steak was just as amazing, soft and buttery, as well as the ribs. Definitely going back :)

Nice chillout place for summer nights. I went there on super bowl Sunday. The environment is really cozy and the customer service is fantastic as well. I got the pulled BBQ chicken sandwich and the meat in the burger was very juicy and tender. Can't rave enough about the food and the interior!

First time here! - super friendly staff - FREE SIDE WITH CHECK IN - COMPLIMENTARY BOMB ASS APPLE CAKE for dessert - great cocktail list- quick service - The Mac and cheese I didn't LOVE the sauce on the ribs... I would get the dry rub or sauce on the side next time but the ribs truly fell off the bone and were cooked to perfection. Corn bread with apple butter was also awesomeeeeeWould totally return !

Came by for brunch on a weekend with my boyfriend and we grabbed two spots at the bar right away. We shared the burn ends sandwich on brioche (soo awesome, my favorite thing we ate) and 1/4 rack of sauced ribs (decent but nothing special). You also get a free side with Yelp check-in so we got the mac and cheese, which was delicious. Finally, they apparently don't usually serve dessert at brunch, but the bartender snuck us some key lime pie. So good!Next time: need to try the apple cake!!

Nice enough place - service was friendly. We sat at the bar and was attended to right away. We had the half pound of ribs and quarter brisket to share. The sides were Mac and cheese and French fries. The Ribs were tender just needed more flavor. Same with brisket. Mac and cheese was a bit too creamy for me.
Came here with a ticket from the Queens Beer Book.It's obvious this place is known for their meat. I had been here once before for brunch but I returned to try out their dinner menu.

Truly a delicious brunch. Nick is a fantastic waiter! He answered all of our questions and was overall very attentive and friendly. The brisket and meat candy were made to perfection. Definitely give this place a try!
Not even sure how I found this place but I'm glad I did. My Beef Brisket ,Meat Candy Beef Burnt Ends and garlic Broccoli was very good.Service was on point!Just overall great experience!

Absolutely love Butcher Bar!! I came here craving a burger that reminded me of the In N Out burgers I grew up on, and the Animal Burger is that and more! Their Mama's Fried Chicken Sandwich is one of the best in the city and pair that with their cheese fries, it is a dream! They also have a delicious brunch. We just ordered delivery the other night to continue social distancing, and it was just as great as eating it in the restaurant! On top of that they delivered their mixed cocktails and it was perfect!

Real Deal BBQ....  The Burnt Ends are far from burnt....They are tasty bites of tender ,sweet and Smokey brisket. Ditto with the Pork Belly !Unfortunately, the fried pickles appetizer was a big disappointment. They were like pickle bits inside of over fried hush puppies....defiantly not worth $10. The one thing that really irritates me is when a server brings a check that suggests gratuities where the total check is factored in including sales tax.  WE DO NOT TIP ON SALES TAX !!!!!

Came back after a nice day off with great weather and yes a huge parking lot up to 15 hrs so getting here was easy and parking was not a hastle, Finally Astoria, given that the whole boulevard is full of restaurants and bars.Ordered the Half Rack of Sauced ribs came with sides and ordered the smoked wings and pork belly. Coleslaw was on point nice and crunchy freshBaked beans so good with a hint of chiliMac n cheese omg creamy goodnessCornbread just enough and softPork belly was delish totes recommend Ribs off the bone and saucy, portion was hugeChicken wings were decent sized but nothing to bragHad happy hr 4$ drafts really good one for a pintBerry Moonshine cocktail was lit uff 1 was enoughService was prompt, our server Lisa was very welcoming, friendly and attentive. Service never disappoints. The music was cool very laid back and the setting was young hip and clean. Glad I came back and can't wait to get more ribs or pick up take out.

Holy moly!!! That was legit the best BBQ I've ever had!!! I had the beef with Mac n cheese and corn bread. I simply don't have the words to describe how amazing the meat was.  100% going back for more. Awesome job butcher bar!!!

I really enjoyed eating at this location! The foods great and the customer service is spectacular. The only con is the food is a bit pricey compared to most butcher restaurants. You don't get the amount you deserve with what they charge. Still, great place to come with friends for a drink & for a quick bite.

Was ok, use to be better, good Smokey taste, but all the meat was cold (pretty unacceptable).  It was served literally 2 minutes after ordering.  Sides came out later, and then more later... overall just ok, better places around!

Finally got to go after some recommendation. Really great food. Great staff.We originally wanted to make reservations for a large group, but saw they dont take reservations. After messaging Kathy, we were told to call. When we first called, we were told we couldnt make reservations. Until we mentioned Kathy. I really loved their honey cornbread. It is AMAZING!!

I have a number of friends who've told me that Butcher Bar is better then BBQ they've had in Texas and Memphis.  So, I finally ordered their famous brisket and burnt ends tonight.  My friends were absolutely right.  This BBQ joint in the heart of Astoria is top notch!  Chris was extremely accommodating and he made my girlfriend and I feel like VIP's.  We both can't wait to order from Butcher Bar again soon.

Ordered half rack of ribs with sauce. The bbq sauce was terrible. The ribs were tasteless.The service was was substandard. The server was not attentive. If you are looking for bbq, this restaurant is a total bust. Kathy K, thanks for the response. I was there on Sunday, September 8th at table 404 at 628pm.

Butcher Bar was pretty busy on a wednesday night at 7pm but luckily we got seats as soon as we arrived. I ordered their candied meat which tasted really good but the portions were quite small for the price of 10 dollars. I also bought their animal burger which didn't really taste that good, mind you I was very hungry so my standards for taste should be pretty low. One of the major reasons that i'm giving this rating is because we waited for almost fifty minutes for our food to arrive. The place was busy, but I was starving when I got there. So don't go there if you're starving, you'll end up being grumpier 'cause of the wait time.

Went on this past Saturday night service was horrible , placed my order and waited 40 minutes to find out the order never made it to the kitchen !manager tried to tell use the order was placed and would take another half hour ! Staff was also rude and not very helpful ....wouldn't recommend it to anyone very Disappoint ! U sound kind of angry Kathy K that's u answer to good customer service! Place sucks! Food smells like low grade Dog Food! So u think all the other reviews are welcoming for new customers? Like the guy who waited 45 minutes to get cold food! How about the person who waited to get seated and wasn't even acknowledged! Come on Kathy k , u cant take constructed criticism gracefully!Hi Kathy, My name is Nancy and I bumped into my friend Louis that wrote the above post. We started talking about the reviews and after reading them I am taken back by your behavior. I am in the hospitality business and shocked at they way you talk to people that post complaints. Your comments are outrageous! I think you would be a smart business owner if you started treating your customers with respect. Instead of always backing up your staff maybe you should take the complaints more seriously to improve their work habits. If someone has a boss that constantly takes their side no matter what customers had to say I am sure they get lax with customer service. You need to start presenting yourself as a leader and business owner and not a LOSER as you call your customers. With that attitude I can see your business failing in a couple of years.

Ummm.... YES PLEASE!!! I actually learned about this place through Groupon. It sounded good so I figured it was worth a shot. Yelp reviews supported quality food so I was eager to try. My husband and I went yesterday. I wish I could say I had pictures, but I don't cuz I was too busy eating. We shared the Diablo sandwich with fries, cornbread, burnt ends, 1/4 rack ribs, and Mac n cheese. Meat can seem a bit pricey, but we both agreed we'd prefer higher price, small portion + high quality, vs. cheap + huge portion "meh" meat. It tasted amazing!!!!! In all honesty not sure I would order the sandwich again, cuz I found I liked just getting to the point, the star, the meat!! But it was good. I was obsessed with the burnt ends which taste great dry, but even better topped with their sauces provided at each table. The ribs were truly fall of the bone! We're going back!! Next time will probably do 1/2lb orders. We were clueless with how much 1/4lb would be and now we know. Mind you we had a good amount of food and were FULL. I just need to leave with leftovers next time I had their hard pink lemonade which was amazing. My husband had a whiskey cocktail. It was a great brunch date! With twin babies it can be hard to get out. Glad it was a worthwhile visit while the little ones spent time with grandma.

Ordered delivery from caviar and food was delivered 40 minutes after longest initialDelivery window almost 1 hour and a half after ordering. Came luke warm. Biggest slap in the face is how small the $13 half baked Mac and cheese was. I was so offended I got a ruler and it was 4.5 inches by 2.5 inches big. You should be ashamed of yourselves honestly - I would have been a continued customer as food (once reheated) was fine and I can even tolerate a lengthy delivery time. Would love to speak to a manager.

I know, I know, I am rating Butcher Bar only 3 stars, while it is a decent option all I can say is that once you've had the likes of Hometown and Fette Sau or Mighty Quin's, this one just doesn't compete.The atmosphere is nice, while looking for that rustic BBQ vibe, it feels a bit more upscale and spacious.  Our waitress was lovely, the staff all around provided wonderful service.The House Dry Rubbed Ribs, had a nice flavor and while the meat came off the bones with ease, they were on the dry side.  The Gimme The Beef platter included brisket and burnt ends.  Again the brisket was kind of dry and definitely needed some sauce to make it more enjoyable.  The absolute star were the burnt ends, they were juicy and tender and just delicious. Something else to note, was that the meats were missing that smokiness that you get from other BBQ joints.Both dishes were served with coleslaw (a bit too wet and mushy), pickles, cornbread (kind of dense and bready) and choice of side.  The sides were great, the mac & cheese was creamy and wonderful; the Brussels Sprouts with bacon were very tasty.The apple cake offered to us at the end of the meal was actually fantastic; light and delicious. Overall, I'd rather get my BBQ elsewhere, but I will say the burnt ends and mac & cheese and the apple cake are things I'd visit for again.
Ordered delivery, which was quick and wonderful. The meat candy literally melts in your mouth. The Mac and cheese was incredibly creamy. Highly recommend, fantastic service!

EDIT 2: this business continues to harass me via DMs on social media accounts. Their lack of consideration and character is appalling. I made the right decision by posting here - this business does not align with my values at all. I'm devastated by the personal attack I just received from the manager, Christos. I left my credit card after paying a $200 bill, and ran to the restaurant as soon as I had realized it. Christos has recently left, and after getting him on the phone, he yelled at me and refused to help a customer in need get her card back. I'm disappointed in the lack of compassion for what was an honest mistake. He accused me of drinking tonight - but maybe when he checks my bill from tonight, he'll see that my party ordered 3 drinks for 6 people. EDIT: either the owner or manager responded on Facebook asking what "any other restaurant in America" would do. Well, I used to work in tech retail and we had very similar situations. More than once, we stayed open late, let a customer in early, and yes - even reopen the store in order to solve situations like these, especially when there were extenuating circumstances. As humans in any situation, we ALWAYS have a choice whether we want to go out of our way to help someone. Every single time any of us opens our mouth, we have a chance to show compassion and offer creative solutions (even to problems that aren't our own). ESPECIALLY at the management level, I urge this restaurant to do better in this regard. I am so disappointed and will refuse to patronize this restaurant in the future.

I been wanting to try this place out long time ago & finally I went there about 3 weeks ago. I read good reviews online and most of the reviews said the burnt ends was good!My partner and I went there to have lunch.My partner ordered a steak with a salad. For his salad he asked for Italian sauce but it never came with it.I ordered Gimme the beef.I loved th corn bread, mashed potatoes it was bland.The brisket was soft and delicious but the burnt end was disappointing. It had more FAT than Meat! The food was great but the wait time was very long time. Almost waited nearly 30 min waiting for the two dish.The waitress was friendly but the person at the front who gives a menu didnt say hello. They were busy talking to each other. Overall my experience with them was okay not to perfect about it. Will come back next time in the future to try other foods
The cheese stake was out of this world,  my wife and i ordered for a delivery, the delivery was extremely fast and the delivery guy was awesome.

Went with my wife and son today. Second time. Place not too busy and hostess comes over and tries to sit us at the crappiest table in the middle lane by door.  No thanks. We will take that one over there. Catch a waitresses eye, much to her chagrin, and she comes over with menus.  Hands them to us and says are you ready to order. Lol no.  I haven't even taken out my reading glasses yet. She says ok and starts to wake away.  I say, "madam, we will place a drink order". We get past the confusion of ordering drinks Spoiler alert!  This place is run by millennials.This is an open environment so I see her  pour the sodas, leave them there, and continue to gab with her co workers while I am parched.  Finally she musters her interior determination to bring them over. We ordered without fanfare and 20 minutes later the food came out. My wife couldn't eat her chicken, my quesadilla was bland and my sons combo meal was underwhelming. No one comes by to offer anything else or see how we are doing, as this would break   up the servers party environment ,so I shoot up a flare and get the check.We pay and won't return. I very generously give 2 stars based on good cole slaw and a clean bathroom.  Nuff said

Went with the family for my dads bday party of 5. Great BBQ spot in Astoria. Love the Decor huge American flag hanging on the wall. Started with an appetizer had the "burnt ends". It's small taste great you can kill it by yourself.   The "smoked pork belly" basically chicharrón thinly sliced. It comes with the " Porkys platter" You can't go wrong with that. Got that with max & cheese it was on point! My dad got the dry rubbed ribs very tasty. My brother ordered "fall of the bone" ribs had wayyyy to much bbq sauce so ask for it on the side.   Service was GREAT! Our servers name was Christina she was helpful when my dad asked a billion questions. She was energetic, informative,patient and did all that with a smile. They don't wear name tags she has light eyes and a smile that could light up a room! She recommended the "bourbon banana bread" which was really good. All it that was missing was a scoop of ice cream to go along with it. Idk what they pay her but GIVE HER A RAISE!!!!   Will definitely be back Great food and Great service! Also, check in and you'll get 10% of your bill of $20 or more!
We had a fabulous time for my first time,Chris, Emily & Daisy were absolutely divine, we didnt even want to leave I will definitely be back again reeeeaaaaalllllll soooooooonnnn l, they  Rock!

Last night while me and my girlfriend were home continuing social distancing we decided to order from a place we trust. By trust, I mean a place with cleanliness, delicious food and consistency in general. We ordered the butchers platter which never fails!!! Burnt ends , brisket and pork belly along with creamy Mac and cheese, sautéed spinach and some fresh cut fries. Not only were we satisfied with the food and service but it really made us smile the fact that the young lady that took our order over the phone was so pleasant. She was so helpful and went the extra mile. I always say it's the smallest things that count. In this time of need it's good to know that there is still some humanity and kindness left in people. Emily sent us a nice message on one of the brown bags which we just thought was just so nice of her and it assured that they care about the customer. That message really made our night. I will most definitely keep ordering from Butcher bar. Thank you Emily !!! and the butcher bar staff. We will definitely be calling back for more and also dining it once it reopens after this pandemic. 5 stars !!!
This is a great place for brunch. The food is delicious. The portions are generous and brunch comes with a free cocktail. There are also yummy vegetarian options.

I was hungover and cramping, their chili cheese fries are the absolute bomb so I decided to order some to be delivered as a way of treating myself! Extra jalapeños! Turns out I wasn't supposed to be able to order them online during brunch time Oops! Instead of calling to cancel they called letting me know that it would just take slightly longer for the kitchen to prep the necessary things! So so sweet of them especially since I said they didn't have to!!The brussel sprouts here are also some of the best I've ever had! Definitely not healthy for your body but top notch for your soul
The burnt ends here are everything! These guys have the best barbecue in all of Astoria!

I had the wrong address so asked a few people on 30th Ave. if they knew a BBQ place nearby, no one did. After finally finding it and eating there, I can understand why.The BBQ ends were at best luke warm and nowhere near burned. Looks like they just cut a piece from the middle and made it into small pieces. Not very much of it either. The mac and cheese came at $6 but the portion was the size of maybe $3, not very hot either. Creamy should describe some consistency but these were like  someone had to finish the extra milk.Up to you. For me, Quinn's still wins.
Alright, my second visit was better. Chris C the bartender did a good job. The food came out quickly and the beer was cold. Its expensive. I REALLY REALLY want to love this place. :/

We really enjoyed our experience here. The food was quality, the service was great, and the ambiance was perfect for a casual BBQ meal. Try to get there early enough to try the burnt ends! They always run out. I will certainly be back for more.
Worst bunch of my life absolutely hate it we can do a much better job from the staff to the food

First time visit yesterday (Friday evening, not busy at all). No wait for a seat at the bar, decently priced cocktails (although light pours, at least from our bartender), overpriced beers, and the food was good with little wait. Docking one star for our bartender, Chris, for his lack of attentiveness. Didn't see a name tag, but overheard his name from his friends/co-workers he constantly chatted with. My wife and I ordered 2 drinks, and took him a while to make those. Not a big deal at first, but the repeated delay in his service became annoying considering a rather empty dining room. Even took a long time for him to take my credit card as he continued chatting with co-workers, and literally flirting with/tapping a waitress' ass. We noted this on their comment card, but now thinking about it, not sure if he would've actually submitted something with a poor review of his service to his manager. Another star docked for the food. It was good, but portions were smaller than expected and came out room temp.Trying this BBQ place for the first time made me miss The Strand on Broadway (how it used to be).

Hmm. It's a beautiful place and the decor is super comfy. We were here for brunch so maybe thats why I'm not giving it 4/5 stars.. I was honestly a bit disappointed with my order and even the candied bacon. The bacon wasn't cooked well. It was fatty and not overly cooked and it was room temp, therefore it wasn't crispy. It just felt and tasted as if it wasn't fresh. Main dish was the brisket hash platter and it looked great. But tasted a bit bland. Also it wasn't crispy at all. Potatoes were boiled and stirred with some sort of seasoning. When I order hash I kind of expect for it to be somewhat crispy or have crispy bites. Also was excited for the sausage hash but honestly I didn't taste anything. I'm hoping to be back to try the dinner menu. Maybe I'll get lucky then.

Been there, done that and don't ever need to do it again. Ordered ribs, brisket, fries and coleslaw and all were fairly tasteless. Mighty Quinn's blows this place away - should have stuck with Quinns as we live in Manhattan and it's our usual place. Sub-par food is such a bummer.

Burnt ends were flavored well with a sweet outside.  There was also a nice char.  Most of the pieces were moist but a few were on the drier end.  The dry rubbed ribs were above average and fairly tender.  Cornbread portions were substantive and it seemed quite fresh; it was also comped given my yelp check-in.  There was also a free dessert accompanying my meal.  Ambience of the facility was trendy and sharp.  Food overall was 3.5ish stars in quality, though the free items were welcome.  Wait time was somewhat long for the few dishes I ordered, but service was quite good.

The food at Butcher Bar is overall good. The brussel sprouts are probably my favorite thing on the menu. The skirt steak is consistently cooked well. I have to say that for a BBQ place I think the brisket could be much better, I find it lacking taste and a bit dry. The service is hit or miss. Overall the food is good, as is the environment.

Heard about place and went on a Sunday. ARRIVAL - hostess took a while to engage and found a table for the 3 of us. Interesting to note the place was very empty but in 40 minutes there was a long line. AMBIANCE - what u would envision from a BBQ joint. Southern looking and kind of small in terms of the number of tables. SERVICE - waiter was super polite but not very engaging. Getting food took way too long given how empty it was. Albeit a number of folks streamed in. FOOD - the ribs were cooked well but the sauces we ok at best. I'm not a dry rub type so it was disappointing that the sauces were not spectacular. The side dishes were mixed. The Brussel sprouts and spinach were excellent. The corn bread was blah. The turkey sandwich was passable but not great. PRICE - actually not bad for ok cuisine three people with tax and tip was like $105.

Ordered delivery from here and was really hoping I had something awful to say so I could get the snarky owner response but, alas, it was pretty good! We ordered the Butcher's Platter and my only complaint was that the burnt ends, while most of it was good, there were some parts that were inedible--not because they were burnt but they just felt like you were gnawing on plastic. It must have just been a blip/small piece because no one else mentioned any issues. The brisket was also a tad bland but they had a lovely bbq sauce to go with it. The entire platter was enough to be shared among 3 people so great value. Delivery was pretty speedy for a holiday (4th of July!) but I don't think I'd order again. Not sure BBQ is meant to be delivered, should go in person.
Came here last night and picked up and order of Mac and cheese. Hate to say it wasn't that good it was super bland and mushy. Haven't tried the meat yet but the sides so far are a NO from me.

I came here for my birthday and was very disappointed. The service is super slow, the food is mediocre and there's a lot of weird tacky stuff going on. I heard of the "infamous" meat candy that this place serves and was really interested in trying it but for the price, the quantity and taste didn't match up. It was like 6 small cubes of meat candy and it was awfully salty. My cousins ordered burgers though and apparently it wasn't bad but overall, I wasn't too pleased. What caught me off guard though was that there was this skinny waitress who kept harassing us to write positive yelp reviews about her and the restaurant. It started from when we literally sat down to us getting up to go leave. I GUESS it would've been alright if the service and food was okay, but it's still super tacky nonetheless. I don't want to blast her on here but I definitely recommend the restaurant to fix that and maybe work on how slow the service is!

I will start by saying Chris for President!Why not? We currently have a real estate reality personality with questionable views on everything. So....Why not vote for the most hospitable and charming bartender from Butcher Bar?Ok ok... it may be the Apple pie moonshine talking but Chris at least needs a raise if he can't be the next Pres. lolLast night was the perfect example of what the Yelp  Community represents. A group of elites at an event, get together to head home and remember a previous event at Butcher Bar. So they decide to stop in and introduce me to a totally new establishment and possibly my new favorite bartender. (And the start of a FUN night. Lol)If you didn't already catch the clue Chris was great. He was super excited that the other ladies were returning customers and that I was a newbie. He personally took care of us without hesitation. Monday's are 2 for 1 apps and he explained everything and even honored our check-in offers (a free side of your choice). He mixed up some good  drinks with his own special twist and hooked us up with some apple pie moonshine.  Chris made sure all of ours orders were accurate and each of our bills were on point. I order the Butcher Bowl w/ chicken (his recommendation), buffalo wings and a side of cornbread w/ honey butter. All of our orders were to go since we had just ate. However when I dug into my food I was a very happy camper.With that said... awesome drinks, great food, and excellent service. It was a wonderful night. So maybe Chris for Mayor instead then?
This spot never fails me when it comes to great food! Always does the job. Clean, cool staff.. No complaints. Absolutely marvelous!

Butcher Bar has a lot of good things happening.  For one - they serve barbecued meats with brunch. Brilliant!  Two favorite foods (bbq and breakfast) on one plate?  Yes please!  Second - it's got a cool vibe.  Very casual with simple wood tables with red chairs, white subway tile, and chili pepper lights hanging from the ceiling.  And who doesn't love a neon sign spelling out BBQ.The portions are kindof amazing too.  For brunch most items are served with a drink (Bloody Mary, Mimosa, Bellini, Draft Beer, Coffee, HotTea, Juice, IcedTea or Soda) AND all dishes come with home fries, a salad and toast.  It's not fries or a salad - its BOTH.  For $16 I got a really generous quesadilla stuffed with pork, potatoes, salad, toast and (refillable) sweet tea.What's not so amazing?  That brunch quesadilla was stuffed with pork - but it was very plain.  I didn't get any sense of seasoning or sauce.  And the combination of monterey jack and parm was ok... but boring in many ways.  This could have been an amazing opportunity for bursts of flavors and there just wasn't any.  I was also missing the eggs in this brunch offering.  Maybe its just me but I think a breakfast quesadilla needs some eggs.  and not to nitpick - but my salad was over dressed.  Halfway through the meal I found the leaves to be soggy and I didn't end up finishing. So lesson learned with the pork quesadilla.  Tried it, liked it, but will probably order something different next time I'm at Butcher Bar.

Butcher Bar is a great neighborhood spot. Honestly, everything I have tried on the food menu (roughly 85%) is good. We never had to wait to get a table, which is probably disappointing the owners but personally I'm not a fan of waiting 20 mins for one. The serving sizes makes sure that you don't walk out hungry and the service has always been warm and friendly.     All the bbq meats are solid. But our favorites are the burnt ends aka meat candy, briskets and the ribs. The burgers are all quite good too. I would come to the conclusion that beef is the way to go here! The meats have mostly been well seasoned, smoky, tender and moist. Except that one time when I came in for brunch and the burnt ends were a tad on the dry side.Brunch here is great. The price tag is a bit higher compared to other brunch menus in the area but they do give you tons of food. Also, you can chose your beverage to be coffee, juice, cocktail or draft beer. Not too shabby I say. It is worth mentioning that the cole slaw here happens to be done to my selfish liking. Light and not too sweet nor sour, they go easy on the mayo, making the salad refreshing and just right. The corn bread here is nothing to rave about but the kitchen puts some whole corn kernels into it, so I will give it a wink-wink.Have I had better bbq somewhere else? Yes. But Butcher Bar is still great because it is a well rounded joint, no lines, great service, pleasant atmosphere and overall good solid food. There is no let down.

5 stars for service ! Our waiter was incredibly friendly and warming! 3 stars for food ...I was spoiled by Texas bbq and had an expectation with the burnt ends which is know as their best seller. Little did I expect the burnt ends to be dry and lack flavor. The brioche bun that came with it was lightly toasted. Cole slaw and pickles were great sides. The corn bread was a nice treat. My boyfriend had the 50/50 which we thought it was dry as well. So for both sandwiches we used their bbq sauce which we thought was delicious. Lastly, we finished with their apple cake in which most yelpers agree with that it was good.

I went in thinking things look familiar and as I sat down, I realized that we have been here before. Sat outside but the wooden walls and oddball decor hit me like an acid flashback. We remember the feeling of disappointment we had leaving the place over a year ago but we thought "Hey, maybe they had an off day." I'm sure you can figure out by the one star rating that we were wrong. We had fries, brisket, and half a rack of ribs. In other words, the good, the bad, and the ugly.The brisket was dry and had very little favor but edible in a state of starvation -- which luckily I was. But where Butcher Bar really left us feeling used and abused was the half of rack. Three of the five pieces were ends!! Not the delicious fatty burnt ends that were out of stock that night, but the dry barely editable shorter ends of a rack.When you cook a rack of ribs, you cook it whole with two ends. The ends are shorter and thus, drier because they cook faster. Why this Cooking 101 lesson? There is a point, I promise. How many end pieces should you get when you order a half of rack? One! And the rest? Bigger and juicier pieces all leading up to that middle melt in your mouth piece that is so coveted. We were ripped away from that delight and $27. When we try to ask the waiter politely (we were both in the service business) if this suppose to come like this, no one working was to be found for 10 mins. And when he finally did show up, he simply states, "It is just luck of the draw." My partner, who was a chef in a past life, was livid. Consistency is very important in kitchens and this answer told us everything about what type of establishment and culture we were dining in. Go to John Browns. Those fine fellas know BBQ.---In response to Kathy, the owner's comments:Mighty Quinn's, Fette Sau, even Dinosaur Bar-B-Que -- take your pick. They are all better choices than the three dry, hard pieces I was served at Butcher Bar yesterday night. Insidiously implying that your customers have an affiliation doesn't help make your case on your restaurant's ability to resolve complaints.

Placed an order through Grubhub. I ordered the bbq Chicken Butcher Bowl, Butcher Bar Sweetened Tea and Banana Pudding for dessert. The BBQ Chicken butcher bowl was delicious, exceeded what I was expecting. Flavors hit all the taste buds. The sweet tea tasted like sweet tea...the end.And for dessert the banana pudding was out so it had to be good; but the lady called me to switch to either bread pudding or the apple cake. I asked what the bread pudding tasted like because I didn't know and she said I'll put both in there and you can try it out. (She didn't have to do that, but she's the real MVP for that because it was delicious... the apple was too.)Win-Win!
Great BBQ and drinks in Queens! Didnt have to travel to the city . I ordered the beef brisket,  mac and cheese and a hard pink lemonade!

Cute spot and enjoyed meeting friends there buttttttt waitress was a bit bothered by something and didn't come by too much though food came out quick. Friends' barbecue looked good and they enjoyed in. I got the pancakes, fruit cup and my husband a brisket side. Brisket seemed a little over cooked but pancakes were fine. Not good, not bad.

So I've been going to this place for awhile now and I do still like it. Especially the burnt ends. The staff are always nice. But I have noticed it is pricey. Then the other day I received my order and the portions were definitely smaller. To their credit, when I did say something they came back and it looked like they added a couple more pieces of meat. I get that the meat runs out fast, but I rather be told their are out of something than get a small amount for the price I am paying. Even if I was given the right amount, I do think this place is on the more expensive side.

So glad that my boyfriend and I came on a weekday - not crowded and for seated right away. Our food came pretty fast as well. We ordered a full rack of "fall off the bone ribs" and 1/4LB burnt ends, for sides we had Mac and cheese and fries. This was good for 2 people to share!The fall off the bone ribs was very good! Literally falls of the bones, super tender and the BBQ sauce was very good. There was a lot more ribs than I've seen in photos since it's double stacked. The burnt ends were also very tender and juicy. The Mac and cheese was very good. It also came with corn bread, which was a bit different - more moist and less.We wanted to try their complimentary apple cake since it seems pretty popular here but sadly, they it's only complimentary for dinner.... but we saw a very nice waitress who offered to her tables as a complimentary dessert, so that was a bit of a bummer for us. Overall, we really enjoyed the food and the service was great.

Good. For 2 large appetites we got the butcher's platter (includes 3 meats) + 2 extra meats and side of corn sticks/bread. -grilled chicken: surprisingly very very good! a lot of flavor. would actually recommend.-brisket: alright. Tastes better with the sauce-beef burnt ends: tasty, slightly sweet. very fatty.-grilled sausage (chose the Filipino one): very flavorful.-1/4 rack ribs, sauced: very goodTook a while to get the food but we were happy with it and satisfied when we left.

I havent been here in a very long time. Was dying to come for a long time and was very disappointed with this  visit. I started off with some sweet and spicy chicken wings that had some good flavor.  I ordered the  "Gimme the beef plate" which came with brisket and double burnt ends. I found the brisket and ends extremely dry. I was very disappointed.  We also ordered the chicken sandwich which i must say was amazing. . The sandwich came out and my order was forgotten.  I had to wait an extra 10 minutes for my food to come out which didnt make me happy. I will be giving it another chance just not sure when.

I had dinner with Andrew in a gloomy Saturday night after reading CFA book for the whole day. The place was quite cozy. We ordered:- beef burnt ends: the tastiness depends on how much fat that chop you picked up had. Generally good but the lean meat in each chop is a bit dry.- meat fall off the rib: too much sauce on the rib, and the sauce is way too sweet.- corn bread: the best corn bread I ever had! There is actual corn in it! Not too sweet.- Brussels sprout: I'd give a 5-Star to this dish as well. You don't see bacon in the dish but you totally taste it in the greens!

Not only was the food bad (not fresh, no flavor, look like cafeteria food) but the owner is verbally abusive. Take a look at her response to spike for mikes review below me. I went with spike for mike to Butcher Barf. He's very real- I'm in his wedding for Christ sake!!!
I was there last night tonight, went home and was so sick til the morning. Had the meat candy, which in hindsight should've been my warning. Avoid at all costs. Butcher Bar, you let me down so much..

Came in Tuesday night for what was supposed to be "an experience".Based on the yelp reviews we had high expectations which turns into big disappointment.The meat candy was dry and over cooked. Salad wasn't cut and inconvenience to chew.We feel like the it is way overrated and deserves 2 star the most.

Gosh..I don't even know where to start my review from.. This place was like a JOKE!! Like the other customers already mentioned in their reviews, they gave me axactly the same disrespectful attitude for using a Groupon voucher! First, we did yelp check in for only 1 side order because the waitress said it is 1 per table! then, we said okay and accepted it. Then,at the end when I wanted to use my Groupon voucher, their Extremely Rude, Fully Attituded Manager told us that he is going to charge us for Yelp Check in Too!Btw, when you try to do yelp check in it doesnt give you any rules or terms to get this free side order! So, I have said okay.. Im going to pay for it.. Then, when we got the bill, he gave us only $36 off instead of $40!! And on top of that he taxed me twice!!! And he wanted me tax me even on third!! This guy with a thick spanish accent is extremely RUDE, and a thief because you cannot steal other people's money for only to fill your server's pockets without the permissions of the customer!!! I AM THE PERSON WHO DECIDES TO GIVE HOW MUCH TIP I WILL LEAVE TIP FOR THE SERVICE!!!And when I told him that you guys calculated and billed us incorrectly, he told me HE doesnt have time for me to argue! Btw he didnt know how to do a basic calculation he was using a calculator! As a person who has 2 college degrees and 2 minors in major ivy league schools, I felt really insulted and questioned myself even for being at the same level for communication with this Uneducated guy! I feel really sorry for him and this place, because Astorians award and value real good businesses really well, and you can see such as Taverna Cylacades, Queens Room etc.. But we also know how to punish BAD restaurants get shut down. If you want to do a favor for yourself just avoid this place because there are much better quality food restaurants at better prices than this! their meat has even no taste, its like shoe sole.The owner is now calling me loser lol  I arrived way before 7pm and told your hostess that I would use a Groupon voucher!! Groupon is a voucher that I purchased! It is not a Coupon!! You do not pay for a coupon! I paid money for that!! I am not eating for free!! I am eating with my own money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Ma'am, Im calling you Ma'am because you sound like a very uneduacted NASTY old lady from the way of your talking! I don't need your CRAP food to fill my belly! It was terrible!! you guys even don't know how to cook American Style BBQ Meat. It was definitely something else. Now, I see how come your Manager can act that way. Because you are all the same! I will report you to the Yelp and your fake positive reviews get removed!! Wow, this is the way you are promoting your restaurant huh? it is extremely Genius! Keep going, you'll soon go out of business!

Just wanted to take a moment to say how much I love and appreciate Butcher Bar. Not only are they providing high-quality amazing food sourced from local grass fed farms WHO TREAT THEIR ANIMALS HUMANELY, but they have also stepped up their game during the whole pandemic here in New York City regarding COVID-19 quarantine To help their community by extending their delivery area to all five boroughs allowing people to order high-quality food outside of their local area. I have been a patron of Butcher Bar for the past 2.5 years as I am a cancer survivor and completely changed my diet two years ago eating only organic clean meat. This is how I found Butcher Bar, but to find out that their food also tastes amazing was a huge plus and has kept me coming back. I have always found their in house service to be very good an during the quarantine Chris in particular has been wonderful with every phone order that I've had. He has been very helpful and kind. I would recommend this restaurant to anybody who wants a high-quality meal at a fair price as well as supporting local farms. Thank you Chris, I appreciate all of your help and support for your community during this time!
The food was delicious! Went there two weeks ago for a lunch date with my husband and we both enjoyed it very much! Jalapeno margarita was great!

3.5 stars. Good BBQ and good service, though nothing really stood out for me here. I came by on a Sunday night with friends, and it was a nice dinner out.-House Dry Rubbed Ribs: the famous Sauced Ribs were already sold out when we came around Sunday 6pm so we decided to try the dry rub instead. Meat was smoky and tender, but definitely needed additional sauce on the side to kick it up a notch. -Animal Burger: juicy and tasty, but not memorable in flavor. In a week's time, I probably wouldn't be able to describe the burger to you...but I can say that the sauce in it was delicious! The menu mentioned that this burger is "Always cooked Medium Well", but we had the option to cook it differently if we liked.-Smoked and Fried Wings (with Sweet & Spicy Sauce): the smoked and fried combo sounded amazing on the menu, but tasted like solid, average wings in reality. I couldn't really taste the "smokiness" in them.-Sides: Mac and cheese was rich and creamy and the coleslaw/pickles was a light and refreshing side to pair with all the meat. If you order the cornbread as a side, it's sooooo much softer and more moist than the cornbread that comes with the Butcher's Platter (they're probably the leftover edges). Loved the honey butter as well.Staff here was very friendly and offered a complimentary warm apple cake at the end of our meal. It's practically cornbread once again, but topped with powdered sugar and a drizzle of apple syrup. Nice sweet way to end the meal.

DO NOT EAT HERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!Before you think of eating here, please take the time Kathy K's responses to reviewers who have left negative comments here on Yelp (and if that's not enough, there's even more of her trash talk responding to reviews of their failed LES location). These are not "fake reviews" as Kathy claims, but legitimate reviews, several from "Elite" yelp reviewers.Kathy is part owner of this restaurant and her comments speak for themselves. She is unapologetically foul mouthed and rude and makes up non-sense to try and discredit anyone who doesn't heap praise on her restaurant. Even after my bad experience here I still intended to come back and actually try the food and update my review. After Kathy's respond I will NEVER return to this restaurant, and recommend that no one else eat here either.Just to clarify my initial review:I was fully familiar with the Groupon fine print, and intentionally arrived early to make sure I'd be able to use it. I was polite to the hostess (who initially ignored our family when we first walked in) and did not make a scene or try to "get away" with anything. The most "childish" thing I said is "I guess you've wasted my time in coming here".I am not related to Ilir K., who also posted a negative review, despite Kathy's comments of Ilir's review.

Had a craving for some barbecue type food and searched for a place in Astoria I haven't been to yet. I'm SO glad I came across this! First impressions for me are everything and I will definitely be coming back here! Everything we ordered was delicious and the server (I think her name was Jessica/maybe Julia) we had was such a delight! The atmosphere was super chill and felt like I was down south eating some authentic southern food. The food came out quickly and was cooked to perfection. Seriously, if any of you are having that craving like I had, YOU MUST GO HERE! You will NOT be disappointed :) (Also, pricing is like your regular Astoria restaurant pricing but I will SO pay $13 for another chicken sandwich)

From the moment we walked in to this restaurant our experience just kept excelling. We were promptly greeted and told to take a seat wherever we'd like. We happen to go on a week day around lunch time and let me tell you that was one of the best things we could have done. Monday through Friday there is a "Blue Plate" special for $9.99. The amount of food that came in this order was amazing. The taste was great with not to much or too little of anything. We also ordered the kids chicken fingers and French fries. The fries are hand cut potatoes and the chicken was actual chicken breast breaded and fried. This place was hands down five stars and will we will absolutely be returning soon.

I have not been here in awhile but I was craving some burnt ends so I came in. I sat at the bar and ordered burnt ends and mashed potatoes with a berry good time for the drink. Irene was a very attentive bartender and the service was wonderful. Not only was she sweet but whenever I was ready to order another drink, she was always available. I will definitely come back when she is here because I felt at home with her. I have always loved the food at butcher bar and if you come, the burnt ends are a must!!!

Decor: Butcher Bar is very well designed and the set-up is great. They have bar seating,indoor,and outdoor seating in which it is an open space and it is great to sit outside on a nice hot day.Service and food: I came here for lunch on a Friday and got a seat at the bar. From the moment I walked inside the staff was very pleasant and nice to me the entire time. I ordered the fried pickles and had a sangria pitcher to start off. The white sangria was very good and the fried pickles were so-so;I felt like they were fried a tad bit too much but I did have a few that were perfectly cooked but the sauce hat came with it was amazing. For my meal I had 'Gimmie the Beef' platter which came with burnt ends and brisket and I chose Mac n cheese as my side. I must say I thoroughly enjoyed the burnt ends but I feel like the brisket was under seasoned therefore wasn't overall that desirable. The Mac n cheese was good and the cornbread that came with it was also tasty. Their homemade BBQ sauces are also very goo They also gave me a complimentary apple cake for dessert and a shot of moonshine after dessert. The Apple pie hit the spot and as expected the moonshine was strong. I must say that this made up for me not liking the brisket that much but as I stated before this place has perfect customer service.

Had the best time ever sitting at the bar with Gina. She was absolutely amazing and made the entire experience fantastic! She knew the menu, and was able to navigate it with me and my friend as both of us suffer from food allergies. She checked in on us at the right amount, not too aggressive at all. We chatted about all things Astoria and it was nice. Everything she recommended was spot on, the salad with marinated steak, which was cooked perfectly as well as the brisket burger. She even brought a sample of the burnt ends, and let us also sample the frozen drinks as we were undecided about what cocktails to try. The food here is amazing, and you can see that from the reviews, but it is just so awesome when the customer service matches the quality of the food.My friend and I will be back and you will find us at the bar with Gina

Wow, that was a pleasant surprise.Burnt ends were perfect, had great baked beans (not on the menu just asked?)Fast, friendly service at the bar.I am a BBQ snob, this is the real deal.Well done, well done.

Even if their food was 5 stars, I would never return to this restaurant due to the nasty, unprofessional manager Kathy. Instead of treating customers with some dignity and respect, Kathy calls them "idiots" and tells clients "we hate idiots like you." Instead of responding professionally, she tells her clients "go somewhere else you nasty human." I have never in my life experienced someone in the service industry talk down like this to paying customers. Whether or not the customer was right or wrong, you still can't talk to people like that. Period. Her nasty responses to yelp reviews shows what type of person she is. A professional manager would have responded positively, even to a negative review. I will never give another penny to this place or support such a foul mouthed, nasty person.

Me and my Family discovered Butcher Bar a couple years ago and instantly feel in love with the Menu and the Atmosphere. We recently went back this month of August 2018 and wasn't happy with the Order that we choose. The pickles had a Slimy substance on it that turned our stomach!! I kept my composure and tried the Philly Steak Sandwich. It grossed me out how that Added Mustard to replace the Cheese. I don't know what was going wrong with the dishes of food that we ordered. I asked the Waiter what went wrong and they replied that the Chef was new!! No Excuse!!! They used to be a restaurant in West Village that I always when to because of their Delicious Food about six years I was A regular Customer. Than....they had changed the Chef!! that was it!!! no more business from me. I'm hoping that Butcher Bar doesn't follow that mistake! I really love this place and I told SO MANY PEOPLE!! Friends Family and Work colleagues!! Please don't disappoint me again.

This place has gone down hill big time the last year. Inattentive staff, even though there was about 10 of them. Breakfast overrated, cocktails was basically sugar water. Lost me as a customer. Spend your cash else where. Happy hour dosnt apply too all cocktails, so watch the super fine print. Overall go to sugar freak for better food and value.

Came to Butcher Bar on a Friday night and was surprised to find that it wasn't crowded and they had every meat still available (they typically run out). My girlfriend and I ordered the Meat platter that comes with 1/4 pound of Burnt Ends and 1/4 Pound of brisket. For our side we got the Sweet Potato mash and the Brussel sprouts with bacon. If you check in on yelp you get a free side! The burnt ends were some of the best I've ever had, so moist and flavorful. The brisket was average, not much flavor and not as moist as I would've liked. The Sweet potato mash and Brussel sprouts were both delicious sides. The platter also comes with Cole slaw, pickles, and corn bread, all very tasty. The cole slaw does not contain a whole lot of mayo (My preference). At the end of our meal we got complimentary apple cake which was a generous gesture and a nice way to end the meal. I also recommend the Moonshine! So good. The happy hour here has some great deals so I would definitely come back for drinks!

This place dishes out some pretty good BBQ classics from ribs to pulled pork and brisket along with the old fashion sides that you look forward to with you BBQ meats such as mac n cheese, cole slaw, and string beans. Came here and ordered the sample platter that came with a little bit of everything. You can choose your meat by the pound and with that you get sides to go along with it. We got the brisket, pulled pork, pork belly, and ribs. The brisket was moist and on its own was good but withe their BBQ was better. The pulled pork was a bit dry. It wasn't sitting in any sauce which really could have helped it along. The pork belly was crispy fatty salty and delicious. The ribs were NOT fall off the bone but they did have good flavor. It was a dry rub so its not dripping with sauce but we definitely added some BBQ sauce to it. Their sides are pretty standard. Your regular old mac n cheese. String beans were decent, the cole slaw was heavy with mayo, and the corn bread was just corn bread. We did order the beets which were unique. Tangy and sweet. Good foil to the heavy BBQ. Overall a decent BBQ spot.

One of my favorite places in Astoria or in all of New York City ... Great food, superior service and a beer list that doesn't disappoint (they have a stout on draft that isn't Guinness).I usually sit at the bar and the staff, led by Allison, is very attentive without being intrusive, which makes for a comfortable vibe.Well worth a visit ...

Two words.  BURNT. ENDS!!!  My favorite BBQ place in NYC.  The burnt ends are so good they sell out during the day.  I thought that only happened in Texas.  Turns out the chef is from the Austin area so I can see why.  The burnt ends are packed with so much flavor are have a nice crunch on the outside.  I could literally eat them every single day.  the sauces are all amazing and I slather it on the burnt ends.  Not because they need them but because it's just so good.  I wished i lived around the corner.  Also, the cornbread with housemade honey butter is just unfair.  My girlfriend and I have ask for extra cornbread and extra honey butter after every meal we have had!  Place is no joke get there ASAP!

We live in Astoria and love Butcher Bar. The burnt ends melt in your mouth!!! And the Rueben is so yummy. It's really great that the bbq sauce is also gluten free! This has become our fav local spot, especially because we are always treated so well. Nick is always our server of choice! He's so polite, knowledgeable, friendly, and welcoming! His service is fantastic.
Probably the best ribs and sauce in Astoria. Reasonably priced steaks, but, supplies don't lat too late into evening dinner rush. No complaints about this place at all. Service is superb.

This is my second time here but first review. We had the burnt ends, both dry and sauced ribs, Mac and cheese, garlic broccoli, and the cornbread. We enjoyed everything except the Mac and cheese. Service was great everyone was very attentive but also gave us our space to enjoy our drinks and meal. Will definitely be back soon.

Pros: Spacious, had many tables and seats, decor is warm and welcoming, clean, burgers were ok but I probably wouldn't order one again if I return. The Apple cake is super good and complimentary for dinner (I think because of the previous reviews and because we received a large piece...but there is a story to that...). Corn bread was pretty good. Cons: The wait for our food took an hour (the place was not that busy), we ordered two sides, Mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts...we never received the sprouts. The burger was not juicy, I ordered a medium..it was more like a medium well. The food was just ok. So to not elongate this review, here is the story. We got there (two of us), were seated right away. Our order was taken, we ordered two burgers, Mac and cheese, and Brussels sprouts. One long hour later....and with no communication from the staff, we received our dinner, minus the Brussels sprouts. The waitress told us that it will come out in a min...like Maury says...."that was a lie". We ate our entire meal and still nothing. When our waitress comes back we tell her and she apologizes and asks if we want it to go. We say no and she apologizes. They take it off the bill and give us the complimentary Apple cake.  They also added complimentary corn bread to go. I was disappointed because I expected more because of all the good reviews and stars. The lack of communication and the wait time was a bad experience. I will probably be going back to try their burnt ends because they look really good. Hopefully it's a better experience.

The food was tasty but in my opinion, doesn't match up to some of the other bbq spots ( John Browns, Hill country, Might Quinns's, Hometown) but it was still tasty. The brisket was cut bacon thin, the ribs were tasty but I thought lacked some seasoning. The Mac n cheese was decent. The food was good, but I'm not sure if I'd go out of my way again to eat here. The brunch items look really good.

Eh. I came here because I was craving bbq food and I left still craving bbq food. We came on July 4th to try a couple of the hot items on the lift. First off, the burnt ends were soggy and distasteful. The ribs we got did not have much meat on them. We also got the bacon brussels sprouts which had literally no bacon. The worst part was that we came for happy hour and was only told that happy hour prices do not apply on holidays AFTER we got the bill... Honestly really disappointed.

Ordered two pulled pork sandwiches to go and asked for the sandwiches to have bbq sauce.  When I got home no sauce on the sandwiches and the taste of the pork was just ok.  Honestly I had better BBQ.  And the price wasnt cheap!!  Not sure I would go back, but Im def open to going again if in the neighborhood.

FYI they discontinued bottomless brunch. Came here a couple of times, dinner food is better than the breakfast food (much better). Would recommend coming for dinner and getting the BBQ items (don't skip the meat candy!). Mac and cheese was a little watery for me. The wait for your food is a bit long as well.

Butcher bar is always amazing. Service is good with Irene great spot to go to eat anything ! thank you Irene. Good and drinks were delicious and the atmosphere was amazing. My family and I enjoyed the whole experience. See you soon butcher bar.

So as my GF knows all too well, I hate crowds and looking on Google reviews and busy times we both wanted to go to Butcher Bar so many times in the past but always woke up too late on the weekend or just couldn't find the time during the week.This week we both got lucky... I had finished work early and she was off....off to the butcher bar at 430pm... Perfect!! As soon as we walked in the place was mainly empty (trust me it's never like this we just happen to pick a sweet spot time to eat) the staff was really welcoming and the bar was a little warm for a 90 degree day but aaahhh who cares they have cold beer.As soon as we sat down we ordered our drinks, for me a Narragansett Lager and my GF a Cider Old Fashion... yeah I didn't know they make this combo. We both like to sit at the bar when possible...who knows best about the food than the bartender? She recommended a beef platter to share but we went with the Cubano Sandwich for her and Gimme the Beef platter for me. Sides were bacon beans and Mac and cheese. Reading the reviews before going I knew we were in for a treat. The Cubano Sandwich was delicious, the sandwich bread crispy and the meat and cheese all at perfect temps. The corn bread that comes with both meals is very good, I've had better but I'm not there for the corn bread. My platter was excellent, both meals were cooked just right, the dipping sauces are a nice touch...Beware of the Habanero sauce, not for the weak! Our sides were a mix, the bacon beans were outstanding and the Mac and cheese was good but I've had better, once again not there for the Mac and cheese. All told Cubano Sandwich, Meat Platter, two sides and four drinks...$92 including tip, keep in mind we were there for happy hour. A bit steep for a late lunch but very tasty. Oh yeah just as we were finishing up small crowds started wandering in...... Check Please!

My boyfriend and i had to wait about 10 minutes for a table even though there were 2 tables available. We were told if a bigger party were to come in, they'd get those tables. But we still gave it a chance. We had the nachos and the brisket sandwiches with fries. The brisket wasn't as flavorful as I've had. I did appreciate the free fries for checking in on yelp, the complimentary dessert, and the great service from our waitress

Amazing food...amazing service always!  The burnt ends are a must!!  They taste amazing on their own or in a "meat candy" sandwich.  Either way... you won't be disappointed.  Their burgers are also amazingggggg!  My favorite burger spot in the city!  Can't say enough about this place!   Highly highly recommend the butcher bar!

With a name like Butcher bar, you won't be surprised at the meat-heaviness of their menu! The service was extremely quick and friendly. The meat... oh man! Soft, tasty, tender, everything that you want from a place that claims to do meat well. We had the Beef Brisket - amazing; meat candy - amazing; mac and cheese - surprisingly well done and not overly cheesy or salty; cornbread - delicious. The spicy sausage was sold out, we had the other one which was good, but not as special as the rest of the food. We had beer, but the whiskey selection is generous and something to look for, if that's what floats your boat. Just beware that you will not be passing any cholesterol health assessments after a visit!!

The food was delicious! I left stuffed.Lisa (the bartender) was an absolute sweetheart! Was super helpful all afternoon and made sure I didn't forget my food after I had a few drinks and saved my headphones after I forgot them. Would definitely come back!

I ordered a meat candy sandwich off Seamless and it had a chunk of hard plastic in the sandwich. When I took the bite, I thought it was a bone at first but realized shortly after that it was actually blue plastic, it looked like it was from a container or something. Usually the food and quality are good I was disappointed with this mishap. I hope they see this review so they can do better quality assurance for their to go orders in the future.

We all know this is a meat lover's paradise.What impressed me most was our server and host Nicholas who seamlessly took on many different roles on a busy Sunday evening. I had to take care of my very elderly parents and Nicholas and his colleagues couldn't have been nicer to meet their physical and social needs.  Upon entering, Nicholas was very kind in telling us what the anticipated wait would be but then he did something few people in our society do nowadays.  Rather than exaggerating for the sake of making empty promises, he said he wanted to be transparent and let us know what menu items were not available.  Given the late hour on a Sunday before the workweek, it was totally understandable that burnt ends and the "fall off the bone" ribs would not be available.   Then, upon noticing another menu item just sold out (given the freshness of the products used), Nicholas couldn't have been more flexible and kind in doing right by us.  He was generous, extremely courteous and a master of public relations which was always impregnated with respect.
The food was delicious. My favorite was the Burt beef ends, so good! Everyone is so friendly, especially our waitress Cristina. No complaints at all.

Came here after an amazing day at the Barclays Center seeing Ice Cube's 3 on 3 basketball league ( if you haven't been go lol ). Needless to say I was starving after the game. I had been eyeing this place for awhile. Well, the service was exceptional. If you go ask for Nick I told him what I was in the mood for and that I wanted suggestions. Per his suggestion, I had the mac and cheese,  candy burnt ends and a great cocktail. It was my first time and I was starving haha. I left nothing but a tip ( ate all the food on my plate) . Great Food, Great Service and as a bonus I had a great view.

After being turned away by a long line at their Manhattan location, was surprised to find that their original stop had barely anyone inside late Friday night. Took a seat at the bar as the bartender took my order.Had to get the Burnt Ends ($9) of course, with a side of Creamy Mac ($5) and a draft IPA ($7). Before I even put down my glass from my first sip of beer, the food had arrived. Was a little worried that my meal was just microwaved and served, but figured it's a popular dish and they had plenty of fresh-made available. The "meat candy" packed a lot of flavor, especially the outer coating and sauce. I did find the ends incredibly chewy however; almost jerky-like. The mac and cheese was definitely creamy as advertised - rich flavor, but I do wish there were some bread crumbs to provide a different texture to the side.Service here is excellent; was in and out of the establishment in about 25 minutes. Though I wasn't really blown away by the food, it's a solid choice for a late night meal in the area (Also free side with Yelp check-in!).
I like this place. The burnt ends was really good. Went there with coworkers, they had the wings which I enjoyed as well. We had Sangria, was okay a little water down. I would definitely go back.

Emily was my favorite part about this place! The food is amazing of course, but service here is outstanding. This is my third time here, and I will be back! Any of the butcher meats are amazing. Would highly recommend brussel sprouts and Mac and cheese as sides!!
Chill spot food was decent I've had better off course. Service was great.. drinks was great and Astoria is so cute

Ok who does not love BBQ ?! So I saw and I went in I ordered the Mac &  Cheese yum yum ! Cheesy and it had bacon awe bacon makes me happy . The waiter expressed the portions were large so to order with that in mind. Well I was disappointed because I told him this girl can eat ! When I saw the portions I was let down. My Burnt ends was mouth watering with a side order of Brussels sprouts yasss add vegetables please , it was delish. I washed it down with a Moonshine Mimosa I mean why not it was also very good !  I wanted more food !!!  The grilled chicken as they say so so !  The burger well it was just a burger !!  All in all I will return for burnt ends and make it a triple it will be amazing !!!!

3.5 stars The service was awesome really friendly We had the pork plate with three different meats and a side (their original sauce is really good!)The pulled pork and ribs were delicious I was the pork belly was crispier or more seasoned became it tasted off The fries were also good next time I wanna try the mac and cheese and the greens with bacon The drinks here are strong I had the Astoria sour and booooy was lit but I enjoyed it The reason I take away stars is the pork belly and also just the owners attitude to other yelpers is a little upsetting
Emily was fantastic. Great lunch deal. Did not plan on getting a drink or two at the bar, but Emily was so hospitable, I had to change my plans!!

Brisket burger wassss amazing. Thought it would be too meaty and difficult to eat but omg the meat just falls apart in your mouth. Sides: I was expecting the Mac and cheese to be better than the mashed potato but the mashed potato was the winner, it was so good! Would order a whole platter of that mash.The pear hard cider was yummy, but $7 for that small can, I'll pass next time but it was worth a try.They gave a free on the house cornbread apple cake, that was mouth watering, so delicious!Would recommend to others. They also have an amazing Groupon if you haven't tried butcher bar before.

Delicious bbq! Located in the heart of Astoria is this jewel bbq spot. The bbq is amazing, savory, and satisfying. The ambiance is very local yet rustic. High return-ability. I ordered the burnt tips and brisket- very tender and juice meat. Not fancy, can be up to 45 min wait during prime times, affordable prices, a great date spot :)

Here. Meat. You're welcomeMEAT CANDY AKA BURNT ENDS Crowdfavorite; what they're known for. The ends were more like charred to the point of inedible but the actual meat had an intensified flavor since it is double smoked, pretty good $13PHILLY CHEESE BRISKET This was philly phenomenal. The cheese and beef together was money. One of their better items $13BRISKET SANDWICH Their bottled sauces on the table are pretty good if mixed right so I like this dry rubbed no-sauced sandwich. I like to add my own for fear of getting an oversauced sandwich (get mopped and chopped if you prefer less work). $11REUBENNot bad. I love cole slaw with any smoked meats so this is right up my alleyPortions for side dishes could be bigger, very scant. Service is okay. They, of course, have ribs steaks and platter options. Great dinner option for those meat cravings without the hefty rodizio/churrascaria prices. Plus, they frequently have Groupon deals (groupon.com/biz/long-isl…) so great idea to save money while checking them out!Recommended: Philly Cheese Brisket, Bob's Burger, Creamy Mac, Sweet Potato Wedges

Just finished ordering from Butchers Bar and I got the regular burger and a side of Mac and cheese. I would say I am quite happy with the delivery time and the burger. It did bother me that the burger had shredded lettuce and everything was falling out. It was a little messy but I don't mind it. The burger was cooked perfectly and it tasted great! As for the Mac and cheese.... it was tasteless. No salt and it literally tasted like milky cheese with no salt. If it wasn't for the Mac and cheese I would of gave five stars.
Emily was lit, food is bomb, Good drinks. Coming back for Emily, she is the best. Beer is awesome.

Butcher Bar is the bomb! Let me reiterate that this place has some of the best tasting barbecue meats and side dishes that I have consumed in a long time. I am currently having dinner somewhere else and would have gone to Butcher Bar if I had the energy to go to Astoria Queens at this hour!-lol. That is a true testament to exactly how fantastic the food is....I went there recently to have some of their famous Double Smoked Beef Burnt Ends. When I arrived, the lovely Bartender Julian informed me that they were sold out of Burnt Ends for the evening....I thought "Oh No! What am I going to do without being able to order and eat Burnt Ends?-lol I had to think fast, so Julian recommended Smoked Pulled Pork. Wow, the Smoked Pulled Pork consisted of juicy succulent pork meat smothered in a mesmerizing barbecue sauce!!!! I licked my lips and fingers several times as I ate.....When you check in on Yelp, your side order is free! I had Cornbread w/ Honey Butter...it was hot and fluffy. Oh the creamy, sweet honey butter.....Julian was also kind enough to bless me with a slice of their Grand Mas Cake which was drizzled in Caramel Sauce!!! I enjoyed every bite! I just want to thank Julian for being so gracious, kind and hospitable. He was working hard behind the bar!!! How I wish there was a Butcher Bar in Brooklyn! Well, there is one in Manhattan....In the meantime, I will be heading to Astoria!
This place is wonderful. I recently ate there, the food was great and our server Manos was nice and accommodating!!!Excellent food..especially if you re a meat lover and really good dessert
Burnt ends were great and so was the brussel sprouts side. The servers are so nice and helpful!

I went to the Butcher Bar many times before  but last night was the best experience ever. We are becoming empty nesters, my husband and I.  It was date night. The food was amazing and the wine just as good.  I would recommend sticking to the simpler menu items. My husband ordered a very expensive steak entree and it was not worth it. Great place just have to know what to order

I know I know...you can't mess up authentic BBQ. BB does not break the chain here! We've been coming here since we moved to Astoria. Every time is has been as succulent as the next. On this day, my fiancée and I were STARVING. We could have eaten the floor boards, but we settled for the "Butchers" platter. What we got:-Mac & Cheese (Creamy. #1 side dish; I also love the fact they don't do those cheap breadcrumbs to lose the flavor)-String Beans sautéed in bacon fat (what's not to like here?!) MEATS:-Burnt Ends (or meat candy) -Brisket (perfect meat to fat ratio) -Pulled Chicken (least favorite...on the dry side) -Slaw and corn bread came with to settle our stomachs. Overall, outstanding joint on 30th Ave. This is our go to spot when we can't decide. Our waitress was also great! Catlin?! She was kind and even gave us a funny story. Drink prices were a bit high...maybe they should look into a drink special when you buy in bulk or hit a certain $ on your tab?

I discovered this place through Groupon when they displayed a deal that I couldn't pass up... $40 for $80 worth of BBQ! My wife and I headed over to Astoria from Manhattan one Sunday afternoon to partake of their brunch. It was a fantastic experience made even better by our wonderful server, Christina B.! There is some fine print to the Groupon deal and she made us aware immediately of how we could get the most bang for our buck. Immediately she steered us in the direction of the burnt ends and Lord am I glad she did! She even instructed us to get two orders... we should've gotten 3 more orders... or 13 for that matter. They were melt-in-your mouth delicious. We've lived in North Carolina and Texas and this BBQ holds up well against some of the best I've had in both of those places. We ended up ordering two breakfast entrees and while tasty we'll probably just stick with BBQ next time. They were good but when you're at Butcher Bar just stick with what's tried and true, their barbecue. Drink prices were unreal, although when you use a Groupon you can't order off the happy hour menu. Next time, we'll scuttle the coupon and just order off the happy hour menu. All in all, we couldn't have been happier with our experience and we'll certainly be back for more!

Simply outstanding! The selection is great. You will have great food, drinks and dessert is the best part. Try the banana bread pudding. The service was very personalized and although the place was full it wasnt loud. Its not cheap but well worth the price.

I was very satisfied with the Butcher Bar. The BBQ was really good,  just under spectacular. Great meat, cooked well, but the flavor didn't explode. Cornbread could be more moist. Vegetables were great! If I had to criticize on thing, it would be the menu. There should be more mix n match options. The menu was a bit confusing too. In all, I enjoyed my time and I will return with my brother!

My friend and I came here on a Groupon deal and it was one of the most satisfying meals we've both had in a while. If you're in the mood for BBQ and anywhere near Astoria (or even not near Astoria) come here! The burnt ends are fantastic and the staff is just as amazing. Nick G. was our dude for the night and made us feel like we were Butcher Bar regulars. Much appreciated!
Best Brunch in Astoria. Great flavors and nice staff! Surprisingly good veg options too!
This place is excellent!!The food and service is great!!Go and enjoy ....you will not be disappointed Go and enjoy a mouthful of meat!!!

Food was awesome !!! Waitress Emily was great and gave  us great suggestions...the Burnt Ends we on point and the fall off the bone ribs as well!!! Sides were really good too...mash/mac n cheese/ baked beans
Large bbq spot. I would definitely go back for the burnt ends and the Mac and cheese. Wait staff is very attentive to your every need.
