First time visit was July 4th and we lucky to have a table for 2 right away. Irene our server was energetic and warm welcoming us, I ordered Lager beer, cheapest in the beer list $5 but it tastes great. We ordered platter combo with Butcher Bar signature two end burn meat, beef brisket with Mac&cheese on a side. Two end burn meat was slightly sweet seasoning if you like sweet flavor, you will love it, meat very tender . Beef brisket was as well great. Mac&cheese is super cheesy, love it. I checked in on Yelp app and got free side I chose the famous Brussels sprout with bacon sprinkled. Also order Filipino Sausage, I don't like its seasoning maybe becuz I'm not familiar with it's I guess. Total bill: $54, pretty decent price for smoke bar. If you eat in downtown BK it must be 70-80

OMG YELPERS , You have to try the famous "Meat Candy" to die for... My boyfriend and I just enjoyed great service. Emily was super friendly and suggested to add the sautéed onions to our  sandwich and it was delicious  ... I will be back  cheers
I moved to Astoria and this has fast become my favorite Barbecue spot - Not just in Queens but in all of NYC.  The Burnt Ends are their Masterpiece!

We came on a Saturday afternoon. We ordered the brisket, burnt ends, fall off the bone ribs, french fries and Mac and cheese. The food was amazing. High quality meat. Great service. And their sauce is good too. Thanks Liz for taking care of us
Had an amazing experience my first time. Food was incredible! And our server Christina B was super sweet and attentive! Thanks for an awesome experience!

I smoke a lot of meat. I have a wood pellet smoker in my backyard. I've smoked brisket, and I have smoked ribs. I was really looking forward to eating at this place. Imagine my excitement with having a great barbecue place in Queens. Much to my disappointment, the food was bland. I ordered the rubbed ribs and the brisket. I also ordered the macaroni and cheese which was quite good, but that wasn't the focus of the evening. The ribs and the brisket were quite bland and felt like they haven't even been smoked. It took forever just to get the ribs and brisket even though these sort of things are pre made. Anyways I've made much better ribs and much better brisket in my backyard, I definitely won't be coming back.  I don't know how they got these 'awards'.  This bbq was sub par. John Brown, Feta Sau even Mighty Quinn's make better bbq. What a shame...

The food wasn't hot. The Burnt Ends were tasty, but the other meats and sandwiches were just OK.The prices didn't seem worth it compared to the portions, though. The customer service was fine; I appreciate knowledgeable staff. I'm not impressed with Butcher Bar. After reading the business owner's responses to customer reviews here, I'm baffled. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant.

Went to Butcher bar for my sister's birthday to have some brunch. I was blessed with the services with Nick, Emily and Allison. The food was amazing, the service provided by the staff made the experience so much more fun. Overall awesome.

Food was very good, we each got one side and small dish of bbq meat. The plates looked small but we were all very full after. They also have extra sauce on the side if you wanted an extra kick for your meat. Our waitress was super nice and even gave us free desserts on the houseFood: 5Service: 5Price: 5
The food is amazing and the drinks are awesome! Chris is the best!  Would definitely recommend.

This is the best BBQ place in NYC! So stop reading the review and go order. Good quality, organic , and delicious. Order the meat candy platter. The best sides are baked beans and Mac n cheese. Bring a friend , a date , a relative, a co worker, an enemy , just being another mouth to feed and come eat! The food and quality are phenomenal. Emily is fantastic so say hi to her. Pilar is wonderful too- so say hi!
It's great BBQ for being in NY, but when you have had bbq in Texas it's hard for anything to hold par. Staff was great, food came out fast and got 10% for checking in.

This food is great. The service is awesome. Irene ran the bar and was super friendly and attentive and had awesome suggestions. Loved the delicious food and service and vibe. A must if you like bbq!Update: Chris was my bartender today. He was so funny and nice and had amazing service. You better hope you have Chris as a bartender! This place is dope. And his earring. Is. Dope.

It was a really cool ambience, the burnt ends were amazing they have a nice sweet and spicy bbq sauce which had a very nice and tangy flavor not to much of a spicy kick for someone who likes spicy food like myself we also had the pork belly which had a very good flavor, the mac and cheese was very good and the corn bread had this nice little butter that went great with it but I must say the Russell sprouts and bancon gave me a whole new look on Russell sprouts since I wasnt a big fan of them before

Owner Kathy had my review deleted. So let me re-iterate again and will continue to do so! The food here is TERRIBLE. They claim to be real bbq but they do not own a SMOKER. The ribs and brisket were dry. Im from texas so I know GOOD que. Alot of phony 5 star reviews and begging ppl in store to leave good reviews in order to get compensation such as free DRY tasteless sides and watery drinks. If you want good Que in Queens, check out John Browns. The owners actually respond PROFESSIONALLY to constructive criticism.

They offered complimentary apple cake with small apple chunks drizzled with caramel melt. after the end of my meal. The food here is really tasty i had beef brisket and the slice is thin and it is  little bit longer than other places.

I would say it's more like a 3.5 star establishment. Great ambiance, very friendly servers. Hits the spot if you're looking to get your BBQ fix in. Pulled pork was pretty good - nothing to write home about. Sides were great, especially the Mac and cheese - but if it was served warm instead of at somewhat room temperature it would be phenomenal. The cornbread is top notch - one of the best I have had. Good selection of unique and fun drinks, including a jalapeño margarita, which my friend said was fantastic. Overall, good barbecue food and an Astoria staple. I have also ordered pickup online - but for the price, you might as well go and sit down and have the full restaurant experience.

The restaurant ambience was nice it was comfortable and clean.  The service was mediocre, I had to call the waitress over for the bill, meanwhile there were no customers she should have been more attentive and not have a lengthy personal conversation with her co worker.  The grub and cocktail were good.  I would recommend this place if you're craving bbq but don't want to leave the neighborhood.

Technically an LIC-Flea-based reviewed, but if the food and service is consistent, then the B&M is definitely worth the trip.I ordered up the Monster - a sizable sandwich filled with 1/2 pulled pork 1/2 brisket...all nomlicious! The bbq sauce was great, the meat was plentiful, with plenty of side/condiments (slaw, onions, pickles, the works).I also ordered a side of cornbread, which wasn't too shabby - a little bit moist (for it not being of the more-pudding-type variety), but still very tasty.All n all, great food and a staple LIC Flea-go-to!

Came here yesterday afternoon and had a great time! The service was amazing and friendly. The server had recommended the burnt ends, which I haven't had before. With the ends, I also did cornbread and ribs. Once I was finished, I was full!

I liked everything about the place. I got the brisket and it was awesome. The meat isn't smothered in sauce and it is excellent. You add the type you want and as much sauce as you want.  The fried pickles are not greasy and really crunchy.  The service is very good The place has a great vibe. It was super crowded, but the staff handled it well. I went with a Groupon and it was great. I will definitely come back
Excellent brunch today. Our group had burnt ends, omelets, French toast, brisket hash, burgers. It was all delicious. Great atmosphere, staff was super friendly and helpful.

Yelper and other users, checkin to get the YELP DEAL for this place. That's what we did. Yes, I am a fan. After much thought, me and my fiance decided to venture into Astoria for Sunday brunch. I am not sure what drove us to that choice but we just got in the car and drove to find a new place. Parking in Astoria is a battle. If you drive it might take some time find parking. We initially thought of Sugar Freak. The cajun brunch spot cross the street from Butcher Bar. We were enticed by the $14.99 per person boozy brunch ad.   We walked in and immediately seated but the place was busy. I am not a vegan but I am not a fan of seeing raw meat / butchered meat while I eat my burger. We asked to be seated elsewhere and was happily accommodated. The services staff was great, very cheerful and helpful which added to the experience. I ordered the brunch burger without any bacon and a bellini. We opted out of the boozy brunch to save the calories. My fiance ordered the BBQ chicken Sandwich with the Filipino sausage. My fiancé is Filipino and he was not impressed with the taste of the sausage. The food is good and tasty. So if your on a diet don't bother stepping into this place. You don't really have much healthy options. The menu if filled with delicious, finger licking and grease loving bbq food. I must say the fries are awesome and the brunch burger was good.  I am not sure, if we may come back but we did enjoy our experience.

Since I had a Groupon, the boyfriend and I stopped into Butcher Bar for an early dinner one Sunday after visiting the Museum of the Moving Image just down the block. From the longhorn skull displayed on the wall above the bar, to the all-wood rustic décor, could it feel any more like a Texas smokehouse?Their mac 'n cheese was oh-so-savory, especially with the beans and bacon cooked right in, and was my favorite part of our meal. The Monster, which was my 50/50 pulled pork & brisket sandwich, was too sweet and not the pull-apart tender people like in their BBQ - but a little extra spicy sauce fixed that right up. Ended on a high note with their warm and gooey apple caramel cornbread dessert, though~

We were looking forward to checking out this place as we just moved to the area and it's right across the street. The night started off pretty well - we ordered somewhat tasty frozen margaritas and my fiancé spilled hers by accident and they replaced hers of no charge, which was a nice gesture. We had the burnt ends to start, also pretty tasty. When it came for the main course, we ordered the porkys platter. Before the waitress could even set the plate on our table, you could tell the food was colder than Alaska in January and looked very unappetizing (even if it did come out hot). I get that this place is very crowded on the weekends and some of the platters are probably pre-made ahead of time but there is no reason to not have BBQ food come out hot. The food tasted even worse than it looked. I wouldn't bother wasting your time, there are plenty of cheaper better BBQ places a close ride away in LIC to check out.

The absolute worst bbq I've ever had.  Everything was bland and tasteless.  The pork belly was dry and bland.  Burnt ends had the texture of jerky.  Chicken wings were also dry and bland, they were so dry that it just sat in my mouth bc I had trouble swallowing it.  The pull pork was fatty but had some flavor.  The Mac n cheese was ok.  And they forgot our cornbread.  This place is "one and done" for us.  Spend your money elsewhere where more than 1/2 your order will be decent.

Where do I even begin to start!?!?! ... I patronized the Butcher Bar this past Saturday & what a better way to start summer with even better food than I imagined! My boyfriend & I ordered the Mac & cheese which was cooked to perfection, I love smooth & creamy Mac & cheese & it was just that, we also ordered the fried pickles which came recommend by Chris whom by the way was super friendly, nice & helpful & he guaranteed me that I would NOT be disappointed & he was right, it came with a sauce on the side which it didn't even need because the pickles were so crunchy & tasty, lastly we had the Meat Candy" Beef Burnt Ends & there are no words to describe how juicy, flavorful & tender they were (I think I just described it lol) the only thing I'd like to see different is the Butcher Bar possibly adding smoked wings to their menu cooked in the same rub as the brisket!!

By the time I reached for my phone to take a photo of my food, it was all gone.Been here a handful of times and unfortunately I've always missed the "fall off the bone" sauce and FINALLY tonight I got it. First off shout out to our waitress, she was the best, recommended some awesome sides - applewood smoked bacon beans, Mac n cheese, Brussels sprouts and checked up on our a good amount. When I was eating the half rack of fall off the bone I was literally thinking "wow this was totally worth eating low carb / Keto diet" and "I really must be dreaming" it was totally worth waiting for and I almost didn't even want to come thinking it wasn't available but calling ahead came to my aid! Aside from the awesome sides & main entree I also got the Narangansett lager and the apple pie bread at the end. Super satisfied. Thank you butcher bar!

This review is ONLY based on the bar service. We sat at the bar after walking around looking for a bar. There are a lot of option but this was wasn't packed or completely dead. So the 3 of us girls took a seat. Our bartender(young guy, sorry didn't get his name) was really nice. He made some suggestions and took our order. So we ordered what tasted like a coconut margarita(from the machine) which was strong and delicious. My other girl ordered a Moscow mule, which was served in a cute metal like cup. She said it was good. Some time later...a couple more drinks...2 maybe 9 later we decided to munch on some food. Ordered some cheese fries and coleslaw(weird my girl ordered). The cheese fries are small but really taste good, the slaw was slaw. Then our amazing bartender served us Apple Pie Moonshine!!!! OMG!!!!! We were hooked!!!! So after 3 or 4 round of shots later, we ordered a plate of food to share. Blah, food is definitely NOT all that. No flavor on the ribs, brisket or even cornbread. My fellow Yelpers are right. BTW this place gets packed, like a wait and all. While we really enjoyed the bar & drinks here, I don't think we will be returning for any of the flavorless food. There are plenty of other food places to eat while Astoria but don't be discouraged to stop here, come for the Moonshine!!!!!!!!

Had dinner and drinks last night and everything was delicious. The "meat candy" was so good I probably should've ordered seconds. I had the ribs and my wife had a steak and both were prepared to perfection. I used to live in Astoria and only wish this place was around before I moved away. However, this place is definitely now on my must stop when I visit NYC. The resturant atmosphere was nice, clean, and the staff very friendly.
Amazing service!! Kathy and chris were great at making sure we had everything we needed and that the food was up to our standards. Hard pink lemonade delish  would highly recommend

Just had my first visit and   I enjoyed myself thoroughly. Big shout-out to our server Chris who gave 5 star service and  great recommendations : I loved them  all!  I had  the burnt ends,meat was tasty, Brussels sprouts with applewood bacon and french fries didn't need sauce or ketchup, and ice tea.  Topped it.  off with banana pudding ( my choice) which was nice but Chris' suggestion, apple cake was better!Everything tastes better when served with a smile. Thanks Chris. Happy to recommend and looking forward to trying the ribs next time!

Delish!!! I love that you can pick and choose what you want to eat. I usually split the meats with my boyfriend and then we will get a few sides, it's delicious and the servers are nice and friendly. Love going here!!

BEWARE of this place. The owner is one of the nastiest people I have ever encountered. She DM'd me asking me to explain what had happened (see my first review) and basically said it was MY fault for not realizing that THEIR employee charged my card twice. After going back & forth she offered me a $50 gift card if I removed my negative review. No thanks. I would rather be out $50 than to support a business with such a rude business owner. There are so many wonderful places to eat in Astoria, please go give your money to the ones you deserve and need it. I just want my money back, thats it!

The place looks great. I like the ambiance. Water and cocktails were good. Vegetables were probably the best part of our meal. ( the garlic broccoli and the Brussels sprouts.The brisket- dry, not much flavor. Really disappointing.Dry rubbed ribs- not much flavor but at least not dry.Bbq pulled pork- the bbq sauce is tangy for sure probably vinegar based so if you like that kind of bbq sauce then you'll probably like it. If you prefer smoky bbq sauce then probably not. We were hungry so obviously we ate our food but overall disappointing after reading reviews. The service was good. Although our cocktails came when we were basically done with our food so we were disappointed for that. But waitress was very pleasant. The 3 stars is mostly because the food wasn't as good as we were hoping.
DELICIOUS BBQ & drinks in the heart of Astoria! We always have a great time at butcher bar. Staff is friendly and attentive, food is delicious.

Butcher bar is always packed and so I thought I'd give it a try. A packed restaurant typically means that it's pretty good. Well, I was disappointed. The food was bland especially for barbecue and the service was very slow.

Had the meat candy burnt ends sandwich on a Saturday afternoon. We were able to be seated quickly with a group of 3. Good service with employees that reflect the neighborhood.The meat was very tasty and smoky, and the sauce complimented the taste very well. A good Texas style bar-b-que in NY. Hometown still tops my list, but this doesn't have a 1+ hour wait, the long trip to Redhook, and the prices seem a bit better here.

Came here with my Groupon, cause i can't pass up  a bargain. The server was attentive, kind, and patient. They sent us the wrong side, so he brought the correct side and gave us the extra instead of throwing it out. The burnt ends are a must. Everything they say is true. It's really wonderful. I can live without the brisket. The drinks are interesting and have a healthy shot of whatever you order. They're also huge! I couldn't finish my drink and my meal, is I opted for enjoying the Mac and cheese and the burnt ends. Don't forget about your little side of cole slaw. I know it's an afterthought but it's nicely done. You'll be glad you tried it. I'll be back for more burnt ends.

i tried their half rack dry ribs with side of corn bread with honey butter. both of them were absolutely splendid. the corn bread is the best corn bread ive ever tasted, it has actually chunks of corn in it! The ribs are seasoned very well!

Highly disappointed in my visit here. I thought I was coming to get bbq but instead it was a bad imitation. Came with a group of three and we ordered a rack of their sauced ribs, 1/2 pound of brisket, half pound of burnt ends, Mac and cheese, fries, and corn. When there brisket came out I knew before I tasted it that it wasn't going to be good. Absolutely no signs of having been smoked (no smoke ring) and clearly it was very dry. The "double smoked" burnt ends were also dry and had no smokiness to them. The ribs were fall off the bone but were also dry and packed smoke flavor. The sides were average. The service was good but that doesn't make up for the poor quality of food especially when you consider how much they charge for the "bbq". Anyone looking for good bbq should steer clear of this place because they definitely are not serving bbq just some bad imitation.

Finally managed to get the Fall-off-the-bone ribs, and let me tell you, I am happier than a dog in a shoe store with a ball pit.The meat was so tender, it broke the moment I stuck my fork in it. The sauce so delicious, that I spent no time the entire meal muttering a sound, instead taking every second to enjoy and absorb the fantastic meal before me.The cornbread was moist and fluffy. The brussel sprouts simply wonderful, cooked to just the right amount of crisp, and an absolute compliment to the rest of the meal. Also the cole slaw was great. Oh and did I mention the service? Friendly as heck and accomodating too.Coming tonight was just an absolute joy, and I certainly will be doing it again soon.

Came in on a Sunday morning with my partner and the food was amazing! Fresh and tasty authentic BBQ. I got the brisket hash platter recccommended by our awesome server Cristina B. And a 1/4 of the infamous meat candy. 10/10 recommend and Cristina you were amazing!

This is honestly the best meal I've had in 20+ years in NYC!!!  Nick was an amazing server, the bartender makes some awesome drinks and I can't even begin to explain how great the award winning ribs are!!!  This is a MUST GO PLACE in Queens.  I know because I work in the industry for over 20 years and grew up in the mid west with great ribs!!!  My favorite spot in the whole city!!!!!!!!!!  Get your ass from Manhattan to come check this place out!
Never disappoints! Have had a few date nights and girls dinners here. Love the cinnamon moonshine shot with a beer chaser. Meat candy is delicious and the service is on point! Yum
Burger was DELICIOUS! It took a while to reach me but I appreciated the bartenders apology.The service was spotty but the burger made up for it.

They should hand you a flare when you walk in.The service is horrible. Waitress waa nowhere to be found after they sat us down. A flare is appropriate or maybe a matchbook for smoke signals. Gentleman behind register had take our order. Horrible
This place is amazing thanks to the bartenders Lisa and Chris. If you want a place to chill on Friday and Saturday's late night until 2am check out butcher bar!! Bless up

The Best BBQ Joint In Queens! So I needed to arrange a surprise 40th dinner for my husband. I sent an email request & within 24hrs Kathy responded. She was very accommodating and helpful and she helped me come up with a menu to the amount of guests who were attending. She totally knew what she was doing because there was an abundance of food. Everyone was very pleased with the food & the variety & we had plenty of doggie bags to take home. On the evening that we were there Chris  was in charge of our table. The service was even better than the food! Himself and his staff were very attentive. Our drinks never ran out & our food came out in a timely fashion. & not once were we rushed. It was an amazing experience from beginning to end! Thank you Kathy! Thank you Chris! You've made our first experience at Butcher Bar memorable, it definitely won't be the last! I couldn't ask for anything more. Kindly,Erika
Had an amazing time for my bday with my loved ones . Deff recommend you this  Cathy was so great my birthday was the 19th and my dads was the 20th of July!!!! Had the best bday ever

There's no pride in the workplace there, maybe one person but that's it. Hard to see that when nobody can admit to their mistakes. And Matt, one of the owners, what a real piece of work. I don't give it long before the business tanks.
Service: 4/5Food: 2/5It's ok. Not good though. Wouldn't ever go again. It's like if an Eskimo heard about BBQ though word of mouth and tried to recreate it to its best ability using Seal meat.

I ordered through grubhub and ordered for a pickup. What a disappointment. Barely any meat and potato couldnt be any bigger. Pork and chicken was okay. Beef was just so tasteless and rubberish. I wont be back.
Extremely disappointed and I've been meaning to come here for quite some time. Ordered the give me the beef platter and got nothing by dry meat. Wasted money, wasted Friday night dinner.

Really wanted to like it. Drove all the way to Astoria...but sadly was not worth the trip.Pros: One saving grace, the Burnt Ends. I'd give 5 stars for that alone. Cons: everything else. pork belly, pulled pork, brisket. All kind of dry and/or strange texture. Some of my least favorite sides....beans were watery and just eww with dried pieces of pork. Cornbread also dry and crumbly. If you have to come here, get the burnt ends and a beer.
Kathy was amazing funny and very friendly the food was excellent and the wings are amazing and the burnt ends

If you are a meat lover and find yourself in the mood for greasy cheese fries which are a must side dish for any sandwich or meat order, give BB a shot. BB is reasonably priced for being an organic meat focused restaurant. I have been to the Astoria location twice and both times did have to wait for a table for about 20 min. The place is always crowded!!!! However once seated your order is taken promptly by a jolly server and the sandwiches are on point. My go to is a brisket sandwich ( can't you tell I love my Jewish roots ) Try to avoid ordering their Mac and cheese as it does not come out right. First time it was cold all around. Second time it was burnt on the outside and still cold inside. BB is not a place to order a dessert. Their apple pie is just as good as store bought or maybe it was purchased at C Town two blocks away.... who knows!!!Bottom line, get here early to satisfy your meat cravings!
Really good brunch and great service. Definitely the best barbecue in queens. Tried it on a Groupon but would have paid full price for the food. I can't wait to go back.

I went here with my husband and several of our friends to celebrate my husband's 30th. Chris was amazing and so accommodating. Our server was Emily and she was so nice, awesome and quick with our drinks and food. Food wise, it was delicious! I would definitely recommend the pulled pork, mashed potatoes and the Mac and cheese. Thanks again Chris!!!!

So, I'm not a big BBQ fan, but if you're craving BBQ in Astoria, this is the place to be. After being told that we would have to wait 20-25 minutes for a table for three on Friday night, we actually got in just 4 minutes later.When we were seated, Rory, our waiter, told us that there were no more burnt ends, which was super disappointing because that's all I read about on Yelp! In lieu of that, we ordered the pulled pork sandwich ($13), the monster 50/50 sandwich ($15) and the porky's platter ($25). I had the pulled pork sandwich, but I think we all agreed that the various meats were kind of dry, so we all had to use the original BBQ sauce which was on the table. The sauce was delicious, so that wasn't an issue, but I thought I would point that out.While I ate there, I thought that the prices were just a little bit high for the amount of food. Thinking back, though, it was probably worth it. Maybe I don't know BBQ, but I think it would be much more worth it if they knocked $1 off of each item. In any event, the food was delicious.Additionally, Rory was very friendly and knowledgeable. He gave us a rundown of all the meats when he first came by, and he hooked us up with an extra dessert even though we only ordered two. Rory is awesome! At the end of the day, I'll definitely be coming back, and that's saying something since I'm not a big BBQ fan!

I understand this place has won awards for its BBQ - so be it.Arrived on a Wednesday evening (group of 3) at 630pm without a reservation (no reservations taken here) and was promptly seated.  Attended to within reasonable time by server who listened to our order (felt a little uncomfortable that she did not write the order down thinking that this was a mistake-in-the-making).For appetizers we got the wakka's guacamole and the smoked & fried wings - both were under-performing.  The guac was bland and appeared to come from a bottle rather than freshly made.  The wings (ordered buffalo sauce) was very buttery with no real hot/spicy flavor.Main order came- and as I had dreaded- came to the take wrong.  Burger #1 was ordered with ONLY onions, pickles and mustard - instead came with a heap of sauteed onions and mushrooms.  Burger #2 did not come out as ordered at all.  My order (Gimme the Beef), thankfully, came out without a problem (I guess due to the fact that I ordered it "as-is" without any requests).  I tried to point out the errors to the server (a different person than the one who took our order) but she was irritated and didn't want to be bothered.  Gimme the Beef - I liked smoked burnt ends.  They were full of flavor.  The brisket was dry, and bland.  Mashed potatoes and mushroom gravy is excellent choice for a side.  Cole slaw and pickled were just okay. Worth a trip if in the area- perhaps I got them on an off-day.  Worth a repeat? I will pass.

This place is as bad as it gets. The staff is rude. They made us wait an hour and we were forced to walk out. Terrible management!!! These folks don't deserve to stay in business. We kept being told to wait 15 minutes and then the shift change took place and the new hostess didn't have a clue. They never apologized and we had no option but to walk out. Never again . Horrible place and management. Additionally, Look at their response. They are calling us idiots and associating us with Jon who we have no idea who that is and that statement alone should tell everyone the whole story. Save yourself the aggravations and go to another place. Bareburger around the corner is a whole new experience! Unfortunately 1 star is the only option we have as they deserve none!

I don't get the 4 stars. We ordered the fall off the bone ribs, chicken, burnt beef tips, Mac and cheese, and cornbread. First of all most of the food was lukewarm to touch. The cook seems lazy since he just threw a little bbq sauce on one side of the ribs. Portions were kid sized. I wasn't even full after ordering all that food. Service was okay, they never checked in. Only to order and to pay.

I came to this spot with my family & we had an okay time. This spot is SMALL; limited seating + tables. It would help the hostess as well as guests with parties 3+ that she'd know how to utilize the space. There's NO reason to wait an hr or more for a table. There were single tables (couple seating) EMPTY while she sat party of 2's in booth spots (in the middle at that) only leaving more single tables available while abt 3 parties of 3+ were waiting. She actually seated a white family of 4 before us, who came AFTER us because we were 5 stating that the seating arrangement wouldn't allow 5 but she added that extra seat to the table we were finally seated & it was the same set up. Can't say she was racist cause she looked latina but definitely prejudiced! Which leads me to the next prejudiced staff, Lisa @ the bar! I sat at the bar to order a drink & she walked past me several times, didnt ask if I wanted a menu or anything. So I flagged down the guy (didn't get his name) he gave me menu and I ordered with him. I promise you not even 2 minutes after I ordered & the guy is STILL making my drink, Lisa presents me with the check! The same person who was ignoring my existence suddenly shows up! That's why I didn't feel bad for her when the white dude + his kid next to us  ran out on the bill on her. She ran outside to look for them but they were GONE! She obviously can't do her job well!The food: the appetizers are the BEST thing on the menu. Just do the bar (if they have HH) & go home.Pulled bbq chicken unflavorful.Smoked turkey no flavor!Mac & cheese = DO NOT ORDERMashed potatoes= okay One skirt steak was BURNT when asked for well done & the orders were mixed up. Apple crumb cake =you can skip itI've been to several cities in Texas & ate BBQ. This is the worse way you can represent! Do better butcher bar.

This is my second visit to Butcher Bar, and the barbecue simply is nothing to write home about. Thought it may have been a fluke, but I'd not recommend coming here if you're in the mood for some good BBQ. We ordered a handful of apps, meats and sides. The brisket was quite dry. The Cobb salad barely had any bacon - and this is a meat place. My boyfriend was also underwhelmed by the burnt ends. The Philly cheesesteak was okay (best among what we ordered), but just keep in mind the go-to BBQ items definitely aren't great. I will say the drinks are amazing. Great cocktails but not a good BBQ joint.

All I can say is BURNT ENDS...ever since I had them, I dreamt of them day and night...So I went back to 2 weeks ago to NYC to see some friends and I was so excited to meet one of my friend's baby boy! First, it's cold out so we couldn't go to a park or anything so I had to do my research on restaurants that are baby friendly. Butcher Bar was recommended to me (knives as door handles, baby friendly..CHECK). So we came and the ambient was perfect, I loved the southern barn feel. Then there are TVs so I was able to keep an eye on the football game. We got a seat immediately during a Sunday afternoon lunch time, so it means that the place is busy but not obnoxious where you have to wait 13 years for a meal. We got a 4 seater so score! The baby sat in his seat next to mommy on the bench against the wall. Both my friend and I got the brunch with one drink deal and both of us got Burnt Ends & Scrambled Eggs. It was perfect, just a good balance of juicy and crispy meat, eggs, potatoes and greens. I usually hate brunch food (I know, how could I?!), just sick of the the usual omelette, sausages, cheese and bacon combo..BORING. But this plate was perfect. The drinks did come a little late they are forgiven because the service and food was amazing.Overall I really would recommend this place, even the baby boy liked it! It's cozy, delicious meat, great service and I can't wait to have more burnt ends!

Owner making threats then blocked me. This was the most unprofessional exchange I've ever had with a business owner. Also the most fun I've ever had with a business owner. Shame she blocked me like a coward.

Came here with a friend. It's a pretty laid back, casual restaurant. We ordered the appetizer that was similar to a KFC bowl (mashed potato, cheese, corn, chicken). This was good but not worth $12, it was a small portion that didn't have enough toppings, it was mostly mashed potatoes. Instead I would just order a side of the mashed potatoes for about $5, $6. I also ordered the brisket and Mac n cheese. The brisket was on the dry side and I wasn't crazy about the spices used. The Mac n cheese was good. My friend got a sandwich that was similar to a Philly cheesesteak that came w brisket, 3 cheeses and onions. It was good but very heavy, and again the brisket was on the dry side. It was a nice place but I'm not sure if I would come back.

Not sure what happened, this place use to be one of my favs. They ran out of burnt ends, which happens I get it, but I didn't think when I settled for brisket that it would be such a step down. It tasted of absolutely nothing. I get that not everyone likes sauce, I actually don't either, but I had to drown it to get any semblance of flavor. Tender, yes, but bland as hell. Pork belly also had no flavor, but fatty pork tends to be a bit more forgiving. Mac and cheese was still good, cornbread also great. Burger came with no fries, which is kind of ridiculous when you're charging $15.

Awesome BBQ spot! Quick and super friendly service. To start, we got the "meat candy" appetizer of burnt ends which were tender and delicious; practically melted in your mouth. Definitely recommend!For my entree I ordered a Monster 50/50 which comes with a side of slaw and pickles. The burger was delicious and has an awesome kick to it because of the jalapeño. (Literally forgot to take a picture at first). Amazingly both the pickles and the cole slaw were also delicious. I also ordered a Mac and cheese (which they forgot initially but promptly served once they were notified) on the side and it was creamy and decadent. My date got the pulled BBQ chicken carvery and a side of the cornbread and honey butter and said she really enjoyed it as well. The pulled chicken has a lot of BBQ sauce and the cornbread was very moist and not dry. To top it off the waitress offered us a complimentary piece of the Grandma's Apple Cake as dessert which was really nice. Good cake but not necessarily something I would order on my own. Overall, it was a great experience and our waitress, Gina, was very sweet. Will definitely be back.
Amazing candied beef tips! The appetizer was so good we got the sandwich too! 30th St. Is a cool little area! Would definitely recommend!

I am gonna have to keep this review short because I got a good buzz going from the draft beers here. This is a very nice place with great food in my opinion. The staff is friendly and helpful if it's your first time here. I ordered the animal burger with fries and my girlfriend ordered the chicken tenders with broccoli and spinach. Everything was delicious and very filling. I will return to try other items from the menu.

It's not a common practice of mine to post an in depth review, but today stands as an exception. My world, from a culinary perspective, opened up when I met Irene. To call it good service would in fact be a disservice to an unparalleled dining experience. Someone please tell, Mr. Butcher, that he has found a profound talent in Irene. Long live Irene and god bless mr butcher!
This place is amazing, christina is the best!!  Burned ends sandwich is amazing.  Complimentary shots and dessert was great! Thank you!

Lovely servers but bland and overly sweet food. Would be great to have some vinegar sauce to cut through the sweetness/blandness of the meat. We had the sauced ribs, mac and cheese, corn bread and the porky platter. The sauced ribs were the best of the bunch.

I've been to Butcher Bar twice, both times were really just meh at best. The burnt ends are supposed to be the thing to get there but both times I got them they were pretty flavorless, no smoke or anything. We also had the turkey burger which was very overdone (which is easy to do to turkey burgers) but it was also completely flavorless.My buddy got the ribs which he said were pretty good.  But the most surprising part was that the cornbread was really subpar. We get corn bread from Trade Fair when we make chili and it's exponentially better at the supermarket then at the bbq joint, very strange.

The Turkey was great. The mashed potatoes and gravy sucked, there wasnt much gravy. The mac and cheese was very dry and just ok. I dont want to be too hard on this place since I ordered delivery and that might be why it was subpar. The Turkey and spicy sauce was amazing so that in itself was worth it, just wish for more Turkey

Awesome atmosphere, delicious food, friendly staff and awesome drinks. Pricing is reasonable and there's a municipal parking lot down the block. Mac and cheese kinda tastes a little like Stouffers Mac and cheese but the burnt ends and brisket is bomb! And their drink menu is good. Definitely worth coming and experiencing at least once. But come here more than once because this place is absolutely worth the trip!

3.5 starsCame here to try their popular burnt ends. I got it with the burger and it ended up being around $15, which is expensive even though it comes with cole slaw, pickles, and cornbread. The burger was very good though. Burnt ends...slightly crispy, slightly sweet...yum! The biggest tip I can give is to make a Yelp account if you don't already have one and to check in because you get a free side just by doing so! That's like saving $5 with just a few clicks on your phone! I got the mac and cheese and it was really good. Very creamy and flavorful. Overall, I would say the prices here are a little high but the food is solid. Place is pretty spacious and clean. Rounding up because the server that I had was super friendly and attentive!

The food was just ok, but serivce was very, very subpar. We went in to Butcher Bar for a late dinner on a Sunday night, around 8PM. We are greeted nicely and chose to sit at the bar. We were 2 of the 4 people sitting at the bar. Upon being greeted by the bartender, it was quite obvious he was not sober. I was never given his name. I asked what rotating drafts they had, and he did not mention the holiday draft I could see directly behind him. I asked about it, he said he didn't know and offered for me to try it. I received the sample and ordered the draft. We then ordered dinner soon after, and chose to split the Gimme Beef. The kitchen was out of the burnt ends for the night, and we were offered ribs in replacement. We accepted them, though it is not what we would have preferred. We then ordered a margarita, but the bartender never made it. He played on his phone instead. The food came out and the ribs, brisket and Mac and cheese were all cold. The coleslaw was too salty. We ate our food without complaint, mostly because the bartender was nowhere to be found. We finished our food and I stacked the plates, the bartender watched from the computer at the end of the bar, again on his phone. He never came down to take the plates or offer the check. Soon after he walked outside and came back a few minutes later with friends behind him, and sat at a table and chatted with them while ignoring us. I had to ask a server, Emily, for our check. She was pleasant, understanding and apologetic about the situation. Emily offered to make us the drink we never received, but we declined because we were ready to leave. Emily kindly closed our check and we never saw the bartender again. Would not recommend.

LOVED this place!! It was my number 1 bottomless brunch spot for almost 2 years. My boyfriend and I went almost every weekend for the mimosas, the Burnt ends & scrambled eggs. I recently went on vacation for 2 weeks and when I returned I was disappointed to hear that they discontinued Bottomless Brunch. They now have more drink and food options which I guess was aimed at getting more customers but as a regular there it was a major blow. I noticed they also had new brunch staff that weren't as experienced and a little slower than the normal people (I know service industry has a lot of turnover). My food also came out a little cold which is unusual for them. Other than that 1 bad experience the food and service of this place has always been great. However I don't think we will be back as often now that the bottomless is gone.

The Butcher Bar has taken a turn for the worse.  The food was mediocre and the kitchen service was terrible w wrong orders and cold food.   Although management claims, there has been no change in the kitchen, we found that hard to believe with the recent quality of service .I felt compelled to reply to the response of the owner.  First, the Fries were the only thing we didn't complain about. ( and you didn't give us additional fries.). Second, our order was sent back 3x.   The ribs and Mac and Cheese were tasteless . As a fellow business owner, shame on you for this reply! (Future customers, READ this ! ). Good luck in 2019!

Butcher Bar was out of Sauced Ribs when I visited, but I didn't miss them because the Dry Rubbed Ribs were goddamn amazing!Some of the sides were surprisingly good too, particularly the Brussels sprouts and garlic broccoli. The house slaw was pretty good but could have used more red onion mixed into it for a kick.Not all the food was outstanding, but I will come back for the ribs! The smoked pork belly was pretty good (it's hard to make a bad pork belly dish!) but I didn't really enjoy the brisket or burnt ends.
Excellent spot!!!! I absolutely love it and recommend!!! Burnt ends are a must!!! The bread pudding dessert is amazing!!!!

Awesome burger. Went to Burger Klub the month before and thought that was as good as it gets for Astoria. Their Butcher burger is a great signature burger with everything you would expect from such a fine piece of meat.I'm not a fan of thick bready buns and wish they offered different choices. It still worked really well and I left knowing I'd be back to make an event out of their main attraction.Awesome place to hang out, drink beers and enjoy tasty food.

This place was phenomenal! My plans were to go to a place across the street, and I wasn't familiar with the area but my plans were ruined when the place was closed... Yet what do I find across the street? This lifesaver butcher bar and the most delicious food I could ask for along with the best service.  I was immediately addicted to the food and the atmosphere, and I wish it was closer to home!  I definitely will be back and I highly recommend this place.

Great location and service was amazing! We ordered brisket tacos, half baked mac n cheese, and fall off the bone ribs. Great portion size and the ribs were amazing! Mac n cheese was great, but I was expecting an authentic brisket, and I wasn't a fan of them. Overall great experience!

I must say the atmosphere and service is amazing. Music is not too loud. Staff let's us talk and are not instusive. We started with the Mac n cheese topped with chili & bacon. I wanted to order another portion but we had already ordered our entrees.I ordered the platter of 1/4 of burnt ends and 1/4 brisket. It came with pickles, cole slaw, 2 pcs of corn bread and side of chouce. I choose the string beans with bacon and onions. It was amazing but a little small for the price. My friend had the regular burger (can't remember the name) she said it was one of the best she has tasted.We both had the mixed berry drink which was AMAZING!!!Then we ordered the grandma's apple cake. It was warm and gooey but nothing I would order again.My suggestion: order off the appetizers for the table with a couple of drinks and sample everything :)

After a few years in the Astoria area, we have had Butcher Bar takeout several times. It's a decent and reliable place, but definitely not my personal favorite BBQ. I've tried a variety of their BBQ meats. Rib meat is dryer than I'd like and it's happened on more than one occasion, though I may have to try the "sauced" ribs rather than the dry-rub. The BBQ sauce is on the sweeter side with almost no complexity of flavor. I have been similarly disappointed by the side of beans; they are just too sweet and one note for me (I also have the bar set high - I'm pretty obsessed with Mighty Quinn's burnt end beans).Onto the good: mac and cheese is good, as is the corn bread. And the key lime pie dessert? TO DIE FOR DELICIOUS.Will I order from here again? Yes, but I may stick to a few items and branch out for others.

Hi Kathy, I really appreciate you trying to make things right. I was going to address the situation on the spot but didn't want to cause a scene or embarass the hostess. I have no problem speaking my mind and when she told me to wait while she checked, I assumed she already spoke to who ever was in charge. Didn't feel like I had to ask again and again. Once should have been enough. Nevertheless, I'm changing to four stars simply based on your  kind and professional gesture and offer.  Hopefully she can learn from this experience so your business can thrive on overall service. She may not earn in tips but the wait staff does and her decisions can affect what they earn and needs to know that. It isn't fair but it does happen. I've seen it firsthand as a waitress myself years ago. Keep up the positive  and inviting hospitality...it can go a long way.
Worst turkey burger ever had. Overpriced and tasted like rubber

I'm just in love with this place. First off I want to thank Matt and Chris for always making my visit here so amazing. Now let's talk food. This is not a BAR people. Yes they may serve beers but this is a restaurant. A very family friendly restaurant at that. Once you walk in you will feel comfortable and see families eating or friends hanging out grabbing a bite or maybe even people having a business lunch or dinner. It's that kind of vibe. Now for the food. To die for. I always get "Gimmie the Beef" it's burnt ends and briskets with some other things but it's just delicious. The Mac and cheese here is also very good. Usually to me it's just cheese but this places forces me to treat Mac and cheese as a decent side. Oh and their chicken wings, I am honestly just impressed.

In search of a hearty brunch to get together for our yearly Friendsgiving catchup my friends and I decided on Butcher Bar. And thank heavens we did. Hands down the best brunch I've had in a long time. I ordered the eggs benedict with Filipino sausage over cornbread. AMAZING. Its not 100% traditional Filipino longanisa but its delicious, especially paired with their cornbread. I wish I could eat it daily. Also ordered a side of mac and cheese because I was clearly in a gluttonous mood and was not disappointed. My friends ordered dishes with brisket and bbq chicken and they were flavorful as well. We took advantage of their unlimited drinks option. Never felt rushed. Our server was awesome! Rory definitely made our day. I can't wait to return for another brunch and I definitely want to try out their dinner menu for some good ole bbq.

This is the best place in Astoria to eat a good brisket. Everything we order is always AMAZING. I love the brisket, burnt ends, mac&cheese, cheese fries, corn on the cub, and corn bread. We never waited for more than 10 minutes to be seated. You may wait awhile for your food but it is worth it. We even go there for aniversaries and birthdays. If you are a bbq enthusiast or a meat lover, you should definitely check this place.
The beef brisket was smoky, juicy, tender & so good! It came with pickle & hot sauce.

I came here with some co-workers for happy hour a few months back. The food was good and there were options for vegetarian and vegans. The service was great and our waitress was so nice. They even gave us a free round of shots. I had the apple pie moonshine and loved it!

meh, i think the reviews are a bit on the gracious side, service is ok at best, smiley and friendly but not efficientfood is a bit of a let downdrinks may be overpriced, like a 4oz bloody mary for 10+, take into consideration for ice, maybe they should use a bigger glass?ok but nothing to write home about, i wouldnt bring out of town friendsmore of a do you feel like bbq? whats close? ooh yeah butchers bar? interest? ehhh, maybe just get chinese...

The hostess was gracious and did her best to sit our large party together.   The servers were friendly, and accomodating. The food took a long time to come (what can we expect on a busy Saturday night), but the servers kept the drinks coming, and the hostess gave us cornbread while we were waiting. Everything i ate was delicious (street tacos, burnt ends, brussel sprouts).  I wouldn't say the barbecue sauce is my favorite but it was tasty, and some of our guests were not fans of the dry brisket but I thought it was extremely tender and delicious.  A definite try is the jalapeno Margarita.Im still dreaming of the burnt ends...

My boyfriend and I came here last week and the service/ food was excellent! The brisket, pull pork & cornbread was phenomenal! I highly recommend trying this place & grabbing one of the good signature beers; which compliments the food.

We wanted astoria. we wanted bbq. we got butcher bar! cam on a thursday night around 8:30pm and were immediately seated, with options both inside and out! it was such a pleasant experience. to start, i am gluten and dairy free and they had lots of options AND a gf beer and 2 different ciders plus a full barr! the waitress answered all of my questions about ingredients and dishes and was super patient! i got the rave reviewed beef ends and brisket combo with fries. the brisket was a bit dry but the burnt ends were AMAZE!!!!! boyfriend got the fall off the bone ribs and finished half. the food came out fast and hot and we were really pleased. blows dinosaur bbq out of the park. my only complaint, brussels were supposed to have bacon and there were literally 2 small diced up pieces. we'll be back!

I love this place. Food was great. Their brunch menu is outstanding the eggs so fluffy n tasty.  My fav is the their burnt end and Brussels sprout. The waiters are very attentive and nice. Love everything about butcher bar

For my birthday I wanted some good BBQ food. After reading all the reviews, my family and I decide to go to this restaurant. We got a table, the waitress came and took our order and said the side order came with the meal. We waited a long time for our food to arrive was problem # 1. Problem # 2 since they took a long to bring our food you would think the food would be hot!!! Nope, it was cold. I ordered the dry rub ribs because I like tasting the season on the ribs before I add bbq sauce to it. The ribs had NO flavor and then added their bbq sauce to the ribs it still couldn't help these ribs taste good. I also ordered the beef brisket, but my waitress forgot to bring it with our order. I let her know and she ask if she could bring it to me now, I said no thank you. The mac & cheese tasted like it was made using government cheese ( if you never heard about government cheese look it up). My family also was unhappy with their food. We got chance for the sides ordered, so I guess it doesn't come with the meal. I was already upset with the whole experience we paid and just walked out; I left a note because I didn't leave a tip with the reason why I didn't leave a tip. When I got home, I did call the restaurant to explain the note I left. The manager was very friendly and said she wish we would have told her when we were at the restaurant. She stated that she would have changed all of our meal if we were unhappy with the food.Sorry, Kathy, I am a real customer that was at your restaurant today for my birthday. Everything I wrote in my comment was accurate. How dare you try to discredit a customer just because I wrote my experience at your restaurant today. Kathy, instead of you trying to clip-back at a custom. You should be making to correction at your restaurant so other customers won't be unhappy with their food and service like we were. It just shows how unprofessional you as a manager really is.
Cristina B. Is the best!!! The food is great, will definitely be back again soon! I ordered the bone in rib-eye with the brussel sprouts, mac and cheese, and spinach.

We placed an order for pick-up for a last minute 4th of July BBQ dinner. *Butcher's Platter- choice of meat: smoked & pulled pork, smoked beef brisket, and grilled chicken breast. It came with choice of sides: corn on the cob, and mac & cheese. *Fall off the bone Ribs w/ coleslaw and opt for side of sweet potatoes*1/4 double smoked beef burnt endsTotal: $70.00 w/ tax The portions were pretty small especially for the beef burnt ends. Though it was delicious, it only contained a few pieces. It was pricey compared to other items. The pulled pork was juicy and full of flavor. Unfortunately, the beef brisket and grilled chicken breast was too dry. We had to smother it with BBQ sauce. The ribs were good and plentiful. My daughter end up devouring 2 pcs along with the beef burnt ends. She's a really picky eater. We were surprised that she willingly ate the meat. The sides were great esp the mac & cheese. It was creamy with a touch of cayenne pepper. The only downfall for us was the sweet potatoes. It was very damp and sticky. It looks like it had been marinated in a sauce for too long. Taste-wise, it was a bit off. I do like that they use organic and locally sourced quality meats. So that factors in the cost. However, for take-out the platters and sides are way too small. Not sure if the portions are bigger when you eat in. Hub did noted the staff was attentive and offered water or soda while waiting for the pick-up. Def will return for their "candy" burnt ends and other items! I would give it 3.5 stars for the first try. Hopefully, we'll get a chance to dine in another time and compare if the portions varies.

Words can not describe how good the food is here.  I have been to Texas, and it is better than the best place I have tried there.  That is saying loads for a place located in Astoria, Queens.The wet ribs are to die for.  Even the bones are tender enough to eat.The pulled pork is also to die for.  Perfectly sauced and tasted delicious.The beef brisket melts in your mouth.  It's not possible to get high off taste alone, but if it were this beef brisket would do it.The bbq Turkey, which they only serve on the weekends, is the absolute best.  Not a bit dry, at all.  They do this by making it only when the demand is there, so it does not become dry, hence its limited availability.  It's a must try.The staff is wonderful as well.  The bartenders are curtious and attend to your every need.  They make you feel like you're at home.I don't know if they give michelin stars to casual bbq joints, but if they do this place deserves 3.  It's the best resturant in Astoria, which has one of the most intense restaurant markets in NYC.  This place deserves 6 stars.

Butcher Bar is definitely one of the best BBQ places in NYC. The quality of meat they use, is showcased in every item ordered. It is also very hard to find a BBQ place where the sides are just as good as the meats, but here, they are!! As for sides, we ordered mashed potatos, mac & cheese, pickles, coleslaw, & all were delicious. To top it off, our server Emily was incredibly personable & attentive. She gave us honest & legit food recommendations, and made us feel very at home. We live in the neighborhood, and will for sure add Butcher Bar to our go-to list when in the mood for great BBQ, and friendly neighborhood service.

I tried to order from the Yelp app and got a call 15 minutes later saying the items weren't available at this time (ordered lunch when they were serving brunch). Why is it even an option? I must've looked like I was about to cry because my guardian angel Gina stepped in and saved the day. She was truly amazing and figured out how to order almost all the stuff I originally wanted just under different names. They put it together so quickly and with such great customer service. I would venture back here and I don't even live in the area. Aside from my ordering fiasco, there's a lot of things to like about Butcher Bar. Their meats are organic, grass fed, and pasture raised. We tried pretty much everything that was available at the time- the pulled pork, dry and wet ribs were the best. Brisket was ok and grilled chicken was a little dry. Pickles and slaw were great, Mac n cheese could've been cheesier. The restaurant is wide open and just big enough to fit a brunch crowd comfortably. Can I mention the changing table in the ladies room?! After lots of baby wrestling on restaurant bathroom floors it's much appreciated.

So I live up the block from Butcher Bar and they've been on my "to eat" list for quite some time now. As far as stars go I'm between 4 and 4.5 - but I'm not ready to bump it up to 5 until I go back and check out their "Meat Candy" Beef Burnt Ends and their "Butcher Bowl" (mashed potatoes, fresh corn & jack cheese topped w/your choice of Smoked Pork or BBQ Chicken.)Last Saturday I came here for dinner with my fiancé after a fun filled day in Brooklyn. We were planning on going to one of my favorite Italian food restaurants but the MTA had different plans for us so we decided to go here. He had been here for cocktails and I had been here...never - although I truly, truly, truly regret not checking them out back when they were BYOB - (RIP because now they sell booze themselves).As my entree I ordered their Half Baked Mac & Cheese off of their appetizer menu. They describe it as being their famous creamy mac & cheese, oven baked in a cast iron skillet topped w/ grass fed beef chili, bacon bits  & jack cheese. I asked for the chili on the side because I worried that if it was too spicy then it would ruin the meal for me.The waiter asked me if we were sharing it and I responded back that I was gonna treat this cheesy sucker as my main meal. He was concerned that I wouldn't be able finish it all on my own. He also stressed that this was a serving for two and that I would not be able to handle it all on my own...yeahhhh...he clearly doesn't know me, lol. I stood firm in my order.My sweetheart ordered their Smoked Ribs. There are two options here - House Dry Rubbed and Fall Off The Bone Sauced and he opted for the latter. On BB's menu they are described as being "smoked til they fall off the bone" and "sauced just right". He gave me a rib and I've gotta say, IT TOTALLY FELL OFF THE BONE aaaaaaand WAS SAUCED JUST RIGHT!! Lol. These ribs are easily in the top 3 ribs I've ever had at a restaurant. Yes, they were that good.My mac and cheese was delightfully creamy and I'm happy to report that while the beef chili had a little bit of kick, it was totally fine for me! Trust, my tolerance for spicy anything isn't great and their chili was super flavorful and generously meaty. The mac also came with crispy bacon bits (of kind of thick cut bacon...sooooooo not complaining here!) and was really good without being overpowering. We also shared sides of mashed potatoes and their french fries (go hard or go home, amirite?). The mashed potatoes were really delicious and made chunky with the skins on - just the way I like em'. The fries were unbearably salty for me. I could barely get through 4 or 5 before throwing in the french fry towel. I did like that they were clearly hand cut, with the skin on and rather thick. Just a little less salt tossed in next time would make me a happier camper.Both my fiancé and I really enjoyed our meal here. Even though it was like a 20 minute wait  to get a table - it was a Saturday around 7ish - so totally understandable. Everyone was great from the hostess, to the bartender, to our really attentive and personable waiter. Great service, great food and located in a fantastic location. Anyone giving Butcher Bar 2 stars and a place like Dallas BBQs 4 needs a palette readjustment because it's like comparing Morton's Steakhouse to Burger King (*sips her tea* just my opinion, lol).I love you Butcher Bar and I can't wait to be back! :)

WHO: party of 1WHY: hungerWHAT: (Deets) I ordered the 1/4 pound Burnt ends and got a free side (honey butter cornbread) with my Yelp check in (Scoooooooore!!). The burnt ends were my whole LIFE, delectable sweet crunchy charred outer layer...perfectly seasoned tender inner layers...HEAVEN! (I had an order to stay AND one to go (worth it!) Thanks to Gina for the drink recommendation, the white sangria was just the right amount of light sweetness with fresh fruit goodness. Thanks Matt for the hospitality!!WHEN: 6/28/17 dinner time WHERE: dine in/take awayHOW: bike/ public transportation Q18 bus, N trainBATHROOM: roomy (2 stall, separate gender)WIFI: yes "Butcher Bar Guest"DRESS CODE: as you likeSERVICE: Katy was attentive and often anticipated my needs throughout my meal! She checked on my without being overbearing. It was perfection! Thank you ;)BOTTOM LINE: visit this place repeatedly TIP: if you are a TRUE carnivore/omnivore...treat yourself to the burnt ends

Pretty solid BBQ joint in Astoria - good choice if you're around the area. However, definitely not the best BBQ in NYC.I came here to redeem a Groupon which included 2 beers, 2 sandwiches/burgers, and 2 apple crumb cakes. The place was pretty packed for Sunday night around 6pm.. I'm not sure if it's cause everyone is redeeming their Groupon. Around 6:30pm or so, there were maybe 5 people waiting in line to get a seat.Here's what we got:- "Meat Candy" burnt ends $14: Good, but I think my friend would've liked more meat in the sandwich- "The Monster" 50/50 brisket & pulled pork combo $15: This was humongous and I'm surprised I was able to stuff everything in my mouth (heh heh). But with the soft buns and lavishly drizzled BBQ sauce, nothing is impossible.- Mac and cheese side: Very well made. It was cheesy yet milky at the same time, making it actually pretty substantial.- Sauteed bacon & onion string beans: They said it was one of their specialties but honestly, I didn't think it was anything special.Original BBQ and Sweet & Spicy BBQ sauce are already on the table (they're delicious). You can ask for Habanero sauce but BEWARE it's actually REALLY REALLY hot and numbing (and I love spicy). Coleslaw, pickles and cornbread already come on the side with your sandwich.Yelp check-in for a free side! Though they didn't let us use it with the Groupon :(Bathroom rating: 9/10 - very spacious and clean, but I think there's only 2 bathrooms total (1 male, 1 female).

Things to try here: everything. But really, the drinks and food here are top quality. I highly recommend the Chef's Queso and the Mac & Cheese for sides & the beef brisket and the 'Meat candy' for barbecue. Try the Rum Runner for drinks - the bartenders here are so friendly and talented! I definitely want to come back here & try everything on the menu - thank you Butcher Bar family for a great experience!
Allison was a wonderful bartender and was very knowledgeable about the food with a charming personality! The food was amazing! I'll definitely be coming back here only if Allison is working though.

Decided to head there to celebrate a friend's birthday. Arrived there early with another friend so we decided to sit at the bar. The bartenders/servers were kind and provided great customer service. My friend and I were convinced to try the apple pie moonshine. It was pretty good, I would get it again. Food was great as well and you can't really go wrong with whatever you decided to order here. Our waitress, Emily, helped us out with a candle and went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our time. She was great, give her a raise. My friends and I will definitely be coming around some time soon.

The 4 stars is only for their brisket sandwich, which is amazing. Everything else I've had from there is okay, but not good enough for me to want to go again: I only go back for the brisket sandwich. A lot of the BBQ that I've ordered from there has been a little too dry or under-flavored for my liking, and their sides are definitely around 2-3 stars (mac and cheese, potato salad, etc)...but again. brisket sandwich. winner. Oh, and if you want to try an array of BBQ goods, I'd suggest going early, especially on weekends, because this place runs out of food (UGH!). I've been a few times and have yet to taste their burnt ends, b/c they're always out.
Love the way the waitress treated was. She was so concerned about my 11 years old daughter and even my daughter told me she was great to bad I don't remember the name:(

Came on a Friday night for the first time with friends they said it was one of their favorite restaurants. Arrived around 7:30pm and was told about a 20min wait. We decided to do next door to the bar to waste some time. Waited about 30mins until we were called. Tables are kind of tight but we sat in the back right near the bathrooms and we're very comfortable. I had the red sangria and it was tasty. Boyfriend had the hard pink lemonade and it was alright but veryyyy sweet. Our waitress was very helpful and patient. I had a burger that was cooked correctly, while the others had the Monster and liked it. Said it was a little dry but still good. Mac and cheese side is delicious. Meals come with coleslaw, small piece of corn bread and pickle. When we denied dessert the waitress offered warm apple turnover complimentary ..and it was deliciousssss! What a nice tough! If in the area would come back, but from LI so a little bit of a hike!

I've been here twice already and definitely will be back again. One thing is a must here and that's the BURNT ENDS! Omg it's so delish!!!! First Visit:I ordered the Butchers platter which came with burnt ends, brisket & I substituted the 3rd meat for ribs and I had a side of the mac n cheese. Burnt ends and Brisket was delicious! I wasn't a fan of the ribs or Mac n cheese. The meat on the ribs didn't fall off the bone and felt a little dry. And the side Mac n cheese lacked in flavorSecond visit: I ordered the half baked Mac & cheese entree and I was not disappointed! It tasted much different than the side order of Mac and cheese. This Mac n cheese comes with beef chili and I also ordered a side of brisket and mixed that into my Mac & cheese.... so yummy!!!! My friend ordered a rack of ribs and those were deliciously juicy and fell off the bone unlike the previous time I had ordered them.I do recommend to go early or call in ahead of time because they ran out of burnt ends the second time I went and I was so upset! And it was only 7:30pm!  However I highly recommend this place! Food is great and staff is friendly! I will definitely be going back whenever I need my BBQ fix
Absolutely love this place! It's a staple for me. The ribs fall of the bone. If you like real bbq, check it out.

I loved this place. I came here with my boyfriend a few months ago and we shared a big slab of ribs and some sides, honestly I was full off of the appetizer. We had red wine that was okay next time I think well try the beer, the waiter was friendly and the staff seem very nice. It looked like a few regulars were there this is definitely great for date or group night. I'll definitely be back

Very nice and lively BBQ place in Astoria. Service was great. We ordered smoked and fried wings(habanero), Half baked mac and cheese, PBLT(pork belly, lettuce and tomato). 1/4lb of brisket and 1/4lb of burnt ends.Half baked mac and cheese and burnt ends was a well deserved of a 5 star. We were looking forward to burnt ends and it did not fall any less of our expectations. Extremely flavorful, no sauce needed. Half baked mac and cheese with the baked beans and bacon bits, compliments it very well. Wish there was a little more bacon mixed in.Only reason why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because the PBLT(pork belly sandwich) was bland. Had to add some of the original BBQ sauce on it. Tips to the restaurant, add a more savory sauce on it. Brisket was nice and juicy but bland and lacked flavor that it was necessary to dip in the BBQ sauce. The habanero wings was not spicy, we could taste the habanero flavor but was hoping there was a spicy kick rather than a tangy kick. Not bad, but I guess we have higher expectations on the spicy tolerance. Also they have a 5 dollar special of a shot and beer. A moonshine(with flavor) and a Narragansett lager. Absolutely an amazing happy hour deal. Btw this is an everyday deal between 3-6pm. We will be back!

So my first time here and omg what a blast!!! As someone in the food industry, I know how important service is and kathy was top notch! She is an amazing waitress and entertained us as well. She was joking with our group and having a good time with us. She made our bday group the best, thank you kathy

I've been to butcher bar I think 3 times now and every single time I have a great experience. Today was probably the best. My boyfriend and I were sat down immediately and our food came out fast and hot. We shared the burnt ends, pulled pork and 4 sides: mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, string beans and baked beans. (Take advantage of that check in deal guys! One free side!) We were so satisfied with everything. They forgot the gravy but the potatoes were so smooth and buttery that I didn't even need it! The string beans were soo flavorful. The burnt ends were crisp on the outside but juicy and tender. Highly recommend. The service was top notch. They were attentive without being hovering and so friendly in general. To make things even better, they offered a complimentary dessert! I was stuffed but magically made room for the apple cake. And oh my God. Soft, warm, not too sweet with the best glaze on top. Thank you so much for blessing us with that. Can't wait to visit them again.

Hands down the best corn bread I've ever eaten is served here! I've never been much of a corn bread lover though have tasted my fair share of corn bread because both my mom and fiancé love corn bread. It is seriously THE BEST corn bread ever! Besides the amazing corn bread my fiancé and I had the Porky's with a side of Mac & Cheese, Sweet Potato Wedges, and bread pudding for dessert. The Porky's comes with ¼ lb. pulled pork, ¼ lb. pork belly & ¼ rack of ribs. We had the dry rub ribs because they were out of the wet ribs (it was the 4th of July and they were really busy).  All three meats were excellently seasoned and cooked to perfection. The pork belly was crispy, the ribs were falling off the bone, the mac and cheese was creeeeamy. The Cole Slaw was great with the meal and by itself. There was no overpowering taste in the slaw, you could taste all the different ingredients, which is quite a feat. My only suggestion is that they offer the sweet potato wedges as a dessert. Don't get me wrong the sweet potato wedges were great! However, to me they reminded me, and tasted like, a sweet potato pie only in a wedge form. The sweet potatoes were really sweet and they added sugar and cinnamon, making them a dessert in my opinion. They didn't fit well with our meal so we ate them after we were done with the BBQ. Since we had the sweet potato wedges as dessert we took the bread pudding to go and had it a couple days later. The bread pudding was ok. We should have had it at the restaurant. Overall the service was ok but the food was delicious!

I would rate butcher bar four and a half stars.We shared a platter with brisket, burnt ends, and the fall off the bones ribs. My favorite meat was undoubtedly the ribs. They had a delicious smokey flavor as evidenced by the meat and bone color. The outside had a perfect char, and the meat was so tender. To top it off, the ribs were smothered in a delicious BBQ sauce. The sauce was so good that I decided to take some home on my pants.The burnt had had an excellent char and was super crispy. The brisket went well with the table sauces, but I'd definitely order the ribs when I return. We also had an order of their delicious Mac n cheese. It was so creamy with the perfect viscosity. I'd certainly recommend the Mac n cheese as well. The staff was accommodating and helpful. Our waitress was attentive and made us feel very comfortable. The draft list has offerings from breweries like Fat Tore and UFO. The bathrooms were clean and spacious.

The mac and cheese is sooo good...one of my favorites in Astoria. However, the consistency is a bit liquidy so if you prefer your mac and cheese dry then you might not like it. Otherwise, it's very creamy and cheesy. The chicken tenders are also really tasty - they're juicy and fresh. I haven't had anything else from here but I can't wait to try some actual meat!
Soup dumpling is delicious and I enjoyed it very much. Delivery on time. Friendly and speedy service.

Tiny restaurant making legitimate and very good Shanghainese "fast food."  It looks like a hole-in-the-wall joint transplanted right out of a Chinatown.  It's quirky location is all the way at the end of an alleyway on Austin Street, close to Yellowstone Blvd, next to the 112th police precinct.  There are a few outdoor tables in the alley, which are good places to wait for the food or eat as the limited seating inside (tables/counter) isn't open for use currently.The food ranges from good to fantastic, making this a gem in the neighborhood.  The soup dumplings (xiaolongbao) are well-made, thin-skinned, and tasty.  Radish puffs are perfect: crispy, hot clouds of savoriness.  Beef soup noodles have noodles with good texture and flavorful beef/soup.  Fried pork buns are the right mix of fluffy bun, crispy bottom, and juicy meat.  Steamed and fried dumplings are fine, although couldn't get into the pork wontons in chili sauce because of the peanut butter component.  Their housemade tofu pudding and soy milk are terrific.  There's plenty more for me to try on a menu filled with simple, comforting dishes of dumplings, noodles, soups, rice, and sweets.The small kitchen at Memories of Shanghai turns out good food and is well-worth supporting and visiting.  So glad I have a local Chinese restaurant good enough to bring my parents to, and have them approve too!

Doesn't look like.m much when you are passiby but I've had my eye on this place for some time now. Since today was such a beautiful day for a walk, my husband and I ventured over to finally try it. When you walk in through the gates then the alleyway to get to the restaurant entrance all the way in the back, it feels a bit odd but they did try to spruce it up but having some decorations outside and also seating. As you walk into the restaurant, you can already tell its a very small space. Just 3 tables that seat 2 each and a bar table that seats 3 or 4 I think. The menu is quite small which I like because then you're not overwhelmed with so many choices. Quality over quantity.We ordered the crab soup dumplings, shrimp dumpling and scallion pancake with beef. We just really wanted to get a taste. I must say everything was delicious! The presentation was not all that but I think its because they're more of a take out or delivery place. The scallion with beef was delicious..crispy but not oily and beef was super tender. The dumplings were also delicious! Soup dumpling soup was savory and warming. We would definitely come back or order from here again. Just a bit hard if you're driving here because....well it is forest hills. I think walking here is perfect if you live close or also just ordering take out.

A take out setting in this little food joint. They do have tables and can serve around 6 people, plus 6 seats on bar top setting.   There are outdoor outdoor seating during summer time as well. These are the 5 items I ordered Steamed soup dumplings Steamed soup dumplings with crab meat Pan fried buns Radish puffs Scallions pancake Everything taste pretty good but I do enjoy their homemade vinegar for the soup dumplings Radish puffs is most memorable and radish are so fresh and juicy. They don't season the radish with salt and the shredded radish taste very refreshing.They do offer delivery service as well.
They open at 12noon during the pause. But def not on Tuesdays. A must if you crave shanghai rice cakes, rice rolls and soup dumplings.
