My husband and  I had vegetable dumplings, pork soup dumplings, crab & pork soup dumplings, and scallion pancake, everything was delicious, I especially enjoyed how perfect the dough was, strong enough to keep the soup in but not too thick to enjoy. We Did not have to wait too long for our food. Highly recommended and very happy to have this establishment in Forest Hills.

This place is a hidden gem! I've ordered delivery from here multiple times! Always fast and on time. Soup dumplings are amazing. The pan fried pork are really good also and last but not least the noodle dishes are delicious!
Very well priced, relatively authentic Shanghai cuisine. Breakfast is better than other times. Like the family biz nature of it.

Been here a few times for soup dumplings and scallion pancakes. The soup dumpings are excellent! You can see them making them as you order, they are super fresh. Scallion pancakes are great too. 3 out of 4 times the soup dumplings did not break during take-out.

This place is incredible! We love it so much! The only reason I gave it 4 starts is because they don't deliver and the space inside is so tiny! Please get a new delivery person I highly recommend the pork buns, pan fried dumplings, spicy beef noodle soup, scallion pancakes...basically everything.
Finally a great Chinese eatery with regional emphasis, not just another fast food American Chinese. Love it.
This is food is very goodness very friendly service very attentive very helpful l give 5 doller

This place was cozy and delicious. Service was great and staff was very friendly. There is seating inside and outside the restaurant. The place inside doesn't have a lot of seating but food is amazing. Great variety in menu. The Scallion Pancakes were A++. I especially loved the Braised Beef Noodle in soup. I highly recommend it!

I came here tonight with some friends and luckily got a table right away since they only had two big tables and a couple left. I had the soup dumplings with crab meat and scallion pancakes which were both delicious. I'm giving this place one star because the customer service was terrible. They had asked us to bring the tray that the previous customer left back to the counter and also wipe the table. I've never had anyone tell me to do that as I am a customer at the restaurant, what a disgrace. Never coming back here.

We love this place. We have gone there several times and they never disappoint. Its a bit pricey for what it is but worth it. The various types of dimsum we ordered have always been good and the beef soups were nothing particularly special but still pretty good with good flavors. Cant wait to return.
The place is small and only has about 10 to 12 seats  so take out is recommended.  The food is very decent food decent overall.  The sticky rice shuimai are surprisingly delicious!

Reminds me of my time in JapanYes,  this is chinese dumplings and food, but, in Japan, you can find little places with only counter seating,  no more than eight seats,  and the entire kitchen with woks, steamer pots, and grills, is right on the other side.  This is that kind of place.  It is warm and cozy and smells great. This place, in cold weather,  has about four counter seats and two tables.  Its tiny.  In warmer weather there is outdoor seating.  But they do offer take-out,  so that is a sure thing.  We opted for dumplings,  but the menu does offer more.  Based on the quality of the dumplings,  we will be back for more dumplings,  and to see what else is as good!  We tried the soup dumplings,  and shanghai sticky rice shoamai.  The soup dumplings were top quality,  but the sticky rice shoamai was not only a unique item, it was delicious!  There are only four in an order,  so I am going to get two orders next time.  We also got the bok choi and Shitake Mushrooms.  I am not the biggest fan of shitake mushrooms as I find their flavor way too dominant if the chef is not skilled.  This vegetable stir fry was very well done,  with a nice balance between the garlic and shitake.  I will certainly get that again.
Absolutely incredible... some of the best dumplings and dim sum I've ever had. I wish they had more seating!

The food is truly authentic and delicious! My fiance and I are always on the lookout for great Shanghainese food and are happy to report that this is as good as it gets outside Flushing. We ordered the pan friend pork buns, rice cake as well as a few of the puffs. The place is small, so I would recommend this as an ideal take out! Goooo!
Omg finally an amazing Asian restaurant totally authentic and just delicious. Bonus such a pleasant staff. What a great addition to Forest Hills.

What a find this place is! A diverse selection of classic Shanghai dishes, reasonable prices, and friendly service! I had ordered a set of dishes to go, and ordered another set to sit down and eat with my friend. The owner of the restaurant noticed that my to-go bag had been sitting by my side for quite some time, and offered to take it back and prepare a new set of the same dishes, so that they'll be fresher by the time I'm ready to leave. Very considerate and kind people here! I will be back! Highly recommend the fried crispy dough (fried to a perfect crisp, no burnt parts, no sogginess), rice cakes and soup dumplings.

Absolutely delicious. We tried the pork buns, soup dumplings, noodles with beef (instead of seafood) and scallion pancakes. Loved everything! Everyone was also very friendly and so we will definitely be back and hopefully also use their delivery service.

Just tried this for the first time and it's just become my new go to! Everything was very authentic. The beef scallion pancakes were one of the best I've ever had, flaky, crunchy, and not too oily. The soup dumplings are very good and like the ones you'd find in Chinatown or Flushing. The fried rice cakes were very yummy and wonderfully chewy and tasty. Chive pancakes were also delicious but are more of a giant dumpling than a pancake. All of the aforementioned are definitely worth repeating...and repeating! The beef noodle soup was the ugly duckling of this wonderful meal, although the beef was perfectly tender. A must try in the area!!!

Memories of Shanghai?!? More like NIGHTMARES of Shanghai!!!  This has to be the worst business run in Forest Hills, Rego Park or Queens in general!!! Placed an order and surprised to find out they deliver, which sounded great but I should've guessed it was too good to be true.  Half an hour went by, an hour then two hours!!! I called over 10 times only to get an automated message from TWC stating their mailbox was full and no way to get any updates on my order.  Of course as I was getting ready to go to the restaurant to give them something to think about, my door bell rings!  These !?$&@! sent a guy that doesn't understand a word I said and expects me to pay for this meal!  Granted it's not his fault but he couldn't even call the restaurant for me to speak to them as he didn't have a clue as to what I was saying.  Extremely frustrating and livid that there is a business as such in my neighborhood.  I'd give them negative stars if Yelp allows it! I won't ever consider this place again and I hope you don't either!!!!!!!!!

O-M-G.  AMAZINGG.  This place blew my expectations. Me and my boyfriend got delivery with two orders of snow crab.  It was absolutely delicious.  My boyfriend finished his and I only had 2 legs left.  I will keep ordering again and again.  So goodddd!
We've ordered here 3 times since quarantine started. Affordable, delicious every single time, and pleasant work staff. Definitely one of our regular places now!

Ordered delivery tonight during the Covid pandemic for my wife's birthday. It was delicious. We got 1 pound of shrimp and one pound of snow crab legs in the mild garlic butter sauce. When we have ate at this restaurant before we ordered spicy sauces, but we wanted our 5 year old to try it so we chose the mild garlic butter. The garlic butter was actually delicious. It was a real sauce with a black pepper kick. On the side we had garlic bread and fries. Because of Covid we could order a margarita which was nice and strong. Everything was great. My wife liked the crab legs and I preferred the shrimp. They are head on with a ton of flavor. The food wasn't hot but I knew that would happen. It was warm. I would suggest this if you have a craving for it. 5 stars.

The food here is so yummy and fresh which is very important with seafood. Some places don't take this into consideration and you end up regretting it later  At Oceanic Boil you really get a huge portion of food for your money. I always leave with leftovers that are still great tasting the following day. The wait staff are very attentive and anticipate your needs in a timely fashion. It gets really crowded, with a wait to be seated at times but the food generally arrives quickly.

Oceanic Boil delivered all the way to me in Astoria, and did so during the pandemic, so I already have a lot to like about this place!Delivery came on time and the food was all decent to good. The thing I'd recommend most is the lobster roll. Not to sound pretentious (but I know will come across that way anyway) but I lived in Boston for almost four years and let's say if you're a Bostonian, or any New Englander by the ocean, you'd find the lobster roll here to be lacking. But beyond those spoiled by living in that premiere lobster roll region of this country, most people will enjoy Oceanic Boil's take on it!Sadly, one of my favorite dishes in general, the crab cake, was 'eh'. It was pretty dried out and had some shell in it. All in all, a solid pick for seafood and I'm glad they're open for business!

This is my favorite place fromSince they opened but tonight I bought 1lb crab legs and it taste different oily and salty . This is the first bad experience I have had. I will still give themA next chance. Must be a different cook.

Tried this place when it first opened and I was pretty much hooked. It was usually always busy. I have eaten most of the stuff on the menu and I like the dungeness crab the best. So much garlic in the sauce its amazing. I have always eaten in the restaurant so I can not say how the delivery is. Staff was always very nice and attentive to our needs especially when it came to drinks and refills which is important to me. I always try to get my wife to eat here when I can, but because of the price we have to save this place for special occasions primarily. I always enjoy coming here for boil.

I had to try this place based on the reviews and being so far away from NYC at the time .I went with my best friend as one of our first post Covid19 meals and it was so worth it! One thing about this type of meal? It's truly best to eat it in the restaurant but I couldn't take the craving much longer!!I got the Oceanic Boil combo with the spicy garlic old bay seasoning with one pound of snow crab legs , shrimp and I added sausages. It was very very good but the only con was that the shrimp were not peeled or cleaned so you will get this with a head and it's poop ; once I noticed I could not eat it but the flavor and serving size were very good. Moral of the story is come here but maybe 86 the shrimp Cajun Mac and cheese was pretty good as well. I would go back to sit in for snow crab legs and you can buy the seafood cracker for $6

Last time I was here was in 2016.  This place had gone a long way.  Came here with a party of 20 people, we were  cool to ger split tables, The vibe of the place felt a biT too rrusher, the server, aS he was sitting us down asked us if we can order as soon as we sat down, I guess its because they were trying to flip tabLes fast.. So we rushed with ordering our fOod.. and here is my  verdict with the food. Taste was about 3 stars-- the one in flushing is way better. The potatoes that coles with the shrimp was way over cooked, almost to the point of being  mashed potatoes.The shrimp, which was supposed th be the highlight of the show was over cooked thus making it hard to peel bEcuase the skin is now sticking to the meat.. The crawfish ( which my friends ordered) had a funky smell to it, that is why they didn't even touch it at all..The crab legs (according to my wife) was pretty good and well flavored.In the middle of our meal, I oRdered 1 soda for my wife.. and it took so long  that I actually forgot about it  already. The place is a starting to get some reviews and check ins but I believe that there is still a lot of room foR improvement. Training  the staff to be a little bit more attentive to the tables upon meal service will definitely go a long way, Maybe have a better consistency on how well or done the shrimp are. The garlic butter  -Lemon pEpper( I think that's the flavor) was pretty good. This for this one I give it 3 stars..So overall is 2 STARSSERVICE   is 2 STARStaste is 3 starsFOOD quality is 2 STARS ( due to the shrimp being over cooked)

The chair broiled mussels are $10. They come with seasoned fries but there's only 4 mussels. The fries & the muscles were really good but I wish there were more mussels.  The Oceanic Combo is $85 but it's not enough to fill anyone up. It definitely isn't worth $85. It's not even worth half of that. The sauce was too salty & the Crawfish tasted weird. The shrimp, lobster, crab legs tasted fine. The server was nice.

Recent discovery during the COVID craze. A bit of a drive, but closer than some of my favorite spots near my office and looking for something closer to home. We had a massive order, including margaritas to go, and were very happy with our order. We must have missed the online option for spice (we like spicy), so it ended up being more mild than we normally would order. The seafood was fresh enough, though the crab legs left a little to be desired. Will definitely keep in mind for future orders! Also, not entirely contactless. You can order online, then you can call to confirm your order before going in.

I really wanted to like this place and have only tried delivery here. However, I don't think I'll be going or ordering again. Their sizes seem smaller than other places I've gone to. This was one pound shrimp that comes with corn and potatoes for 17$. They must have measured it with the potatoes because there were 3 huge pieces. That weighed down most of the bag. The sauce was barely there and wasn't as garlicy or spicy as other places I've tried in the past. They also charge 3$ for extra sauce which is pretty steep for a tiny container. The delivery was pretty quick but I didn't get that satisfaction one gets after a good seafood boil.

Been to this place a few times already and even took family members visiting from Poland here because I knew this place would  impress and wouldn't disappoint. The location is not too big, but it's very cozy and has great atmosphere.I've tried the BBQ Shrimp basket appetizer which comes with super crispy cajun fries which are both amazing. Also another great appetizer choice is the Calamari with the spicy mayo. I'm not a fan of gummy and mushy calamari this was nice and crispy.The drinks are pretty strong and delicious as well. I am huge fan of a frozen margaritas and the one served here won't get any negative comments from me. Also try the passion fruit cocktail, it packs a strong kick. Out of the mains, I always ordered the combo with a pound of snow crab legs and a pound of shrimp in a mild garlic butter sauce. It still has a little kick to it and It doesn't kill the taste by overpowering it with more heat. By the way this was always shared between two people. Portions are fairly big especially if you have an appetizer prior. The quality of the food is just top notch, the meat in the legs just slides out and shrimp even though you have to put some work into in ( LOL ) it's worth the troubles. Be prepared to get a little messy and work for your food but you won't be disappointed. The sauce is so good you'll keep on dipping whatever you worked for, but you can always order some BBQ sauce on the side for a dip you won't regret. You'll get gloves and a bib with a secret compartment for whatever falls off the table.... This place is so good I plan on going back very soon.

Oh Oceanic Boil how I love thee. I've been here 3 separate times and each time I leave satisfied. I love seafood (shrimp and crab legs are my absolute favorite) so when I saw the other yelp reviews I knew I had to check it out. I'm glad I did because the spicy garlic butter sauce is delicious! There is usually no wait for seats when I've come here so that's a plus. Speaking of seats, the ones here are not particularly comfortable but they work. The staff is delightful. Every server I've had and even the bartender at the back bar are always so helpful with suggestions on food and drinks. Tips: - The appetizers come with a side of Cajun fries (the fries are perfection) -  1 combo platter is enough for 2 people. - The calamari appetizer is decent. It comes with fries as I mentioned above so if you order the calamari you may get too full before your meal comes out. - I'm on the edge about the chicken wings appetizer. The first time I ordered them they were delicious and the second time I ordered them they were very crispy as we asked for but did not have much flavor. I had to use lots of hot sauce on them. - The combo platters come with corn and potatoes. The corn and potatoes are soaked in whatever sauce you ordered the seafood in. *This was not an issue for me but other people may not care for this. - I suggest trying the snow crab legs - Try the spicy garlic butter sauce. The spice level is mild. My favorite. I know I'll be back and maybe I'll try the fried lobster next time.

Update! Myself and husband still continue to come here twice a month.Pros: Great seafood, Strong drinks, Friendly servers.Cons: Scarce parking, long wait times , small seating space.Recommendations ** use Yelp app to hold your place once you're in a 10 mile radius.

Came here for my mom's birthday. Took a while for a server/host to flag us down but everything went down like this:Service: we had a male server, didn't catch his name, but he was very attentive to our table without overly hovering over us and interrupting our dinner. I can see him glancing over here and there to see if we had enough water, etc. He also explained the menu to us and recommended certain things to our liking. I ended up ordering everything he recommended plus more cause i'm just fat.Food: Absolutely amazing. Taste was great, display was nice, nothing too heavy and everything was flavorful. We paid 119$ for an order of chicken finger baskets, branzino, whole lobster + crawfish combo, extra new zealand mussels, virgin pina colada, and margarita on the rocks. I wish the place was a bit bigger and the seats weren't stationed to the floor. However it didn't really both us much.Ambiance: They had pop/modern songs playing throughout my stay. It was on at a comfortable volume so that I didn't have to speak up while conversing with the fam. Place was dimly lit, but the outdoor sunsetting light complimented very well and made the atmosphere great for an early dinner.

The gumbo (mix) was definitely not shareable and super soupy... but had such amazing flavor! I would order that alone with an extra side of rice and call it a day if I were solo. The bbq shrimp basket came with 6-8 big shrimps dressed and fired up in delicious bbq sauce, head-on... side of Cajun fries that were not quite enough and sauce and bitty ramekin of corn that was more decor.The mussels were a bit overdone but large and doused in a delish garlic butter (we chose the house "oceanic mix" of old bay, spicy and garlic) that was basically a tapenade slurry with melted butter- yum. The shrimp bag was better as the shrimp head juices sucked in the garlic oil and the structure just innately made it a wonderful natural coil for flavor. My margarita was strong just the way I like it with a twist- none other than my fave liquor- st germain. Her lycheetini was even more potent and had a soft kick with the fruit purée and his mango daiquiri just looked amazing.What a wonderful intro and welcomed boil to the neighborhood. Clearly this is not a little known fact since your party had to be all present before seating and after an hour or so they did kick us out for chatting because there were ppl waiting for a table. Not kick, sorry- suggested. They are great actually. If you are not from here, that may sound a bit crass but every native knows time waits for no one here in nyc.

This seafood boil is truly the stuff that dreams are made of! We came here for my fiancé's birthday and ordered a large selection of items including shrimp, crab Legs and crawfish tossed with the spicy garlic sauce. The sauce was cooked to perfection and seriously some of the most delicious eats I have had in NYC. For the quality and quantity of seafood we were served the prices were very affordable and our group of three were very full and satisfied. Pro tip: come with a group so you can mix and match a variety of seafood and sauces. The space was small and seating is rather limited however we got a table pretty quickly as soon as we walked in. Definitely Looking forward to visiting again soon for another special occasion!

Four of us went to Oceanic Boil for dinner on a Saturday night and ordered fried calamari, soft shell crab, combo of 1 lb shrimp and whole lobster with oceanic boil sauce, 1 lb king crab legs with oceanic boil sauce and a side of sausages.The sausages had a nice spicy kick to it. The calamari and soft shelled crab were crunchy and good. It came with a spicy mayo sauce which was yummy and a side of fries which were tasty as well. The corn that came with it wasn't very good- it could have done without the corn.The lobster and king crab legs were full of meat and  so I would definitely recommend these. The shrimp was ok - they were kind of on the smaller side compared to other boil places I've been to. The oceanic sauce that came with it was subpar. It lacked real full flavor. The sauce could've been made slightly saltier and it really wasn't that memorable. I was disappointed by the oceanic boil sauce. I didn't try the other sauces though. Overall, I've had better seafood boils at other restaurants. Everything is in the sauce and the oceanic boil sauce was lacking. Other than that, the appetizers and sides were good and service is good too.

Went on weekday with my kids to eat boiled Cajun food again since a visit to New Orleans.The decro and the lighting could be better; dull and dark (I like to see my food).Kids like their spicy boiled and I had their grilled fish which needed more flavoring and spice. Overall it was an average meal.
An amazing place to eat , this is a must go for any type of sea food and the home sauce is to die for .You will not regret it

What the actual fax?!? How hard is using Zatarain's? How is it even possible to make a crab and shrimp boil with no flavor? Like zero! Now let's be clear: the sauce is yummy, the spicy fries are tasty and crispy, the many dips are also quite good. But the meat itself: no flavor to be found. The crab had a hint, just a rumor, a suspicion of flavor- like they'd passed by a sign advertising crab boil. I've spent a good deal of time in Louisiana enjoying proper crab boil. This is like pizza made outside NY- it may look like sauce, might look like cheese, but one bite and you know you've made a mistake. It's not awful, but not worth another trip.

I've been here 4 times and all 4 times the food has been consistently good. Their stone crab, little neck clam and shrimps are my all time favorite. Their clams are bigger and fresher than any places that I've ever been to. That includes The Boil, Claw Daddy and Naked Crab. Their Garlic butter sauce and Oceanic boil sauce are better than all the competitors. Me and my family always lick the sauce off the plastic bags, it is just that good. Their prices are fairly reasonable too. I used to order their combos thinking it would save me money. It actually doesn't. It only saves you $1. So if you want different sauce for each boil, I say go for their non-combo boils. I knocked off 1 star for their service because they messed up my take out order once. They forgot to give us the shrimp that we ordered, so we had to drive 20 minutes to get that back. Also two days ago I ordered take out due to Covid from Yelp. It says the ordered was accepted and will be ready in an hour. So we drove there and turned out it was closed. Again for the second time I drove there 40 minutes round trip for nothing. As a small business during this crisis, you guys should really improve your service. It is one thing to mess up the order once in a while. But this is 2 times out of 5 which is almost 50% of the time.  If they keep this up, they are losing me as their customer forever.

Wifey and I have been eating seafood boil from all different places throughout my restaurant adventures, but I think Oceanic Boil is up there in terms of deliciousness.(!) WHAT WE GOT: We got the 1 lb. shrimp and 1 lb. crawfish combo, which comes with a piece of corn and a couple chunks of potato. We also got an order of French fries which were delicious!(!) HOW IT DID: I'm happy to say that, in contrast to other boil places we've been to, our palates felt significantly less salty. The Oceanic Boil house sauce (a mix of all their sauces: garlic butter, cajun spices, and lemon pepper) also tasted a little sweeter than other boils. It seemed like there was a slight sweetness to it, which sets it apart! And of course, the quality of the shrimp and crawfish was up there. Everything was meaty and easy to peel.(!) HOW IT DID, PT 2: I would be remiss to not talk about how the food is actually served. Our server tossed the bag around a bit to mix the sauce up, and -- I really appreciate this -- it was all served in a bowl. It's actually easier to navigate vs. fishing your hand into a sauced up bag.(!) SPECIAL MENTION: The sauce that came with the fries were delightfully different: it was an orange sauce, think thousand island with hints of spice or tabasco. It worked really well with the fries!(!) SERVICE & VIBES: Excellent service, and we felt like we were taken care of. It's not a big restaurant so it has a nice, less hectic vibe to it. Special mention to those interesting chair backs that they have as well haha.

Oceanic boil is our only choice if we are curved with Cajun style seafood in Queens. The waiters were welcoming and served quickly. Their seafood was fresh with amazingly well-balanced sauce. We would highly recommend to try their garlic bread which surprised us so much at our first try!

So I bookmarked this restaurant because I love a good seafood boil & I heard pretty good things about it. So I came here on a Sunday afternoon with my friend, there wasn't a wait, so we were seated immediately.For starters we tried the fried oysters & spicy broiled mussels which came with fries. The mussels were ok & they had cheese on top, which was weird, but I like cheese & love mussels...so it wasn't bad, but just a weird combination. The oysters were fine too. For our boil I had mussels with crab legs in the oceanic sauce which was a combination of sweet & spicy but balanced well. My friend had crab legs with shrimp with the spicy garlic butter. Both came with corn & potatoes. I wish it would've came with sausage as well as been a little more saucy. The seafood was coated good in the sauce, however it wasn't enough in my bag to dip my seafood in the sauce. For drinks  I had a lychee-Tini which was fine & my friend had a margarita, which was also fine.My friend did mention the seats aren't really comfortable, which it's nailed to ground & it's like a piece of metal you're sitting on with a bar for your back. The service was good & the prices are in the same ball park as other places. Overall everything was ok.

Amazing food! Ordered take out on May 26, first time. I was in food heaven!!! The whole time I was eating I kept saying omg this is delicious!! We had the boiled clams, snow crab, catfish. We got the oceanic boil sauce spicy. I highly recommend this place!! My new favorite.

All the food tastes fresh which is different from places like Naked Crab. All the sauces are absolutely delicious and the delivery always comes so fast! Definitely worth the money. Now I'm going to pass out after eating a copious amount of seafood.

Came here on a Friday night around 8ish PM. It was very packed. The restaurant itself is super cozy and somewhat snug. We walked in and the hostess said it would be 20 minutes...it took around 45 minutes. Granted she gave me false hope and shattered my fragile heart but eventually I got over  it. Because of the food. I'm a picky person when it comes to seafood, especially when it comes to the sauce. But this placed: DELIVERED. I loved the food. It's really good. I was pleaesantly surprised. Honestly I thought this place would be more popular. The service is on par. The fried oysters were amazing. They come with fries. Get the spicy mayo sauce if you want you belly to be happy. And the oceanic boil/ dugeness with the crawfish. Mad good. Im not a crawfish personal at all but I enjoyed it. Honestly the bad reviews scared me a little. Don't listen to them. Take them with a grain of salt. I mean this is coming from someone who is super anal and reads reviews for a living. I don't read them for a living but I might as well! I'll definitely be back.

The Oceanic Boil is serving up some SERIOUS seafood fair in Queens. I visited with my family for an early Sunday dinner. On the entire drive over, my sisters were convinced we wouldn't be seated immediately and would instead have to wait for nearly an hour. The restaurant has a Yelp Waitlist that I checked every five minutes and never had to use because the wait time was less than one minute each time I checked. Parking was terrible - but that's not news to anyone who is familiar with this area of Queens. We did get lucky however and found street parking a few blocks away from the restaurant. We were seated immediately and must have missed the rush my sisters were warning me about because about 20 minutes after we were seated people started to rush in. We waited a while before being greeted by our waiter, which gave us the opportunity to put in our food orders in while he took our drink orders. I ordered a virgin pina colada - which was a bit watery. I also ordered the oceanic combo which came with snow crab legs, head-on shrimp, corn and potatoes in the oceanic sauce (a thick, spicy garlic based sauce). It was good, but a bit slimy, which explains the latex gloves and bib they give you prior to bringing you your order.

My boyfriend and I came here for our seafood boil date and we truly enjoyed ourselves. We got the stone crab with shrimp , French fries, and the New England Chowder. We later got the matcha flan for dessert. We had a wonderful time.

My sister has been ranting and raving of this place for 2 years now. Finally tried this place and did take out. I don't recommend takeout. The food is very good, but portion is small. Ordered 1 pound of snow crab and 1 pound of shrimp combo. After giving $6 take out tip I would assume they would at least give you gloves. Disappointed. Will try to eat in next time and hopefully I'll have a better experience.

Definitely have to get the oceanic combo! Get the oceanic combo sauce to go with it. It's the best! The fried lobster appetizer is to die for and the Cajun Mac and cheese is great. The drinks are reasonable and they give you a lot. I highly recommend this place. It's great because you can add yourself to the waitlist and reserve your table. Definitely worth it. A little small and the chairs are a little hard to sit on but otherwise a great place to eat. We will definitely be back!

Although I'd not a fan of working for my food, this was an experience! My friends love coming here and I had to give it a try. Everything was DELICIOUS, beyond my expectations. We didn't not leave disappointed and neither did our stomachs. Try the oysters

I called around 3:30 to make 7pm reservations for a party of 6. The young lady informed me they hold the table for up to 10 mins before giving it to another party as the restaurant gets busy around 7pm. We arrived and was seated immediately. The restaurant had a few empty tables but within minutes the restaurant was full. ( ON A WEDNESDAY NIGHT, WOW )The menu was just as it was online, most items from the appetizers comes with Cajun fries. I ordered the calamari & lobster roll ( both came with fries ) and shared with my sister. The calamari which was amazing, came out about 10 minutes before everything else. By the time everyone else had gotten their food, mine was cold but I was hungry so I didn't make a fuss. - The lobster roll comes on a toasted 6in roll, the meat is cold ( for those who likes it heated ) - The Cajun fries are deliciousssss- The Coconut shrimp looked gigantic but it had a very thick breading and a small piece of shrimp inside. They were good but very deceiving in size- The Catfish slider was amazinggggg- Chicken fingers were average nothing special- The snow crab legs comes with corn and potatoes. They give 1lb of legs which is pretty satisfying. They have different sauce options, the garlic butter covered snow crab legs were 10/10Overall, Our waiter was polite and the service was good given the restaurant was full. The food was delicious. The music playlist was so good it was as if it was taken from my Spotify account. We will be returning.
- great service- great crab- great lobster- great shrimp- plentiful food- parking sucks- Henry punch was really strong- fun environment

The seafood boil here is very good. The quality of the seafood is not bad and ample quantity they give you with each order ( based on weight). Service is attentive somewhat. Will I be back?  Would say "yes"  if I have a seafood craving again.I would recommend the snow crab and shrimp combo if you looking for value (dungenesse crabs yield less meat IMO).

I came here with some friends and it's exactly what you would expect from a Cajun seafood joint. Our food was really good, just a tad salty. But the customer service was on point. I def recommend if you're into Cajun seafood and are in the Queens area!

Food: 3.5/5My friends and I were craving The Boil on Waverly but the wait time was 75 minutes. I found this place on Yelp and we decided to give it a try.We ordered: lobster bisque, 1lb of mussels in oceanic sauce (house recommended), 2lbs of clams in garlic butter lemon pepper, 1lb king crab, 1lb shrimp and a lobster roll.The lobster bisque was interesting. It sort of tasted like a mix of lobster bisque and tomato soup. It was weird and interesting but decent. Definitely not your standard lobster bisque. The mussels were tasty and the oceanic sauce made it even better. (It's the recommended sauce for a reason and I recommend you try it). The clams were cooked perfectly, the 1lb king crab leg turned out to be just one huge leg but it was juicy nonetheless and the shrimp was fresh, perfectly medium firm and succulent. The mains come in a bag with corn and potato. I didn't try the lobster roll because the waitress forgot it and it came out late. By this time, I was already pretty full. They also forgot our ginger ale.We originally wanted crawfish but we learned today that crawfish season is April. If you order crawfish now, it's most likely frozen. Bummer. We also ordered green tea crepe with a side of vanilla ice cream. The crepe was a disappointment. It was so frozen that we couldn't even cut through it with utensils. My chardonnay was also a disappointment too. Very cheap quality and too sweet (IMO).Service: 4/5Our waitress was very sweet and accommodating. Cute girl from Thailand. Very attentive minus the forgotten lobster roll and ginger ale but her effort was endearing. Ambiance: 2/5The interior of this place is nothing special. It looks a bit plain. I personally thought they could have done more. Sort of bare bones minimum but decent for casual dining. It was clean though hence 2 stars.

Excellent service. I went on a Friday afternoon around 6pm and there were plenty of seats available. I ordered the snow crab legs and shrimp combo which came with potatoes and corn. The snow crab legs were amazing. I got the garlic butter sauce and it was nice and creamy! It got super messy but that's expected. The shrimp came with the heads on and the shell was very thin so it was hard to peel. So hard that I couldn't finish eating them! The strawberry daiquiri was good, although it was thick so I'm thinking it may have been mixed with jello. Nonetheless a great meal and chill experience and ambiance.

It was my mom's 70th yrs old birthday last week. I ordered the seafood a week prior. They cancelled my order last minute. I ended up having to order some cheap food for this big celebration. Unacceptable.

Whew! The food is amazing here! One of the best seafood boil restaurants I have been too. The place is definitely smaller, than other restaurants but the great good makes up for the lack of space. Expect a good 1  1/2 - 2 hour wait on weekend nights, for parties of 3 or larger. I would plan to hit a local bar or something in between, because there is no where to wait but outside. I got the shrimp and mussels and the seasoning was amazing! Sometimes seaboil's are too watery or oily. But the sauce was thick and clung to the seafood. The seafood was fresh and the gumbo was a hit too! Anytime I am in Queens, this will be my go to spot!

My boyfriend lives in the area and we love Oceanic Boil. It was love at first sight, or first taste. The food is full of flavor and the service is great. It feels like you're in the middle of Cajun country in Queens, New York. There is truly nothing like Oceanic Boil in Jackson Heights. The price is fair too. We never spend more than $40 per person and that's when we're feeling gluttonous (an appetizer, two mains, dessert, and two drinks, plus tax, before tip). This place is so popular, guarantee there will be a wait time of close to an hour, especially if you go for dinner on the weekend. Pro tip: there's a small bar in the back (sits about 6-8 people) where you can order too. First come, first serve.

I've been coming to this place for the past year and they have always served me justice! In the past year I've been to oceanic boil about 5x and every time the seafood is amazing. I recently had a crab boil from Naked Crab in Flushing, NY and it just wasn't it. She garlic butter was a 4 on a scale from 1-10. The whole time I'm eating their crab legs I'm wishing it was Oceanic Boils crab legs. Oceanic Boil is definitely worth 5 stars in book.

I was amazed on how great the food was. You must try the gumbo definitely is one of the best I have had. The Cajun Mac and cheese taste delicious. For the main course I had snow crab legs w shrimp in butter garlic sauce. Let's just say I must have this again. My boyfriend had the Cajun catfish. He really enjoyed it. I highly recommend this place
The  lobster roll wasn't that great but the mussels were amazing. French fries came soggy.

This was my second time coming here. The first time was a lot better experience. The service was extremely slow tonight. I was very surprised. It was just my daughter and I and we ordered 2lbs of shrimp, crab legs and 1 lobster. I knew I was going to bring the rest home to my husband and in-laws. I have zero idea how to crack this stuff properly. I don't know what is edible and what isn't. I just put it in my mouth.. if it tastes decent, then it stays. I had to crack everything open before I left because I knew we didn't have a cracker thing at home. The waiter offered zero help in that department. I asked for a little thing to get the crab meat out of the legs...and I was handed a wooden pic. I snapped it in half on accident. I cut my knuckles on... I have no idea. My husband and his toolshed friends went there about a year ago and the guy cracked everything for them. I watched everyone around me get their food, even though they came in after me. Normally I wouldn't think much of it.. because different things come out at different times. Buttttttttt....the women next to me that came in about 10 mins after I did, was chowing down on crab legs and shrimp. Soooo we pretty much ordered the same thing but she got hers first. The waiter kept apologizing and said 2 more minutes, 2 more minutes. It wasn't until I got up to leave, after an hour of waiting that my food was brought out. He kept saying that they were changing the broth. But...the table next to me had their seafood. This place is good to come with a family.. it wasn't great doing all the work alone. I left this place hungry. $100+ with tip and I ended up walking to the bakery down the block and ate a brownie on my way home.

Came here for lunch on Saturday. They advertise opening at noon; but don't expect to be let in immediately. Typical bar atmosphere; music currently treading on radio and TVs tuned to ESPN. The only reason I'm not reviewing this place a one star is because of their wait staffs candidness. They were upfront about their crawfish being frozen (due to the season) and encouraged us to explore other options on their menu. Settled on New England Clam Chowder as an appetizer followed by a pound of shrimp and crab cake. The chowder was inconsistent. My bowl was very watery while my fiancé's was thick; loaded with potatoes and very little clam. They pair their chowder with baked garlic bread as opposed to tHe traditional packaged oyster crackers. Everything with the main entree was wrong. They accidentally made the shrimp spicy and entirely forgot about her crab cake. Seeing that the restaurant had just opened we expected the crab cake to take longer than everything else. But 10 minutes turned into 20 and when we finally asked the waitress to check in on her plate she completely blanked. There was no apology, just an offer to place the order now. Disappointed with this restaurant and their lack of attentiveness.
Soooooo Yummmmm Seasoning was on point and server was sweet. My BF however thought that the seafood wasn't enough (in comparison with other places)

Just when I thought Jackson heights had it all, I see this restaurant and evaluate that thought.The space is cozy so depending on the time of the day, there seems to be lines that pour into the inside of the restaurant. For a party of 5, I waited about 35 mins-40 mins, including a 29 minute wait just on the "Yelp" list. Once we were seated, the servers were really sweet and remained very attentive. I tried the lobster with Cajun seasoning. It came with 2 potatoes and corn, all shaked and smothered in the delicious sauce. The sauce had a kick, but the flavors still stood out. I had fun eating the lobster (which was of a good size) and though took longer to eat than others in the table who opted for smaller dishes, I thought it was worth it. The snow crabs I have previously tried from here with garlic sauce are also delectable. They definitely don't skimp on any sauce.Come and try out this restaurant- especially on a date if you are not afraid of eating good and getting dirty.

My husband and I had been reading about this place for awhile on yelp and finally decided to make the schlep down. We're both big seafood fans so we're excited about this. If you live in the area or close enough by, i highly recommend it. The crab legs were my favorite. I do have a garlic intolerance, so I unfortunately couldn't have the seafood with the sauces they offer (all have a garlic butter base). Which was sad, but that's ok. I can't say we'll be back any time soon--just not quite worth the trek from the Bronx for us. But again, definitely plan a visit if you live nearby.

Oceanic Boil has always been our go-to spot for seafood. I love seafood and I used to go to Joe's Crab Shack for years but when I discovered Oceanic Boil, that was it. buh-bye JCS, hello new seafood spot.This last visit was so different from all out previous ones that I have to leave a review. We came at around 7 on a Saturday, it was busy but not too busy that we were able to get a seat immediately (there are 4 of us). BTW the place is small, but it does it's job.This review will NOT be about their food because their food is always exceptional. This will be about the service we've been subjected to here.So, as we were winding down our dinner with drinks and the green tea flan, I believe, we also were given the bill. Well, we decided to grab one more round of drinks to finish off the desert and one of the waitresses there stopped and told us "IDK where your waiter is but I really need this table". I was like "did I hear her correctly?" Did she reserve our table to a different group even before we were done eating and drinking? This seriously left a very sour taste in my mouth that not even the taste of their food can wash down...I was beyond disappointed. I've never been to a restaurant that did that. EVER.I know the restaurant is small and they are extremely busy but you don't lie to potential customers who are asking for how long the wait is and tell them it isn't long and then kick out your current customers since you told the potential ones its not a long wait.WHO DOES THAT?

I have been to Oceanic boil about 3-4x and recently I was craving their food because it is SOOO good, and I've always had a great experience with the service and food. At the beginning my girlfriends and I had to wait for about 45 minutes (the wait is expected in the evening). We decided to wait by the bar until a table became available. We started off with a bad experience by the bar but I am so happy to see how that quickly changed thanks to the manager. They made sure our experience with the restaurant turned into a positive one again and it did. I will continue to go to Oceanic boil thanks to that service, it just makes the food even yummier. Recommend!

I'll tell you what... this was difficult for me to grade. I'm somewhere between a 3 and a 4, and if I think abt various aspects of the quality of food, drink, service, ambience, decor, etc, I'd grade them each very differently. We arrived around 8pm on a Thursday (a co-worker and I) after leaving a trade show. We were basically starving after having fasted all afternoon (and having been on our feet the whole time at the trade show). Parking sucks on these streets, so we circled for 5 - 10 min and were lucky to park outside. You might all yourself, "WTF does this have to do with the restaurant?"  When rating any establishment, you're comparing them with others. If a restaurant with a parking lot gives you a more relaxing experience, then why shouldn't a lack of parking work against you? In this case, I don't detract even a whole point from them for the parking, and we were lucky to find sombre seating available at the bar when we arrived... would have preferred a table, but locals seem to love this place. I didn't catch the bartender's name, but he was a blast. Very funny and personable, great personality and accommodating. And damn... dude can sell you a bridge if he wants to. Upon placing the order with him, when I found out that they don't serve blue cheese dressing with the chicken wings, I told him to forget abt it and just bring me the lobster bisque. Even though he said out was spicy, and there's no blue cheese dressing, he somehow convinced me-- thru pure enthusiasm--to give the wings a try, AND the lobster bisque. Hard core.I got a Strawberry Daiquiri... my co-worker laughed ay me, but screw him. I have to say, though... it wasn't a good daiquiri... it wasn't actually sweet. It was blended ice with a slight strawberry flavor and tasted like rum. I guess I just like them sweet. When the Lobster Bisque came... both of us had ordered it... it was expensive and we were starving, so I was surprised to see that my co-worker had left over about 25% of the bowl of soup! But truthfully, as another reviewer mentioned, it's a very different Lobster Bisque than what you're likely accustomed to. I liked the flavor on that it was complex but still creamy, but it wasn't thick at all. I feel like I wish they had reduced it more... boil out more of the water content to thicken the consistency. To their credit, though, I'll bet there is more pieces of lobster on that soup than you've ever seen a Bisque have before. But the soup itself tasted exactly like the sauce in an excellent Penne a la Vodka, but not thick, and no penne. Once our Lobster and Shrimp had arrived, I realized that the bartender forgot abt the Chicken Wings he sold me on. It's ok... I want looking forward to them very much! While the Lobster and Shrimp were good, the Garlic Butter sauce it's in are very overpowering. I got it mild, and still, I couldn't really taste the meat itself. To me, that's a terrible shame. In that sense, I'm a traditionalist (and not a Creole traditionalist!)... I like my shellfish with minimal sauce, or none at all. The meal was very messy, but they give you a bib, nitrile rubber gloves (with which to 'operate' on the victim), crackers, and a pair of scissors. My co-worker was kind of disgusted that the shrimp were head-on... he sat there struggling to remove the head, the shell, and de-vein the things and I was dying laughing at the perturbed but determined look on his face. He didn't eat very much. But me? I'll eat dog or cat of you make it taste good enough! I finished it, but it wasn't something I'd get again. And there you have it. I don't believe it's a 5 star place, though I understand how someone could feel that way if they loved the style of food enough.

I had done my online research on local joints for the first of several travel waypoint overnights in the LGA 'hood and this was my numero uno so it was up on the first night unless I could be convinced otherwise by the shifting sands of the desert. The girl behind the front desk at the hotel vouched for this joint so I knew that I would have a verified true local, neck tats and all, to blame if she was wrong about this which is always important to have when you travel in case of fauda.Truuu thugs got choices on spice level to make your snow crab legs either extra spicy or super spicy, on top of the spice level this banger is already supposed to have. Being the owner of a very unflattering t-shirt from beating the fire burger challenge at LBBB in Houston where I am a designated truuuu thug and spice hound to eat the burger, I like to call my stuff as spicy as you can go for this delicate little porcelain doll. So I ordered super spicy, the spiciest mamma mia, madonne, level you can get. In my Ron Swanson voice: I'm not sure you heard what I said. I want ALL of the spices.Charmingly they thought I was not #about #that #life and provided disposable plastic gloves with my order as if I did not know what I was doing and did not know my way around some spice, as if I must be new here. Meanwhile their hottest spice level on the crab was about as mild as eating a room temperature tomato. Given the gloves (the only other place I have been given that in all of my spicy life was at LBBB during the fire burger challenge) I had prepared my body for more.Absent the requisite spice level I thought I was getting since I had ordered super spicy, the snow crab legs were entirely divine with loads of garlic (to keep Dracula away) and so much better than I worried I might find this close to the airport, which is almost TOO close to the airport unless you are window shopping for bargain priced Thai ladyboys and motels that charge in six minute increments like law firms. And unlike other competitors of this type of seafood biz in the Jackson Heights area that only gave you the legs at a similar price point in the 20s, these kind gentlesirs threw in the corn and potatoes to boot making it an easy decision to dine with them for value and convenience.Definitely worth considering for a night near the LGA airport, just know that even the hottest spice level is not all that and a bag of chips. But still a very pleasant taste of the briny deep and satisfying gastronomic tour of the LGA adjacent neighborhood to know this is an option here in the 'hood as an alternative to the LGA Plaza hotel resto or the Little Caesars.Snow crab legs pair well with everything, but especially with Rick & Morty back in the hotel room.

Do they have Wi-Fi ??There was no sitting available besides the bar.Which was perfectly fine for me.  I ordered the Lobster Roll.      It was A good amount of lobster, didn't have any real significant taste. Great amount satisfied definitely. I suppose it was a bread roll,  seem like a piece of toast. The staff was great.. Really quick and really responsive. I find the lobster roll was a good price for the amount of lobster you receive. No they do not have Wi-Fi available.
I came here before the pandemic and I enjoyed my time. Buts it very small and worth the long wait:). The food is delicious!

I am an avid lover of seafood, however the circle of friends that I frequently dine with aren't too fond of it and can be picky eaters.  As a result, I don't get to have it anywhere near as much as I should.  With that said, I had the ability to come here with a friend a bit ago and I'm definitely impressed and had to come back to give a review of it.  We were given pretty quick service and were seated quickly, there seemed to be a bit of a rush as I was halfway through my meal, so the place does get crowded and you should keep that in mind when you head here.  I had no idea what to get due to the options, so I just opted for what I believe is their flagship item the Oceanic Combo, which comes with shrimp (skin and head are still on), corn, snow crab legs, crawfish, a entire lobster and potatoes along with what appears to be small chunks of sausage in a very thick gravy like sauce (the oceanic sauce).  The sauce was a bit spicy, but I could see it being an issue if you don't prefer hotter food items.  The combo ran us about $75-80 if i remember correctly, but it was pretty darn filling and satisfying.  Definitely not something that I could order everyday.    We also had some dollar oysters halfway through the meal that we decided on before their happy hour event ended.  I think it runs from 330 to 7pm on weekdays only.  Definitely give it a try when you're craving seafood and you're in the area.  Oceanic Boil is pretty good.

I went here with my fam, and it was pretty good. I still like theBoil in the city much more (2 locations, but I like Waverly the best b/c it's much more spacious) when it comes to the all-magical make-or-break sauce, but this place is definitely easier to get to if you drive. In terms of freshness of seafood, it was fine, and the prices are slightly cheaper than theBoil, but the primary issue I had with this joint was that I was SO THIRSTY for hours after eating here. As I was eating the meal, I was thinking, "Mm. This is pretty tasty! I'd go here again." but then later that night, I was thinking, "Danggg how much salt/MSG did they put in that sauce? I am so freaking thirsty!!" All in all, it tasted good going in, but the ridiculous level of thirst I experienced afterwards would probably make it unlikely that I'd go again. That said, only 2 out of the 4 of us had the thirst issue, so maybe if you're not sensitive in that way, it won't be that big of a deal.

One of my favorite creole seafood place. You can easily find the street parking. In queens area, I think this place serve a really good creole / cajun food. Their seafood is fresh and their drinks are very good. We tried their garlic butter sauce with the seafood in the past and it was good. We take on oceanic boil sauce today. This is their mixed sauce and it is spicy. We also try their garlic noodle and they taste way better than other places garlic noodle. The noodle is moist and full of flavor. Overall, this is one of our go to restaurant in queens. PS: they will open up 2nd location soon in Rego Park. Yay

I've been here twice and both times where pleasant. Both times we sat at the bar because for me the tables are too close together for my liking. Music was nothing special seemed like it was music of opportunity and not an actual play list. First time I had the shrimp with potatoes and corn in mild lemon pepper and garlic sauce. To drink I have the peach lemonade. The second time I had crabs, potatoes and corn in mild garlic sauce with a side of old bay and no drink.The people I was with had French fries and fried catfish which was good.  I preferred the crab over the shrimp just cause it has a better natural flavor and the mild garlic sauce. The potatoes were a little under done, but the corn is amazing especially when dipping it in the sauce!! The drink was perfect, not too sweet, but had a punch to it.The staff was really nice, especially our bartender (I'm bad with names) Overall I'd come back!!

SOOOO GOOOOOD!Me and a friend came in around 5:30pm on a weekday and there was no wait. I ordered a pound of mussels with mild garlic butter + lemon pepper sauce and the shrimp and crawfish combo tossed in their oceanic sauce. It was so DELICIOUS. We also had oysters and garlic noodles. Everything here is so yummy! The price is really decent here compared to other seafood boil places, and having happy hour is a plus. Service here is a thumbs up as well. Definitely coming back!
Kind of nasty. I ordered delivery, so there's that, but it was just disgusting. Threw it away immediately I got the Seafood Boil. Not great. At all. And I know crawfish and crab.

Oceanic boil was great. The way it smelled when I walked in didn't compare to what the food tasted like. The spicy garlic & old bay sauce tasted funny, and the shrimp wasn't cleaned so my partner didn't eat any of it but it was still a great experience. I'm on a mission to try every seafood boil restaurant in the city. This has been the third spot I've been to. It didn't compare to Loui Loui in Harlem but the service was amazing and they definitely accommodated to my requests.I hope that they'll offer head off shrimp soon. The crab was insanely fresh with lots of meat. I would go back for just the crab. Some of the crawfish were really small, but I guess because it wasn't in season. The piña coladas are to die for!Crawfish were a bit tasteless. I like to crack the claws and eat the bit of meat in there but it didn't set my taste buds on fire. The garlic noodles were too spicy to eat, kind of threw off the flavors of everything else. I really wanted to love this place! Maybe next time.

AMAZING! Where do I even begin, wow wow wow. I did read the reviews before I went and was a little very minimally concerned. But, I am a firm believer you are the best critic, you have to try it for yourself. That being said , it satisfied my every desire and then some.We were a party of 3 and ordered the combo and there was enough food for all of us. Granted there were appetizers before. And the variety in appetizers were beyond amazing. The dollar value was great, music was popping, drinks were strong for the long work week, overall great experience. Will definitely be going there again.

I'll start off by saying that their boil sauce taste amazing and their potato was just soft enough and corn were flavorful and sweet. Their drinks are also really tasty also.  On to why I leave a review today.This place tasted great for a while, but recent delivery had tons of sand in their boiled clams, so much so that you can see literal sand patches on the clams.  Not sure if they didn't rinse the clams long enough, but it was crunchy like cheetos, and believe me that's not a good thing for clams.  The snow crabs had gotten really salty and wasn't a good combination with their recommended sauce :( .  The shrimps were also soft and pasty when you peel off the shell, which told us they weren't that fresh, even for frozen shrimp.  I never had issues until today, I guess their quality has dropped since their open, which sucks because I really liked this restaurant.

I went here on a Saturday afternoon date with my wife. The atmosphere is fun. Very clean inside and everything is new. Fun decor on the wall and cool chairs and tables.The service was great. Friendly staff and attentive.We ordered the shrimp / dungeness crab combo, and the King Crab. The seafood was really fresh, the sauce was delicious.We had a great experience. We would certainly go back and recommend it to friends.
My gf loved it. I thought it was allot of work though. I was more into the anatomY of the thing than eating it. Service was good and the food was a delicious experience I won't forget.

Haven't been here in a while. Place was completely  full on a Tuesday night. We were a party of 7. For appetizers, we had my usual catfish Basket, one wanted to try the crab cake basket and one ordered Cajun fries. I love cat fish. Seriously it's so good. It's not a fish I'd buy to cook at home since I don't fry food, but these are always cooked perfectly. My only issue is the amount, I wish they'd sell an entree portion. I want a big piece of catfish! Everyone loved the fries and the fish. I didn't try the crab cake. For dinner, I shared 1 lb. of snow crabs and 1 lb. of mussels in garlic butter with L. There was 2 orders of the Oceanic Combo... That combo has lobster, shrimp, crawfish and snow crabs. D ordered a lb of snow crab and 1lb of crawfish I think.Everything was good. Seafood was fresh. Snow crab was very sweet. Mussels were plump. Shrimp was meaty. I tried a crawfish. Not my fav. So lil meat, mostly shells. They weren't in season but nobody at the table seemed to care cuz they loved everything! Lobster was great. It's not something I can eat often. I think I could've taken a lil home and add some carbs to soak some of that sauce. It's really heavy with all that salt and butter?I still prefer the Cajun place in the city but this place is still pretty good and convenient. Staff are very nice. Checked on us plenty of times. Refilled our waters. Definitely recommend the snow crabs.

Decent tasting seafood, but not that fresh. Don't order the crawfish if it's not in season. For the price, you barely get enough sauce ,potatoes and corn for the combos. Dine early. Usually packed during peak hours.

Wen't here on a rainy Wednesday night and there was still a 45 min wait, which was expected based off the popularity of this place. We got a tiny table for two right by the front window, which me and my friend didn't mind, since it was more private and away from the rest of the diners there. We decided to order the fried calamari as an appetizer and the sausage as a side. The calamari was delicious along with the fries it came with. Both were seasoned well and the spicy mayo we got with it was delish. The sausage came in a tiny cup, and although it was good, I don't think it was worth the $5.For our entree, we ordered the 1lb of snow crab legs and 1lb of shrimp with the garlic butter sauce. Both were absolutely phenomenal and we couldn't have been any more happier with our order.My only complaint is that it took a while for our entree to come out. 40 minutes to be exact, but the food made up for it. Will definitely be returning to this place.

First time here today and we loved it, the restaurant itself is very cozy and has a cool relaxed vibe, the music was an awesome part of experience...they played a lot of R&B and a lot of 90's R&B at that...it was perfect. We ordered the Oceanic Combo and added clams to it. It was sooooo delicious, perfectly seasoned and the amount of heat as we asked for it "spicy" was also perfect on the garlic butter spicy sauce. I really look forward to going back and trying out many other items from their menu. The options we all so good it was kinda hard to choose. Great addition to Jackson Heights!! This place is a MUST GO!!!! The table next to us ordered the lobster Mac and cheese and I overheard them saying how good it was.

Oh boy! This place was definitely worth the hour wait on a Saturday night. Ordered the Oceanic Combo with the garlic butter + Old Bay sauce to share and it was utterly amazing. The seafood was fresh and the sauce was not overly packed with salt and butter. It was a balanced taste throughout and didn't leave me requesting a water refill every few minutes. The staff was courteous, kind and attentive the entire night. The music is also a plus! 90s R&B jams are always clutch. Drinks are well made and priced right. For sides, we ordered Cajun fries, white rice, and the catfish basket. I'd recommend skipping the fried foods and sticking with everything else they have to offer.  We live in the city and typically go to a seafood boil place on the LES, but since coming here, this will definitely be the new go to spot. I'm always a hard critic when it comes Southern and Cajun food in NYC, because it can often times be inauthentic and subpar. As a native Houstonian with Creole roots, finding good southern food in NYC is my passion. This place gets it right more so than the others. Will be back on my next Oh boy! This place was definitely worth the hour wait on a Saturday night. Ordered the Oceanic Combo with the garlic butter + Old Bay sauce to share and it was utterly amazing. The seafood was fresh and the sauce was not overly packed with salt and butter. It was a balanced taste throughout and didn't leave me requesting a water refill every few minutes. The staff was courteous, kind and attentive the entire night. The music is also a plus! 90s R&B jams are always clutch. Drinks are well made and priced right. For sides, we ordered Cajun fries, white rice, and the catfish basket. I'd recommend skipping the fried foods and sticking with everything else they have to offer.  We live in the city and typically go to a seafood boil place on the LES, but since coming here, this will definitely be the new go to spot. I'm always a hard critic when it comes Southern and Cajun food in NYC, because it can often times be inauthentic and subpar. As a native Houstonian with Creole roots, finding good southern food in NYC is my passion. This place gets it right more so than the others. Will be back on my next cheat day!

First time eating Cajun style seafood! Not disappointed at all. Depending on the night, you may have to wait a while to sit down. I went on a Saturday night and had to wait about an hour. They do not take reservations on the weekends so be prepared. We waited at the bar for a little and had a drink and starter there before being moved to the table. They provide you with gloves and bib depending what you order. We got the snow crab legs and crawfish which came with a side of potatoes and corn. The recommended oceanic boil sauce was great, it says its spicy and for those who cannot tolerate spice you can ask for it mild (like me). Ot was packed but the staff was on point and the music gave out vibes playing tons of 90s music and plenty of r&b. Definitely a place  I will be returning to.

We ventured on this place after reading the reviews on Yelp. I called to make a reservation, but we were told they dont take reservations on Friday-Sunday. (Totally understandable). When we got there, we were greeted by the host and we had to wait 30mins. The place was pretty crowded. There wasnt much of a waiting area. The restaurant itself is pretty small. There is a bar area in the back where guests can grab a drink while waiting. Our food didnt take long to come at all. We got (2) orders of the Alaskan Crab & Shrimp. We got one with Old Bay/Butter & the other with the Oceanic Boil Sauce. Both sauces were absolutely DELICIOUS! We also ordered calamari with fries & garlic bread. The calamari was great. However the "garlic bread" was just a deli roll with garlic seasoning. (Wouldn't recommend it.) Our drinks were great, a little pricey for the size. Aside from the food, this restaurant has very good ambiance. I was little turned off when I went to the bathroom and saw high chairs stacked there. Very unhygienic. Also, the restuarant does not have parking. You'd have to find metered street parking, which can be a little difficult. Overall, I enjoyed it and we'll definitely be back!

So glad I found a seafood spot that I love that's not in busy Flushing , Queens. Went on a Saturday night at 10pm , sat at the bar because I was alone. The staff is on point & pleasant,  they check on you & pay attention. Tiny spot so be prepared to wait if you go with a large group. I had a pound of shrimp with garlic butter & lemon pepper sauce,  omg !! So damn good. Fried calamari which came with seasoned fries. And a frozen Mango margarita,  which was ok. Definitely will be returning soon !

Oh gosh! This place DID NOT disappoint. It was birthday Shenanigans. The place is small and quaint. Please don't change. The music was also very hip and cool!! Loved it. And it wasn't to loud that you couldn't hear yourself. The drinks blah! But the food SO makes up for it. Ordered the appetizers  fried catfish and fried shrimp with fries. So hot, so fresh, SO GOOD!! I ordered the spicy garlic sauce with the crab legs and shrimp and my friend had the same with the Oceanic sauce. That was better!! But still they were both very very good. The servers were on point and accommodating. Good service!! Good music! Good food!!  oh parking! All meters. That sucks but at least found a park an hour before 7pm. So paid for just an hour.

I am a local resident and I have passed by this place a dozen times. It is always busy so I waited for the right moment to come in and try it out. Today it's 19 degrees outside and there aren't many people here, which is understandable.Food:We ordered the branzino fish w/ sautéed spinach, 8 raw oysters, boiled clams in garlic lemon pepper sauce, a regular (non-virgin) piña colada, and a mango (non-virgin) piña colada. The fish was very tasty and well seasoned. My date and I licked the bones dry! The oysters were good, but we were missing the proper utensils (small fork). The clams were also tasty and my date enjoyed the potatoes and corn on the cob that accompanied the clams. The piña coladas were pretty darn good. Service:Although the restaurant wasn't busy, they were attentive. However, my food arrived before my date's food came. My date did not appreciate that, but because the food was so good we did not mind. Overall, we can't wait to come back.

Sometimes it's really the service that makes a restaurant. The food is very important but the hospitality begins first. Especially when you have a restaurant that is geared towards Cajun food. Southern hospitality, duh. I had to really flag down a person to refill my water. When you are running a boil restaurant, it's important to keep the water flowing. Even a pitcher of water on the table would have been ok. All that salt, and spice - H20 helps. When I finally received water, the waitress knocked over my cup and apologized. She didn't get a napkin or rag to even clean up the spill. This experience really raised my eyebrow. It's a boil place, it's messy, but I am still out to eat! To begin, they brought us the garlic noodles and Cajun Mac and cheese. I am so glad that I didn't get the lobster Mac and cheese. I felt like both noodles were edible. Nonetheless, it wasn't anything super special. I felt like I was eating from a box of KRAFT macaroni with seasoning added on top. Macaroni was way over cooked. The garlic noodles weren't spicy but had a lot of garlic on them. It was what you would envision with shrimp scampi. It wasn't impressive to me because I make a lot of spaghetti at home and add garlic and oil. We decided to opt for the shrimp boil 1lb. to share. We weren't in the mood for the fried food last night. We opted out for the crawfish. Let me say that I have been to Louisiana several times. I have had some good ol' Louisiana crawfish. During the month of January, they are not in season. This must mean that they get their crawfish from China or they are farm raised. I read a past review that they were tasteless. This is probably why. It doesn't feel like a true Cajun place. The boil garlic and old bay was very tasty. My potatoes were mostly not fully cooked throughout. Corn was exceptional. To be honest, I wasn't looking forward to the corn but I think the corn and shrimp were my favorite. The quality of the shrimp was fresh. Overall, the food here was ok. I am very grateful for the meal that I had with someone I love. ShrimpWas fresh.

Was not expecting EVERYTHING to be delicious!!! For apps we got shrimp basket and oysters. The oysters were fresh and served over a bed of shaved ice...loooved...the shrimp and cajun fries were seasoned and cooked perfectly. For entrees, we ordered the king crab leg boil. Do yourself a favor..get it!!! Absolutely sweet and succulent crab legs in a garlic butter sauce that is rare to match. I'm a foodie and I dont rate 5 stars very often but we are putting this place in our rotation! Expect a wait though.
Best place ever!  It's my favorite sea food spot ever. Butter garlic king crabs/ shrimp / clams  I'm never disappointed wen I come here

I cannot believe to have found a seafood boil in my neighborhood!Yes at first, my friends and I were reluctant- but they proved us wrong! Food as great, service was great, the place was a little tight- but not enough to bring down a star. They also went above and beyond!Once I ordered for delivery and they missed something- a drink. So I naturally called them, not pissed off but kind of disappointed because I didnt get my full order. I basically wanted to point out that they missed something so they should continue to double check every delivery order. Humans make mistakes, I understood it and that was what I told them. They were so nice about it, they apologized and ask if I wanted to get credit for it, the next time I visit or get something delivered and I gladly accepted. A few minuted after I ate my food, the doorbell rang and the same delivery man came up and gave me the "missing drink". I was soo surprised by it. Needless to say, they did an awesome job!

Skip it.  It's not bad, it's just not good.  I was excited to give this place a shot when it first opened since O Crab in Flushing closed (which had the best seafood boil Cajun sauce in my opinion).  I found the sauce bland, & definitely no heat.  Fast forward to 2020 & with the recent great reviews, I figured the issues were growing pains for a new business.  Nope.  Ordered the boil with shrimp & snow crab legs: again, no heat (after requesting extra spicy).  The sauce is also weirdly on the sweet side, which I wouldn't mind if balanced with some spice.  Another odd choice for the restaurant, the sauce was almost on the side?!!!  They didn't toss the seafood in the sauce, so boiled seafood was just sitting on top of the sauce.  Other boils I had, the seafood absorbed all the flavors from the sauce, so it was odd to see my (overcooked)  crabs & shrimps just sitting there.  However, since I despised the sauce, all good.  Also, pass on the fried oysters.  Too salty & the breading was so thick as if to disguise the not-so-fresh oysters?  Had to chuck it.

Came here on a Friday Night around 8pm & it was Full ! I like that it was small and cozy , but it's becoming popular sooo might want to expand .  Had to sit at the bar for about 15-20 min for a table to be Available. It was Okay , we enjoyed Pina Coladas and it gave time to look at the Menu and other patrons food. Drink prices were reasonable . So BOOM let's get into the food : A) Lobster roll , it came on a small bun with a lot of meat , and you get Cajun fries with it . Very Fulfilling &  Flavorful.B) Chicken wings were well done , very crispy ( I don't eat meat but my folks said they were okay ) C) Garlic Bread was a great appetizer to start of off , nice and warm D) Lobster Mac and cheese - It was okay , of course everyone's Mac and cheese is NOT the same . Think it could've used more CHEEEEEESE . $18 ehh didn't think it was worth that much as far as quality but it was a decent portion , I some left over THE WINNER GOES TOO !  E) Snow Crab + Shrimp OCEANIC BOIL SAUCE !!!!!!!!!Ooooo child ! Let me tell you ! This was finger licking Good ! I wanted to slap someone .. JP LOL . The crab legs had a lot of meat , the shrimps were juicy and huge ( unpeeled) and the corn and potatoes were Juicyyyyy ! I couldn't move after I ate . I needed help to the cab smh . Overall Great experience ! I am a pescatarian so I will be back over and over and over again ! Oh they were playing R&B Music all night I loved it ! Good Food, Drinks and Music . The Vibe was Right for a Friday Night ! OKURRRRTT

**Delivery Review**Wanted to try something new and Cajun is something you don't see very often in the neighborhood. Menu specializing in seafood with both large and small dishes.Wasn't overly hungry, but wanted to try a bit of everything. Decided on the  Seafood Gumbo ($8), Fish Taco ($10), and Sauteed Veggies ($4). Food comes in just under an hour - super hefty bag that comes with utensils and sauces. Veggies are a batch of steamed broccoli, potatoes and other greens with a glaze of butter on them (pretty good). Gumbo has a thick consistency but was overall lacking in some flavor and more meat. The pair of tacos envelop an overly fried fish with some veggies inside. Liked the soft tortilla but the meat needs work. Cajun fries are delicious with the side sauce.Overall the meal was okay - I think this is probably a better spot to go in person rather than for delivery.

Came through boilin' (boil, boil)Came through boilin' (boil, boil)Came through boilin' (boil, boil)Seafood in a bag, they boilin (shrimp)Give a little shrimp in spicy sauce (hot)Snow crab legs in butta sauce (eat)Taters corn soakin up flavor (woo)Lookin like a mess got my bib on (yeah)Cardi b-dripBest boil I've had in New York so far, that garlic butter lemon pepper sauce is "butter" than the rest. Spicy is the way to go if you can handle some heat. Calamari was nice and tender and we got a complimentary coffee flan which was okay, coffees not my fave flavor but it was good. Super friendly staff and attentive. Wish it wasn't so far from me I'd def frequent this spot. They have a happier hour too during the week but not sure what it is. It's worth the trip out to Jackson heights. Prices were very reasonable as well. $14/lb for shrimp and $19/lb for snow crab legs $10 calamari and fries combo

Came for early dinner.Place is very dark. I don't know why, but maybe for some kind of effect? Had fish tacos for starter $11: crispy fried fish inside tortilla with very little lettuce - tasted good, but expected more veggies, cajun fries tastes crispy and delicious.Oceanic combo- $86: the oceanic sauce was delicious- what a waste that they do not give any bread to soak the sauce with.They had a good amount of shrimp, but too many little crawfish which was a pain to eat- lobster was okay and so was the snow crab legs. Overall I think I may have gotten a better portion somewhere else for the price. Not sure if I will return. Its a good thing for them that there is no close seafood place as competition.

I called on a Saturday around 2:30 to confirm whether or not I was going to need a reservation. I was told, just come in.If you drive to this place, parking around the area could be rough, but you'll find a metered spot near by.The place is not that big, lighting was dark, I thought, for those with reading issues like me. We were greeted and sat very fast.
