Utensils and water were brought along with their menu.We ordered one pound of shrimp, one pound of steamed clams and one pound of snow crab legs all in garlic buttered sauce.For drinks: one piña colada and a beer. I tasted my piña colada and asked the waitress if it was a virgin one because it had no liquor. She immediately said, no worries and fix the issue. I was  Food came out pretty quickly and nice temperature. The taste was so delicious. I began using the clam shell as a spoon to eat that buttery garlic sauceThe service was amazing. Everything about this place deserves an A+

Wow, this place is downright amazing.  We had passed by this place few months back and it was packed.  We somehow showed up tonite and had to wait only about 20 mins.  Not bad.  We got the Oceanic combo $84 which came with 1 lobster (about 1.75 lbs), couple of snow crab legs, lots shrimps and crayfish, along with potatoes and corn.  For the sauce, we got the recommended Oceanic sauce but asked for it to be on the mild side.  When they brought it out, they had it in a white plastic bag with sauce and shook a few times to get all the sauces swimming.  Man, it was just delicious and you can really taste the fresh seafood.  Really great deal.  We also got the 8 piece raw Blue Point oysters for $16.  That went down smooth and fresh.  This place is all about the food and it helps that the service is to be commended.  They would prep you by giving you a bib and gloves.  Hahahaha you laugh but they do come in handy.  Definitely will come back again.
We got the crab leg and shrimp boil. It was flavorful but not Cajun. I wouldn't come here for an authentic seafood boil. Happy hour drinks were good though.

placed an order online for takeout due to this coronavirus/stay at home/social distancing. it says cash only. only to arrive there with 40 ppl waiting outside not knowing if folks are there to pick or just plain order. oceanic boil's phone was busy all afternoon, no way to reach a live person to ask any questions, what time will it be ready or even try to cancel order.  i waited outside of oceanic boil, listening for names being called and severalpeople never came to pick up their order, i eventually left, to receive a call an hour and a half later that my order was ready. sorry, if folks were able to pay credit card online, then maybe they wouldnt waste food that was ordered where people never came to pick up.  i made it very clear to the person who called, if they want to keep business going, to be more organized because it Sucks that their food is decent but other small businesses would have had their organization on POINT, this place is not and this coronavirus will be around for awhile. heed this advice and be more organized when it comes to take out/pick up ordere
Definitely way better since they changed owners. Now it's my new fave go to! Definitely check it out. Delicious!

Oceanic Boil was an unexpected treat. I went on an impromptu visit on a Saturday afternoon. We were seated right away. The decor is ocean and water themed and the lights were low. Natural light was coming in from the windows. We ordered a few orders of fries to start and garlic noodles. To share we ordered the meal to share with lobster, subbed clams instead of crawfish, crab legs and shrimp.  There was also sweet corn and potatoes. The food came quicker than we thought it would. The seafood was delicious in a garlicky and spicy sauce. We shared the meal for 4. It could have been good for 3. 5 definitely would have been a stretch.   We ordered extra garlic noodles to put into the sauce which was perfect. I would definitely go again for another trip.
You can never go wrong eat inside or even taking it to go. The jumbo shrimp is a really good option to buy. Fills me up well.
A nice neighborhood spot for seafood. The oyster is fresh and sauce added flavor. The shrimp basket is good, I would like to try more shrimp and fish next time.
If you want seafood with unique choices of sauce, this is the place. Old bay sauce is insanely  good.

As a huge fan of the Cap't Loui chain, I was stoked to try Oceanic Boil & I'm happy to report that it didn't disappoint. In fact, I actually prefer Oceanic Boil's garlic noodles in comparison to Cap't Loui's! (They're thicker and they have nice chunks of garlic in them... I need the recipe). I wasn't as impressed with the garlic bread which was subpar. Spicy sauce wasn't as advertised but the table is loaded with Louisiana hot sauce & Sriracha so it was an easy fix. The service was nothing out of the ordinary but I appreciated how everyone worked as a team, making the experience enjoyable; The bartender sat us down, food runners were able to add to our orders & I think at one point someone from the kitchen dropped our food -- I love a business that runs smoothly and this one surely does. If I could give a 4.5, I would. I'll most definitely be back!

Me and a few coworkers found this place online. We wanted seafood, and was hoping we could get it delivered via uber eats or seem less. We couldn't so we decided to go because we were impressed with the menu. The only thing I did not like was the long wait time. The food was so good... I had the shrimp, with snow crab legs potato, and corn.  The staff was very nice and attentive. Update: just found out you can order on Ubereats yaaaaa!!!

This is by far my favorite boil in NYC that I've went to. This was my second time here. 1st Time was for my birthday in June and second time was recently in December with my boyfriend. He loved it and I loved it all over again. the ambience is very comfortable, you are greater as soon as you walk in. Both times the music was good, so you can do a little head bob and sing along while waiting for your food. Portion size are amazing. I am a seafood eater and love seafood especially boils. They give you gloves for those who don't want your hands to get dirty and a bib. The first time I ordered a drink it was pretty strong (just how I like it). Will definitely recommend anyone to go here, I actually already did. And I must say the price are pretty reasonable. For two boils with extra sides $78.00, I can't complain.

Just delicious all around with great service. From the drinks to the food. They provide enough coverage for you to get eat without getting too messy. Great service as well. I've eaten there 2x and it has lived up to the reviews both times. Warning for the spice, don't order the medium or high spice unless you really are a true spice lover!

Oceanic is one of the many Seafood Boil places that have popped up over the years mirroring The Boil. It is your typical Louisiana Boiled Seafood ran by Vietnamese folks. We got the Fired Lobster special, a combo of 1lb crawfish and shrimp and a side of garlic noodles. The fried lobster was ok nothing special. The combo though was preety darn good. It seemed like it was more then 2lbs of food. The Crawfish were big and seemed endless. The sauce we chose was the garlic butter lemon pepper. Boy oh boy was that sauce phenomenal. When I was finished I was scooping from the bottom of the bowl just eating the sauce. The garlic noodles are a must if you love garlic. Super delicious. This place is small and gets crowded. We arrived at 6pm and was seared right away but by 7pm people were waiting and when I walked past later on at 845pm there was huge crowd outside waiting and this was a Sunday night. Lastly the prices were reasonable for the amount of food you get.

I have done a lot of reviews on Yelp and I've always been satisfied with 5 stars. Now I'm wishing there were more stars to give this place. A couple weeks ago I had a dinner in Long Beach California that was five times as expensive not a fraction is good is this. This is simply the most amazing Cajun seafood place I have ever encountered in my life and I've been to New Orleans more than once. We got the super duper seafood boil with lobster crab crayfish and shrimp and it was simply off the charts good. We went to five pairs of gloves in about 40 napkins. It was absolutely amazing. one of the reasons I'm so crazy about this place is that it looks like a little hole-in-the-wall place except that it's busy the service is good the prices are reasonable and it was just awesome it's a very unassuming place in an unassuming neighborhood but by God it's your anywhere near there you should go. That is unless you don't like seafood.

Definitely worth the wait. Food was amazing, a whole lobster and a pound of head on shrimp for about $45 can't beat that. Plus the choice of seasonings and corn and potatoes ties it all together. I'll be going back.

Had a great time here. Been wanting to come for a while. Service was quick and good. The crab legs were great. No fishy taste to the legs and was well seasoned with the corn and potatos. For two people we had 1lb of snow crabs each with drinks, and lobster rolls. Our total was around $120-140.

Hmmm .... 4 stars for flavors 1 star for my tummy aches.It was really good going down but not so much afterwards. Perhaps too oily and maybe not 100% clean? Idk. It's been 30 hrs since we had our Sunday brunch. I am still suffering. My husband and I both had a rough night with our tummies. I left work early today because of that. Flavor-wise there's room for improvement for sure. I usually can't decide if I wanted to eat all the potatoes and the corn first before getting to the seafood because when done right they are like crack! I had a bite of the potato, something was off. It was hard and wasn't cook all the way through with the sauce absorbed. I wasn't crazy about them. :( We had the 1lbs snow crab and 1lbs shrimp combo plus a side of fries - just the right amount of food for two people. The shrimp was big and the quality of the crab was pretty good. We had the House Sauce base with our combo. It was pretty spicy.  I have to say the other boil places in the lower east side tasted better. More sauce and less garlicky. This one is basically smothering the seafood in garlic and butter. It's a bit too much for me. The fries were pretty good. The dipping sauce that came with the fries was quite awesome. A bit spicy but just the right amount of kick. Friendly staff but do need to provide more napkins to customers. seafood boil is a messy business. You can't just give me one piece of napkin and I have to keep asking you to give me more, which you did give me one piece at a time.... Let's hope my tummy issue will go away soon...

This is a decent spot for seafood. Servers are very attentive. The food is tasty. Two thumbs way up for the garlic bread. Sooo yummy. We ordered the oceanic seafood combo which came with one pound of shrimp, crawfish, snow crab legs and a whole lobster. They were accommodating and put the shrimp in a separate dish as I am allergic. You'd be surprised how many other establishments give a hard time for this. I was very pleased with them. The drinks were also good. Definitely will be back.

Their food is so good! The place is always crowded but i don't mind waiting cause the food is worth it, i always get the combo snow crab legs and 1lb shrimp with Oceanic boil sauce super spicy. Always craving it only if i had the money to eat it often.
Nice, cozy place. Wait time can be long. Decent place. Service was A++, food was okay but nothing fancy. Overall great sea food place to dine in.

I wanted to like it, but between the horrible food I ordered (raw oysters and salmon filet) and the horrible music, I can't believe it is rated as high as it is.Prices are reasonable for NYC - drinks are less than $12 - and the amount of food you get is plenty.  Back to my food: the 8 oysters for $16 were algae-ridden.  My salmon was mildly warm and dry. Oh and she brought it before our drinks arrived and about 10 minutes before my dining companions combo meals came.    They enjoyed the combos... definitely wear bibs because it does get messy!

Seafood!!!!!!!! ILove It When I first order crab legs with the pound of shrimp I was truly satisfied the spicy oceanic sauce amazing !!!!! But the garlic lemon  is my favorite!!!! The lobster cook to the point  the corn and potato delicious combo with the meal. Soft shell crabs are bombing if you want something to share with the fam before you get your meal. Make sure to wear comfy clothes it gets messy but hey it's seafood you to get messy or else it's not good trust me and Oceanic Boil leave me happy and full lol thank you for making seafood truly amazing !!!!!

2.5 stars rolling up to a 3.After coming across the Oceanic Yelp review a friend and I had to try it!  Both of us are huge seafood lovers and are always looking to try new places.  Upon entering you'll quickly notice the inside is casual a bit dim but clean with mounted seats so reconfiguring for large parties would be difficult.  After ordering a beverage to start and reviewing the menu we decided on a couple of apps to share and an entree.  We decided on the fish tacos with onion rings, the fried oysters (the star of the show) with Cajun fries, the BBQ shrimp with a salad and for our entree the pound of mussels in the Oceanic Boil sauce with a side of the extra spicy sauce on the side. The apps all came with Cajun fries but the waitress gave us the option to switch it to onion rings and salad.  -The oysters, fried to perfection with a side of cajun fries - if this was the only thing I ate this review would a solid 4 stars.  -The fish tacos were just alright, with a chunk of fried fish in a soft flour tortilla it was missing the love, the onion rings were great. -The BBQ (head-on, shell-on) shrimp... I can deal with head-on/shell on shrimp, but these were overcooked and tasted a bit weird, after eating the second one I decided that food poisoning is not worth it and decided to not finish them.  The salad was from a bag of mixed greens.- The pound of mussels... they were the giant New Zealand tough chewy mussels.  The sauce, corn and potatoes were good.  I don't ever need to eat those mussels again.All in all not sure I'd ever go back.

What winner for seafood-boil-in-a-bag. Not expensive, not cheap, not glamorous and definitely not fancy. Staff very accommodating and a nice happy hour selection of reds and whites. As they say in Cambodia: me gusta
I liked the vibe a lot but crawfish smelled a bit funky. I will come back to try something new. Cocktails are good and apps are delish

This place is located in my old neighborhood where I grew up and I love that I can eat here and then walk around afterwards in a neighborhood I can never stop calling home. Yesterday was my first time visiting. The place is small with dim lighting that actually makes one enjoy some messy eating in a rather intimate way. Even though the place is on the smaller side, there is ample amount of seating both for small groups and larger groups. I came here with my sister and we ordered 1lb shrimp and 1lb mussels in the oceanic boil sauce. We also got garlic bread and Cajun fries with spicy mayo for the table. First off, this was my first time ever trying seafood boil and I am blown away at how flavorful and filling this meal was. The sauce was an excellent combo of spicy, sweet and garlicky. I love that it also comes with potatoes and corn which I devoured in seconds because it was that good. The fries were also my favorite. For two people, the amount of food we ordered was more than enough (we had to take some to go because it was so much). If you're ever in doubt of what to try the shrimp and mussels are a safe bet for sure. I highly recommend this place!!

Wow just wow, awesome bakes here. Went with a large party usually I'll recommend that to keep the bill low, especially with seafood sometimes you remain hungry with seafood but not here, they bring you an abundance of seafood with so many different options of flavor it was so good that we did another order it was so delicious  after trying it out i will say i won't order the crawfish, nothing against theirs but i feel you may as well go for a lobster I'm too lazy to sit there with those slippery suckers. The lobster claw was massive!!! Made it difficult to open it up but when you do! Omg definitely going back

So I had dinner here again last night and I'm slightly disappointed. I ordered a dozen oysters that were horrible. They had no taste whatsoever. Not quite sure if they were overly rinsed/cleaned or whether they were frozen but they absolutely were the worst I've ever had.  The table next to us also placed an order and mentioned to us that they thought the same. They were asking other tables if they wanted them as they couldnt even finish eating them. The shrimp basket, calamari basket and snow crab legs however were amazing! Hoping they try to improve the quality of their oysters.

This place is a hidden gem... The seafood is delicious and the place is small and cozy... It was awesome eating there and listening to the old school R&B.... The drinks are ok... Nothing to brag about but I will say it's the food that will keep bringing you back...

This place is the best! My friends and I left stuffed but happy, which is pretty much exactly what you'd hope for any time you go out to eat.Food: The oceanic mix sauce is truly incredible, I almost licked the bag clean! We tried every spice level and each one was perfect butttt just know, the oceanic mix is spicy on its own. Extra spicy and super spicy just takes it to the next level, which is perfect if you love spicy :) We tried snow crabs, stone crabs, clams and shrimp. I would definitely recommend the snow crabs and clams, so delicious! The potatoes and corn that come with each bag is such a treat. We ordered some nice warm garlic bread which was a nice accompaniment to the meal. I also had an amazing virgin piña colada. So overall: yum. Service and ambiance: this place is a little hole in the wall, which made it super cozy. The music was really good, my friends and I sang along to some great throwbacks. Our table neighbors were singing along as well! There was such a fun happy vibe. The waiters were very friendly and helpful and always had a smile on their faces. They give us bibs and gloves, but it still gets messy and I honestly think it adds to the fun of it. If you love seafood and you want to have a good time, I'd definitely recommend this place!

Yummy in my tummy.I've worked in Elmhurst queens for the past three years and finally stumbled upon this place. It has an adorable nautical theme that makes you feel like your somewhere near the ocean if you close your eyes you can even hear the waves.The food is AMAZING !!! we ordered their garlic noodles which is a must have when visiting this place. We also ordered the prawns and crab basket with the spicy butter garlic sauce -if given the chance I would've licked the bag containing the seafood. The seafood was perfectly cooked and delicious and the sauce made my day . It was the perfect combination of butter ( like who doesn't love butter ) , garlic and spice. I will be going back again for sure.

Great little whole in wall spot with a chill environment. I came across this place from a friend on yelp that had this spot bookmarked. Decent selection of beers and the food for the most part was excellent. I came here on a Saturday night and i ordered the shrimp and fries which was good. The service and wait staff was great. The place was packed and food came out pretty fast. If your looking for seafood this place is cool. Definitely not city island, but a great spot to grab seafood without traveling to the Bronx. I would definitely come back and try something different.

the only reason it went down one star is that you will leave there with your clothes smelling like garlic. i wore a leather jacket and i'm still trying to get the smell out!!! so wear clothes that are machine washable.Otherwise great price and value for seafood. the oceanic recommended flavor i would agree with is delicious. i got the oysters, lobster mac (which isn't too heavy or has that hard crusted cheese on top), the mussels main dish which are large mussels, along with corn and potatoes and my friend got the king crab legs which he had to take some home. I did the waitlist on yelp and it worked perfectly. I even went on a Saturday night and it wasn't crazy packed. I didn't get a drink but my friend got the oceanic sangria and loved it.

Have had pick up here twice and it's probably a place I will ALWAYS come back too. Oceanic boil is delicious and I've been searching for a place like this for a long time! I had the combo the both times that I ordered.First Time: 1lb Snow crab with 1lb Crawfish 2 potatoes 1 corn. Garlic butter + Lemon pepper seasoning it was delicious! He did tell me crawfish wasn't in season but they were good. The snow crab was amazing , the corn is nice and sweet everything was really good. It's like eating something of off Instagram lol! We also had calamari but those were okay.Second time: 1lb Snow Crab with 1lb of shrimp 2 potatoes 1 Corn. Cajun Style (Garlic All Day) also very delicious! If you like more of the seafood taste then season go with this one it's just a little more subtle. Ordered on the phone and the hospitality was great, place is small but feels homey. Very casual place, opens at 3pm which is amazing you can eat late and it's just a wonderful restaurant over all!

This place is GOLD! I found this place on Yelp after my best girlfriend got dumped and it literally turned her entire mood around. The food was so delicious and flavorful. Even though we were full, I would've eaten more. We shared the Lobster, Crawfish, and Shrimp with the Oceanic sauce. THE SAUCE! omggggg. The drinks were pretty delicious and mildly strong. The servers were also really amazing and made the experience super fun. Also, they played the jams from the early 00's which gets an A+. I've been to other boil places in the city (which I won't name) and Oceanic Boil takes the cake! Also, the Yelp waitlist feature works amazingly as I got to put my name in at home, watched an episode of Broad City, got dressed, met up with my friend, walked in and our table was ready! Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu!

So most seafood boil places are just alright. I mean, it's seafood and it's a boil...add some old bay, some crazy spice level and charge an arm and a leg.At least, that's what I expected yesterday after stopping in for an early dinner with the family. I was pleasantly surprised that their mild spice, WAS ACTUALLY mild. In addition, most places kind of blur together because their boil is rally just the sharp bite of old bay seasoning with some garlic. Oceanic Combo had the base layer of old bay, but then there were other layers of flavor in the sauce that I wound up going back to dip my seafood, corn and potatoes in. It almost tasted like there was a mild coconut curry layer in their sauce. Whatever it was, the flavor was delicious. The ONLY complaint I have is their portions were slightly less than I would have liked. They claim their Oceanic Combo feeds four people.  At first glance, I could have finished the entire thing by myself. Then again...I can eat. lol

I am sooooooo in love with this place. Its my favorite restaurant ever. We always come here and Nita is the best she knows us by now because thats how often we come LOL. Garlic lemon pepper is the best sauce ever, and second best is the oceanic sauce which is all the sauces mixed together.I always get the snow crabs, lobster, but the shrimp and crawfish (in season) is soo good too.Appetizers- cajun fries, THE CORN!!, and the shrimp basket is so bomb, also the wings are so tangy and amazing. My mouth is watering writing this. I. Just. Love. This. Place.

It's a great place to go if you love seafood. My girlfriend took me there cause she knows how much I love seafood and so does she; that's one thing we have in common. The food is tasty and the price was just right. What was funny about going there was that I didn't know how to peel the shrimp, so my girlfriend helped me peel it off. The staff are very friendly and helpful as well. Overall it's a nice place and it has a nice environment to go with friends and family, for big or small groups. Price is right and the food is good, so would definitely recommend it to anyone and everyone go check it out, especially if your a seafood lover.

Delicious! Our seafood was so fresh and it was drained in amazing garlic butter sauce.... sooo good. Place was PACKED on a Sunday afternoon , the line was outside. Next time will book a table ahead of time . Staff is very attentive and friendly. Will be back again.

A true hidden gem! I had been craving seafood boil for a while and decided to come with my aunt on a Friday night. We were promptly seated and our orders were taken right away even though the restaurant was slightly full. They do have happy hour specials M-F from 5-7 but I got their signature sangria which isn't part of happy hour. It was delicious, not too sweet and not too strong. We got calamari for an appetizer which comes with cajun fries and Siracho mayo - delicious! For my entree I got a combo of shrimp and snow crab legs (1 lb) with the garlic butter + lemon pepper sauce which comes with corn and potatoes. My aunt got the clams casino and lobster mac and cheese. Everything was bursting with flavor esp the butter sauce. The lobster mac and cheese was so good I even ordered one to take home. It all rang up about $125 which is an amazing deal for all that seafood! The service was beyond amazing and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back!

If you blink you'll walk by and miss this small neighborhood seafood joint but so happy it's here! Fresh seafood without the manhattan prices?! YES PLEASE! Ordered the oceanic combo that came with a pound each of lobster, king and snow crab legs, shrimp, crawfish and a small smattering of corn on the cob and potato chunks in a spicy garlic butter sauce. The sauce had a nice spicy bite to it with a ton of chopped fresh garlic mingled into the mix. Ordered a mojito and a lychee sake martini and both were made to perfection and complimented our meal beautifully. The staff was really warm and welcoming. I loved the fact that the staff informed us that fresh crawfish season had ended and that what they were serving was the frozen variety, so we could substitute it for more of one of the other items in the combo of we chose. Thought that was pretty kick ass and thoughtful to the customer. Wish more places did that!Loved everything about this place, will definitely be back very soon!

I have yet to be disappointed by Oceanic Boil, and hopefully never will be. This seafood restaurant based in Jackson Heights is the first of hopefully more absolutely wonderful restaurants in the neighborhood.Everything tastes fresh and I honestly can't get enough of everything. Their Cajun fries are delicious, their appetizers are superb, and the mains are tasty, messy, and fun to eat. For their mains they even now give you the option of how spicy you want your sauce to be, which is a great idea and let me tell you, it's pretty hot. This establishment is small so make a reservation if you can since it gets very crowded. Hopefully they might expand in the future to accommodate more people, so that we all might enjoy eating it.

Cajun Mac n' Cheese- Pretty good, the cajun gave it a little spicy kickFor the mains, we got 1 pound of shrimp & clams each with the garlic butter/lemon pepper sauce. Some of the clam meat were really small compared to the shell. But overall the buttery garlicky sauce was so addicting and I couldn't help but smother the shrimp in it!Garlic Noodles- wasn't my favorite if I had to compare the flavor to everything else. But if you mix the noodles with the clam/garlic butter sauce it does make it more flavorful.

Amazing! Love their seafood! Their butter based sauces are amazing! Service is great, I've never had an issue. The place is a little snug, the wait could be a bit long for larger parties. The parking is on the street so that's a little horrific lol one time it took my husband 35 minutes to find a parking spot near by. But for me it was worth it at the end! I absolutely love the boil basket!

The place doesn't have many seats but the staff was amazing. We had a drink at the bar and before we could order a second round our table was ready.  The food was great, and happy hour deals made it a perfect place for an early dinner. After our first visit, we have been back several times.

Great food and they're very accommodating.  The sun was in my face where we were seated, so they offered us another table.  The food was delicious and it was a great price.  I love that they don't compete with Manhattan prices because locals will definitely just come here instead of going to Manhattan.  Will definitely come again!

My new favorite place. Oysters, crab legs and snow crabs were FABULOUS. I loved the garlic butter. They give you gloves and aprons if you need. My hubby and I are definitely coming back. And we found out that they also take reservations. I know where I want to go for my birthday!UPDATE:  they expanded their menu  and changed up their recipes for the sauces. And this place is heaven for any seafood lover. The service is really good.My husband and I love this place. And the owner is extremely nice.
I loved it with never imagine to have such great seafood at this location was worth every dollar we spent food is excellent the service the ambience loved it

The perfect place to try out to satisfy my craving for seafood! I came during happy hour and was sad to see that the happy hour had less items than 5 months ago. Only appetizers and a few drinks are on the happy hour menu now...Despite that hiccup, I placed an order for mussels with garlic butter sauce. I don't really get the point of the potatoe so the waitress let me know she can just give me an extra piece of corn instead.You get gloves and a bib to conquer your seafood deliciousness.Man were the mussels delicious especially since they were freshly boiled! Some were orange while others were a tan color. I'm no seafood expert so I don't know if it made a difference but everything was yummy in my tummy. I got 1lb of mussels which equals 12 mussels with two pieces of corn.The bathrooms are really clean which is always a plus in my book. And with the receipt they give you mint candies and a wet nap. Talk about ending the experience on a good note!
Delicious! Definitely get the Oceanic boil sauce.. garlicky buttery goodness. Sweetest staff too!

We ordered: - Garlic noodles- garlic bread- mussels in oceanic seasoning- snow crab in oceanic seasoningGarlic noodles were $6 and underwhelming, wouldn't get it again. Garlic bread was a delicious compliment to the mussels and crab and was only $3. The oceanic seasoning is a mix of all their different seasoning options and it was so buttery, spicy and garlicky. We liked the mussels the most since they were cooked perfectly and the sauce was infused well. We also liked the potatoes and corn but would've liked to see sausages in there.

I'm not trying to be mean, this is my second time here and I was trying really hard to give it a chance, but, The food is terrible. The sauce is all brown, muddy and thick and gooey and bland. The garlic noodles stink when brought to the table and it's terribly bland too. It's creamy and sticky and UGHHH! The seafood was fishy too. I hate the sauce! I hate the sauce! I hate the sauce! I really hate it! The appetizers were all blaahhhh...The wait staff was nice but so slow and inattentive!!
Food is amazing!  Prices are great and the staff is adorable and so pleasant. Definitely my go to spot for terrific seasoned seafood

This place never disappoints! The drinks are really good, and the sauce for the boils are the best. Way better than claw daddy's in my opinion. They're garlic noodles are the best I taste this far and not dry either. I love this place been here 4 times and I'm going again. I'm going to try other menus items I haven't ent tried next time I go.
Love it here! Food and Drinks never disappoint! Always have a great experience and the service is great as well. My go to seafood place.

I came in at around 7pm on a Sunday evening and was very lucky to get seated right away. There is usually a line here.Service here was very exceptional. People were friendly, and attentive.I started off with a mai tai drink. It was basic and good. I had lobster roll with fries and branzino. Everything came with an Asian style garlic butter sauce!! The sauce was on point!!!!!!!!I would buy jars of this if it was sold in a jar.  If you like seafood then this is a spot you will want to try.
Smells like ass, they also won't seat you if you come in at 11:30 even though it says open till midnight.

Finally got around to checking this place out!Went there with a family member on a Tuesday night. Restaurant is located on a busy street corner but Parking was easy to find.DecorSmall restaurant, cute, nothing fancy. Clean and cozy.ServiceService was good. The waiter was attentive. He made a couple of mistakes with my order but was very apologetic about it and fixed it right away--no questions asked.FoodI would have given this place 4 stars even if it wasn't for the subpar food. I ordered the snow crab leg with their house sauce. I have tried crab in many different restaurants and states and I can tell you that this one was just okay. The sauce was tasty and slightly spicy but not as flavorful as i hoped. The cajun fries were good though.Price fair, probably a little cheaper than in Manhattan.Overall cute restaurant with good service and average seafood.

I love a good seafood boil!!!  My husband and I usually travel from LI to downtown NYC to really great spot, so when I saw the reviews from this spot I wanted to give it a try. The restaurant is cozy.  The chairs are interesting (the back is just a bar) not really to comfortable but manageable.  It's tight quarters so be ready to share your space.  The food was really good! I got the oceanic special (mild) and then had them add some lemon pepper. Hubby got the oceanic special and added extra spicy.  It was the combo meals of crab/shrimp and crab/crawfish.  To note, shrimp had the heads still on them .  When we got there it was happy house.  Their white wine was aPinot Grigio. The service was good.  Very laid back, and no sense of rushing us out.  It was a Thursday evening and the place was packed!! They also had a A for their health inspection which is great!!
Pricey but really great food! The crab legs were really nice amounts of meat! Worth a visit

I came here a couple of weeks ago with my best friend and a business associate. Very nice ambience and excellent service. The bathrooms are clean. Soon as you order they give you tools and bibs to get right to business. My bff and I ordered the Oceanic combo. It is a combo of a crawfish, shrimp, crab legs and a whole lobster with the garlic-butter lemon-pepper sauce. This was sooooo good. I wasn't very hungry and didn't plan on eating much but I couldn't stop eating. The flavor was out of this world. The seafood was fresh. The lobster was perfection!!! I wish I had ordered the passion fruit tea, I hear great things. Next time for sure!!!!

As personal opinions go I'll be blunt. Don't expect any exemplary service here, as the past two test visits has shown nothing but a good lack of common sense. How does a restaurant that serves hardshell seafood not have the tools you need to crack and open them?!Another fact, don't expect a good "tip" for trash service. Two stars for the sauce.
The food tasted good but ended up giving me and my wife hart burn and a bad stomach ache the next day

really delish place. Great combos and the sauces are so good! they could give a little more in terms of portion sizing (was it really a pound?) and some of the apps (mac n cheese) felt like something from a kraft box lol. the spagetti was good tho.

OCEANIC BOIL IS THE BEST RESTAURANT FOR SEA FOOD LOVERS , I wasn't that fan of sea food until I stumbled upon oceanic boil. The sea food they serve is fresh well seasoned and bursting with flavors , they also serve the crunchiest best fries ever with a side of spicy mayo. I would totally recommend One thing I didn't enjoy was their calamari and shrimp basket ( fried) they were super greasy and heavy with no flavor but other than that everything was amazing , the service was great and the food comes in minutes from ordering 9.5/10
They're the absolute best ! The mac & cheese (with and without lobster) is delicious .

Food was amazing! Got the snow crab legs and 1lb shrimp with garlic and old bay and I was so satisfied with the flavor and amount of food. Although I was hungry within an hour, I will definitely be back for more!
Definitley coming back. The oceanic boil sauce on the snow crabs was so delicious. The calamari was also very good.

Honestly the lobster Mac and cheese is disgusting and the cheese is cheap loose Watery cheese. The boil lobster Mac and cheese is way better. I haven't tried nothing else and maybe will try but for now don't ever order the lobster Mac and cheese I really wanted my money back so bad.

Only positive is the service. Ordered shrimp and it wasnt cleaned still had the crap in it. Steak was extremely dry and tasteless. This restaurant has no ventilation and is extremely hot and chairs are uncomfortable.
The wait was 45 min to an hour when we went so we just took our food to go which only took 15 min. It was delicious! I've been dying for some crab legs lately and that 1 pound really hit the spot.

hidden gem! for sure!!!!! i live in the neighborhood and i cant believe it took me so long to visitb highly recommend this place, food was amazing!!!! a bit on the pricey side but they do serve a lot of food!!!!ps. i wish the shrimps were peeled!!!!

Absolutely scrumptious!!!!Ordered to go since I have a baby and couldn't really stay to dine in. I'm a bit skeptical when it comes to lobster rolls, more than often the lobster meat would be bland and condiments would only consist of mayo... BUT NOT HERE!!! LOBSTER ROLL IS AMAZING!!! Spicy, add a bit of lemon juice and boom!!! Party in your mouth!!!!Even though I only stopped to pick up my food, the employees were very nice.Would definitely be back and try the crawfish. Super stoked I was able to find this cute little gem!

Ordered online and went to pick up. The restaurant is pretty small but when I got home and opened up my food I started drooling lol. Seafood was fresh and seasoned just how I like it. Definitely will be stopping by again
Food here is great! And the wait staff is very friendly and warm. Always angood time here.

This place is my favorite seafood spot. It's a hidden gem in Jackson Heights. I always order to-go and dine-in. The shrimp and lobster combo with their lemon garlic butter sauce is delicioussssssss. The clam chowder soup is also one of my favorites. I would recommend seafood lovers to try this spot.

4-7pm happy hour. Oysters $1, frozen drinks like sake pina colada $5.50. The old bay seasoning was perfect. Wasn't too salty and just the right amount of spice. The garlic butter was very puréed and the garlic flavor tastes even better. Cajun fries were amazing as well.It's in a neighborhood where you don't expect to have good seafood Cajun style. But it was on point

I really want to 1 star this place and tell you it blows and don't go there. But it'd be a lie. The truth is, this place is great, I just don't like waiting for a table. What's so great? Oh, IDK, have you ever looked at the ocean and said "Yes, please, with extra butter"? Welp, now you can. Crab legs, mussels, shrimp, crawfish, all those things. Corn so you feel like you're eating vegetables? Sure, whatever, throw it in. I've been to several boil joints, and this one is definitely the most difficult/costly to get to for me, but the one I keep coming back to. But I gave it 4 stars, so here it is: One time they gave someone else my table. They said we have the next table, and then they gave it to someone else that they clearly knew. That was real uncool, because as I mentioned above, I don't like waiting, and I had already waited a very long time. So to watch someone sit in the seat that should be mine? Yeah, not into it.

Love the seafood here! The price is amazing and the food is even better! There always busy so you know the food is great! I get the salmon biggest chunk of salmon I've ever gotten while eating out and the old bay butter is the bomb! My boyfriend gets the crab and shrimp shaking up with the butter, potatoes and corn the flavor is so good!

This review is long overdue since I ate here about 8months ago. Better late than never though lol. Came here with my bestie to meet up for dinner with a future employer. We came around 4 or 5pm so it was fairly quiet except for us and another group at another table. We waited quite a while for the 3rd person to show up and the waitress was friendly about it. I use this time to look around the restaurant. The decor is cute,beachy feel and casual which is just right for a seafood boil spot. He finally shows up and we order right away. He gets the snow crab legs and my gf and I get the Oceanic combo which has a little of everything.Some shrimp,crawfish,snow crab legs,lobster,corn and potatoes. It took a VERY long time for it to come out. So if you have time to kill by all means eat here lol. When it did arrive it was soooo delicious. We opted for the sauce that has a lil of everything and it was perfect. Just the right amount of flavor and spice. The seafood was perfectly cooked. Especially the lobster which was amazeballs. I could not stop eating once I started. If I had anything to critique was that the potatoes were way undercooked and they only give you two tiny pieces of corn. And sausage should be added as well for that smoky flavor. For such a big entree there should def have been more. When I return I will just say less potatoes and more corn please. We didn't eat dessert since we were so stuffed. But as a huge seafood lover I'm def on planning on going back for my fix and it's walking distance from me. As far as prices I don't know since our employer treated. Go check it out!
Oceanic boil sauce with king crab is the best! Try to get it every payday. Coz its maaaad money but maaaad good.

Great food. Great service. Better yet, it's LOCAL. You want great Seafood come over here !! It's amazing. I won't give it 5 stars only because it's so full and it's a small restaurant. The liquor from the bar was ehh. Not worth it's price but the food is great!
Is a really good spot for sea food !!! A lil pricey but worthy!!!! Can check this place out if you love sees food like I do

Hidden gem in Queens for seafood! Usually, when I'm hungry for some seafood, I hop in the car and travel to the famed City Island in the Bronx. For whatever reason, I wasn't up for the drive and decided to keep things local. What a great decision on my part!Looking through the Yelp app under the best seafood tab, Ocean Boil was at the top of the list with a healthy 4 & 1/2  rating. I take my Yelp ratings very seriously and decided to give them a shot! So glad I did!This place's calling card is by far the crab and lobster. I mean, they offer about 5 different sauces you can have your or lobster mixed in. I went for the spicy garlic butter sauce and boy was it terrific. Scarfed on a pound of king crab cluster that were gigantic! The crab meat was so sweet and fresh and the butter sauce marinade complemented it so well! It's safe to say I will definitely be going back to get more of the yummy crab this place serves up! If you are looking for some fresh and tasty crab/lobster but aren't looking to get socked in the mouth with crazy menu prices, give this place a try. You won't be disappointed!
The atmosphere is fantastic. A good family place with a small bar in the back. The food looked good but wasn't super. I would go back and give them another chance when I'm in the area.

A HIDDEN GEM IN JACKSON HEIGHTS FOR SURE. So happy I tried this place out last night !!!! It was DELICIOUS and everything I wanted out of a seafood boil.  Been trying to find a place that serves seafood like this and I was so excited. We got two Oceanic Combos for a table of 5 people & it was perfect! 1 Combo we got with Garlic Butter sauce and the other combo we got with Oceanic Boil Sauce (spicy) - both so yummy! The garlic butter was my favorite for sure though. All of the seafood was greattt and I loved that we all got to wear bibs and gloves while devouring this food haha. It's such a perfect place to go if you love seafood.
Delicious food and fast service. A bit noisy but overall enjoyable. Im definitely coming back.

I've bookmarked this place for a while. Mainly because they have matcha flan on the menu lol. Finally got to try it a couple of weeks ago. We got the crab legs and shrimp combo with spicy garlic butter & old bay sauce. OMG sooo delish!!! My only complaint is they could be a little more genorous with the potatoes and corn it comes with. There was half a piece of corn and barely any whole pieces of potatoes. C'mon these are not expensive. Not  knowing exactly how much food we'd be getting, that's all we ordered. In the end we weren't too full. So I ordered the Cajun mac n' cheese after we finished the seafood. It was very good. Of course I had to order the flan. Well, to be honest, it was a bit disappointing, as I really didn't taste matcha. But as far as the food, it was really good and will definitely be returning.

We really enjoyed this spot! We shared a few apps and the 1lb shrimp boil. Highly recommend getting the Oceanic Boil sauce. It was soooooo delicious!! Service was solid and friendly! We would definitely return in the future.
As a repeat  customer.  I enjoying having  this place in my neighborhood.  I enjoy the shrimp And lobster seafood.  Drinks are delicious.  The sangria is my favorite.

The first time with my friends is so good and the second time I brought 6 friends there. However, they don't have such a big table for 6 so we have to sit separately into 2 groups. The food was delicious and fresh, I wish they could have big-table for 6-8 people
- im so in love w these crab legs an the sausage ' wait isnt that long .. Food isnt expensive an been there 3 days n a row

Really great spot. Loved the garlic butter marinade sauce they use on the boil. Clams were plump and fresh. Oysters were ok ( fresh but small). My husband really enjoyed his king crab. I also had stone crab claws but would prob get different next time. Drinks are also great.

Don't come to this place because this is MY place. Aaand I don't want this place crowded because I don't want to have to wait in lines. But let me just tell you why this is my hidden gem. First of all their SPICY GARLIC BUTTER is life. The first cell that ate a mitochondria to become a complex life form thought that it was drenched in spicy garlic butter from oceanic boil. I've been coming here for maybe three years now and I'm sorry Oceanic Boil crew, can't believe it took me this long to write a review. I always get 2lb of snow crab legs (~$20 a pound) for me and my lady, 1 lb of massive mussels (I think it was ~$13 and it's not the cheap shit you buy frozen in a box), 1 dollar oyster minimum of 8 (during happy hour so happy me). Also I like to get the fries and the soft shell crab time to time because the spice mayo sauce is muy bien gue. 3 dollar beers like corona with lime and 5 dollar cocktails that are just so great *tearing*They also got dungeons crab, lobsters, shrimp, crawfish, stone crab claws, king crab legs, lobster rolls, kind attentive servers, cocktail bar, nice decoration that makes you feel like your at a warph somewhere by the sea but really you in the midst of Jackson height. They also got delivery, I think 5 or 6 different sauces for your seafood btw. And if you go there despite my useless warning I just want to let you know to grab a napkin cuz your gonna drool in that moment where the servers come out the back door in slow motion shaking your bag of delicious goodness walking towards you. it's gonna get hot in there.

My god is this place good. When you walk in it's a little dark with the expected sea decor. Greeted instantly by the kind waitresses right when we walked in. Hourly street parking out in front - saw a lot of cars go in and out during peak rush hour time (Friday around 5pm-6pm).Now the food:We went for happy hour (Monday through Friday 4p-7p) and first had the $1 oysters, pina colada, and mango daiquiri. Alcohol could be a little stronger, but they made up for it with the delicious main entrees. My girlfriend got the lobster roll and it looked great - they definitely were generous with the amount of lobster. I ordered the snow crab legs (1 lb.) with spicy garlic butter and old bay sauce. Mind blowing! The flavors made me feel like I was on a food network show I couldn't believe it. This place just has solid good food that's hard to find. Be prepared to get a little messy - they do provide gloves and bib!Staff was also extremely polite and surprisingly considerate (you don't get that very often). Checked up on us just enough not to be annoying, but close enough that if we needed something they were available and approachable. Will definitely go back again.

This place was surprisingly tasty. Started with fried catfish and french fries ‍I've had better, but it was fried and fresh.  Flavor was a little lacking in the batter.  For dinner I ordered  mussels in garlic butter, which were on point.  Garlic butter has a balanced flavor, not overly garlicky. I also got crab legs and shrimp in the oceanic boil sauce, which was really nice with a little spice.  My Margarita was ok and my date had one of the signature rum cocktails, which left him a little giddy.  No place outdoes The Boil in the city, but I will def be back!  If you're a seafood lover in Queens, try it out.

Simply Amazing!!!!!  A nice intimate spot in Jackson Heights. We made reservations for 5 people midday on a Saturday. We were immediately seated by the hostess. We ordered drinks and appetizers. The strawberry pina colada is amazing. Everything served was fresh. We had the fried shrimp appetizer that's served with French fries, crab cakes and garlic bread. It was so good. For our meals, we tried so many different items. I had the snow crab legs with shrimp, corn on the cob and potatoes with the garlic butter sauce. Make sure you tell them to take the head off the shrimp. The waitress brought out gloves, bibs and a bucket. The food was seasoned to perfection. I will definitely be going back to this establishment. One hint: Parking is a mess. So be prepared to search for a spot.

First time here and my friend and I were super hungry and eager to try this place out. We shared the combo: 1 lb snow crab leg & 1 lb of crawfish with the Oceanic Boil sauce (asked for mild) and an order of the garlic noodles & fries. Everything was super super DELICIOUS! Noodles were nicely buttered and garlicky, the fries were good with a delicious sauce,and the seafood....GREAAAT. I would definitely without a doubt recommend this place to everyone especially if you're a seafood lover. Cute space too & good happy hour deals!

Horrible ass Cousy we service like when I tell you horrible I mean very bad. I call almost every single other day for delivery & they always tell me "minimum is 20.00 " okay fine nest day I call they tell me 50.00 delivery when I only live like 6 blocks away. Now I call today and they say 25.00 delivery fee. What type manger is running this business you just lost a great customer I used to order all the time now I won't because you're telling me exactly how much to spend. Are you kidding me ? I get it if you say minimum 10-15 buy every time I call you tell me 20, 25 & even once 50.00 delivery fee just Bc it was "busy" food is good could never complain but the fact that you're telling me how much to spend that's crazy I nightly recommend you guys to never order from this place ever again

I had been here twice. We didn't wait too long to get a table (like around 5-10 minutes). But if you want to come during the busy hour, it's better to make a reservation (cuz the place it's not big, and sometimes it's very packed). I love seafood, especially clams and crabs, so that's what I usually get. Rich taste and fresh, I enjoyed their food a lot. You might feel very salty after eating that, need to drink some water. Anyway, I still like it and will come back again.

I searched for a low key somewhat different lobster restaurant and wound up here in Queens. A friend and I shared a "Oceanic Combo" based on reviews and were not displeased with either the quantity or variety of seafoods, including clams, shrimp, Alaskan King Crab, and a one pound lobster (with two half ears of corn and a couple of small potatoes. The gimmick at this restaurant is to blend all this with a massive amount of spicy dressing, and have you wear disposable gloves to manage handling the squishy mess. Being somewhat of a purist, I asked for dressing on the side. The first cup of dressing was simply too much over taste so I had it replaced with butter and garlic for a little dipping. Overall, the food quality was fair to good. but by no means exceptional. Things I found to be annoying was having to signal the young waitresses when needed for anything, as they were not paying attention to the table, even though at 2:30 PM only four out of twelve tables were occupied. And I found it classless being served ice cream in a plastic cup along with small cheap plastic spoons. Three stars is being generous for the $100.00 spent.

I love love LOVVVVVE this place! If you love seafood and don't mind getting messy (you get gloves and a bib), COME HERE! I have been to this place 3 times so far and every time it's delicious. Happy Hour prices are incredible for the amount of seafood you get and they have an array of options. I recommend the Oceanic Boil seasoning if you love spicy.

Overall was a great experience! Food was great except for a few piece of potato that was half cooked. Great atmosphere, vibe and neighborhood! Would've been better with those oversized plastic gloves instead of the more expensive tight vinyl Doctor gives.

My first time at oceanic boil was great. Service was decent, everyone was very friendly which was pleasant. I started with the oceanic sangria which was actually strong and good. My friends ordered the crab chowder and the fiesta clams (can't remember the name exactly) and both of these apps were really good, especially the soup! I had the wings which were very tasty and crispy and the fries were hot fresh crispy and seasoned. For the boil I got snow crab and shrimp with the oceanic sauce, spicy. It was amazing. It came out piping hot, the crab was juicy and the sauce was thick and sooo good. It wasn't too salty like a lot of other boil spots I've been to. I had a really great experience and definitely will be back for more!
Amazing! Worth it!! So delicious. Will be back! I got the house sauce crab leg boil and happy hour wine. absolutely loved it and will be back.

A nice spot with great seafood with a lot of flavor! Went there with a couple of co workers who only eat seafood and they loved it! The portions were decent. My favorite would be the calamari and fries and the shrimp and lobster tasted amazing. The place is small so there isn't a lot of space but they definitely make up for it with their food. They have a good selection of drinks as well and there prices are great for seafood and drinks.
This place is absolute love! The service was attentive and fast. Crab legs and shrimps were delicious and fresh! So glad this exists in JH!
L.O.V.E!!!! ... Enough said! I must've been here 12 times in one year alone. The sauce is to die for, I get the classic "Oceanic Broil" flavor and I ALWAYS make it a double order (2 lbs).

So damn good!!! OMG! This place doesn't look like much on the outside and it's small and quaint and unglamorous on the inside, but the food is delicious!!! Drinks are good, prices are decent, no complaints about service, good music... only complaint is that portions for the seafood bags could be more plentiful. I was still hungry and I'm a fairly petite person.

This place is so incredible. I almost don't want to review it so that I can keep the place to myself. Everything is perfect from the flavor to their service and they have a great happy hour menu. My favorite thing? Their pina coladas!!!! If I had the room,  I would've had a third. This is my new go to celebratory spot,l. I would come here now often if it was cheaper. But totally worth every penny!

Did NOT disappoint! My man and I usually eat a lot but the chicken wings starter and the 1 lb. crab leg with 1 lb. of shrimp filled us up. We shared it but could have probably ordered our own combos and finished them; we'll do that next time. I would recommend trying the spicy garlic butter with old bay - delicious! A plus for me is that they provided us with gloves to eat with. I appreciated that because, where I'm from, you just leave with hands that smell for the rest of the week. Please visit if you are in the area and want seafood!
My friends and I stopped here for lunch on our way to LaGuardia. I ordered take-out of the Cajun Mac & Cheese with Lobster and was not disappointed! Glad I got some great seafood on my visit to NY.
Delicious king crab legs and Cajun fries!!! And the lychee martinis are to die for...I usually sit at the bar and the bartender is incredible as well! Definitely not cheap with the alcohol...
Amazing food staff customer service drinks Waiting a bit but they accommodate our party of 4 instead of three

No words to describe how amazing this place is! Nice small place and I called to make a reservation and they told me they would hold the table for me. The staff was very nice and attentive. Started off with the clam chowder with bacon. So so so good and it was a big bowl! Then I tried the garlic noodles and they were absolutely amazing! Pure garlic and sweet and just delicious. I then had the lobster in garlic sauce mild and it came with potato and corn. I cannot wait to come back. Their garlic sauce is to die for!!!!!

I ordered from here and the food is amazing . I'm def gonna order again . I order the crab legs and they give your corn and potatoes, at first I didn't think it was gonna be good but it was delicious . I definitely would recommend this place I have to stop by and dine in . I had ordered through  uber eats

This places was awesome the food was beyond perfection even though I don't like spice this place made me to loved the way they prepare. Everything was nice and friendly, very clean. I would recommend this place to everyone that love seafood.

I've been wanting to try this place for a long time and finally had the chance to. We came here last night around 7pm and there was no wait. It was actually pretty empty but then again it was a freezing cold Monday night. It was the two of us and we ordered the calamari basket, garlic noodles, oysters and one of the combos. Calamari basket ($10) - It comes with cajun fries, a dipping sauce and a small cup of corn. The breading was a little meh but besides that, it was alright. Oysters ($1)- They had a $1 special for oysters and minimum of 8 oysters per order. We are complete suckers for oysters so we automatically ordered 8. The sauce was a little thicker than the usual sauce you get with oysters. The oysters were really good compared to other $1 oyster spots. There were no sand and no excess salt water on the oysters which is always a good thing! Combo ($50)- dungeness crab + 1 pound of crawfishI love the fact that the waitress was so honest to us. She told us crawfish was not in season at the moment and that we would be getting frozen crawfish instead.  Personally, I don't understand the hype over crawfish anymore. I used to love it but the more I eat it, the more I realize to myself, "damn it takes way too much work to eat so little meat". She also allowed us to replace it, so we replaced it with shrimp. The seafood was super fresh and the garlic butter sauce was so savory. The shrimps were meaty and the crab tasted super fresh! Garlic noodles ($5)I'm a sucker for anything garlic, so of course I had to order it. and I'm so glad I did. I've had better garlic noodles but I really liked this too. I actually love just throwing the garlic noodles into the garlic butter from the combo. That taste heavenly! I wasn't able to try out any drinks because I was having a hangover, but will def come by next time and give it a shot. (haha pun intended). The waitress was super friendly and made sure to keep checking up on us. The bus boy kept refilling our drinks and cleaned up whenever we were making a mess. Praying that my review doesn't hype this place up, so I won't have to be waiting next time to get in! I really wish I took some pictures, but I was way too hungry for that.

This has become my favorite spot since I've become too lazy to drive to the boil in the city. The food is really good, I love seafood so this is heaven to me. The butter sauce can be heavy but it's very flavorful and delicious.I always get the catfish sliders and the combo of crawfish and shrimp. The food is always fresh and if the crawfish are out of season they tell you beforehand. That's honesty that a lot of businesses don't have. Wether the crawfish is or isn't season doesn't matter because the frozen ones are just as good if not better. They are significantly larger than the fresh ones with exactly the same taste.The staff is very friendly and attentive, no complaints when it comes to service. The bartender made our drinks strong and I had a light buzz after one so sip responsibly folks.The atmosphere is casual and a great spot to kick back but can also be cute for a date. If you don't mind seeing your partner covered in sauce.

My son and I were beyond thrilled with the combo bucket of shrimp, crawfish, crab legs, calamari, and lobster! What a feast! Everything was really well seasoned and fresh. The wait staff were also very nice. Definitely coming back here.
Wicked wait time, but I took my younger sister and mother and enjoyed the experience. Good seafood, heavy on the garlic. Nice experience!
I'm in love with this place. My family can't get enough of this. Everything taste so good. I need the recipe. I'm glad I found this place.
Amazing food.  Great atmosphere.  Seafood boils were great!!  Good beer selection. Would never find this place without Yelp.
Excellent service and great food!!!!! Seafood lover Different types of flavors. Awesome prices and a lot food!!

I have never been a huge seafood fan, so I avoided Oceanic Boil for quite some time.  A couple of meetings with friends took me there and I was not disappointed. The Catfish Fillet with Cajun battered fries was pretty good.  I won't talk about the broccoli. Nothing was wrong with it. However, it was just there.The seating was pretty....unique.

My new favorite spot for seafood boils. The food is delicious. We had calamari which is served with fries. Has a nice kick to it. The gumbo is very flavorful and delicious. We went with the crab legs and shrimp in the oceanic boil sauce. It was served with potatoes and corn. We added sausage which was grilled and then added to the boil...perfection. Drinks were a little too sweet for me but who cares? I came for the seafood. Service was attentive and fast. I'll definitely be back soon.
Food and service was great. Cozy atmosphere with a nice vibe. Highly recommend. I will definitely be going back. Yummy!
Great spot & even better food! The drinks were great as well. The food left me satisfied happy and full . Thank you for having us and knocking our expectations out the pArk

Absolutely delightful! The music, the food, and the experience. After waiting an hour or so to be seated (make reservations on a Friday night if you plan to go) it finally began. I ordered the mac n cheese appetizer and it was unexpectedly good.  One order can be shared with two people.  Next time I will order it with lobster.  My entree included shrimp and crab legs in garlic butter sauce.  Looooovvvvveeeed it! Warning.....If you don't want the head on your shrimp be sure to mention it when you order.  I didn't mind.  The only reason I gave this restaurant four stars and not five has to so with the music used to celebrate someone's birthday. The music is absolutely great until you hear the classic cajun funeral music, slow and somber in the beginning and then upbeat after a few minutes. I was disappointed at first but found myself  moving to it after the 3rd time it was played. But I was also drinking my Oceanic Sagria which relaxed my nerves, lol. All in all I had a great time.

Many Cajun spots in the city don't serve crawfish. So I took a 20 mins drive to Jackson Heights, and it's worth it! I had raw oysters, fried calamari (comes with fries! Yummm), stone crab and crawfish boil with their special sauce. Everything is great!

Been curious about this place for a while now...and most reviews seemed ok....but I was disappointed. The seafood wasn't that fresh at all, so of course that killed the taste and quality of this whole dinning experience.Pro:*Loved the well prepared set up with the utensils, bowl holding the bag of food so it doesn't leak, and the almost apron size bib provided (outstanding!!)*Takes credit cards, Amex included*Linda, our very friendly server, she let me try a little of the spicy sauce before I placed my first order, and it wasn't the kind of spicy that would linger and numb your tongue for hours. But a nice kick that you can feel the heat by your throat for a minute and then slowly dissipates.*Bf said his drinks were good (IPA beer and Oceanic Passion fruit drink with sake)* They can do sauce on the side, in case you prefer dipping into a cup as you eat. :)*They offer delivery ! And we were able to wrap leftovers to go.Con:*Overall staff wasn't attentive and there were two other couples there tonight. Our water was never refilled, and the other girl was more into singing to the music and staring at the TV. * Charges extra for sauce, even though seafood portion vs sauce isn't taken into consideration when mixing in the bag. They just give you this one size cup of sauce for any size order....which is inconsiderate ..who ever is in the kitchen or made this rule, clearly doesn't cook for large amounts and knows adjustments for seasoning amount is required!!!* SEAFOOD WASN'T FRESH!!....big no no....* My bf said Popeye's has better Cajun fries than this place...:/ and soft shell crabs he ordered was so/so. (folks...he is very easily pleased when it comes to food.)Lastly, the green tea flan ....was more like pudding, didn't taste bad...but nothing like a traditional flan texture at all ....but the coconut flan tastes pretty good. (It's sweeter tho and thicker texture)
I love this place. The seafood, the sauce, the everything is so yummy! Seafood was fresh and juicy and we got the spicy garlic butter and it's just the right amount of spice and buttery goodness.
amazing music. super flavorful boil. cheap hh drinks. i never go to queens but i'd go back for suuuuure.
Delicious food. Amazing staff. Snow Crab Legs. Garlic Noodle and Clam Chowder. Me and my Fiance enjoyed this diamond in the middle of Jackson Heights.

I love this place!!!! I'm a huge seafood lover and their seafood is better than most seafood restaurants in the city. It's truly a hidden gem in Queens. I've tried other more known seafood boil restaurants and they don't compare. Their oceanic boil sauce is the best seafood sauce I've ever had it's absolutely scrumptious!!!! Their cajun shrimp and sausage gumbo is also delicious and tastes very authentic to the gumbo in Nola. It's is a must have for me every time I visit. Their seafood is always fresh and the portions are plentiful. The prices are also reasonable for the quality and quantity. By far much tastier and better priced than some other seafood boil restaurants.

Oceanic Boil is a great addition to the neighborhood, but be forewarned, make a reservation or be prepared to wait.  The space is tight, yet festive.  The service was excellent , the food was superb and, IMO, eliminates the need to go to City Island.  Fresh oysters, lobsters etc. cooked and sauced in very inventive ways makes this a go to spot for seafood.  Put on the gloves and go to work! Don't wear your Sunday best because you will get messy.  I only tried the garlic butter sauce, but since I'm a purist, maybe next time I'll do no sauce at all and just enjoy the seafood as is.  The bar kept the drinks flowing and everyone had a fabulous time.  Parking is a nightmare, so subway or cab it.

Went here last night with my boyfriend. He was referred by a friend. The waitlist here on Yelp is amaaaaazing! It gives you updates in real time and what time your table is ready! We arrived and the table was ready. Our waiter was very nice. We got the lobster mac and cheese, which is just regular mac n cheese but the lobster on it was good. I recommend changing up the pasta and adding different cheeses and a little more lobster to justify the $18. We got the fries, which came with a spicy ketchup, which is probably spicy mayo or sriratcha ketchup with was reaaal good! For the entree, we got the Oceanic Boil special, which comes with a pound of shrimp, crawfish, lobster, crab legs, and some potatoes and some corn. We subbed the crawfish for shrimp because we both don't eat it. It was only $1 more. They give you gloves and a bib to eat and wipes afterwards. Overall, that oceanic sauce was bomb, not spicy for me at all!

Found this spot on yelp, and so happy I did.  My friend and I went on a Tuesday night, and got seated right away.  They have a great drink menu, but we decided to be responsible adults on a work night and opted out.  We shared the oceanic boil with a side of fries and onion rings.  There is a choice of sauces for the seafood, we chose one that was a combo of a garlic sauce with old bay.  The boil had a whole lobster, crab legs, shrimp, and crawfish, but we got double shrimp and omitted the crawfish, for an upcharge of $1.  The boil was great, lots of sauce, lots of food, and nice sized fresh seafood.  Onion rings and fries were also good.  Service was excellent, prompt, and the staff had great anticipation of needs, like bringing extra napkins, before we asked.  Definitely will return!

Omg this place is so good. The waiters are kind, the food is on POINT! I went there twice and they haven't disappointed me. Very fresh and good seafood. The spices they use is delicious. Just writing this comment here and thinking about the food is getting me hungry . Its worth it. Trust me
REALLY DELICIOUS! Although the lighting was kinda bad because it was a little dark. All in all, super delicious!

Amazing local spot and hidden gems of queens. So much better then the trend shaking crab. Only downfall is the place is kinda small, and they dont take reservations on weekends. Waiter is attentive and drinks are good. Calamari is also tasty. Got the strawberry pina colada with a kick, and the combo with 1lb of shrimp and snow crab legs. Pina colada definitely had a kick but it was subtle. The crab legs and shrimp had garlic butter on it and was meaty and sweet. Hands down a good place to come to. Perfect size for 4 people. Anything over that it's kinda tricky to seat. Definitely worth checking out
This place is fantastic, definitely a hidden gem in a melting pot of food. It's busy be prepared to wait. Seafood all day keeps the doctor away.. boil it up with some special sauces
Great place in my neighborhood for oysters, and all other seafood. Great service and most of all delicious food. Treat yourself.
Try Oceanic Boil sauce... It's little bit spicy but yummyIf you don't like spicy, I recommend garlic sauce.
Is this how the lobster roll supposed to be or the other half got eaten by the delivery guy?

I stopped by with my wife to try out this restaurant. I gave four stars based on our overall experience with the food and services. Their catfish sandwich was good. Their French fries were so delicious that we had to get another order. Snow crab legs were good. Raw oysters were excellent. The only thing We didn't like was their crawfish which were not fresh. Service was great!!

This restaurant is better than the Boil and Claw Daddy's NYC. You get your bang for the buck. The sauces are delicious. I recommend the oceanic boil if you are in love with sweet and spice. It's absolutely the best. The staff are amazing and they treat you so good. They accommodate you really well.  The trip and distance is worth it. I love it!!  I come all the way here from Brooklyn. It's amazing guys. Try the sauce Oceanic boil.

Everything is great, from the soup to the snow crab legs to the king crab legs. I was hesitant about getting take out, but it was just like eating everything in the restaurant but from the comfort of home! Clams casino wasn't soggy and the crab legs are tightly packaged to go.

Very delicious. I used to go to The Boil in manhattan. But it's kinda far. Finally find one in queens. Ordered crawfish, snow crab legs, mussels , claim chowder and fried oyster. Don't order the fried the oyster. It says 8 on the menu, I only got 6, and one tastes not fresh. They fried without the shell and over fried. This one costs $14, not worth it. But the rest dishes are delicious.

I see why this place has so many positive reviews. Returning from a visit home to KC, I wanted some seafood close to LGA. This place was sooo good. Now keep in mind the happy hour wings and calamari come with fries so there will be plenty to share. I had the snow crab legs with shrimp. It comes with potatoes and corn. My Lord. We arrived right at 5pm before the evening rush. Keep in mind it's Tuesday. The oceanic sauce for the crab legs had just enough kick. Great balance of spice, lemon , butter and garlic. Word to the wise--use the gloves chile! I started without them, because I'm an ol' pro. The sauce is so abundantly present, you save a rainforest of trees using gloves instead of asking for napkins. To drink I had the sake mango deal. It was pretty tasty but but you for the food not the drinks. The liquids just take up space for the food. Let's be clear I ate all the crab and couldn't finish all of the shrimp. Just a heads up --the heads are on the shrimp so if that's not your thing let them know. The service was very attentive and welcoming. They even asked if we had complaints. They also inquired whether or not we liked it because we had some leftover! There was simply no room in my belly!If you are still reading this review just stop and make your way to oceanic boil geeeesh!

My go to place for snow crab legs! The sauces are amazing. The drinks are pretty good too. They are super friendly and attentive to their guests! If you like seafood boils, this is definitely the place to visit.
A gem in Flushing. The food was seasoned well, big shrimp and great service with a smile. The wait staff are very nice.

So after stopping by this amazing Cajun styled seafood restaurant. I can comfortably say I will be returning over and over again with friends and family so they can enjoy amazing shrimp, lobster, snowcrab, oysters, crawfish, Seafood Mac and Cheese and a long list of other well spiced and decadent food on the menu.This place has surprisingly good mixed drinks as well. We had the"Oceanic Passionfruit to start"  then followed with a Cajun Fries, Seafood Mac and Fries which mixed creamy Crab, Octopus, Fish and calamari with a lovely breaded top. The Main Dish was the Combo Snowcrab and Shrimp. You can choose from a variety of sauce to have it in. Went with Spicy Butter Garlic Butter + Old Bay. (PLUS WE ADDED AN EXTRA Spicy Oceanic Boil for those who are adventurous)The service was AMAZING. Great Staff, who are extremely polite and courteous. Nothing ever felt.dishes and the menu recommendations were in lime with the flavor the exact flavor we were looking for. I would put 6 stats if I could. 5 Star Atmosphere, 5 star Menu, 5 Star Flavor, Unmatched Service and great bang for the Buck.
The best seafood that I've had in years!!! Such a shame its hidden in Jackson heights queens and I live in brooklyn....will definitely come hear again after work. A serious gem
Our go to spot for amazing seafood boil! I will gladly splurge whatever amount of money I need to here!! The food is just too amazing & the service is awesome!

Yas this place is liiiit.First the service is super friendly you walk in and everyone is all smiles which is really nice it makes you feel welcome This place is pretty small so if you are a party of over 5 people it might be hard to sit together.We had the oceanic boil it was huge it was worth the price we had the oceanic sauce it was good because it had nice spice where you feel the kick but you don't wanna die after eating itThe garlic noodles were kinda meh I prefer them at claw daddy's but they weren't bad it's just personal preferences I enjoyed how they shake the bags in front of you so you can kinda see it spread out rather then bottom of bag and you gotta dig for that sauce so that's def a pro if you like sauce like me I had a non-alcoholic pina colada it's was really good if you get it with alcohol sake is added in and I didn't know how I felt about that The one thing I wish I tried but we were too full is the lobster elote which seems really cool

New local business that just opened 5 days ago right across from our residence! Been waiting for this place to open for a while now, so glad it did. The  ratings are for the customer service and interaction we received today from the owners and staff. Starting with the staff, very welcoming, friendly and attentive. The owners also came over to check on us and see how we were enjoying things. Being that I'm from LA, I told him my experience about the Boiling Crab and the Boil in NY, making some suggestions and recommendations to him about their menu items, sauce etc. I loved that he was super open to suggestions and recommendations and actually listening to what I had to say. Definitely helps knowing they value their customers opinions.Coming to the food...we had the fried calamari for appetizer which was great! Just recommend making it slightly bigger in portion and perhaps charging more to go accordingly. My husband and I then shared the Dungeness Crab and 1lb of Shrimp with the house special sauce. The sauce was interesting and definitely different from the boil or boiling crab...but we enjoyed it! I feel the shrimp portion was slight less compared to other places so highly recommend more shrimp for the price. As for the Dungeness Crab, I'd probably recommend the snow crab legs over it just due to preference.Overall, I definitely recommend trying this place out and supporting the business due to reasons listed above. I hope my recommendations are considered to give this place higher ratings the second time around!

OMG.....some of the best seafood I had in a lonnnnggggg time. I highly recommend this place. I found this little gem while browsing Yelp for seafood restaurants. Upon looking at the reviews I decided to give it a try. I called first to see if reservations were required. All through a reservation wasn't required I would highly recommend it for group 4 or more and anytime after 6:00pm Upon arrival my friend and I were greeted and seated immediately.
