The pork in the soup was extremely soft, tender, and simply delicious.  Side condiments of bean sprouts and pickle gives  balance of the sweet and sour, which  is a staple in typical Thai cuisine.   The filet tamarind Was delicious and crisp and easily pulled from the skin; the dish was decorated with pomegranate seeds... and flavored with baby bok choy.  Adding a dash of the fried hot red paper gives you a nice firey taste ; and again exemplifies the balance of hot and sweet in this great cuisine.   You can skip The White Rice side dish... it's simply a filler.   I went off the special lunch menu and onto the main entrées and tried the incredible hot and spicy dish of Kanom Jeen Nam Ngeaw... chili with pork ribs and shrimp paste, blood cubes, red cotton flowers and tomatoes... Incredibly unforgettable... if you are a practicing Bhuddist....this maybe your Nirvana.   A large dish and savory that is second to none!   I am truly enlightened.
Love their food. I like how it's very different from the other Thai restaurant that are near by. Also the staff are very friendly. This is the only Thai restaurant I am going to ATM.
A new thai-northern restaurant in here, let's check it in   That's great  Awesome thai- northern restaurant

One of the best places for lunch specials! The flavor is authentic, the food delicious! No watered down Thai food here for the beginner palate! You best bring your war face here because you gonna get a flavor beat down, and you gonna like it and come back for more! (Service is good too. The bathroom, lol, try to hard it in). Yay, long live Lamoon!
This place has become my favorite! They have truly captured the flavors of Northern Thailand! Khao Soi is best this side of Chiang Mia. So far made 5 visits and will continue till I've tried all.

If I could give 10 stars I would. The food is delicious. The menu is  limited, but the quality is amazing. The dishes were authentic and the service was excellent. They even serve free pandan water as a beverage. The cold, refreshing drink compliments the spicy aromatic dishes beautiful.

Came here on a Saturday night. Small setting with a great vibe. I always like to try new places and this one stood out from recent experiences. Never tried the Thai Iced tea, so I guess he knew I don't eat much Thai food, so he explained every dish we ordered as they brought out. The waitress said the jackfruit was the most popular so I ordered that and my buddies ordered the kang hung ley (pork belly) I didnt have a huge taste for the jackfruit (very flavorful just not a flavor for me) but I LOVED the kang hung ley. Amazing experience and the iced teas were on the house because I was a newbie!! This place is worth a meal 100%
Items were very good. Much more comforting and savory than your normal thai place. Would def go back.And when they spicy it really is very spicy!
Love this place. Service was friendly and helpful and fast. Food was fresh and delicious. We've been to Thailand and this stands out as one of the best Thai meals we've ever had

My first time today,!!! There's a few Thai restaurants in my neighborhood, so when this one opened up,i kink of had second thoughts,but let me tell you i was wrong, I'm not gonna tell you what i ordered, cause i want you to go and taste their food, very tasty very unique, something that i was looking for a long time,i totally will recommend, the service that i got was great, delicious,!!!
The chicken fried rice, the curry seafood noodles and thai fried fish were all delicious. Restaurant was clean and had friendly staff. Chicken wings were crispy and tasty.

This was a very pretty restaurant with really good food. My friend and I got the thai tea pad thai and the fried rice nam prik ong, both which were really good. The thai iced tea and the mango sticky rice were amazing as well. This restaurant is definitely authentic and makes for a great place to go for a date night. I would definitely recommend this place for the food and the aesthetics.

Small but cozy place. Friendly and efficient waitstaff. I went with my inlaws and they thought it was the best Thai they've had. Being northern style Thai, the flavors are a bit different, but very good. I'd go back, but get there early or make reservations.

I've been wanting to try new local restaurants and found this place while randomly driving around. The place is small but very cutely decorated - it reminded me a lot of the actual restaurants I went to during my trip to Thailand a few years ago. I was with some people, and we ordered a Thai tea pad Thai (I know so different - this place has some interesting things!) and two khao soys. I ordered the pad Thai and it came out first. Since I was close to the door on a cold day, I moved it to the side while I waited for everyone else's food. A worker quickly jumped up and asked me if I didn't like my food and could bring my something new. I really appreciated how attentive they were and told him I just simply pushed my food aside so it didn't get cold. He then offered to take it to the back to keep it warm, which I agreed to. When all the food came out, we loved it all. I did like the khao soy better but that's purely because that's my favorite Thai dish- the pad Thai was one of the best I've ever had. I really enjoyed my experience - from the service to the food to the atmosphere - and highly recommend!
This restaurant took me back to Chiang Mai. Awesome khao soi and a few other dishes that anyone who has traveled to northern Thailand will recognize. Go eat here!

Excellent Thai northern foods. We love the chicken hot and spicy soup (Yum Jin Gai), Nam Priknum Fried rice, Hunglay Pork, and fried chicken wings. For dessert, Mangoes with sticky rice is great!!  We will go back again soon.

Even though the restaurant is relatively small but very well organized. The art on the wall made me felt that this place is modernized and cool. I came to this restaurant because I had heard about their good reputation. Wow!  This place is beyond my expectations. The waiters and waitresses is very generous and caring to their customers. I felt like a little princess while I was dining there. The food is also awesome. It is not easy to find the Northern Thai food in NYC in matter of the fact any places beside Thailand however this place really made me felt that I'm in Thailand eating the food from the local. The popular dish is Jackfruit salad which is so delicious. Jackfruit salad also came with sticky rice and crispy  pork skin. Not only that most restaurant will give you ice water for free but this place will give you water with a hint of Pandan which is a plus. This is just amazing. The price is also very reasonable. I wish you could give more than 5 star. This is just WOW!!! Everyone please come and try out this place.  Will definitely returning soon. Because my heart is calling for the food from that place.
Excellent & spicy northern Thai. Amazing sausage - some of the best in the neighborhood

The food was decent and service is good. Very interesting menu.  Downside is that it's Not family friendly at all. No highchair available (which seems like such a poor choice to make). The bathroom is very awkward in the back and you have to pass through the kitchen.
Really amazing Thai food. The tender pork masaman curry is amazing. The fish dish is yummy. Friendly service as well. Want to try more dishes here.

Great, authentic food with an amazing vibe. The food choices are also eclectic, but there are a lot of spicy items for those who can handle the heat. Awesome artwork, and unique and fun menu. Service was also unbeatable. Can't wait to go back.

This will certainly be my next go-to place for thai food in the area. Very unique flavor and presentation of food. It is not your typical thai restaurant. My husband even said their flavors took him back to Thailand. We tried the thai sausage, curry egg noodles, pork belly, and shrimp cloud cake. All taste good. Not to mention this place is very child friendly. I have two fidgety toddlers and the waiters were very patient and understanding, even sharing his own toys for them to play. The mango rainbow sticky rice dessert was one-of-a-kind. We will be back.
Delicious food from Northern Style Thailand! Highly recommend this new restaurant that's opened up in Elmhurst. Check them out, you won't be disappointed!!

I really did not like the food here. It is extremely overpriced with small portions of food. Also when I asked for water without ice, I received ice water that tasted like rice. There is also bad waitering and it doesn't seem like it is very spacious. The one good thing was that the food came fast but that's was because the places business was running very bad. Overall the food was disgusting, the waiters were and and took time, and the space was cramped. I came in expecting a nice Thai dinner and left hungry and feeling robbed. Very overpriced.
Food was so good and everything was so clean. Also the waitress was so friendly and kind. Definitely I will visit again! Just perfect.
A cute Thai restaurant with very good and authentic Thai food. The staff is also very nice! I will be back!
Staff is courteous and friendly and 3explains the menu to you.  Not the ordinary Thai food you usually have and definitely tasty and flavorful.
Almosy everything is nice! Mango salad was good, the fried pork is good, almost everything is good!

We stopped here for a quick bite on our way to Bklyn from the airport. What a great choice! We only tried the Yum Jin Gai, and the rice balls...oh and we got to sample the traditional pork jerky. Everything was fresh, tasty and prepared with care. The owner was so gracious and hospitable, too. We had tons of questions because the menu was quite different from other Thai places we've visited. The owner explained that the menu is made up of traditional northern Thai dishes. I haven't been to Thailand (yet!) but eating here definitely made me want to visit--especially the north. Everyone in our party of 6 tried the soup and loved it. Really delicious!! We also loved the rice balls and jerky. Try this place. You will not be disappointed. The restaurant is also spotless and nicely decorated. The owners take pride in providing great, authentic Northern Thai cuisine. Great experience! We will be back!

Went here for dad's b-day. It was great! The waiters were super nice and tried their best to accommodate us (three people) since it was a pretty small restaurant. Highly recommend the pink lady, pork belly with curry, and jackfruit salad. Checking in also got us some free drinks. We ended with the rainbow mango sticky rice, which was sweet and pleasant. This is very different from the usual Thai fare you would find; you won't find any pad thai or green curry here. This is apparently a Northern Thai restaurant (I never knew there was such a thing, actually). Will definitely be coming back to try the rest of the dishes they have.
The food was good... The mango salad was DELICIOUS.... I also had the sweet rice dessert and that was very good.. Staff was very nice..

A welcomed addition to Elmhurst. Food was tasty, not too expensive, and good portions. Free drink with check in was definitely appreciated.  The restaurant is small but could fit medium size groups.  You'll have to walk through the kitchen for the bathroom but I didn't mind it.

An extraordinary Thai food from northern Thailand, totally different from what I would usually get in Thai restaurant, everything I had was really good, very different and special, their menu is not the regular type of food from other Thai restaurant, the server was also very helpful and gave us a good recommendation when we order, I recommend people should try it for a new taste of Thailand！
Great new place for Thai food in elmhurst! Loved everything we ordered. The fried appetizers were great!
Actually this is my second time at Lamoon, I come back for " Aab Aong Aor" I love this dish very authentic the test of strong herb and it's amazing with sticky rice.....

Very friendly service and great food ! Wonderful atmosphere, there's pleasant music playing, but its not too loud to have a conversation. My dish had blood cubes in it, it was delightful. The chili paste is spicy but flavorful.

The food was really good. Taste very fresh. Polite, friendly stuff. My friend is very picky(she likes good food), so it's difficult to choose where to go with her. But she said she'd like to come back here. I'd like to come back and try different stuff too.

This place is amazing. It specializes in Northern Thai food, which is different from the sort of Thai that everyone is used to. You're not going to find panang curry or pad kee mao here, nor are you going to find the Esaan cuisine that dominates in this neighborhood. It is a very unique experience, I doubt there is another restaurant like this in New York City. I recommend trying Khao Soi chicken, a tasty coconutty curry with crunchy noodles. Jackfruit salad is strange but very interesting, almost tastes like chicken. The fried papaya salad (I think it's called "Angie") is also really good. If you are adventurous, get the sticky rice cooked in pork blood. A really unusual flavor, although those who have tried Argentinian food may compare it to the morcilla. The Thai sausage is really good as well. Not as exotic as some of the other items on the list, but really good if you want something familiar. Overall the experience was amazing. This restaurant has amazing food and service, and I would not be surprised if they became as popular as SriPraPhai or Ayada.

Amazing food, outstanding flavor. This is not your typical Thai joint with Pad Thai highlights.  They serve atypical Northern Thai food and the food is just top notch. Give it a try and you won't get disappointed.

This is my first time eating at this place. The place reminds me of going to a friend's home and eating a home cook meal. Not much food to choose from. It's actually a good thing for someone like me who wants to try everything. The place is homey rather than cozy. Both waiter and waitress are super attentive. Overall I enjoy the place. The downside of the place is that their vegetarian option is very limited.
Yummy dishes! We ordered pad Thai and hot pot. Both were very good. Will def visit again!
Absolutely wonderful and entirely authentic Northern Thai cuisine. The food is geniunely spicy, and all the ingredients are appropriately local. Must try.

I got the kanom Jeen Nam Ngeaw (tasty and hearty and perfect amount of spice if you like spice), Larb Neua (delicious with the lettuce wrap and rice to go with it), and the rainbow sticky rice & mango for dessert (must get this and will come back for it again)
Yep, best new Northern Thai place in town. If you've never had Northern Thai, this is one of many great options to try it. Don't be shy.

Overall a decent restaurant with very friendly staffs, we felt very much welcomed and def will be back to try other foods.  I also felt like their menu can expand a little. This is not the regular thai restaurant out there,  their menu is very different from others,  most stuff was yummy. Can't wait to be back.

Tried Lamoon on a whim and boy was I impressed by the service, hospitality and the food. Ordered the jackfruit salad and some curry egg noodles and they were flavorful. The riceballs were savory and hot. Also got the pork belly with glass noodles and that too was good. However, the most pleasant surprise was their pandan infused water which had a subtle aroma that helps cools your tastebuds from the spice. Only downer was not much on the dessert menu.

Great service, and portions are generous. The Thai iced tea was the best I'd ever had. The prices are extremely reasonable as well. Interior was cool and inviting with beautiful wall art and decor, which was especially appreciated on a hot summer day. On a side note, they play great throw-back songs from the 90s. Would definitely go again to try more dishes.
Hard to find northern Thai food with great music and fun atmosphere. The manao rice balls are excellent.

I came here with high expectations, and unfortunately, the meal we had fell far from the mark. There are a number of great Thai restaurants in the Elmhurst area, and I particularly like the restaurants that specialize in Northern Thai dishes. Lamoon had some unusual dishes on their menu and looked like a cute space, so I was intrigued. We ordered the jasmine rice and ground pork marinated in pork blood for the appetizer and two entrees - a stewed curry pork dish for my boyfriend and the green curry fried rice for myself. The appetizer did not set the stage well - it was dry and rather bland with a metallic aftertaste. My fried rice was so dull, despite the server saying it was quite spicy, that I had to put several teaspoons of chili flakes on it. My boyfriend's stewed curry pork had a good flavor, fortunately, so I wound up spooning that over my rice as well to give it flavor. They didn't skimp on the fried rice portion, but there was just nothing there flavor-wise - and very few veggies or anything in it. One of the worst fried rices I've had in a while. Overall, the food left me feeling like I'd wait a while - a long while - before coming back. The stewed curry pork dish and the nice server are the only things keeping my review at 3 stars rather than 2.
Excellent addition to a neighbourhood with dozens of Thai options. The service was fantastic, and the menu is different and delicious, with its Northern Thai focus. Will definitely be coming back!

So my friend told me that there's a new Thai restaurant just opened in Queens and it's a northern style food and we decided to check it out and we absolutely love it. The vibe and the decorations are really nice. We'll definitely come back for the next time!!

In this time of Corona, I give thanks for Nicks Bistro. This wonderful place was a regular hang out for us before the lockdown. Now that they are delivering we're going to be eating Nick's once a week at least. We ordered four spreads with still warm pita for an appetizer. For entrees, souvlaki and pastitsio. Everything was super delicious and so welcomed.Keep it up. We can't wait to visit you in the restaurant.Laura and David Butler

My first time here even though I wasn't really there. I don't live too far so I'm in delivery range, which is great for me. I've already ordered from them a few times. Easy and quick and their delivery guy is nice. It's greek themed but they have burgers, salads, platters, and a bunch more. I've tried the fish, gyro platters, burgers and a few of the appetizers so far. Everything we've had so far has been excellent. There aren't too many Greek options in this area so this place hits the spot. I'll have to actually try to dine in as well one of these days.

Ordered food from them twice this week and I was shocked that I haven't ordered or been to this place before! Very delicious food and the menu has a wide variety of choices. On top of that all for affordable price and a great service. Their delivery was always on time. The chicken souvlaki platter and the greek chicken wrap are my favorites, highly recommend to try! We love this place and can't wait for restaurants to reopen so that we can go there for dinner!

Nick's Bistro is a cozy, intimate restaurant with a laid back, welcoming environment. On the two occasions I have been there, the service and food has been impeccable each time. During my first visit, I had the crab stuffed shrimp and lamb chops. I usually don't enjoy  most dishes stuffed with crab because I find that the crab tends to be overcooked or dry or too heavily breaded. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the crab stuffed shrimp at Nick's was absolutely delicious. The shrimp was succulent and the crab was light, fresh and seasoned to perfection. The lamb chops were mouth wateringly tender and flavorful. These are both dishes that I would happily get again.During my second visit, my friend and I ordered the grape leaves and mussels for our appetizer. My friend doesn't usually enjoy grape leaves but she loved them at Nick's. The mussels were very fresh and the tomato sauce was rich without overpowering the mussels. My friend ordered the Asian Sea Bass and I ordered the crab stuffed (yep, I'm sold with their crab) sea bass. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals. The servings at Nick's are relatively large so I had enough left overs to take home. My fish tasted just as delicious the next day, which speaks highly to the freshness of the ingredients Nick's Bistro utilizes in their cooking. In short, I love this neighborhood spot and am a loyal patron. Don't ever change, Nick!

For years when we usually hit up Cinemart, one of our favorite movie theaters, we usually go to Nick's for brunch. Yesterday we actually had dinner, which rekindled our feelings about Nick's. First off I wanted to mention how we love this little part of Forest Hills. It's quiet and secluded, plus it feels like it's somehow stuck in time... Love it!I never associated Nick's with Greek food. I always envisioned it as a feel-good, home-growned, family owned restaurant that is heavily supported by the community. You can feel it, sense it and taste it. As for the taste, the food is delicious and the service is nothing short of fantastic! It's just a great place to be on a Saturday night. The locals make it even more comforting and appealing. Is it just me or do I usually see teachers here... food for thought???To us, Nick's is part of the Trifecta of Cinemart, Nick's and Eddie's. Always a highlight on any given weekend. You will never lose!!One request to Nick's. If you can make a little brother in Bayside, that will be amazing, hehehe!

Been to Nick's Bistro twice within the last few months and so far, I consider it one of the best dine in restaurants in Forest Hills. The food is delicious and the service is great.On both visits, we basically ordered the same thing because it was so good the first time. We started off with fried calamari, very fresh and tender, good sauce too served nice and hot. For our main course, we ordered the pork souvlaki and spicy seafood pasta. Just to be clear, first visit was for dinner, second visit was lunch. The lunch menu is different however, if you want stuff from the dinner menu such as pasta, you can still ask for it.The pork souvlaki was excellent. Very juicy and tender. The lemon potatoes were great. Also comes with a small bowl of salad and pita. The spicy seafood pasta was enormous. It comes with lots of mussels and shrimps.Verdict - a little pricey but the quality is top notch. Highly recommend this restaurant, easily beats out any restaurant on Austin St.

Food is actually really good but had a terrible delivery experience. 2.5 hours and 3 calls later the food never came. An hour and 15 mins after ordering they said all their orders were out for delivery, almost 2 hours later they said the driver picked up the orders and it will be there shortly. 2.5 hours later the story is now that they had sent it out very quickly and I should've already gotten it. They insisted that the driver had delivered it and left it with the doorman. I don't have a doorman so clearly the driver delivered it to the wrong place. They insisted that it was delivered and offered no resolution to the issue. I had to go through delivery.com and was told that the restaurant requested the issue be escalated to management and I had to wait 24-48 hours for management to reach out to me, which they never did. They need a new person to answer the phones, terrible customer service and made me feel like I was in the wrong when clearly your driver made the mistake. Just own up to it.

Cuisine: 5Service: 7Decor: 6Value: 7Overall: 6Confused. I don't get why this restaurant has a strong 4.5 star rating when I have never experienced extraordinary food or impeccable service after numerous visits. I keep giving it another try thinking I must be missing something, but at last, I don't think so. Unfortunately, Nick's is just an average restaurant.First of all, knowing it's a Greek restaurant, we have tried many authentic Greek dishes in the past. Nothing bad, but nowhere near the quality of what you can get in Astoria. Maybe people around here settled for subpar Greek/Mediterranean food, but I rather drive all the way to Astoria.Today, stopped in with a friend for a quick bite. I got the Lamb Gyro Sandwich and he ordered a Porcini Cheeseburger. Gyro was fine but nothing to rave about. The burger however needed to be returned since it was super well done and not medium rare at all.  On the second go around, it was well done again, but we ran out of time to return it. Took a few bites and ran.Servers were friendly enough, did not complain when we sent back the food and apologized for the mistake. Yet, they never came back to check on the new burger, which was slightly better but still not what my friend ordered. Oh well, fool me once, shame on you. Fool me a half dozen times, I'm a complete idiot. Lol

This place is just the best. It has a very cozy setting and the staff is kind. Not to mention, the food is spectacular! The lamb gyro is to DIE for and the crab cakes are really tasty and flavorful. I would definitely recommend the burger and fries. This restaurant certainly does NOT seem like a place to get a burger, but it is. I have no doubt saying this, but this restaurant has the BEST burger I have ever had. I will come back here no matter what.

Thoroughly pleased. The food was delicious, the staff were great, and the overall experience was pleasant. This place is good vibe for all occasions: family dinners, dates, even just a good solo meal.I suggest getting entree special of lobster ravioli. It was filling and you can really taste the seafood. The sauce was tasty and a little sweet. The apple crisp dessert was huge. It was a rich blend of salty caramel and apple with a hefty scoop of ice cream on top. I would definitely go again for a nice bite in forrest hills that's not the usual Austin street restaurants. Also, the live music was beautiful esp on Tuesdays!

I have come here for lunch a dinner and have never been disappointed. This is easily one of my favorite restaurants in Forest Hills.The food is absolutely delicious from salmon over salad to Greek chicken wraps and gyros. The price is right for dinner and they also have a great lunch special.

We went and had lunch on New Year's Day and the place was pretty packed. However, you have to take in to account that most restaurants were closed. The restaurant had a nice cozy vibe and the service was friendly and efficient.Their homemade falafels were really delicious and the fries were cooked to perfection. I even loved their salad dressing because it was extremely acidic yet creamy and delicious. However, my mistake was that I ordered the grilled chicken, goat cheese and fig Panini and it was a little sweet for me. I knew I should've went with the souvlaki. I can't wait to go back and try the lobster avocado roll for brunch when I get a chance and I would love to try the mussels and spanakopita as well.
Picked up dinner from Nick's yesterday. They were efficient & friendly, and the food was delicious!

Let me start off with this looks nicer of the outside than it is on the inside, service was ok the only part I found interesting was there signature drinks are very unique.I came here with my brother and his fiancé  for my birthday and it was the worse decision I have made in a while. We ordered they special for the day; crab meat and shrimp sliders ( not sure if this is where I went wrong but I believe it was) and for entrees we ordered:Pork Chops, Lamb Gyro and someone sort of lemon chicken with the wildfire drinks. All I know is that 45 minutes into the dinner I started to feel sick so I asked to leave. I wish that where my story ended but I instead ended up with 3 days of a stomach virus with not stop vomiting and the runs which was either a stomach virus or food poisoning  either way I would NEVER come back here again!

Was in the neighborhood on a random Wednesday night so decided to stop by -- it was busy but not full and so easy to grab a table. The complementary warm pita and hummus to start was a nice touch and we order the mixed gyro/seafood plate and the pork souvlaki. Gyro was fine but the shrimp was fantastic. Pork was flavorful and tender (tough pork is awful but unfortunately common elsewhere) but I wished they used a different cut. I've had amazing pork souvlaki at random roadside stands in Greece and I'm still looking for that in the city somewhere. Not luck so far. Overall solid place that I'd go back to if I were in the area. Don't forget to get the sour cherry soda, it's good.

Want to guess what I paid for these 5 regular size pieces of shrimp (No side included)? $18!! I got this off the menu expecting at least a little more. I called and they said nope that's correct only 5 or 6 pieces. For $18 I think that's a little crazy. I never had a problem with them always liked their food, but I'm coming to realize their overpriced for what you get. Disappointed

Exactly what you might imagine of a little bistro just right there, totally nondescript, in a neighborhood in Forest Hills.. until you walk in and feel the feelings that happen when a place is packed and everyone is smiling.  The immediacy of our perfect table-treat hummus (w/ black eyed peas -- totally new to me, totally amazing!) with dark wheat pita or maybe it was dark rye, a perfect start to an honestly amazing meal! Our server was kind and patient with my multiple wine taste requests (it's hard to choose a bottle for three people including my 88-year old birthday girl great aunt). We chose one of the Greek wines and we loved it! The zucchini fritter dill cream sauce special appetizer was amazing.  We shared the falafel plate and the lamb gyro plate and everything was perfect, and that was plenty of food for 3! plus a little birthday surprise baklava.  my mom and I are totally the people that stare at all of the food that everyone else gets, very easy in a small bistro, and every dish looked honestly beautiful and delicious. And then when my mom left her purse behind, we came back to more joyful people who had kindly found it and told us they'd considered just dropping it off until they saw my moms address in CA... but that spoke volumes about this little gem on the corner of Metropolitan Ave, where it seems like locals gather but lucky people like us also stumble into.

I was looking for something Greek and delicious and stumbled upon this beauty. Had to come since there are so many reviews. I am so glad I picked this place. It was so quick and needed to be somewhere by 930 so it worked out perfectly. Ordered the vegetable chips and a large Greek salad with gyro meat. Perfect sized app and salad that filled me up for the night. The vegetable chips, which were zucchini and squash, were delicious. The tzatziki sauce was delicious I loved the pieces of cucumber, I think. The lamb was a bit greasy but I didn't care bc it was delicious.  The salad was so fresh, cucumbers cherry tomatoes red onions, I mean it's a classic Greek salad. Very good. They also started with complementary pita and hummus. I would so come back ! Loved their drink specials I saw on the wall. Didn't try any bc I was sick :/ lycheeee martini was calling my name

This is our second time to Nick.  First time was many years ago.  We just finished biking in the city as part of Summer Street, and we were looking for a place to eat! We chose Nicks Bistro in a party of 10.  We were seated outside and I got the lamb gyro sandwich ($8).  It was very tasty and they were generous with the baby tomatoes and greens.  The size is pretty decent and I could have eaten another one for sure.  My wife got the wild salmon Greek salad which she enjoyed as well. My son got the Italian chicken breast sandwich with lemon potatoes.  Wow those potatoes rock for sure.  All in all, we enjoyed our meal and the service was top notch.  All the staffs were very friendly and attentive.  Will definitely come back again soon for sure.

Another good delivery experience through Yelp. I got the 3-appetizer combo: grilled calamari, keftedes, crab cakes. Great flavors. The only issue was that the three appetizers were all packed in the same container, and the crab cakes became soggy because they were sitting in the calamari juices. They still tasted good though.

We got nicks bistro for take out and it was absolutely amazing! So much food included in every meal we received. The chicken platter was amazing! Highly recommend! Cannot wait to go to sit down and eat!

Having lived in the neighborhood for almost a year and a half, I always drove by this place. I never thought of it to be more than an American diner based on the name. Don't judge a book by its cover! When I was looking up Mediterranean restaurants around me and saw this place pop up, I had to try it. No disappointment here on a weekday afternoon for lunch. Quick, courteous service. Lunch special prices are quite reasonable. I had a broiled salmon filet over Greek salad. The salmon was perfectly cooked. The salad was perfectly simple--a hunk of feta, a stuffed grape leaf, and a nicely dressed salad. Will definitely return to try other options on their menu.

We had a great time at Nick's tonight. I ordered the lamb chops which were cooked perfectly and went great with the sautéed asparagus. Everyone else ordered turkey and hamburgers which looked fantastic. I picked at their fries and they were crispy and delicious. It's a small restaurant and the wait staff is attentive and pleasant. Definitely recommend. The four of us had 2 apps , 4 entrees, and 2 deserts for like $160 ( no drinks though). Enjoy!

I love Nick's Bistro!  I have not been here in a couple of years but it was just as wonderful today as it always is.  Service is great, very friendly.  Place is cozy.  We ordered the calamari, which was lightly fried and calamari was tender not chewy.  My fiance ordered the special which was the pork chops, he was very pleased.  Two big juicy chops with asparagus.  I ordered my usual, the Pastitsio...soooo delicious!!  The portion is the size of a brick! i have enough for lunch tomorrow.  We did not get dessert however the people next to us had a beautiful plate of baklava that made me drool a little lol.  This is truly a neighborhood gem.

Omg - I am BEYOND hooked on this place.  Their falafel wrap is my crack! The best thing I've eaten since moving to NYC a couple months ago and hands down the BEST falafel I've had, literally WORLDWIDE! I'm a falafel junkie and get them everywhere and this is by far the best! Don't think of those dry flavorless ones you have had before - this is moist (god I hate that word, but this is the only way to really capture them) and flavorful! I've dined in only once but loved the friendly staff and laid back atmosphere.  I am however, guilty of ordering this wrap through delivery about once a week and it never disappoints!! I'll take pictures next time - it never seems to last long enough for me to remember before I gobble it up! Check this place out - I'm sure the rest of the food is equally as good!

We were driving around Queens on New Years Day, trying to find a place to eat and we saw Nick's Bistro was open so we decided to give it a try. We were very graciously welcomed and shown to a table. We had:- Greek Salad (of course!) - delicious and fresh- Chicken Souvlaki - very good, the chicken wasn't too dry- 3 Spreads - Tzatziki, Babaganoush, and spiced feta - all very good- Beet Salad - very tasty- Pancakes - an odd choice, but my daughter enjoyed- Avegolemono Soup - very good, just the right amount of lemon- Dessert - an assortment of baklava, greek yogurt, ​and a greek cannoliThe staff couldn't be friendlier and the food was great!

In a quite neighborhood stands Nick's Bistro. A bit far from any subway line but that is why you have uber.Lovely brunch menu! Delicious cappuccino. I had a lovely egg white omelette with toast and potatoes. Food was fabulous.Defiantly worth the Uber.

I've been to this restaurant a number of times and have always enjoyed it, but never wrote a review. This weekend, as it turned out, I went there twice, once with a friend, once with my husband and two other couples. I must say, everything I had and my friends had was absolutely delicious, so I decided to put in a review. On Friday we each had a salad, mine with grilled octopus, hers with grilled seafood. Plentiful and delicious! The next evening most of us had the barramundi fish, one person had shish kebab and one had the stuffed shrimp. So, so good. The service was excellent and sitting outside was a pleasure. We will be returning.
Loveeee this place! Good good food and the hospitality is amazing. If you're looking for authentic and fresh this is the place to go!!
Very pleasant dinning experience. All seafood dishes I tried were excellent. I would definitely comeback again.

This place is great ! I was seated very quickly ( outside too ! ) and the servers were really fast and attentive . I got the chicken souvlaki platter and my boyfriend got the chicken gyro platter . They were both great and the lemon potatoes were delicious . I will definitely be back to try out some other items on the menu

Came here a few weeks ago with my boyfriend for dinner. I was very excited and raved to him about how good the food was. I had made a reservation since it was a Saturday night and I figured it would be busy. Needless to say, upon arrival it was packed. We walked in and expected to be greated by a hostess to whom we would tell we had a reservation. 10 minutes pass and we were not acknowledged by a single worker. I work in the restaurant business and I know how easy it is to get caught up with trying to keep things running smoothly. However, it got worse when a couple walked in after us and the hostess walked right up to them said hello and told them they would have a table ready soon...At this point we were still NOT acknowledged. So I then had to get the hostesses attention and tell him we had a reservation for 8:00 pm. We arrived about 5 minutes early and it was now 8:15 by the time we were ACKNOWLEDGED. I understand waiting for a table, but this was extremely rude and unprofessional. I was HIGHLY disappointed as I was just raving about how good this place is. We're finally sat in the corner where a waiter (who was very kind and accommodating) couldn't even reach our table. Whatever this was fine as I was about to walk out and was just happy to be seated. I ordered the falafel platter which was delicious and made up for the rudeness earlier. My boyfriend had a cheeseburger to which he took two bites out of and did not eat the rest of it as he said it wasn't good (he is not a picky eater). I expected better of this place and I will not be returning after the unkind service and lack of professionalism. Three stars for my falafel and very nice waiter.

I think I found a new favorite!Service: sat immediately outside on a beautiful Saturday summer evening Location: busy but lots of cool restaurants around. Food: so good! Listen I can make a mean lamb and I can tell you those lamb chops gave me life again after a 80 hrs work week! I'll be back!

Nick's opened again after Easter during the COVID-19 restrictions. I ordered takeout by phone and John was very pleasant in taking the order. I was planning to order Lemon Potatoes as a side but they were offereing a complementary side with each entree. I ordered a large greek salad to share, Filet of Flounder stuffed with spinach and feta with Lemon Potatoes, Chicken Kebob with Lemon Potatoes, and a dessert order of Baklava. The order was ready when we arrived for pickup and it was then we learned that Nick's was offering 10% off for takeout. Very thoughtful of them. The salad was excellent as was the Chicken Kabob and the Stuffed Flounder that was large enough for two to share. Surprisingly, there was no Lemon Potatoes, only Rice Pilaf. I guess they ran out of the potatoes and substituted the Rice Pilar which was excellent. We were too full for the Baklava which will have to wait a day before we try it. Thanks Nick's for being so accomodating.

This was not my first time at Nick's, It is a place I have always enjoyed and had I taken the time to review prior, would have chosen 3 or 4 stars. I thought it a great stop for a solo pre-movie afternoonWhen I arrived just before 12 noon, there were just two others already enjoying brunch, so I was hopeful I would get in and out fairy quickly.Nope.I ordered an omelet, no onions, no bread. I also asked for the omelet not to be  prepared with butter, but realized with my problem communicating with my server, that was a long shot. Even though mine was the only order being prepared, it took 15 minutes before it arrived, with a lot of onions (and a side of bread).  When my omelet did finally arrive, prepared properly, it was disappointing. Very flat frittata style, with greasy home fries.In fairness, for the delay I was comp'ed my coffee.  The waiter handling the coffee service was outstanding, keeping my cup filled.  But I honestly rather have paid for it and enjoyed my meal.This was my first omelet at Nicks.  In  the past I have had wonderful eggs benedict.  Omelets may simply not be their thing.  Nevertheless, I will not be returning anytime soon.

Really quality restaurant. The fish is always fresh and tasty. The place is quite busy always but the service is great and they always manage to tend to all of your needs. I love that they have a great deal of specials and they get creative with their dishes. My favorite is the salmon with crab meat!

What a great restaurant this is! Service, food, neighbourhood are all impeccable. We stopped there because of outdoor seating and is pretty friendly. My daughter had what we all agreed were the best pancakes we have ever had. She also had their chicken noodle soup...excellent also. My wife and I opted for more Greek dishes...pork souvlaki with lemon potatoes, lamb burger, and appetizer of Taramasalata. All were unbelievably delicious and we'll presented.Our writers were attentive and very helpful. All in all, we were very happy and will return.

Nicks bistro is a Mediterranean delight. With fresh fish and a great selection of dip, you can save yourself a trip   to Astoria.  I was feeling something different so I had the gnocchi.  To my surprise the pastas are as tasty as the other selections. You can't go wrong with nick.

Update: STILL AMAZING! Nicks Bistro is my go to for brunch. the wait staff was very attentive and polite. The food was AMAZING! I had the eggs Benedict, made perfectly. The place is very cute and clean. Felt like it was a very welcoming place. Very comfortable and cozy. They have outside seating if that's your thing. Menu had a great variety of food. We go at least every 2 weeks.also they are open 11 am on Sunday. not 1130.

Went to this place on a Monday for lunch/ brunch. The neighbor was nice and quiet. They have outdoor seating for those who like to have some sunshine. It was my first having Greece cuisine and I have no idea what to order. The owner( I think) came over and spoke to us to see if we need advice on ordering food. He is super friendly!!! We were so satisfied about the lunch. Price is reasonably considering the service we are getting. Totally recommended!
I love this place. The atmosphere is so nice and the food is excellent!! It's always crowded at night so I try to go during the day but the staff is very nice.

Great place: great food great drinks great ambiance. Ate with people who have different eating preferences (vegan, pesceterian and meat-lover). The food was amazing hands down. Everyone loved their meal. Service was not fast food service be prepared to sit a talk (European style) which we did not mind. Humus on the house when you first sit. Great friendly service. Outdoor seating available (with blankets)

Originally I convinced my hubby to come here because he's a seafood person but I came for the lamb chops but they were sold out and it was still fairly early. Nevertheless the the food was good and the desert was really sweet, if ur into that. The service was polite and kind. the guy did apologize for running out of the lambs and he was so sorry our desert was on the house. I really liked the lemon potatoes. Overall great place will be going back to definitely try those lambs. Must be good since it was sold out.

First time when I came this place was good and service was good. This time...not so much as we didn't get our food until two hours later....only to get the baklava as a free dessert(apology for the wait). I got the pork soulvakia and it looked like it was put together by myself lol (I can't cook) as it was just cubes of pork, pita bread, and fries thrown together on a round plate, that's it!

Visited here for the first time with 4 friends for our quarterly get together. I suggested this place based on the reviews. We all got different dishes. We liked 3 out of the 5 choices. I chose the Tilapia. It was bland and the broccoli was cold. They substituted a different dish which slightly made up for other dish. We decided we wouldn't go back. It wasn't worth the money we spent there.

Food is always exceptional. Huge portions and best seafood and crabmeat. The pasticio is so delicious. The Greek cannoli for dessert is wonderful. Nice selection of wines by the glass too. Truly enjoy every meal I have here and the chef is always so nice and makes sure you are happy. I am!

Great food lunch specials are delicious.  Everything I've  had from here has been perfect I recommend people to try this place.  And the service if Friendly fast and perfect. I will be returning many more times!!!

I always order the lamb chops and my partner orders the chicken kebab. We see never disappointed.. We typically order delivery but have also eaten at the restaurant as it has a nice ambiance. Food is pricey as per usual with Greek but it's worth it. Service is warm and gracious, too.

My friend and I got here at 7pm on a Friday. I made a reservation for 2 on the Yelp App. Upon arrival, I was told there was no reservation within their system. I showed the confirmation emails + texts to the host and was escorted to a table about 5mins later. The area has street parking which could easily be found or a total nightmare. The restaurant itself had about one free table. My friend and I both got the chicken souvlaki platters ($14.95). She got a club soda ($2) and i got a sprite ($3). $3 for sprite ... come on Nick's . Seriously? DO . BETTER. It tasted like water with fizz and some sugar but whatever, i'll let you live!!!!!For dessert: Baklava- exceptional !Our entrees were large and delicious. Mine came with french fries and pita while my friend's was paired with rice. Bottom Line: Good greek food with friendly staff. I'd go again.

Came by here for lunch at around 12 on a Friday; surprisingly the place was empty. The server was friendly and attentive. The menu is not vast so choosing comes easily except everything seems bland. I got the braised beef burger with Greek salad and the salmon with feta cheese salad. The salmon was about 4 oz, very little for $15. The salad it sat on wasn't enough as well. The burger's meat was juicy with bbq sauce, but covered in a thick layer of American cheddar cheese; Nobody need that much bad cheese on anything. I didn't see where it said cheese so I didn't bother to have them remove it. But It wasn't easy to remove due to the sticky nature of the cheese to the meat. Overall, I wouldn't waste money here again. The price for quality is not worth it.

Went to nicks bistro for dinner with my husband. There food is so delicious the service is great. What a great dinning experience. I had chicken souvlaki and my husband had lamb kebab. Both dishes was very tasty and very big portions.I will be coming back again to nicks bistro great place.
I lovedddd the food, I was literally mind blown. It was my first time trying Greek food and i would definitely go back numerous times. I had the Chicken Souvlaki and it was AMAZING !!

Was on the hunt once again for Greek food...and stumbled upon this place for Friday date night.It wasn't a particularly memorable experience, but we did enjoy sitting outside and enjoying the breeze. For apps, we got a combo of a few items (they have an option to do that I believe) - most notable were the stuffed mushrooms and crab cakes! The calamari was pretty standard.As for mains, we both got the gyro sandwich, which we found to be quite disappointing. The gyro itself did not taste fresh, and the SO suspected it might be the frozen variety. It was slightly rubbery in texture for some reason, and tasted quite lackluster.Overall a meh experience.
Delicious brunch menus and mimosas :)Had a western omelette with home fries.  Great service will come again.

Good place to try some grilled branzino fish but the dessert options were okay, we ordered the banana bread stuffed with nutella! Sounded exciting but it turned out to be below average! The bread was a bit hard and the nutella stuffing was very minimal.

Excellent service and tasty Greek food. Had the keftedes, Pastichio, broiled filet, chicken souvlakia, and spinach pies.  All good and even though I'm Greek the food was surprisingly spiced in new way. I think I'd like everything on the menu. My family feels similarly.

If you want great food and a great customer service experience I suggest coming here. The waiters are attentive, the  food is delicious! Came on a Friday night and as always never disappointed. Kudos to the staff and to the chef.

Delicious food!  I went with friends and it was pretty busy for a week day night. We started with pita with hummus and ordered more dips to start. All so good!  The falafel was good even though I'm typically not a fan of it. We also had the platter that came with 3 options for $19. Well worth it!I ordered the lamb loin chops and they were done nicely!  Very flavorful and despite already being full from appetizers I finished my food. The salad was also fresh with a house made dressing. We skipped dessert but I'm sure that's yummy as well. I will definitely be back!

The staff is super friendly and amazing!Their food is very authentic and fresh.My favorite dish is the filet of sole stuffed with spinach and feta, their mussels are also very good, they are served in a spicy marinara sauce with feta.If you haven't tried this place I highly recommend it! It won't disappoint you.

Happened to be in the neighborhood so gave this Greek spot a try.  Service was great and the food was good/solid.  Tried the gyro plate and while it wasn't the best Gyro I've ever had, it was still tasty.  For soda lovers, fyi sodas aren't refillable.

If you have never tried Greek food this is the place to start your adventure. I went Tuesday and they had a singer singing with his guitar which made the mood super relax and fun. The place is not big but is very confortable and the decoration is very fun. We had the Nicks Trio for which I chose the Lountza , dolmadthes and the crab cakes, the order came in very fast and every item was delicious, the marinated pork lion was juicy and flavorful, the crab cakes were very soft and warm, and lastly the grape rolls were so good. I had the steak as my entry and the eggplant roll as a side. The roll was so good i didn't even finish the steak and took it home. If you like eggplant the eggplant roll is a must. Had a good time overall will definitely go back.

One word, FANTASTIC!  The location, service and food were wonderful.  I only wished it had parking, but it is Queens and we need to be realisticThe pork chops were seasoned deliciously, juicy and a generous portion.  I had to give 1 pork chop to my boyfriend.  The spinach and feta rice was such a lovely compliment to the pork chops. My boyfriend ordered the shrimp, scallops and lobster ravioli.  It was tasty and the sauce was well done. we look forward to going back to try other dishes.
The BEST chicken souvlaki. So juicy, so delicious. I'm drooling just thinking about that dinner. 2 thumbs up!

Really good! My friend and I split an order of moussaka (it is HUGE) and an order of scallops. Both were excellent, and balanced each other nicely. Next time I might opt to split a moussaka and a salad instead so we might be a little less stuffed. The cocktails were very decent, I had something with rye on their craft list and liked it a lot though it was slightly sweet. This is going to be in regular rotation.

This is the best restaurant in Forest Hills! And to be honest - in my opinion - one of the best in Queens! I've been coming to Nicks for years and the service/food/prices are always consistent. The food is phenomenal, it's my go-to place!

Nick's is amazing! The staff is so welcoming and the food is delicious. Everything we ordered was outstanding! We were visiting our daughter and she wanted to share one of her favorite local eateries and we were certainly not disappointed. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. The property is small so you may have a bit of a wait but folks seemed to move in and out quickly which is very considerate of the other diners! Highly recommended!

One of the best customer service we have ever recieved, based on hundreds of places we've been too. Nicks treated us like we part of the family we never knew existed, and this was our first visit! The presentation of the food was excellent. From appetizers to desert, everything was perfect! We had an amazing time here and I will recommend this place to anyone and everyone. The servers took great care of us the second we landed. You have the ultimate team!Thank you for the wonderful Mother's Day.

My favorite place for Greek food in the neighborhood. I usually get the souvlaki platter. The taste is spot on. It may be a little on the saltier side but it's okay with me. I've gotten take out from there, eaten there, and have also gotten delivery. Delivery has always arrived on time for me.

Two words. AMAZING FOOD. And even better service. I ordered the surf n turf, because of the waiteress Lara's recommendation. It was beyond good, the steak was so tender, juicy, and packed with flavor. The mash potatoes was creamy, and delicious. The Lobster tail was cooked to perfection. I would highly recommend this entree to anyone who comes in. My boyfriend ordered the filet mignon kebab. He absolutely LOVED it! He finished his whole plate off , and even said the rice pilaf is to die for. There were several people who made sure to come to the table to ensure we were having a great experience. They provided pleasant conversation, and we enjoyed talking to them. Overall, it was a excellent experience , and I highly suggest you come to this restaurant to eat.  One of the best restuarants we've come to in a long time. 10/10.P.S You MUST try the lobester tails!!!!!!

Super sweet small restaurant on forest hills. Great location, popular street. Parking is always tough in this area but Nicks is totally worth.They took us as a last minute reservation and we showed up early, yet were seated immediately! Kudos for that. The pita bread with hummus was served so quickly and was delicious, we asked for a second plate.Our kind Croatian waitress was a doll and very attentive. She was working many many tables and still served all of us properly. We started with coconut shrimp (bangin'),and stuffed grape leaves. I must say, their knives are not sharp enough. Get new silverware!For the entree i stuck with the grilled octopus, which was good. a little too buttery but too good to take away a star. Definitely worth a visit!

Thinking of a place to to have lunch , this is the place. My husband and I went yesterday it was delicious !!!!So many dishes to pick from ordered a few, and everything was better than the last dish. Havent had such a pleasant server or overall just nice feeling in a long time. Definitely going back and soon.

I came in for brunch this morning and ordered the eggs benny and it was great!! My friend and I also shared the chocolate chip pancakes which were delicious. The plate has a strawberry drizzle on the sides to dip in and that was a great addition to the taste. Overall, 5 stars! It was my first time and I will definitely come again :) P.S. - the mimosas are everything

My coworkers and I come here for lunch as it's not too far away from the office. There's outdoor seating so it makes for a nice long lunch in the Summer. We generally get the salad which includes salad, rice, pita bread and skewers. The food is great and when you share a platter, the price is right!

One of my absolute favorites!  I love the seafood, basticcio, stuffed mushrooms, and the crabmeat is amazing.  The Greek cannoli is sinful!  Couldn't find a nicer wait staff, and the chef is so friendly and talented.  This is a true gem!!!

Great Restaurant! One of the best Mediterranean restaurants in New York City! Their bread is just amazing and their fries are one of the best I have ever had! Their Chicken could of have been seasoned a little more, but their Chicken was still very good! I definitely recommend going to Nicks Bistro!
Ate here once and loved the food. Ambiance was good too. Will go back for more for sure. The service was good also. No complains.

The food here is AMAZING! It's a small intimate place and perfect for a quick bite or even a date night. From the drinks to the appetizers and the entrees are generous! Very flavorful and our server Stephano is always a pleasure and is super sweet. Every time I've come, he has always been so great! Come and try Nicks! You won't regret it! :)
Great neighborhood restaurant with outdoor seating. Friendly staff and great service. Food was delicious and I highly recommend.

This is by far my fav spot in Forest Hills, the entire staff is amazing! I've pretty much tried everything on the menu except the meat. Beautiful people and atmosphere. I love how creative they get with the windows around holidays!

They accidentally took the wrong order for my husband, but they were able to remake the dish in a good amount of time. When it was the correct dish, everything was great. The portions and prices are pretty good as well!

The last time I was here (about a year ago) I wasn't too impressed - the waitress was a little rude and the food was OK but not great. That's why I kept skipping it whenever I visited Metropolitan to catch a film at Cinemart.The rude waitress was no longer there and it looks like the cook has changed too. Nick's was never bad food, but it has gone from "eh, it's Forest Hills dining," to "Wow. Just wow. I thought I was in Astoria!"I ordered the shrimp and lobster fettucini and it was absolutely delicious. Hubby ordered shrimp stuffed with crab meat. It came with a side of lemon potatoes. He swooned. He said it was one of the best meals he's ever had (and this includes meals in Williamsburg, Park Slope, Astoria, UWS, Soho, Tribeca, etc).The chef, a beefy dude, even came out to make sure everyone was enjoying their meal. Now that's being conscientious! How often do you see that? I thought I was dining at a Michelin starred-restaurant or dining with Gordon Ramsey.I haven't had such great food since I moved out of Astoria and into the geriatric foodie desert that is Forest Hills. Now if only the other restaurants in the Hills would measure up, I'd be in foodie heaven.

We came here twice, once for dinner, and once for brunch.The food is hit or miss for the price but the service was excellent!For dinner, we met with group of friends from my grad school. The area is small (seats ~24 ppl), so its best if you arrive earlier. We got complimentary toasted pita bread with humus while we were waiting for another friend to arrive. K and I ordered grilled Mediterranean octopus, Gyro platter and jumbo shrimp stuffed with crab meat.Our friends ordered the lamb shank, wild salmon, lamb kebobs, and chicken souvlaki.The grilled octopus was charred but overcooked, so the texture was mushy and the sauce was a little too sour. My jumbo shrimp came as a shrimp scampi, without the crab meat but I ate it anyway. I wish there were more shrimp than 5 pieces but K's dish had more than enough for him, so he shared. K's gyro platter was delicious and plentiful! Definitely getting this next time! I'm happy to say my friends seemed satisfied with the meal. All my friends were happily munching away at their lamb and chicken. The lamb shank was somewhat tender and bigger than my hand! My girl friend told me that 'the flavors were good, I just wanted the lamb softer and melting off the bone.' The lamb kebobs was cooked to order (medium) and my friend appeared happy while eating it. We sat and laughed and talked for a couple hours. We got rounds of espresso and baklava to share. Very crispy honey-sweet baklava. Someone didn't eat their piece of baklava so one of my friends and I split the remaining one. So good. Two days later, we joined my family for brunch. We ordered blueberry cream cheese french toast, crab benedict and pork souvlaki. This time, all the dishes were well made! The French toast was crispy and fluffy, and I liked the blueberry cream cheese. The crab benedict had a good amount of crab and perfectly soft runny poached egg. And the pork souvlaki had tender half fatty pieces of pork. I definitely wanted that dish all to myself! And my nephew loved the crab benedict and the home fries. He kept saying mmmmm, and reaching for more! The staff was great and so is the neighborhood. I will definitely be back and now I know what to order next time!

I came here tonight with my friend Andrea G and the restaurant was pretty packed. Not really a waiting area inside the restaurant and I gave my name to the woman carrying a notepad. The wait should have been like 15-20 mins but we waited much longer since the people before us decided to give up their table to the elderly couple and two companions that came after me and Andrea. It was a nice gesture but still pushed back the time for us to sit down and enjoy our dinner. The heat lamps are toasty if you are standing right in front of it. Seriously what's the point of giving your name, if the guy had to come out and asked whose next...that just annoyed me. Andrea G was going to try the Shrimp Souvlaki Platter but changed her mind when she saw the dinner specials and wanted to try the Shrimp Linguine. I decided lets just do a shrimp night. I choose French Fries to come with the Shrimp Souvlaki. They finally brought out to everyone's table a plate of complimentary pita with hummus and black eye peas.Our server brought out our dishes, I saw the rice next to the Shrimp Souvalki and I told him French Fries and plus they cooked the rice in chicken stock which I overheard from the table next to us. Well my friend is a vegetarian so no chicken stock rice for us since we were sharing the two dishes. We started the Shrimp Linguine...tasty but the linguine was a bit bland though and I love shrimps with the tail still intact. I did like the creamy sauce along with the peas..mmmm!Finally our Shrimp Souvalki was brought back to our table, yummy shrimp with the grilled marks on them. Overall, the food was yummy but we finally crossed this off our bookmarks!

I had dinner here Saturday night with my friend Anna. When we got there Anna put her name down and we were told there was a 15-20min wait. I didnt mind except for the fact that you have to wait outside and once it gets colder thats going to be a pain, especially since they dont take reservations for parties of two.For dinner we decided to share two dishesShrimp Linguine, which was pretty good but couldve used a little more seasoning. Shrimp Souvlaki with french fries. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the fries were nice and crispy.Overall I would say it was a good dinner and I would probably go back again.

This is A pretty cool spot in Queens.They have pretty good vegan and vegetarian options which I appreciate. I have met the owner a few times and he's a pretty cool guy. The place is really cute and quaint and really nice during the summer.

Had this on my radar for awhile and it was worth the wait. Ordered some apps and was very pleased. Ordered 2 spreads and pita bread. Melitzanosalata (Eggplant) spread and tirokafteri (Spiced Feta). Both were delicious. I also ordered the greek sausage, greek meatballs and stuffed mushrooms with crab meat. The apps were authentic, well seasoned and fresh. For Entrees I had one of myFavorite greek dishes Pastitsio. And theirs was fantastic, large portion, great macaroni, bechamel sauce and tomato sauce were all seasoned with the greek authenticity Ive come to love in their dishes. The red wine selection was great as well. If you are in queens and not in Astoria definitely come over to Forest Hills and try Nicks Bistro. For image of the dishes check out my Instagram page "journeyoffoodd"

Nice small spot. Came here on Sunday evening and got a spot right away. It was empty at first but quickly filled up.They gave us some pita with humus for starters and the bartender came to us and asked us what we would Ike to drink. She was very nice and gave her recommendations. The food was good. Nothing awesome about it but it was good like a regular Greek spot. I ordered a chicken slovaki and my friend ordered another chicken dish (don't recall the name of dish) but it was a flat chicken dish with lemon potatoes. Parking was easy for a Sunday evening. May come back here again but not a must.

Amazing place. Food was delicious!!!!! And it was in big portions. The service was amazing as well. Our server realized I might not be eating meat and actually offered grape leaves with only rice in it! Pricing was great. I would love to go back and recommend it to other people as well.

Nice trendy look, friendly staff. However, ordered the gyro - this is fake gyro meat! It has filler in it and reminds me of frozen reheated gyro you buy on the street. NOT GOOD.  (Compare to Taci down the block, real amazing gyro and cheaper)Other dishes are probably good but was definitely put off by overpriced fake meat

I'm sad to give this venue a bad review, we have eaten there in the past and always had a great experience, but after what happened yesterday, I must give a one-star review.This is what happened: yesterday we decided to stop by to order some take out. We decided not to eat in because we figured it would take longer, and since we had just gone grocery shopping, we didn't want our groceries to spoil in the car.We went in and placed our order, and everything went smoothly thus far. The waiter even kindly told us we could have waited on the bench outside if we wanted to, and he would have brought our food to us as soon as it was ready.We did, and after 40 minutes of waiting and receiving no updates, I walked back into the restaurant. I walked by two other staff members who told me that our food was being packed. Ten minutes later, I walked in again, and after inquiring about the status of our order I was asked which one was our order, and then I was told again that our food was being packed. After I said that I had been told the same 10 minutes before, the staff apologized. Another 5 minutes went by and the food was finally ready. The  waiter apologized and said they had put free dessert in our bag (4 bites of Baklava).When we arrived home, quite angry for the long wait, we had some more unpleasant surprises: the container with my food hadn't been closed properly and all the condiments had spilled. In addition, my wife had ordered a side of rice; guess what was in her container...potatoes!! Finally, the groceries we had bought were all melted thanks to the extremely long wait. So in addition to the $40 we spent at Nick's, we also wasted $80 in groceries since we had to throw them all in the garbage; not to mention the time that we are going to have to waste again, having to return to the grocery store and buy the same groceries again.What's most upsetting is that the restaurant was quite empty on a Monday evening (maybe 5 tables had guests), so it's not that they were busy. They should have informed us we would have had to wait and we would have either went somewhere else, or placed our order, driven back home and gone back to pick it up, being able to put our groceries in the freezer and not have them spoiled.So yes, we are quite upset, and we don't think we are going to return to this restaurant.

This place is just the best. The service is always excellent and really every dish is great- we've been here multiple times for special occasions and even just quick lunches. Their specials are always on point too. Super fresh, tasty Greek food done right.

Went there on Friday, great ambiance...excellent service and great food. We had grilled branzino, lamb chops, trio appetizer with stuffed mushrooms, crab cakes and fried calamari and few other things and every dish was perfect.I highly recommend to anyone who enjoys great food.
Must go !!! Food is great , the stuff is amazing. If you planning to go in the evening I suggest you to make reservation it gets crowded after 6 Pm don't forget to have Greek cannoli For desert

I happened to be in the area & since I'm not familiar with the neighborhood I turned to yelp. Based on the reviews this place should have been a slam dunk but instead it was an epic miss. The wait for our food was over 30minutes after we ordered & the place was no where near full at 3:00pm in the afternoon. The food was really not good. It was indeed edible hence 2 stars, not 1. I am pissed for wasting my time & money on this place instead of having a quality meal else where. Note to self, yelp is not always right.

The food here was awesome! There's outdoor seating available with a nice set up if you want. You could probably bring your dog to hang out too. I'm vegan/Gluten Free and I really appreciated the menu being labeled with GF options. We started off with an app of pita and hummus/beans (+ GF pita) which we really enjoyed. The GF pita was really good, something I haven't had. I opted for the quinoa falafel with lemon potato wedges and a side salad. SO DELICIOUS! They were kind enough to swap the dairy dipping sauce for hummus and I was thrilled. The hummus had a really nice texture, tasted homemade. My friend ordered the skirt steak and she really loved it as well.We've both been living in the neighborhood for over 10yrs and this was our first time here but certainly not the last!

We order delivery from Nicks all the time but today we stopped in to sit down. We were greeted right away and seated with a delicious plate of soft pita and hummus spread! For appetizer we had the fried calamari which was perfectly crispy and a delicious hot dipping sauce. For dinner I ordered the seafood salad which I have to say was out of this world! The portion was generous and the shrimp, calamari, and octopus were all grilled to perfection. The dressing was light and very good too! My boyfriend ordered the steak, it came covered in a thick sauce with grilled vegetables spread over top. Overall it was really delicious! The only thing I would change was that it was slightly too cold inside the restaurant but otherwise everything was perfect! We will be back!
Great little spot in Forest Hills. Staff is always friendly and they have a great menu with lots of variety.
Really tasty Greek food. The place is nice and cozy and is good for a couples night out. Enjoyed it.

I took my bro here for his bday, table of 3, first time for all. It's nice little bistro, has an outside seating area too. It does get busy super fast so recommend rsvp especially for outside seating. Plates are bit expensive but worth it. I had the Athenian fish entree and my bro had the filet steak I think. All of our food were super tasty and worth every bite. We got the brownie w ice cream ! Highly recommend - big portion so I was glad we 3 shared one dessert. There house red wine Cabernet was so nice and silky! Loved it. I def will go back since I live close by, place is pretty popular, waiters are friendly. They came by often to provide anything we needed. One little comment I would make that can be better is the smell inside the bistro, was a bit pungent. Perhaps it was the cheese they were using, but then again it was my first time. Don't know if that's a normal thing there but I would still go back and if that the case sit outside :)Food is def exceptional.
Big fan of Nicks. A little pricy but worth it for the quality and portion of the food. I usually split the chicken kebab plate and salad with my wife and be more then full.
Came here for a dinner with friends on a Friday for dinner.  It was empty at first but quickly filled up. Pros: Nice atmosphereGood foodCons:The food took a while Music was a little too loud

definitely one of my favorite establishments around the forest hills areas, problem is though some of the food items are some of the best I've ever tasted, one item in particular ( that I've tried at least ) left me wondering if I came out of some kind of inner city school cafeteria of some sort.Came here twice, once for brunch and once for dinner. First time I came here I ordered the mixed shwarma and nicks appetizer combo which consisted of calamari, greek sausages and crab cakes. the appetizers were absolutely amazing! the calamari was some of the softest and most delicious I've ever had in my life, moist and done extremely well definitely recommend everyone get this item when you visit, same goes for the crab cake, extremely hardy portions with actual crab chunks in it, again one of the best crab cakes I've ever had. I really enjoyed the sausages as they were extremely moist and fatty, but they may not be everyones cup of tea since they were pretty fatty and tasted pretty gamey. My biggest disappointment was the shawarma, the meat was incredibly dry and the yogurt sauce non existant, the food item also literally broke apart before I even took my first bite, one of the worst shwarmas I've ever tasted in my life, absolutely avoid at all cost.I came back here because I was salivation over the appetizers. This time around I ordered the pork chops and the same appetizers but swapping the sausages for greek meatballs. The meatballs tasted fine, very moist but a strong hint of mint was mixed into the concoction. Pork chops again were done fantastically. They gave me two very large healthy portions, and the pork came out tender and done very clean and simply yet incredibly delicious.in essence come here definitely get the appetizers at all costs! avoid the shwarma like the plague and everything else is fair game, I definitely recommend this place

Wow. Talk about hidden gem!I've been passing this place for years and never thought to give it a try. I am kicking myself right now. On Sunday I came here for brunch with my mother. I ordered a Bellini - it was fabulous. But let's get to why were really here. The food!For an appetizer we ordered the crab stuff portobello mushroom. Oh my god. This was amazing. I could have had two orders and been fine with just that.However - I ordered the lamb burger & sweet potato fries with a side of tirokefteri (aka spicy feta dip) AMAZING!!!!!My mother ordered a Greek omelette that she put the tirokefteri on and she was in heaven. Please if you live anywhere nearby go here. You will love it!

I love Greek food, this is a good Greek restaurant. Good service, the waiter and waitress are very friendly and caring. Mediterranean octopus salad, whole grill bronzini and a appetizer combo were what I ordered, they are all very delicious, just the fish a little bit too dry, my guess is the fish is not fresh(frozen fish), but overall is good. My husband ordered a steak, he loves it too.

Must go!! 2nd time here and the owner/chef didn't disappoint. Million thumbs up !!! The wrap shrimp a was delicious and I had the chicken and falafel amazing. Parents had wild salmon even better. I'm telling you there foods are fresh and nothing will disappoint!!

I rarely get food delivered because I find that the quality of food is generally better when you eat in but tonight I decided to take a risk and I'm so glad I did. First of all, my food was delivered within 21 minutes...And more impressively, the food was perfect. The seafood in the black linguine was fresh and a fair amount of everything. My steak (Athenian filet) was cooked to perfection, medium, and the sauce was very unique. I always order avgololemono from Greek restaurants to compare and this is at the top of my first for sure; good consistency, strong lemon taste but not overwhelming, orzo was cooked right and not too mushy like a lot of places. I can't wait to go through the rest of the menu and to eat in the restaurant.
Always a favorite you can't beat the lemon potatoes and each meal is just as delicious as the other!

I'm not going to say anything about negative about the food or Nicks Bistro in general. My wife and I enjoy the food at Nicks. Yesterday, the service wasn't up to par. I had to wait minutes to be seated, even though when I arrived several tables for 2 were available. Once I sat down, no one came over to ask if we wanted anything. On the 2 other times that we had dinner at Nicks, the wait staff usually bring out a portion on hummus with pita bread to the table. We only received our hummus & pita bread after making a request. The patrons that came after us received their hummus & pita bread immediately. Our waiter took our order and basically that was the extend of our service until we requested the check. I left only a 10% tip, due to the fact I don't think that we had good service that night. I hope that this was just an anomaly and not the norm.

My husband & I absolutely love this restaurant. Food is ALWAYS fresh & delicious. We have never had a bad experience! I usually get the salmon with crab meat which is amazing & my husband gets the stuffed shrimp which is too die for. One of our favorite places for date night!

Stopped in for early dinner.  The dining room was clean and neat. The set up made a great atmosphere.Our waiter, Kevin, was awesome! Personable yet professional.  Attentive to any glass half full and he even charged my phone for me(an odd request I am sure).After receiving complimentary hummus, beans, and pita for the table, we ordered the trio appetizer; Picked Calamari, stuffed shroom, and Cyprian sausage. The Calamari was fine. The shroom and sausage were fantastic.  The gyro platter was great. I even asked for an extra full pita and it came out fresh made very quickly.Two airline pilots that frequent Greek restaurants all the time, Rick's was aces!
The food was delicious!!!!! Great decor. The service was excellent. I highly recommend this place.

Bad experience tonight. 25 min wait for food. Had to ask for forks Hummus,salad  and drinks. Invisible to the waiter when we are regulars here. Had to ask for more drinks. Food was good but service was very lacking. It's a small place so this should never happen. Very disappointed.

Nick's bistro is a hidden gem in queens. The greek food is authentic and consistently great.We had  the stuffed salmon w/ spinach & feta and the souvlaki. Both were superb, finished every last  bite. Also, the greek wines are great as well. Highly recommend this spot if you're craving greek food.

I am very pleased to be giving Nick's Bistro a 4 star review. The food was delicious. The taste, although not as authentic as the real deal, it was pretty close.
