My boyfriend and I eat like animals so portion sizes are very important to us. We waddled out of Nick's Bistro with very full bellies. The service was amazing. Our water glasses were constantly being refilled before they ever reached the bottom. It was a bit chilly today so we sat indoors. I loved the fact that the music wasn't super loud. We were able to have a regular conversation. The outdoor seating looked very nice, so I'd love to come back on a warmer day to sit there.Defiantly a place I would recommend to my Greek friends and family.

This is such a cute and cozy restaurant. Great Greek option in Forest Hills. We were seated right away and noticed how it was intimate and comfortable, not loud and obnoxious. Can definitely carry a normal conversation and have great food. They serve complimentary hummus and bean dip which was delicious and offer a variety of whole wheat and regular pita bread. We ordered the tzatziki and eggplant dip for $8.50 and keftda (meatballs) for appetizers. DELICIOUS. I highly recommend their dips - it also comes with the same variety of pita bread. Them meatballs....oh my goodness. So flavorful, very fresh and just a burst of Mediterranean goodness. Highly recommend the keftda. There's a total of 7 meatballs for this order so it's definitely a good sharing dish.I ordered the chicken souvlaki platter with a side of spinach rice (which was recommended to me over the pilaf) and it was great! It's a lot of food so it's a meal worth taking it to go so you can have this goodness for lunch the next day. The chicken was cut in chunks and grilled to perfection - not too dry and lots of flavor. I like spinach so the spinach rice was a great complement to the chicken. The platter comes with more pita bread, a bit of salad and an additional side salad (separate bowl). Overall, Nick's is now my go-to when I want Greek food in the area. The staff is very nice and attentive, and provide great service. Lots of different dishes to try and definitely interested in their brunch.

Mmmmmm!! Came here last night for dinner. Before we entered we were warmly greeted and seated. First impression.. It's a nice cozy dimmed restaurant in a cute quiet neighborhood.Ordered a lamb and chicken platter with lemon potatoes and French fries. Before our food came we got a nice hummus platter with warm pita bread which was very tasty. When the food came..it looked amazing. I didn't take a picture since there's a lot of them on yelp as is. But Yes, everything was fresh and delicious. They serve a lot of meat which is good and very filling.  Oh and the french fries are out of this world! Crunchy and tasty. The lemon potatoes were soft and had a subtle lemon flavor. It came with a side salad which I thought  would have feta cheese in it but it was a regular side salad with a really good creamy balsamic vinaigrette. Overall the service here is excellent. The staff is very welcoming and superb. I would definitely come back if I'm in the area.

I've lived in Forest Hills and Kew Gardens for years, but just recently made it into this neighborhood favorite. It's a small restaurant on Metropolitan with some fantastic food and service that's friendly but professional. It's a real treat to eat there in person because of the service and mellow vibe, but the food is so good that it's fine to have it delivered. The stuffed grape leaves-filled with meat, rice, and spices-are so good that we all crave them and order them in far too frequently. Their mussels in red sauce with feta travel surprisingly well and my 7-year-old son says they're the best thing he's ever eaten in his "whole entire life." The one thing that's excellent in the restaurant that doesn't seem to travel well is the gluten free pita, but that tends to be the nature of gluten free foods rather than a delivery issue. My only suggestion with delivery is to remind them to send your tzaziki and pita-they've been left out a couple of times and that's disappointing, particularly when you've ordered mussels and can't dunk pita in the sauce.

Went with a large party for a friend's retirement party. He had recommended it.  We were all overwhelmed by the service, the friendliness and most especially, the food.Fantastic does not do this place justice.Owner was over to make sure all was well several times, their specialties lived up to that title.  The waiting staff was attentive and professional, the atmosphere was homey and down to earth.More than twenty of us there, and the service was personal and outstanding.  The food was great!  Staff took time to explain and recommend appetizers, dinners and drinks, but were never pushy.VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

I've eaten here 3 times, one of which was take out so I think I've given this place a fair shot. The first two times it was ok, not amazing, but ok. Yesterday I ordered delivery and was kind of disappointed. I ordered a Greek salad with grilled shrimp. The shrimp was burned, but the vegetables were nicely fresh as was the calamari I ordered. It's okay, 3 stars.

Very cozy little spot, with great food and attentive service.  Have had brunch here with a friend or two and they do not rush you out either, which is nice. They do refill on the coffee and have a great selection for brunch.  Love their omelettes.  I heard the Baklava is fantastic there, so will try it next time.

Nick's is a decent Greek restaurant.  Living in Richmond Hill there's not many places to choose from.  That being said I think it is way over priced for the quality of food that you get.  The food is good but the 20 min drive to Astoria is the way to go.
Ordered for delivery and it was amazing! A bit pricey but well worth it. Got the greek lasagna and gnocchi. Definitely going to drop by and try it for dine-in.

The best thing about this meal was the charming company I had but as she's not on the menu here's our experience. The dessert was excellent Galaktoubrueko, definitely 5 stars for that. Perfect end to the meal cleaning our palate. The server was a charming young man who had a genuine interest in us as customers and in the food itself. He realized from our conversation that both my friend and I have a passion for food and after he knew how we enjoyed the dessert a nice surprise was to bring a piece each of baklava to try. Baklava was beautifully layered and not dipped in honey so could actually taste it. Better than that though was the chefs special cream whipped by his own hand. Very clean taste, light and fluffy. Main course large bronzini fish was nicely grilled and not swimming in fat. It was dry though but possibly because we had it butterflied. Starter octopus was delicious and after dessert our 2nd favorite item.  Mixed starter the chefs Greek sausage was short but thick and flavorsome, grilled and not fatty at all. The calamari was not to our liking and dry as indeed was the crab cake. For two of us the bill was over $120 so not cheap. I liked this place because of the company and the server but otherwise with so many places to try in NYC more to experience.

Nick's Bistro is neighborhood gem! Delicious Greek food that even satisfies the taste buds of even the most picky diners. I dined here on a Saturday evening with a large group of friends for a birthday celebration. My group was seated promptly upon arrival and unfortunately, some of my guests decided tell me, literally, last minute that they wanted to show up... After speaking to the staff, they were actually understanding and accommodating to us. Thank you Alfred and staff!!!Food! Our group was presented with complimentary warm, grilled pitas with hummus and a fresh black eyed peas dip. I really enjoyed it! For appetizer, I ordered the Mediterranean Grilled Octopus. It was quite delicious! I loved that it was not greasy at all compared to others. Each piece was mouth sized, super tender, and slightly charred. It was bedded on a small salad. My neighboring guests and I really loved it. I really wish there was more!For entrees, I had a taste of the Chicken/Pork Souvlaki, Colorado Lamb Chops, and the Black Linguini. Souvlaki: Whether you get the chicken or pork souvlaki, you made a great choice! Souvlaki comes with many jumbo pieces of meat, grilled pitas (yes, again!), a side salad, and another side - lemon potatoes or rice. Each piece of meat was juicy and my knife was able to just slice into smaller pieces without much effort! It was nicely seasoned and tastes smokey! Must-order!Colorado Lamb Chops come with four beautifully grilled lamb chops and a side. They are very well seasoned with salt and spices. Not to mention, they were so tender and not gamey as I thought they would be. This quite a popular dish among the guys.Black Linguini. This pasta dish was pretty flavorful with all the fresh seafood in it - two jumbo prawns, scallops, mussels, and squid rings. I love the flavor of the seafood infused into the red sauce. I thought the portion of pasta was not enough. The black linguini was quite interesting and this is my second time having it. However, aside from its harder texture and color, I am actually not too sure what else is different from the normal linguini. This is something that I will research about!Sangria. Simply delicious. Obviously, very well made. Red wine was infused with the fresh fruits. It was so good that I just kept drinking and drinking... and it slowly creeped up on me. Before I even knew it, my face was as red as my drink!Service was phenomenal! Shout out to Alfred! I made reservations about a week prior using Yelp SeatMe. I asked for tables on the right side of the restaurant with the benches. I sincerely appreciate a phone call that I got from Alfred who simply wants to clarify which part of the restaurant I meant. I liked that he just simply asked me rather than just assuming. Thank you very much for being so accommodating!!!

I ordered delivery recently after a 6 year hiatus from Nick's Bistro. I was very impressed! Grilled shrimp caesar salad was good. But, the sea kabob was excellent! What really caught my attention was that they accommodated my very annoying request that was placed in comments. I'm an extremely indecisive person and can never choose what accompanying side I want. I placed a request asking for a half portion of rice pilaf, and a half portion of lemon potatoes and they brought my order exactly as requested. The gentleman who delivered the food also could not have been any friendlier!

I have nothing to complain about.You can tell the staff and everyone is on top of their customers, making sure everything is going smoothly. The vibe is nice, love the dim lighting.I came here mainly by word of mouth so I gave it a go and I'm glad I did! I will be back to try the other very delicious looking things on the menu! Thanks!

My rating would have likely been five stars if not for the following:1) We were seated and despite asking for menus twice and asking for a server we were ignored for 15 minutes.  2) Once we got the apparent manager's attention the staff played who gets our table.  3) The acoustics are lousy so it's extraordinary loud. 4) Orecchiette was  pedestrianThe food is delicious except one dish was barely average. Get the meat stuffed grape leaves as an appetizer. Best I've ever eaten. Octopus was tender and moist with a nice char. Keftedes were tasty balls of goodness. Two different shrimp dishes were cooked perfectly. While the crab stuffed shrimp was excellent the geek style in a tomato and feta sauce were outstanding.  . All fishes were expertly cooked. Desserts were 4-1/2 star worthy.  Would definitely return.

This is a 10 star establishment, please if you're a Michelin officer come and check out the food, everything we ordered was literally cooked to the right texture and consistency I did not expect everything to be perfect the service was outstanding and super accommodating, this is a gem a neighborhood operation where everyone's friends and remembered. Just last night I had a similar meal to which I paid nearly $200 dollars and Nick's bistro just blew away my $200 dollar mistake, I'm glad to have experienced this amazing food and cannot wait to be back for more!

This restaurant has amazing customer rapport and service. I came to Nick's tonight and the place was full, so I had to wait a bit for a table. They were very accommodating during our wait, frequently offering us to sit outside by the heaters (it was a chilly evening). We politely declined, and decided to wait for a table within the restaurant. When the moment finally came and our seats were ready, they offered us a round of drinks on the house. Every time I come to Nick's, I am greeted with warm smiles and comfort, and that makes all the difference. It's what keep me coming back (plus, their food is the bomb).

A friend was running late (we were meeting at Oliloli) and I was starving so I walked into Nicks Bistro alone on a Saturday afternoon. It was pretty busy but I was seated right away, and I ordered quickly so I could meet my friend when she arrived. There was a lot of yummy things to choose from. I ordered a veggie sandwich from the brunch menu, and it was so good! The portions were huge. I also had a mimosa, which was inexpensive and very good. Looking forward to going back!

I have been to this restaurant a few times with friends. It wasn't a very good Greek restaurant compared to others I've been too and the food was always old. Their falafel was horrible and had such a spongy texture. They get the order wrong half of the time and the service is horrible. If I could I would give this restaurant 0 stars.

I am pleased to add an enthusiastic FIVE STARS to this outstanding restaurant. Although the restaurant was very busy, our party of four was seated immediately at our reservation time. From the start of pita with chick-peas and hummus to the perfectly seasoned main courses, all of us were very pleased with the food. Portions were generous and the food was fresh. Two of us had salmon (one with kale, another over Greek salad. We both agreed that the fish was excellent. The two others had gyro (big portion, well seasoned) and the other had beautifully finished stuffed shrimp.We all agreed that the service was second-to-none. I've been to much more expensive, "fancier" restaurants who could take direction on customer service and presentation from these pros. Don't miss this gem.

1 star for the excellent food 2nd star for making my dad very obliviously happy on his birthday The food was amazing. Service a little slow but we were happy regardless and having a grand time celebrating my father's birthday. I ordered some drinks at the end of dinner and mentioned to the waiter it was my father's birthday drinks, and to our very pleasant surprise they brought out a brownie cake with candles and sang a birthday song.We were all so surprised and appreciative until I got the bill and saw that they charged me for the surprise birthday brownie that I didn't order and my family was so pleasantly surprised about.I didn't have the heart to tell my parents since they raved about how considerate and thoughtful they were to bring out a birthday brownie. But it didn't feel good. It was a cheap move. I am very disappointed. We tipped well regardless.

So happy I found this spot. The food was great, and the people on the phone were very accommodating, when I called in with a question. I really like tzatziki, but couldn't figure out how to order more from Yelp, so I called them. Unfortunately, they didn't know either, so they just gave me an extra one. Very nice, but I feel bad, because they really should be paid for it. Either way, I'm going to order again, and if they still don't have the tzatziki on the menu, I'm going to have to just place my order over the phone. I know you don't care about me and my tzatiki story, but it helps me to remember, so, yeah.

I went today for the first time with a friend. Tempting menu. We had one of the specials and it was delicious. The service was prompt, professional and courteous. We weren't rushed to leave. All in all, a very pleasant experience.

Terrible first experience here! The drink (rum punch) I ordered tasted so watered down that I had to send it back. I ordered the lobster roll special and specifically asked for no bacon as I am highly allergic. Food took forever and when it came and I took my first bite, what did I taste? A mouthful of bacon. Ugh. Hope I don't have to pay for that later at a doctor's office! Had to send that back too. There were a bunch of different waiters moving around so I barely got the same person throughout the night. When the new order came out the waitress that took the original order barely mumbled a sorry and just placed the plate in front of me. Apparently she was more mad than me. I never saw her again the rest of the night. My husband did enjoy his shrimp dish and when the lobster came right the second time, it was good but a smaller portion than the original serving. Different waiter came to clear our plates and take dessert order. They didn't have what I wanted (cheesecake baklava) so we settled for just the baklava. It was good. The bill came and of course nothing was comped for the mistake. Infact, the drink I sent back was still on there. Waiter took a good 10-15 mins to reappear at which point I asked him to have the rum punch removed. It was and we paid and left. The food was good but not worth the hassle (with no proper apology) so we wouldn't be returning.

Very small place but very good service and food. Lamb burger and Bronzino is the best! One day they were closing for an event and still allowed us to come sit an order even though it felt rushed but we understood. Been about 3 times already.
I wanted Greek food before Leaving New York. This place is great The food is So yummy!!!!!The service is great!The food is Delicious!

Greek is one of my favorite types of cuisine, and I am fortunate it is as ubiquitous as it is in NYC, and especially Queens. Nick's is certainly a gem of a restaurant for upscale Greek in the Kew Gardens-Forest Hills area. With an eclectic mix of Italian and American dishes, you won't get the authenticity of the establishments in Astoria, the Greek epicenter of Queens, but you will certainly be treated to a good meal, service, and ambiance. I don't mind the diversity of the menu because the setting is nice, and having the option of eating chicken wings or a mozzarella sticks in addition to the Greek fare is nice. The Mediterranean spreads  are OK here, but I would recommend skipping them and opting for a meat or seafood appetizer instead. The keftedes are delicious, but we tried some Greek sausages that were a part of the night's specials, which were full of flavor, tender, and absolutely delicious. When it comes to entrees, Nick's portions are huge, and lamb served in a variety of ways is what I like most. The lamb chops, loin, shank, and kebabs are all superb: crispy and slightly charred on the outside and delightfully juicy and tender on the inside. The Colorado lamb chops are a must have, and if you're lucky enough to snag an order of the lamb shank that is often offered a special, it's an absolute must! A really nice neighborhood place that is upscale enough for a nice night out, and reasonably priced enough for a quick meal if you're in the mood for Greek.

This was our first visit to nicks bistro. My boyfriend ordered a lamb gyro and loved it except they toasted pita bread to long. Didn't say anything about it. I had a stuffed flounder with spinach and feta with salad on side. I think a Greek restaurant would put some feta or kalamata olives in but no. Fine no problem. Didn't say anything. Food was actually very good. We ordered shots of tequila. 2 each. No problem. Asked for the check and gave waitress my debit card. Anyways she comes back and said had to void it because her and her boss (I guess) added 2 extra drinks. Honestly wouldn't have bothered me if she just told me. Would have taken the 2 shots. But to charge twice and void once without telling me is bad. Could have messed me up with my bank. Just give people a heads up before you charge and void. Anyways I feel bad because up until the checks came had a lovely time. I understand there was good intentions just a bad way to end a good lunch.
Place was good, came here for some lunch, had a veggie burger. sides. Decent spot. kinda pricy but not too bad.

This is wonderful gem in Forest Hills. It's one of my favorite spots.  I feel the need to order from here at least once a week. The food is delicious and fresh. There is a lot of variety on the menu and it's a cozy atmosphere. The staff is always friendly and the service is great! I highly recommend this place.

It's interesting. I went again recently for dinner and we didn't enjoy it at all. They didn't have what I wanted for dinner and so I settled on something else and overall it was just eh. I kinda wrote it off. However! We went today for brunch for Father's Day and it was superb. I got the crab cake Benedict and absolutely loved it. I'm actually excited to give it another try. I just hate that their lunch menu is totally different than dinner. The lunch menu actually looks way more appealing.

This food at this restaurant is great. I went with my bf for a nice quick meal before going to the movies. The waitress greeted us and sat us down immediately. The place is nicely decorated, dim lighting, low music. They have outdoor seating but it was too hot for that!  I had the pork souvlaki, with French fries and a side salad... omg it was so good. It was simple but good and tasty and the fries were so crispy and delicious. My bf had the salmon salad with extra chicken on the side. He said his salad was delicious and the salmon was perfectly marinated and cooked. We had water and coffee as drinks with our meals, our cups were constantly refilled. The staff is very attentive. I will definitely go back to this restaurant.

Cute place with friendly customer service and amazing food! We ordered the stuffed mushrooms as an appetizer based on our servers recommendations and it was delicious. My bf ordered the lamb chops, which came out juicy and had the perfect amount of seasoning. I ordered the black linguine, which I highly recommend if you like seafood pasta. The servers were super friendly and took the time to describe different items on the menu. Wish I could have for dessert in because the baklava looked delish. Definitely would come again!
The food at this establishment was absolutely amazing and the service was also amazing . The initial wait for a party of 2 was 10 minutes .
We ordered stuffed mushroom, grilled octopus, and lemon potato. Everything is great. The chef really knows what they are doing.

Had lunch recently at Nicks. Was visiting family in Queens and she suggested Nicks. What a great lunch!! I had the chicken souvlaki platter with the lemon roasted potatoes. The service and food were nothing but the best!!Come to CT please!!!

I love this place! The food is always fresh and so delicious! My only complaint was recently that I ordered delivery for first time and it took almost an hour to get to me. I called and the gentleman that took my order gave me a reasonable explanation as to why it took so long, but having a newborn at home, made me change my lunch plans. Nevertheless, I still give them 5 stars. I love their seafood salad, which was what I ordered for delivery, but also love their salmon stuffed with fetta cheese and spinach and also crabmeat. I also tried their greek cannoli, which was a true delight.

I just discovered this place, and boy what a great place. The food is spectacular and the service is exceptional. Very well run restaurant I have returned back to eat here at least a dozen times in the last month and consistently the food is great. What a gem. Highly recommended. I wish I had tried the place earlier.

After a trip to the pet shop down the block, A and I along with our two new fur babies stopped in at Nick's Bistro to grab a quick bite al fresco as it was such a nice afternoon. They accommodated our having pups with us and sat us at the end of the outdoor dining area (in case of other diners, though there were none. More on that later.) I ordered the stuffed zucchini special which was described as "how grandma made it"; a gigantic zucchini stuffed with spiced meats and rice with a side of lemon mashed potatoes. A got the Nick's burger. I also ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc, which was pretty good. Good wines by the glass  surprise me as many places sell subpar wine that's been open too long so it's flat and sour. Not so here! Minutes into our meal, our pups decided they've had it with waiting under the table for us and started howling and pulling at their leash (anyone know of a good obedience school?). Plus, the nice afternoon turned into a chilly, breezy evening and we were freezing! No wonder no one sat outside! I went to the bathroom and the inside was very warm and cozy. So we asked for them to wrap our meal to go and they again accommodated us very nicely and quickly. Good food, good service; we'll be back petless to have a full meal here again soon!

This restaurant beat my expectations. All of the waiters were very friendly and respectful. Also, THE FOOD WAS AMAZING. This restaurant has vegan and vegetarian options as well. I would recommend this spot to anyone!

The service was fantastic!  The food a disappointment.  My daughter and I shared the saganaki, greek salad, moussaka and baklava.  The greek salad was thin slivers of peppers and cucumbers.....not nice thick chunks.  The moussaka had so little meat we thought we received a vegetarian version!  And, the baklava had a paper thin layer of nuts with what seemed like mushy bread crumbs on top.  I make better and I am not Greek!!

My gf brought me here for my birthday. The restaurant is super cozy & has live music which was a huge plus. The food was filling and really flavorful. It was our first time trying Greek and the waitress was really helpful. Overall, I had a great time and would def come back

Food - Excellent and authentic as can beService - First Class - my son (being a picky eater) decides he now does not want what he wanted in the first place. He did try it but did not want it in the end. Our server was very nice and took the order off the checkExperience - awesome - kid friendly and timing for everything was a breezeSummery - well worth the price and it's now my local go to (with or without the kids)Greta place must visit!  Thank you guys   ******  6 stars!

Had excellent food here today. Jalapeño dip. Stuffed Mushroom. And the best of all the stuffed grape leaf app. Moved on to some of the best sausage I've ever had. Had some falafel and beer salad. Enjoyed everything. Great drink tip: don Julio margarita

We unexpectedly found ourselves in the neighborhood and someone recommended this restaurant to us. The food was actually very good (stuffed crab mushrooms appetizer, fish dish & dinner platter) and the portions were generous. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and friendly.

I have been here quiet a few times after a friend of mine recommended the restaurant. This place has a very cozy and intimate atmosphere. The servers are very attentive, and make sure you're always catered to.The food is great. They start you off with some pita bread and hummus. I have tried a wide range of dishes here from the lemon ouzo chicken to the crab meat stuffed salmon (my boyfriends favorite dish) and they've all been great. Now my absolutely favorite thing from here is the Greek Cannoli. It's basically a caramel coated waffle cone with sort of a cheese cake ice cream filling (you MUST try it )
Food was awesome!!Service was great I started with fry calamari and mussel..love it both...thenI had the lamb kabobs with spinach feta rice and the mix meat platter..Definitely going back here again

Finally got the chance to try this restaurant. Thank God we did! Food is amazing, drinks were delicious! Wait staff was on point, extremely friendly and knowable about thier food. I'm a Seafood lover so we start of with their Stuffed Mushrooms (stuffed with real crab meat, you can actually see chunks of crab meat) and Grilled Octopus. Best Octopus I ever had! Later on I had Thalassini Fotia (huge plate with a lot of spicy Seafood and linguni). My date tried their Lamb Shank Uvetsi from special menu. He was thrilled. Meat was so tender and full of flavor!If you have room left for dessert please go with Mama's homemade Brownies. Delicious!!Definitely will be back!!!

We're back at Nicks Bistro. One of our favorite places to eat in queens. I'm getting the shrimp cocktail and the Athenian Filet (sliced filet mignon in a brown feta cheese sauce.). I usually get their fabulous Black Linguini w/ shrimp, mussels, clams in a delicious tomato sauce - but this evening I'm trying something new.  My hubby is getting his usual favorite: Lemon Ouzo Chicken.  He loves that! I love the hummus w/ black eyed peas & pita that they put on the table as you peruse the menu.The Athenian Filet was an excellent choice! The filet mignon was cooked exactly as I ordered it and who knew feta & steak paired so well together!!  Delicious! As I stated in my previous review, the servers are very attentive, informative & welcoming.   They've been working here quite a few years - Alfred, one of the partners is a very nice guy & I'm sure he's an excellent boss!! They're busy as they usually are & Alfred is checking on customers, pouring water --- very involved !

Never heard of Nick's, but was in the area and walked by. The place was completely empty, but we decided to give it a try. Service was excellent, but the real winner here is the food. I had the steak salad which we DELICIOUS with blue cheese and candied nuts. Also, the wines are $6, so I ordered their Pinot Noir and it was delicious. I look forward to coming back and trying more of their delicious food. Oh, and after we sat the place filled up quick, so it's definitely a known place to eat at for good food.
Came here for the first time. Service was top notch and he dishes are all fresh and made with a lot of flavor. The lunch special for 2 is a great deal and a lot of food.
What can I say, the place is awesome! Food is cooked and flavored to perfection, atmosphere is beautiful and the service is great. Real family style feeling in this place. Highly highly recommended!

Oh Nick! I've driven by this place so many times and I always say I would check it out because it's always crowded and well I finally did and boy was I disappointed. I came in around 7:30 pm with a party of 2 and was seated right away the service was good the food was okay and the drink we ordered was strong but had too much ice. We ordered the grilled octopus, lemon potatoes and the chicken souvlaki platter. The octopus was a bit chewy which we know that means it's not fresh the potatoes were good the chicken on the souvlaki platter was basic grilled chicken nothing special. The food was just okay the place was just okay what can I say I wouldn't go back.
I love Nicks. Their food is always delicious and clean tasting and their customer service is great. Definitely recommend!

3.5 stars really, but I'm rounding down. It's a decent enough place with friendly enough waitstaff and decent sized portions. I just think it's kind of unremarkable, otherwise, and a bit on the pricier side, particularly for rather standard fare like falafel.

Probably one of the worst dining experiences I've had in a long time. The waiter was so clumsy and didn't even understand the first thing about being a waiter. He spilled ice cold water all over me and the staff decided it was best just to give us a new waiter- fine. If you make such a stupid and amateur mistake, wouldn't you guys agree they should give me something on the house or comp something off our bill? Nope! I paid $80 for what was the worst food ever. The scallops tasted like they died before they were caught and the food was either under seasoned or over seasoned. THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER. Don't eat here unless you want water spilled on you and management doesn't want to be responsibile. What a joke.
Had dinner Saturday night after craving a gyro and found this place on yelp. It's a nice small restaurant on metropolitan Ave in forest hills. Dinner was good and I'd go back.
This place exceeded my expectations.  The food was fresh and delicious.  The service was excellent!

Nicks is simply the best restaurant in the Forest Hills area as far as I'm concerned. The food and service are stellar and for size of portions and quality of preparation they are a great value. I have been there MANY times and everything I've ordered has been excellent. Their Grilled Salmon over Greek Salad for lunch is an incredible value at about $14. At dinner their grilled meats chicken and fish cannot  be beat and the Greek specialties are all tasty and interesting. ( Cyprian sausage ! ) The outdoor seating area - is IMO- the best place to enjoy their excellent food - what's better than sitting outdoors on a beautiful evening with great food and a glass of wine, being taken care of by friendly and professional staff !
Amazing place amazing servers . Definitely back again. Do always ask for lamb spring roll IT IS AWESOMEEEEEEEEEE....

Not too shabby! I've had Nick's bookmarked for a while and was able to cross it off my list on a random Saturday afternoon for brunch. It was around 2:30 in the afternoon and there were only a handful of tables occupied, however, that quickly changed a few minutes later. We were greeted and seated to a table for 2 and offered drinks to start. For our brunch items, we opted for the octopus salad and the gyro platter. Both were delicious and were served in generous portions. The octopus was grilled and tender, which complemented the greens nicely. The salad was served tossed in dressing, which was just right. The gyro platter was served with pita bread and tzatziki on the side and was more delicious than I could remember. We left satisfied and full and were pleased with both the service and food.Great job, Nick's!
Amazing food and really nice service! The Mediterranean grilled octopus salad was unreal

I would have given 5 stars as our food was delicious but several things were an issue. My girlfriend and I went to dinner here last night. The restaurant was not crowded and just to play it safe I made a reservation earlier in the week. We were seated promptly. The waiter came over to take our drink order and asked if we were ready to order our meal which we were not yet ready to order yet. He came over a few minutes later and we gave him our order which consisted of a salad we were going to share before our main meal and our dinner. As we were eating our salad , the busboy brings out the side dishes to our main meal!!  I told him to take it away as we were still eating our salad! We finish our salad and they take away our plates and bring us our dinner. Needless to say my girlfriend's steak was cold and my side dish was cold as well. We asked to have each dish heated. I do not understand why we were rushed as the restaurant was not crowded and at the same time, it is a Saturday night out and we shouldn't have felt as though we are being kicked out so the next set of diners of which there were none can be seated.

The best place ever , I try salmon with spinach and cheese on top , and I'll tell you I never had anything tasty with salmon dishes before . Place is very cute and has best staff !6 stars I want to out but it has limit to 5

So my family and i go out to eat on a weekly basis, essentially. Been doing it for a few years now and decided to take my pops out to Nick's for father's day. Nick's gets 5 stars because as my dad put it, it was the best food he's had (combined with the service) in years. Again, will be back (and then stop by Eddie's down the block for some ice cream)!!
Pretty disappointed. A gyro that doesn't stay wrapped. Mine had onions. Apparently all the onions because the other one had none. Just so blech.
Love the food here , service is never really the best which is disappointing but the convenience and the food keep me coming back.

As always the food and service were good. What was a bit disappointing was that we had made 7:30 reservations through Yelp and yet we had to wait 1/2 hr to be seated. Let's be honest those reservations were absolutely useless because that's the length of time we would've had to wait had we just walked up and into the restaurant. I mentioned this to the hostess and her reply was "well we can never tell when there'll be a table available, it happens." So what is the point of accepting reservations then, If your process is to seat everyone who walks into the restaurant on a first come first serve basis? It seems like this restaurant needs to reevaluate their reservation process. And if you ask no, we were not offered even a drink or coffee or dessert on the house which most places would've done.

Alicia was our server on a very rainy day, and she couldn't have been more pleasant, friendly, and helpful in finding just the right items on the menu to help me and my dining companion get through a lousy afternoon!  We started with an appetizer (soup for my friend, and a greek salad for me) that was almost large enough to be an entire meal!  Main course was a spicy chicken wrap for my friend, and I had the Cubano Press sandwich.  Again, delicious.  Nicely sized servings, seasoned well (meaning not overly done as in some places), and pleasingly presented.  I wish I had taken a photo or two!!Would definately go back when in the neighborhood again!

Nick's Bistro is one of the many gems of Metropolitan.  Equipped with a bar and comfortable seating, there's no question as to why so many are regulars.  The waiters are super friendly and always check on you to make sure that your meal is as good as they intended.They start you off with a complimentary hummus dip with two options of whole wheat or plain pita - both are delicious.  We also ordered two apps: their lamb sliders with feta - absolutely filling and nicely prepared and their stuffed mushroom with crab meat. The crab stuffing was so good that my boyfriend ordered his all time favorite: salmon with crab stuffing and grilled vegetables.  Absolutely well-cooked, crispy outside and tender pink inside.  The grilled vegetables are so grilled that you can see the dark grill marks, making this an ultimate side dish.  We also had the strozzapreti with grilled zucchini and feta and I must say, this is probably one of the best pasta dishes I've had.  Chunks of feta and grilled veggies are a nice touch to their beautifully cooked strozzapreti with red sauce.  The service is absolutely stellar, always refilling water glasses and checking up on you.  Seating is not really an issue but keep in mind - there are a lot of regulars, so if you have to wait, it is worth the wait!
This is the place to go! The service here is great. The food is delicious. I love their mashed potatoes. My compliments to the chef, waiters, and owner.
First time in here and i loved the food as much as the service!! Live performance and amazing ambiance! See you guys soon. :)

Love this place! Great food and great service. Been here many times and never disappointed. Highly recommend the baklava for dessert. Always listen for the specials for your entree because they're usually fantastic.  Just had my first brunch experience and got exactly what I expected; excellence as per usual.  Enjoy!
Food is average - nothing special.  Quality declined on the last visit so we have dropped this place from our restaurant rotation.
Excellent food. Seafood is very fresh. Owner is very welcoming and goes above and beyond to make you a happy guest.

Great service great food and they have an A for grading... I'm big on bathrooms and the bathroom is cute with really nice photos inside. I had the salmon over Greek salad and the salad with the salmon was superb. It was Springtime and a little hot out and the waiter kept bringing water to our table without us asking awesome..seating out side.

Visited with my mother and wife a couple of weeks ago.Waitress - Snotty Food - Decent to inedible We've had Falafel from at least 30 places around NYC and the falafel balls found here are the worst we've ever had by far. So insanely bitter that we couldn't choke them down even with pita and salad to soften the blow. Honestly seemed like someone had accidentally tipped an entire container of cumin (which I happen to love) or something of the sort into the mix by accident and decided to make them anyway. When the side of rice and complimentary hummus served when you sit down are the highlights of the meal you know something has gone seriously awry.
It's good. That's all I wanted to say but yelp is making me type more stuff.

We were a family group of 18 and Nick's Bistro welcomed us w open arms. A long table was reserved for us on the Sunday, 12:00 arrival. Service was excellent and food was served almost all at once. All meals were quite good, frequent water service and questions about our meals were asked. Excellent restaurant, service and food.
Food is pretty good at this place.  We always have a good experience at Nicks!
Delicious food, fresh seafood, amazing octopus salad , my favorite so far. I'll keep exploring their menu .

For easy causal double date night we decided to try this place out. They have wonderful reviews and outdoor seating. Although we actually didn't stay outside for our dinner. I am not sure if they have valet parking but you definitely have look for your parking. We were at the restaurant around 7.15 and it wasn't too bad but around 8 pm, people started to flock to this place.    We were super hungry when we got this place and we devoured everything. My taste buds were in over stimulation that I am too sure about how well my review be considered.  When we sat down the service was friendly and quick. We had our drinks and got some pita with hummus and olives. They were all wonderful. I kinda made a tiny pig outta myself but eat way too much of that pita. The hummus is average, it didn't spark my pallet into wonder lust.   I ordered the lobster ravioli because it was pasta and I was starving. Everyone else had the chicken kabobs with rice. We also ordered fries and they were delicious. Of course it is fries and we were all so hungry. So they tasted marvelous. The lobster ravioli was not particular good. It was kinda of weird because the pasta was "grilled". I am not sure if that's the exact term but that's what it looked like. The dish can be more favor full. It was mundane. Regardless, I will go back and try them because the place is clean, affordable and friendly.

I have been to nick's at least 3 times now and the quality of food is disappointing. Last time I went & we ordered a Kobe beef burger that was incredibly dry. We also got the regular burger with sautéed mushrooms and the mushrooms were cooked to the point it tasted bitter.I love the look and feel of nicks. It's really a nice restaurant with live music on some nights. The out door seating is very cute. I just wish their food wasn't so dry or bitter or over cooked all the time. It just lacks serious flavor in my opinion.

Have come here several times with my family, and this place never fails to disappoint! Since I have such a sweet tooth, the baklava is my FAVORITE thing ever! But the food at Nick's is truly amazing. Their chicken souvlaki, the chicken gyro, the hummus with pita chips, the lemon potatoes...everything!

Sea legs? Really? In the "crabmeat" stuffed jumbo shrimp?  Not good to find. Shrimp were good though. Grilled octopus appetizer is good. Not great. Avgolemeno soup is ok. No Greek wine by the glass? Why?  Gin and tonic was yellowed? It's our "weird tonic"'the waiter says. Chicken spanaki has too much creamed sauce on top and the sauce was cold. Stuffing of spinach and feta was very flavorful though. And lastly, the clientele..... Maybe just tonight but older folks with poor eating habits and poorer table manners.  Been here before but still not a fan. Astoria is so close will find better Greek elsewhere.

Amazing food three people ate and three cleaned plates as in nothing left. Fresh everything, the salad was amazing the sandwich was perfect fries were seasoned amazing. Waitstaff was beyond our expectations. If you don't eat here and have a bad experience somewhere else consider yourself warned you missed out.

Best Greek food delivery in Forest Hills! My family has tried every Greek delivery available and this is the only one we feel satisfied after. Between the execution and the abundance of food, we couldn't be happier with the results! Fun fact: it's the only restaurant we have never physically eaten in, not that the location is bad, it's beautiful and close to another favorite - Eddies Ice Cream Parlour. This is just our habit! Lol enjoy!

Just got home from enjoying another great meal at Nick's Bistro, and I realized something... I don't think I ever reviewed them on Yelp.  Silly me! I have had many meals at this fantastic restaurant and have never eaten anything I did not like. We have had several family birthday dinners there, as well as impromptu get-togethers with friends and family. Several weeks ago, my sister and I went there on a weeknight for drinks and appetizers. (I still have not gone on a Tuesday, when they have live music. I have to fit that into my schedule.) I pride myself on trying new dishes when I go out to eat, and Nick's always has something interesting on the menu for me to try! Tonight, after a rough day at work, I didn't go too far off of the beaten path, but instead enjoyed "comfort food." One of my favorite appetizers is their crab cakes, and tonight they offered crab cake fritters. I had to try them, and they did not disappoint! For my main dish, I was drawn to their fresh fish menu (what a great selection... I asked the waiter for a recommendation.) I decided on the filet of sole stuffed with their flavorful crabmeat stuffing.  I have had their crabmeat stuffing in the past - with a shrimp dish - and it was just as delicious as I remembered. The stuffing is fluffy and fresh, and full of flavor. (Never dry or crusty like other places I have dined.) The fish was fresh... the grilled veggies on the side were fresh... and I had a glass of wine to compliment the food.  By the way... in the past, I have also tried their stuffed mushrooms (my second favorite menu item) as well as their spinach pie, mozzarella sticks, onion rings, steak, duck, lamb chops, chicken, shrimp, and one other fish dish - the entire whole fish was served on a platter. That was an interesting meal! (By the way - I don't usually like duck, but my fiance ordered it once when we went to dinner at Nick's and insisted I try a bite.... it changed my mind about duck!) In summary, you can never go wrong when you enjoy a meal at Nick's Bistro. It has a great atmosphere, the staff is always friendly and polite, and we always end up socializing with the folks at neighboring tables because it is such a wonderfully inviting place. If I could give them ten stars... I would!
